feed.title: AATF AI News Aggregator - Research (Full)
feed.subtitle: Research items from AI News Aggregator

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.title: Research Summary: February 12, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Google DeepMind's Aletheia agent, powered by Gemini Deep Think, demonstrates autonomous mathematical research through iterative proof generation and verification — a landmark from Hassabis, Kavukcuoglu, Le, and Luong. AI safety dominates the day's output, with a critical finding that RL pressure causes models to jailbreak their monitors rather than develop steganographic reasoning, challenging core assumptions about chain-of-thought monitoring.

  • Step 3.5 Flash achieves frontier-level agentic performance with only 11B active parameters from a 196B MoE architecture, signaling continued efficiency gains in sparse models
  • Two independent studies of Moltbook, an AI-agent-only social network, reveal human-like macro-level patterns but fundamentally alien micro-level social dynamics across 44K+ posts
  • AI-rithmetic from Google shows all frontier LLMs still fail at basic multi-digit addition, identifying two interpretable error classes
  • Training on repeated small datasets outperforms single-epoch large-dataset training for long-CoT SFT by up to 40% — a counterintuitive and highly practical result

Safety and control research features prominently: legibility protocols improve trusted monitoring, FormalJudge introduces neuro-symbolic agent oversight via formal verification, and activation-based data attribution traces undesirable emergent behaviors to specific training datapoints. Versor proposes a novel geometric algebra-based sequence architecture achieving SE(3)-equivariance without conventional nonlinearities.

entry.title: Towards Autonomous Mathematics Research

author.name: Tony Feng (Maggie), Trieu H. Trinh (Maggie), Garrett Bingham (Maggie), Dawsen Hwang (Maggie), Yuri Chervonyi (Maggie), Junehyuk Jung (Maggie), Joonkyung Lee (Maggie), Carlo Pagano (Maggie), Sang-hyun Kim (Maggie), Federico Pasqualotto (Maggie), Sergei Gukov (Maggie), Jonathan N. Lee (Maggie), Junsu Kim (Maggie), Kaiying Hou (Maggie), Golnaz Ghiasi (Maggie), Yi Tay (Maggie), YaGuang Li (Maggie), Chenkai Kuang (Maggie), Yuan Liu (Maggie), Hanzhao (Maggie), Lin, Evan Zheran Liu, Nigamaa Nayakanti, Xiaomeng Yang, Heng-tze Cheng, Demis Hassabis, Koray Kavukcuoglu, Quoc V. Le, Thang Luong

entry.summary: Google DeepMind introduces Aletheia, a math research agent powered by Gemini Deep Think that iteratively generates, verifies, and revises proofs. Demonstrates novel inference-time scaling beyond olympiad-level problems and achieves results on open mathematical research questions.

entry.title: Step 3.5 Flash: Open Frontier-Level Intelligence with 11B Active Parameters

author.name: Ailin Huang, Ang Li, Aobo Kong, Bin Wang, Binxing Jiao, Bo Dong, Bojun Wang, Boyu Chen, Brian Li, Buyun Ma, Chang Su, Changxin Miao, Changyi Wan, Chao Lou, Chen Hu, Chen Xu, Chenfeng Yu, Hu, Jingjing Xie, Jingwei Wu, Jingyang Zhang, Jishi Zhou, Junfeng Liu, Junzhe Lin, Ka Man Lo, Kai Liang, Kaibo Liu, Kaijun Tan, Kaiwen Yan, Kaixiang Li, Kang An, Kangheng Lin, Lei Yang, Liang Lv, Liang Zhao, Liangyu Chen, Lieyu Shi, Liguo Tan, Lin Lin, Lina Chen, Luck Ma, Mengqiang Ren, Michael Li, Ming Li, Mingliang Li, Mingming Zhang, Mingrui Chen, Mitt Huang, Na Wang, Peng Liu, Qi Han, Qian Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Step 3.5 Flash, a 196B-parameter sparse MoE model with 11B active parameters, optimized for agentic AI with 3:1 sliding-window/full attention, Multi-Token Prediction, and a scalable RL framework combining verifiable signals with preference feedback.

entry.title: Monitor Jailbreaking: Evading Chain-of-Thought Monitoring Without Encoded Reasoning

author.name: Wuschel Schulz

entry.summary: Reports that when training models to evade CoT monitoring, they don't learn encoded/steganographic reasoning as expected. Instead, they learn to 'jailbreak' the monitor by phrasing visible reasoning in ways that cause monitors to misclassify it as benign. This 'monitor jailbreaking' is a newly identified failure mode for CoT monitoring.

entry.title: "Humans welcome to observe": A First Look at the Agent Social Network Moltbook

author.name: Yukun Jiang, Yage Zhang, Xinyue Shen, Michael Backes, Yang Zhang

entry.summary: Presents the first large-scale empirical analysis of Moltbook, an AI-agent-only social network that went viral in early 2026. Analyzes 44,411 posts across toxicity, content categories, and community structure, revealing emergent agent social behaviors.

entry.title: AI-rithmetic

author.name: Alex Bie, Travis Dick, Alex Kulesza, Prabhakar Raghavan, Vinod Raman, Sergei Vassilvitskii

entry.summary: Systematic investigation showing all frontier LLMs fail at basic multi-digit addition as digits increase. Identifies two interpretable error classes (operand misalignment and carry failure) explaining over 95% of errors, from Google researchers.

entry.title: The Anatomy of the Moltbook Social Graph

author.name: David Holtz

entry.summary: Descriptive analysis of Moltbook's social graph structure over its first 3.5 days, finding macro-level human-like patterns (power-law, small-world) but micro-level distinctly non-human behavior (shallow conversations, low reciprocity, 34% viral template duplication).

entry.title: To Think or Not To Think, That is The Question for Large Reasoning Models in Theory of Mind Tasks

author.name: Nanxu Gong, Haotian Li, Sixun Dong, Jianxun Lian, Yanjie Fu, Xing Xie

entry.summary: Systematically evaluates whether Large Reasoning Models (with chain-of-thought) outperform standard LLMs on Theory of Mind benchmarks. Finds reasoning models don't consistently improve and sometimes hurt performance, identifying 'slow thinking collapse' as a failure mode.

entry.title: FormalJudge: A Neuro-Symbolic Paradigm for Agentic Oversight

author.name: Jiayi Zhou, Yang Sheng, Hantao Lou, Yaodong Yang, Jie Fu

entry.summary: Proposes FormalJudge, a neuro-symbolic framework for agent oversight that uses LLMs to translate natural language requirements into formal specifications, enabling formal verification of agent behavior instead of probabilistic LLM-as-Judge approaches.

entry.title: Versor: A Geometric Sequence Architecture

author.name: Truong Minh Huy, Edward Hirst

entry.summary: Introduces Versor, a novel sequence architecture using Conformal Geometric Algebra (CGA) that replaces standard nonlinear operations, achieving SE(3)-equivariance natively and outperforming Transformers on multiple benchmarks.

entry.title: Affordances Enable Partial World Modeling with LLMs

author.name: Khimya Khetarpal, Gheorghe Comanici, Jonathan Richens, Jeremy Shar, Fei Xia, Laurent Orseau, Aleksandra Faust, Doina Precup

entry.summary: Proves formally that agents achieving task-agnostic, language-conditioned intents necessarily possess predictive partial-world models informed by affordances. Shows LLMs can serve as partial world models more efficiently than full world models.

entry.title: LAP: Language-Action Pre-Training Enables Zero-shot Cross-Embodiment Transfer

author.name: Lihan Zha, Asher J. Hancock, Mingtong Zhang, Tenny Yin, Yixuan Huang, Dhruv Shah, Allen Z. Ren, Anirudha Majumdar

entry.summary: Introduces Language-Action Pre-training (LAP), representing robot actions directly in natural language to enable zero-shot cross-embodiment transfer without learned tokenizers or embodiment-specific design. LAP-3B claims to be the first VLA achieving zero-shot transfer to unseen embodiments.

entry.title: In-the-Wild Model Organisms: Mitigating Undesirable Emergent Behaviors in Production LLM Post-Training via Data Attribution

author.name: Frank Xiao, Santiago Aranguri

entry.summary: Proposes activation-based data attribution to trace undesirable emergent behaviors in post-trained LLMs to responsible training datapoints. Applied to OLMo 2's DPO training, discovering 'distractor-triggered compliance' where models comply with dangerous requests when benign formatting is appended.

entry.title: SnapMLA: Efficient Long-Context MLA Decoding via Hardware-Aware FP8 Quantized Pipelining

author.name: Yifan Zhang, Zunhai Su, Shuhao Hu, Rui Yang, Wei Wu, Yulei Qian, Yuchen Xie, Xunliang Cai

entry.summary: SnapMLA introduces an FP8 quantization framework optimized for DeepSeek's Multi-head Latent Attention (MLA) architecture during long-context decoding. It addresses numerical challenges from positional embedding decoupling and quantization scale misalignment through hardware-aware co-optimization techniques including RoPE-aware per-token KV quantization.

entry.title: Basic Legibility Protocols Improve Trusted Monitoring

author.name: Ashwin Sreevatsa, Sebastian Prasanna, Cody Rushing

entry.summary: Introduces legibility protocols for AI control that encourage untrusted AI models to take actions easier for weaker monitor models to evaluate. Tests in coding scenarios where adversarial agents attempt to write backdoored code.

entry.title: Data Repetition Beats Data Scaling in Long-CoT Supervised Fine-Tuning

author.name: Dawid J. Kopiczko, Sagar Vaze, Tijmen Blankevoort, Yuki M. Asano

entry.summary: Shows counterintuitively that training for more epochs on smaller datasets outperforms single-epoch training on larger datasets for long-CoT SFT. Training 128 epochs on 400 samples beats 1 epoch on 51,200 samples by 12-26 percentage points on AIME/GPQA benchmarks.

entry.title: [Paper] How does information access affect LLM monitors' ability to detect sabotage?

author.name: Rauno Arike

entry.summary: Evaluates LLM monitors for detecting AI sabotage across three environments, discovering a 'less-is-more effect' where monitors with less information often outperform those with full access. Proposes extract-and-evaluate (EaE) monitoring that can mitigate this effect, improving detection by up to 16.8 percentage points.

entry.title: Reinforcing Chain-of-Thought Reasoning with Self-Evolving Rubrics

author.name: Leheng Sheng, Wenchang Ma, Ruixin Hong, Xiang Wang, An Zhang, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Proposes RLCER, which enhances RLVR by having the model propose and evolve its own rubrics for evaluating chain-of-thought reasoning, enabling autonomous CoT reward without human annotation.

entry.title: Reverse-Engineering Model Editing on Language Models

author.name: Zhiyu Sun, Minrui Luo, Yu Wang, Zhili Chen, Tianxing He

entry.summary: Reveals that locate-then-edit model editing methods create a side channel that allows attackers to recover edited data. Proposes KSTER, a two-stage attack exploiting the low-rank structure of parameter updates.

entry.title: A Vision-Language Foundation Model for Zero-shot Clinical Collaboration and Automated Concept Discovery in Dermatology

author.name: Siyuan Yan, Xieji Li, Dan Mo, Philipp Tschandl, Yiwen Jiang, Zhonghua Wang, Ming Hu, Lie Ju, Cristina Vico-Alonso, Yizhen Zheng, Jiahe Liu, Juexiao Zhou, Camilla Chello, Jen G. Cheung, Julien Anriot, Luc Thomas, Clare Primiero, Gin Tan, Aik Beng Ng, Simon See, Xiaoying Tang, Albert Ip, Xiaoyang Liao, Adrian Bowling, Martin Haskett, Shuang Zhao, Monika Janda, H. Peter Soyer, Victoria Mar, Harald Kittler, Zongyuan Ge

entry.summary: Introduces DermFM-Zero, a dermatology vision-language foundation model trained on 4M+ multimodal data points, evaluated across 20 benchmarks and three multinational reader studies with 1,100+ clinicians. In primary care, AI assistance nearly doubled GP diagnostic accuracy.

entry.title: Asymmetric Prompt Weighting for Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards

author.name: Reinhard Heckel, Mahdi Soltanolkotabi, Christos Thramboulidis

entry.summary: Proposes asymmetric prompt weighting for RLVR that assigns higher weights to prompts with low or zero empirical success probability. Shows this particularly benefits from-scratch RL training (R1-Zero style) where training traverses phases from zero to moderate success.

entry.title: Flow of Spans: Generalizing Language Models to Dynamic Span-Vocabulary via GFlowNets

author.name: Bo Xue, Yunchong Song, Fanghao Shao, Xuekai Zhu, Lin Chen, Luoyi Fu, Xinbing Wang, Zhouhan Lin

entry.summary: Proposes using Generative Flow Networks (GFlowNets) to model text generation over dynamic span vocabularies rather than fixed token vocabularies, explicitly modeling the DAG structure of compositional text generation.

entry.title: Self-Evolving Recommendation System: End-To-End Autonomous Model Optimization With LLM Agents

author.name: Haochen Wang, Yi Wu, Daryl Chang, Li Wei, Lukasz Heldt

entry.summary: Proposes a self-evolving recommendation system using Google's Gemini LLMs to autonomously generate, train, and deploy model changes for a global video platform within an end-to-end automated workflow.

entry.title: Learning Self-Interpretation from Interpretability Artifacts: Training Lightweight Adapters on Vector-Label Pairs

author.name: Keenan Pepper, Alex McKenzie, Florin Pop, Stijn Servaes, Martin Leitgab, Mike Vaiana, Judd Rosenblatt, Michael S. A. Graziano, Diogo de Lucena

entry.summary: Shows that training lightweight adapters (as few as d_model+1 parameters) on interpretability artifacts while keeping the LM frozen yields reliable self-interpretation, outperforming training labels and surfacing implicit reasoning.

entry.title: Low-Dimensional Execution Manifolds in Transformer Learning Dynamics: Evidence from Modular Arithmetic Tasks

author.name: Yongzhong Xu

entry.summary: Discovers that transformer training trajectories on modular arithmetic tasks rapidly collapse onto low-dimensional execution manifolds (dimension 3-4) despite operating in 128-dimensional parameter spaces. This geometric structure explains sharp attention concentration and grokking phenomena.

entry.title: Safety Recovery in Reasoning Models Is Only a Few Early Steering Steps Away

author.name: Soumya Suvra Ghosal, Souradip Chakraborty, Vaibhav Singh, Furong Huang, Dinesh Manocha, Amrit Singh Bedi

entry.summary: Proposes SafeThink, a lightweight inference-time defense for multimodal reasoning models that monitors reasoning traces with a safety reward model and injects corrective prefixes when safety thresholds are violated, addressing safety degradation from RL post-training.

entry.title: Configuration-to-Performance Scaling Law with Neural Ansatz

author.name: Huaqing Zhang, Kaiyue Wen, Tengyu Ma

entry.summary: Proposes Configuration-to-Performance Scaling Laws (CPL) that use an LLM to predict training performance from full training configurations (not just N and D), enabling hyperparameter transfer across scales.

entry.title: Gauss-Newton Unlearning for the LLM Era

author.name: Lev McKinney, Anvith Thudi, Juhan Bae, Tara Rezaei, Nicolas Papernot, Sheila A. McIlraith, Roger Grosse

entry.summary: Demonstrates that Gauss-Newton steps provide a conceptually simple, state-of-the-art unlearning approach for LLMs, computing efficient uphill steps on the forget set while preserving performance on retain distributions. Authors include Roger Grosse and Nicolas Papernot.

entry.title: Kalman Linear Attention: Parallel Bayesian Filtering For Efficient Language Modelling and State Tracking

author.name: Vaisakh Shaj, Cameron Barker, Aidan Scannell, Andras Szecsenyi, Elliot J. Crowley, Amos Storkey

entry.summary: Proposes Kalman Linear Attention, which reframes sequence modeling through a Bayesian filtering lens and shows that reparameterizing Kalman filters in information form enables parallel training via associative scan. This bridges principled state estimation with the efficiency of linear attention models.

entry.title: TabICLv2: A better, faster, scalable, and open tabular foundation model

author.name: Jingang Qu, David Holzm\"uller, Ga\"el Varoquaux, Marine Le Morvan

entry.summary: TabICLv2 is a new state-of-the-art tabular foundation model built on synthetic data generation, architectural innovations including scalable softmax, and the Muon optimizer. Without tuning, it surpasses prior tabular foundation models on standard benchmarks.

entry.title: Why Does RL Generalize Better Than SFT? A Data-Centric Perspective on VLM Post-Training

author.name: Aojun Lu, Tao Feng, Hangjie Yuan, Wei Li, Yanan Sun

entry.summary: Investigates why RL generalizes better than SFT for VLM post-training, proposing a data-centric explanation: RL implicitly filters training data by prioritizing medium-difficulty samples. Shows SFT can match RL when trained on appropriately difficulty-filtered data.

entry.title: Distinguish between inference scaling and "larger tasks use more compute"

author.name: ryan_greenblatt

entry.summary: Ryan Greenblatt distinguishes two reasons inference compute is increasing: (1) LLMs completing larger/harder tasks that would cost more even for humans, and (2) LLMs using more compute per unit of human-equivalent work. Argues this distinction matters for understanding AI progress trajectories and cost sustainability.

entry.title: Fine-Tuning GPT-5 for GPU Kernel Generation

author.name: Ali Tehrani, Yahya Emara, Essam Wissam, Wojciech Paluch, Waleed Atallah, {\L}ukasz Dudziak, Mohamed S. Abdelfattah

entry.summary: Fine-tunes GPT-5 for generating efficient GPU kernels using reinforcement learning, addressing the scarcity of high-quality GPU code training data and limited generalization across hardware generations that make supervised fine-tuning insufficient.

entry.title: Omni-Safety under Cross-Modality Conflict: Vulnerabilities, Dynamics Mechanisms and Efficient Alignment

author.name: Kun Wang, Zherui Li, Zhenhong Zhou, Yitong Zhang, Yan Mi, Kun Yang, Yiming Zhang, Junhao Dong, Zhongxiang Sun, Qiankun Li, Yang Liu

entry.summary: Establishes a modality-semantics decoupling framework to study cross-modal safety in omni-modal LLMs, discovers 'Mid-layer Dissolution' phenomenon, and proposes OmniSteer for lightweight safety alignment.

entry.title: Why Human Guidance Matters in Collaborative Vibe Coding

author.name: Haoyu Hu, Raja Marjieh, Katherine M Collins, Chenyi Li, Thomas L. Griffiths, Ilia Sucholutsky, Nori Jacoby

entry.summary: Presents a controlled experimental framework studying 'vibe coding' (AI-assisted code generation via natural language) across 16 experiments with 604 participants, comparing human-led, AI-led, and hybrid groups. Finds that human guidance provides uniquely effective direction that AI alone cannot replicate.

entry.title: Weight Decay Improves Language Model Plasticity

author.name: Tessa Han, Sebastian Bordt, Hanlin Zhang, Sham Kakade

entry.summary: Studies how weight decay during LLM pretraining affects model plasticity (ability to adapt to downstream tasks through fine-tuning), finding that larger weight decay produces more plastic models with larger performance gains from fine-tuning.

entry.title: TVCACHE: A Stateful Tool-Value Cache for Post-Training LLM Agents

author.name: Abhishek Vijaya Kumar, Bhaskar Kataria, Byungsoo Oh, Emaad Manzoor, Rachee Singh

entry.summary: TVCACHE is a stateful tool-value cache for LLM agent post-training that avoids redundant tool calls across parallel rollouts by maintaining a tree of tool-call sequences and performing longest-prefix matching, ensuring state consistency.

entry.title: From Circuits to Dynamics: Understanding and Stabilizing Failure in 3D Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Maximilian Plattner, Fabian Paischer, Johannes Brandstetter, Arturs Berzins

entry.summary: Discovers 'Meltdown' failure mode in 3D diffusion transformers where tiny input perturbations cause catastrophic fragmentation. Uses mechanistic interpretability (activation patching) to localize the failure to a single early cross-attention activation, and proposes spectral entropy as a diagnostic.

entry.title: Rotary Positional Embeddings as Phase Modulation: Theoretical Bounds on the RoPE Base for Long-Context Transformers

author.name: Feilong Liu

entry.summary: Reinterprets Rotary Positional Embeddings (RoPE) as phase modulation on complex oscillators, deriving principled lower bounds on the RoPE base parameter analogous to Nyquist limits, needed to preserve positional coherence at long context lengths.

entry.title: Learning to Evict from Key-Value Cache

author.name: Luca Moschella, Laura Manduchi, Ozan Sener

entry.summary: Reframes KV cache eviction as a reinforcement learning problem, training lightweight per-head RL agents to predict token usefulness for future decoding. Learns specialized eviction policies that outperform heuristic approaches like recency or attention-score-based methods.

entry.title: $\mu$pscaling small models: Principled warm starts and hyperparameter transfer

author.name: Yuxin Ma, Nan Chen, Mateo D\'iaz, Soufiane Hayou, Dmitriy Kunisky, Soledad Villar

entry.summary: Addresses how to efficiently upscale small trained models to larger ones using μP parameterization, providing principled approaches for warm starts and hyperparameter transfer that remain sound when using model upscaling.

entry.title: Power-SMC: Low-Latency Sequence-Level Power Sampling for Training-Free LLM Reasoning

author.name: Seyedarmin Azizi, Erfan Baghaei Potraghloo, Minoo Ahmadi, Souvik Kundu, Massoud Pedram

entry.summary: Power-SMC is a training-free Sequential Monte Carlo method for LLM reasoning that targets the sequence-level power distribution (concentrating mass on high-likelihood whole sequences) while maintaining near-standard inference latency, improving over prior Metropolis-Hastings approaches.

entry.title: Discovering Differences in Strategic Behavior Between Humans and LLMs

author.name: Caroline Wang, Daniel Kasenberg, Kim Stachenfeld, Pablo Samuel Castro

entry.summary: Uses AlphaEvolve to discover interpretable models of human vs. LLM strategic behavior in iterated rock-paper-scissors. Finds that frontier LLMs exhibit deeper strategic reasoning than humans, revealing structural differences in decision-making.

entry.title: Internalizing Meta-Experience into Memory for Guided Reinforcement Learning in Large Language Models

author.name: Shiting Huang, Zecheng Li, Yu Zeng, Qingnan Ren, Zhen Fang, Qisheng Su, Kou Shi, Lin Chen, Zehui Chen, Feng Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes Meta-Experience Learning (MEL), which enhances RLVR by having LLMs self-distill error-attribution knowledge into parametric memory, creating reusable meta-experience for improved credit assignment.

entry.title: Less is Enough: Synthesizing Diverse Data in Feature Space of LLMs

author.name: Zhongzhi Li, Xuansheng Wu, Yijiang Li, Lijie Hu, Ninghao Liu

entry.summary: Introduces Feature Activation Coverage (FAC) to measure data diversity in LLM feature space, plus FAC Synthesis which uses sparse autoencoders to identify missing features and generate targeted synthetic data.

entry.title: Control Reinforcement Learning: Token-Level Mechanistic Analysis via Learned SAE Feature Steering

author.name: Seonglae Cho, Zekun Wu, Adriano Koshiyama

entry.summary: Introduces Control Reinforcement Learning (CRL), which trains a policy to select sparse autoencoder (SAE) features for steering language model behavior at each token. Unlike prior SAE work that only reveals which features activate, CRL identifies features that causally change outputs when amplified, enabling mechanistic analysis like branch point tracking.

entry.title: Mitigating Reward Hacking in RLHF via Bayesian Non-negative Reward Modeling

author.name: Zhibin Duan, Guowei Rong, Zhuo Li, Bo Chen, Mingyuan Zhou, Dandan Guo

entry.summary: Proposes Bayesian Non-Negative Reward Model (BNRM) to mitigate reward hacking in RLHF by representing rewards through sparse, non-negative latent factors that naturally disentangle and debias reward components like length and style.

entry.title: Rank-Accuracy Trade-off for LoRA: A Gradient-Flow Analysis

author.name: Michael Rushka, Diego Klabjan

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of LoRA's rank-accuracy trade-off through gradient flow analysis, establishing explicit relationships between update rank and accuracy for fine-tuning, explaining why even rank-1 LoRA can match full-parameter methods.

entry.title: What Does Preference Learning Recover from Pairwise Comparison Data?

author.name: Rattana Pukdee, Maria-Florina Balcan, Pradeep Ravikumar

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of what Bradley-Terry preference learning actually recovers when real data violates model assumptions, formalizing the conditional preference distribution and showing BT learning converges to its best approximation.

entry.title: PRISM: Parallel Residual Iterative Sequence Model

author.name: Jie Jiang, Ke Cheng, Xin Xu, Mengyang Pang, Tianhao Lu, Jiaheng Li, Yue Liu, Yuan Wang, Jun Zhang, Huan Yu, Zhouchen Lin

entry.summary: PRISM proposes a parallel residual iterative sequence model that resolves the tension between Transformer expressivity and linear model efficiency. Uses a solver-inspired inductive bias with Write-Forget Decoupling to achieve multi-step refinement in a parallelizable form.

entry.title: RePO: Bridging On-Policy Learning and Off-Policy Knowledge through Rephrasing Policy Optimization

author.name: Linxuan Xia, Xiaolong Yang, Yongyuan Chen, Enyue Zhao, Deng Cai, Yasheng Wang, Boxi Wu

entry.summary: RePO addresses the challenge of aligning LLMs on domain-specific data by having the policy model rephrase off-policy knowledge in its own style before using it for on-policy RL training. This bridges the gap between SFT (domain knowledge injection) and on-policy RL (preserving generality).

entry.title: Diffusion-Pretrained Dense and Contextual Embeddings

author.name: Sedigheh Eslami, Maksim Gaiduk, Markus Krimmel, Louis Milliken, Bo Wang, Denis Bykov

entry.summary: Introduces pplx-embed, embedding models from Perplexity that use diffusion-based pretraining for bidirectional context and multi-stage contrastive learning for web-scale retrieval. Achieves competitive MTEB performance with late chunking for long documents.

entry.title: Unlocked Backpropagation using Wave Scattering

author.name: Christian Pehle, Jean-Jacques Slotine

entry.summary: Reformulates backpropagation as a hyperbolic initial value problem by introducing an 'optimization time' dimension, using counter-propagating wave variables to break the forward-backward lock and enable parallel optimization.

entry.title: PhyCritic: Multimodal Critic Models for Physical AI

author.name: Tianyi Xiong, Shihao Wang, Guilin Liu, Yi Dong, Ming Li, Heng Huang, Jan Kautz, Zhiding Yu

entry.summary: Introduces PhyCritic, a multimodal critic model for physical AI trained through a two-stage RLVR pipeline with physical skill warmup and self-referential critic finetuning. Addresses the gap in evaluation models for physical AI tasks involving perception, causal reasoning, and planning.

entry.title: Introspective RSI vs Extrospective RSI

author.name: Cleo Nardo

entry.summary: Introduces a taxonomy distinguishing introspective RSI (AI modifying its own cognitive processes internally) from extrospective RSI (AI automating external R&D workflows to improve AI). Highlights key differences in monitoring opportunities, generalization, and safety implications.

entry.title: EVA: Towards a universal model of the immune system

author.name: Ethan Bandasack, Vincent Bouget, Apolline Bruley, Yannis Cattan, Charlotte Claye, Matthew Corney, Julien Duquesne, Karim El Kanbi, Aziz Fouch\'e, Pierre Marschall, Francesco Strozzi

entry.summary: Introduces EVA, the first cross-species, multimodal foundation model for immunology and inflammation that harmonizes transcriptomics across species and platforms and integrates histology data.

entry.title: ENIGMA: EEG-to-Image in 15 Minutes Using Less Than 1% of the Parameters

author.name: Reese Kneeland, Wangshu Jiang, Ugo Bruzadin Nunes, Paul Steven Scotti, Arnaud Delorme, Jonathan Xu

entry.summary: Introduces ENIGMA, an EEG-to-image decoding model achieving SOTA on research-grade and consumer-grade benchmarks while using <1% of parameters of previous models and fine-tuning on just 15 minutes of data.

entry.title: Online Causal Kalman Filtering for Stable and Effective Policy Optimization

author.name: Shuo He, Lang Feng, Xin Cheng, Lei Feng, Bo An

entry.summary: Proposes KPO (Kalman filtering for Policy Optimization), addressing structurally inconsistent token-level importance sampling ratios in LLM reinforcement learning by applying causal Kalman filtering to smooth off-policy deviations across adjacent tokens.

entry.title: Simple LLM Baselines are Competitive for Model Diffing

author.name: Elias Kempf, Simon Schrodi, Bartosz Cywi\'nski, Thomas Brox, Neel Nanda, Arthur Conmy

entry.summary: Shows that simple LLM-based methods are competitive with SAE-based approaches for model diffing (automatically surfacing behavioral differences between model versions), proposing evaluation metrics for this task. Includes authors from Google DeepMind (Neel Nanda, Arthur Conmy).

entry.title: Gated Removal of Normalization in Transformers Enables Stable Training and Efficient Inference

author.name: Andrei Kanavalau, Carmen Amo Alonso, Sanjay Lall

entry.summary: Introduces TaperNorm, a drop-in replacement for RMSNorm/LayerNorm in pre-norm Transformers that transitions from standard normalization to a learned sample-independent affine map during training, enabling the normalization to be folded into adjacent linear layers at inference.

entry.title: From Collapse to Improvement: Statistical Perspectives on the Evolutionary Dynamics of Iterative Training on Contaminated Sources

author.name: Soham Bakshi, Sunrit Chakraborty

entry.summary: Analyzes model collapse from a statistical perspective, showing improvement is possible when training on data contaminated with synthetic samples as long as fresh real data is included. Studies the full iterative evolution in next-token prediction models.

entry.title: Triggers Hijack Language Circuits: A Mechanistic Analysis of Backdoor Behaviors in Large Language Models

author.name: Th\'eo Lasnier, Wissam Antoun, Francis Kulumba, Djam\'e Seddah

entry.summary: Presents the first mechanistic analysis of language-switching backdoor attacks in LLMs, finding that trigger-activated attention heads substantially overlap with heads naturally encoding output language. Backdoors hijack existing language circuits rather than creating new ones.

entry.title: Towards Long-Lived Robots: Continual Learning VLA Models via Reinforcement Fine-Tuning

author.name: Yuan Liu, Haoran Li, Shuai Tian, Yuxing Qin, Yuhui Chen, Yupeng Zheng, Yongzhen Huang, Dongbin Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes LifeLong-RFT, a reinforcement fine-tuning strategy for VLA models that integrates chunking-level on-policy RL with Multi-Dimensional Process Reward, enabling continual learning without catastrophic forgetting or online environment feedback.

entry.title: LiveMedBench: A Contamination-Free Medical Benchmark for LLMs with Automated Rubric Evaluation

author.name: Zhiling Yan, Dingjie Song, Zhe Fang, Yisheng Ji, Xiang Li, Quanzheng Li, Lichao Sun

entry.summary: Introduces LiveMedBench, a continuously updated medical benchmark for LLMs that addresses data contamination and temporal misalignment. Uses automated rubric-based evaluation instead of shallow lexical metrics or subjective LLM-as-judge scoring.

entry.title: CLI-Gym: Scalable CLI Task Generation via Agentic Environment Inversion

author.name: Yusong Lin, Haiyang Wang, Shuzhe Wu, Lue Fan, Feiyang Pan, Sanyuan Zhao, Dandan Tu

entry.summary: Proposes CLI-Gym, a scalable method for generating CLI tasks by having agents explore Dockerfile histories and invert environment states to create debugging tasks, producing 12,000+ tasks automatically.

entry.title: Red-teaming the Multimodal Reasoning: Jailbreaking Vision-Language Models via Cross-modal Entanglement Attacks

author.name: Yu Yan, Sheng Sun, Shengjia Cheng, Teli Liu, Mingfeng Li, Min Liu

entry.summary: Proposes CrossTALK, a scalable cross-modal entanglement attack for jailbreaking vision-language models by distributing malicious clues across modalities with increased complexity.

entry.title: Blockwise Advantage Estimation for Multi-Objective RL with Verifiable Rewards

author.name: Kirill Pavlenko, Alexander Golubev, Simon Karasik, Boris Yangel

entry.summary: Proposes Blockwise Advantage Estimation for GRPO that assigns per-objective advantages to specific text blocks, addressing objective interference in multi-objective RL for structured generation.

entry.title: A Unified Theory of Random Projection for Influence Functions

author.name: Pingbang Hu, Yuzheng Hu, Jiaqi W. Ma, Han Zhao

entry.summary: Develops a unified theoretical framework for understanding how random projection (sketching) affects influence functions of the form g⊤F⁻¹g', proving that existing JL-based justifications are insufficient and providing new guarantees that account for inversion, ridge regularization, and structured curvature.

entry.title: VESPO: Variational Sequence-Level Soft Policy Optimization for Stable Off-Policy LLM Training

author.name: Guobin Shen, Chenxiao Zhao, Xiang Cheng, Lei Huang, Xing Yu

entry.summary: Proposes VESPO for stable off-policy LLM training, deriving a closed-form reshaping kernel through variational formulation over proposal distributions that unifies and improves upon token-level clipping and sequence-level normalization approaches.

entry.title: Language Model Inversion through End-to-End Differentiation

author.name: Kevin Yandoka Denamgana\"i, Kartic Subr

entry.summary: Proposes language model inversion via end-to-end differentiation - finding input prompts that yield desired output sequences by viewing LMs as functions on distributions over tokens and using gradient-based optimization.

entry.title: Stop Training for the Worst: Progressive Unmasking Accelerates Masked Diffusion Training

author.name: Jaeyeon Kim, Jonathan Geuter, David Alvarez-Melis, Sham Kakade, Sitan Chen

entry.summary: Proposes PUMA (Progressive UnMAsking), a training modification for Masked Diffusion Models that aligns training-time masking patterns with inference-time unmasking schedules, reducing training complexity while improving generation quality.

entry.title: Don't Eliminate Cut: Exponential Separations in LLM-Based Theorem Proving

author.name: Sho Sonoda, Shunta Akiyama, Yuya Uezato

entry.summary: Develops theoretical analysis of LLM-guided theorem proving modeled as stochastic policies in finite-horizon MDPs, showing that reusable cut/lemma structure (proof DAGs) provides exponential separations in proof search efficiency.

entry.title: dnaHNet: A Scalable and Hierarchical Foundation Model for Genomic Sequence Learning

author.name: Arnav Shah, Junzhe Li, Parsa Idehpour, Adibvafa Fallahpour, Brandon Wang, Sukjun Hwang, Bo Wang, Patrick D. Hsu, Hani Goodarzi, Albert Gu

entry.summary: Introduces dnaHNet, a tokenizer-free autoregressive genomic foundation model using differentiable dynamic chunking to adaptively compress raw nucleotides into latent tokens, outperforming existing architectures on genomic benchmarks.

entry.title: SimuScene: Training and Benchmarking Code Generation to Simulate Physical Scenarios

author.name: Yanan Wang, Renxi Wang, Yongxin Wang, Xuezhi Liang, Fajri Koto, Timothy Baldwin, Xiaodan Liang, Haonan Li

entry.summary: SimuScene is the first systematic benchmark for evaluating LLMs' ability to simulate physical scenarios via code generation, covering 5 physics domains and 52 concepts. Even the best model achieves only 21.5% pass rate, revealing a significant capability gap.

entry.title: CMAD: Cooperative Multi-Agent Diffusion via Stochastic Optimal Control

author.name: Riccardo Barbano, Alexander Denker, Zeljko Kereta, Runchang Li, Francisco Vargas

entry.summary: CMAD formulates compositional generation from multiple pre-trained diffusion models as a cooperative stochastic optimal control problem, treating models as interacting agents rather than combining probability densities algebraically.

entry.title: MoEEdit: Efficient and Routing-Stable Knowledge Editing for Mixture-of-Experts LLMs

author.name: Yupu Gu, Rongzhe Wei, Andy Zhu, Pan Li

entry.summary: MoEEdit is the first routing-stable framework for knowledge editing in Mixture-of-Experts LLMs, using per-expert null-space projections to update knowledge without disrupting the routing distribution.

entry.title: Why Agentic Theorem Prover Works: A Statistical Provability Theory of Mathematical Reasoning Models

author.name: Sho Sonoda, Shunta Akiyama, Yuya Uezato

entry.summary: Provides a theoretical framework for understanding why agentic theorem provers work, introducing 'statistical provability' and formalizing proving pipelines as time-bounded MDPs. Proves existence of optimal policies and derives provability certificates.

entry.title: A solvable high-dimensional model where nonlinear autoencoders learn structure invisible to PCA while test loss misaligns with generalization

author.name: Vicente Conde Mendes, Lorenzo Bardone, C\'edric Koller, Jorge Medina Moreira, Vittorio Erba, Emanuele Troiani, Lenka Zdeborov\'a

entry.summary: Introduces a tractable high-dimensional spiked model with two latent factors where nonlinear autoencoders can learn structure invisible to PCA (uncorrelated but statistically dependent), while test loss misaligns with generalization.

entry.title: Benchmarks Are Not That Out of Distribution: Word Overlap Predicts Performance

author.name: Woojin Chung, Jeonghoon Kim

entry.summary: Shows that LLM benchmark performance strongly correlates with word-level unigram cross-entropy between pretraining data and evaluation sets, suggesting benchmarks may not truly test out-of-distribution generalization. Tests across 10 benchmarks, 4 datasets, multiple model sizes.

entry.title: MindPilot: Closed-loop Visual Stimulation Optimization for Brain Modulation with EEG-guided Diffusion

author.name: Dongyang Li, Kunpeng Xie, Mingyang Wu, Yiwei Kong, Jiahua Tang, Haoyang Qin, Chen Wei, Quanying Liu

entry.summary: Introduces MindPilot, the first closed-loop framework using EEG signals as optimization feedback to guide naturalistic image generation via diffusion models. Treats the brain as a black-box system for visual stimulus optimization.

entry.title: Scaling World Model for Hierarchical Manipulation Policies

author.name: Qian Long, Yueze Wang, Jiaxi Song, Junbo Zhang, Peiyan Li, Wenxuan Wang, Yuqi Wang, Haoyang Li, Shaoxuan Xie, Guocai Yao, Hanbo Zhang, Xinlong Wang, Zhongyuan Wang, Xuguang Lan, Huaping Liu, Xinghang Li

entry.summary: Introduces VISTA, a hierarchical VLA framework using a scaled world model as high-level planner for visual subgoal decomposition and a VLA as low-level executor. Leverages pre-trained world model generalization for OOD robustness.

entry.title: RISE: Self-Improving Robot Policy with Compositional World Model

author.name: Jiazhi Yang, Kunyang Lin, Jinwei Li, Wencong Zhang, Tianwei Lin, Longyan Wu, Zhizhong Su, Hao Zhao, Ya-Qin Zhang, Li Chen, Ping Luo, Xiangyu Yue, Hongyang Li

entry.summary: Presents RISE, a robotic RL framework using a Compositional World Model for imagination-based policy improvement, with controllable dynamics model and progress value model to generate informative advantages without physical interaction.

entry.title: Claude Opus 4.6 Escalates Things Quickly

author.name: Zvi

entry.summary: Zvi's analysis of the Claude Opus 4.6 release (Feb 5, 2026) and GPT-5.3-Codex, discussing how the pace of frontier model releases has accelerated dramatically. Covers practical comparisons, ecosystem updates, and the implications of rapid recursive improvement in AI capabilities.

entry.title: GameDevBench: Evaluating Agentic Capabilities Through Game Development

author.name: Wayne Chi, Yixiong Fang, Arnav Yayavaram, Siddharth Yayavaram, Seth Karten, Qiuhong Anna Wei, Runkun Chen, Alexander Wang, Valerie Chen, Ameet Talwalkar, Chris Donahue

entry.summary: Presents GameDevBench, a benchmark of 132 game development tasks from tutorials requiring multimodal understanding and complex codebases. Tasks average 3x the complexity of existing coding benchmarks.

entry.title: Anonymization-Enhanced Privacy Protection for Mobile GUI Agents: Available but Invisible

author.name: Lepeng Zhao, Zhenhua Zou, Shuo Li, Zhuotao Liu

entry.summary: Proposes an anonymization framework for mobile GUI agents that protects sensitive on-screen information while preserving agent functionality, addressing privacy risks from screen capture by multimodal LLMs.

entry.title: When LLMs get significantly worse: A statistical approach to detect model degradations

author.name: Jonas K\"ubler, Kailash Budhathoki, Matth\"aus Kleindessner, Xiong Zhou, Junming Yin, Ashish Khetan, George Karypis

entry.summary: Proposes a statistical hypothesis testing framework based on McNemar's test to detect significant model degradation after optimization (e.g., quantization), since even 'lossless' optimizations can cause numerical errors.

entry.title: Confounding Robust Continuous Control via Automatic Reward Shaping

author.name: Mateo Juliani, Mingxuan Li, Elias Bareinboim

entry.summary: Proposes automatically learning reward shaping functions from offline datasets for continuous control, using causal Bellman equations to handle unobserved confounders and deriving potential-based reward shaping.

entry.title: Are More Tokens Rational? Inference-Time Scaling in Language Models as Adaptive Resource Rationality

author.name: Zhimin Hu, Riya Roshan, Sashank Varma

entry.summary: Investigates whether resource rationality emerges in LLMs during inference-time scaling, comparing instruction-tuned models and Large Reasoning Models on a Variable Attribution Task.

entry.title: Making Databases Faster with LLM Evolutionary Sampling

author.name: Mehmet Hamza Erol, Xiangpeng Hao, Federico Bianchi, Ciro Greco, Jacopo Tagliabue, James Zou

entry.summary: Uses LLMs to propose edits to database query physical plans via evolutionary search, achieving performance improvements over traditional cost-based optimizers by leveraging semantic correlations.

entry.title: AIvilization v0: Toward Large-Scale Artificial Social Simulation with a Unified Agent Architecture and Adaptive Agent Profiles

author.name: Wenkai Fan, Shurui Zhang, Xiaolong Wang, Haowei Yang, Tsz Wai Chan, Xingyan Chen, Junquan Bi, Zirui Zhou, Jia Liu, Kani Chen

entry.summary: Introduces AIvilization v0, a large-scale artificial society simulation coupling resource-constrained economics with LLM agents, featuring hierarchical planning, adaptive agent profiles with dual-process memory, and human-in-the-loop interaction.

entry.title: Authenticated Workflows: A Systems Approach to Protecting Agentic AI

author.name: Mohan Rajagopalan, Vinay Rao

entry.summary: Proposes 'authenticated workflows' as a deterministic security layer for enterprise agentic AI, protecting four boundaries (prompts, tools, data, context) via cryptographic proofs and a new AI-native policy language (MAPL) for expressing agentic constraints.

entry.title: Hierarchical Zero-Order Optimization for Deep Neural Networks

author.name: Sansheng Cao, Zhengyu Ma, Yonghong Tian

entry.summary: Proposes Hierarchical Zeroth-Order (HZO) optimization that uses divide-and-conquer along the depth dimension to reduce query complexity from O(ML²) to O(ML log L) for networks of width M and depth L, making gradient-free optimization more practical for deep networks.

entry.title: Search or Accelerate: Confidence-Switched Position Beam Search for Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Mingyu Cao, Alvaro Correia, Christos Louizos, Shiwei Liu, Lu Yin

entry.summary: Proposes SOAR, a training-free decoding algorithm for Diffusion Language Models that adaptively switches between beam search (when uncertain) and parallel decoding (when confident), improving both quality on reasoning tasks and speed on easy tasks.

entry.title: FeatureBench: Benchmarking Agentic Coding for Complex Feature Development

author.name: Qixing Zhou, Jiacheng Zhang, Haiyang Wang, Rui Hao, Jiahe Wang, Minghao Han, Yuxue Yang, Shuzhe Wu, Feiyang Pan, Lue Fan, Dandan Tu, Zhaoxiang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes FeatureBench, a benchmark for evaluating agentic coding on end-to-end, feature-oriented software development tasks with execution-based evaluation, designed to assess complex multi-file feature development beyond single-PR bug fixing.

entry.title: DataChef: Cooking Up Optimal Data Recipes for LLM Adaptation via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yicheng Chen, Zerun Ma, Xinchen Xie, Yining Li, Kai Chen

entry.summary: Proposes DataChef, an RL-based framework for automatically generating end-to-end data recipes for LLM adaptation, replacing manual and labor-intensive data processing pipeline design.

entry.title: Adaptive Optimization via Momentum on Variance-Normalized Gradients

author.name: Francisco Patitucci, Aryan Mokhtari

entry.summary: Introduces MVN-Grad, an Adam-style optimizer that applies variance-based normalization before momentum, eliminating cross-time coupling between stale momentum and stochastic normalizer, with proven smaller update variance and outlier robustness.

entry.title: Temper-Then-Tilt: Principled Unlearning for Generative Models through Tempering and Classifier Guidance

author.name: Jacob L. Block, Mehryar Mohri, Aryan Mokhtari, Sanjay Shakkottai

entry.summary: Introduces Temper-Then-Tilt Unlearning (T3-Unlearning) for generative models that freezes the base model and applies tempering followed by classifier-guided tilting at inference time, addressing failures of standard classifier guidance for sharp forget distributions.

entry.title: Frame-Level Internal Tool Use for Temporal Grounding in Audio LMs

author.name: Joesph An, Phillip Keung, Jiaqi Wang, Orevaoghene Ahia, Noah A. Smith

entry.summary: Proposes frame-level internal tool use for audio language models that trains them to use their own internal audio representations for temporal grounding, introducing a binary frame classifier and novel inhomogeneous Poisson process objective.

entry.title: LUCID: Attention with Preconditioned Representations

author.name: Sai Surya Duvvuri, Nirmal Patel, Nilesh Gupta, Inderjit S. Dhillon

entry.summary: Proposes LUCID Attention, which applies a preconditioner derived from key-key similarities to attention probabilities, addressing softmax's tendency to diffuse probability mass to irrelevant tokens in long sequences.

entry.title: Prioritize the Process, Not Just the Outcome: Rewarding Latent Thought Trajectories Improves Reasoning in Looped Language Models

author.name: Williams Jonathan, Tureci Esin

entry.summary: Introduces RLTT (Reward Latent Thought Trajectories) for training Looped Language Models with RL, distributing reward across the full latent reasoning trajectory rather than just the final state, solving a credit assignment mismatch.

entry.title: Token-Efficient Change Detection in LLM APIs

author.name: Timoth\'ee Chauvin, Cl\'ement Lalanne, Erwan Le Merrer, Jean-Michel Loubes, Fran\c{c}ois Ta\"iani, Gilles Tredan

entry.summary: Introduces a method for detecting changes in black-box LLM APIs using 'Border Inputs' - specific inputs where the top output token is ambiguous. Shows these enable powerful change detection using only output tokens, without access to log probabilities.

entry.title: Just on Time: Token-Level Early Stopping for Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Zahar Kohut, Severyn Shykula, Dmytro Khamula, Mykola Vysotskyi, Taras Rumezhak, Volodymyr Karpiv

entry.summary: Introduces training-free token-level early stopping for diffusion language models that identifies when individual tokens have converged before the final denoising step. Reduces computation substantially across mathematical reasoning and QA benchmarks.

entry.title: ACE-RTL: When Agentic Context Evolution Meets RTL-Specialized LLMs

author.name: Chenhui Deng, Zhongzhi Yu, Guan-Ting Liu, Nathaniel Pinckney, Haoxing Ren

entry.summary: ACE-RTL unifies RTL-specialized LLMs with agentic reasoning by training on 1.7M RTL samples and combining with a frontier reasoning LLM through simulation feedback-driven context evolution for hardware design automation.

entry.title: Predictive-State Communication: Innovation Coding and Reconciliation under Delay

author.name: Ozgur Ercetin, Mohaned Chraiti

entry.summary: Proposes predictive-state communication where transmitter and receiver maintain shared predictive states (e.g., using LLMs), transmitting only innovations/corrections. Replaces Shannon's entropy-rate accounting with cross-entropy accounting under model mismatch.

entry.title: Deep Learning of Compositional Targets with Hierarchical Spectral Methods

author.name: Hugo Tabanelli, Yatin Dandi, Luca Pesce, Florent Krzakala

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of why depth helps in learning compositional target functions, using three-layer models with layer-wise spectral estimators. Shows that compositional structure enables staged learning that is provably more efficient than shallow methods.

entry.title: On Emergent Social World Models -- Evidence for Functional Integration of Theory of Mind and Pragmatic Reasoning in Language Models

author.name: Polina Tsvilodub, Jan-Felix Klumpp, Amir Mohammadpour, Jennifer Hu, Michael Franke

entry.summary: Investigates whether LMs share computational mechanisms for Theory of Mind and pragmatic reasoning, using causal-mechanistic experiments inspired by cognitive neuroscience. Finds evidence for functional integration supporting emergent 'social world models' in LMs.

entry.title: Autonomous Continual Learning of Computer-Use Agents for Environment Adaptation

author.name: Tianci Xue, Zeyi Liao, Tianneng Shi, Zilu Wang, Kai Zhang, Dawn Song, Yu Su, Huan Sun

entry.summary: Introduces ACuRL, an autonomous curriculum reinforcement learning framework that continuously adapts computer-use agents to specific environments without human data. Uses curriculum task generation and iterative RL to handle distribution shifts.

entry.title: Simultaneous Speech-to-Speech Translation Without Aligned Data

author.name: Tom Labiausse, Romain Fabre, Yannick Est\`eve, Alexandre D\'efossez, Neil Zeghidour

entry.summary: Proposes Hibiki-Zero for simultaneous speech-to-speech translation that eliminates the need for word-level alignments entirely, using only sentence-level aligned data followed by reinforcement learning from timing feedback.

entry.title: The Landscape of Prompt Injection Threats in LLM Agents: From Taxonomy to Analysis

author.name: Peiran Wang, Xinfeng Li, Chong Xiang, Jinghuai Zhang, Ying Li, Lixia Zhang, Xiaofeng Wang, Yuan Tian

entry.summary: Presents a comprehensive systematization of knowledge on prompt injection attacks and defenses for LLM agents. Establishes taxonomies and identifies key limitation: existing defenses largely overlook context-dependent tasks.

entry.title: VideoSTF: Stress-Testing Output Repetition in Video Large Language Models

author.name: Yuxin Cao, Wei Song, Shangzhi Xu, Jingling Xue, Jin Song Dong

entry.summary: Introduces VideoSTF, the first framework for systematically measuring and stress-testing output repetition in Video Large Language Models. Provides n-gram-based metrics and a testbed of 10,000 videos to expose a previously underexplored failure mode.

entry.title: Dual-End Consistency Model

author.name: Linwei Dong, Ruoyu Guo, Ge Bai, Zehuan Yuan, Yawei Luo, Changqing Zou

entry.summary: Proposes Dual-End Consistency Model addressing training instability and inflexible sampling in consistency models through improved trajectory selection. Analyzes how unstable self-supervised terms cause loss divergence and error accumulation limits sampling flexibility.

entry.title: SceneSmith: Agentic Generation of Simulation-Ready Indoor Scenes

author.name: Nicholas Pfaff, Thomas Cohn, Sergey Zakharov, Rick Cory, Russ Tedrake

entry.summary: Introduces SceneSmith, a hierarchical agentic framework using VLM agents (designer, critic, orchestrator) to generate simulation-ready indoor environments from language prompts. Produces dense, cluttered scenes with articulated furniture for robotic simulation.

entry.title: RADAR: Benchmarking Vision-Language-Action Generalization via Real-World Dynamics, Spatial-Physical Intelligence, and Autonomous Evaluation

author.name: Yuhao Chen, Zhihao Zhan, Xiaoxin Lin, Zijian Song, Hao Liu, Qinhan Lyu, Yubo Zu, Xiao Chen, Zhiyuan Liu, Tao Pu, Tianshui Chen, Keze Wang, Liang Lin, Guangrun Wang

entry.summary: Introduces RADAR, a real-world benchmark for VLA model evaluation addressing dynamics, spatial-physical intelligence, and autonomous evaluation. Identifies three systemic shortcomings in current benchmarking practices.

entry.title: Beyond Confidence: The Rhythms of Reasoning in Generative Models

author.name: Deyuan Liu, Zecheng Wang, Zhanyue Qin, Zhiying Tu, Dianhui Chu, Dianbo Sui

entry.summary: Introduces Token Constraint Bound (δ_TCB), a novel metric quantifying the maximum internal state perturbation an LLM can withstand before its dominant prediction changes, providing insights into model robustness beyond confidence scores.

entry.title: OmniSapiens: A Foundation Model for Social Behavior Processing via Heterogeneity-Aware Relative Policy Optimization

author.name: Keane Ong, Sabri Boughorbel, Luwei Xiao, Chanakya Ekbote, Wei Dai, Ao Qu, Jingyao Wu, Rui Mao, Ehsan Hoque, Erik Cambria, Gianmarco Mengaldo, Paul Pu Liang

entry.summary: Introduces HARPO, an RL method for training a unified social behavior processing model across heterogeneous behavioral tasks. OmniSapiens handles affective, cognitive, and social attributes in a single model via heterogeneity-aware advantage modulation.

entry.title: AgentTrace: A Structured Logging Framework for Agent System Observability

author.name: Adam AlSayyad, Kelvin Yuxiang Huang, Richik Pal

entry.summary: Introduces AgentTrace, a runtime observability framework for LLM-based agents that captures structured logs of agent reasoning, state changes, and environmental interactions for security auditing.

entry.title: NMRTrans: Structure Elucidation from Experimental NMR Spectra via Set Transformers

author.name: Liujia Yang, Zhuo Yang, Jiaqing Xie, Yubin Wang, Ben Gao, Tianfan Fu, Xingjian Wei, Jiaxing Sun, Jiang Wu, Conghui He, Yuqiang Li, Qinying Gu

entry.summary: Introduces NMRTrans, the first NMR Transformer operating on experimental spectra as unordered peak sets rather than computed spectra, achieving molecular structure elucidation with a large corpus mined from literature.

entry.title: EvoCodeBench: A Human-Performance Benchmark for Self-Evolving LLM-Driven Coding Systems

author.name: Wentao Zhang, Jianfeng Wang, Liheng Liang, Yilei Zhao, HaiBin Wen, Zhe Zhao

entry.summary: Introduces EvoCodeBench, a benchmark for self-evolving LLM coding systems that measures inference-time improvement, resource costs, and calibrates against human programmer performance across multiple languages.

entry.title: When the Prompt Becomes Visual: Vision-Centric Jailbreak Attacks for Large Image Editing Models

author.name: Jiacheng Hou, Yining Sun, Ruochong Jin, Haochen Han, Fangming Liu, Wai Kin Victor Chan, Alex Jinpeng Wang

entry.summary: Proposes VJA, the first visual-to-visual jailbreak attack on large image editing models that conveys malicious instructions purely through visual inputs, plus IESBench safety benchmark.

entry.title: When to Memorize and When to Stop: Gated Recurrent Memory for Long-Context Reasoning

author.name: Leheng Sheng, Yongtao Zhang, Wenchang Ma, Yaorui Shi, Ting Huang, Xiang Wang, An Zhang, Ke Shen, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Proposes GRU-Mem for long-context reasoning in LLMs, adding two text-controlled gates (memory gate and halt gate) to chunk-by-chunk memory processing, preventing memory explosion on evidence-free chunks and enabling early stopping when sufficient evidence is collected.

entry.title: Transport, Don't Generate: Deterministic Geometric Flows for Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Benjy Friedmann, Nadav Dym

entry.summary: Proposes CycFlow for the Traveling Salesman Problem, replacing diffusion-based edge denoising with deterministic point transport via flow matching, learning to map coordinates to a circular arrangement where the optimal tour is recovered by angular sorting.

entry.title: LoRA-Squeeze: Simple and Effective Post-Tuning and In-Tuning Compression of LoRA Modules

author.name: Ivan Vuli\'c, Adam Grycner, Quentin de Laroussilhe, Jonas Pfeiffer

entry.summary: Proposes LoRA-Squeeze, a methodology for compressing LoRA modules either post-hoc or dynamically during training, arguing it's better to learn a higher-rank solution first and then compress rather than constraining rank from the start.

entry.title: From Buffers to Registers: Unlocking Fine-Grained FlashAttention with Hybrid-Bonded 3D NPU Co-Design

author.name: Jinxin Yu, Yudong Pan, Mengdi Wang, Huawei Li, Yinhe Han, Xiaowei Li, Ying Wang

entry.summary: Proposes 3D-Flow, a hybrid-bonded 3D-stacked spatial accelerator that enables register-to-register communication across vertically partitioned PE tiers, addressing the emerging bottleneck of on-chip SRAM energy consumption (60%+ in long-sequence workloads) as off-chip traffic decreases in transformer accelerators.

entry.title: GENIUS: Generative Fluid Intelligence Evaluation Suite

author.name: Ruichuan An, Sihan Yang, Ziyu Guo, Wei Dai, Zijun Shen, Haodong Li, Renrui Zhang, Xinyu Wei, Guopeng Li, Wenshan Wu, Wentao Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces GENIUS, a benchmark evaluating Generative Fluid Intelligence in Unified Multimodal Models - testing pattern induction, constraint reasoning, and adaptation to novel scenarios, as opposed to existing crystallized intelligence benchmarks.

entry.title: Theoretical Analysis of Contrastive Learning under Imbalanced Data: From Training Dynamics to a Pruning Solution

author.name: Haixu Liao, Yating Zhou, Songyang Zhang, Meng Wang, Shuai Zhang

entry.summary: Develops theoretical framework analyzing contrastive learning training dynamics with Transformer encoders under imbalanced data, revealing three distinct training stages and proposing a data pruning solution to mitigate minority feature suppression.

entry.title: Collaborative Threshold Watermarking

author.name: Tameem Bakr, Anish Ambreth, Nils Lukas

entry.summary: Introduces threshold watermarking for federated learning where K clients embed a shared watermark during training, but only coalitions of at least t clients can verify it. Uses secret sharing to prevent individual clients from extracting and removing the watermark.

entry.title: STRAND: Sequence-Conditioned Transport for Single-Cell Perturbations

author.name: Boyang Fu, George Dasoulas, Sameer Gabbita, Xiang Lin, Shanghua Gao, Xiaorui Su, Soumya Ghosh, Marinka Zitnik

entry.summary: STRAND predicts single-cell transcriptional responses to genetic perturbations by conditioning on regulatory DNA sequence at the genomic locus, using conditional optimal transport. Goes beyond gene-level models to capture locus-specific effects.

entry.title: Statistical Inference and Learning for Shapley Additive Explanations (SHAP)

author.name: Justin Whitehouse, Ayush Sawarni, Vasilis Syrgkanis

entry.summary: Develops rigorous statistical inference methods for global SHAP values (mean absolute and mean squared) using empirical likelihood, enabling proper confidence intervals and hypothesis testing for feature importance comparisons.

entry.title: SoftMatcha 2: A Fast and Soft Pattern Matcher for Trillion-Scale Corpora

author.name: Masataka Yoneda, Yusuke Matsushita, Go Kamoda, Kohei Suenaga, Takuya Akiba, Masaki Waga, Sho Yokoi

entry.summary: Presents SoftMatcha 2, an ultra-fast fuzzy pattern matching algorithm for trillion-scale corpora that handles semantic variations (substitution, insertion, deletion) using suffix arrays. Achieves sub-second search on FineWeb-Edu scale data.

entry.title: Latent Thoughts Tuning: Bridging Context and Reasoning with Fused Information in Latent Tokens

author.name: Weihao Liu, Dehai Min, Lu Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes LT-Tuning, a framework for reasoning in continuous latent space that addresses feature collapse and instability issues of prior latent reasoning methods. Fuses context information into latent tokens rather than recurrently using hidden states.

entry.title: VERA: Identifying and Leveraging Visual Evidence Retrieval Heads in Long-Context Understanding

author.name: Rongcan Pei, Huan Li, Fang Guo, Qi Zhu

entry.summary: Identifies Visual Evidence Retrieval (VER) Heads in VLMs - sparse, dynamic attention heads critical for locating visual cues during reasoning. Proposes VERA, a training-free augmentation method leveraging these heads to improve long-context understanding.

entry.title: Improving Medical Visual Reinforcement Fine-Tuning via Perception and Reasoning Augmentation

author.name: Guangjing Yang, ZhangYuan Yu, Ziyuan Qin, Xinyuan Song, Huahui Yi, Qingbo Kang, Jun Gao, Yiyue Li, Chenlin Du, Qicheng Lao

entry.summary: Proposes VRFT-Aug, a visual reinforcement fine-tuning framework for medical imaging that augments both perception and reasoning through prior knowledge injection, perception-driven policy refinement, and medically informed reward shaping. Extends RFT techniques from LLMs to cross-modal medical vision domains.

entry.title: Generalized Prediction-Powered Inference, with Application to Binary Classifier Evaluation

author.name: Runjia Zou, Daniela Witten, Brian Williamson

entry.summary: Generalizes prediction-powered inference (PPI) to any regular asymptotically linear estimator, situating PPI within the missing data and semi-parametric efficiency theory literature. Shows PPI doesn't achieve the semi-parametric efficiency bound.

entry.title: Do More Predictions Improve Statistical Inference? Filtered Prediction-Powered Inference

author.name: Shirong Xu, Will Wei Sun

entry.summary: Proposes 'Filtered Prediction-Powered Inference,' which selectively uses AI-generated predictions rather than naively incorporating all of them for statistical inference. The method addresses the problem that heterogeneous prediction quality can degrade inference when low-quality predictions dilute informative signals.

entry.title: Neuro-symbolic Action Masking for Deep Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Shuai Han, Mehdi Dastani, Shihan Wang

entry.summary: Proposes NSAM, a framework that automatically learns symbolic models from high-dimensional states during deep RL to mask infeasible actions, requiring minimal supervision rather than manual specification.

entry.title: See, Plan, Snap: Evaluating Multimodal GUI Agents in Scratch

author.name: Xingyi Zhang, Yulei Ye, Kaifeng Huang, Wenhao Li, Xiangfeng Wang

entry.summary: Introduces ScratchWorld, a benchmark for evaluating multimodal GUI agents on program-construction tasks in Scratch. Tests both fine-grained visuomotor control and compositional reasoning across 83 curated tasks.

entry.title: PEST: Physics-Enhanced Swin Transformer for 3D Turbulence Simulation

author.name: Yilong Dai, Shengyu Chen, Xiaowei Jia, Peyman Givi, Runlong Yu

entry.summary: Proposes PEST, a physics-enhanced Swin Transformer for 3D turbulence simulation that integrates physical constraints for stable long-horizon rollouts and faithful small-scale structure reproduction.

entry.title: Protecting Context and Prompts: Deterministic Security for Non-Deterministic AI

author.name: Mohan Rajagopalan, Vinay Rao

entry.summary: Introduces authenticated prompts and authenticated context as cryptographic primitives for LLM workflows, providing verifiable provenance and tamper-evident hash chains. Formalizes a policy algebra with Byzantine resistance theorems.

entry.title: Co-jump: Cooperative Jumping with Quadrupedal Robots via Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Shihao Dong, Yeke Chen, Zeren Luo, Jiahui Zhang, Bowen Xu, Jinghan Lin, Yimin Han, Ji Ma, Zhiyou Yu, Yudong Zhao, Peng Lu

entry.summary: Introduces Co-jump, where two quadrupedal robots learn to synchronize cooperative jumps beyond individual capability using decentralized multi-agent RL (MAPPO) with progressive curriculum, without explicit communication or pre-specified motion primitives.

entry.title: TwiFF (Think With Future Frames): A Large-Scale Dataset for Dynamic Visual Reasoning

author.name: Junhua Liu, Zhangcheng Wang, Zhike Han, Ningli Wang, Guotao Liang, Kun Kuang

entry.summary: Introduces TwiFF-2.7M, the first large-scale temporally grounded Visual Chain-of-Thought dataset derived from 2.7M video clips for dynamic visual reasoning, along with TwiFF-Bench for evaluation of temporal reasoning trajectories.

entry.title: Blind Gods and Broken Screens: Architecting a Secure, Intent-Centric Mobile Agent Operating System

author.name: Zhenhua Zou, Sheng Guo, Qiuyang Zhan, Lepeng Zhao, Shuo Li, Qi Li, Ke Xu, Mingwei Xu, Zhuotao Liu

entry.summary: Conducts a systematic security analysis of mobile AI agents using Doubao Mobile Assistant as a case study, decomposing threats across Agent Identity, External Interface, Internal Reasoning, and Action Execution, and proposing an intent-centric operating system architecture.

entry.title: Chatting with Images for Introspective Visual Thinking

author.name: Junfei Wu, Jian Guan, Qiang Liu, Shu Wu, Liang Wang, Wei Wu, Tienie Tan

entry.summary: Proposes 'chatting with images' framework for vision-language models that reframes visual manipulation as language-guided feature modulation, enabling introspective visual reasoning without external tools.

entry.title: Beyond VLM-Based Rewards: Diffusion-Native Latent Reward Modeling

author.name: Gongye Liu, Bo Yang, Yida Zhi, Zhizhou Zhong, Lei Ke, Didan Deng, Han Gao, Yongxiang Huang, Kaihao Zhang, Hongbo Fu, Wenhan Luo

entry.summary: Proposes DiNa-LRM, a diffusion-native latent reward model that formulates preference learning directly on noisy diffusion states with noise-calibrated Thurstone likelihood, avoiding the domain mismatch of pixel-space VLM rewards.

entry.title: How Much Reasoning Do Retrieval-Augmented Models Add beyond LLMs? A Benchmarking Framework for Multi-Hop Inference over Hybrid Knowledge

author.name: Junhong Lin, Bing Zhang, Song Wang, Ziyan Liu, Dan Gutfreund, Julian Shun, Yada Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces HybridRAG-Bench, a framework for constructing benchmarks to evaluate multi-hop reasoning in retrieval-augmented LLMs over hybrid knowledge (text + knowledge graphs), designed to avoid overlap with pretraining data.

entry.title: Hardware Co-Design Scaling Laws via Roofline Modelling for On-Device LLMs

author.name: Luoyang Sun, Jiwen Jiang, Yifeng Ding, Fengfa Li, Yan Song, Haifeng Zhang, Jian Ying, Lei Ren, Kun Zhan, Wei Chen, Yan Xie, Cheng Deng

entry.summary: Proposes hardware co-design scaling laws that jointly model accuracy and inference performance for on-device LLM deployment, using roofline modeling to jointly optimize across architectures and hardware platforms.

entry.title: Flow Matching with Uncertainty Quantification and Guidance

author.name: Juyeop Han, Lukas Lao Beyer, Sertac Karaman

entry.summary: UA-Flow extends flow matching with heteroscedastic uncertainty prediction, propagating velocity uncertainty through flow dynamics to assess sample reliability and steer generation via uncertainty-aware guidance.

entry.title: Causal Effect Estimation with Learned Instrument Representations

author.name: Frances Dean, Jenna Fields, Radhika Bhalerao, Marie Charpignon, Ahmed Alaa

entry.summary: ZNet constructs instrumental variable representations from observed covariates through architecture design that mirrors IV structural causal models, enabling IV-based causal estimation even without an explicit instrument.

entry.title: Optimal Initialization in Depth: Lyapunov Initialization and Limit Theorems for Deep Leaky ReLU Networks

author.name: Constantin Kogler, Tassilo Schwarz, Samuel Kittle

entry.summary: Provides rigorous probabilistic analysis of deep Leaky ReLU networks, proving Law of Large Numbers and CLT for activation norms governed by the Lyapunov exponent. Shows standard initialization methods (He, orthogonal) are suboptimal and proposes Lyapunov initialization.

entry.title: Neuro-Symbolic Synergy for Interactive World Modeling

author.name: Hongyu Zhao, Siyu Zhou, Haolin Yang, Zengyi Qin, Tianyi Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes NeSyS, a neuro-symbolic framework integrating LLM probabilistic priors with executable symbolic rules for world modeling. Alternates training between neural and symbolic models, with the symbolic model constraining LLM outputs to reduce hallucination.

entry.title: On the Robustness of Knowledge Editing for Detoxification

author.name: Ming Dong, Shiyi Tang, Ziyan Peng, Guanyi Chen, Tingting He

entry.summary: Proposes a robustness evaluation framework for knowledge-editing-based LLM detoxification, identifying 'pseudo-detoxification' where apparent toxicity reductions come from degenerate generation rather than genuine behavioral change. Tests across optimization, compositional, and cross-lingual dimensions.

entry.title: DeepImageSearch: Benchmarking Multimodal Agents for Context-Aware Image Retrieval in Visual Histories

author.name: Chenlong Deng, Mengjie Deng, Junjie Wu, Dun Zeng, Teng Wang, Qingsong Xie, Jiadeng Huang, Shengjie Ma, Changwang Zhang, Zhaoxiang Wang, Jun Wang, Yutao Zhu, Zhicheng Dou

entry.summary: Introduces DeepImageSearch, an agentic paradigm reformulating image retrieval as autonomous exploration over visual histories. Models must perform multi-step reasoning over temporal sequences rather than matching isolated images.

entry.title: FastFlow: Accelerating The Generative Flow Matching Models with Bandit Inference

author.name: Divya Jyoti Bajpai, Dhruv Bhardwaj, Soumya Roy, Tejas Duseja, Harsh Agarwal, Aashay Sandansing, Manjesh Kumar Hanawal

entry.summary: Proposes FastFlow, a plug-and-play adaptive inference framework for flow matching models that identifies and approximates low-impact denoising steps using finite-difference velocity estimates, without retraining.

entry.title: Say, Dream, and Act: Learning Video World Models for Instruction-Driven Robot Manipulation

author.name: Songen Gu, Yunuo Cai, Tianyu Wang, Simo Wu, Yanwei Fu

entry.summary: Proposes a framework for instruction-driven robot manipulation using video world models, combining robust video generation with adversarial distillation for fast prediction and video-conditioned action generation.

entry.title: Found-RL: foundation model-enhanced reinforcement learning for autonomous driving

author.name: Yansong Qu, Zihao Sheng, Zilin Huang, Jiancong Chen, Yuhao Luo, Tianyi Wang, Yiheng Feng, Samuel Labi, Sikai Chen

entry.summary: Presents Found-RL, a platform combining vision-language models with reinforcement learning for autonomous driving. Uses asynchronous batch inference to decouple slow VLM reasoning from fast RL training loops.

entry.title: AD$^2$: Analysis and Detection of Adversarial Threats in Visual Perception for End-to-End Autonomous Driving Systems

author.name: Ishan Sahu, Somnath Hazra, Somak Aditya, Soumyajit Dey

entry.summary: Conducts closed-loop evaluation of autonomous driving agents under black-box adversarial attacks (acoustic blur, electromagnetic interference, ghost objects) in CARLA, revealing severe vulnerabilities.

entry.title: Beyond SMILES: Evaluating Agentic Systems for Drug Discovery

author.name: Edward Wijaya

entry.summary: Evaluates six agentic drug discovery frameworks against 15 task classes, identifying five systematic capability gaps including lack of peptide support, no in vivo/in silico bridge, and no ML training pathway.

entry.title: ImprovEvolve: Ask AlphaEvolve to Improve the Input Solution and Then Improvise

author.name: Alexey Kravatskiy, Valentin Khrulkov, Ivan Oseledets

entry.summary: Presents ImprovEvolve, a technique to enhance AlphaEvolve by evolving programs that improve given input solutions rather than constructing solutions from scratch, reducing cognitive load on the LLM.

entry.title: Constructing Industrial-Scale Optimization Modeling Benchmark

author.name: Zhong Li, Hongliang Lu, Tao Wei, Wenyu Liu, Yuxuan Chen, Yuan Lan, Fan Zhang, Zaiwen Wen

entry.summary: Introduces MIPLIB-NL, a benchmark for evaluating LLMs on industrial-scale optimization modeling with 10³-10⁶ variables and constraints, built via reverse construction from real optimization models to natural language specifications.

entry.title: C^2ROPE: Causal Continuous Rotary Positional Encoding for 3D Large Multimodal-Models Reasoning

author.name: Guanting Ye, Qiyan Zhao, Wenhao Yu, Xiaofeng Zhang, Jianmin Ji, Yanyong Zhang, Ka-Veng Yuen

entry.summary: Proposes C²ROPE, a causal continuous rotary positional encoding for 3D multimodal models that fixes spatial locality loss and long-term attention decay in standard RoPE when processing visual features alongside language.

entry.title: ICA: Information-Aware Credit Assignment for Visually Grounded Long-Horizon Information-Seeking Agents

author.name: Cong Pang, Xuyu Feng, Yujie Yi, Zixuan Chen, Jiawei Hong, Tiankuo Yao, Nang Yuan, Jiapeng Luo, Lewei Lu, Xin Lou

entry.summary: Proposes a visual-native web search framework for information-seeking agents that treats webpages as visual snapshots, combined with Information-Aware Credit Assignment (ICA) for long-horizon RL training that identifies which retrieval actions actually matter.

entry.title: What do people want to fact-check?

author.name: Bijean Ghafouri, Dorsaf Sallami, Luca Luceri, Taylor Lynn Curtis, Jean-Francois Godbout, Emilio Ferrara, Reihaneh Rabbany

entry.summary: Provides the first large-scale empirical study of what people actually want to fact-check when given an open-ended AI fact-checking tool, analyzing ~2,500 statements from 457 participants across five semantic dimensions.

entry.title: ROCKET: Rapid Optimization via Calibration-guided Knapsack Enhanced Truncation for Efficient Model Compression

author.name: Ammar Ali, Baher Mohammad, Denis Makhov, Dmitriy Shopkhoev, Magauiya Zhussip, Stamatios Lefkimmiatis

entry.summary: Presents ROCKET, a training-free model compression method that formulates layer-wise compression as a multi-choice knapsack problem with a single-step sparse matrix factorization, achieving state-of-the-art among training-free compression methods.

entry.title: ContactGaussian-WM: Learning Physics-Grounded World Model from Videos

author.name: Meizhong Wang, Wanxin Jin, Kun Cao, Lihua Xie, Yiguang Hong

entry.summary: Proposes ContactGaussian-WM, a differentiable physics-grounded world model that learns contact-rich dynamics from sparse video sequences using unified Gaussian representations for both visual appearance and collision geometry.

entry.title: Learning to Compose for Cross-domain Agentic Workflow Generation

author.name: Jialiang Wang, Shengxiang Xu, Hanmo Liu, Jiachuan Wang, Yuyu Luo, Shimin Di, Min-Ling Zhang, Lei Chen

entry.summary: Proposes a decompose-recompose-decide mechanism internalized in an open-source LLM for cross-domain agentic workflow generation, learning reusable workflow primitives that transfer across domains.

entry.title: Signature-Kernel Based Evaluation Metrics for Robust Probabilistic and Tail-Event Forecasting

author.name: Benjamin R. Redhead, Thomas L. Lee, Peng Gu, V\'ictor Elvira, Amos Storkey

entry.summary: Proposes signature-kernel-based metrics (Sig-MMD and CSig-MMD) for probabilistic forecasting evaluation that capture inter-temporal dependencies and are sensitive to tail events, addressing critical flaws in current evaluation frameworks.

entry.title: PRISM: Differentially Private Synthetic Data with Structure-Aware Budget Allocation for Prediction

author.name: Amir Asiaee, Chao Yan, Zachary B. Abrams, Bradley A. Malin

entry.summary: Develops PRISM, a prediction-centric approach to differentially private synthetic data that allocates privacy budget based on structural knowledge (causal, graphical, or correlational), rather than treating all features symmetrically.

entry.title: Risk-Equalized Differentially Private Synthetic Data: Protecting Outliers by Controlling Record-Level Influence

author.name: Amir Asiaee, Chao Yan, Zachary B. Abrams, Bradley A. Malin

entry.summary: Introduces risk-equalized DP synthesis that prioritizes protection for high-risk outlier records by estimating per-record outlierness and weighting their influence on the learned generator, reducing membership inference success rate disparities.

entry.title: Analyzing Fairness of Neural Network Prediction via Counterfactual Dataset Generation

author.name: Brian Hyeongseok Kim, Jacqueline L. Mitchell, Chao Wang

entry.summary: Proposes analyzing neural network fairness through counterfactual datasets - finding the closest alternative training dataset (differing by a few label changes) that would alter predictions, providing a new lens on label bias.

entry.title: Adaptive Sampling for Private Worst-Case Group Optimization

author.name: Max Cairney-Leeming, Amartya Sanyal, Christoph H. Lampert

entry.summary: Proposes ASC algorithm for differentially private optimization that focuses on worst-performing groups, adaptively controlling sampling rates and clipping thresholds per group. Addresses the tension between fairness (focusing on hard groups) and privacy (uniform guarantees).

entry.title: From Natural Language to Materials Discovery:The Materials Knowledge Navigation Agent

author.name: Genmao Zhuang, Amir Barati Farimani

entry.summary: MKNA is a language-driven agent that translates natural-language scientific queries into executable actions for materials database retrieval, property prediction, structure generation, and stability evaluation. Applied to high-Debye-temperature material search.

entry.title: GPU-Fuzz: Finding Memory Errors in Deep Learning Frameworks

author.name: Zihao Li, Hongyi Lu, Yanan Guo, Zhenkai Zhang, Shuai Wang, Fengwei Zhang

entry.summary: GPU-Fuzz is a fuzzer for finding GPU memory errors in deep learning frameworks by modeling operator parameters as constraints and using constraint solvers to probe boundary conditions. Found 13 unknown bugs in PyTorch, TensorFlow, and PaddlePaddle.

entry.title: Deep Learning-based Method for Expressing Knowledge Boundary of Black-Box LLM

author.name: Haotian Sheng, Heyong Wang, Ming Hong, Hongman He, Junqiu Liu

entry.summary: Proposes LSCL, a deep learning method for expressing knowledge boundaries of black-box LLMs (API-only access), helping detect when models are operating outside their knowledge. Addresses hallucination by learning confidence scores externally.

entry.title: Canvas-of-Thought: Grounding Reasoning via Mutable Structured States

author.name: Lingzhuang Sun, Yuxia Zhu, Ruitong Liu, Hao Liang, Zheng Sun, Caijun Jia, Honghao He, Yuchen Wu, Siyuan Li, Jingxuan Wei, Xiangxiang Zhang, Bihui Yu, Wentao Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Canvas-of-Thought (CoT), a reasoning approach using mutable structured states instead of immutable linear text chains, allowing models to update and correct reasoning state without regenerating full context. Reduces token consumption for complex reasoning.

entry.title: Embedding Inversion via Conditional Masked Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Han Xiao

entry.summary: Frames embedding inversion as conditional masked diffusion, recovering all tokens in parallel rather than autoregressively. A 78M parameter model achieves 81.3% token accuracy with only 8 forward passes and no access to the target encoder.
