entry.title: TestExplora: Benchmarking LLMs for Proactive Bug Discovery via Repository-Level Test Generation

author.name: Steven Liu, Jane Luo, Xin Zhang, Aofan Liu, Hao Liu, Jie Wu, Ziyang Huang, Yangyu Huang, Yu Kang, Scarlett Li

entry.summary: Introduces TestExplora, a benchmark evaluating LLMs as proactive bug discoverers (finding bugs before failures), with 2,389 tasks from 482 repositories. Addresses the overlooked third goal of software assurance beyond regression and reproduction.

entry.title: Comp2Comp: Open-Source Software with FDA-Cleared Artificial Intelligence Algorithms for Computed Tomography Image Analysis

author.name: Adrit Rao, Malte Jensen, Andrea T. Fisher, Louis Blankemeier, Pauline Berens, Arash Fereydooni, Seth Lirette, Eren Alkan, Felipe C. Kitamura, Juan M. Zambrano Chaves, Eduardo Reis, Arjun Desai, Marc H. Willis, Jason Hom, Andrew Johnston, Leon Lenchik, Robert D. Boutin, Eduardo M. J. M. Farina, Augusto S. Serpa, Marcelo S. Takahashi, Jordan Perchik, Steven A. Rothenberg, Jamie L. Schroeder, Ross Filice, Leonardo K. Bittencourt, Hari Trivedi, Marly van Assen, John Mongan, Kimberly Kallianos, Oliver Aalami, Akshay S. Chaudhari

entry.summary: Reports Comp2Comp, open-source software containing two FDA-510(k)-cleared deep learning pipelines for CT image analysis (aortic quantification and bone mineral density), bridging the gap between open-source transparency and regulatory validation.

entry.title: Eliminating VAE for Fast and High-Resolution Generative Detail Restoration

author.name: Yan Wang, Shijie Zhao, Junlin Li, Li Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes eliminating the VAE bottleneck in diffusion-based super-resolution by using pixel-shuffle operations, converting latent-space models to pixel-space. Addresses memory and latency constraints for high-resolution image restoration.

entry.title: ResWorld: Temporal Residual World Model for End-to-End Autonomous Driving

author.name: Jinqing Zhang, Zehua Fu, Zelin Xu, Wenying Dai, Qingjie Liu, Yunhong Wang

entry.summary: Proposes TR-World (Temporal Residual World Model) for end-to-end autonomous driving that focuses on dynamic object modeling through temporal residuals of scene representations, without relying on explicit detection and tracking.

entry.title: From Representational Complementarity to Dual Systems: Synergizing VLM and Vision-Only Backbones for End-to-End Driving

author.name: Sining Ang, Yuguang Yang, Chenxu Dang, Canyu Chen, Cheng Chi, Haiyan Liu, Xuanyao Mao, Jason Bao, Xuliang, Bingchuan Sun, Yan Wang

entry.summary: Analyzes representational complementarity between VLM and vision-only backbones for end-to-end driving, finding VLMs introduce additional subspaces and exhibit more aggressive behavior in long-tail scenarios. Oracle selection shows 2-3% improvement.

entry.title: LocoVLM: Grounding Vision and Language for Adapting Versatile Legged Locomotion Policies

author.name: I Made Aswin Nahrendra, Seunghyun Lee, Dongkyu Lee, Hyun Myung

entry.summary: Proposes LocoVLM integrating foundation model reasoning into legged locomotion adaptation, using LLMs for skill database synthesis and VLMs for environmental semantic extraction to enable instruction-grounded locomotion.

entry.title: APEX: Learning Adaptive High-Platform Traversal for Humanoid Robots

author.name: Yikai Wang, Tingxuan Leng, Changyi Lin, Shiqi Liu, Shir Simon, Bingqing Chen, Jonathan Francis, Ding Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes APEX, a system for humanoid high-platform traversal using climbing-based behaviors composed through terrain-conditioned RL. Introduces a ratchet progress reward for contact-rich goal-reaching maneuvers.

entry.title: A Doubly Robust Machine Learning Approach for Disentangling Treatment Effect Heterogeneity with Functional Outcomes

author.name: Filippo Salmaso, Lorenzo Testa, Francesca Chiaromonte

entry.summary: Introduces FOCaL, a doubly robust meta-learning framework for estimating heterogeneous treatment effects (CATE) when outcomes are functional (e.g., time series or spatial data) rather than scalar. This extends personalized causal inference to richer data types common in scientific applications.

entry.title: Building a Regex Engine with a team of parallel Claudes

author.name: kiankyars

entry.summary: Demonstrates using two parallel Claude Opus 4.6 agents to build a functioning Rust regex engine, requiring ~1,273 Claude sessions and producing 1.7K lines of code. Plans to scale to a larger project (SQLite-like database engine).

entry.title: LHAW: Controllable Underspecification for Long-Horizon Tasks

author.name: George Pu, Michael S. Lee, Udari Madhushani Sehwag, David J. Lee, Bryan Zhu, Yash Maurya, Mohit Raghavendra, Yuan Xue, Samuel Marc Denton

entry.summary: Introduces LHAW, a modular pipeline that transforms well-specified tasks into controllable underspecified variants for evaluating long-horizon workflow agents, systematically removing information across Goals, Constraints, Context, and Dependencies dimensions.

entry.title: Locomo-Plus: Beyond-Factual Cognitive Memory Evaluation Framework for LLM Agents

author.name: Yifei Li, Weidong Guo, Lingling Zhang, Rongman Xu, Muye Huang, Hui Liu, Lijiao Xu, Yu Xu, Jun Liu

entry.summary: Introduces LoCoMo-Plus, a benchmark for evaluating long-term conversational memory in LLM agents beyond surface-level factual recall, focusing on implicit constraints and cue-trigger semantic disconnect where models must retain latent constraints across long conversations.

entry.title: MERIT Feedback Elicits Better Bargaining in LLM Negotiators

author.name: Jihwan Oh, Murad Aghazada, Yooju Shin, Se-Young Yun, Taehyeon Kim

entry.summary: Introduces AgoraBench, a benchmark for LLM negotiation across nine challenging settings (deception, monopoly), plus utility-theory-grounded metrics. Shows that structured MERIT feedback improves LLM bargaining performance.

entry.title: Spend Search Where It Pays: Value-Guided Structured Sampling and Optimization for Generative Recommendation

author.name: Jie Jiang, Yangru Huang, Zeyu Wang, Changping Wang, Yuling Xiong, Jun Zhang, Huan Yu

entry.summary: Addresses the probability-reward mismatch in RL-tuned generative recommendation systems, proposing value-guided structured sampling that explores high-reward items in low-probability branches instead of relying on beam search.

entry.title: ERGO: Excess-Risk-Guided Optimization for High-Fidelity Monocular 3D Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Zehua Ma, Hanhui Li, Zhenyu Xie, Xiaonan Luo, Michael Kampffmeyer, Feng Gao, Xiaodan Liang

entry.summary: Proposes ERGO, an adaptive optimization framework for monocular 3D Gaussian splatting that decomposes losses into excess risk components to handle geometric inconsistencies in synthesized auxiliary views.

entry.title: The Alignment Bottleneck in Decomposition-Based Claim Verification

author.name: Mahmud Elahi Akhter, Federico Ruggeri, Iman Munire Bilal, Rob Procter, Maria Liakata

entry.summary: Identifies evidence alignment as the critical bottleneck in decomposition-based claim verification. Shows decomposition only helps when evidence is granular and strictly aligned with sub-claims.

entry.title: Time-to-Event Transformer to Capture Timing Attention of Events in EHR Time Series

author.name: Jia Li, Yu Hou, Rui Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a Time-to-Event Transformer for EHR time series that treats timing as a computable dimension, enabling the model to assign relative timestamps and discover personalized sequential event patterns.

entry.title: Breaking the Curse of Repulsion: Optimistic Distributionally Robust Policy Optimization for Off-Policy Generative Recommendation

author.name: Jie Jiang, Yusen Huo, Xiangxin Zhan, Changping Wang, Jun Zhang

entry.summary: Establishes the Divergence Theory of Repulsive Optimization showing negative gradient updates cause exponential intensity explosion in off-policy generative recommendation, then proposes optimistic distributionally robust policy optimization as a fix.

entry.title: Driving Reaction Trajectories via Latent Flow Matching

author.name: Yili Shen, Xiangliang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes LatentRxnFlow, which models chemical reactions as continuous latent trajectories using Conditional Flow Matching, rather than one-shot reactant-to-product mappings. This approach provides insight into the reaction process while maintaining competitive prediction accuracy.

entry.title: 1%>100%: High-Efficiency Visual Adapter with Complex Linear Projection Optimization

author.name: Dongshuo Yin, Xue Yang, Deng-Ping Fan, Shi-Min Hu

entry.summary: Proposes CoLin, an adapter using complex linear projection optimization for vision foundation models that adds only ~1% parameters while achieving strong fine-tuning performance. Provides theoretical analysis of convergence issues in low-rank composite matrices.

entry.title: LLM-Based Scientific Equation Discovery via Physics-Informed Token-Regularized Policy Optimization

author.name: Boxiao Wang, Kai Li, Tianyi Liu, Chen Li, Junzhe Wang, Yifan Zhang, Jian Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes PiT-PO, using RL to evolve LLMs into adaptive symbolic regression generators with physics-informed token-level regularization, moving beyond static prompt-based approaches that fail to update internal representations based on search feedback.

entry.title: Kill it with FIRE: On Leveraging Latent Space Directions for Runtime Backdoor Mitigation in Deep Neural Networks

author.name: Enrico Ahlers, Daniel Passon, Yannic Noller, Lars Grunske

entry.summary: Proposes FIRE, an inference-time backdoor mitigation approach that uses latent space directions to neutralize backdoor triggers without modifying the model or training data, designed for already-deployed models.

entry.title: GraphSeek: Next-Generation Graph Analytics with LLMs

author.name: Maciej Besta, {\L}ukasz Jarmocik, Orest Hrycyna, Shachar Klaiman, Konrad M\k{a}czka, Robert Gerstenberger, J\"urgen M\"uller, Piotr Nyczyk, Hubert Niewiadomski, Torsten Hoefler

entry.summary: Introduces GraphSeek, a framework for LLM-based graph analytics over industry-scale property graphs using a Semantic Catalog abstraction that separates LLM planning from deterministic execution, replacing brittle direct query generation.

entry.title: ELROND: Exploring and decomposing intrinsic capabilities of diffusion models

author.name: Pawe{\l} Skier\'s, Tomasz Trzci\'nski, Kamil Deja

entry.summary: Proposes ELROND, a framework to disentangle semantic variation directions in diffusion models' input embedding space using PCA or Sparse Autoencoders on backpropagated gradient differences between stochastic realizations.

entry.title: Linear-LLM-SCM: Benchmarking LLMs for Coefficient Elicitation in Linear-Gaussian Causal Models

author.name: Kanta Yamaoka, Sumantrak Mukherjee, Thomas G\"artner, David Antony Selby, Stefan Konigorski, Eyke H\"ullermeier, Viktor Bengs, Sebastian Josef Vollmer

entry.summary: Introduces Linear-LLM-SCM, a benchmarking framework for evaluating LLMs on quantitative causal reasoning - specifically estimating linear Gaussian structural causal model parameters when the DAG is given.

entry.title: Binary Flow Matching: Prediction-Loss Space Alignment for Robust Learning

author.name: Jiadong Hong, Lei Liu, Xinyu Bian, Wenjie Wang, Zhaoyang Zhang

entry.summary: Investigates flow matching on binary manifolds, identifying a structural mismatch between x-prediction and velocity-based loss objectives, and proves that prediction-loss alignment is necessary for robust training.

entry.title: QTALE: Quantization-Robust Token-Adaptive Layer Execution for LLMs

author.name: Kanghyun Noh, Jinheon Choi, Yulwha Kim

entry.summary: Proposes QTALE, a framework for integrating token-adaptive layer execution (dynamic layer skipping) with quantization in LLMs, addressing accuracy degradation from naively combining these complementary efficiency techniques.

entry.title: Natural Hypergradient Descent: Algorithm Design, Convergence Analysis, and Parallel Implementation

author.name: Deyi Kong, Zaiwei Chen, Shuzhong Zhang, Shancong Mou

entry.summary: Proposes Natural Hypergradient Descent for bilevel optimization that uses the empirical Fisher information matrix as a surrogate for the Hessian inverse, enabling parallel optimization. Provides high-probability error bounds and sample complexity guarantees.

entry.title: Near-Constant Strong Violation and Last-Iterate Convergence for Online CMDPs via Decaying Safety Margins

author.name: Qian Zuo, Zhiyong Wang, Fengxiang He

entry.summary: FlexDOME is the first algorithm for online CMDPs that achieves near-constant O(1) strong constraint violation alongside sublinear strong regret and non-asymptotic last-iterate convergence, using time-varying safety margins.

entry.title: Sample Efficient Generative Molecular Optimization with Joint Self-Improvement

author.name: Serra Korkmaz, Adam Izdebski, Jonathan Pirnay, Rasmus M{\o}ller-Larsen, Michal Kmicikiewicz, Pankhil Gawade, Dominik G. Grimm, Ewa Szczurek

entry.summary: Introduces Joint Self-Improvement for molecular optimization, combining a joint generative-predictive model with a self-improving sampling scheme to address distribution shift and sample efficiency in drug design.

entry.title: Dissecting Performative Prediction: A Comprehensive Survey

author.name: Thomas Kehrenberg, Javier Sanguino, Jose A. Lozano, Novi Quadrianto

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey of performative prediction - the setting where deploying a predictive model causes distribution shifts in the environment. Covers solution concepts, theoretical analyses, and intersections with other ML fields over the past 5 years.

entry.title: Geometry-Aware Decoding with Wasserstein-Regularized Truncation and Mass Penalties for Large Language Models

author.name: Arash Gholami Davoodi, Navid Rezazadeh, Seyed Pouyan Mousavi Davoudi, Pouya Pezeshkpour

entry.summary: Top-W is a geometry-aware truncation rule for LLM decoding that uses Wasserstein distance over token-embedding geometry to keep the cropped distribution close to the original while balancing probability mass and entropy.

entry.title: Variational Optimality of F\"ollmer Processes in Generative Diffusions

author.name: Yifan Chen, Eric Vanden-Eijnden

entry.summary: Constructs generative diffusions transporting point masses to target distributions using the stochastic interpolant framework, proving that minimizing estimation error selects Föllmer processes. Provides closed-form optimal diffusion coefficients.

entry.title: YOR: Your Own Mobile Manipulator for Generalizable Robotics

author.name: Manan H Anjaria, Mehmet Enes Erciyes, Vedant Ghatnekar, Neha Navarkar, Haritheja Etukuru, Xiaole Jiang, Kanad Patel, Dhawal Kabra, Nicholas Wojno, Radhika Ajay Prayage, Soumith Chintala, Lerrel Pinto, Nur Muhammad Mahi Shafiullah, Zichen Jeff Cui

entry.summary: Introduces YOR, an open-source, low-cost (<$10K) mobile manipulator with omnidirectional base, telescopic lift, and two arms. Demonstrates capabilities in generalizable robotics tasks and provides complete hardware/software specifications.

entry.title: Macaron: Controlled, Human-Written Benchmark for Multilingual and Multicultural Reasoning via Template-Filling

author.name: Alaa Elsetohy, Sama Hadhoud, Haryo Akbarianto Wibowo, Chenxi Whitehouse, Genta Indra Winata, Fajri Koto, Alham Fikri Aji

entry.summary: Introduces Macaron, a multilingual benchmark factorizing reasoning type and cultural context across 20 languages/cultures with 11,862 instances. Uses template-first design to control for reasoning while varying cultural content.

entry.title: Training-Induced Bias Toward LLM-Generated Content in Dense Retrieval

author.name: William Xion, Wolfgang Nejdl

entry.summary: Shows that dense retrieval models develop training-induced bias toward LLM-generated content, tracing this preference across training stages. Challenges the hypothesis that lower perplexity alone explains the bias.

entry.title: HII-DPO: Eliminate Hallucination via Accurate Hallucination-Inducing Counterfactual Images

author.name: Yilin Yang, Zhenghui Guo, Yuke Wang, Omprakash Gnawali, Sheng Di, Chengming Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes HII-DPO for mitigating VLM hallucinations by synthesizing hallucination-inducing counterfactual images and using DPO training. Reveals consistent scene-conditioned hallucination patterns where models mention scene-typical objects without visual evidence.

entry.title: Stride-Net: Fairness-Aware Disentangled Representation Learning for Chest X-Ray Diagnosis

author.name: Darakshan Rashid, Raza Imam, Dwarikanath Mahapatra, Brejesh Lall

entry.summary: Proposes Stride-Net, a fairness-aware framework for chest X-ray classification that learns disease-discriminative yet demographically invariant representations through disentanglement and learnable masking with embedding alignment.

entry.title: FastUSP: A Multi-Level Collaborative Acceleration Framework for Distributed Diffusion Model Inference

author.name: Guandong Li

entry.summary: Proposes FastUSP, a multi-level optimization framework for distributed diffusion model inference combining compile-level, communication-level, and computation-level optimizations for Unified Sequence Parallelism.

entry.title: SurfPhase: 3D Interfacial Dynamics in Two-Phase Flows from Sparse Videos

author.name: Yue Gao, Hong-Xing Yu, Sanghyeon Chang, Qianxi Fu, Bo Zhu, Yoonjin Won, Juan Carlos Niebles, Jiajun Wu

entry.summary: Proposes SurfPhase for reconstructing 3D interfacial dynamics in two-phase flows from sparse camera views, combining dynamic Gaussian surfels with SDF formulation and video diffusion for novel-view synthesis.

entry.title: Adaptive Time Step Flow Matching for Autonomous Driving Motion Planning

author.name: Ananya Trivedi, Anjian Li, Mohamed Elnoor, Yusuf Umut Ciftci, Avinash Singh, Jovin D'sa, Sangjae Bae, David Isele, Taskin Padir, Faizan M. Tariq

entry.summary: Proposes adaptive time step flow matching for autonomous driving motion planning that jointly predicts future motions of ego and surrounding agents. Avoids expensive noise schedule retraining common in consistency models.

entry.title: A Human-in-the-Loop Confidence-Aware Failure Recovery Framework for Modular Robot Policies

author.name: Rohan Banerjee, Krishna Palempalli, Bohan Yang, Jiaying Fang, Alif Abdullah, Tom Silver, Sarah Dean, Tapomayukh Bhattacharjee

entry.summary: Presents a human-in-the-loop failure recovery framework for modular robot policies that integrates calibrated module-level uncertainty with human intervention cost models. Separates module selection from timing decisions.

entry.title: Strategic awareness tools: design sketches

author.name: rosehadshar

entry.summary: Presents design sketches for AI-powered 'strategic awareness tools' including ambient superforecasting, scenario planning on tap, and other tools that could help individuals and institutions make better decisions during the AI transition period.

entry.title: What concrete mechanisms could lead to AI models having open-ended goals?

author.name: Jemal Young

entry.summary: Explores what concrete mechanisms could lead to AI models developing open-ended goals, identifying three candidates: training on open-ended tasks, RL with open-ended reward specs, and mesa-optimization. Argues mesa-optimization is unlikely and that instrumental convergence alone doesn't create open-ended goals.

entry.title: Flow caching for autoregressive video generation

author.name: Yuexiao Ma, Xuzhe Zheng, Jing Xu, Xiwei Xu, Feng Ling, Xiawu Zheng, Huafeng Kuang, Huixia Li, Xing Wang, Xuefeng Xiao, Fei Chao, Rongrong Ji

entry.summary: Presents FlowCache, the first caching framework for autoregressive video generation that maintains independent caching policies per video chunk, recognizing that different chunks have varying similarity patterns at identical timesteps.

entry.title: Resource-Efficient Model-Free Reinforcement Learning for Board Games

author.name: Kazuki Ota, Takayuki Osa, Motoki Omura, Tatsuya Harada

entry.summary: Proposes a model-free RL algorithm for board games that achieves more efficient learning than search-based methods like AlphaZero, validated across five board games including Go, without requiring the computational demands of tree search.

entry.title: Weighting-Based Identification and Estimation in Graphical Models of Missing Data

author.name: Anna Guo, Razieh Nabi

entry.summary: Introduces a tree-based algorithm for identifying complete data distributions in graphical models with missing data, using an interventionist framework where missingness indicators are treated as variables that can be intervened on. Addresses the challenge that interventions on missingness can propagate selection bias.

entry.title: Large Language Models Predict Functional Outcomes after Acute Ischemic Stroke

author.name: Anjali K. Kapoor (Department of Neurosurgery, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA), Anton Alyakin (Department of Neurosurgery, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA, Global AI Frontier Lab, New York University, Brooklyn, USA, Department of Neurosurgery, Washington University in Saint Louis, Saint Louis, USA), Jin Vivian Lee (Department of Neurosurgery, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA, Global AI Frontier Lab, New York University, Brooklyn, USA, Department of Neurosurgery, Washington University in Saint Louis, Saint Louis, USA), Eunice Yang (Department of Neurosurgery, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA, Columbia University Vagelos College of Physicians and Surgeons, New York, USA), Annelene M. Schulze (Department of Neurosurgery, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA), Krithik Vishwanath (Department of Aerospace Engineering and Engineering Mechanics, University of Texas at Austin, Austin, USA), Jinseok Lee (Global AI Frontier Lab, New York University, Brooklyn, USA, Department of Biomedical Engineering, Kyung Hee University, Yongin, South Korea), Yindalon Aphinyanaphongs (Department of Population Health, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA, Division of Applied AI Technologies, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA), Howard Riina (Department of Neurosurgery, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA, Department of Radiology, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA), Jennifer A. Frontera (Department of Neurology, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA), Eric Karl Oermann (Department of Neurosurgery, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA, Global AI Frontier Lab, New York University, Brooklyn, USA, Division of Applied AI Technologies, NYU Langone Health, New York, USA, Center for Data Science, New York University, New York, USA)

entry.summary: Evaluates encoder and generative LLMs for predicting functional outcomes after acute ischemic stroke from admission notes. Compares BERT, NYUTron, Llama-3.1, and MedGemma on mRS prediction using a large stroke registry.

entry.title: Can Large Language Models Implement Agent-Based Models? An ODD-based Replication Study

author.name: Nuno Fachada, Daniel Fernandes, Carlos M. Fernandes, Jo\~ao P. Matos-Carvalho

entry.summary: Evaluates 17 LLMs on translating ODD (Overview, Design concepts, Details) specifications into executable agent-based model code, using the PPHPC predator-prey model as a reference.

entry.title: Cosmo3DFlow: Wavelet Flow Matching for Spatial-to-Spectral Compression in Reconstructing the Early Universe

author.name: Md. Khairul Islam, Zeyu Xia, Ryan Goudjil, Jialu Wang, Arya Farahi, Judy Fox

entry.summary: Proposes Cosmo3DFlow, combining 3D discrete wavelet transforms with flow matching for cosmological reconstruction, addressing dimensionality and sparsity by translating spatial emptiness into spectral sparsity.

entry.title: Equivariant Evidential Deep Learning for Interatomic Potentials

author.name: Zhongyao Wang, Taoyong Cui, Jiawen Zou, Shufei Zhang, Bo Yan, Wanli Ouyang, Weimin Tan, Mao Su

entry.summary: Extends evidential deep learning to vector-valued predictions for machine learning interatomic potentials, enabling single-forward-pass uncertainty quantification for both energies and forces while maintaining equivariance.

entry.title: AudioRouter: Data Efficient Audio Understanding via RL based Dual Reasoning

author.name: Liyang Chen, Hongkai Chen, Yujun Cai, Sifan Li, Qingwen Ye, Yiwei Wang

entry.summary: Proposes AudioRouter, an RL framework that teaches large audio language models when to use external audio tools versus internal reasoning, treating tool use as an explicit decision-making problem. The routing policy is lightweight and keeps the base reasoning model frozen.

entry.title: Neural Additive Experts: Context-Gated Experts for Controllable Model Additivity

author.name: Guangzhi Xiong, Sanchit Sinha, Aidong Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Neural Additive Experts (NAEs), a mixture-of-experts framework that balances interpretability and accuracy by learning multiple specialized networks per feature with dynamic gating, relaxing the strict additive constraint of standard GAMs.

entry.title: OmniVL-Guard: Towards Unified Vision-Language Forgery Detection and Grounding via Balanced RL

author.name: Jinjie Shen, Jing Wu, Yaxiong Wang, Lechao Cheng, Shengeng Tang, Tianrui Hui, Nan Pu, Zhun Zhong

entry.summary: Proposes OmniVL-Guard for unified vision-language forgery detection and grounding across interleaved text, images, and videos, using balanced RL to address the difficulty bias where simpler classification dominates over fine-grained grounding.

entry.title: Enhancing Multivariate Time Series Forecasting with Global Temporal Retrieval

author.name: Fanpu Cao, Lu Dai, Jindong Han, Hui Xiong

entry.summary: Introduces Global Temporal Retriever (GTR), a plug-and-play module that extends time series forecasting models' temporal awareness by retrieving relevant historical patterns beyond the input horizon, capturing global periodic patterns.

entry.title: General Flexible $f$-divergence for Challenging Offline RL Datasets with Low Stochasticity and Diverse Behavior Policies

author.name: Jianxun Wang, Grant C. Forbes, Leonardo Villalobos-Arias, David L. Roberts

entry.summary: Proposes a general flexible f-divergence framework for offline RL that addresses datasets with low stochasticity and diverse behavior policies, connecting f-divergence choices to Bellman residual optimization constraints.

entry.title: Neural Network Quantum Field Theory from Transformer Architectures

author.name: Dmitry S. Ageev, Yulia A. Ageeva

entry.summary: Constructs Euclidean scalar quantum field theories from transformer attention heads by averaging over random network parameters, computing two-point and four-point correlation functions and identifying non-Gaussian statistics from shared random softmax weights.

entry.title: Colorful Talks with Graphs: Human-Interpretable Graph Encodings for Large Language Models

author.name: Angelo Zangari, Peyman Baghershahi, Sourav Medya

entry.summary: Introduces human-interpretable graph encodings for LLMs using Weisfeiler-Lehman similarity classes mapped to color tokens, enabling LLMs to reason about graph structure through natural language prompts.

entry.title: What Makes Value Learning Efficient in Residual Reinforcement Learning?

author.name: Guozheng Ma, Lu Li, Haoyu Wang, Zixuan Liu, Pierre-Luc Bacon, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: Identifies and addresses two key bottlenecks in residual RL value learning: cold start pathology and structural scale mismatch, showing that base-policy transitions as value anchors and critic normalization suffice as solutions.

entry.title: TRACE: Theoretical Risk Attribution under Covariate-shift Effects

author.name: Hosein Anjidani, S. Yahya S. R. Tehrani, Mohammad Mahdi Mojahedian, Mohammad Hossein Yassaee

entry.summary: Introduces TRACE, a framework decomposing risk change when models are retrained on shifted data into four interpretable factors: two generalization gaps, a model change penalty, and a covariate shift penalty.

entry.title: Learning Mixture Density via Natural Gradient Expectation Maximization

author.name: Yutao Chen, Jasmine Bayrooti, Steven Morad

entry.summary: Improves mixture density network optimization by connecting them to deep latent-variable models via an expectation maximization framework, revealing connections to natural gradient descent and deriving a natural gradient EM objective (nGEM).

entry.title: Generative clinical time series models trained on moderate amounts of patient data are privacy preserving

author.name: Rustam Zhumagambetov, Niklas Giesa, Sebastian D. Boie, Stefan Haufe

entry.summary: Shows that generative models for clinical time series trained on moderate dataset sizes can preserve privacy, evaluating through membership inference attacks and demonstrating privacy protection without explicit DP mechanisms.

entry.title: Coarse-Grained Boltzmann Generators

author.name: Weilong Chen, Bojun Zhao, Jan Eckwert, Julija Zavadlav

entry.summary: Proposes Coarse-Grained Boltzmann Generators that combine coarse-grained molecular modeling with exact-likelihood generative models and importance sampling, enabling scalable molecular sampling with correctness guarantees.

entry.title: The Sample Complexity of Uniform Approximation for Multi-Dimensional CDFs and Fixed-Price Mechanisms

author.name: Matteo Castiglioni, Anna Lunghi, Alberto Marchesi

entry.summary: Studies sample complexity of learning multi-dimensional CDFs under one-bit bandit feedback, showing near-dimensional-invariance where dimensionality only affects logarithmic terms. Provides tight bounds and novel results for fixed-price mechanism design.

entry.title: Stochastic Parroting in Temporal Attention -- Regulating the Diagonal Sink

author.name: Victoria Hankemeier, Malte Hankemeier

entry.summary: Analyzes temporal attention mechanisms, deriving sensitivity bounds showing that off-diagonal attention scores depend on sequence length and that temporal attention suffers from a diagonal attention sink. Proposes regularization methods to address this.

entry.title: Beyond Closed-Pool Video Retrieval: A Benchmark and Agent Framework for Real-World Video Search and Moment Localization

author.name: Tao Yu, Yujia Yang, Haopeng Jin, Junhao Gong, Xinlong Chen, Yuxuan Zhou, Shanbin Zhang, Jiabing Yang, Xinming Wang, Hongzhu Yi, Ping Nie, Kai Zou, Zhang Zhang, Yan Huang, Liang Wang, Yeshani, Ruiwen Tao, Jin Ma, Haijin Liang, Jinwen Luo

entry.summary: RVMS-Bench is a benchmark for real-world video memory search with 1,440 samples using hierarchical descriptions that mimic realistic multi-dimensional search cues including visual impression, key moments, temporal context, and auditory memory.

entry.title: Compute Only Once: UG-Separation for Efficient Large Recommendation Models

author.name: Hui Lu, Zheng Chai, Shipeng Bai, Hao Zhang, Zhifang Fan, Kunmin Bai, Yingwen Wu, Bingzheng Wei, Xiang Sun, Ziyan Gong, Tianyi Liu, Hua Chen, Deping Xie, Zhongkai Chen, Zhiliang Guo, Qiwei Chen, Yuchao Zheng

entry.summary: UG-Sep enables reusable user-side computation in dense feature interaction recommendation models by introducing a masking mechanism that disentangles user and item information flows, addressing the scaling cost of large recommendation models.

entry.title: Solving PDEs in One Shot via Fourier Features with Exact Analytical Derivatives

author.name: Antonin Sulc

entry.summary: FastLSQ exploits the cyclic derivative property of sinusoidal Fourier features (O(1) per derivative) to solve PDEs in a single least-squares step, avoiding iterative optimization entirely. Achieves massive speedups over PINNs.

entry.title: Deep Bootstrap

author.name: Jinyuan Chang, Yuling Jiao, Lican Kang, Junjie Shi

entry.summary: Proposes Deep Bootstrap using conditional diffusion models for nonparametric regression, generating bootstrap samples by pairing original covariates with diffusion-generated responses. Unifies conditional distribution estimation, sampling, and regression.

entry.title: The Subjectivity of Respect in Police Traffic Stops: Modeling Community Perspectives in Body-Worn Camera Footage

author.name: Preni Golazizian, Elnaz Rahmati, Jackson Trager, Zhivar Sourati, Nona Ghazizadeh, Georgios Chochlakis, Jose Alcocer, Kerby Bennett, Aarya Vijay Devnani, Parsa Hejabi, Harry G. Muttram, Akshay Kiran Padte, Mehrshad Saadatinia, Chenhao Wu, Alireza S. Zaibari, Michael Sierra-Ar\'evalo, Nick Weller, Shrikanth Narayanan, Benjamin A. T. Graham, Morteza Dehghani

entry.summary: Introduces the first large-scale traffic-stop dataset annotated with respect ratings from multiple community perspectives (police-affiliated, justice-impacted, non-affiliated) using LAPD body-worn camera footage. Models subjective respect perception.

entry.title: UMEM: Unified Memory Extraction and Management Framework for Generalizable Memory

author.name: Yongshi Ye, Hui Jiang, Feihu Jiang, Tian Lan, Yichao Du, Biao Fu, Xiaodong Shi, Qianghuai Jia, Longyue Wang, Weihua Luo

entry.summary: Proposes UMEM, a framework that jointly optimizes memory extraction and management for LLM-based agents, using Semantic Neighborhood Modeling to prevent overfitting to specific instances. Addresses the gap between extraction and management in self-evolving agent memory.

entry.title: Can Large Language Models Make Everyone Happy?

author.name: Usman Naseem, Gautam Siddharth Kashyap, Ebad Shabbir, Sushant Kumar Ray, Abdullah Mohammad, Rafiq Ali

entry.summary: Proposes a cross-dimensional misalignment benchmark for LLMs that evaluates trade-offs between safety, values, and cultural dimensions simultaneously, rather than testing each in isolation as existing benchmarks do.

entry.title: Characterizing and Optimizing the Spatial Kernel of Multi Resolution Hash Encodings

author.name: Tianxiang Dai, Jonathan Fan

entry.summary: Characterizes the spatial behavior of Multi-Resolution Hash Encodings (MHE) by analyzing their Point Spread Function, deriving closed-form approximations revealing grid-induced anisotropy and establishing criteria for optimal hyperparameter selection.

entry.title: Med-SegLens: Latent-Level Model Diffing for Interpretable Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Salma J. Ahmed, Emad A. Mohammed, Azam Asilian Bidgoli

entry.summary: Introduces Med-SegLens, a model-diffing framework for medical image segmentation that decomposes activations into interpretable latent features using sparse autoencoders, identifying shared representations and population-specific failure modes across patient cohorts.

entry.title: Dynamic Frequency Modulation for Controllable Text-driven Image Generation

author.name: Tiandong Shi, Ling Zhao, Ji Qi, Jiayi Ma, Chengli Peng

entry.summary: Proposes dynamic frequency modulation for controllable text-driven image generation, analyzing how frequency spectrum of noisy latent variables affects hierarchical structure emergence in diffusion models. Provides a frequency-domain perspective on generation control.

entry.title: From Steering to Pedalling: Do Autonomous Driving VLMs Generalize to Cyclist-Assistive Spatial Perception and Planning?

author.name: Krishna Kanth Nakka, Vedasri Nakka

entry.summary: Introduces CyclingVQA, a diagnostic benchmark for evaluating VLMs from a cyclist's perspective, testing perception, spatio-temporal understanding, and traffic-rule reasoning. Evaluates 31+ VLMs and finds significant gaps in cyclist-centric reasoning.

entry.title: Hyperspectral Smoke Segmentation via Mixture of Prototypes

author.name: Lujian Yao, Haitao Zhao, Xianghai Kong, Yuhan Xu

entry.summary: Introduces hyperspectral imaging for smoke segmentation with the first hyperspectral smoke segmentation dataset (HSSDataset) from 18,000+ frames across 20 real-world scenarios. Proposes a Mixture of Prototypes approach for adaptive band weighting.

entry.title: HairWeaver: Few-Shot Photorealistic Hair Motion Synthesis with Sim-to-Real Guided Video Diffusion

author.name: Di Chang, Ji Hou, Aljaz Bozic, Assaf Neuberger, Felix Juefei-Xu, Olivier Maury, Gene Wei-Chin Lin, Tuur Stuyck, Doug Roble, Mohammad Soleymani, Stephane Grabli

entry.summary: Presents HairWeaver, a diffusion-based pipeline for animating human images with realistic hair dynamics using Motion-Context-LoRA and Sim2Real-Domain-LoRA modules. Trains on specialized dynamic human motion data.

entry.title: ReSPEC: A Framework for Online Multispectral Sensor Reconfiguration in Dynamic Environments

author.name: Yanchen Liu, Yuang Fan, Minghui Zhao, Xiaofan Jiang

entry.summary: Introduces ReSPEC, a framework for online multispectral sensor reconfiguration that unifies sensing, learning, and actuation into a closed loop using RL to adaptively configure sensor modalities based on situational utility.

entry.title: Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning of Drone Aerobatics by Exploiting Geometric Symmetries

author.name: Zhanyu Guo, Zikang Yin, Guobin Zhu, Shiliang Guo, Shiyu Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes GEAR, a multi-task RL framework for drone aerobatics that exploits SO(2) rotational symmetry in MAV dynamics through geometric equivariance, enabling a single policy to master multiple aerobatic maneuvers.

entry.title: A Non-asymptotic Analysis for Learning and Applying a Preconditioner in MCMC

author.name: Max Hird, Florian Maire, Jeffrey Negrea

entry.summary: Provides non-asymptotic analysis of learning a preconditioner during MCMC sampling, specifically for the Unadjusted Langevin Algorithm. Establishes finite-time guarantees showing that learned preconditioning can provably improve computational efficiency.

entry.title: Jevons Burnout

author.name: Kemp

entry.summary: Explores 'Jevons Burnout'—the scenario where AI makes human labor so productive that demand for it increases (Jevons paradox), but the resulting work environment becomes unsustainably intense and burns people out, creating a new kind of dystopia even without mass unemployment.

entry.title: TokaMark: A Comprehensive Benchmark for MAST Tokamak Plasma Models

author.name: C\'ecile Rousseau, Samuel Jackson, Rodrigo H. Ordonez-Hurtado, Nicola C. Amorisco, Tobia Boschi, George K. Holt, Andrea Loreti, Eszter Sz\'ekely, Alexander Whittle, Adriano Agnello, Stanislas Pamela, Alessandra Pascale, Robert Akers, Juan Bernabe Moreno, Sue Thorne, Mykhaylo Zayats

entry.summary: Introduces TokaMark, a curated benchmark and dataset for AI models applied to MAST tokamak plasma dynamics prediction from sparse, noisy sensor data.

entry.title: RealHD: A High-Quality Dataset for Robust Detection of State-of-the-Art AI-Generated Images

author.name: Hanzhe Yu, Yun Ye, Jintao Rong, Qi Xuan, Chen Ma

entry.summary: Proposes RealHD, a large-scale dataset of 730K+ images for detecting AI-generated images, covering state-of-the-art generation methods including text-to-image, image-to-image, and inpainting across multiple categories.

entry.title: MetaphorStar: Image Metaphor Understanding and Reasoning with End-to-End Visual Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Chenhao Zhang, Yazhe Niu, Hongsheng Li

entry.summary: Proposes MetaphorStar, the first end-to-end visual reinforcement learning framework for understanding image metaphors, including a dataset (TFQ-Data), RL method (TFQ-GRPO), and evaluation pipeline for visual implication tasks requiring cultural and emotional reasoning.

entry.title: AugVLA-3D: Depth-Driven Feature Augmentation for Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Zhifeng Rao, Wenlong Chen, Lei Xie, Xia Hua, Dongfu Yin, Zhen Tian, F. Richard Yu

entry.summary: Proposes AugVLA-3D, integrating depth estimation into Vision-Language-Action models for robotics by extracting 3D cues from RGB inputs using VGGT, enhancing spatial understanding for robotic manipulation in 3D environments.

entry.title: Diagnosing Structural Failures in LLM-Based Evidence Extraction for Meta-Analysis

author.name: Zhiyin Tan, Jennifer D'Souza

entry.summary: Proposes a structural diagnostic framework for evaluating LLM-based evidence extraction for meta-analysis, testing schema-constrained queries with increasing relational complexity to identify precise failure points beyond atom-level extraction.

entry.title: Interactive LLM-assisted Curriculum Learning for Multi-Task Evolutionary Policy Search

author.name: Berfin Sakallioglu, Giorgia Nadizar, Eric Medvet

entry.summary: Proposes an interactive LLM-assisted framework for online curriculum generation in multi-task evolutionary policy search, where the LLM adaptively designs training cases based on real-time feedback from the optimization process.

entry.title: OSIL: Learning Offline Safe Imitation Policies with Safety Inferred from Non-preferred Trajectories

author.name: Returaj Burnwal, Nirav Pravinbhai Bhatt, Balaraman Ravindran

entry.summary: Introduces OSIL, an offline safe imitation learning algorithm that infers safety constraints from non-preferred trajectories without per-timestep safety cost annotations. Formulates safe policy learning as a CMDP and avoids online environment interaction.

entry.title: Chamfer-Linkage for Hierarchical Agglomerative Clustering

author.name: Kishen N Gowda, Willem Fletcher, MohammadHossein Bateni, Laxman Dhulipala, D Ellis Hershkowitz, Rajesh Jayaram, Jakub {\L}\k{a}cki

entry.summary: Proposes Chamfer-linkage, a novel linkage function for Hierarchical Agglomerative Clustering that measures bidirectional average nearest-neighbor distances, showing more consistent quality than classical linkages across diverse datasets.

entry.title: Online Min-Max Optimization: From Individual Regrets to Cumulative Saddle Points

author.name: Abhijeet Vyas, Brian Bullins

entry.summary: Proposes online min-max optimization based on cumulative saddle points, showing incompatibility of static Nash equilibrium with individual regrets and introducing static duality gap and dynamic saddle point regret measures.

entry.title: On the Role of Consistency Between Physics and Data in Physics-Informed Neural Networks

author.name: Nicol\'as Becerra-Zuniga, Lucas Lacasa, Eusebio Valero, Gonzalo Rubio

entry.summary: Systematically analyzes how data-to-PDE inconsistencies fundamentally limit PINN accuracy, showing that training with noisy or inconsistent data creates inherent accuracy bounds.

entry.title: Semi-Supervised Cross-Domain Imitation Learning

author.name: Li-Min Chu, Kai-Siang Ma, Ming-Hong Chen, Ping-Chun Hsieh

entry.summary: Introduces semi-supervised cross-domain imitation learning (SS-CDIL) that uses a small number of target expert demonstrations and unlabeled imperfect trajectories to transfer policies across domains. Proposes a novel cross-domain loss function with theoretical justification.

entry.title: Divide, Harmonize, Then Conquer It: Shooting Multi-Commodity Flow Problems with Multimodal Language Models

author.name: Xinyu Yuan, Yan Qiao, Zonghui Wang, Wenzhi Chen

entry.summary: Pram uses multimodal language models to solve multi-commodity flow optimization problems by dividing them into local subproblems handled by an MLM-powered agent, with global constraint harmonization.

entry.title: Validating Interpretability in siRNA Efficacy Prediction: A Perturbation-Based, Dataset-Aware Protocol

author.name: Zahra Khodagholi, Niloofar Yousefi

entry.summary: Proposes a validation protocol for saliency map-based design guidance in siRNA efficacy prediction, revealing failure modes where saliency is faithful but model predictions fail, or where top-saliency edits are less impactful than random controls.

entry.title: Physically Interpretable AlphaEarth Foundation Model Embeddings Enable LLM-Based Land Surface Intelligence

author.name: Mashrekur Rahman

entry.summary: Analyzes Google AlphaEarth's satellite foundation model embeddings for physical interpretability, showing individual dimensions map to specific land surface properties and can be integrated with LLMs for environmental decision systems.

entry.title: A Gibbs posterior sampler for inverse problem based on prior diffusion model

author.name: Jean-Fran\c{c}ois Giovannelli

entry.summary: Introduces a Gibbs sampling algorithm for inverse problems using diffusion model priors, showing this unexplored approach is effective, simple, and has convergence guarantees. Provides an alternative to existing posterior sampling methods.

entry.title: Reviewing the Reviewer: Elevating Peer Review Quality through LLM-Guided Feedback

author.name: Sukannya Purkayastha, Qile Wan, Anne Lauscher, Lizhen Qu, Iryna Gurevych

entry.summary: Proposes an LLM-driven framework for improving peer review quality by decomposing reviews into argumentative segments, identifying issues via neurosymbolic modules, and generating targeted feedback using templates refined by genetic algorithms.

entry.title: MLDocRAG: Multimodal Long-Context Document Retrieval Augmented Generation

author.name: Yongyue Zhang, Yaxiong Wu

entry.summary: Proposes MLDocRAG for multimodal long-document understanding using a Multimodal Chunk-Query Graph that projects cross-modal content into unified query space, addressing cross-modal heterogeneity and cross-page reasoning challenges.

entry.title: DEGMC: Denoising Diffusion Models Based on Riemannian Equivariant Group Morphological Convolutions

author.name: El Hadji S. Diop, Thierno Fall, Mohamed Daoudi

entry.summary: Introduces DEGMC, denoising diffusion models incorporating Riemannian equivariant group morphological convolutions derived from Hamilton-Jacobi PDEs, addressing geometric feature extraction and network equivariance in DDPMs.

entry.title: Multimodal Priors-Augmented Text-Driven 3D Human-Object Interaction Generation

author.name: Yin Wang, Ziyao Zhang, Zhiying Leng, Haitian Liu, Frederick W. B. Li, Mu Li, Xiaohui Liang

entry.summary: Proposes MP-HOI for text-driven 3D human-object interaction generation, leveraging multimodal priors from large models to bridge the cross-modality gap. Addresses sub-optimal human/object motion and weak interaction through enhanced object representation and multimodal guidance.

entry.title: Ecological mapping with geospatial foundation models

author.name: Craig Mahlasi, Gciniwe S. Baloyi, Zaheed Gaffoor, Levente Klein, Anne Jones, Etienne Vos, Michal Muszynski, Geoffrey Dawson, Campbell Watson

entry.summary: Explores geospatial foundation models (Prithvi-E0-2.0 and TerraMind) for ecological mapping tasks including LULC generation, forest trait mapping, and peatlands detection. GFMs outperform baseline ResNet models across all experiments.

entry.title: DMP-3DAD: Cross-Category 3D Anomaly Detection via Realistic Depth Map Projection with Few Normal Samples

author.name: Zi Wang, Katsuya Hotta, Koichiro Kamide, Yawen Zou, Jianjian Qin, Chao Zhang, Jun Yu

entry.summary: Proposes DMP-3DAD, a training-free framework for cross-category 3D anomaly detection using multi-view realistic depth map projection and frozen CLIP visual encoder. Eliminates need for category-specific training.

entry.title: Towards Learning a Generalizable 3D Scene Representation from 2D Observations

author.name: Martin Gromniak, Jan-Gerrit Habekost, Sebastian Kamp, Sven Magg, Stefan Wermter

entry.summary: Introduces a Generalizable Neural Radiance Field approach for predicting 3D workspace occupancy from egocentric robot observations in global coordinates. Achieves 26mm reconstruction error trained on 40 real scenes.

entry.title: LaSSM: Efficient Semantic-Spatial Query Decoding via Local Aggregation and State Space Models for 3D Instance Segmentation

author.name: Lei Yao, Yi Wang, Yawen Cui, Moyun Liu, Lap-Pui Chau

entry.summary: Introduces LaSSM for 3D instance segmentation using hierarchical semantic-spatial query initialization and coordinate-guided state space model decoder for efficient query refinement from point clouds.

entry.title: SQ-CBF: Signed Distance Functions for Numerically Stable Superquadric-Based Safety Filtering

author.name: Haocheng Zhao, Lukas Brunke, Oliver Lagerquist, Siqi Zhou, Angela P. Schoellig

entry.summary: Identifies a critical issue with superquadric implicit functions as barrier candidates (gradient problems) and proposes SQ-CBF using signed distance functions for numerically stable safety filtering in cluttered environments.

entry.title: A receding-horizon multi-contact motion planner for legged robots in challenging environments

author.name: Daniel S. J. Derwent, Simon Watson, Bruno V. Adorno

entry.summary: Presents a receding-horizon multi-contact motion planner for legged robots capable of chimney climbing, narrow passage navigation, and large gap crossing, with reactive re-planning and simultaneous contact/trajectory optimization.

entry.title: Fast and Large-Scale Unbalanced Optimal Transport via its Semi-Dual and Adaptive Gradient Methods

author.name: Ferdinand Genans (SU, LPSM)

entry.summary: Develops scalable gradient-based algorithms for Unbalanced Optimal Transport (UOT) by analyzing the semi-dual formulation and showing it is amenable to adaptive gradient methods despite apparent ill-conditioning. This enables large-scale UOT computation which is important for robust distribution matching with outliers.

entry.title: Abstraction Generation for Generalized Planning with Pretrained Large Language Models

author.name: Zhenhe Cui, Huaxiang Xia, Hangjun Shen, Kailun Luo, Yong He, Wei Liang

entry.summary: Investigates whether LLMs can generate QNP (Qualitative Numerical Planning) abstractions for generalized planning problems, with an automated debugging method to fix abstraction errors.

entry.title: Anatomy-Preserving Latent Diffusion for Generation of Brain Segmentation Masks with Ischemic Infarct

author.name: Lucia Borrego, Vajira Thambawita, Marco Ciuffreda, Ines del Val, Alejandro Dominguez, Josep Munuera

entry.summary: Proposes an anatomy-preserving generative framework for synthesizing brain segmentation masks including ischemic infarcts, combining VAE for anatomical representation with diffusion in latent space.

entry.title: The Complexity of Bayesian Network Learning: Revisiting the Superstructure

author.name: Robert Ganian, Viktoriia Korchemna

entry.summary: Investigates parameterized complexity of Bayesian Network Structure Learning, showing fixed-parameter tractability when parameterized by feedback edge set size in the superstructure.

entry.title: Beyond Calibration: Confounding Pathology Limits Foundation Model Specificity in Abdominal Trauma CT

author.name: Jineel H Raythatha, Shuchang Ye, Jeremy Hsu, Jinman Kim

entry.summary: Investigates why foundation models have poor specificity for abdominal traumatic injury detection in CT, finding that heterogeneity in the negative class (confounding pathology) is a key limiting factor.

entry.title: Modular Multi-Task Learning for Chemical Reaction Prediction

author.name: Jiayun Pang, Ahmed M. Zaitoun, Xacobe Couso Cambeiro, Ivan Vuli\'c

entry.summary: Evaluates LoRA as parameter-efficient fine-tuning for organic reaction prediction, showing it achieves comparable accuracy to full fine-tuning while mitigating catastrophic forgetting across forward synthesis, retrosynthesis, and reagent prediction.

entry.title: Learning Adaptive Distribution Alignment with Neural Characteristic Function for Graph Domain Adaptation

author.name: Wei Chen, Xingyu Guo, Shuang Li, Zhao Zhang, Yan Zhong, Fuzhen Zhuang, Deqing wang

entry.summary: Proposes ADAlign for graph domain adaptation, using neural characteristic functions to learn adaptive distribution alignment without manually designed graph filters. Automatically identifies and aligns the most important distributional discrepancies across transfer scenarios.

entry.title: Cross-Sectional Asset Retrieval via Future-Aligned Soft Contrastive Learning

author.name: Hyeongmin Lee, Chanyeol Choi, Jihoon Kwon, Yoon Kim, Alejandro Lopez-Lira, Wonbin Ahn, Yongjae Lee

entry.summary: Proposes FASCL for financial asset retrieval that uses future return correlations as continuous supervision targets in a soft contrastive learning framework, arguing that asset similarity should be future-aligned rather than based on historical patterns.

entry.title: VulReaD: Knowledge-Graph-guided Software Vulnerability Reasoning and Detection

author.name: Samal Mukhtar, Yinghua Yao, Zhu Sun, Mustafa Mustafa, Yew Soon Ong, Youcheng Sun

entry.summary: Proposes VulReaD, using knowledge graph-guided approaches for software vulnerability detection that goes beyond binary classification to CWE-level reasoning, using teacher LLM-generated contrastive reasoning supervision.

entry.title: FedPS: Federated data Preprocessing via aggregated Statistics

author.name: Xuefeng Xu, Graham Cormode

entry.summary: Introduces FedPS, a unified framework for federated data preprocessing using data-sketching techniques to efficiently summarize local datasets while preserving statistics needed for handling missing values, inconsistent formats, and heterogeneous scales.

entry.title: RiemannGL: Riemannian Geometry Changes Graph Deep Learning

author.name: Li Sun, Qiqi Wan, Suyang Zhou, Zhenhao Huang, Philip S. Yu

entry.summary: Presents a comprehensive survey arguing that Riemannian geometry should be viewed as a unifying paradigm for graph representation learning, rather than isolated applications of hyperbolic spaces.

entry.title: Conversational Behavior Modeling Foundation Model With Multi-Level Perception

author.name: Dingkun Zhou, Shuchang Pan, Jiachen Lian, Siddharth Banerjee, Sarika Pasumarthy, Dhruv Hebbar, Siddhant Patel, Zeyi Austin Li, Kan Jen Cheng, Sanay Bordia, Krish Patel, Akshaj Gupta, Tingle Li, Gopala Anumanchipalli

entry.summary: Introduces a conversational behavior modeling framework that captures human conversation as multi-level perception (intents and speech acts) structured via a Graph-of-Thoughts, targeting natural full-duplex interactive systems.

entry.title: Direct Learning of Calibration-Aware Uncertainty for Neural PDE Surrogates

author.name: Carlos Stein Brito

entry.summary: Introduces cross-regularized uncertainty for neural PDE surrogates that learns uncertainty parameters during training via a held-out regularization split, avoiding ensemble replication or post-hoc calibration.

entry.title: Data-Efficient Hierarchical Goal-Conditioned Reinforcement Learning via Normalizing Flows

author.name: Shaswat Garg, Matin Moezzi, Brandon Da Silva

entry.summary: Proposes NF-HIQL, a hierarchical goal-conditioned RL framework that uses normalizing flow policies to model multimodal behaviors at both hierarchy levels, with theoretical guarantees for offline settings.

entry.title: When Gradient Clipping Becomes a Control Mechanism for Differential Privacy in Deep Learning

author.name: Mohammad Partohaghighi, Roummel Marcia, Bruce J. West, YangQuan Chen

entry.summary: Proposes a control-driven gradient clipping strategy for differentially private deep learning that adapts the clipping threshold using weight-only spectral diagnostics, avoiding per-example gradient norm computation.

entry.title: Evaluation metrics for temporal preservation in synthetic longitudinal patient data

author.name: Katariina Perkonoja, Parisa Movahedi, Antti Airola, Kari Auranen, Joni Virta

entry.summary: Introduces metrics for evaluating temporal preservation in synthetic longitudinal patient data, revealing that strong marginal resemblance can mask covariance distortions and trajectory disruptions.

entry.title: Domain Knowledge Guided Bayesian Optimization For Autonomous Alignment Of Complex Scientific Instruments

author.name: Aashwin Mishra, Matt Seaberg, Ryan Roussel, Daniel Ratner, Apurva Mehta

entry.summary: Proposes domain knowledge guided Bayesian Optimization that uses physical insight to transform coordinates, decouple input features, and align active subspaces with search axes for high-dimensional optimization of scientific instruments.

entry.title: MoToRec: Sparse-Regularized Multimodal Tokenization for Cold-Start Recommendation

author.name: Jialin Liu, Zhaorui Zhang, Ray C. C. Cheung

entry.summary: MoToRec addresses cold-start recommendation by transforming multimodal recommendation into discrete semantic tokenization using a sparsely-regularized Residual Quantized VAE for generating compact item representations.

entry.title: Statistical Learning Analysis of Physics-Informed Neural Networks

author.name: David A. Barajas-Solano

entry.summary: Reformulates physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) as a statistical learning problem, showing that the physics penalty can be understood as an infinite source of indirect data rather than a regularizer.

entry.title: The Offline-Frontier Shift: Diagnosing Distributional Limits in Generative Multi-Objective Optimization

author.name: Stephanie Holly, Alexandru-Ciprian Z\u{a}voianu, Siegfried Silber, Sepp Hochreiter, Werner Zellinger

entry.summary: Identifies the 'offline-frontier shift' problem in offline multi-objective optimization, showing that generative methods systematically underperform evolutionary alternatives on certain metrics due to displacement of offline data from the Pareto front.

entry.title: End-to-End Semantic ID Generation for Generative Advertisement Recommendation

author.name: Jie Jiang, Xinxun Zhang, Enming Zhang, Yuling Xiong, Jun Zhang, Jingwen Wang, Huan Yu, Yuxiang Wang, Hao Wang, Xiao Yan, Jiawei Jiang

entry.summary: UniSID proposes end-to-end semantic ID generation for generative advertisement recommendation, jointly optimizing embeddings and semantic IDs to avoid the objective misalignment and error accumulation of two-stage residual quantization approaches.

entry.title: Generalized Robust Adaptive-Bandwidth Multi-View Manifold Learning in High Dimensions with Noise

author.name: Xiucai Ding, Chao Shen, Hau-Tieng Wu

entry.summary: GRAB-MDM proposes a kernel-based diffusion geometry framework for integrating multiple noisy data views with view-dependent adaptive bandwidths. Establishes asymptotic convergence under a common-manifold model.

entry.title: Bayesian Signal Component Decomposition via Diffusion-within-Gibbs Sampling

author.name: Yi Zhang, Rui Guo, Yonina C. Eldar

entry.summary: Develops a Bayesian framework for signal component decomposition combining Gibbs sampling with plug-and-play diffusion priors, allowing separately learned component priors to be flexibly combined without retraining. Provides convergence guarantees.

entry.title: The emergence of numerical representations in communicating artificial agents

author.name: Daniela Mihai, Lucas Weber, Francesca Franzon

entry.summary: Studies whether neural network agents develop numerical representations through communication pressure alone. Agents achieve high accuracy with discrete or continuous channels but fail at compositionality, suggesting communication alone is insufficient for human-like numerals.

entry.title: How Do Decoder-Only LLMs Perceive Users? Rethinking Attention Masking for User Representation Learning

author.name: Jiahao Yuan, Yike Xu, Jinyong Wen, Baokun Wang, Yang Chen, Xiaotong Lin, Wuliang Huang, Ziyi Gao, Xing Fu, Yu Cheng, Weiqiang Wang

entry.summary: Studies how attention masking (causal vs bidirectional) affects user representation quality in decoder-only LLMs, proposing Gradient-Guided Soft Masking for smoother transitions. Evaluated on industrial Alipay data across 9 user cognition benchmarks.

entry.title: AntigenLM: Structure-Aware DNA Language Modeling for Influenza

author.name: Yue Pei, Xuebin Chi, Yu Kang

entry.summary: Presents AntigenLM, a DNA language model pretrained on influenza genomes with intact functional units, enabling antigenic variant forecasting and subtype classification. Shows that preserving genomic structure during pretraining is crucial.

entry.title: (MGS)$^2$-Net: Unifying Micro-Geometric Scale and Macro-Geometric Structure for Cross-View Geo-Localization

author.name: Minglei Li, Mengfan He, Chao Chen, Ziyang Meng

entry.summary: Proposes (MGS)²-Net for cross-view geo-localization that addresses geometric misalignment between aerial and satellite views by incorporating 3D geometric reasoning. Introduces macro-geometric structure filtering and micro-geometric scale alignment.

entry.title: Chart Specification: Structural Representations for Incentivizing VLM Reasoning in Chart-to-Code Generation

author.name: Minggui He, Mingchen Dai, Jian Zhang, Yilun Liu, Shimin Tao, Pufan Zeng, Osamu Yoshie, Yuya Ieiri

entry.summary: Proposes Chart Specification, a structured intermediate representation for chart-to-code generation that shifts training from text imitation to semantically grounded supervision. Introduces Spec-Align Reward for structural correctness feedback.

entry.title: Interpretable Vision Transformers in Image Classification via SVDA

author.name: Vasileios Arampatzakis, George Pavlidis, Nikolaos Mitianoudis, Nikos Papamarkos

entry.summary: Adapts SVD-Inspired Attention (SVDA) mechanism to Vision Transformers for image classification, introducing geometrically grounded attention formulation that enhances interpretability and sparsity across four benchmarks.

entry.title: Uncertainty-Aware Ordinal Deep Learning for cross-Dataset Diabetic Retinopathy Grading

author.name: Ali El Bellaj, Aya Benradi, Salman El Youssoufi, Taha El Marzouki, Mohammed-Amine Cheddadi

entry.summary: Proposes an uncertainty-aware deep learning framework for diabetic retinopathy grading that explicitly models ordinal disease progression using evidential Dirichlet-based ordinal regression with lesion-query attention pooling.

entry.title: Free-Flying Crew Cooperative Robots on the ISS: A Joint Review of Astrobee, CIMON, and Int-Ball Operations

author.name: Seiko Piotr Yamaguchi, Andres Mora Vargas, Till Eisenberg, Christian Rogon, Tatsuya Yamamoto, Shona Inoue, Christoph K\"ossl, Brian Coltin, Trey Smith, Jose V. Benavides

entry.summary: First joint review of three ISS free-flying robots (Astrobee, CIMON, Int-Ball) co-authored by their development teams, presenting shared experiences, convergences in design, and joint lessons learned across lifecycles.

entry.title: Stability Analysis of Geometric Control for a Canonical Class of Underactuated Aerial Vehicles with Spurious Forces

author.name: Simone Orelli, Mirko Mizzoni, Antonio Franchi

entry.summary: Provides first formal stability analysis for geometric control of floating rigid bodies with spurious forces, constructing Lyapunov-based proof of local exponential stability for hovering equilibrium despite non-minimum-phase behavior.

entry.title: RadarEye: Robust Liquid Level Tracking Using mmWave Radar in Robotic Pouring

author.name: Hongyu Deng, He Chen

entry.summary: Introduces RadarEye, a real-time mmWave radar pipeline for liquid level estimation during robotic pouring, using physics-informed tracking to suppress multipath reflections. Achieves sub-millisecond latency.

entry.title: SynergyKGC: Reconciling Topological Heterogeneity in Knowledge Graph Completion via Topology-Aware Synergy

author.name: Xuecheng Zou, Yu Tang, Bingbing Wang

entry.summary: Presents SynergyKGC for knowledge graph completion that addresses structural resolution mismatch across varying graph densities using cross-modal synergy experts and density-dependent anchoring.

entry.title: Multimodal Information Fusion for Chart Understanding: A Survey of MLLMs -- Evolution, Limitations, and Cognitive Enhancement

author.name: Zhihang Yi, Jian Zhao, Jiancheng Lv, Tao Wang

entry.summary: Survey paper on multimodal large language models for chart understanding, covering information fusion challenges, downstream tasks, datasets, and a novel taxonomy of benchmarks.

entry.title: Silence Routing: When Not Speaking Improves Collective Judgment

author.name: Itsuki Fujisaki, Kunhao Yang

entry.summary: Proposes a 'silence routing' framework for collective intelligence in taste-based judgments, showing that having contributors strategically abstain improves prediction accuracy over an all-participate baseline.

entry.title: PRISM-XR: Empowering Privacy-Aware XR Collaboration with Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Jiangong Chen, Mingyu Zhu, Bin Li

entry.summary: Proposes PRISM-XR, a privacy-aware framework for XR collaboration using multimodal LLMs that protects sensitive real-world background information captured by XR headsets.

entry.title: MalMoE: Mixture-of-Experts Enhanced Encrypted Malicious Traffic Detection Under Graph Drift

author.name: Yunpeng Tan, Qingyang Li, Mingxin Yang, Yannan Hu, Lei Zhang, Xinggong Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes MalMoE, a graph-based encrypted malicious traffic detection system using Mixture of Experts to handle graph drift (temporal changes in flow statistics and topology).

entry.title: Learning Structure-Semantic Evolution Trajectories for Graph Domain Adaptation

author.name: Wei Chen, Xingyu Guo, Shuang Li, Yan Zhong, Zhao Zhang, Fuzhen Zhuang, Hongrui Liu, Libang Zhang, Guo Ye, Huimei He

entry.summary: Proposes DiffGDA, a diffusion-based method for graph domain adaptation that models the adaptation process as continuous-time evolution of graph structures and semantics, addressing limitations of discrete stepwise alignment approaches.

entry.title: Contrastive Learning for Multi Label ECG Classification with Jaccard Score Based Sigmoid Loss

author.name: Junichiro Takahashi, Masataka Sato, Satoshi Kodeta, Norihiko Takeda

entry.summary: Develops a contrastive learning approach for multi-label ECG classification using Jaccard-score-based sigmoid loss (SigLIP-inspired), building a robust ECG encoder for multimodal pretraining with real hospital data.

entry.title: Interpretable Graph-Level Anomaly Detection via Contrast with Normal Prototypes

author.name: Qiuran Zhao, Kai Ming Ting, Xinpeng Li

entry.summary: Proposes ProtoGLAD for interpretable graph-level anomaly detection, using concrete normal graph prototypes rather than abstract latent vectors to provide explanations by contrasting detected anomalies with specific normal reference graphs.

entry.title: RSHallu: Dual-Mode Hallucination Evaluation for Remote-Sensing Multimodal Large Language Models with Domain-Tailored Mitigation

author.name: Zihui Zhou, Yong Feng, Yanying Chen, Guofan Duan, Zhenxi Song, Mingliang Zhou, Weijia Jia

entry.summary: Presents RSHallu, a systematic study of hallucinations in remote sensing multimodal LLMs with an RS-oriented taxonomy, image-level hallucination category, and domain-tailored mitigation strategies.

entry.title: Time Series Foundation Models for Energy Load Forecasting on Consumer Hardware: A Multi-Dimensional Zero-Shot Benchmark

author.name: Luigi Simeone

entry.summary: Benchmarks four Time Series Foundation Models for electricity demand forecasting on consumer hardware, comparing zero-shot performance against Prophet and statistical baselines across multiple evaluation dimensions.

entry.title: CVPL: A Geometric Framework for Post-Hoc Linkage Risk Assessment in Protected Tabular Data

author.name: Valery Khvatov, Alexey Neyman

entry.summary: Introduces CVPL, a geometric framework for post-hoc assessment of linkage risk between original and protected tabular data, providing continuous risk estimates rather than binary compliance verdicts through cluster-vector-projection analysis.

entry.title: LightGTS-Cov: Covariate-Enhanced Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Yong Shang, Zhipeng Yao, Ning Jin, Xiangfei Qiu, Hui Zhang, Bin Yang

entry.summary: Introduces LightGTS-Cov, a lightweight covariate-enhanced time series foundation model that adds a ~0.1M parameter MLP plugin to a ~1M parameter backbone for incorporating past and future covariates.

entry.title: A Multimodal Conditional Mixture Model with Distribution-Level Physics Priors

author.name: Jinkyo Han, Bahador Bahmani

entry.summary: Develops a physics-informed multimodal conditional modeling framework using mixture density networks with distribution-level physics priors for scientific systems with multimodal behavior.

entry.title: Bridging the Compression-Precision Paradox: A Hybrid Architecture for Clinical EEG Report Generation with Guaranteed Measurement Accuracy

author.name: Wuyang Zhang, Zhen Luo, Chuqiao Gu, Jianming Ma, Yebo Cao, Wangming Yuan, Yinzhi Jin

entry.summary: Proposes a hybrid architecture for clinical EEG report generation that separates exact measurement extraction via signal processing from text generation, addressing the compression-precision paradox in long EEG recordings.

entry.title: Roughness-Informed Federated Learning

author.name: Mohammad Partohaghighi, Roummel Marcia, Bruce J. West, YangQuan Chen

entry.summary: Proposes RI-FedAvg, a federated learning algorithm that mitigates client drift in non-IID settings via Roughness Index-based regularization that penalizes updates based on local loss landscape fluctuations.

entry.title: Rising Multi-Armed Bandits with Known Horizons

author.name: Seockbean Song, Chenyu Gan, Youngsik Yoon, Siwei Wang, Wei Chen, Jungseul Ok

entry.summary: Studies the Rising Multi-Armed Bandit problem where arm rewards increase with plays, focusing on how knowledge of the time horizon T dramatically changes the optimal strategy. Provides algorithms that exploit horizon knowledge for better regret bounds.

entry.title: A Jointly Efficient and Optimal Algorithm for Heteroskedastic Generalized Linear Bandits with Adversarial Corruptions

author.name: Sanghwa Kim, Junghyun Lee, Se-Young Yun

entry.summary: Proposes an efficient algorithm for heteroskedastic generalized linear bandits with adversarial corruptions, achieving O(1) per-iteration complexity using online mirror descent and Hessian-based confidence weights.

entry.title: Motion Capture is Not the Target Domain: Scaling Synthetic Data for Learning Motion Representations

author.name: Firas Darwish, George Nicholson, Aiden Doherty, Hang Yuan

entry.summary: Studies synthetic data pretraining for human motion representations, showing that synthetic data improves generalization when mixed with real data or scaled sufficiently, and that motion-capture pretraining transfers less well than expected to wearable HAR tasks.

entry.title: MerLin: A Discovery Engine for Photonic and Hybrid Quantum Machine Learning

author.name: Cassandre Notton, Benjamin Stott, Philippe Schoeb, Anthony Walsh, Gr\'egoire Leboucher, Vincent Espitalier, Vassilis Apostolou, Louis-F\'elix Vigneux, Alexia Salavrakos, Jean Senellart

entry.summary: MerLin is an open-source framework for systematic benchmarking of photonic and hybrid quantum machine learning, integrating optimized simulation of linear optical circuits into PyTorch and scikit-learn workflows. Reproduces 18 state-of-the-art photonic QML works.

entry.title: Conditional Uncertainty-Aware Political Deepfake Detection with Stochastic Convolutional Neural Networks

author.name: Rafael-Petru\c{t} Gardo\c{s}

entry.summary: Investigates uncertainty-aware political deepfake detection using stochastic CNNs, evaluating when detector outputs are unreliable in high-stakes political contexts rather than providing only point predictions.

entry.title: Flash-SD-KDE: Accelerating SD-KDE with Tensor Cores

author.name: Elliot L. Epstein, Rajat Vadiraj Dwaraknath, John Winnicki

entry.summary: Flash-SD-KDE accelerates score-debiased kernel density estimation by reordering computations to expose matrix multiplication structure suitable for GPU Tensor Cores, achieving up to 47x speedup over GPU baselines.

entry.title: Distributed Online Convex Optimization with Nonseparable Costs and Constraints

author.name: Zhaoye Pan, Haozhe Lei, Fan Zuo, Zilin Bian, Tao Li

entry.summary: Studies distributed online convex optimization with nonseparable global costs and constraints, proposing a distributed primal-dual belief consensus algorithm. Removes the common separability assumption in prior work.

entry.title: From Diet to Free Lunch: Estimating Auxiliary Signal Properties using Dynamic Pruning Masks in Speech Enhancement Networks

author.name: Riccardo Miccini, Cl\'ement Laroche, Tobias Piechowiak, Xenofon Fafoutis, Luca Pezzarossa

entry.summary: Shows that dynamic channel pruning masks in speech enhancement networks contain useful information about signal properties like VAD and SNR, enabling auxiliary signal estimation without additional models at zero cost.

entry.title: Convergence Rates for Distribution Matching with Sliced Optimal Transport

author.name: Gauthier Thurin (ENS-PSL), Claire Boyer (LMO, IUF), Kimia Nadjahi (ENS-PSL)

entry.summary: Studies convergence rates of slice-matching schemes for distribution matching using sliced optimal transport, deriving non-asymptotic rates via Łojasiewicz-type inequalities. Provides tractable analysis for Gaussian distributions with orthonormal bases.

entry.title: When Tables Go Crazy: Evaluating Multimodal Models on French Financial Documents

author.name: Virginie Mouilleron, Th\'eo Lasnier, Djam\'e Seddah

entry.summary: Introduces Multimodal Finance Eval, the first multimodal benchmark for French financial document understanding with 1,204 expert-validated questions spanning text, tables, charts, and multi-turn reasoning from real financial documents.

entry.title: Reinforced Curriculum Pre-Alignment for Domain-Adaptive VLMs

author.name: Yuming Yan, Shuo Yang, Kai Tang, Sihong Chen, Yang Zhang, Ke Xu, Dan Hu, Qun Yu, Pengfei Hu, Edith C. H. Ngai

entry.summary: Proposes Reinforced Curriculum Pre-Alignment for adapting VLMs to specialized domains while preserving general capabilities. Uses curriculum-based approach as efficient alternative to continual pretraining.

entry.title: ArtisanGS: Interactive Tools for Gaussian Splat Selection with AI and Human in the Loop

author.name: Clement Fuji Tsang, Anita Hu, Or Perel, Carsten Kolve, Maria Shugrina

entry.summary: Introduces ArtisanGS, interactive tools for Gaussian Splat selection and segmentation combining AI-driven 2D-to-3D mask propagation with user-guided editing, enabling controllable manipulation of 3DGS scenes.

entry.title: Colorimeter-Supervised Skin Tone Estimation from Dermatoscopic Images for Fairness Auditing

author.name: Marin Ben\v{c}evi\'c, Kre\v{s}imir Romi\'c, Ivana Hartmann Toli\'c, Irena Gali\'c

entry.summary: Proposes neural networks for estimating skin tone from dermatoscopic images using colorimeter measurements and Fitzpatrick labels as ground truth, enabling fairness auditing of dermatology AI models.

entry.title: A Low-Rank Defense Method for Adversarial Attack on Diffusion Models

author.name: Jiaxuan Zhu, Siyu Huang

entry.summary: Proposes LoRD (Low-Rank Defense), an efficient defense against adversarial attacks on latent diffusion models using LoRA modules with a balance parameter to detect and defend against adversarial samples.

entry.title: MapVerse: A Benchmark for Geospatial Question Answering on Diverse Real-World Maps

author.name: Sharat Bhat, Harshita Khandelwal, Tushar Kataria, Vivek Gupta

entry.summary: Introduces MapVerse, a benchmark for geospatial question answering on diverse real-world maps, testing spatial reasoning, visual cue integration, and domain-specific expertise across multiple map types.

entry.title: OccFace: Unified Occlusion-Aware Facial Landmark Detection with Per-Point Visibility

author.name: Xinhao Xiang, Zhengxin Li, Saurav Dhakad, Theo Bancroft, Jiawei Zhang, Weiyang Li

entry.summary: Presents OccFace, an occlusion-aware facial landmark detection framework for human-like faces that jointly predicts landmark coordinates and per-point visibility. Uses a unified 100-point layout covering humans, stylized characters, and non-human designs.

entry.title: Interpretable Vision Transformers in Monocular Depth Estimation via SVDA

author.name: Vasileios Arampatzakis, George Pavlidis, Nikolaos Mitianoudis, Nikos Papamarkos

entry.summary: Extends SVD-Inspired Attention to Dense Prediction Transformers for monocular depth estimation, providing spectrally structured attention formulation. Preserves accuracy while adding interpretability on KITTI and NYU-v2.

entry.title: A Systematic Review on Data-Driven Brain Deformation Modeling for Image-Guided Neurosurgery

author.name: Tiago Assis, Colin P. Galvin, Joshua P. Castillo, Nazim Haouchine, Marta Kersten-Oertel, Zeyu Gao, Mireia Crispin-Ortuzar, Stephen J. Price, Thomas Santarius, Yangming Ou, Sarah Frisken, Nuno C. Garcia, Alexandra J. Golby, Reuben Dorent, Ines P. Machado

entry.summary: Systematic review of AI-driven approaches for brain deformation modeling in image-guided neurosurgery, covering 41 studies from 2020-2025. Synthesizes methods for compensating tissue motion that misaligns preoperative planning with intraoperative anatomy.

entry.title: Amortized Inference of Neuron Parameters on Analog Neuromorphic Hardware

author.name: Jakob Kaiser, Eric M\"uller, Johannes Schemmel

entry.summary: Uses simulation-based inference to approximate posterior distributions for neuron parameters on the BrainScaleS-2 analog neuromorphic hardware. Compares handcrafted summary statistics vs learned summary networks.

entry.title: Morphogenetic Assembly and Adaptive Control for Heterogeneous Modular Robots

author.name: Chongxi Meng, Da Zhao, Yifei Zhao, Minghao Zeng, Yanmin Zhou, Zhipeng Wang, Bin He

entry.summary: Presents a closed-loop automation framework for heterogeneous modular robots covering morphological construction to adaptive control, with a hierarchical planner using bidirectional heuristic search for module assembly.

entry.title: Omnidirectional Dual-Arm Aerial Manipulator with Proprioceptive Contact Localization for Landing on Slanted Roofs

author.name: Martijn B. J. Brummelhuis, Nathan F. Lepora, Salua Hamaza

entry.summary: Proposes an omnidirectional dual-arm aerial manipulator with proprioceptive contact detection and localization using momentum-based torque observer, designed for landing on slanted rooftops.

entry.title: Safe mobility support system using crowd mapping and avoidance route planning using VLM

author.name: Sena Saito, Kenta Tabata, Renato Miyagusuku, Koichi Ozaki

entry.summary: Proposes a framework integrating VLMs with Gaussian Process Regression to generate dynamic crowd-density maps for autonomous robot navigation, enabling avoidance route planning in crowded environments.

entry.title: Assessing Vision-Language Models for Perception in Autonomous Underwater Robotic Software

author.name: Muhammad Yousaf, Aitor Arrieta, Shaukat Ali, Paolo Arcaini, Shuai Wang

entry.summary: Assesses Vision-Language Models for underwater robot perception, evaluating their robustness in challenging conditions like low visibility. Examines trustworthiness of VLM-based perception for autonomous underwater robots.

entry.title: Where Will Call Center Workers Go?

author.name: loic

entry.summary: Examines the likely displacement of call center workers (~1-2% of US labor force) by AI voice models, analyzing where these workers might go and what policy interventions could help. Attempts a data-driven rather than purely speculative approach.

entry.title: A Swap-Adversarial Framework for Improving Domain Generalization in Electroencephalography-Based Parkinson's Disease Prediction

author.name: Seongwon Jin, Hanseul Choi, Sunggu Yang, Sungho Park, Jibum Kim

entry.summary: Introduces a new ECoG dataset from rat models of Parkinson's disease and proposes a Swap-Adversarial Framework (SAF) for domain generalization that mitigates inter-subject variability through adversarial training with feature swapping.

entry.title: Traceable, Enforceable, and Compensable Participation: A Participation Ledger for People-Centered AI Governance

author.name: Rashid Mushkani
