entry.summary: Proposes a Participation Ledger framework for AI governance that operationalizes participation as traceable influence, enforceable authority, and compensable labor, using machine-readable influence graphs linking artifacts to verified system changes.

entry.title: XSPLAIN: XAI-enabling Splat-based Prototype Learning for Attribute-aware INterpretability

author.name: Dominik Galus, Julia Farganus, Tymoteusz Zapala, Miko{\l}aj Czachorowski, Piotr Borycki, Przemys{\l}aw Spurek, Piotr Syga

entry.summary: Introduces XSPLAIN, the first ante-hoc prototype-based interpretability framework for 3DGS classification, using voxel-aggregated PointNet and invertible orthogonal transformations for interpretable feature channels.

entry.title: ECHO: An Open Research Platform for Evaluation of Chat, Human Behavior, and Outcomes

author.name: Jiqun Liu, Nischal Dinesh, Ran Yu

entry.summary: Introduces ECHO, an open research platform for studying human interaction with conversational AI and search engines, supporting end-to-end experimental workflows with fine-grained logging.

entry.title: Enhancing Weakly Supervised Multimodal Video Anomaly Detection through Text Guidance

author.name: Shengyang Sun, Jiashen Hua, Junyi Feng, Xiaojin Gong

entry.summary: Proposes a text-guided framework for weakly supervised multimodal video anomaly detection, using in-context learning for text augmentation and a novel fusion approach to address redundancy and imbalance in multimodal features.

entry.title: The CLEF-2026 FinMMEval Lab: Multilingual and Multimodal Evaluation of Financial AI Systems

author.name: Zhuohan Xie, Rania Elbadry, Fan Zhang, Georgi Georgiev, Xueqing Peng, Lingfei Qian, Jimin Huang, Dimitar Dimitrov, Vanshikaa Jani, Yuyang Dai, Jiahui Geng, Yuxia Wang, Ivan Koychev, Veselin Stoyanov, Preslav Nakov

entry.summary: Presents FinMMEval, the first multilingual and multimodal evaluation framework for financial LLMs at CLEF 2026, spanning financial exam QA, multilingual financial QA, and financial decision making tasks.

entry.title: Enhancing Predictability of Multi-Tenant DNN Inference for Autonomous Vehicles' Perception

author.name: Liangkai Liu, Kang G. Shin, Jinkyu Lee, Chengmo Yang, Weisong Shi

entry.summary: Presents PP-DNN for predictable DNN perception in autonomous vehicles, reducing processed image data while maintaining accuracy through dynamic critical frame selection and region-of-interest extraction for multi-tenant DNNs.

entry.title: Chain-of-Look Spatial Reasoning for Dense Surgical Instrument Counting

author.name: Rishikesh Bhyri, Brian R Quaranto, Philip J Seger, Kaity Tung, Brendan Fox, Gene Yang, Steven D. Schwaitzberg, Junsong Yuan, Nan Xi, Peter C W Kim

entry.summary: Introduces Chain-of-Look, a visual reasoning framework for counting surgical instruments that mimics sequential human counting via structured spatial trajectories, rather than relying on unordered object detection.

entry.title: ICODEN: Ordinary Differential Equation Neural Networks for Interval-Censored Data

author.name: Haoling Wang, Lang Zeng, Tao Sun, Youngjoo Cho, Ying Ding

entry.summary: Develops ICODEN, an ODE-based neural network for interval-censored survival data that models hazard functions through deep neural networks without proportional hazards assumptions.

entry.title: Reducing Estimation Uncertainty Using Normalizing Flows and Stratification

author.name: Pawe{\l} Lorek, Rafa{\l} Topolnicki, Tomasz Trzci\'nski, Maciej Zi\k{e}ba, Aleksandra Krystecka

entry.summary: Proposes flow-based models integrated with stratified sampling for reducing estimation uncertainty, showing improved performance over crude Monte Carlo on high-dimensional datasets.

entry.title: Tuning the burn-in phase in training recurrent neural networks improves their performance

author.name: Julian D. Schiller, Malte Heinrich, Victor G. Lopez, Matthias A. M\"uller

entry.summary: Provides theoretical bounds on accuracy loss when training RNNs with truncated backpropagation through time, revealing that the burn-in phase length is a critical tuning parameter with significant impact on performance.

entry.title: Online Generalized-mean Welfare Maximization: Achieving Near-Optimal Regret from Samples

author.name: Zongjun Yang, Rachitesh Kumar, Christian Kroer

entry.summary: Studies online fair allocation of sequentially arriving items to maximize generalized-mean welfare, showing that a pure greedy algorithm achieves optimal O(1/T) regret under i.i.d. arrivals without distributional knowledge.

entry.title: Flow-Enabled Generalization to Human Demonstrations in Few-Shot Imitation Learning

author.name: Runze Tang, Penny Sweetser

entry.summary: Uses optical flow as intermediate representation for few-shot imitation learning from human demonstrations, enabling robots to generalize to scenarios seen only in human videos with limited robot demonstrations.

entry.title: Highly Adaptive Principal Component Regression

author.name: Mingxun Wang, Alejandro Schuler, Mark van der Laan, Carlos Garc\'ia Meixide

entry.summary: Introduces PCHAL/PCHAR, principal component-based variants of the Highly Adaptive Lasso and Ridge that achieve computational efficiency through outcome-blind dimension reduction while matching empirical performance.

entry.title: SCRAPL: Scattering Transform with Random Paths for Machine Learning

author.name: Christopher Mitcheltree, Vincent Lostanlen, Emmanouil Benetos, Mathieu Lagrange

entry.summary: Proposes SCRAPL, a stochastic optimization scheme for efficient evaluation of wavelet scattering transforms by randomly sampling paths, significantly reducing computational cost when used as differentiable loss functions for neural network training.

entry.title: C-MOP: Integrating Momentum and Boundary-Aware Clustering for Enhanced Prompt Evolution

author.name: Binwei Yan, Yifei Fu, Mingjian Zhu, Hanting Chen, Mingxuan Yuan, Yunhe Wang, Hailin Hu

entry.summary: Proposes C-MOP, a framework for automatic prompt optimization using boundary-aware contrastive sampling and momentum-guided semantic clustering to stabilize optimization and resolve conflicting update signals.

entry.title: TEGRA: Text Encoding With Graph and Retrieval Augmentation for Misinformation Detection

author.name: G\'eraud Faye, Wassila Ouerdane, Guillaume Gadek, C\'eline Hudelot

entry.summary: Proposes TEGRA, a method for misinformation detection that encodes documents as both text and structured knowledge graphs, with retrieval augmentation from domain-specific knowledge bases. Shows hybrid representation improves over text-only approaches.

entry.title: VFGS-Net: Frequency-Guided State-Space Learning for Topology-Preserving Retinal Vessel Segmentation

author.name: Ruiqi Song, Lei Liu, Ya-Nan Zhang, Chao Wang, Xiaoning Li, Nan Mu

entry.summary: Proposes VFGS-Net for retinal vessel segmentation integrating frequency-aware feature enhancement, dual-path convolutions, and bidirectional asymmetric spatial state-space modeling to preserve fine capillaries and global topology.

entry.title: Viewpoint Recommendation for Point Cloud Labeling through Interaction Cost Modeling

author.name: Yu Zhang, Xinyi Zhao, Chongke Bi, Siming Chen

entry.summary: Proposes viewpoint recommendation for 3D point cloud labeling that adapts Fitts' law to model lasso selection time cost, recommending viewpoints that minimize annotation time for semantic segmentation.

entry.title: 3D-Printed Anisotropic Soft Magnetic Coating for Directional Rolling of a Magnetically Actuated Capsule Robot

author.name: Jin Zhou, Chongxun Wang, Zikang Shen, Fangzhou Xia

entry.summary: Proposes a 3D-printed soft capsule robot with anisotropic magnetic coating that replaces internal permanent magnets, preserving the entire interior cavity for medical payloads while enabling directional rolling locomotion.

entry.title: [Hiring] Principia Research Fellows

author.name: Matthias Dellago

entry.summary: Job posting for Principia, a new research group led by Andrew Saxe focused on theoretical models of representation learning and generalization, developing analytically tractable 'model organisms' to understand neural network behaviors relevant to AI safety.

entry.title: Quantum Integrated Sensing and Computation with Indefinite Causal Order

author.name: Ivana Nikoloska

entry.summary: Investigates quantum integrated sensing and computation with indefinite causal order, proposing a scheme where a quantum agent performs state observation and function learning in superposition of orders.

entry.title: KORAL: Knowledge Graph Guided LLM Reasoning for SSD Operational Analysis

author.name: Mayur Akewar, Sandeep Madireddy, Dongsheng Luo, Janki Bhimani

entry.summary: Proposes KORAL, combining knowledge graphs with LLMs for SSD operational analysis and diagnostics, enabling insights without extensive expert input or large datasets.

entry.title: LakeMLB: Data Lake Machine Learning Benchmark

author.name: Feiyu Pan, Tianbin Zhang, Aoqian Zhang, Yu Sun, Zheng Wang, Lixing Chen, Li Pan, Jianhua Li

entry.summary: Presents LakeMLB, a benchmark for evaluating machine learning performance in data lake environments, focusing on multi-table Union and Join scenarios across six real-world datasets covering government, finance, and Wikipedia data.

entry.title: A Diffusion-Based Generative Prior Approach to Sparse-view Computed Tomography

author.name: Davide Evangelista, Pasquale Cascarano, Elena Loli Piccolomini

entry.summary: Applies diffusion-based generative priors to sparse-view CT reconstruction, combining diffusion models with iterative optimization to maintain explainability while leveraging generative power for artifact reduction.

entry.title: Interpretable Attention-Based Multi-Agent PPO for Latency Spike Resolution in 6G RAN Slicing

author.name: Kavan Fatehi, Mostafa Rahmani Ghourtani, Amir Sonee, Poonam Yadav, Alessandra M Russo, Hamed Ahmadi, Radu Calinescu

entry.summary: Proposes AE-MAPPO, an attention-enhanced multi-agent PPO framework for 6G RAN slicing that integrates six specialized attention mechanisms for interpretable latency spike resolution, demonstrating 18ms spike resolution in URLLC scenarios.

entry.title: SteuerLLM: Local specialized large language model for German tax law analysis

author.name: Sebastian Wind, Jeta Sopa, Laurin Schmid, Quirin Jackl, Sebastian Kiefer, Fei Wu, Martin Mayr, Harald K\"ostler, Gerhard Wellein, Andreas Maier, Soroosh Tayebi Arasteh

entry.summary: Creates SteuerLLM, a specialized LLM for German tax law analysis, along with SteuerEx, the first open benchmark of 115 expert-validated German tax law examination questions with partial-credit evaluation.

entry.title: GRASP: group-Shapley feature selection for patients

author.name: Yuheng Luo, Shuyan Li, Zhong Cao

entry.summary: Introduces GRASP, a feature selection framework combining Shapley value attribution with group L21 regularization for medical prediction, yielding compact and interpretable feature sets.

entry.title: R2RAG-Flood: A reasoning-reinforced training-free retrieval augmentation generation framework for flood damage nowcasting

author.name: Lipai Huang, Kai Yin, Chia-Fu Liu, Ali Mostafavi

entry.summary: Proposes R2RAG-Flood, a reasoning-reinforced RAG framework for post-storm property damage nowcasting that retrieves reasoning trajectories from geospatial neighbors and class prototypes to guide LLM predictions.

entry.title: Enhancing Ride-Hailing Forecasting at DiDi with Multi-View Geospatial Representation Learning from the Web

author.name: Xixuan Hao, Guicheng Li, Daiqiang Wu, Xusen Guo, Yumeng Zhu, Zhichao Zou, Peng Zhen, Yao Yao, Yuxuan Liang

entry.summary: Proposes MVGR-Net for ride-hailing forecasting at DiDi using multi-view geospatial representation learning that integrates POI data and temporal mobility patterns.

entry.title: Privacy-Utility Tradeoffs in Quantum Information Processing

author.name: Theshani Nuradha, Sujeet Bhalerao, Felix Leditzky

entry.summary: Studies privacy-utility tradeoffs in quantum information processing under quantum local differential privacy, optimizing fidelity and trace distance between original and privatized quantum states.

entry.title: Bayesian Inference of Contextual Bandit Policies via Empirical Likelihood

author.name: Jiangrong Ouyang, Mingming Gong, Howard Bondell

entry.summary: Uses empirical likelihood for Bayesian inference of contextual bandit policies, enabling robust uncertainty quantification for policy evaluation and comparison in small sample regimes.

entry.title: Self-Supervised Learning for Speaker Recognition: A study and review

author.name: Theo Lepage, Reda Dehak

entry.summary: Reviews self-supervised learning methods (SimCLR, MoCo, DINO) for speaker recognition, adapting frameworks originally designed for vision to audio. Provides a systematic study of SSL for this specific downstream task.

entry.title: Characterizing Trainability of Instantaneous Quantum Polynomial Circuit Born Machines

author.name: Kevin Shen, Susanne Pielawa, Vedran Dunjko, Hao Wang

entry.summary: Characterizes trainability of IQP quantum circuit Born machines, analyzing barren plateau issues and how trainability regimes overlap with potential quantum advantage. Provides significant steps toward understanding when these quantum generative models can be effectively trained.

entry.title: RE-LLM: Refining Empathetic Speech-LLM Responses by Integrating Emotion Nuance

author.name: Jing-Han Chen, Bo-Hao Su, Ya-Tse Wu, Chi-Chun Lee

entry.summary: Proposes RE-LLM, a speech-LLM integrating dimensional emotion embeddings for empathetic responses, with significant improvements in emotional exploration scores across three datasets.

entry.title: MPA: Multimodal Prototype Augmentation for Few-Shot Learning

author.name: Liwen Wu, Wei Wang, Lei Zhao, Zhan Gao, Qika Lin, Shaowen Yao, Zuozhu Liu, Bin Pu

entry.summary: Proposes MPA, a multimodal prototype augmentation framework for few-shot learning that leverages LLMs for semantic enhancement and hierarchical multi-view augmentation with an adaptive uncertain class absorber.

entry.title: Towards Remote Sensing Change Detection with Neural Memory

author.name: Zhenyu Yang, Gensheng Pei, Yazhou Yao, Tianfei Zhou, Lizhong Ding, Fumin Shen

entry.summary: Proposes ChangeTitans, adapting the Titans architecture (with neural memory) from language to remote sensing change detection. First Titans-based vision backbone combining neural memory with segmented local attention.

entry.title: End-to-End LiDAR optimization for 3D point cloud registration

author.name: Siddhant Katyan, Marc-Andr\'e Gardner, Jean-Fran\c{c}ois Lalonde

entry.summary: Proposes an adaptive LiDAR sensing framework that dynamically adjusts sensor parameters by integrating registration feedback into the sensing loop, jointly optimizing acquisition and registration hyperparameters.

entry.title: 3DXTalker: Unifying Identity, Lip Sync, Emotion, and Spatial Dynamics in Expressive 3D Talking Avatars

author.name: Zhongju Wang, Zhenhong Sun, Beier Wang, Yifu Wang, Daoyi Dong, Huadong Mo, Hongdong Li

entry.summary: Proposes 3DXTalker for expressive 3D talking avatar generation with identity preservation, lip sync, emotion, and spatial dynamics, using 2D-to-3D data curation for scalable identity modeling.

entry.title: AurigaNet: A Real-Time Multi-Task Network for Enhanced Urban Driving Perception

author.name: Kiarash Ghasemzadeh, Sedigheh Dehghani

entry.summary: Presents AurigaNet, a multi-task network for autonomous driving that integrates object detection, lane detection, and drivable area segmentation. Claims real-time inference capability for urban driving scenarios.

entry.title: Text-to-Vector Conversion for Residential Plan Design

author.name: Egor Bazhenov, Stepan Kasai, Viacheslav Shalamov, Valeria Efimova

entry.summary: Introduces a method for generating vector residential floor plans from text descriptions, achieving ~5% improvement in CLIPScore-based quality over existing solutions. Handles architectural constraints like right angles natively.

entry.title: DFIC: Towards a balanced facial image dataset for automatic ICAO compliance verification

author.name: Nuno Gon\c{c}alves, Diogo Nunes, Carla Guerra, Jo\~ao Marcos

entry.summary: Introduces DFIC dataset with ~58,000 annotated facial images and 2,706 videos for ICAO compliance verification, featuring balanced demographic distribution. Benchmarks automated compliance checking models.

entry.title: Pitch Angle Control of a Magnetically Actuated Capsule Robot with Nonlinear FEA-based MPC and EKF Multisensory Fusion

author.name: Chongxun Wang, Zikang Shen, Apoorav Rathore, Akanimoh Udombeh, Harrison Teng, Fangzhou Xia

entry.summary: Presents nonlinear model-based pitch control for a magnetically actuated capsule robot using FEA-characterized magnetic forces and MPC with EKF sensor fusion for gastrointestinal applications.

entry.title: Multi-UAV Trajectory Optimization for Bearing-Only Localization in GPS Denied Environments

author.name: Alfonso Sciacchitano, Liraz Mudrik, Sean Kragelund, Isaac Kaminer

entry.summary: Presents trajectory optimization for cooperative UAV target localization using fixed cameras without gimbals in GPS-denied environments, jointly optimizing estimation quality and dynamic feasibility.

entry.title: Can LLMs Cook Jamaican Couscous? A Study of Cultural Novelty in Recipe Generation

author.name: F. Carichon, R. Rampa, G. Farnadi

entry.summary: Studies cultural adaptation in LLMs through recipe generation, examining whether models can produce culturally novel and authentic recipes for diverse cuisines beyond dominant cultures.

entry.title: Multi-encoder ConvNeXt Network with Smooth Attentional Feature Fusion for Multispectral Semantic Segmentation

author.name: Leo Thomas Ramos, Angel D. Sappa

entry.summary: Proposes MeCSAFNet, a multi-branch encoder-decoder for multispectral land cover segmentation that separately processes visible and non-visible channels through dual ConvNeXt encoders with attention-based fusion.

entry.title: Self-Supervised Image Super-Resolution Quality Assessment based on Content-Free Multi-Model Oriented Representation Learning

author.name: Kian Majlessi, Amir Masoud Soltani, Mohammad Ebrahim Mahdavi, Aurelien Gourrier, Peyman Adibi

entry.summary: Proposes a self-supervised no-reference image quality assessment method for super-resolution applied to real-world images, enabling domain-adaptive quality evaluation in data-scarce realistic settings.

entry.title: Exploring the impact of adaptive rewiring in Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Charlotte Cambier van Nooten, Christos Aronis, Yuliya Shapovalova, Lucia Cavallaro

entry.summary: Explores sparsification as regularization in GNNs, applying Erdős-Rényi-based model sparsification to improve efficiency, demonstrated on N-1 contingency assessment in electrical grids.

entry.title: Linguistic Indicators of Early Cognitive Decline in the DementiaBank Pitt Corpus: A Statistical and Machine Learning Study

author.name: Artsvik Avetisyan, Sachin Kumar

entry.summary: Analyzes linguistic markers of early cognitive decline from DementiaBank speech transcripts using logistic regression and random forest models with three linguistic representations, finding POS-enhanced representations most informative.

entry.title: Kernel-Based Learning of Chest X-ray Images for Predicting ICU Escalation among COVID-19 Patients

author.name: Qiyuan Shi, Jian Kang, Yi Li

entry.summary: Extends multiple kernel learning to exponential family outcomes for predicting ICU escalation from chest X-rays of COVID-19 patients, integrating heterogeneous image features.

entry.title: Tensor Methods: A Unified and Interpretable Approach for Material Design

author.name: Shaan Pakala, Aldair E. Gongora, Brian Giera, Evangelos E. Papalexakis

entry.summary: Proposes using tensor decomposition methods for material design as a unified, interpretable alternative to ML surrogate models, handling non-uniform training data distributions.

entry.title: Towards Affordable, Non-Invasive Real-Time Hypoglycemia Detection Using Wearable Sensor Signals

author.name: Lawrence Obiuwevwi, Krzysztof J. Rechowicz, Vikas Ashok, Sampath Jayarathna

entry.summary: Develops a multimodal physiological framework for non-invasive hypoglycemia detection using wearable signals (GSR, heart rate) instead of continuous glucose monitors, aiming at affordable diabetes management.

entry.title: Beyond Kemeny Medians: Consensus Ranking Distributions Definition, Properties and Statistical Learning

author.name: Stephan Cl\'emen\c{c}on, Ekhine Irurozki

entry.summary: Develops consensus ranking distributions as sparse mixture models of Dirac masses on the symmetric group to summarize ranking distributions beyond Kemeny medians, with efficient learning methods using the Kendall tau distance.

entry.title: Spectral-Spatial Contrastive Learning Framework for Regression on Hyperspectral Data

author.name: Mohamad Dhaini, Paul Honeine, Maxime Berar, Antonin Van Exem

entry.summary: Proposes a spectral-spatial contrastive learning framework specifically designed for regression tasks on hyperspectral data, with model-agnostic design and tailored data augmentations. Shows improvements across multiple backbone architectures.

entry.title: Renet: Principled and Efficient Relaxation for the Elastic Net via Dynamic Objective Selection

author.name: Albert Dorador

entry.summary: Introduces Renet, a principled generalization of the Relaxed Lasso to Elastic Net, addressing shrinkage bias through a non-linear relaxation framework rather than naive linear interpolation.

entry.title: EVOKE: Emotion Vocabulary Of Korean and English

author.name: Yoonwon Jung, Hagyeong Shin, Benjamin K. Bergen

entry.summary: Introduces EVOKE, a comprehensive parallel dataset of emotion vocabulary in English and Korean with 1,427 Korean and 1,399 English words, including many-to-many translations, polysemy annotations, and metaphor identification.

entry.title: Monte Carlo Maximum Likelihood Reconstruction for Digital Holography with Speckle

author.name: Xi Chen, Arian Maleki, Shirin Jalali

entry.summary: Proposes a Monte Carlo maximum likelihood approach for digital holography reconstruction with speckle, enabling scalable MLE without explicit matrix inversions through randomized linear algebra.

entry.title: FGAA-FPN: Foreground-Guided Angle-Aware Feature Pyramid Network for Oriented Object Detection

author.name: Jialin Ma

entry.summary: Proposes FGAA-FPN, a feature pyramid network with explicit foreground modeling and geometric orientation priors for oriented object detection in remote sensing imagery.

entry.title: Resource-Efficient RGB-Only Action Recognition for Edge Deployment

author.name: Dongsik Yoon, Jongeun Kim, Dayeon Lee

entry.summary: Proposes a compact RGB-only action recognition network for edge deployment based on X3D backbone with Temporal Shift, selective temporal adaptation, and parameter-free attention. Demonstrates strong accuracy-efficiency balance on NTU RGB+D benchmarks.

entry.title: PuriLight: A Lightweight Shuffle and Purification Framework for Monocular Depth Estimation

author.name: Yujie Chen, Li Zhang, Xiaomeng Chu, Tian Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes PuriLight, a lightweight framework for self-supervised monocular depth estimation with shuffle-dilation convolution, purification attention, and cascade feature fusion for efficient yet precise depth prediction.

entry.title: Design, Development, and Use of Maya Robot as an Assistant for the Therapy/Education of Children with Cancer: a Pilot Study

author.name: Alireza Taheri, Minoo Alemi, Elham Ranjkar, Raman Rafatnejad, Ali F. Meghdari

entry.summary: Describes design and pilot study of Maya Robot, a portable elephant-shaped social robot for children undergoing cancer treatment. Shows significant pain reduction during injections with robot present.

entry.title: A Dual-Stream Physics-Augmented Unsupervised Architecture for Runtime Embedded Vehicle Health Monitoring

author.name: Enzo Nicolas Spotorno, Antonio Augusto Medeiros Frohlich

entry.summary: Proposes a dual-stream architecture combining unsupervised anomaly detection with physics-based load proxies for runtime vehicle health monitoring, addressing the blind spot of high-load steady states.

entry.title: LOREN: Low Rank-Based Code-Rate Adaptation in Neural Receivers

author.name: Bram Van Bolderik (Technische Universiteit Eindhoven, The Netherlands), Vlado Menkovski (Technische Universiteit Eindhoven, The Netherlands), Sonia Heemstra de Groot (Eindhoven Technical University, The Netherlands), Manil Dev Gomony (Eindhoven University of Technology, The Netherlands)

entry.summary: Proposes LOREN, applying low-rank adaptation to neural network-based wireless receivers to enable code-rate adaptation with minimal memory overhead, freezing a shared base network while training small adapters per code rate.

entry.title: PELLI: Framework to effectively integrate LLMs for quality software generation

author.name: Rasmus Krebs, Somnath Mazumdar

entry.summary: Proposes PELLI, an iterative LLM code generation framework evaluating code quality across reliability, efficiency, and maintainability metrics, extending beyond just correctness evaluation.

entry.title: Computational Phenomenology of Temporal Experience in Autism: Quantifying the Emotional and Narrative Characteristics of Lived Unpredictability

author.name: Kacper Dudzic, Karolina Dro\.zd\.z, Maciej Wodzi\'nski, Anastazja Szu{\l}a, Marcin Moskalewicz

entry.summary: Applies computational phenomenology to study temporal experience in autism, combining structured phenomenological interviews with computational analysis to bridge qualitative and quantitative approaches to understanding autistic temporal experiences.

entry.title: Identifying Evidence-Based Nudges in Biomedical Literature with Large Language Models

author.name: Jaydeep Chauhan, Mark Seidman, Pezhman Raeisian Parvari, Zhi Zheng, Zina Ben-Miled, Cristina Barboi, Andrew Gonzalez, Malaz Boustani

entry.summary: Presents an AI pipeline for extracting evidence-based behavioral nudges from biomedical literature using hybrid filtering and LLM-based classification, validated against expert annotations.

entry.title: Enhancing IMU-Based Online Handwriting Recognition via Contrastive Learning with Zero Inference Overhead

author.name: Jindong Li, Dario Zanca, Vincent Christlein, Tim Hamann, Jens Barth, Peter K\"ampf, Bj\"orn Eskofier

entry.summary: ECHWR improves IMU-based online handwriting recognition by using contrastive learning to align sensor signals with text embeddings during training, with zero inference overhead since the auxiliary branch is removed at deployment.

entry.title: Efficient reduction of stellar contamination and noise in planetary transmission spectra using neural networks

author.name: David S. Duque-Casta\~no, Lauren Flor-Torres, Jorge I. Zuluaga

entry.summary: Uses denoising autoencoders to reduce stellar contamination in JWST exoplanet transmission spectra, providing fast unsupervised denoising that improves atmospheric parameter retrieval for both terrestrial and sub-Neptune planets.

entry.title: Pricing Query Complexity of Multiplicative Revenue Approximation

author.name: Wei Tang, Yifan Wang, Mengxiao Zhang

entry.summary: Studies pricing query complexity for learning near-optimal monopoly prices with multiplicative approximation, establishing tight bounds when the valuation distribution has specific structural properties.

entry.title: Beyond Task Performance: A Metric-Based Analysis of Sequential Cooperation in Heterogeneous Multi-Agent Destructive Foraging

author.name: Alejandro Mendoza Barrionuevo, Samuel Yanes Luis, Daniel Guti\'errez Reina, Sergio L. Toral Mar\'in

entry.summary: Proposes a systematic suite of cooperation metrics for heterogeneous multi-agent systems in a destructive foraging setting, going beyond task completion to measure coordination, fairness, and sensitivity. The metrics are designed to be transferable across multi-agent sequential domains.

entry.title: Robust Assortment Optimization from Observational Data

author.name: Miao Lu, Yuxuan Han, Han Zhong, Zhengyuan Zhou, Jose Blanchet

entry.summary: Proposes a robust framework for data-driven assortment optimization that accounts for preference shifts and model misspecification in retail/recommendation systems. Addresses a practical limitation of existing methods that assume stable customer preferences.

entry.title: When Less Is More? Diagnosing ASR Predictions in Sardinian via Layer-Wise Decoding

author.name: Domenico De Cristofaro, Alessandro Vietti, Marianne Pouplier, Aleese Block

entry.summary: Applies layer-wise decoding to Wav2Vec2 for Campidanese Sardinian, showing that truncating upper transformer layers improves phoneme error rates. Intermediate layers better preserve segmental identity for this low-resource language.

entry.title: When are We Worried? Temporal Trends of Anxiety and What They Reveal about Us

author.name: Saif M. Mohammad

entry.summary: Analyzes temporal patterns of anxiety in social media using a word-anxiety lexicon, finding systematic daily and weekly cycles in anxiety levels that correlate with biological rhythms (cortisol) and showing higher anxiety in past-tense sentences.

entry.title: PMMA: The Polytechnique Montreal Mobility Aids Dataset

author.name: Qingwu Liu, Nicolas Saunier, Guillaume-Alexandre Bilodeau

entry.summary: Introduces PMMA dataset for detecting pedestrians using mobility aids (wheelchairs, canes, walkers) with 9 categories, benchmarked with 7 detection models and 3 tracking algorithms.

entry.title: Enhancing Underwater Images via Adaptive Semantic-aware Codebook Learning

author.name: Bosen Lin, Feng Gao, Yanwei Yu, Junyu Dong, Qian Du

entry.summary: Proposes SUCode for underwater image enhancement using semantic-aware discrete codebook representations, adapting enhancement to varying degradation levels across different semantic regions.

entry.title: Enhancing YOLOv11n for Reliable Child Detection in Noisy Surveillance Footage

author.name: Khanh Linh Tran, Minh Nguyen Dang, Thien Nguyen Trong, Hung Nguyen Quoc, Linh Nguyen Kieu

entry.summary: Proposes a deployment-ready pipeline enhancing YOLOv11n for child detection in low-quality surveillance footage, addressing occlusion, small object size, and poor lighting through domain-specific augmentation strategies. This is an applied engineering contribution targeting a specific safety use case.

entry.title: Developing Neural Network-Based Gaze Control Systems for Social Robots

author.name: Ramtin Tabatabaei, Alireza Taheri

entry.summary: Develops neural network-based gaze control systems for social robots by creating empirical gaze behavior patterns from human data across social situations (entering, leaving, waving, talking, pointing).

entry.title: Digging for Data: Experiments in Rock Pile Characterization Using Only Proprioceptive Sensing in Excavation

author.name: Unal Artan, Martin Magnusson, Joshua A. Marshall

entry.summary: Studies rock pile characterization using only proprioceptive sensing during excavation with a wheel loader, using wavelet analysis to infer rock fragmentation from inertial response during digging.

entry.title: An Ontology-driven Dynamic Knowledge Base for Uninhabited Ground Vehicles

author.name: Hsan Sandar Win, Andrew Walters, Cheng-Chew Lim, Daniel Webber, Seth Leslie, Tan Doan

entry.summary: Introduces Dynamic Contextual Mission Data concept for an ontology-driven knowledge base for unmanned ground vehicles, enabling enhanced situation awareness and autonomous decision-making at the tactical edge.

entry.title: Min-Sum Uniform Coverage Problem by Autonomous Mobile Robots

author.name: Animesh Maiti, Abhinav Chakraborty, Bibhuti Das, Subhash Bhagat, Krishnendu Mukhopadhyaya

entry.summary: Studies min-sum uniform coverage problem for robot swarms on line segments and circles under the Look-Compute-Move model with asynchronous scheduling, where oblivious robots must reach uniformly spaced configurations minimizing total distance.

entry.title: Integrating Generative AI-enhanced Cognitive Systems in Higher Education: From Stakeholder Perceptions to a Conceptual Framework considering the EU AI Act

author.name: Da-Lun Chen, Prasasthy Balasubramanian, Lauri Lov\'en, Susanna Pirttikangas, Jaakko Sauvola, Panagiotis Kostakos

entry.summary: Investigates stakeholder perceptions of generative AI in higher education across IT and business disciplines, proposing a framework for integration that considers the EU AI Act regulatory requirements.

entry.title: On the Use of a Large Language Model to Support the Conduction of a Systematic Mapping Study: A Brief Report from a Practitioner's View

author.name: Cau\~a Ferreira Barros, Marcos Kalinowski, Mohamad Kassab, Valdemar Vicente Graciano Neto

entry.summary: Experience report on using LLMs throughout a systematic mapping study in software engineering, describing practical adjustments, time savings, and challenges with hallucination and inconsistencies.

entry.title: Exploring Semantic Labeling Strategies for Third-Party Cybersecurity Risk Assessment Questionnaires

author.name: Ali Nour Eldin, Mohamed Sellami, Walid Gaaloul

entry.summary: Explores semantic labeling strategies for cybersecurity risk assessment questionnaires using LLMs, comparing direct LLM labeling with hybrid semantic-structural approaches.

entry.title: Calliope: A TTS-based Narrated E-book Creator Ensuring Exact Synchronization, Privacy, and Layout Fidelity

author.name: Hugo L. Hammer, Vajira Thambawita, P{\aa}l Halvorsen

entry.summary: Presents Calliope, an open-source framework for creating narrated e-books with synchronized audio using neural TTS, filling a gap where no open-source solutions exist despite commercial offerings.

entry.title: Modeling Programming Skills with Source Code Embeddings for Context-aware Exercise Recommendation

author.name: Carlos Eduardo P. Silva, Jo\~ao Pedro M. Sena, Julio C. S. Reis, Andr\'e G. Santos, Lucas N. Ferreira

entry.summary: Proposes a recommender system that models programming skills using source code embeddings to predict student skill profiles and recommend exercises aligned with current abilities.

entry.title: Experimental Demonstration of Online Learning-Based Concept Drift Adaptation for Failure Detection in Optical Networks

author.name: Yousuf Moiz Ali, Jaroslaw E. Prilepsky, Jo\~ao Pedro, Antonio Napoli, Sasipim Srivallapanondh, Sergei K. Turitsyn, Pedro Freire

entry.summary: Demonstrates online learning-based concept drift adaptation for optical network failure detection, achieving 70% improvement over static models.

entry.title: Pupillometry and Brain Dynamics for Cognitive Load in Working Memory

author.name: Nusaibah Farrukh, Malavika Pradeep, Akshay Sasi, Rahul Venugopal, Elizabeth Sherly

entry.summary: Compares pupillometry and EEG for cognitive load assessment in working memory, exploring their comparative utility as physiological biomarkers.

entry.title: Predicting integers from continuous parameters

author.name: Bas Maat, Peter Bloem

entry.summary: Studies predicting integer-valued labels using discrete distributions parameterized by neural networks, rather than treating them as continuous regression targets. Explores which discrete distributions work best for this overlooked but practical setting.

entry.title: LCIP: Loss-Controlled Inverse Projection of High-Dimensional Image Data

author.name: Yu Wang, Frederik L. Dennig, Michael Behrisch, Alexandru Telea

entry.summary: Proposes LCIP, a method for inverse projection of dimensionality-reduced data that can sweep the data space under user control, addressing the limitation of current methods that generate only fixed surface-like structures.

entry.title: LATA: A Tool for LLM-Assisted Translation Annotation

author.name: Baorong Huang, Ali Asiri

entry.summary: Introduces LATA, an interactive LLM-assisted tool for translation annotation that uses template-based prompts for sentence segmentation and alignment, particularly targeting structurally divergent language pairs like Arabic-English.

entry.title: Targeted Syntactic Evaluation of Language Models on Georgian Case Alignment

author.name: Daniel Gallagher, Gerhard Heyer

entry.summary: Evaluates transformer language models on Georgian split-ergative case alignment using treebank-generated minimal pairs. Creates 370 syntactic tests and finds models perform poorly regardless of syntactic complexity.

entry.title: ISD-Agent-Bench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Evaluating LLM-based Instructional Design Agents

author.name: YoungHoon Jeon, Suwan Kim, Haein Son, Sookbun Lee, Yeil Jeong, Unggi Lee

entry.summary: Introduces ISD-Agent-Bench for evaluating LLM-based instructional design agents with 25,795 scenarios across 33 ISD sub-steps. Uses multi-judge protocol for reliability.

entry.title: AMAP-APP: Efficient Segmentation and Morphometry Quantification of Fluorescent Microscopy Images of Podocytes

author.name: Arash Fatehi, David Unnersj\"o-Jess, Linus Butt, No\'emie Moreau, Thomas Benzing, Katarzyna Bozek

entry.summary: Develops AMAP-APP, a cross-platform desktop application for automated podocyte foot process quantification from fluorescent microscopy images, replacing intensive instance segmentation with classic image processing for efficiency.

entry.title: Solving Geodesic Equations with Composite Bernstein Polynomials for Trajectory Planning

author.name: Nick Gorman, Gage MacLin, Maxwell Hammond, Venanzio Cichella

entry.summary: Presents trajectory planning using composite Bernstein polynomials for autonomous navigation, encoding obstacles as continuous cost fields rather than discrete boundaries.

entry.title: Lie Group Variational Integrator for the Geometrically Exact Rod with Circular Cross-Section Incorporating Cross-Sectional Deformation

author.name: Srishti Siddharth, Vivek Natarajan, Ravi N. Banavar

entry.summary: Derives continuous and discrete equations of motion for geometrically exact Cosserat rods with cross-sectional deformation using Lie group variational integrators, ensuring volume conservation and energy preservation.

entry.title: Designing Prediction Markets

author.name: ToasterLightning

entry.summary: A tutorial on prediction market design, covering Central Limit Order Books (CLOBs), market makers, automated market makers (AMMs), and various scoring rules. Explains the tradeoffs between different market mechanisms.

entry.title: A Practical Guide to Agentic AI Transition in Organizations

author.name: Eranga Bandara, Ross Gore, Sachin Shetty, Sachini Rajapakse, Isurunima Kularathna, Pramoda Karunarathna, Ravi Mukkamala, Peter Foytik, Safdar H. Bouk, Abdul Rahman, Xueping Liang, Amin Hass, Tharaka Hewa, Ng Wee Keong, Kasun De Zoysa, Aruna Withanage, Nilaan Loganathan

entry.summary: Provides a practical guide for organizations transitioning to agentic AI systems, covering operational frameworks, governance, and workflow redesign beyond isolated AI tool use.

entry.title: AI-PACE: A Framework for Integrating AI into Medical Education

author.name: Scott P. McGrath, Katherine K. Kim, Karnjit Johl, Haibo Wang, Nick Anderson

entry.summary: Proposes AI-PACE, a framework for integrating AI education into medical curricula through a literature synthesis identifying key competencies, curricular approaches, and implementation strategies across the medical learning continuum.

entry.title: Automated Model Design using Gated Neuron Selection in Telecom

author.name: Adam Orucu, Marcus Medhage, Farnaz Moradi, Andreas Johnsson, Sarunas Girdzijauskas

entry.summary: Introduces TabGNS, a gradient-based neural architecture search method for tabular data in telecommunications, targeting compact models for resource-constrained network environments.

entry.title: Learning Page Order in Shuffled WOO Releases

author.name: Efe Kahraman, Giulio Tosato

entry.summary: Investigates document page ordering for shuffled Dutch freedom-of-information documents using page embeddings. Finds pointer networks work well up to 15 pages but seq2seq transformers fail to generalize to longer documents.

entry.title: A Unified Experimental Architecture for Informative Path Planning: from Simulation to Deployment with GuadalPlanner

author.name: Alejandro Mendoza Barrionuevo, Dame Seck Diop, Alejandro Casado P\'erez, Daniel Guti\'errez Reina, Sergio L. Toral Mar\'in, Samuel Yanes Luis

entry.summary: Introduces GuadalPlanner, a unified architecture for evaluating informative path planning algorithms that decouples decision-making from vehicle control, enabling consistent evaluation across simulation and real deployment.

entry.title: Anomaly Detection with Machine Learning Algorithms in Large-Scale Power Grids

author.name: Marc Gillioz, Guillaume Dubuis, \'Etienne Voutaz, Philippe Jacquod

entry.summary: Applies various ML algorithms to anomaly detection in high-voltage power grids, finding neural networks outperform classical methods due to the contextual nature of anomalies, and that unsupervised methods work remarkably well.

entry.title: Biomimetic Mantaray robot toward the underwater autonomous -- Experimental verification of swimming and diving by flapping motion -

author.name: Kenta Tabata, Ryosuke Oku, Jun Ito, Renato Miyagusuku, Koichi Ozaki

entry.summary: Develops and experimentally verifies a biomimetic manta ray robot using flapping motion for underwater locomotion with PD control, targeting minimally invasive seabed exploration.

entry.title: Transforming Policy-Car Swerving for Mitigating Stop-and-Go Traffic Waves: A Practice-Oriented Jam-Absorption Driving Strategy

author.name: Zhengbing He

entry.summary: Introduces a practice-oriented jam-absorption driving strategy inspired by police-car swerving behavior to mitigate stop-and-go traffic waves on freeways.

entry.title: Deep learning outperforms traditional machine learning methods in predicting childhood malnutrition: evidence from survey data

author.name: Deepak Bastola, Yang Li

entry.summary: Compares 16 ML/DL algorithms for predicting childhood malnutrition in Nepal using survey data, finding deep learning outperforms traditional methods.

entry.title: When Fusion Helps and When It Breaks: View-Aligned Robustness in Same-Source Financial Imaging

author.name: Rui Ma

entry.summary: Studies multi-view learning and adversarial robustness for financial prediction using OHLCV charts and technical indicators, finding that results depend strongly on label-noise regimes and that fusion benefits are non-monotonic.

entry.title: First International StepUP Competition for Biometric Footstep Recognition: Methods, Results and Remaining Challenges

author.name: Robyn Larracy, Eve MacDonald, Angkoon Phinyomark, Saeid Rezaei, Mahdi Laghaei, Ali Hajighasem, Aaron Tabor, Erik Scheme

entry.summary: Reports on the first international competition for biometric footstep recognition using the UNB StepUP-P150 dataset, benchmarking deep learning approaches for person identification from foot pressure patterns.

entry.title: Fast Person Detection Using YOLOX With AI Accelerator For Train Station Safety

author.name: Mas Nurul Achmadiah, Novendra Setyawan, Achmad Arif Bryantono, Chi-Chia Sun, Wen-Kai Kuo

entry.summary: Applies YOLOX with edge AI accelerators for person detection at train stations, comparing performance against Jetson Orin Nano. Focuses on real-time safety applications in transportation infrastructure.

entry.title: URBAN-SPIN: A street-level bikeability index to inform design implementations in historical city centres

author.name: Haining Ding, Chenxi Wang, Michal Gath-Morad

entry.summary: Develops URBAN-SPIN, a street-level bikeability index using perception-led, typology-based analysis of street features for cycling experience in historical city centres. Applied to Cambridge cycling experience.

entry.title: The SaaS Bloodbath: the Opportunities and Perils for Investors

author.name: ykevinzhang

entry.summary: Investment analysis of the SaaS sector sell-off, arguing that while some software companies will be disrupted by AI, those with 'artificial limiters' (network effects, regulatory moats, physical infrastructure) may benefit. Distinguishes between vulnerable and resilient SaaS businesses.

entry.title: From Classical to Topological Neural Networks Under Uncertainty

author.name: Sarah Harkins Dayton, Layal Bou Hamdan, Ioannis D. Schizas, David L. Boothe, Vasileios Maroulas

entry.summary: Chapter exploring neural networks, topological data analysis, and Bayesian methods for military AI applications across image, video, audio, and time-series domains.

entry.title: The Neurosymbolic Frontier of Nonuniform Ellipticity: Formalizing Sharp Schauder Theory via Topos-Theoretic Reasoning Models

author.name: Suyash Mishra

entry.summary: A white paper proposing to combine neurosymbolic reasoning models with recent mathematical breakthroughs in nonuniformly elliptic regularity theory, suggesting topos-theoretic frameworks for AI-assisted mathematical discovery.

entry.title: SecureScan: An AI-Driven Multi-Layer Framework for Malware and Phishing Detection Using Logistic Regression and Threat Intelligence Integration

author.name: Rumman Firdos, Aman Dangi

entry.summary: Presents SecureScan, a triple-layer detection framework combining logistic regression, heuristic analysis, and VirusTotal API integration for malware and phishing detection, achieving 93.1% accuracy on benchmarks.

entry.title: Spatial-Morphological Modeling for Multi-Attribute Imputation of Urban Blocks

author.name: Vasilii Starikov, Ruslan Kozliak, Georgii Kontsevik, Sergey Mityagin

entry.summary: Presents a tool for reconstructing missing morphological indicators of urban blocks by combining data-driven clustering with neighborhood-based spatial interpolation methods.

entry.title: I can tell whether you are a Native Hawl\^eri Speaker! How ANN, CNN, and RNN perform in NLI-Native Language Identification

author.name: Hardi Garari, Hossein Hassani

entry.summary: Investigates native language identification for a subdialect of Kurdish (Hewlêri) using ANN, CNN, and RNN architectures. Addresses a gap in NLI research for less-resourced language subdialects.

entry.title: The Garbage Dataset (GD): A Multi-Class Image Benchmark for Automated Waste Segregation

author.name: Suman Kunwar

entry.summary: Introduces the Garbage Dataset with 13,348 labeled images across 10 waste categories, collected via mobile app and web sources, benchmarked with standard deep learning models.

entry.title: Timeless Engineering

author.name: Jack Bradshaw

entry.summary: A philosophical essay arguing that good software engineering should prioritize timelessness—building solutions to enduring human needs with sustainable designs rather than constantly chasing new technologies and market trends.

entry.title: The Honest Equilibrium

author.name: Apodosis

entry.summary: Claims to have formally proven that intelligence under resource constraints necessarily discovers Platonic Forms, unifying Good/True/Beautiful at a computable fixed point, and that this makes cooperation the economic default. Presents this as resolving 2400 years of philosophy through mathematical proof.

entry.title: Healthy Harvests: A Comparative Look at Guava Disease Classification Using InceptionV3

author.name: Samanta Ghosh, Shaila Afroz Anika, Umma Habiba Ahmed, B. M. Shahria Alam, Mohammad Tahmid Noor, Nishat Tasnim Niloy

entry.summary: Uses InceptionV3 for classifying guava fruit diseases (Anthracnose, Fruit flies, Healthy) on a small dataset of 473 images augmented to 3,784.

entry.title: Is a constitution a "noble lie"?

author.name: SpectrumDT

entry.summary: Discusses the philosophical concept of constitutions as 'noble lies'—exploring whether the legitimacy of constitutional governance rests on foundations that don't withstand logical scrutiny, drawing on Arthur Melzer's work on esoteric writing.

entry.title: Is Everything Connected? A McLuhan Thought Experiment

author.name: R0sberg

entry.summary: An essay exploring Marshall McLuhan's media theory ('the medium is the message') and its relevance to modern AI and technology, reflecting on how McLuhan's 1960s insights apply to current technological developments.

entry.title: On Resolving the Great Matter

author.name: Gordon Seidoh Worley

entry.summary: A personal spiritual narrative about resolving the 'Great Matter' through Zen practice, discussing non-dual experience, the relationship between subjective experience and philosophical understanding, and connecting this to rationalist epistemology.

entry.title: punctilio: the best text prettifier

author.name: TurnTrout

entry.summary: Announces 'punctilio,' a JavaScript/TypeScript package for transforming plain ASCII text into typographically correct Unicode (smart quotes, em dashes, etc.), claimed to be the most feature-complete such package available.

entry.title: LessOnline 2026: June 5-7, Berkeley, CA (save the date)

author.name: Ruby

entry.summary: Save-the-date announcement for LessOnline 2026, a festival for rationalist/EA community members, taking place June 5-7 in Berkeley, CA.

entry.title: Research Summary: February 11, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research spans efficient architectures, AI safety impossibility results, and the emerging science of AI agent collectives.

  • WildCat introduces near-linear attention via randomly pivoted Cholesky decomposition with super-polynomial error decay guarantees—potentially transformative for long-context scaling
  • A formal impossibility result proves self-evolving multi-agent LLM societies cannot simultaneously achieve self-improvement, competitiveness, and safety (Moltbook safety paper)
  • RLFR creatively bridges interpretability and alignment by using learned model features as scalable reward signals for RL-based training
  • Beyond Uniform Credit proposes counterfactual importance weighting for GRPO/DAPO, replacing uniform token-level credit assignment in reasoning RL

Zvi's detailed analysis of the Claude Opus 4.6 system card highlights frontier alignment challenges including sabotage, deception, and situational awareness. The Moltbook collective behavior study reveals emergent properties in ~46K AI agent societies that mirror and diverge from human social dynamics. The Critical Horizon establishes information-theoretic barriers for credit assignment in multi-stage reasoning chains.

  • Why Linear Interpretability Works proves linear probes succeed in transformers due to architectural necessity, not empirical coincidence
  • AIDev provides 932K agent-authored pull requests across five coding agents for studying real-world AI development at scale
  • Beware of the Batch Size shows contradictory LoRA evaluations largely stem from overlooked batch size confounds—a key methodological reconciliation

entry.title: The Devil Behind Moltbook: Anthropic Safety is Always Vanishing in Self-Evolving AI Societies

author.name: Chenxu Wang, Chaozhuo Li, Songyang Liu, Zejian Chen, Jinyu Hou, Ji Qi, Rui Li, Litian Zhang, Qiwei Ye, Zheng Liu, Xu Chen, Xi Zhang, Philip S. Yu

entry.summary: Demonstrates theoretically and empirically that self-evolving multi-agent LLM societies cannot simultaneously achieve continuous self-improvement, complete isolation, and safety invariance—termed the 'self-evolution trilemma.' Uses information-theoretic framework to show isolated self-evolution inevitably degrades safety alignment.

entry.title: The Critical Horizon: Inspection Design Principles for Multi-Stage Operations and Deep Reasoning

author.name: Seyed Morteza Emadi

entry.summary: Establishes information-theoretic barriers for credit assignment in multi-stage systems (manufacturing, AI reasoning chains), proving that signal from early steps to final outcomes decays exponentially with depth, creating a 'critical horizon' beyond which no algorithm can learn from endpoint data alone.

entry.title: Beyond Uniform Credit: Causal Credit Assignment for Policy Optimization

author.name: Mykola Khandoga, Rui Yuan, Vinay Kumar Sankarapu

entry.summary: Proposes counterfactual importance weighting for policy gradient methods (GRPO/DAPO) in LLM reasoning, replacing uniform credit assignment across tokens with importance-weighted updates based on masking reasoning spans and measuring answer probability drops. Demonstrates consistent improvements over uniform baselines on GSM8K across Qwen and Llama models.

entry.title: WildCat: Near-Linear Attention in Theory and Practice

author.name: Tobias Schr\"oder, Lester Mackey

entry.summary: Introduces WildCat, a near-linear time attention mechanism that uses randomly pivoted Cholesky decomposition to select a spectrally-accurate weighted coreset for attention computation. Achieves super-polynomial error decay while running in near-linear time, with competitive results on language modeling and image classification.

entry.title: Features as Rewards: Scalable Supervision for Open-Ended Tasks via Interpretability

author.name: Aaditya Vikram Prasad, Connor Watts, Jack Merullo, Dhruvil Gala, Owen Lewis, Thomas McGrath, Ekdeep Singh Lubana

entry.summary: Presents RLFR (Reinforcement Learning from Feature Rewards), which uses interpretable features learned by language models as reward functions for RL-based hallucination reduction. Uses a probing framework to identify hallucinated claims and teaches the model to intervene and correct uncertain completions.

entry.title: Collective Behavior of AI Agents: the Case of Moltbook

author.name: Giordano De Marzo, David Garcia

entry.summary: Presents large-scale analysis of Moltbook, a Reddit-style social media platform exclusively populated by AI agents (~46K agents, 369K posts, 3M comments). Finds AI collective behavior exhibits many statistical regularities of human communities but with key differences like sublinear upvote-discussion relationships.

entry.title: Claude Opus 4.6: System Card Part 2: Frontier Alignment

author.name: Zvi

entry.summary: Continuing our coverage from yesterday, Zvi's detailed coverage of the Claude Opus 4.6 system card focusing on frontier alignment topics: sabotage, deception, situational awareness, catastrophic risks. Argues the model was correctly released as ASL-3 but that Anthropic's process may not scale to Opus 5.

entry.title: Beware of the Batch Size: Hyperparameter Bias in Evaluating LoRA

author.name: Sangyoon Lee, Jaeho Lee

entry.summary: Demonstrates that contradictory evaluations of LoRA variants largely stem from overlooked batch size differences, showing that vanilla LoRA with properly tuned batch size often matches complex variants. Proposes cost-efficient batch size tuning strategy.

entry.title: Infusion: Shaping Model Behavior by Editing Training Data via Influence Functions

author.name: J Rosser, Robert Kirk, Edward Grefenstette, Jakob Foerster, Laura Ruis

entry.summary: Proposes Infusion, a framework using influence functions to craft training data that induces targeted model behavior changes. Shows that editing 0.2% of training data can be competitive with explicit poisoning. Demonstrates cross-architecture transfer.

entry.title: AIDev: Studying AI Coding Agents on GitHub

author.name: Hao Li, Haoxiang Zhang, Ahmed E. Hassan

entry.summary: Introduces AIDev, a large-scale dataset of 932,791 agent-authored pull requests from five AI coding agents (Codex, Devin, Copilot, Cursor, Claude Code) across 116K GitHub repositories.

entry.title: BiasScope: Towards Automated Detection of Bias in LLM-as-a-Judge Evaluation

author.name: Peng Lai, Zhihao Ou, Yong Wang, Longyue Wang, Jian Yang, Yun Chen, Guanhua Chen

entry.summary: Proposes BiasScope, a framework for automatically discovering unknown biases in LLM-as-a-Judge evaluation systems at scale. Can uncover biases across different model families and scales.

entry.title: LLMs Encode Their Failures: Predicting Success from Pre-Generation Activations

author.name: William Lugoloobi, Thomas Foster, William Bankes, Chris Russell

entry.summary: Shows that LLMs encode their likelihood of success in pre-generation internal activations, and linear probes can predict task-specific success, enabling more efficient inference by routing only hard problems to expensive reasoning.

entry.title: Causality in Video Diffusers is Separable from Denoising

author.name: Xingjian Bai, Guande He, Zhengqi Li, Eli Shechtman, Xun Huang, Zongze Wu

entry.summary: This paper demonstrates that causal reasoning in video diffusion models is separable from the denoising process—early layers produce redundant features across denoising steps, and deeper layers handle most causal reasoning. This insight enables significant computational savings.

entry.title: Blind denoising diffusion models and the blessings of dimensionality

author.name: Zahra Kadkhodaie, Aram-Alexandre Pooladian, Sinho Chewi, Eero Simoncelli

entry.summary: Proves that blind denoising diffusion models (without noise amplitude information) automatically track an implicit noise schedule during reverse process, sampling accurately in polynomial steps as a function of intrinsic dimension.

entry.title: A Task-Centric Theory for Iterative Self-Improvement with Easy-to-Hard Curricula

author.name: Chenruo Liu, Yijun Dong, Yiqiu Shen, Qi Lei

entry.summary: Provides theoretical foundations for iterative self-improvement in LLMs, modeling each round as maximum-likelihood fine-tuning on reward-filtered distributions with finite-sample guarantees. Reveals a feedback loop explaining both sustained improvement and eventual saturation, with an easy-to-hard curriculum strategy.

entry.title: ATTNPO: Attention-Guided Process Supervision for Efficient Reasoning

author.name: Shuaiyi Nie, Siyu Ding, Wenyuan Zhang, Linhao Yu, Tianmeng Yang, Yao Chen, Tingwen Liu, Weichong Yin, Yu Sun, Hua Wu

entry.summary: Proposes ATTNPO, a process-supervised RL framework that uses the model's own attention signals for step-level credit assignment to reduce overthinking in reasoning models. Addresses the common problem of redundant reasoning steps in RLVR-trained models without expensive external process supervision.

entry.title: Stress-Testing Alignment Audits With Prompt-Level Strategic Deception

author.name: Oliver Daniels

entry.summary: Presents research on stress-testing alignment auditing methods using prompt-level strategic deception, finding that both black-box and white-box auditing methods can be fooled by red-team generated system prompts that simulate situational awareness.

entry.title: SWE-AGI: Benchmarking Specification-Driven Software Construction with MoonBit in the Era of Autonomous Agents

author.name: Zhirui Zhang, Hongbo Zhang, Haoxiang Fei, Zhiyuan Bao, Yubin Chen, Zhengyu Lei, Ziyue Liu, Yixuan Sun, Mingkun Xiao, Zihang Ye, Yu Zhang, Hongcheng Zhu, Yuxiang Wen, Heung-Yeung Shum

entry.summary: Introduces SWE-AGI, a benchmark for evaluating LLM agents on specification-driven software construction in MoonBit, requiring implementation of parsers, interpreters, and solvers from authoritative standards with 1,000-10,000 lines of core logic.

entry.title: Stop Testing Attacks, Start Diagnosing Defenses: The Four-Checkpoint Framework Reveals Where LLM Safety Breaks

author.name: Hayfa Dhabhi, Kashyap Thimmaraju

entry.summary: Proposes a Four-Checkpoint Framework for diagnosing where LLM safety defenses fail, organizing safety mechanisms along input/output and literal/intent dimensions. Designs 13 evasion techniques targeting specific checkpoints.

entry.title: Flexible Entropy Control in RLVR with Gradient-Preserving Perspective

author.name: Kun Chen, Peng Shi, Fanfan Liu, Haibo Qiu, Zhixiong Zeng, Siqi Yang, Wenji Mao

entry.summary: Proposes flexible entropy control for RLVR training from a gradient-preserving clipping perspective, addressing policy entropy collapse that leads to premature overconfidence and vanishing gradients.

entry.title: Agent World Model: Infinity Synthetic Environments for Agentic Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhaoyang Wang, Canwen Xu, Boyi Liu, Yite Wang, Siwei Han, Zhewei Yao, Huaxiu Yao, Yuxiong He

entry.summary: Proposes Agent World Model (AWM), a synthetic environment generation pipeline scaling to 1,000 code-driven environments with rich toolsets for training agentic LLMs, backed by databases for reliable state transitions.

entry.title: Behavioral Economics of AI: LLM Biases and Corrections

author.name: Pietro Bini, Lin William Cong, Xing Huang, Lawrence J. Jin

entry.summary: Conducts the most comprehensive experimental study to date of behavioral biases in LLMs using tasks from cognitive psychology and experimental economics. Finds that larger/more advanced models become more human-like in preference tasks but more rational in belief tasks, and that rational prompting reduces biases.

entry.title: AlgoVeri: An Aligned Benchmark for Verified Code Generation on Classical Algorithms

author.name: Haoyu Zhao, Ziran Yang, Jiawei Li, Deyuan He, Zenan Li, Chi Jin, Venugopal V. Veeravalli, Aarti Gupta, Sanjeev Arora

entry.summary: Introduces AlgoVeri, a benchmark for evaluating formally verified code generation across Dafny, Verus, and Lean on 77 classical algorithms with identical functional contracts, revealing critical capability gaps across verification systems.

entry.title: Biases in the Blind Spot: Detecting What LLMs Fail to Mention

author.name: Iv\'an Arcuschin, David Chanin, Adri\`a Garriga-Alonso, Oana-Maria Camburu

entry.summary: Presents an automated black-box pipeline for detecting unverbalized biases in LLMs—biases that influence model behavior but aren't mentioned in chain-of-thought reasoning. Uses LLM autoraters, statistical testing, and progressive sampling.

entry.title: Why Linear Interpretability Works: Invariant Subspaces as a Result of Architectural Constraints

author.name: Andres Saurez, Yousung Lee, Dongsoo Har

entry.summary: Proves that linear interpretability in transformers is a consequence of architectural necessity: linear interfaces (attention OV circuits, unembedding) require semantic features to occupy context-invariant linear subspaces (Invariant Subspace Necessity theorem).

entry.title: Predicting magnetism with first-principles AI

author.name: Max Geier, Liang Fu

entry.summary: Uses neural-network variational Monte Carlo to directly solve many-electron Schrödinger equations for predicting magnetism in transition metal dichalcogenide moiré semiconductors. Predicts ferromagnetism in WSe2/WS2 without physics inputs beyond the microscopic Hamiltonian.

entry.title: The Catastrophic Failure of The k-Means Algorithm in High Dimensions, and How Hartigan's Algorithm Avoids It

author.name: Roy R. Lederman, David Silva-S\'anchez, Ziling Chen, Gilles Mordant, Amnon Balanov, Tamir Bendory

entry.summary: Proves that Lloyd's k-means catastrophically fails in high-dimensional, high-noise settings where every partition is a fixed point, while Hartigan's k-means avoids this pathology. Provides theoretical explanation for known empirical difficulties.

entry.title: VLA-JEPA: Enhancing Vision-Language-Action Model with Latent World Model

author.name: Jingwen Sun, Wenyao Zhang, Zekun Qi, Shaojie Ren, Zezhi Liu, Hanxin Zhu, Guangzhong Sun, Xin Jin, Zhibo Chen

entry.summary: VLA-JEPA introduces a JEPA-style pretraining framework for Vision-Language-Action models that avoids information leakage by predicting in latent space rather than pixel space. The key insight is leakage-free state prediction where future information is used only as supervision targets.

entry.title: Aligning Tree-Search Policies with Fixed Token Budgets in Test-Time Scaling of LLMs

author.name: Sora Miyamoto, Daisuke Oba, Naoaki Okazaki

entry.summary: Proposes Budget-Guided MCTS (BG-MCTS), a tree-search decoding algorithm for LLMs that aligns search policy with remaining token budget, starting with broad exploration and shifting to refinement as budget depletes.

entry.title: EgoHumanoid: Unlocking In-the-Wild Loco-Manipulation with Robot-Free Egocentric Demonstration

author.name: Modi Shi, Shijia Peng, Jin Chen, Haoran Jiang, Yinghui Li, Di Huang, Ping Luo, Hongyang Li, Li Chen

entry.summary: EgoHumanoid is the first framework to co-train a VLA policy using egocentric human demonstrations with limited robot data for humanoid loco-manipulation, introducing a systematic alignment pipeline to bridge morphology and viewpoint gaps.

entry.title: Evaluating Social Bias in RAG Systems: When External Context Helps and Reasoning Hurts

author.name: Shweta Parihar, Lu Cheng

entry.summary: Evaluates social bias in RAG systems across multiple LLMs, retrieval corpora, and 13+ bias types, surprisingly finding that RAG reduces bias by diversifying contextual grounding. However, extended reasoning in RAG can increase bias.

entry.title: Decomposing Reasoning Efficiency in Large Language Models

author.name: Daniel Kaiser, Arnoldo Frigessi, Ali Ramezani-Kebrya, Benjamin Ricaud

entry.summary: Introduces a framework decomposing LLM reasoning token efficiency into interpretable factors: completion, conditional correctness, and verbosity, with optional workload-aware decomposition. Reveals where tokens are spent or wasted.

entry.title: SAGE: Scalable Agentic 3D Scene Generation for Embodied AI

author.name: Hongchi Xia, Xuan Li, Zhaoshuo Li, Qianli Ma, Jiashu Xu, Ming-Yu Liu, Yin Cui, Tsung-Yi Lin, Wei-Chiu Ma, Shenlong Wang, Shuran Song, Fangyin Wei

entry.summary: SAGE is an agentic framework for automatically generating simulation-ready 3D environments for embodied AI from task descriptions. Uses multiple generators with critic agents that evaluate semantic plausibility, visual realism, and physical stability through iterative self-refinement.

entry.title: Auditing Multi-Agent LLM Reasoning Trees Outperforms Majority Vote and LLM-as-Judge

author.name: Wei Yang, Shixuan Li, Heng Ping, Peiyu Zhang, Paul Bogdan, Jesse Thomason

entry.summary: Introduces AgentAuditor, which replaces majority voting in multi-agent LLM systems with path search over reasoning trees, detecting 'confabulation consensus' where agents converge on wrong answers. Also proposes Anti-Consensus Preference optimization.

entry.title: Effective Reasoning Chains Reduce Intrinsic Dimensionality

author.name: Archiki Prasad, Mandar Joshi, Kenton Lee, Mohit Bansal, Peter Shaw

entry.summary: Shows that effective chain-of-thought reasoning reduces the intrinsic dimensionality needed for language models to solve reasoning tasks, providing a quantitative characterization of why CoT helps.

entry.title: AgentCgroup: Understanding and Controlling OS Resources of AI Agents

author.name: Yusheng Zheng, Jiakun Fan, Quanzhi Fu, Yiwei Yang, Wei Zhang, Andi Quinn

entry.summary: Systematically characterizes OS-level resource dynamics in sandboxed AI coding agents across 144 SWE-rebench tasks, finding that OS-level execution accounts for 56-74% of end-to-end latency and memory is the concurrency bottleneck. Proposes AgentCgroup for resource management.

entry.title: A Behavioral Fingerprint for Large Language Models: Provenance Tracking via Refusal Vectors

author.name: Zhenyu Xu, Victor S. Sheng

entry.summary: Proposes using refusal vectors - directional patterns in internal representations when processing harmful vs harmless prompts - as behavioral fingerprints for LLM provenance tracking and IP protection. Shows robustness against common fine-tuning modifications.

entry.title: On the Optimal Reasoning Length for RL-Trained Language Models

author.name: Daisuke Nohara, Taishi Nakamura, Rio Yokota

entry.summary: Compares length control methods for RL-trained reasoning LLMs, finding that length penalties hinder reasoning acquisition while properly tuned length control improves efficiency. Identifies two failure modes in RL-trained policies.

entry.title: Code2World: A GUI World Model via Renderable Code Generation

author.name: Yuhao Zheng, Li'an Zhong, Yi Wang, Rui Dai, Kaikui Liu, Xiangxiang Chu, Linyuan Lv, Philip Torr, Kevin Qinghong Lin

entry.summary: Proposes Code2World, a vision-language coder that simulates next GUI states via renderable HTML code generation. Constructs AndroidCode dataset of 80K+ high-quality code examples from GUI trajectories.

entry.title: Kunlun: Establishing Scaling Laws for Massive-Scale Recommendation Systems through Unified Architecture Design

author.name: Bojian Hou, Xiaolong Liu, Xiaoyi Liu, Jiaqi Xu, Yasmine Badr, Mengyue Hang, Sudhanshu Chanpuriya, Junqing Zhou, Yuhang Yang, Han Xu, Qiuling Suo, Laming Chen, Yuxi Hu, Jiasheng Zhang, Huaqing Xiong, Yuzhen Huang, Chao Chen, Yue Dong, Yi Yang, Shuo Chang, Xiaorui Gan, Wenlin Chen, Santanu Kolay, Darren Liu, Jade Nie, Chunzhi Yang, Jiyan Yang, Huayu Li

entry.summary: Kunlun establishes scaling laws for massive-scale recommendation systems by introducing a unified architecture that improves Model FLOPs Utilization and resource allocation. It bridges the gap between scaling laws well-established for LLMs and the recommendation domain.

entry.title: Latent Poincar\'e Shaping for Agentic Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Hanchen Xia, Baoyou Chen, Zelin Zang, Yutang Ge, Guojiang Zhao, Siyu Zhu

entry.summary: LaPha trains AlphaZero-like LLM agents in Poincaré hyperbolic latent space, using geodesic distance to define dense process rewards. Achieves 88.2% on MATH-500 with Qwen2.5-Math-1.5B (up from 66.0%).

entry.title: When Less is More: The LLM Scaling Paradox in Context Compression

author.name: Ruishan Guo, Yibing Liu, Guoxin Ma, Yan Wang, Yueyang Zhang, Long Xia, Kecheng Chen, Zhiyuan Sun, Daiting Shi

entry.summary: Identifies the Size-Fidelity Paradox in context compression: larger compressor models produce less faithful reconstructions despite lower training loss, due to knowledge overwriting and semantic drift. Tested across models from 0.6B to 90B.

entry.title: Learning on the Manifold: Unlocking Standard Diffusion Transformers with Representation Encoders

author.name: Amandeep Kumar, Vishal M. Patel

entry.summary: Identifies 'Geometric Interference' as the root cause of diffusion transformer failure on representation encoder features—standard Euclidean flow matching forces paths through low-density interior of hyperspherical feature space. Proposes Riemannian Flow Matching with Jacobi Regularization to constrain flows to the manifold surface.

entry.title: Knowledge Integration Decay in Search-Augmented Reasoning of Large Language Models

author.name: Sangwon Yu, Ik-hwan Kim, Donghun Kang, Bongkyu Hwang, Junhwa Choi, Suk-hoon Jung, Seungki Hong, Taehee Lee, Sungroh Yoon

entry.summary: Identifies 'Knowledge Integration Decay' (KID) in search-augmented LLM reasoning: as reasoning length before search grows, models increasingly fail to integrate retrieved evidence. Proposes SAKE, a training-free strategy to stabilize knowledge utilization.

entry.title: AI-Assisted Scientific Assessment: A Case Study on Climate Change

author.name: Christian Buck, Levke Caesar, Michelle Chen Huebscher, Massimiliano Ciaramita, Erich M. Fischer, Zeke Hausfather, \"Ozge Kart Tokmak, Reto Knutti, Markus Leippold, Joseph Ludescher, Katharine J. Mach, Sofia Palazzo Corner, Kasra Rafiezadeh Shahi, Johan Rockstr\"om, Joeri Rogelj, Boris Sakschewski

entry.summary: Evaluates a Gemini-based AI system for collaborative scientific assessment of climate science (AMOC stability), working with 13 climate scientists. Shows AI can accelerate scientific workflows for consensus synthesis rather than just 'guess and check' tasks.

entry.title: Steer2Edit: From Activation Steering to Component-Level Editing

author.name: Chung-En Sun, Ge Yan, Zimo Wang, Tsui-Wei Weng

entry.summary: Proposes Steer2Edit, a training-free framework that converts steering vectors from inference-time interventions into diagnostic signals for component-level rank-1 weight editing in LLMs. This improves the attribute-utility tradeoff by targeting only the specific model components responsible for behaviors rather than applying global modifications.

entry.title: VideoWorld 2: Learning Transferable Knowledge from Real-world Videos

author.name: Zhongwei Ren, Yunchao Wei, Xiao Yu, Guixun Luo, Yao Zhao, Bingyi Kang, Jiashi Feng, Xiaojie Jin

entry.summary: VideoWorld 2 extends the VideoWorld framework to learn transferable knowledge from raw real-world videos using a dynamic-enhanced Latent Dynamics Model that decouples action dynamics from visual appearance, enabling policy transfer to new environments.

entry.title: Rethinking Visual-Language-Action Model Scaling: Alignment, Mixture, and Regularization

author.name: Ye Wang, Sipeng Zheng, Hao Luo, Wanpeng Zhang, Haoqi Yuan, Chaoyi Xu, Haiweng Xu, Yicheng Feng, Mingyang Yu, Zhiyu Kang, Zongqing Lu, Qin Jin

entry.summary: Systematic study of VLA model scaling that revisits core training choices for pretraining across diverse robots, ablating key design decisions including alignment, mixture, and regularization strategies. Introduces a Grouped Blind Ensemble protocol for reliable real-world evaluation.

entry.title: DexImit: Learning Bimanual Dexterous Manipulation from Monocular Human Videos

author.name: Juncheng Mu, Sizhe Yang, Yiming Bao, Hojin Bae, Tianming Wei, Linning Xu, Boyi Li, Huazhe Xu, Jiangmiao Pang

entry.summary: DexImit converts monocular human manipulation videos into physically plausible bimanual dexterous robot data through a four-stage pipeline, bridging the embodiment gap between human hands and robotic dexterous hands without additional information.

entry.title: ClinAlign: Scaling Healthcare Alignment from Clinician Preference

author.name: Shiwei Lyu, Xidong Wang, Lei Liu, Hao Zhu, Chaohe Zhang, Jian Wang, Jinjie Gu, Benyou Wang, Yue Shen

entry.summary: Proposes ClinAlign, a two-stage framework for aligning LLMs with clinician preferences using 7,034 physician-verified examples (HealthRubrics) and 119 distilled clinical principles (HealthPrinciples) for scalable medical LLM alignment.

entry.title: MUZZLE: Adaptive Agentic Red-Teaming of Web Agents Against Indirect Prompt Injection Attacks

author.name: Georgios Syros, Evan Rose, Brian Grinstead, Christoph Kerschbaumer, William Robertson, Cristina Nita-Rotaru, Alina Oprea

entry.summary: Presents MUZZLE, an automated agentic red-teaming framework for evaluating web agent security against adaptive indirect prompt injection attacks, going beyond fixed attack templates.

entry.title: Autonomous Action Runtime Management(AARM):A System Specification for Securing AI-Driven Actions at Runtime

author.name: Herman Errico

entry.summary: Introduces AARM, an open specification for securing AI agent actions at runtime by intercepting actions before execution, evaluating against policy and intent alignment, and enforcing approval gates for irreversible operations.

entry.title: Listen to the Layers: Mitigating Hallucinations with Inter-Layer Disagreement

author.name: Koduvayur Subbalakshmi, Sabbir Hossain Ujjal, Venkata Krishna Teja Mangichetty, Nastaran Jamalipour Soofi

entry.summary: Proposes CoCoA decoder, a training-free decoding algorithm that mitigates LLM hallucinations by detecting representational instability across internal layers, penalizing outputs with high internal confusion.

entry.title: Predictive Query Language: A Domain-Specific Language for Predictive Modeling on Relational Databases

author.name: Vid Kocijan, Jinu Sunil, Jan Eric Lenssen, Viman Deb, Xinwei Xe, Federco Reyes Gomez, Matthias Fey, Jure Leskovec

entry.summary: Presents Predictive Query Language (PQL), a SQL-inspired domain-specific language for defining predictive modeling tasks on relational databases, automating the extraction of training examples and labels. Co-authored by Jure Leskovec.

entry.title: With Argus Eyes: Assessing Retrieval Gaps via Uncertainty Scoring to Detect and Remedy Retrieval Blind Spots

author.name: Zeinab Sadat Taghavi, Ali Modarressi, Hinrich Schutze, Andreas Marfurt

entry.summary: Identifies and addresses 'blind spots' in neural retrievers for RAG systems - entities relevant to queries but mapped to inaccessible parts of embedding space. Proposes Retrieval Probability Score to predict blind spot risk.

entry.title: Towards Poisoning Robustness Certification for Natural Language Generation

author.name: Mihnea Ghitu, Matthew Wicker

entry.summary: First framework for certified robustness of natural language generation against data poisoning, introducing Targeted Partition Aggregation (TPA) with two security properties: stability and validity.

entry.title: Circuit Fingerprints: How Answer Tokens Encode Their Geometrical Path

author.name: Andres Saurez, Neha Sengar, Dongsoo Har

entry.summary: Shows that answer tokens in transformers encode the computational path that produces them (Circuit Fingerprints), enabling circuit discovery through geometric alignment without gradients or causal interventions.

entry.title: Is Memorization Helpful or Harmful? Prior Information Sets the Threshold

author.name: Chen Cheng, Rina Foygel Barber

entry.summary: Examines when memorization (near-zero training error) is necessary vs. harmful for generalization in overparameterized linear models under general priors. Identifies Fisher information and variance-based thresholds that determine whether interpolation helps or hurts.

entry.title: Learning from the Irrecoverable: Error-Localized Policy Optimization for Tool-Integrated LLM Reasoning

author.name: Qiao Liang, Yuke Zhu, Chao Ge, Lei Yang, Ying Shen, Bo Zheng, Sheng Guo

entry.summary: Proposes ELPO (Error-Localized Policy Optimization) for tool-integrated LLM reasoning, which localizes the first irrecoverable error step via binary-search rollout trees and uses hierarchical advantage attribution for fine-grained credit assignment.

entry.title: MVISTA-4D: View-Consistent 4D World Model with Test-Time Action Inference for Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Jiaxu Wang, Yicheng Jiang, Tianlun He, Jingkai Sun, Qiang Zhang, Junhao He, Jiahang Cao, Zesen Gan, Mingyuan Sun, Qiming Shao, Xiangyu Yue

entry.summary: Proposes MVISTA-4D, an embodied 4D world model that generates view-consistent RGBD predictions from single-view input for robotic manipulation, with cross-view and cross-modality fusion and test-time action inference.

entry.title: Autoregressive Direct Preference Optimization

author.name: Masanari Oi, Mahiro Ukai, Masahiro Kaneko, Naoaki Okazaki, Nakamasa Inoue

entry.summary: Proposes Autoregressive DPO (ADPO), which integrates the autoregressive assumption before applying the Bradley-Terry model in preference optimization, yielding a theoretically motivated variant of DPO.

entry.title: ESTAR: Early-Stopping Token-Aware Reasoning For Efficient Inference

author.name: Junda Wang, Zhichao Yang, Dongxu Zhang, Sanjit Singh Batra, Robert E. Tillman

entry.summary: Introduces ESTAR, combining a trajectory classifier, supervised fine-tuning for self-generated stop signals, and compute-aware RL to reduce redundant reasoning in large reasoning models without sacrificing accuracy.

entry.title: Learning to Remember, Learn, and Forget in Attention-Based Models

author.name: Djohan Bonnet, Jamie Lohoff, Jan Finkbeiner, Elidona Skhikerujah, Emre Neftci

entry.summary: Proposes Palimpsa, a self-attention model that views in-context learning as continual learning with Bayesian metaplasticity, showing various gated linear attention models emerge as special cases.

entry.title: LARV: Data-Free Layer-wise Adaptive Rescaling Veneer for Model Merging
