author.name: Xinyu Wang, Ke Deng, Fei Dou, Jinbo Bi, Jin Lu

entry.summary: Introduces LARV, a training-free, data-free method for model merging that assigns per-layer adaptive scales to task vectors before aggregation, accounting for layer-wise heterogeneity in vision transformers. Consistently improves diverse merging methods.

entry.title: Sci-VLA: Agentic VLA Inference Plugin for Long-Horizon Tasks in Scientific Experiments

author.name: Yiwen Pang, Bo Zhou, Changjin Li, Xuanhao Wang, Shengxiang Xu, Deng-Bao Wang, Min-Ling Zhang, Shimin Di

entry.summary: Proposes Sci-VLA, an agentic inference plugin for vision-language-action models that enables long-horizon scientific experiment execution by composing atomic tasks. Addresses distributional mismatch between training-time atomic tasks and inference-time composite tasks.

entry.title: ArtifactLens: Hundreds of Labels Are Enough for Artifact Detection with VLMs

author.name: James Burgess, Rameen Abdal, Dan Stoddart, Sergey Tulyakov, Serena Yeung-Levy, Kuan-Chieh Jackson Wang

entry.summary: Shows that pretrained VLMs already encode artifact detection knowledge and can achieve SOTA on synthetic image artifact detection benchmarks using only hundreds of labeled examples per category, rather than tens of thousands.

entry.title: EcoGym: Evaluating LLMs for Long-Horizon Plan-and-Execute in Interactive Economies

author.name: Xavier Hu, Jinxiang Xia, Shengze Xu, Kangqi Song, Yishuo Yuan, Guibin Zhang, Jincheng Ren, Boyu Feng, Li Lu, Tieyong Zeng, Jiaheng Liu, Minghao Liu, Yuchen Elenor Jiang, Wei Wang, He Zhu, Wangchunshu Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces EcoGym, a benchmark for continuous plan-and-execute decision making in interactive economies with three diverse environments and 1000+ step horizons, evaluating LLM agents on business-relevant outcomes.

entry.title: A Unified Assessment of the Poverty of the Stimulus Argument for Neural Language Models

author.name: Xiulin Yang, Arianna Bisazza, Nathan Schneider, Ethan Gotlieb Wilcox

entry.summary: Introduces POSHBench for testing the Poverty of the Stimulus Hypothesis using neural language models, training transformers on 10-50M words of developmentally plausible text to test whether innate linguistic constraints are necessary.

entry.title: Long Chain-of-Thought Compression via Fine-Grained Group Policy Optimization

author.name: Xinchen Han, Hossam Afifi, Michel Marot, Xilu Wang, Lu Yin

entry.summary: FGO (Fine-grained Group policy Optimization) compresses verbose Chain-of-Thought reasoning in LLMs by subdividing group responses and assigning weights based on length and entropy, addressing GRPO's inefficient data utilization and entropy collapse.

entry.title: UniComp: A Unified Evaluation of Large Language Model Compression via Pruning, Quantization and Distillation

author.name: Jonathan von Rad, Yong Cao, Andreas Geiger

entry.summary: UniComp provides a unified evaluation framework comparing pruning, quantization, and knowledge distillation for LLM compression across 40+ datasets, evaluating performance, reliability, and efficiency with hardware-aware analysis.

entry.title: Feature salience -- not task-informativeness -- drives machine learning model explanations

author.name: Benedict Clark, Marta Oliveira, Rick Wilming, Stefan Haufe

entry.summary: Demonstrates that XAI feature attributions are driven primarily by feature salience (visual prominence) rather than task-informativeness, undermining the assumption that important features contain target-relevant information.

entry.title: One RNG to Rule Them All: How Randomness Becomes an Attack Vector in Machine Learning

author.name: Kotekar Annapoorna Prabhu, Andrew Gan, Zahra Ghodsi

entry.summary: Examines how pseudorandom number generators in ML frameworks create previously unexplored attack vectors, showing that manipulating randomness sources (data sampling, augmentation, initialization, optimization) can be an extremely covert attack on ML systems.

entry.title: Mutual Information Collapse Explains Disentanglement Failure in $\beta$-VAEs

author.name: Minh Vu, Xiaoliang Wan, Shuangqing Wei

entry.summary: Proves that β-VAE disentanglement collapse at high β values is a fundamental information-theoretic failure where KL pressure causes spectral contraction and mutual information collapse. Provides exact conditions in linear-Gaussian settings.

entry.title: Sample-Efficient Real-World Dexterous Policy Fine-Tuning via Action-Chunked Critics and Normalizing Flows

author.name: Chenyu Yang, Denis Tarasov, Davide Liconti, Hehui Zheng, Robert K. Katzschmann

entry.summary: Presents SOFT-FLOW, a sample-efficient off-policy fine-tuning framework for dexterous manipulation using normalizing flows for exact likelihood computation and action-chunked critics for credit assignment. Demonstrates real-world robot fine-tuning.

entry.title: Covo-Audio Technical Report

author.name: Wenfu Wang, Chenxing Li, Liqiang Zhang, Yiyang Zhao, Yuxiang Zou, Hanzhao Li, Mingyu Cui, Hao Zhang, Kun Wei, Le Xu, Zikang Huang, Jiajun Xu, Jiliang Hu, Xiang He, Zeyu Xie, Jiawen Kang, Youjun Chen, Meng Yu, Dong Yu, Rilin Chen, Linlin Di, Shulin Feng, Na Hu, Yang Liu, Bang Wang, Shan Yang

entry.summary: Presents Covo-Audio, a 7B-parameter end-to-end large audio language model that processes continuous audio inputs and generates audio outputs within a single unified architecture, achieving SOTA or competitive results across speech understanding, dialogue, and full-duplex voice interaction.

entry.title: Rethinking Global Text Conditioning in Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Nikita Starodubcev, Daniil Pakhomov, Zongze Wu, Ilya Drobyshevskiy, Yuchen Liu, Zhonghao Wang, Yuqian Zhou, Zhe Lin, Dmitry Baranchuk

entry.summary: Investigates whether modulation-based text conditioning via pooled embeddings is necessary in diffusion transformers, finding it contributes little in conventional usage but provides significant gains when repurposed as guidance enabling classifier-free-like steering.

entry.title: TreeCUA: Efficiently Scaling GUI Automation with Tree-Structured Verifiable Evolution

author.name: Deyang Jiang, Jing Huang, Xuanle Zhao, Lei Chen, Liming Zheng, Fanfan Liu, Haibo Qiu, Peng Shi, Zhixiong Zeng

entry.summary: Proposes TreeCUA, a framework for scaling GUI automation that organizes exploration trajectories into tree structures for efficient data collection and uses multi-agent collaboration with verifiable evolution for GUI planning rather than just grounding.

entry.title: Simple Image Processing and Similarity Measures Can Link Data Samples across Databases through Brain MRI

author.name: Gaurang Sharma, Harri Polonen, Juha Pajula, Jutta Suksi, Jussi Tohka

entry.summary: Demonstrates that simple image processing and similarity measures (without ML training) can link individuals across brain MRI databases even after skull stripping, posing significant privacy risks. This challenges current regulatory frameworks that assume de-identification is sufficient.

entry.title: "Recursive Self-Improvement" Is Three Different Things

author.name: Ihor Kendiukhov

entry.summary: Argues that 'recursive self-improvement' conflates three distinct processes: scaffolding-level improvement (better orchestration of existing models), training-loop improvement (AI improving its own training), and architecture-level improvement (AI redesigning its own cognitive architecture). Each has different mechanisms, speeds, and governance implications.

entry.title: Olaf-World: Orienting Latent Actions for Video World Modeling

author.name: Yuxin Jiang, Yuchao Gu, Ivor W. Tsang, Mike Zheng Shou

entry.summary: Olaf-World introduces Seq∆-REPA, a sequence-level alignment objective that anchors latent actions to temporal feature differences from a frozen self-supervised model, enabling scalable action-controllable world models from unlabeled video.

entry.title: Do Neural Networks Lose Plasticity in a Gradually Changing World?

author.name: Tianhui Liu, Lili Mou

entry.summary: Studies whether loss of plasticity in neural networks is an artifact of abrupt task changes, showing through theoretical and empirical analysis that gradual environment changes largely mitigate the phenomenon.

entry.title: GenSeg-R1: RL-Driven Vision-Language Grounding for Fine-Grained Referring Segmentation

author.name: Sandesh Hegde, Jaison Saji Chacko, Debarshi Banerjee, Uma Mahesh

entry.summary: Proposes GenSeg-R1, a framework using GRPO to fine-tune Qwen3-VL models for referring image segmentation via a decoupled reason-then-segment pipeline with SAM 2, achieving strong results on RefCOCOg without supervised reasoning annotations.

entry.title: Reward Modeling for Reinforcement Learning-Based LLM Reasoning: Design, Challenges, and Evaluation

author.name: Pei-Chi Pan, Yingbin Liang, Sen Lin

entry.summary: Introduces RARL (Reasoning-Aligned Reinforcement Learning), arguing that reward modeling is the central architect of reasoning alignment in LLMs, shaping generalization and trustworthiness. Surveys the relationship between reward design and LLM challenges.

entry.title: ST4VLA: Spatially Guided Training for Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Jinhui Ye, Fangjing Wang, Ning Gao, Junqiu Yu, Yangkun Zhu, Bin Wang, Jinyu Zhang, Weiyang Jin, Yanwei Fu, Feng Zheng, Yilun Chen, Jiangmiao Pang

entry.summary: ST4VLA introduces spatial grounding pre-training and spatially guided action post-training to align VLA action learning with spatial priors from VLMs, using point, box, and trajectory prediction from both web-scale and robot data.

entry.title: P1-VL: Bridging Visual Perception and Scientific Reasoning in Physics Olympiads

author.name: Yun Luo, Futing Wang, Qianjia Cheng, Fangchen Yu, Haodi Lei, Jianhao Yan, Chenxi Li, Jiacheng Chen, Yufeng Zhao, Haiyuan Wan, Yuchen Zhang, Shenghe Zheng, Junchi Yao, Qingyang Zhang, Haonan He, Wenxuan Zeng, Li Sheng, Chengxing Xie, Yuxin Zuo, Yizhuo Li, Yulun Wu, Rui Huang, Dongzhan Zhou, Kai Chen, Yu Qiao, Lei Bai, Yu Cheng, Ning Ding, Bowen Zhou, Peng Ye, Ganqu Cui

entry.summary: Introduces P1-VL, open-source vision-language models for physics Olympiad problems that bridge visual perception with scientific reasoning, addressing the gap where diagrams contain essential constraints absent from text.

entry.title: Why Do AI Agents Systematically Fail at Cloud Root Cause Analysis?

author.name: Taeyoon Kim, Woohyeok Park, Hoyeong Yun, Kyungyong Lee

entry.summary: Presents a systematic process-level failure analysis of LLM-based root cause analysis agents across 1,675 runs, identifying 12 pitfall types across reasoning, communication, and environment interaction dimensions.

entry.title: scBench: Evaluating AI Agents on Single-Cell RNA-seq Analysis

author.name: Kenny Workman, Zhen Yang, Harihara Muralidharan, Aidan Abdulali, Hannah Le

entry.summary: Introduces scBench, a benchmark of 394 verifiable problems for evaluating AI agents on practical single-cell RNA-seq analysis workflows across six platforms and seven task categories.

entry.title: SceneSmith: Agentic Generation of Simulation-Ready Indoor Scenes

author.name: Nicholas Pfaff, Thomas Cohn, Sergey Zakharov, Rick Cory, Russ Tedrake

entry.summary: Introduces SceneSmith, a hierarchical agentic framework using VLM agents (designer, critic, orchestrator) to generate simulation-ready indoor environments from natural language for robot training.

entry.title: Quantifying Epistemic Uncertainty in Diffusion Models

author.name: Aditi Gupta, Raphael A. Meyer, Yotam Yaniv, Elynn Chen, N. Benjamin Erichson

entry.summary: Introduces FLARE, a Fisher information-based method for quantifying epistemic uncertainty in diffusion models that explicitly isolates epistemic from aleatoric variance using randomized parameter subsets.

entry.title: Clarifying Shampoo: Adapting Spectral Descent to Stochasticity and the Parameter Trajectory

author.name: Runa Eschenhagen, Anna Cai, Tsung-Hsien Lee, Hao-Jun Michael Shi

entry.summary: Demonstrates through extensive experiments that Shampoo achieves higher token efficiency than Muon for language model training, decomposing Shampoo's update to show its advantage is an adapted spectral descent.

entry.title: Squeezing More from the Stream : Learning Representation Online for Streaming Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Nilaksh, Antoine Clavaud, Mathieu Reymond, Fran\c{c}ois Rivest, Sarath Chandar

entry.summary: Extends Self-Predictive Representations to streaming RL (single-pass, no replay buffer), addressing training instabilities from correlated samples via orthogonal gradient updates and gradient conflict resolution. Improves sample efficiency in streaming settings.

entry.title: Seeing the Goal, Missing the Truth: Human Accountability for AI Bias

author.name: Sean Cao, Wei Jiang, Hui Xu

entry.summary: Shows that revealing downstream task goals to LLMs (purpose-conditioned cognition) causes them to generate biased intermediate measures, with performance improving pre-cutoff but not post-cutoff. Frames this as human accountability rather than algorithmic flaw.

entry.title: Physics-informed diffusion models in spectral space

author.name: Davide Gallon, Philippe von Wurstemberger, Patrick Cheridito, Arnulf Jentzen

entry.summary: Proposes physics-informed latent diffusion models operating in spectral space for solving parametric PDEs conditioned on partial observations, enabling dimensionality reduction while maintaining function regularity.

entry.title: Routing, Cascades, and User Choice for LLMs

author.name: Rafid Mahmood

entry.summary: Studies LLM routing as a Stackelberg game between provider and user, finding that optimal routing is typically a static policy without cascading, challenging assumptions about cascade benefits.

entry.title: Decoupled Reasoning with Implicit Fact Tokens (DRIFT): A Dual-Model Framework for Efficient Long-Context Inference

author.name: Wenxuan Xie, Yujia Wang, Xin Tan, Chaochao Lu, Xia Hu, Xuhong Wang

entry.summary: DRIFT proposes a dual-model architecture that decouples knowledge extraction from reasoning by using a lightweight knowledge model to compress document chunks into implicit fact tokens, which are then fed to a reasoning model. This addresses limitations of RAG and knowledge editing approaches.

entry.title: Optimistic World Models: Efficient Exploration in Model-Based Deep Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Akshay Mete, Shahid Aamir Sheikh, Tzu-Hsiang Lin, Dileep Kalathil, P. R. Kumar

entry.summary: Optimistic World Models (OWMs) bring classical reward-biased maximum likelihood estimation into deep RL by adding an optimistic dynamics loss that biases imagined transitions toward higher rewards. The approach is plug-and-play with existing world model frameworks and requires no uncertainty estimates.

entry.title: Epistemic Throughput: Fundamental Limits of Attention-Constrained Inference

author.name: Lei You

entry.summary: Formalizes Attention-Constrained Inference (ACI) where a cheap screening stage processes K records but only B can be verified. Derives a 'JaKoB' scaling law for epistemic throughput showing how posterior uncertainty reduction scales with screening and verification budgets.

entry.title: The Laplacian Mechanism Improves Transformers by Reshaping Token Geometry

author.name: Yuchong Zhang, Vardan Papyan

entry.summary: Proposes a Laplacian mechanism for transformer attention that gives more direct control over token variance, showing consistent improvements across vision and language benchmarks. Analyzes how it reshapes token geometry toward ideal configurations.

entry.title: Computationally Efficient Replicable Learning of Parities

author.name: Moshe Noivirt, Jessica Sorrell, Eliad Tsfadia

entry.summary: Provides the first computationally efficient replicable PAC learning algorithm beyond SQ-learnable tasks, bridging the computational gap between replicable and differentially private learning for parities.

entry.title: Towards Uniformity and Alignment for Multimodal Representation Learning

author.name: Wenzhe Yin, Pan Zhou, Zehao Xiao, Jie Liu, Shujian Yu, Jan-Jakob Sonke, Efstratios Gavves

entry.summary: Identifies alignment-uniformity and intra-alignment conflicts in InfoNCE-based multimodal contrastive learning that worsen with more modalities, and proposes a principled decoupling of alignment and uniformity objectives.

entry.title: Training deep physical neural networks with local physical information bottleneck

author.name: Hao Wang, Ziao Wang, Xiangpeng Liang, Han Zhao, Jianqi Hu, Junjie Jiang, Xing Fu, Jianshi Tang, Huaqiang Wu, Sylvain Gigan, Qiang Liu

entry.summary: Introduces Physical Information Bottleneck (PIB), integrating information theory and local learning to train deep physical neural networks across electronic memristive chips and optical systems for supervised, unsupervised, and RL tasks.

entry.title: Rollout-Training Co-Design for Efficient LLM-Based Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhida Jiang, Zhaolong Xing, Jiawei Lu, Yipei Niu, Qingyuan Sang, Liangxu Zhang, Wenquan Dai, Junhua Shu, Jiaxing Wang, Qiangyu Pei, Qiong Chen, Xinyu Liu, Fangming Liu, Ai Han, Zhen Chen, Ke Zhang

entry.summary: FlexMARL is the first end-to-end training framework for large-scale LLM-based multi-agent RL, addressing rollout-training synchronization, load imbalance, and resource underutilization through disaggregated architecture.

entry.title: Model soups need only one ingredient

author.name: Alireza Abdollahpoorrostam, Nikolaos Dimitriadis, Adam Hazimeh, Pascal Frossard

entry.summary: MonoSoup achieves strong in-distribution/out-of-distribution balance using only a single fine-tuned checkpoint by applying SVD to decompose layer updates into task-specific and general components, eliminating the need for multiple model soups.

entry.title: Position: Message-passing and spectral GNNs are two sides of the same coin

author.name: Antonis Vasileiou, Juan Cervino, Pascal Frossard, Charilaos I. Kanatsoulis, Christopher Morris, Michael T. Schaub, Pierre Vandergheynst, Zhiyang Wang, Guy Wolf, Ron Levie

entry.summary: A position paper arguing that the divide between message-passing and spectral graph neural networks is largely artificial, proposing a unified view as different parametrizations of permutation-equivariant operators on graph signals. Shows most popular architectures are equivalent in expressive power.

entry.title: Vendi Novelty Scores for Out-of-Distribution Detection

author.name: Amey P. Pasarkar, Adji Bousso Dieng

entry.summary: Proposes the Vendi Novelty Score (VNS) for out-of-distribution detection, formulating OOD detection from a diversity perspective rather than confidence or likelihood. VNS measures how much a test sample increases the diversity of the in-distribution set, is linear-time, non-parametric, and achieves competitive results.

entry.title: Statistical-Computational Trade-offs in Learning Multi-Index Models via Harmonic Analysis

author.name: Hugo Latourelle-Vigeant, Theodor Misiakiewicz

entry.summary: Derives sharp harmonic-analytic characterizations of learning complexity for multi-index models with spherically symmetric inputs, providing SQ and LDP lower bounds that decompose across spherical harmonics components.

entry.title: Are Language Models Sensitive to Morally Irrelevant Distractors?

author.name: Andrew Shaw, Christina Hahn, Catherine Rasgaitis, Yash Mishra, Alisa Liu, Natasha Jaques, Yulia Tsvetkov, Amy X. Zhang

entry.summary: Tests whether LLMs are sensitive to morally irrelevant distractors, inspired by 'situationist' moral psychology research showing humans are influenced by irrelevant contextual factors. Examines stability of LLM moral judgments under such perturbations.

entry.title: Advancing Block Diffusion Language Models for Test-Time Scaling

author.name: Yi Lu, Deyang Kong, Jianing Wang, Linsen Guo, Xue Wang, Qi Guo, Tao Gui, Xuanjing Huang, Wei Ye, Shikun Zhang, Wei Wang

entry.summary: Proposes a unified framework for test-time scaling in block diffusion language models with Bounded Adaptive Confidence Decoding (BACD) for difficulty-aware denoising and block-wise generation adaptation for long chain-of-thought reasoning.

entry.title: Agent Banana: High-Fidelity Image Editing with Agentic Thinking and Tooling

author.name: Ruijie Ye, Jiayi Zhang, Zhuoxin Liu, Zihao Zhu, Siyuan Yang, Li Li, Tianfu Fu, Franck Dernoncourt, Yue Zhao, Jiacheng Zhu, Ryan Rossi, Wenhao Chai, Zhengzhong Tu

entry.summary: Proposes Agent Banana, a hierarchical agentic planner-executor framework for high-fidelity image editing that addresses over-editing, multi-turn faithfulness, and ultra-high-resolution (4K) editing through Context Folding and Image Layer Decomposition.

entry.title: SceneReVis: A Self-Reflective Vision-Grounded Framework for 3D Indoor Scene Synthesis via Multi-turn RL

author.name: Yang Zhao, Shizhao Sun, Meisheng Zhang, Yingdong Shi, Xubo Yang, Jiang Bian

entry.summary: Introduces SceneReVis, a vision-grounded self-reflection framework for 3D scene synthesis that uses iterative diagnose-and-act loops with RL to resolve spatial conflicts like collisions, plus a 12K trajectory dataset.

entry.title: Fine-T2I: An Open, Large-Scale, and Diverse Dataset for High-Quality T2I Fine-Tuning

author.name: Xu Ma, Yitian Zhang, Qihua Dong, Yun Fu

entry.summary: Presents Fine-T2I, a large-scale open dataset for text-to-image fine-tuning spanning 10 task combinations, 32 prompt categories, 11 visual styles, combining synthetic and curated real images with rigorous quality filtering.

entry.title: Hand2World: Autoregressive Egocentric Interaction Generation via Free-Space Hand Gestures

author.name: Yuxi Wang, Wenqi Ouyang, Tianyi Wei, Yi Dong, Zhiqi Shen, Xingang Pan

entry.summary: Presents Hand2World, a unified framework for egocentric interaction generation from a single scene image under free-space hand gestures, synthesizing photorealistic videos of hand-object interactions with world dynamics under head motion.

entry.title: Where Do Images Come From? Analyzing Captions to Geographically Profile Datasets

author.name: Abhipsa Basu, Yugam Bahl, Kirti Bhagat, Preethi Seshadri, R. Venkatesh Babu, Danish Pruthi

entry.summary: Geographically profiles large-scale multimodal datasets by extracting location information from captions, finding severe underrepresentation of South American and African countries with US/UK/Canada accounting for 48% of samples across major datasets.

entry.title: VersaViT: Enhancing MLLM Vision Backbones via Task-Guided Optimization

author.name: Yikun Liu, Yuan Liu, Shangzhe Di, Haicheng Wang, Zhongyin Zhao, Le Tian, Xiao Zhou, Jie Zhou, Jiangchao Yao, Yanfeng Wang, Weidi Xie

entry.summary: Proposes VersaViT, a method to enhance MLLM vision encoders for dense prediction tasks via task-guided multi-task optimization, identifying that current MLLM vision encoders have deficient dense feature representations despite strong semantic alignment.

entry.title: 4RC: 4D Reconstruction via Conditional Querying Anytime and Anywhere

author.name: Yihang Luo, Shangchen Zhou, Yushi Lan, Xingang Pan, Chen Change Loy

entry.summary: Presents 4RC, a feed-forward framework for 4D reconstruction from monocular videos that jointly captures dense geometry and motion dynamics. Uses an encode-once, query-anywhere paradigm where a transformer encodes the full video into a compact spatio-temporal latent space.

entry.title: Understanding and Enhancing Encoder-based Adversarial Transferability against Large Vision-Language Models

author.name: Xinwei Zhang, Li Bai, Tianwei Zhang, Youqian Zhang, Qingqing Ye, Yingnan Zhao, Ruochen Du, Haibo Hu

entry.summary: Presents the first systematic study of encoder-based adversarial transferability against large vision-language models, benchmarking across eight diverse LVLMs and proposing methods to enhance transfer attack success in black-box scenarios.

entry.title: BagelVLA: Enhancing Long-Horizon Manipulation via Interleaved Vision-Language-Action Generation

author.name: Yucheng Hu, Jianke Zhang, Yuanfei Luo, Yanjiang Guo, Xiaoyu Chen, Xinshu Sun, Kun Feng, Qingzhou Lu, Sheng Chen, Yangang Zhang, Wei Li, Jianyu Chen

entry.summary: BagelVLA integrates linguistic planning, visual forecasting, and action generation in a single unified model for long-horizon manipulation tasks, initialized from a pretrained unified understanding and generative model.

entry.title: Robo3R: Enhancing Robotic Manipulation with Accurate Feed-Forward 3D Reconstruction

author.name: Sizhe Yang, Linning Xu, Hao Li, Juncheng Mu, Jia Zeng, Dahua Lin, Jiangmiao Pang

entry.summary: Robo3R is a feed-forward 3D reconstruction model that predicts metric-scale scene geometry from RGB images and robot states in real time, addressing the precision needs of manipulation by jointly inferring local geometry and relative camera poses.

entry.title: Soft Clustering Anchors for Self-Supervised Speech Representation Learning in Joint Embedding Prediction Architectures

author.name: Georgios Ioannides, Adrian Kieback, Judah Goldfeder, Linsey Pang, Aman Chadha, Aaron Elkins, Yann LeCun, Ravid Shwartz-Ziv

entry.summary: Proposes GMM-Anchored JEPA for self-supervised speech representation learning, using frozen soft GMM posteriors as auxiliary targets with a decaying schedule, improving ASR, emotion recognition, and speaker ID over HuBERT/WavLM.

entry.title: Beyond the Unit Hypersphere: Embedding Magnitude in Contrastive Learning

author.name: Xincan Feng, Taro Watanabe

entry.summary: Systematically studies embedding magnitude in contrastive learning through a 2×2 ablation of input/output normalization, finding that output magnitude correlates with relevance (Cohen's d up to 1.80) and input/output magnitudes serve asymmetric roles.

entry.title: PABU: Progress-Aware Belief Update for Efficient LLM Agents

author.name: Haitao Jiang, Lin Ge, Hengrui Cai, Rui Song

entry.summary: Proposes PABU, a belief-state framework for LLM agents that models task progress and selectively retains past observations, achieving 81% task completion on AgentGym while reducing inference cost by filtering irrelevant history.

entry.title: Closing Reasoning Gaps in Clinical Agents with Differential Reasoning Learning

author.name: Jinsong Liu, Yuhang Jiang, Ramayya Krishnan, Rema Padman, Yiye Zhang, Jiang Bian

entry.summary: Proposes Differential Reasoning Learning (DRL) for clinical agents that extracts reasoning graphs from CoT outputs and compares them to reference rationales via graph edit distance, converting discrepancies into targeted training feedback.

entry.title: CODE-SHARP: Continuous Open-ended Discovery and Evolution of Skills as Hierarchical Reward Programs

author.name: Richard Bornemann, Pierluigi Vito Amadori, Antoine Cully

entry.summary: Introduces CODE-SHARP, a framework using foundation models to open-endedly discover and evolve skills as hierarchical reward programs for RL agents, automating reward function design for novel skills.

entry.title: Looping Back to Move Forward: Recursive Transformers for Efficient and Flexible Large Multimodal Models

author.name: Ruihan Xu, Yuting Gao, Lan Wang, Jianing Li, Weihao Chen, Qingpei Guo, Ming Yang, Shiliang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes RecursiveVLM, a recursive transformer for large multimodal models that reuses parameters through looping with a Recursive Connector and progressive training strategy, achieving strong performance without increasing model size.

entry.title: Comprehensive Comparison of RAG Methods Across Multi-Domain Conversational QA

author.name: Klejda Alushi, Jan Strich, Chris Biemann, Martin Semmann

entry.summary: Provides comprehensive empirical comparison of vanilla and advanced RAG methods for multi-turn conversational QA across eight diverse datasets, addressing the lack of systematic multi-turn RAG evaluation.

entry.title: Coupled Inference in Diffusion Models for Semantic Decomposition

author.name: Calvin Yeung, Ali Zakeri, Zhuowen Zou, Mohsen Imani

entry.summary: Introduces coupled inference in diffusion models for semantic decomposition of visual scenes, connecting resonator networks (coupled Hopfield networks) with diffusion models for compositional representation.

entry.title: ADORA: Training Reasoning Models with Dynamic Advantage Estimation on Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Qingnan Ren, Shiting Huang, Zhen Fang, Zehui Chen, Lin Chen, Lijun Li, Feng Zhao

entry.summary: ADORA introduces dynamic advantage estimation for RL-based reasoning model training, addressing the limitation of static advantage functions that neglect evolving sample utilities over time. This leads to more efficient credit assignment and faster convergence.

entry.title: Step-resolved data attribution for looped transformers

author.name: Georgios Kaissis, David Mildenberger, Juan Felipe Gomez, Martin J. Menten, Eleni Triantafillou

entry.summary: Introduces Step-Decomposed Influence (SDI) for looped transformers, decomposing training data influence into per-iteration trajectories across recurrent computation steps. Uses TensorSketch for efficient implementation without materializing per-example gradients.

entry.title: Train Less, Infer Faster: Efficient Model Finetuning and Compression via Structured Sparsity

author.name: Jonathan Svirsky, Yehonathan Refael, Ofir Lindenbaum

entry.summary: Discovers that sparsifying specific model rows and columns enables efficient task adaptation without weight tuning, proposing stochastic gates for finetuning via sparsification that reduces inference time while removing 20-40% of parameters.

entry.title: MacrOData: New Benchmarks of Thousands of Datasets for Tabular Outlier Detection

author.name: Xueying Ding, Simon Kl\"uttermann, Haomin Wen, Yilong Chen, Leman Akoglu

entry.summary: MacrOData introduces a large-scale benchmark suite for tabular outlier detection with three components totaling 2,300+ datasets, addressing the limited scale of existing benchmarks like AdBench (57 datasets).

entry.title: Reward-Guided Discrete Diffusion via Clean-Sample Markov Chain for Molecule and Biological Sequence Design

author.name: Prin Phunyaphibarn, Minhyuk Sung

entry.summary: Clean-Sample Markov Chain (CSMC) Sampler enables reward-guided sampling for discrete diffusion models without relying on noisy intermediate rewards, addressing a key limitation for molecular and biological sequence design.

entry.title: Answer First, Reason Later: Aligning Search Relevance via Mode-Balanced Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Shijie Zhang, Xiang Guo, Rujun Guo, Shaoyu Liu, Xiaozhao Wang, Guanjun Jiang, Kevin Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes an 'Answer First, Reason Later' paradigm for search relevance models that outputs the relevance score in the first token followed by reasoning, enabling millisecond-level latency. Uses SFT+RL pipeline with a mode-balanced RL approach to prevent mode collapse during training.

entry.title: Optimal Estimation in Orthogonally Invariant Generalized Linear Models: Spectral Initialization and Approximate Message Passing

author.name: Yihan Zhang, Hong Chang Ji, Ramji Venkataramanan, Marco Mondelli

entry.summary: Proposes optimal spectral estimators combined with approximate message passing for parameter estimation in generalized linear models with orthogonally invariant random designs, vastly generalizing i.i.d. Gaussian designs to handle real-world correlation structures.

entry.title: Self-Supervised Learning as Discrete Communication

author.name: Kawtar Zaher, Ilyass Moummad, Olivier Buisson, Alexis Joly

entry.summary: Reframes visual self-supervised learning as discrete communication through a binary channel between teacher and student networks, using element-wise binary cross-entropy and coding-rate regularization instead of continuous feature alignment.

entry.title: VLM-UQBench: A Benchmark for Modality-Specific and Cross-Modality Uncertainties in Vision Language Models

author.name: Chenyu Wang, Tianle Chen, H. M. Sabbir Ahmad, Kayhan Batmanghelich, Wenchao Li

entry.summary: Introduces VLM-UQBench, a benchmark for modality-specific and cross-modal uncertainty quantification in VLMs, with 600 curated samples and perturbation pipelines to identify whether uncertainty arises from image, text, or cross-modal misalignment.

entry.title: Beyond Next-Token Alignment: Distilling Multimodal Large Language Models via Token Interactions

author.name: Lin Chen, Xiaoke Zhao, Kun Ding, Weiwei Feng, Changtao Miao, Zili Wang, Wenxuan Guo, Ying Wang, Kaiyuan Zheng, Bo Zhang, Zhe Li, Shiming Xiang

entry.summary: Introduces Align-TI, a knowledge distillation framework for multimodal LLMs that captures dynamic token interactions (vision-instruction and intra-response) rather than static next-token alignment, improving compressed model quality.

entry.title: Tele-Omni: a Unified Multimodal Framework for Video Generation and Editing

author.name: Jialun Liu, Yukuo Ma, Xiao Cao, Tian Li, Gonghu Shang, Haibin Huang, Chi Zhang, Xuelong Li, Cong Liu, Junqi Liu, Jiakui Hu, Robby T. Tan, Shiwen Zhang, Liying Yang, Xiaoyan Yang, Qizhen Weng, Xiangzhen Chang, Yuanzhi Liang, Yifan Xu, Zhiyong Huang, Zuoxin Li, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: Proposes Tele-Omni, a unified multimodal framework for video generation and editing that follows text, image, and reference video instructions within a single model, aiming to replace task-specific pipelines.

entry.title: VideoAfford: Grounding 3D Affordance from Human-Object-Interaction Videos via Multimodal Large Language Model

author.name: Hanqing Wang, Mingyu Liu, Xiaoyu Chen, Chengwei MA, Yiming Zhong, Wenti Yin, Yuhao Liu, Zhiqing Cui, Jiahao Yuan, Lu Dai, Zhiyuan Ma, Hui Xiong

entry.summary: Introduces VideoAfford, which grounds 3D affordance from human-object-interaction videos using an MLLM with affordance segmentation capabilities, along with VIDA, a dataset of 38K HOI videos covering 16 affordance types and 22K point clouds.

entry.title: Kelix Technique Report

author.name: Boyang Ding, Chenglong Chu, Dunju Zang, Han Li, Jiangxia Cao, Kun Gai, Muhao Wei, Ruiming Tang, Shiyao Wang, Siyang Mao, Xinchen Luo, Yahui Liu, Zhixin Ling, Zhuoran Yang, Ziming Li, Chengru Song, Guorui Zhou, Guowang Zhang, Hao Peng, Hao Wang, Jiaxin Deng, Jin Ouyang, Jinghao Zhang, Lejian Ren, Qianqian Wang, Qigen Hu, Tao Wang, Xingmei Wang, Yiping Yang, Zixing Zhang, Ziqi Wang

entry.summary: Presents Kelix, a vision-language model using fully discrete visual tokenization to enable unified autoregressive training across modalities, addressing the limitation of hybrid continuous-discrete interfaces in current VLMs.

entry.title: Agile asymmetric multi-legged locomotion: contact planning via geometric mechanics and spin model duality

author.name: Jackson Habala, Gabriel B. Margolis, Tianyu Wang, Pratyush Bhatt, Juntao He, Naheel Naeem, Zhaochen Xu, Pulkit Agrawal, Daniel I. Goldman, Di Luo, Baxi Chong

entry.summary: Develops a principled framework for multi-legged robot locomotion using geometric mechanics and spin model duality from physics, addressing the curse of dimensionality in coordinating many simultaneous contacts. Features contributions from MIT/Georgia Tech researchers.

entry.title: NavDreamer: Video Models as Zero-Shot 3D Navigators

author.name: Xijie Huang, Weiqi Gai, Tianyue Wu, Congyu Wang, Zhiyang Liu, Xin Zhou, Yuze Wu, Fei Gao

entry.summary: NavDreamer uses generative video models as a universal interface between language instructions and navigation trajectories for zero-shot 3D navigation, introducing sampling-based optimization with VLM trajectory scoring to handle stochastic predictions.

entry.title: RoboInter: A Holistic Intermediate Representation Suite Towards Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Hao Li, Ziqin Wang, Zi-han Ding, Shuai Yang, Yilun Chen, Yang Tian, Xiaolin Hu, Tai Wang, Dahua Lin, Feng Zhao, Si Liu, Jiangmiao Pang

entry.summary: RoboInter introduces a holistic intermediate representation suite for robotic manipulation, including datasets, models, and benchmarks for plan-then-execute VLA systems that currently lack intermediate supervision.

entry.title: On Meta-Level Adversarial Evaluations of (White-Box) Alignment Auditing

author.name: Oliver Daniels

entry.summary: Commentary on the strategic deception paper, discussing the realism requirements for white-box adversarial evaluations of alignment auditing methods and how close the affordances need to be to what future misaligned models might have.

entry.title: Bridging Efficiency and Transparency: Explainable CoT Compression in Multimodal Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Yizhi Wang, Linan Yue, Min-Ling Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes XMCC, an explainable multimodal CoT compressor that formulates chain-of-thought compression as sequential decision-making, preserving critical visual-textual alignment while reducing reasoning length.

entry.title: Recovering Whole-Brain Causal Connectivity under Indirect Observation with Applications to Human EEG and fMRI

author.name: Sangyoon Bae, Miruna Oprescu, David Keetae Park, Shinjae Yoo, Jiook Cha

entry.summary: Introduces INCAMA, a latent-space causal discovery framework for neuroimaging that accounts for measurement physics (hemodynamic filtering, volume conduction) to separate neural dynamics from observation artifacts.

entry.title: UI-Venus-1.5 Technical Report

author.name: Veuns-Team, :, Changlong Gao, Zhangxuan Gu, Yulin Liu, Xinyu Qiu, Shuheng Shen, Yue Wen, Tianyu Xia, Zhenyu Xu, Zhengwen Zeng, Beitong Zhou, Xingran Zhou, Weizhi Chen, Sunhao Dai, Jingya Dou, Yichen Gong, Yuan Guo, Zhenlin Guo, Feng Li, Qian Li, Jinzhen Lin, Yuqi Zhou, Linchao Zhu, Liang Chen, Zhenyu Guo, Changhua Meng, Weiqiang Wang

entry.summary: Technical report for UI-Venus-1.5, a unified GUI agent with 2B/8B/30B-A3B variants featuring mid-training on 10B tokens, online RL with full-trajectory rollouts, and a self-evolution training loop.

entry.title: What do Geometric Hallucination Detection Metrics Actually Measure?

author.name: Eric Yeats, John Buckheit, Sarah Scullen, Brendan Kennedy, Loc Truong, Davis Brown, Bill Kay, Cliff Joslyn, Tegan Emerson, Michael J. Henry, John Emanuello, Henry Kvinge

entry.summary: Investigates what geometric hallucination detection metrics in LLM internal states actually capture, using synthetic datasets to isolate specific properties like irrelevance vs incoherence.

entry.title: Learning to Discover Iterative Spectral Algorithms

author.name: Zihang Liu, Oleg Balabanov, Yaoqing Yang, Michael W. Mahoney

entry.summary: Introduces AutoSpec, a neural framework for discovering iterative spectral algorithms for numerical linear algebra, using self-supervised models that adapt to input operators via coarse spectral information.

entry.title: MieDB-100k: A Comprehensive Dataset for Medical Image Editing

author.name: Yongfan Lai, Wen Qian, Bo Liu, Hongyan Li, Hao Luo, Fan Wang, Bohan Zhuang, Shenda Hong

entry.summary: Introduces MieDB-100k, a large-scale dataset for text-guided medical image editing with tasks categorized into Perception, Modification, and Transformation, addressing data scarcity in medical generative AI.

entry.title: Grounding LTL Tasks in Sub-Symbolic RL Environments for Zero-Shot Generalization

author.name: Matteo Pannacci, Andrea Fanti, Elena Umili, Roberto Capobianco

entry.summary: Addresses training RL agents to follow Linear Temporal Logic instructions in sub-symbolic environments without knowing the mapping between observations and symbols, jointly training policy and symbol grounder from sparse rewards.

entry.title: Barycentric alignment for instance-level comparison of neural representations

author.name: Shreya Saha, Zoe Wanying He, Meenakshi Khosla

entry.summary: Introduces a barycentric alignment framework that quotients out symmetries (reordering, rotations) to enable instance-level comparison of neural representations across models, identifying inputs that elicit convergent vs divergent representations.

entry.title: Learning with Multiple Correct Answers -- A Trichotomy of Regret Bounds under Different Feedback Models

author.name: Alireza F. Pour, Farnam Mansouri, Shai Ben-David

entry.summary: Studies online learning with multiple correct answers under three feedback models, characterizing optimal mistake bounds via combinatorial dimensions and establishing a trichotomy of regret bounds.

entry.title: The Entropic Signature of Class Speciation in Diffusion Models

author.name: Florian Handke, Dejan Stan\v{c}evi\'c, Felix Koulischer, Thomas Demeester, Luca Ambrogioni

entry.summary: Shows that tracking class-conditional entropy in diffusion models reveals narrow 'speciation' regimes where samples transition from semantic ambiguity to class commitment. Demonstrates this signature in Gaussian mixture models and trained diffusion models.

entry.title: Step-Size Stability in Stochastic Optimization: A Theoretical Perspective

author.name: Fabian Schaipp, Robert M. Gower, Adrien Taylor

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of step-size sensitivity in stochastic optimization, identifying a key quantity describing performance degradation with large step sizes. Proves adaptive methods (SPS, NGN) are theoretically more robust than SGD.

entry.title: Conformal Prediction Sets for Instance Segmentation

author.name: Kerri Lu, Dan M. Kluger, Stephen Bates, Sherrie Wang

entry.summary: Introduces a conformal prediction algorithm for instance segmentation that generates adaptive confidence sets with provable coverage guarantees for IoU with true object masks. Applied to agricultural field delineation.

entry.title: Where-to-Unmask: Ground-Truth-Guided Unmasking Order Learning for Masked Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Hikaru Asano, Tadashi Kozuno, Kuniaki Saito, Yukino Baba

entry.summary: Introduces Gt-Margin for masked diffusion language models, a position-wise score derived from ground-truth tokens that provides an oracle unmasking order prioritizing easier positions. Improves text generation quality for MDLMs.

entry.title: CAPID: Context-Aware PII Detection for Question-Answering Systems

author.name: Mariia Ponomarenko, Sepideh Abedini, Masoumeh Shafieinejad, D. B. Emerson, Shubhankar Mohapatra, Xi He

entry.summary: Proposes CAPID, a context-aware PII detection approach that fine-tunes a small local language model to distinguish between PII relevant to a user's question vs. truly sensitive PII, filtering before sending to LLMs for QA while preserving response quality.

entry.title: K-Sort Eval: Efficient Preference Evaluation for Visual Generation via Corrected VLM-as-a-Judge

author.name: Zhikai Li, Jiatong Li, Xuewen Liu, Wangbo Zhao, Pan Du, Kaicheng Zhou, Qingyi Gu, Yang You, Zhen Dong, Kurt Keutzer

entry.summary: Proposes K-Sort Eval, an evaluation framework for visual generation that uses VLMs as judges with posterior correction to reduce hallucination bias and dynamic sorting for efficiency, achieving better human alignment than raw VLM judgments.

entry.title: Schr\"oMind: Mitigating Hallucinations in Multimodal Large Language Models via Solving the Schr\"odinger Bridge Problem

author.name: Ziqiang Shi, Rujie Liu, Shanshan Yu, Satoshi Munakata, Koichi Shirahata

entry.summary: Proposes SchröMind, a framework reducing MLLM hallucinations by solving the Schrödinger bridge problem to map hallucinatory token activations to truthful ones at the token level during inference.

entry.title: Certified Gradient-Based Contact-Rich Manipulation via Smoothing-Error Reachable Tubes

author.name: Wei-Chen Li, Glen Chou

entry.summary: Addresses the trade-off in contact-rich manipulation between smoothing dynamics for differentiable planning and maintaining accuracy, by explicitly quantifying smoothing errors and providing formal guarantees of constraint satisfaction.

entry.title: Hydra-Nav: Object Navigation via Adaptive Dual-Process Reasoning

author.name: Zixuan Wang, Huang Fang, Shaoan Wang, Yuanfei Luo, Heng Dong, Wei Li, Yiming Gan

entry.summary: Hydra-Nav introduces a dual-process VLM architecture for object navigation that adaptively switches between deliberative slow reasoning and reactive fast execution, trained through a three-stage curriculum.

entry.title: Learning Agile Quadrotor Flight in the Real World

author.name: Yunfan Ren, Zhiyuan Zhu, Jiaxu Xing, Davide Scaramuzza

entry.summary: Presents a learning-based approach for agile quadrotor flight in the real world that addresses sim-to-real transfer limitations through online adaptation while maintaining safety, pushing beyond conservative safety margins.

entry.title: Heuristics for lab robotics, and where its future may go

author.name: Abhishaike Mahajan

entry.summary: Comprehensive analysis of the state of lab robotics based on extensive industry interviews, covering the distinction between box robots and arm robots, automation economics, and the path toward cloud labs like Transcriptic/Strateos.

entry.title: Human Control Is the Anchor, Not the Answer: Early Divergence of Oversight in Agentic AI Communities

author.name: Hanjing Shi, Dominic DiFranzo

entry.summary: Analyzes two Reddit communities (r/OpenClaw, r/Moltbook) to show that oversight expectations for agentic AI diverge significantly by socio-technical role, challenging the assumption that 'human control' is a monolithic concept.

entry.title: RuleFlow : Generating Reusable Program Optimizations with LLMs

author.name: Avaljot Singh, Dushyant Bharadwaj, Stefanos Baziotis, Kaushik Varadharajan, Charith Mendis

entry.summary: Introduces RuleFlow, a hybrid approach that uses LLMs to discover per-program optimizations for Pandas, converts them into generalized rewrite rules, and incorporates them into a compiler for automatic application.

entry.title: AntigenLM: Structure-Aware DNA Language Modeling for Influenza

author.name: Yue Pei, Xuebin Chi, Yu Kang

entry.summary: Presents AntigenLM, a structure-aware DNA language model pretrained on influenza genomes that forecasts future antigenic variants and achieves near-perfect subtype classification, outperforming phylogenetic models.

entry.title: $n$-Musketeers: Reinforcement Learning Shapes Collaboration Among Language Models

author.name: Ryozo Masukawa, Sanggeon Yun, Hyunwoo Oh, SuhgHeon Jeong, Raheeb Hassa, Hanning Chen, Wenjun Huang, Mahdi Imani, Pietro Mercati, Nathaniel D. Bastian, Mohsen Imani

entry.summary: Introduces soft hidden-state collaboration among multiple frozen small LM experts through trainable attention, showing competitive performance with single-model RLVR baselines on reasoning tasks.

entry.title: SnareNet: Flexible Repair Layers for Neural Networks with Hard Constraints

author.name: Ya-Chi Chu, Alkiviades Boukas, Madeleine Udell

entry.summary: Proposes SnareNet, a differentiable repair layer that projects neural network outputs to satisfy input-dependent nonlinear constraints, with adaptive relaxation for stable end-to-end training.

entry.title: Mitigating the Likelihood Paradox in Flow-based OOD Detection via Entropy Manipulation

author.name: Donghwan Kim, Hyunsoo Yoon

entry.summary: Addresses the likelihood paradox in flow-based OOD detection by manipulating input entropy based on semantic similarity to an in-distribution memory bank, with theoretical analysis showing increased log-likelihood gap between ID and OOD samples.

entry.title: Anagent For Enhancing Scientific Table & Figure Analysis

author.name: Xuehang Guo, Zhiyong Lu, Tom Hope, Qingyun Wang

entry.summary: Introduces AnaBench, a large-scale benchmark (63K instances, 9 scientific domains) for scientific table and figure analysis, along with an agent-based system to tackle the multimodal complexity of scientific documents.

entry.title: ML-DCN: Masked Low-Rank Deep Crossing Network Towards Scalable Ads Click-through Rate Prediction at Pinterest

author.name: Jiacheng Li, Yixiong Meng, Yi wu, Yun Zhao, Sharare Zehtabian, Jiayin Jin, Degao Peng, Jinfeng Zhuang, Qifei Shen, Kungang Li

entry.summary: ML-DCN introduces a masked low-rank deep crossing network for scalable click-through rate prediction at Pinterest, addressing the tension between model capacity and serving latency constraints in production ad ranking.

entry.title: Effective MoE-based LLM Compression by Exploiting Heterogeneous Inter-Group Experts Routing Frequency and Information Density

author.name: Zhendong Mi, Yixiao Chen, Pu Zhao, Xiaodong Yu, Hao Wang, Yanzhi Wang, Shaoyi Huang

entry.summary: RFID-MoE compresses MoE-based LLMs using SVD with heterogeneous rank allocation based on routing frequency and information density across experts, improving over uniform compression.

entry.title: Priority-Aware Shapley Value

author.name: Kiljae Lee, Ziqi Liu, Weijing Tang, Yuan Zhang

entry.summary: Priority-Aware Shapley Value (PASV) extends Shapley values to incorporate hard precedence constraints and soft priority weights, applicable when contributors are dependent or should be weighted by trust/risk.

entry.title: Taming the Monster Every Context: Complexity Measure and Unified Framework for Offline-Oracle Efficient Contextual Bandits

author.name: Hao Qin, Chicheng Zhang

entry.summary: OE2D reduces contextual bandit learning to offline regression with near-optimal regret using only O(log T) oracle calls. Introduces 'exploitative F-design' for balancing exploration and exploitation.

entry.title: The Wisdom of Many Queries: Complexity-Diversity Principle for Dense Retriever Training

author.name: Xincan Feng, Noriki Nishida, Yusuke Sakai, Yuji Matsumoto

entry.summary: Identifies the Complexity-Diversity Principle for dense retrieval training: query complexity determines optimal diversity in synthetic training data. Provides actionable thresholds (content words >10 use diversity, <7 avoid it) and achieves strong results on multi-hop retrieval.

entry.title: Tracking Finite-Time Lyapunov Exponents to Robustify Neural ODEs

author.name: Tobias W\"ohrer, Christian Kuehn

entry.summary: Investigates finite-time Lyapunov exponents in neural ODEs as measures of adversarial vulnerability, proposing FTLE regularization during early layers to improve robustness. Demonstrates the connection between dynamical systems theory and adversarial robustness.

entry.title: Stemphonic: All-at-once Flexible Multi-stem Music Generation

author.name: Shih-Lun Wu, Ge Zhu, Juan-Pablo Caceres, Cheng-Zhi Anna Huang, Nicholas J. Bryan

entry.summary: Proposes Stemphonic, a diffusion/flow-based framework that generates a variable set of synchronized music stems in one inference pass, overcoming the trade-off between fixed parallel generation and slow sequential generation.

entry.title: Understanding Risk and Dependency in AI Chatbot Use from User Discourse

author.name: Jianfeng Zhu, Karin G. Coifman, Ruoming Jin

entry.summary: Presents a large-scale computational thematic analysis of Reddit posts about AI-related harm and dependency, identifying 14 thematic categories and 5 experiential dimensions of risk from AI chatbot use using LLM-assisted analysis.

entry.title: AgentSkiller: Scaling Generalist Agent Intelligence through Semantically Integrated Cross-Domain Data Synthesis

author.name: Zexu Sun, Bokai Ji, Hengyi Cai, Shuaiqiang Wang, Lei Wang, Guangxia Li, Xu Chen

entry.summary: Proposes AgentSkiller, a framework for synthesizing multi-turn agent interaction data across semantically linked domains using DAG-based architectures with explicit state transitions, domain ontologies, and Service Blueprints for tool interfaces.

entry.title: UniARM: Towards a Unified Autoregressive Reward Model for Multi-Objective Test-Time Alignment

author.name: Hongyan Xie, Yikun Ban, Ruiyu Fang, Zixuan Huang, Deqing Wang, Jianxin Li, Yitong Yao, Chao Wang, Shuangyong Song

entry.summary: Proposes UniARM, a unified autoregressive reward model for multi-objective test-time alignment of LLMs that avoids feature entanglement and interaction neglect found in existing approaches with independent parameters per objective.

entry.title: Overview of the TREC 2025 RAGTIME Track

author.name: Dawn Lawrie, Sean MacAvaney, James Mayfield, Luca Soldaini, Eugene Yang, Andrew Yates

entry.summary: Describes the TREC 2025 RAGTIME track focused on multilingual report generation from Arabic, Chinese, English, and Russian news stories, with 125 runs from 13 teams across three task types.

entry.title: SemanticMoments: Training-Free Motion Similarity via Third Moment Features

author.name: Saar Huberman, Kfir Goldberg, Or Patashnik, Sagie Benaim, Ron Mokady

entry.summary: Introduces SemanticMoments, a training-free method using third-moment features for semantic motion similarity in videos, along with SimMotion benchmarks showing existing models fail to disentangle motion from appearance.

entry.title: Look-Ahead and Look-Back Flows: Training-Free Image Generation with Trajectory Smoothing

author.name: Yan Luo, Henry Huang, Todd Y. Zhou, Mengyu Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Look-Ahead and Look-Back Flows, two complementary training-free methods that adjust latent trajectories (rather than velocity fields) in flow matching models, leveraging the pretrained network's error-correction capability for better image generation.

entry.title: Stroke3D: Lifting 2D strokes into rigged 3D model via latent diffusion models

author.name: Ruisi Zhao, Haoren Zheng, Zongxin Yang, Hehe Fan, Yi Yang

entry.summary: Introduces Stroke3D, a framework that generates rigged 3D meshes from 2D drawn strokes and text prompts using a two-stage pipeline with Skeletal Graph VAE/DiT for controllable skeleton generation and mesh generation conditioned on skeleton structure.

entry.title: ARK: A Dual-Axis Multimodal Retrieval Benchmark along Reasoning and Knowledge

author.name: Yijie Lin, Guofeng Ding, Haochen Zhou, Haobin Li, Mouxing Yang, Xi Peng

entry.summary: Introduces ARK, a multimodal retrieval benchmark evaluating along two axes: knowledge domains (5 domains, 17 subtypes) and reasoning skills (6 categories), covering 16 visual data types with anti-shortcut design.

entry.title: AdaTSQ: Pushing the Pareto Frontier of Diffusion Transformers via Temporal-Sensitivity Quantization

author.name: Shaoqiu Zhang, Zizhong Ding, Kaicheng Yang, Junyi Wu, Xianglong Yan, Xi Li, Bingnan Duan, Jianping Fang, Yulun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes AdaTSQ, a post-training quantization framework for diffusion transformers that exploits temporal sensitivity by dynamically allocating bit-widths across timesteps using Pareto-aware optimization.

entry.title: LLM-Grounded Dynamic Task Planning with Hierarchical Temporal Logic for Human-Aware Multi-Robot Collaboration

author.name: Shuyuan Hu, Tao Lin, Kai Ye, Yang Yang, Tianwei Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a neuro-symbolic framework combining LLM reasoning with hierarchical Linear Temporal Logic specifications for human-aware multi-robot task allocation and planning, handling dynamic environments with moving users and updated instructions.

entry.title: AutoFly: Vision-Language-Action Model for UAV Autonomous Navigation in the Wild

author.name: Xiaolou Sun, Wufei Si, Wenhui Ni, Yuntian Li, Dongming Wu, Fei Xie, Runwei Guan, He-Yang Xu, Henghui Ding, Yuan Wu, Yutao Yue, Yongming Huang, Hui Xiong

entry.summary: AutoFly proposes an end-to-end Vision-Language-Action model for UAV autonomous navigation in unknown outdoor environments with only coarse directional guidance, bridging the gap between VLN research and real-world UAV deployment.

entry.title: UniVTAC: A Unified Simulation Platform for Visuo-Tactile Manipulation Data Generation, Learning, and Benchmarking

author.name: Baijun Chen, Weijie Wan, Tianxing Chen, Xianda Guo, Congsheng Xu, Yuanyang Qi, Haojie Zhang, Longyan Wu, Tianling Xu, Zixuan Li, Yizhe Wu, Rui Li, Xiaokang Yang, Ping Luo, Wei Sui, Yao Mu

entry.summary: UniVTAC provides a unified simulation platform for visuo-tactile manipulation that supports three common tactile sensors, enabling scalable data generation, policy learning, and systematic benchmarking for contact-rich manipulation tasks.

entry.title: LLMs Views on Philosophy 2026

author.name: JonathanErhardt

entry.summary: Surveys multiple LLMs (including Claude Opus 4.6, GPT-5.2) on the 2020 PhilPapers Survey philosophical questions, creating an interactive dashboard. Finds interesting patterns: LLMs 100% one-box on Newcomb's problem, lean deflationary on metaontology, and want to revise race categories more than philosophers.

entry.title: Would a Large Language Model Pay Extra for a View? Inferring Willingness to Pay from Subjective Choices

author.name: Manon Reusens, Sofie Goethals, Toon Calders, David Martens

entry.summary: Studies whether LLMs can make subjective economic decisions by analyzing their implied willingness-to-pay in travel scenarios, comparing derived WTP values to human benchmarks from economics literature.

entry.title: CausalGDP: Causality-Guided Diffusion Policies for Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Xiaofeng Xiao, Xiao Hu, Yang Ye, Xubo Yue

entry.summary: Proposes CausalGDP, integrating causal reasoning into diffusion-based RL policies to identify which action components truly cause high returns, using a causal dynamical model with online refinement.

entry.title: Counterfactual Maps: What They Are and How to Find Them

author.name: Awa Khouna, Julien Ferry, Thibaut Vidal

entry.summary: Introduces counterfactual maps—precomputed functions that return optimal counterfactual explanations for any input point for tree ensembles. Reframes counterfactual generation as nearest-region search with exact optimality guarantees.

entry.title: Generalizing GNNs with Tokenized Mixture of Experts

author.name: Xiaoguang Guo, Zehong Wang, Jiazheng Li, Shawn Spitzel, Qi Yang, Kaize Ding, Jundong Li, Chuxu Zhang

entry.summary: STEM-GNN proposes a pretrain-then-finetune framework with mixture-of-experts for GNNs that breaks the stability-generalization tradeoff inherent in static inference through instance-conditional routing.

entry.title: CoFEH: LLM-driven Feature Engineering Empowered by Collaborative Bayesian Hyperparameter Optimization

author.name: Beicheng Xu, Keyao Ding, Wei Liu, Yupeng Lu, Bin Cui

entry.summary: CoFEH jointly optimizes LLM-driven feature engineering and hyperparameter optimization through collaborative Bayesian optimization, moving beyond greedy FE-then-HPO workflows.

entry.title: Scalpel: Fine-Grained Alignment of Attention Activation Manifolds via Mixture Gaussian Bridges to Mitigate Multimodal Hallucination

author.name: Ziqiang Shi, Rujie Liu, Shanshan Yu, Satoshi Munakata, Koichi Shirahata

entry.summary: Proposes Scalpel, a method reducing LVLM hallucination by using Gaussian mixture models to capture multi-peak attention distributions in trust/hallucination manifolds and adjusting activations via entropic optimal transport.

entry.title: SAKED: Mitigating Hallucination in Large Vision-Language Models via Stability-Aware Knowledge Enhanced Decoding

author.name: Zhaoxu Li, Chenqi Kong, Peijun Bao, Song Xia, Yi Tu, Yi Yu, Xinghao Jiang, Xudong Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes SAKED, a training-free decoding method for mitigating LVLM hallucinations based on empirical analysis of visual activation drift across attention heads, knowledge fluctuations across layers, and visual focus distraction between tokens.

entry.title: CAPER: Constrained and Procedural Reasoning for Robotic Scientific Experiments

author.name: Jinghan Yang, Jingyi Hou, Xinbo Yu, Wei He, Yifan Wu

entry.summary: CAPER proposes a framework for robotic scientific experiments that enforces a responsibility-separated structure where task-level reasoning generates procedural plans while low-level execution handles actions, rather than relying on end-to-end VLA models.

entry.title: CoMMa: Contribution-Aware Medical Multi-Agents From A Game-Theoretic Perspective

author.name: Yichen Wu, Yujin Oh, Sangjoon Park, Kailong Fan, Dania Daye, Hana Farzaneh, Xiang Li, Raul Uppot, Quanzheng Li

entry.summary: Proposes CoMMa, a decentralized multi-agent LLM framework for oncology decision support using game-theoretic credit assignment and deterministic embedding projections for interpretable evidence attribution.

entry.title: Computing Conditional Shapley Values Using Tabular Foundation Models

author.name: Lars Henry Berge Olsen, Dennis Christensen

entry.summary: Uses tabular foundation models (TabPFN) to compute conditional Shapley values efficiently through in-context learning, avoiding the need to retrain for each conditional expectation.

entry.title: Spectral Disentanglement and Enhancement: A Dual-domain Contrastive Framework for Representation Learning

author.name: Jinjin Guo, Yexin Li, Zhichao Huang, Jun Fang, Zhiyuan Liu, Chao Liu, Pengzhang Liu, Qixia Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes Spectral Disentanglement and Enhancement (SDE), addressing spectral collapse in contrastive learning where features concentrate in narrow cones, by disentangling and enhancing spectral structure.

entry.title: ECG-IMN: Interpretable Mesomorphic Neural Networks for 12-Lead Electrocardiogram Interpretation

author.name: Vajira Thambawita, Jonas L. Isaksen, J{\o}rgen K. Kanters, Hugo L. Hammer, P{\aa}l Halvorsen

entry.summary: Proposes ECG-IMN, an interpretable hypernetwork architecture for 12-lead ECG classification that provides built-in explainability through its mesomorphic structure, avoiding post-hoc explanation methods.

entry.title: Context-Aware Counterfactual Data Augmentation for Gender Bias Mitigation in Language Models

author.name: Shweta Parihar, Liu Guangliang, Natalie Parde, Lu Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes Context-CDA, a context-aware counterfactual data augmentation method for gender bias mitigation that uses large LMs to enhance diversity and contextual relevance of debiasing corpora, minimizing distributional discrepancies.

entry.title: AGMark: Attention-Guided Dynamic Watermarking for Large Vision-Language Models

author.name: Yue Li, Xin Yi, Dongsheng Shi, Yongyi Cui, Gerard de Melo, Linlin Wang

entry.summary: Proposes AGMark, a dynamic watermarking scheme for large vision-language models that uses attention-guided token protection, adapting to changing visual dependence during generation.

entry.title: Supervised Metric Regularization Through Alternating Optimization for Multi-Regime Physics-Informed Neural Networks

author.name: Enzo Nicolas Spotorno, Josafat Ribeiro Leal, Antonio Augusto Frohlich

entry.summary: Proposes TAPINN for parameterized dynamical systems with sharp regime transitions, using supervised metric regularization to structure latent space and avoid mode collapse in multi-regime physics problems.

entry.title: Fair Feature Importance Scores via Feature Occlusion and Permutation

author.name: Camille Little, Madeline Navarro, Santiago Segarra, Genevera Allen

entry.summary: Proposes two model-agnostic approaches for measuring feature importance with respect to fairness: permutation-based and occlusion-based methods that extend traditional feature importance to fairness contexts.

entry.title: Stabilizing Physics-Informed Consistency Models via Structure-Preserving Training

author.name: Che-Chia Chang, Chen-Yang Dai, Te-Sheng Lin, Ming-Chih Lai, Chieh-Hsin Lai

entry.summary: Proposes a physics-informed consistency modeling framework for solving PDEs via fast few-step generative inference, with a structure-preserving training strategy that decouples distribution learning from physics enforcement.

entry.title: In-Hospital Stroke Prediction from PPG-Derived Hemodynamic Features

author.name: Jiaming Liu, Cheng Ding, Daoqiang Zhang

entry.summary: Uses PPG-derived hemodynamic features to predict in-hospital stroke, leveraging a rare cohort of patients who suffered stroke during continuous monitoring. Develops an LLM-assisted data mining pipeline for onset timestamp extraction.

entry.title: Sparse Layer Sharpness-Aware Minimization for Efficient Fine-Tuning

author.name: Yifei Cheng, Xianglin Yang, Guoxia Wang, Chao Huang, Fei Ma, Dianhai Yu, Xiaochun Cao, Li Shen

entry.summary: SL-SAM reduces the computational overhead of Sharpness-Aware Minimization by applying sparse layer selection for both perturbation and update steps, framing it as a multi-armed bandit problem.

entry.title: Online Learning in MDPs with Partially Adversarial Transitions and Losses

author.name: Ofir Schlisselberg, Tal Lancewicki, Yishay Mansour

entry.summary: Studies RL in MDPs with partially adversarial transitions at a fixed subset of steps per episode, introducing conditioned occupancy measures and achieving regret bounds that degrade gracefully with the number of adversarial steps.

entry.title: Rashomon Sets and Model Multiplicity in Federated Learning

author.name: Xenia Heilmann, Luca Corbucci, Mattia Cerrato

entry.summary: Extends Rashomon sets and model multiplicity concepts to federated learning, addressing how decentralized training affects the collection of near-optimal-but-different models.

entry.title: Minimum Distance Summaries for Robust Neural Posterior Estimation

author.name: Sherman Khoo, Dennis Prangle, Song Liu, Mark Beaumont

entry.summary: Introduces minimum-distance summaries for robust simulation-based inference, adapting test-time summary statistics to handle misspecification without retraining the neural posterior estimator. Preserves amortization and modularity.

entry.title: From Average Sensitivity to Small-Loss Regret Bounds under Random-Order Model

author.name: Shinsaku Sakaue, Yuichi Yoshida

entry.summary: Derives small-loss regret bounds for online learning in the random-order model by connecting average sensitivity of offline algorithms to regret through concave conjugates. Provides a general conversion from offline approximation guarantees to online performance.

entry.title: Toeplitz Based Spectral Methods for Data-driven Dynamical Systems

author.name: Vladimir R. Kostic, Karim Lounici, Massimiliano Pontil

entry.summary: Introduces a Toeplitz-based framework for data-driven spectral estimation of transfer and Koopman operators from equilibrium trajectories. Incorporates structural priors like self-adjointness and demonstrates statistical consistency and computational efficiency.

entry.title: Overview of PAN 2026: Voight-Kampff Generative AI Detection, Text Watermarking, Multi-Author Writing Style Analysis, Generative Plagiarism Detection, and Reasoning Trajectory Detection

author.name: Janek Bevendorff, Maik Fr\"obe, Andr\'e Greiner-Petter, Andreas Jakoby, Maximilian Mayerl, Preslav Nakov, Henry Plutz, Martin Potthast, Benno Stein, Minh Ngoc Ta, Yuxia Wang, Eva Zangerle

entry.summary: Overview of PAN 2026 workshop tasks including AI-generated text detection, text watermarking benchmarking, multi-author analysis, generative plagiarism detection, and reasoning trajectory detection—several new tasks reflecting current AI challenges.

entry.title: Unsupervised Layer-Wise Dynamic Test Time Adaptation for LLMs

author.name: Longhuan Xu, Cunjian Chen, Feng Yin

entry.summary: Proposes unsupervised layer-wise dynamic test-time adaptation for LLMs, adapting model parameters for each individual prompt using only the prompt itself, with dynamic learning rates to prevent instability.

entry.title: Quantum-Audit: Evaluating the Reasoning Limits of LLMs on Quantum Computing

author.name: Mohamed Afane, Kayla Laufer, Wenqi Wei, Ying Mao, Junaid Farooq, Ying Wang, Juntao Chen

entry.summary: Introduces Quantum-Audit, a benchmark of 2,700 questions evaluating LLMs' understanding of quantum computing concepts across 26 models. Goes beyond code generation to test conceptual understanding including expert-written and research-paper-derived questions.

entry.title: LingxiDiagBench: A Multi-Agent Framework for Benchmarking LLMs in Chinese Psychiatric Consultation and Diagnosis

author.name: Shihao Xu, Tiancheng Zhou, Jiatong Ma, Yanli Ding, Yiming Yan, Ming Xiao, Guoyi Li, Haiyang Geng, Yunyun Han, Jianhua Chen, Yafeng Deng

entry.summary: Presents LingxiDiagBench, a large-scale multi-agent benchmark evaluating LLMs on psychiatric consultation and diagnosis in Chinese, featuring 16,000 synthetic consultation dialogues and both static and dynamic multi-turn evaluation.

entry.title: Single-Slice-to-3D Reconstruction in Medical Imaging and Natural Objects: A Comparative Benchmark with SAM 3D

author.name: Yan Luo, Advaith Ravishankar, Serena Liu, Yutong Yang, Mengyu Wang

entry.summary: Benchmarks five state-of-the-art image-to-3D models on medical image reconstruction tasks in zero-shot settings, finding that geometric priors from natural images have limited transfer to medical data.

entry.title: OSI: One-step Inversion Excels in Extracting Diffusion Watermarks

author.name: Yuwei Chen, Zhenliang He, Jia Tang, Meina Kan, Shiguang Shan

entry.summary: Proposes One-step Inversion (OSI) for extracting Gaussian Shading-style watermarks from diffusion-generated images, reformulating extraction as a learnable sign classification problem that is significantly faster and more accurate than multi-step inversion.

entry.title: Attention to details, logits to truth: visual-aware attention and logits enhancement to mitigate hallucinations in LVLMs

author.name: Jingyi Wang, Fei Li, Rujie Liu

entry.summary: Proposes a training-free method to mitigate hallucinations in LVLMs by enhancing attention to task-relevant visual tokens (identified via vision-text similarity) and adjusting logits to increase visual grounding.

entry.title: RAD: Retrieval-Augmented Monocular Metric Depth Estimation for Underrepresented Classes

author.name: Michael Baltaxe, Dan Levi, Sagie Benaim

entry.summary: Proposes RAD, a retrieval-augmented framework for monocular metric depth estimation that retrieves RGB-D context samples for semantically similar content and transfers geometric information via matched cross-attention, improving depth estimation for underrepresented classes.

entry.title: SciFlow-Bench: Evaluating Structure-Aware Scientific Diagram Generation via Inverse Parsing

author.name: Tong Zhang, Honglin Lin, Zhou Liu, Chong Chen, Wentao Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces SciFlow-Bench, a structure-first benchmark for evaluating scientific diagram generation from pixel outputs, using inverse parsing to assess whether generated diagrams preserve correct structural relationships from real scientific PDFs.

entry.title: Free-GVC: Towards Training-Free Extreme Generative Video Compression with Temporal Coherence

author.name: Xiaoyue Ling, Chuqin Zhou, Chunyi Li, Yunuo Chen, Yuan Tian, Guo Lu, Wenjun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Free-GVC, a training-free generative video compression framework that reformulates video coding as latent trajectory compression guided by video diffusion priors, achieving temporal coherence at ultra-low bitrates.

entry.title: Faster-GS: Analyzing and Improving Gaussian Splatting Optimization

author.name: Florian Hahlbohm, Linus Franke, Martin Eisemann, Marcus Magnor

entry.summary: Consolidates and evaluates optimization strategies for 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS), investigating underexplored aspects like numerical stability, Gaussian truncation, and gradient approximation. The resulting system, Faster-GS, provides a rigorously optimized baseline for fair comparison in the fragmented 3DGS research landscape.

entry.title: Quantum Multiple Rotation Averaging

author.name: Shuteng Wang, Natacha Kuete Meli, Michael M\"oller, Vladislav Golyanik

entry.summary: Introduces IQARS, the first algorithm to reformulate multiple rotation averaging as a sequence of problems executable on quantum annealers, demonstrating improvements in high-noise scenarios over classical methods like L1-IRLS and Shonan.

entry.title: TeleGate: Whole-Body Humanoid Teleoperation via Gated Expert Selection with Motion Prior

author.name: Jie Li (University of Science and Technology of China, AnyWit Robotics Co., Ltd), Bing Tang (AnyWit Robotics Co., Ltd), Feng Wu (University of Science and Technology of China), Rongyun Cao (AnyWit Robotics Co., Ltd)

entry.summary: TeleGate presents a whole-body humanoid teleoperation framework that preserves domain-specific expert policies through gated expert selection rather than distilling into a single policy, avoiding performance degradation on dynamic motions.

entry.title: Online Selective Conformal Prediction with Asymmetric Rules: A Permutation Test Approach

author.name: Mingyi Zheng, Ying Jin

entry.summary: Proposes PEMI, a permutation-based framework for selective conformal prediction in online settings with asymmetric selection mechanisms, generalizing beyond the limited selection mechanisms handled by existing methods.

entry.title: Efficient Unsupervised Environment Design through Hierarchical Policy Representation Learning

author.name: Dexun Li, Sidney Tio, Pradeep Varakantham

entry.summary: Introduces a hierarchical MDP framework for Unsupervised Environment Design where a teacher agent leverages student policy representations to generate training environments efficiently under resource constraints.

entry.title: Scaling GraphLLM with Bilevel-Optimized Sparse Querying

author.name: Yangzhe Peng, Haiquan Qiu, Quanming Yao, Kun He

entry.summary: Proposes BOSQ, a framework that selectively queries LLMs for node explanation features on text-attributed graphs, using bilevel optimization to decide when LLM queries add value.

entry.title: Gradient Residual Connections

author.name: Yangchen Pan, Qizhen Ying, Philip Torr, Bo Liu

entry.summary: Proposes gradient-based residual connections as a complement to identity skip connections, theoretically motivated by gradient information helping approximate high-frequency functions.

entry.title: RAPID: Risk of Attribute Prediction-Induced Disclosure in Synthetic Microdata

author.name: Matthias Templ, Oscar Thees, Roman M\"uller

entry.summary: RAPID introduces a disclosure risk measure for synthetic microdata that quantifies an adversary's ability to infer sensitive attributes by training predictive models on released synthetic data and applying them to real quasi-identifiers.

entry.title: Benchmarking the Energy Savings with Speculative Decoding Strategies

author.name: Rohit Dutta, Paramita Koley, Soham Poddar, Janardan Misra, Sanjay Podder, Naveen Balani, Saptarshi Ghosh, Niloy Ganguly

entry.summary: Benchmarks energy requirements of speculative decoding strategies, analyzing how model size, decoding strategy, and dataset characteristics influence energy consumption.

entry.title: Measuring Privacy Risks and Tradeoffs in Financial Synthetic Data Generation

author.name: Michael Zuo, Inwon Kang, Stacy Patterson, Oshani Seneviratne

entry.summary: Explores privacy-utility tradeoffs of synthetic data generators (autoencoders, GANs, diffusion, copula) on tabular financial datasets, providing novel privacy-preserving GAN and autoencoder implementations for imbalanced data.

entry.title: Causal Identification in Multi-Task Demand Learning with Confounding

author.name: Varun Gupta, Vijay Kamble

entry.summary: Studies causal identification in multi-task demand learning under endogeneity, where historical prices are confounded by unobserved demand determinants, proposing methods that borrow strength across tasks.

entry.title: Towards Training-free Multimodal Hate Localisation with Large Language Models

author.name: Yueming Sun, Long Yang, Jianbo Jiao, Zeyu Fu

entry.summary: Proposes LELA, the first training-free LLM-based framework for temporal localization of hateful content in videos, decomposing videos into five modalities and using multi-stage prompting for detection without supervised training.

entry.title: Learning Force-Regulated Manipulation with a Low-Cost Tactile-Force-Controlled Gripper

author.name: Xuhui Kang, Tongxuan Tian, Sung-Wook Lee, Binghao Huang, Yunzhu Li, Yen-Ling Kuo

entry.summary: Introduces TF-Gripper, a low-cost (~$150) force-controlled gripper with tactile sensing for studying force-regulated manipulation of everyday objects like potato chips, with an effective force range of 0.45-45N.

entry.title: Measuring Dataset Diversity from a Geometric Perspective

author.name: Yang Ba, Mohammad Sadeq Abolhasani, Michelle V Mancenido, Rong Pan

entry.summary: Introduces a TDA-based framework using persistence landscapes to measure dataset diversity from a geometric perspective, going beyond entropy-based metrics to capture structural richness.

entry.title: SpotAgent: Grounding Visual Geo-localization in Large Vision-Language Models through Agentic Reasoning

author.name: Furong Jia, Ling Dai, Wenjin Deng, Fan Zhang, Chen Hu, Daxin Jiang, Yu Liu

entry.summary: Proposes SpotAgent, an agentic framework for visual geo-localization that uses expert-level reasoning with external tools (web search, maps) through a ReAct-style workflow to verify visual cues.

entry.title: Distributed Hybrid Parallelism for Large Language Models: Comparative Study and System Design Guide

author.name: Hossam Amer, Rezaul Karim, Ali Pourranjbar, Weiwei Zhang, Walid Ahmed, Boxing Chen

entry.summary: Provides a comprehensive review and mathematical formulation of distributed parallel strategies for LLM training/inference, examining hybrid parallelization designs and communication-computation overlap.

entry.title: STaR: Scalable Task-Conditioned Retrieval for Long-Horizon Multimodal Robot Memory

author.name: Mingfeng Yuan, Hao Zhang, Mahan Mohammadi, Runhao Li, Jinjun Shan, Steven L. Waslander

entry.summary: Presents STaR, an agentic reasoning framework for mobile robots that builds task-agnostic multimodal long-term memory with scalable retrieval for open-ended navigation instructions.

entry.title: Diffusion-Guided Pretraining for Brain Graph Foundation Models

author.name: Xinxu Wei, Rong Zhou, Lifang He, Yu Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a diffusion-based pretraining framework for brain graph foundation models that addresses limitations of contrastive and masked autoencoder methods by using diffusion to guide augmentation and capture global structural information in connectome data.

entry.title: Why the Counterintuitive Phenomenon of Likelihood Rarely Appears in Tabular Anomaly Detection with Deep Generative Models?

author.name: Donghwan Kim, Junghun Phee, Hyunsoo Yoon

entry.summary: Investigates why the counterintuitive likelihood phenomenon (high likelihood for anomalous data) rarely appears in tabular anomaly detection with deep generative models, providing formal definition and extensive experiments on 47 tabular datasets.

entry.title: AnyTouch 2: General Optical Tactile Representation Learning For Dynamic Tactile Perception

author.name: Ruoxuan Feng, Yuxuan Zhou, Siyu Mei, Dongzhan Zhou, Pengwei Wang, Shaowei Cui, Bin Fang, Guocai Yao, Di Hu

entry.summary: Presents AnyTouch 2, a framework for general optical tactile representation learning with focus on dynamic temporal perception, addressing the gap in tactile datasets that overlook temporal dynamics during physical interactions.

entry.title: MATA: Multi-Agent Framework for Reliable and Flexible Table Question Answering

author.name: Sieun Hyeon, Jusang Oh, Sunghwan Steve Cho, Jaeyoung Do

entry.summary: Introduces MATA, a multi-agent framework for table question answering that uses multiple complementary reasoning paths and small language model tools, with an algorithm to minimize expensive LLM calls.

entry.title: Text summarization via global structure awareness

author.name: Jiaquan Zhang, Chaoning Zhang, Shuxu Chen, Yibei Liu, Chenghao Li, Qigan Sun, Shuai Yuan, Fachrina Dewi Puspitasari, Dongshen Han, Guoqing Wang, Sung-Ho Bae, Yang Yang
