entry.summary: Introduces GloSA-sum, a text summarization approach using topological data analysis (TDA) for global structure awareness, aiming to preserve semantic cores and coherence more efficiently than LLM-based approaches.

entry.title: Unbalanced optimal transport for robust longitudinal lesion evolution with registration-aware and appearance-guided priors

author.name: Melika Qahqaie, Dominik Neumann, Tobias Heimann, Andreas Maier, Veronika A. Zimmer

entry.summary: Proposes a registration-aware matcher using unbalanced optimal transport for tracking lesion evolution in longitudinal CT scans, handling lesion appearance, disappearance, merging, and splitting.

entry.title: Fake-HR1: Rethinking reasoning of vision language model for synthetic image detection

author.name: Changjiang Jiang, Xinkuan Sha, Fengchang Yu, Jingjing Liu, Jian Liu, Mingqi Fang, Chenfeng Zhang, Wei Lu

entry.summary: Fake-HR1 is a hybrid-reasoning model for synthetic image detection that adaptively decides whether Chain-of-Thought reasoning is necessary, reducing computational overhead for obviously generated forgeries while maintaining accuracy on harder cases.

entry.title: Patient foundation model for risk stratification in low-risk overweight patients

author.name: Zachary N. Flamholz, Dillon Tracy, Ripple Khera, Jordan Wolinsky, Nicholas Lee, Nathaniel Tann, Xiao Yin Zhu, Harry Phillips, Jeffrey Sherman

entry.summary: PatientTPP is a neural temporal point process model trained on 500K+ clinical trajectories for patient risk stratification, specifically targeting obesity-associated outcomes. It extends TPP modeling with static/numeric features and clinical knowledge encoding.

entry.title: Faster Rates For Federated Variational Inequalities

author.name: Guanghui Wang, Satyen Kale

entry.summary: Establishes improved convergence rates for federated variational inequalities, showing that Local Extra SGD admits tighter guarantees and proposing a new algorithm to address client drift limitations.

entry.title: Statistical Roughness-Informed Machine Unlearning

author.name: Mohammad Partohaghighi, Roummel Marcia, Bruce J. West, YangQuan Chen

entry.summary: SRAGU proposes a machine unlearning algorithm that uses layer-wise statistical roughness diagnostics to adaptively allocate unlearning updates, preventing catastrophic forgetting during large deletions.

entry.title: LLM-FS: Zero-Shot Feature Selection for Effective and Interpretable Malware Detection

author.name: Naveen Gill, Ajvad Haneef K, Madhu Kumar S D

entry.summary: Investigates whether LLMs can perform zero-shot feature selection for malware detection using only feature names and task descriptions, comparing GPT-5.0, GPT-4.0, Gemini-2.5 etc. against traditional methods.

entry.title: Statistical benchmarking of transformer models in low signal-to-noise time-series forecasting

author.name: Cyril Garcia, Guillaume Remy

entry.summary: Benchmarks transformer architectures for multivariate time series forecasting in low-data regimes with controlled signal-to-noise ratios, showing two-way attention transformers can outperform baselines across settings.

entry.title: How Far Can You Grow? Characterizing the Extrapolation Frontier of Graph Generative Models for Materials Science

author.name: Can Polat, Erchin Serpedin, Mustafa Kurban, Hasan Kurban

entry.summary: Introduces RADII, a benchmark of ~75,000 nanoparticle structures for measuring the 'extrapolation frontier' of graph generative models for materials science—the critical structure size beyond which generation quality degrades.

entry.title: AfriNLLB: Efficient Translation Models for African Languages

author.name: Yasmin Moslem, Aman Kassahun Wassie, Amanuel Gizachew Abebe

entry.summary: Presents AfriNLLB, lightweight translation models for 15 African language pairs created by compressing NLLB-200 600M through iterative layer pruning and quantization, then fine-tuning on curated parallel corpora.

entry.title: Breaking the Pre-Sampling Barrier: Activation-Informed Difficulty-Aware Self-Consistency

author.name: Taewoong Yoon, Geunyeong Jeong, Geon Park, Sihyeong Yeom, Harksoo Kim

entry.summary: Proposes activation-informed difficulty estimation for Self-Consistency decoding that avoids the pre-sampling overhead of Difficulty-Adaptive SC, using model activations to predict problem difficulty before generating samples.

entry.title: TraceMem: Weaving Narrative Memory Schemata from User Conversational Traces

author.name: Yiming Shu, Pei Liu, Tiange Zhang, Ruiyang Gao, Jun Ma, Chen Sun

entry.summary: Proposes TraceMem, a cognitively-inspired memory framework for LLMs that processes conversational traces through short-term processing, synaptic consolidation, and long-term retrieval stages to maintain narrative coherence over extended interactions.

entry.title: LLM Reasoning Predicts When Models Are Right: Evidence from Coding Classroom Discourse

author.name: Bakhtawar Ahtisham, Kirk Vanacore, Zhuqian Zhou, Jinsook Lee, Rene F. Kizilcec

entry.summary: Investigates whether LLM-generated reasoning can predict when the model's own predictions are correct, using 30,300 teacher utterances from classroom dialogue. Finds reasoning text is predictive of label correctness.

entry.title: SCORE: Specificity, Context Utilization, Robustness, and Relevance for Reference-Free LLM Evaluation

author.name: Homaira Huda Shomee, Rochana Chaturvedi, Yangxinyu Xie, Tanwi Mallick

entry.summary: Proposes SCORE, a reference-free evaluation framework for LLM outputs that assesses specificity, context utilization, robustness, and relevance—designed for high-stakes domain-specific settings like natural hazard response where decision-critical details matter.

entry.title: All-in-One Conditioning for Text-to-Image Synthesis

author.name: Hirunima Jayasekara, Chuong Huynh, Yixuan Ren, Christabel Acquaye, Abhinav Shrivastava

entry.summary: Proposes a scene-graph-based approach for text-to-image synthesis that enhances compositional abilities of existing models, moving beyond rigid layout maps to more flexible grounding of multiple objects, attributes, and spatial relationships.

entry.title: Robust Depth Super-Resolution via Adaptive Diffusion Sampling

author.name: Kun Wang, Yun Zhu, Pan Zhou, Na Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes AdaDS, a diffusion-based framework for depth super-resolution that adaptively selects the starting timestep based on estimated degradation severity, exploiting the convergence property of Gaussian smoothing for robust handling of arbitrary degradations.

entry.title: AUHead: Realistic Emotional Talking Head Generation via Action Units Control

author.name: Jiayi Lyu, Leigang Qu, Wenjing Zhang, Hanyu Jiang, Kai Liu, Zhenglin Zhou, Xiaobo Xia, Jian Xue, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Introduces AUHead, a two-stage method for talking head generation that disentangles Action Unit control from audio using large audio-language models with chain-of-thought reasoning, then uses AU-driven diffusion for controllable facial expression generation.

entry.title: Delving into Spectral Clustering with Vision-Language Representations

author.name: Bo Peng, Yuanwei Hu, Bo Liu, Ling Chen, Jie Lu, Zhen Fang

entry.summary: Proposes Neural Tangent Kernel Spectral Clustering that leverages cross-modal alignment in pretrained vision-language models, using positive noun anchors to formulate image affinity as coupling of visual and textual similarity.

entry.title: Reason-IAD: Knowledge-Guided Dynamic Latent Reasoning for Explainable Industrial Anomaly Detection

author.name: Peng Chen, Chao Huang, Yunkang Cao, Chengliang Liu, Wenqiang Wang, Mingbo Yang, Li Shen, Wenqi Ren, Xiaochun Cao

entry.summary: Proposes Reason-IAD, a knowledge-guided dynamic latent reasoning framework for explainable industrial anomaly detection using retrieval-augmented knowledge and entropy-driven latent reasoning in MLLMs.

entry.title: A benchmark for video-based laparoscopic skill analysis and assessment

author.name: Isabel Funke, Sebastian Bodenstedt, Felix von Bechtolsheim, Florian Oehme, Michael Maruschke, Stefanie Herrlich, J\"urgen Weitz, Marius Distler, S\"oren Torge Mees, Stefanie Speidel

entry.summary: Introduces LASANA, a large benchmark of 1,270 stereo video recordings of laparoscopic training tasks with structured skill ratings from three independent raters and binary error labels for surgical skill assessment.

entry.title: Perception with Guarantees: Certified Pose Estimation via Reachability Analysis

author.name: Tobias Ladner, Yasser Shoukry, Matthias Althoff

entry.summary: Presents a certified pose estimation method for safety-critical systems using only camera images and known target geometry, providing formal bounds on pose via reachability analysis. Important for autonomous systems where GPS or other external services may be untrustworthy.

entry.title: Can Image Splicing and Copy-Move Forgery Be Detected by the Same Model? Forensim: An Attention-Based State-Space Approach

author.name: Soumyaroop Nandi, Prem Natarajan

entry.summary: Introduces Forensim, a unified framework using attention-based state-space models for detecting both image splicing and copy-move forgeries, jointly localizing both manipulated and source regions. Addresses the practical need to identify not just what was forged but where content was copied from.

entry.title: Preference Aligned Visuomotor Diffusion Policies for Deformable Object Manipulation

author.name: Marco Moletta, Michael C. Welle, Danica Kragic

entry.summary: Studies preference alignment for visuomotor diffusion policies in deformable object manipulation, introducing RKO, a method combining RPO and KTO frameworks for adapting pretrained policies to user preferences with limited demonstrations.

entry.title: FlyAOC: Evaluating Agentic Ontology Curation of Drosophila Scientific Knowledge Bases

author.name: Xingjian Zhang, Sophia Moylan, Ziyang Xiong, Qiaozhu Mei, Yichen Luo, Jiaqi W. Ma

entry.summary: Introduces FlyBench, a benchmark for evaluating AI agents on end-to-end ontology curation from scientific literature about Drosophila, requiring agents to search papers and produce structured Gene Ontology annotations.

entry.title: Chain of Mindset: Reasoning with Adaptive Cognitive Modes

author.name: Tianyi Jiang, Arctanx An, Hengyi Feng, Naixin Zhai, Haodong Li, Xiaomin Yu, Jiahui Liu, Hanwen Du, Shuo Zhang, Zhi Yang, Jie Huang, Yuhua Li, Yongxin Ni, Huacan Wang, Ronghao Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Chain of Mindset (CoM), a training-free agentic framework that orchestrates different cognitive modes at each reasoning step, arguing that different stages of problem-solving require different cognitive approaches.

entry.title: Persistent Entropy as a Detector of Phase Transitions

author.name: Matteo Rucco

entry.summary: Establishes theoretical conditions under which persistent entropy provably detects phase transitions, providing model-independent sufficient conditions with asymptotically non-vanishing gaps across phases.

entry.title: Enhanced Graph Transformer with Serialized Graph Tokens

author.name: Ruixiang Wang, Yuyang Hong, Shiming Xiang, Chunhong Pan

entry.summary: Proposes a serialized token paradigm for graph transformers that aggregates node signals into serialized graph tokens, improving graph-level representation over single-token approaches.

entry.title: Empowering Contrastive Federated Sequential Recommendation with LLMs

author.name: Thi Minh Chau Nguyen, Minh Hieu Nguyen, Duc Anh Nguyen, Xuan Huong Tran, Thanh Trung Huynh, Quoc Viet Hung Nguyen

entry.summary: Proposes LUMOS, a federated sequential recommendation system that uses on-device LLMs as local semantic generators to augment sparse interaction logs while keeping data decentralized.

entry.title: Accelerating Post-Quantum Cryptography via LLM-Driven Hardware-Software Co-Design

author.name: Yuchao Liao, Tosiron Adegbija, Roman Lysecky

entry.summary: Explores using LLMs to accelerate hardware-software co-design for post-quantum cryptography, specifically the FALCON digital signature scheme on FPGAs. Provides first quantitative comparison between LLM-driven synthesis and conventional HLS approaches.

entry.title: LEMUR: A Corpus for Robust Fine-Tuning of Multilingual Law Embedding Models for Retrieval

author.name: Narges Baba Ahmadi, Jan Strich, Martin Semmann, Chris Biemann

entry.summary: Introduces LEMUR, a large-scale multilingual corpus of EU environmental legislation from 24,953 EUR-Lex documents covering 25 languages, designed for semantic retrieval with domain-adapted embedding models.

entry.title: Resilient Class-Incremental Learning: on the Interplay of Drifting, Unlabelled and Imbalanced Data Streams

author.name: Jin Li, Kleanthis Malialis, Marios Polycarpou

entry.summary: Proposes SCIL framework for streaming class-incremental learning that handles concept drift, class imbalance, label scarcity, and new class emergence simultaneously using autoencoders with dual-loss strategy.

entry.title: ExO-PPO: an Extended Off-policy Proximal Policy Optimization Algorithm

author.name: Hanyong Wang, Menglong Yang

entry.summary: Proposes ExO-PPO, extending PPO with off-policy updates to improve sample efficiency while maintaining training stability, leveraging advantages of both on-policy and off-policy methods.

entry.title: Self-Regulated Reading with AI Support: An Eight-Week Study with Students

author.name: Yue Fu, Joel Wester, Niels Van Berkel, Alexis Hiniker

entry.summary: Eight-week longitudinal study of 15 undergraduates using AI chatbots for academic reading, analyzing 838 prompts across cognitive themes. Finds comprehension prompts dominate (59.6%) and most students use minimum required prompts.

entry.title: Online Monitoring Framework for Automotive Time Series Data using JEPA Embeddings

author.name: Alexander Fertig, Karthikeyan Chandra Sekaran, Lakshman Balasubramanian, Michael Botsch

entry.summary: Proposes a JEPA-based self-supervised monitoring framework for detecting anomalies in autonomous vehicle object state representations without anomaly labels.

entry.title: Weighted Wasserstein Barycenter of Gaussian Processes for exotic Bayesian Optimization tasks

author.name: Antonio Candelieri, Francesco Archetti

entry.summary: Uses weighted Wasserstein Barycenter of Gaussian Processes to unify collaborative/federated BO, batch BO, and multi-fidelity BO under a common framework, requiring only different weighting schemas.

entry.title: Positive-Unlabelled Active Learning to Curate a Dataset for Orca Resident Interpretation

author.name: Bret Nestor, Bohan Yao, Jasmine Moore, Jasper Kanes

entry.summary: Presents the largest curation of Southern Resident Killer Whale acoustic data using positive-unlabelled active learning across 30+ years of hydrophone recordings, with transformer-based detectors outperforming state-of-the-art.

entry.title: Risk-sensitive reinforcement learning using expectiles, shortfall risk and optimized certainty equivalent risk

author.name: Sumedh Gupte, Shrey Rakeshkumar Patel, Soumen Pachal, Prashanth L. A., Sanjay P. Bhat

entry.summary: Derives policy gradient theorems and proposes RL algorithms for three risk measure families (expectiles, shortfall risk, optimized certainty equivalent), establishing convergence rate bounds.

entry.title: Large Language Models for Designing Participatory Budgeting Rules

author.name: Nguyen Thach, Xingchen Sha, Hau Chan

entry.summary: Explores using LLMs for automated design of participatory budgeting rules that balance utility and fairness, leveraging the resemblance between PB rules and knapsack algorithms.

entry.title: Scalable and Reliable State-Aware Inference of High-Impact N-k Contingencies

author.name: Lihao Mai, Chenhan Xiao, Yang Weng

entry.summary: Proposes a conditional diffusion model for scalable N-k contingency assessment in power grids, directly generating high-impact outage scenarios without exhaustive enumeration of the combinatorial space.

entry.title: BRAVA-GNN: Betweenness Ranking Approximation Via Degree MAss Inspired Graph Neural Network

author.name: Justin Dachille, Aurora Rossi, Sunil Kumar Maurya, Frederik Mallmann-Trenn, Xin Liu, Fr\'ed\'eric Giroire, Tsuyoshi Murata, Emanuele Natale

entry.summary: BRAVA-GNN approximates betweenness centrality rankings using multi-hop degree mass as a proxy, enabling generalization to high-diameter graphs like road networks where existing GNN methods fail.

entry.title: Linear Model Extraction via Factual and Counterfactual Queries

author.name: Daan Otto, Jannis Kurtz, Dick den Hertog, Ilker Birbil

entry.summary: Analyzes model extraction attacks on linear models using factual, counterfactual, and robust counterfactual queries. Derives bounds on queries needed for parameter extraction and mathematical formulations for known classification regions.

entry.title: Unsupervised Cross-Lingual Part-of-Speech Tagging with Monolingual Corpora Only

author.name: Jianyu Zheng

entry.summary: Proposes a fully unsupervised cross-lingual POS tagging framework using only monolingual corpora by leveraging unsupervised neural machine translation, eliminating the need for parallel corpora.

entry.title: MEVER: Multi-Modal and Explainable Claim Verification with Graph-based Evidence Retrieval

author.name: Delvin Ce Zhang, Suhan Cui, Zhelin Chu, Xianren Zhang, Dongwon Lee

entry.summary: Proposes MEVER, a model for multi-modal claim verification that jointly performs evidence retrieval, verification, and explanation generation using a two-layer multi-modal graph structure over both textual and visual evidence.

entry.title: QP-OneModel: A Unified Generative LLM for Multi-Task Query Understanding in Xiaohongshu Search

author.name: Jianzhao Huang, Xiaorui Huang, Fei Zhao, Yunpeng Liu, Hui Zhang, Fangcheng Shi, Congfeng Li, Zechen Sun, Yi Wu, Yao Hu, Yunhan Bai, Shaosheng Cao

entry.summary: Presents QP-OneModel, a unified generative LLM for multi-task query understanding deployed at Xiaohongshu search, replacing pipelines of isolated discriminative models with a single model handling query rewriting, expansion, and intent classification.

entry.title: Stability and Concentration in Nonlinear Inverse Problems with Block-Structured Parameters: Lipschitz Geometry, Identifiability, and an Application to Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Joe-Mei Feng, Hsin-Hsiung Kao

entry.summary: Develops theoretical framework for stability and concentration in nonlinear inverse problems with block-structured parameters, with application to Gaussian Splatting, providing algorithm-independent error bounds.

entry.title: CompSplat: Compression-aware 3D Gaussian Splatting for Real-world Video

author.name: Hojun Song, Heejung Choi, Aro Kim, Chae-yeong Song, Gahyeon Kim, Soo Ye Kim, Jaehyup Lee, Sang-hyo Park

entry.summary: Proposes CompSplat, a compression-aware 3D Gaussian Splatting method for novel view synthesis from real-world compressed videos, addressing pose drift and geometric distortion caused by lossy video compression in long sequences.

entry.title: GeoFormer: A Swin Transformer-Based Framework for Scene-Level Building Height and Footprint Estimation from Sentinel Imagery

author.name: Han Jinzhen, JinByeong Lee, JiSung Kim, MinKyung Cho, DaHee Kim, HongSik Yun

entry.summary: Proposes GeoFormer, a Swin Transformer framework that jointly estimates building height and footprint from Sentinel-1/2 imagery with open DEM data, achieving 7.5% improvement over CNN baselines across 54 cities with good cross-continent transfer.

entry.title: ConsID-Gen: View-Consistent and Identity-Preserving Image-to-Video Generation

author.name: Mingyang Wu, Ashirbad Mishra, Soumik Dey, Shuo Xing, Naveen Ravipati, Hansi Wu, Binbin Li, Zhengzhong Tu

entry.summary: Addresses identity preservation in image-to-video generation under changing viewpoints, introducing a large-scale dataset (ConsIDVid) and benchmark along with architectural improvements for cross-modal alignment.

entry.title: Legs Over Arms: On the Predictive Value of Lower-Body Pose for Human Trajectory Prediction from Egocentric Robot Perception

author.name: Nhat Le, Daeun Song, Xuesu Xiao

entry.summary: Studies how different skeletal features (upper vs. lower body, 2D vs. 3D) affect human trajectory prediction from egocentric robot perception. Finds that lower-body 3D keypoints yield 13% improvement in prediction accuracy.

entry.title: Phase-Aware Policy Learning for Skateboard Riding of Quadruped Robots via Feature-wise Linear Modulation

author.name: Minsung Yoon, Jeil Jeong, Sung-Eui Yoon

entry.summary: Introduces Phase-Aware Policy Learning for quadruped robots learning to ride skateboards, using phase-conditioned Feature-wise Linear Modulation to capture phase-dependent behaviors within a unified RL policy.

entry.title: Monday AI Radar #12

author.name: Against Moloch

entry.summary: Weekly AI news roundup discussing the intelligence explosion narrative, recursive self-improvement, and the trajectory of frontier AI development. Highlights concerns about the pace of automation at major AI labs and policy implications.

entry.title: Image Quality in the Era of Artificial Intelligence

author.name: Jana G. Delfino, Jason L. Granstedt, Frank W. Samuelson, Robert Ochs, Krishna Juluru

entry.summary: A position/communication paper raising awareness about limitations of AI-enhanced medical image reconstruction, highlighting the disconnect between perceived image quality and actual information content.

entry.title: Federated Learning for Surgical Vision in Appendicitis Classification: Results of the FedSurg EndoVis 2024 Challenge

author.name: Max Kirchner, Hanna Hoffmann, Alexander C. Jenke, Oliver L. Saldanha, Kevin Pfeiffer, Weam Kanjo, Julia Alekseenko, Claas de Boer, Santhi Raj Kolamuri, Lorenzo Mazza, Nicolas Padoy, Sophia Bano, Annika Reinke, Lena Maier-Hein, Danail Stoyanov, Jakob N. Kather, Fiona R. Kolbinger, Sebastian Bodenstedt, Stefanie Speidel

entry.summary: Reports results from the FedSurg EndoVis 2024 Challenge benchmarking federated learning methods for surgical video classification of appendicitis inflammation stages across multiple clinical centers.

entry.title: DMamba: Decomposition-enhanced Mamba for Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Ruxuan Chen, Fang Sun

entry.summary: Proposes DMamba, decomposing time series into trend and seasonal components with different modeling approaches - lower-dimensional for trends and expressive Mamba-based for seasonal patterns.

entry.title: VLM-Guided Iterative Refinement for Surgical Image Segmentation with Foundation Models

author.name: Ange Lou, Yamin Li, Qi Chang, Nan Xi, Luyuan Xie, Zichao Li, Tianyu Luan

entry.summary: Proposes IR-SIS, an iterative refinement system for surgical image segmentation that uses fine-tuned SAM3 with VLM-guided quality assessment and natural language interaction for clinician-in-the-loop workflows.

entry.title: Administrative Law's Fourth Settlement: AI and the Capability-Accountability Trap

author.name: Nicholas Caputo

entry.summary: Argues that administrative law faces a 'capability-accountability trap' where AI complexity renders agencies opaque to democratic oversight, and proposes AI-assisted mechanisms as a potential solution.

entry.title: TaCo: A Benchmark for Lossless and Lossy Codecs of Heterogeneous Tactile Data

author.name: Zhengxue Cheng, Yan Zhao, Keyu Wang, Hengdi Zhang, Li Song

entry.summary: Introduces TaCo, the first comprehensive benchmark for tactile data compression, evaluating 30 methods across 5 datasets on lossless and lossy compression for robotic applications.

entry.title: Monocular Normal Estimation via Shading Sequence Estimation

author.name: Zongrui Li, Xinhua Ma, Minghui Hu, Yunqing Zhao, Yingchen Yu, Qian Zheng, Chang Liu, Xudong Jiang, Song Bai

entry.summary: Proposes reformulating monocular normal estimation as shading sequence estimation, addressing 3D misalignment issues in existing direct prediction methods.

entry.title: Instruct2Act: From Human Instruction to Actions Sequencing and Execution via Robot Action Network for Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Archit Sharma, Dharmendra Sharma, John Rebeiro, Peeyush Thakur, Narendra Dhar, Laxmidhar Behera

entry.summary: Presents Instruct2Act, a lightweight on-device pipeline converting natural language to robot manipulation actions using BiLSTM-attention for instruction parsing and DATRN with YOLOv8 for trajectory generation.

entry.title: A Collaborative Safety Shield for Safe and Efficient CAV Lane Changes in Congested On-Ramp Merging

author.name: Bharathkumar Hegde, Melanie Bouroche

entry.summary: Proposes Multi-Agent Safety Shield (MASS) using Control Barrier Functions for safe and collaborative lane changes in connected autonomous vehicles, integrated with MARL controllers.

entry.title: From Adam to Adam-Like Lagrangians: Second-Order Nonlocal Dynamics

author.name: Carlos Heredia

entry.summary: Derives a continuous-time formulation of the Adam optimizer as a second-order integro-differential dynamical system, providing Lyapunov stability analysis and an Adam-inspired nonlocal Lagrangian formulation.

entry.title: Boltzmann Reinforcement Learning for Noise resilience in Analog Ising Machines

author.name: Aditya Choudhary, Saaketh Desai, Prasad Iyer

entry.summary: BRAIN introduces a distribution learning framework using variational RL to approximate the Boltzmann distribution on analog Ising machines, achieving noise resilience by aggregating information across multiple noisy measurements.

entry.title: Fully-automated sleep staging: multicenter validation of a generalizable deep neural network for Parkinson's disease and isolated REM sleep behavior disorder

author.name: Jesper Str{\o}m, Casper Skj{\ae}rb{\ae}k, Natasha Becker Bertelsen, Steffen Torpe Simonsen, Niels Okkels, David Bertram, Sinah R\"ottgen, Konstantin Kufer, Kaare B. Mikkelsen, Marit Otto, Poul J{\o}rgen Jennum, Per Borghammer, Michael Sommerauer, Preben Kidmose

entry.summary: Adapts U-Sleep deep neural network for sleep staging in Parkinson's disease and REM sleep behavior disorder, achieving generalizable performance across multiple clinical centers.

entry.title: Windowed SummaryMixing: An Efficient Fine-Tuning of Self-Supervised Learning Models for Low-resource Speech Recognition

author.name: Aditya Srinivas Menon, Kumud Tripathi, Raj Gohil, Pankaj Wasnik

entry.summary: Introduces Windowed SummaryMixing (WSM) that replaces self-attention in SSL speech models with a linear-time alternative incorporating both local and global context summaries. Achieves improved ASR performance with reduced memory in low-resource settings.

entry.title: Life Cycle-Aware Evaluation of Knowledge Distillation for Machine Translation: Environmental Impact and Translation Quality Trade-offs

author.name: Joseph Attieh, Timothee Mickus, Anne-Laure Ligozat, Aur\'elie N\'ev\'eol, J\"org Tiedemann

entry.summary: Evaluates knowledge distillation methods for machine translation considering both translation quality and environmental impact (carbon footprint) using life cycle assessment. Shows computational costs of KD are often overlooked in the literature.

entry.title: Continual Learning for non-stationary regression via Memory-Efficient Replay

author.name: Pablo Garc\'ia-Santaclara, Bruno Fern\'andez-Castro, RebecaP. D\'iaz-Redondo, Mart\'in Alonso-Gamarra

entry.summary: Proposes the first prototype-based generative replay framework for online task-free continual regression, addressing the underexplored area of continual learning for non-stationary regression in Industry 4.0 settings.

entry.title: Effective vocabulary expanding of multilingual language models for extremely low-resource languages

author.name: Jianyu Zheng

entry.summary: Proposes methods to expand multilingual PLMs to previously unsupported low-resource languages through vocabulary expansion with bilingual dictionary-based initialization and continued pre-training.

entry.title: The CLEF-2026 CheckThat! Lab: Advancing Multilingual Fact-Checking

author.name: Julia Maria Stru{\ss}, Sebastian Schellhammer, Stefan Dietze, Venktesh V, Vinay Setty, Tanmoy Chakraborty, Preslav Nakov, Avishek Anand, Primakov Chungkham, Salim Hafid, Dhruv Sahnan, Konstantin Todorov

entry.summary: Overview of CLEF-2026 CheckThat! lab focusing on multilingual fact-checking tasks including source retrieval for scientific claims, fact-checking numerical/temporal claims with reasoning, and low-resource language claim verification.

entry.title: Triggered: A Statistical Analysis of Environmental Influences on Extremist Groups

author.name: Christine de Kock, Eduard Hovy

entry.summary: Analyzes environmental influences on online extremist communities using seven years of data from Stormfront, Incels, and r/News, examining how real-world events, news coverage, and cross-community interactions shape extremist behavior using causal methods.

entry.title: Singpath-VL Technical Report

author.name: Zhen Qiu, Kaiwen Xiao, Zhengwei Lu, Xiangyu Liu, Lei Zhao, Hao Zhang

entry.summary: Presents Singpath-VL, a vision-language model for cervical cytology AI assistance, built using a three-stage pipeline to synthesize million-scale image-description datasets from consensus fusion of multiple MLLM annotators with expert knowledge injection.

entry.title: Time2General: Learning Spatiotemporal Invariant Representations for Domain-Generalization Video Semantic Segmentation

author.name: Siyu Chen, Ting Han, Haoling Huang, Chaolei Wang, Chengzheng Fu, Duxin Zhu, Guorong Cai, Jinhe Su

entry.summary: Proposes Time2General, a domain-generalized video semantic segmentation framework using Stability Queries and Spatio-Temporal Memory Decoder to achieve temporally consistent predictions across unseen driving domains without adaptation.

entry.title: Toward Fine-Grained Facial Control in 3D Talking Head Generation

author.name: Shaoyang Xie, Xiaofeng Cong, Baosheng Yu, Zhipeng Gui, Jie Gui, Yuan Yan Tang, James Tin-Yau Kwok

entry.summary: Proposes FG-3DGS for talking head generation using 3D Gaussian Splatting with frequency-aware disentanglement that models facial regions based on motion characteristics, addressing lip sync and facial jitter issues.

entry.title: Spatio-Temporal Attention for Consistent Video Semantic Segmentation in Automated Driving

author.name: Serin Varghese, Kevin Ross, Fabian Hueger, Kira Maag

entry.summary: Proposes a Spatio-Temporal Attention mechanism that extends transformer attention blocks to incorporate multi-frame context for video semantic segmentation in autonomous driving, improving temporal consistency with minimal architectural changes.

entry.title: Sparse Axonal and Dendritic Delays Enable Competitive SNNs for Keyword Classification

author.name: Younes Bouhadjar, Emre Neftci

entry.summary: Shows that learning either axonal or dendritic delays (rather than full synaptic delays) in spiking neural networks achieves competitive accuracy on speech classification while significantly reducing memory and computational overhead.

entry.title: Diverse Skill Discovery for Quadruped Robots via Unsupervised Learning

author.name: Ruopeng Cui, Yifei Bi, Haojie Luo, Wei Li

entry.summary: Proposes a method for unsupervised skill discovery in quadruped robots that addresses reward hacking and learning efficiency through modeling shared structure and distinctions among skills.

entry.title: Extended Isolation Forest with feature sensitivities

author.name: Illia Donhauzer

entry.summary: Introduces the Anisotropic Isolation Forest (AIF), extending the Extended Isolation Forest to allow controllable sensitivity to deviations in different features for anomaly detection.

entry.title: Importance inversion transfer identifies shared principles for cross-domain learning

author.name: Daniele Caligiore

entry.summary: Formalizes Explainable Cross-Domain Transfer Learning (X-CDTL), introducing Importance Inversion Transfer (IIT) that prioritizes domain-invariant structural features over discriminative ones for anomaly detection across biological, linguistic, molecular, and social networks.

entry.title: Beyond Student: An Asymmetric Network for Neural Network Inheritance

author.name: Yiyun Zhou, Jingwei Shi, Mingjing Xu, Zhonghua Jiang, Jingyuan Chen

entry.summary: InherNet proposes neural network inheritance as an alternative to knowledge distillation, where an asymmetric network directly inherits the teacher's structure while maximizing knowledge transfer.

entry.title: PlugSI: Plug-and-Play Test-Time Graph Adaptation for Spatial Interpolation

author.name: Xuhang Wu, Zhuoxuan Liang, Wei Li, Xiaohua Jia, Sumi Helal

entry.summary: PlugSI proposes a plug-and-play framework for test-time graph adaptation in spatial interpolation, adapting pre-trained models to larger unseen graphs through an Unknown Topology Adapter.

entry.title: A Small-Scale System for Autoregressive Program Synthesis Enabling Controlled Experimentation

author.name: Russ Webb, Jason Ramapuram

entry.summary: Introduces Cadmus, a small-scale system with an integer VM and autoregressive transformer for studying program synthesis at low cost (<$200). Enables controlled experimentation on program completion, OOD representations, and inductive reasoning without the confounds of large LLMs.

entry.title: GHS-TDA: A Synergistic Reasoning Framework Integrating Global Hypothesis Space with Topological Data Analysis

author.name: Jiaquan Zhang, Chaoning Zhang, Shuxu Chen, Xudong Wang, Zhenzhen Huang, Pengcheng Zheng, Shuai Yuan, Sheng Zheng, Qigan Sun, Jie Zou, Lik-Hang Lee, Yang Yang

entry.summary: Proposes GHS-TDA, a framework combining global hypothesis space reasoning with topological data analysis to address error propagation and redundancy in chain-of-thought reasoning.

entry.title: DSFlow: Dual Supervision and Step-Aware Architecture for One-Step Flow Matching Speech Synthesis

author.name: Bin Lin, Peng Yang, Chao Yan, Xiaochen Liu, Wei Wang, Boyong Wu, Pengfei Tan, Xuerui Yang

entry.summary: Introduces DSFlow, a modular distillation framework for few-step and one-step text-to-speech synthesis that reformulates generation as discrete prediction and adapts student models to target inference regimes.

entry.title: Genocide by Algorithm in Gaza: Artificial Intelligence, Countervailing Responsibility, and the Corruption of Public Discourse

author.name: Branislav Radeljic

entry.summary: Examines how AI-driven targeting systems in warfare function as epistemic infrastructures, using Israel's conduct in Gaza as a case study to analyze political, professional, and personal responsibility dimensions.

entry.title: Contractual Deepfakes: Can Large Language Models Generate Contracts?

author.name: Eliza Mik

entry.summary: Argues that LLMs cannot meaningfully generate legal contracts because they lack understanding, context, and legal reasoning - they merely reproduce statistically dominant word patterns that produce superficially plausible but potentially useless documents.

entry.title: Beyond Input-Output: Rethinking Creativity through Design-by-Analogy in Human-AI Collaboration

author.name: Xuechen Li, Shuai Zhang, Nan Cao, Qing Chen

entry.summary: Revisits Design-by-Analogy (DbA) as a cognitive framework for human-AI creative collaboration, expanding it beyond early ideation to the entire creative process to mitigate design fixation caused by AI homogenization.

entry.title: Conceptual Cultural Index: A Metric for Cultural Specificity via Relative Generality

author.name: Takumi Ohashi, Hitoshi Iyatomi

entry.summary: Proposes the Conceptual Cultural Index (CCI), a sentence-level metric for estimating cultural specificity in LLM outputs based on the difference between in-culture and cross-culture generality estimates.

entry.title: From Lightweight CNNs to SpikeNets: Benchmarking Accuracy-Energy Tradeoffs with Pruned Spiking SqueezeNet

author.name: Radib Bin Kabir, Tawsif Tashwar Dipto, Mehedi Ahamed, Sabbir Ahmed, Md Hasanul Kabir

entry.summary: Benchmarks lightweight CNN-to-SNN conversion pipelines, creating spiking variants of ShuffleNet, SqueezeNet, MnasNet, and MixNet on CIFAR-10/100 and TinyImageNet.

entry.title: Explainability in Generative Medical Diffusion Models: A Faithfulness-Based Analysis on MRI Synthesis

author.name: Surjo Dey, Pallabi Saikia

entry.summary: Investigates explainability of generative diffusion models for MRI synthesis using prototype-based methods (ProtoPNet, EPPNet, ProtoPool) to analyze relationships between generated and training features.

entry.title: Drug Release Modeling using Physics-Informed Neural Networks

author.name: Daanish Aleem Qureshi, Khemraj Shukla, Vikas Srivastava

entry.summary: Applies Physics-Informed Neural Networks and Bayesian PINNs to model drug release from planar, wrinkled, and crumpled films, integrating Fick's diffusion law with limited experimental data for long-term predictions.

entry.title: Empirical Stability Analysis of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks in Hard-Constrained Recurrent Physics-Informed Discovery

author.name: Enzo Nicolas Spotorno, Josafat Leal Filho, Antonio Augusto Medeiros Frohlich

entry.summary: Investigates integrating Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks into hard-constrained recurrent physics-informed architectures, finding severe hyperparameter fragility and instability issues despite theoretical motivation.

entry.title: RoboSubtaskNet: Temporal Sub-task Segmentation for Human-to-Robot Skill Transfer in Real-World Environments

author.name: Dharmendra Sharma, Archit Sharma, John Reberio, Vaibhav Kesharwani, Peeyush Thakur, Narendra Kumar Dhar, Laxmidhar Behera

entry.summary: RoboSubtaskNet segments long untrimmed videos into fine-grained, robot-executable sub-tasks using attention-enhanced I3D features and a modified MS-TCN with Fibonacci dilation scheduling. This enables safer human-to-robot skill transfer by accurately localizing temporal sub-task boundaries.

entry.title: The effect of whitening on explanation performance

author.name: Benedict Clark, Stoyan Karastoyanov, Rick Wilming, Stefan Haufe

entry.summary: Investigates whether data whitening (decorrelation) can mitigate XAI errors caused by suppressor variables, finding mixed results on the XAI-TRIS benchmark.

entry.title: Adaptive recurrent flow map operator learning for reaction diffusion dynamics

author.name: Huseyin Tunc

entry.summary: Develops a data-driven operator learner with adaptive recurrent training (DDOL-ART) for reaction-diffusion dynamics, addressing error accumulation in autoregressive rollouts without physics-based regularization.

entry.title: Improved Approximate Regret for Decentralized Online Continuous Submodular Maximization via Reductions

author.name: Yuanyu Wan, Yu Shen, Dingzhi Yu, Bo Xue, Mingli Song

entry.summary: Improves approximate regret bounds for decentralized online continuous submodular maximization, addressing gaps between decentralized and centralized settings and between submodular and convex settings.

entry.title: Differentiable Modeling for Low-Inertia Grids: Benchmarking PINNs, NODEs, and DP for Identification and Control of SMIB System

author.name: Shinhoo Kang, Sangwook Kim, Sehyun Yun

entry.summary: Benchmarks PINNs, Neural ODEs, and Differentiable Programming for modeling and control of low-inertia power systems, evaluating trajectory extrapolation, parameter estimation, and sensitivity accuracy.

entry.title: Contextual and Seasonal LSTMs for Time Series Anomaly Detection

author.name: Lingpei Zhang, Qingming Li, Yong Yang, Jiahao Chen, Rui Zeng, Chenyang Lyu, Shouling Ji

entry.summary: CS-LSTMs framework for univariate time series anomaly detection uses noise decomposition with contextual dependencies and seasonal patterns to detect subtle anomalies like small point anomalies and slow rises.

entry.title: Differentiable Tripartite Modularity for Clustering Heterogeneous Graphs

author.name: Beno\^it Hurpeau

entry.summary: Introduces differentiable tripartite modularity for clustering heterogeneous graphs with three node types, extending DMoN-style community detection to higher-order relational structures.

entry.title: SVD-Preconditioned Gradient Descent Method for Solving Nonlinear Least Squares Problems

author.name: Zhipeng Chang, Wenrui Hao, Nian Liu

entry.summary: Introduces an SVD-preconditioned gradient descent method for nonlinear least-squares problems, integrated with Adam's adaptive learning rate. Proves local linear and global convergence under standard conditions.

entry.title: TVTSyn: Content-Synchronous Time-Varying Timbre for Streaming Voice Conversion and Anonymization

author.name: Waris Quamer, Mu-Ruei Tseng, Ghady Nasrallah, Ricardo Gutierrez-Osuna

entry.summary: Introduces a streamable voice conversion/anonymization system using time-varying timbre representations that align temporal granularity of identity and content, replacing static global speaker embeddings with content-synchronous dynamic timbre.

entry.title: Enhancing Affine Maximizer Auctions with Correlation-Aware Payment

author.name: Haoran Sun, Xuanzhi Xia, Xu Chu, Xiaotie Deng

entry.summary: Proposes Correlation-Aware AMA (CA-AMA) that augments Affine Maximizer Auctions with correlation-aware payments while preserving dominant-strategy incentive compatibility. Shows classic AMAs can perform arbitrarily poorly with correlated bidder valuations.

entry.title: AlignTune: Modular Toolkit for Post-Training Alignment of Large Language Models

author.name: R E Zera Marveen Lyngkhoi, Chirag Chawla, Pratinav Seth, Utsav Avaiya, Soham Bhattacharjee, Mykola Khandoga, Rui Yuan, Vinay Kumar Sankarapu

entry.summary: Introduces AlignTune, a modular toolkit for LLM post-training alignment that provides a unified interface for SFT and RLHF with interchangeable backends (TRL, Unsloth), extensible reward layers, and standardized evaluation.

entry.title: SAQNN: Spectral Adaptive Quantum Neural Network as a Universal Approximator

author.name: Jialiang Tang, Jialin Zhang, Xiaoming Sun

entry.summary: Proposes a constructive quantum neural network (SAQNN) with universal approximation property that supports switching function bases, with asymptotic advantages over classical feed-forward networks in certain settings.

entry.title: Digital Linguistic Bias in Spanish: Evidence from Lexical Variation in LLMs

author.name: Yoshifumi Kawasaki

entry.summary: Examines linguistic bias in LLMs for Spanish, probing how well models capture geographic lexical variation across 21 Spanish-speaking countries using 900+ lexical items. Reveals systematic bias favoring certain varieties.

entry.title: MILE-RefHumEval: A Reference-Free, Multi-Independent LLM Framework for Human-Aligned Evaluation

author.name: Nalin Srun (UL, CNRS, LORIA), Parisa Rastin (UL, CNRS, LORIA), Gu\'ena\"el Cabanes (UL, CNRS, LORIA), Lydia Boudjeloud Assala (UL, CNRS, LORIA)

entry.summary: Introduces MILE-RefHumEval, a reference-free LLM evaluation framework using an ensemble of independently prompted evaluators with a human-aligned schema, supporting both discrete and continuous scoring across multiple tasks.

entry.title: Improving Interpretability of Lexical Semantic Change with Neurobiological Features

author.name: Kohei Oda, Hiroya Takamura, Kiyoaki Shirai, Natthawut Kertkeidkachorn

entry.summary: Proposes mapping contextualized embeddings to neurobiological feature spaces to improve interpretability of lexical semantic change, where each dimension corresponds to a primitive cognitive feature of words.

entry.title: From FusHa to Folk: Exploring Cross-Lingual Transfer in Arabic Language Models

author.name: Abdulmuizz Khalak, Abderrahmane Issam, Gerasimos Spanakis

entry.summary: Studies cross-lingual transfer in Arabic language models from MSA to dialects using probing and representational similarity. Finds transfer is possible but disproportionate across dialects, partially explained by geographic proximity.

entry.title: Fully Differentiable Bidirectional Dual-Task Synergistic Learning for Semi-Supervised 3D Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Jun Li

entry.summary: Proposes a fully differentiable bidirectional dual-task synergistic learning framework for semi-supervised 3D medical image segmentation, enabling mutual feedback between related tasks instead of unidirectional interaction.

entry.title: FD-DB: Frequency-Decoupled Dual-Branch Network for Unpaired Synthetic-to-Real Domain Translation

author.name: Chuanhai Zang, Jiabao Hu, XW Song

entry.summary: Proposes FD-DB, a frequency-decoupled dual-branch network for unpaired synthetic-to-real domain translation that separates low-frequency appearance transfer from high-frequency residual compensation to balance photorealism and structural stability.

entry.title: Weakly Supervised Contrastive Learning for Histopathology Patch Embeddings

author.name: Bodong Zhang, Xiwen Li, Hamid Manoochehri, Xiaoya Tang, Deepika Sirohi, Beatrice S. Knudsen, Tolga Tasdizen

entry.summary: Proposes weakly supervised contrastive learning for histopathology patch embeddings in multiple instance learning frameworks, improving feature representations for slide-level classification using only slide-level labels.

entry.title: A Universal Action Space for General Behavior Analysis

author.name: Hung-Shuo Chang, Yue-Cheng Yang, Yu-Hsi Chen, Wei-Hsin Chen, Chien-Yao Wang, James C. Liao, Chien-Chang Chen, Hen-Hsen Huang, Hong-Yuan Mark Liao

entry.summary: Proposes a universal action space for general behavior analysis that works across animal and human behavior, building on the evolution from hand-crafted features through deep learning to modern vision systems.

entry.title: DR.Experts: Differential Refinement of Distortion-Aware Experts for Blind Image Quality Assessment

author.name: Bohan Fu, Guanyi Qin, Fazhan Zhang, Zihao Huang, Mingxuan Li, Runze Hu

entry.summary: Introduces DR.Experts, a blind image quality assessment framework that explicitly incorporates distortion priors through distortion-aware expert modules and differential refinement, improving alignment with human subjective judgments.

entry.title: BabyMamba-HAR: Lightweight Selective State Space Models for Efficient Human Activity Recognition on Resource Constrained Devices

author.name: Mridankan Mandal

entry.summary: Introduces BabyMamba-HAR, lightweight Mamba-inspired architectures optimized for human activity recognition on resource-constrained devices, exploring channel-independent and channel-dependent designs in the TinyML regime.

entry.title: Towards Human-AI Accessibility Mapping in India: VLM-Guided Annotations and POI-Centric Analysis in Chandigarh

author.name: Varchita Lalwani, Utkarsh Agarwal, Michael Saugstad, Manish Kumar, Jon E. Froehlich, Anupam Sobti

entry.summary: Adapts the Project Sidewalk accessibility mapping platform for deployment in Chandigarh, India, integrating VLM-based mission guidance to help annotators assess sidewalk accessibility. Conducts POI-centric accessibility analysis.

entry.title: From Legible to Inscrutable Trajectories: (Il)legible Motion Planning Accounting for Multiple Observers

author.name: Ananya Yammanuru, Maria Lusardi, Nancy M. Amato, Katherine Driggs-Campbell

entry.summary: Addresses legible and illegible motion planning when there are multiple observers with different visibility regions, where a robot may want to communicate intent to allies while hiding it from adversaries.

entry.title: Design and Evaluation of an Assisted Programming Interface for Behavior Trees in Robotics

author.name: Jonathan Styrud, Matteo Iovino, Rebecca Stower, Mart Karta\v{s}ev, Mikael Norrl\"of, M{\aa}rten Bj\"orkman, Christian Smith

entry.summary: BETR-GUI combines multiple AI assistive methods (LLMs, planning, genetic programming, Bayesian optimization) in a graphical interface for creating Behavior Tree robot programs. A 60-person user study validates the approach.

entry.title: Decoupled MPPI-Based Multi-Arm Motion Planning

author.name: Dan Evron, Elias Goldsztejn, Ronen I. Brafman

entry.summary: Extends the STORM sampling-based motion planning algorithm for distributed multi-arm planning, where each arm plans independently and treats others' plans as dynamic obstacles with a dynamic priority scheme.

entry.title: LiDAR-based 3D Change Detection at City Scale

author.name: Hezam Albagami, Haitian Wang, Xinyu Wang, Muhammad Ibrahim, Zainy M. Malakan, Abdullah M. Alqamdi, Mohammed H. Alghamdi, Ajmal Mian

entry.summary: Proposes an uncertainty-aware, object-centric method for city-scale LiDAR-based 3D change detection using multi-resolution alignment and normalized elevation comparison for municipal compliance and asset monitoring.

entry.title: Witness-or-Wager: Incentive Layers for Epistemic Honesty

author.name: markacochran

entry.summary: Sketches Witness-or-Wager (WoW), a minimal incentive mechanism that requires each substantive AI claim to be either a verifiable witness, a grounded probabilistic wager, or silence, to make epistemic honesty locally optimal.

entry.title: Discovering High Level Patterns from Simulation Traces

author.name: Sean Memery, Kartic Subr

entry.summary: Proposes methods to discover high-level patterns from physics simulation traces to bridge the gap between fine-grained numerical data and natural language understanding for AI agents.

entry.title: NarraScore: Bridging Visual Narrative and Musical Dynamics via Hierarchical Affective Control

author.name: Yufan Wen, Zhaocheng Liu, YeGuo Hua, Ziyi Guo, Lihua Zhang, Chun Yuan, Jian Wu

entry.summary: Proposes NarraScore for video soundtrack synthesis using VLMs as continuous affective sensors to extract narrative-aware emotion trajectories and a dual-branch injection strategy for music generation.

entry.title: Data-centric Design of Learning-based Surgical Gaze Perception Models in Multi-Task Simulation

author.name: Yizhou Li, Shuyuan Yang, Jiaji Su, Zonghe Chua

entry.summary: Studies how the source of gaze supervision (expertise level, active vs. passive viewing) affects surgical gaze perception models, introducing a paired dataset on the da Vinci simulator.

entry.title: TriPilot-FF: Coordinated Whole-Body Teleoperation with Force Feedback

author.name: Zihao Li, Yanan Zhou, Ranpeng Qiu, Hangyu Wu, Guoqiang Ren, Weiming Zhi

entry.summary: TriPilot-FF is an open-source whole-body teleoperation system for bimanual mobile manipulators that introduces foot-operated pedals with lidar-driven haptic feedback for base control, coupled with upper-body bimanual teleoperation.

entry.title: Uncertainty-Aware Multimodal Emotion Recognition through Dirichlet Parameterization

author.name: R\'emi Grzeczkowicz, Eric Soriano, Ali Janati, Miyu Zhang, Gerard Comas-Quiles, Victor Carballo Araruna, Aneesh Jonelagadda

entry.summary: Presents a lightweight, privacy-preserving multimodal emotion recognition framework for edge devices using Dempster-Shafer theory and Dirichlet evidence for uncertainty-aware fusion across speech, text, and facial imagery modalities.

entry.title: X-Mark: Saliency-Guided Robust Dataset Ownership Verification for Medical Imaging

author.name: Pranav Kulkarni, Junfeng Guo, Heng Huang

entry.summary: Proposes X-Mark, a sample-specific clean-label watermarking method for chest x-ray dataset copyright protection using conditional U-Net to generate perturbations within salient regions.

entry.title: LLMAC: A Global and Explainable Access Control Framework with Large Language Model

author.name: Sharif Noor Zisad, Ragib Hasan

entry.summary: Introduces LLMAC, a framework using LLMs to unify different access control methods (RBAC, ABAC, DAC) into a single comprehensive system, evaluated on synthetic datasets representing complex real-world scenarios.

entry.title: Safeguarding Privacy: Privacy-Preserving Detection of Mind Wandering and Disengagement Using Federated Learning in Online Education

author.name: Anna Bodonhelyi, Mengdi Wang, Efe Bozkir, Babette B\"uhler, Enkelejda Kasneci

entry.summary: Proposes federated learning for privacy-preserving detection of mind wandering and disengagement in online education using video-based behavioral indicators.

entry.title: Decoding Future Risk: Deep Learning Analysis of Tubular Adenoma Whole-Slide Images

author.name: Ahmed Rahu, Brian Shula, Brandon Combs, Aqsa Sultana, Surendra P. Singh, Vijayan K. Asari, Derrick Forchetti

entry.summary: Applies deep learning to whole-slide images of tubular adenomas to predict which low-risk colorectal cancer patients may progress to cancer, addressing an unmet clinical need for tailored surveillance.

entry.title: Evaluating Disentangled Representations for Controllable Music Generation

author.name: Laura Ib\'a\~nez-Mart\'inez, Chukwuemeka Nkama, Andrea Poltronieri, Xavier Serra, Mart\'in Rocamora

entry.summary: Evaluates disentangled representations in music audio models using a probing framework across four axes: informativeness, equivariance, invariance, and separability. Analyzes how different unsupervised disentanglement strategies affect representation properties.

entry.title: FM SO.P: A Progressive Task Mixture Framework with Automatic Evaluation for Cross-Domain SOP Understanding

author.name: Siyuan Huang, Ziyu Wang, Chao Pan, Han Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes FM SO.P, a progressive task mixture framework for understanding Standard Operating Procedures across domains, building capabilities through staged training (terminology, sequencing, constraint reasoning) with automatic evaluation.

entry.title: Where Are We At with Automatic Speech Recognition for the Bambara Language?

author.name: Seydou Diallo, Yacouba Diarra, Mamadou K. Keita, Panga Azazia Kamat\'e, Adam Bouno Kampo, Aboubacar Ouattara

entry.summary: Introduces the first standardized ASR benchmark for Bambara using professionally recorded constitutional text. Evaluates 37 models, finding best WER of 46.76%—far below deployment standards even in a narrow formal domain.

entry.title: Equilibrium contrastive learning for imbalanced image classification

author.name: Sumin Roh, Harim Kim, Ho Yun Lee, Il Yong Chun

entry.summary: Proposes equilibrium contrastive learning for imbalanced image classification that aligns class prototypes with classifiers and uses equilibrium-aware rebalancing to improve generalization on imbalanced datasets.

entry.title: HLGFA: High-Low Resolution Guided Feature Alignment for Unsupervised Anomaly Detection

author.name: Han Zhou, Yuxuan Gao, Yinchao Du, Xuezhe Zheng

entry.summary: Proposes HLGFA, an anomaly detection framework that learns normality by modeling cross-resolution feature consistency between high and low resolution representations, using structure and detail priors from high-resolution features to guide low-resolution refinement.

entry.title: Mamba-FCS: Joint Spatio- Frequency Feature Fusion, Change-Guided Attention, and SeK Loss for Enhanced Semantic Change Detection in Remote Sensing

author.name: Buddhi Wijenayake, Athulya Ratnayake, Praveen Sumanasekara, Roshan Godaliyadda, Parakrama Ekanayake, Vijitha Herath, Nichula Wasalathilaka

entry.summary: Introduces Mamba-FCS for semantic change detection in remote sensing, combining Mamba state-space models with spatio-frequency fusion and a novel loss function for handling class-imbalanced land-cover transitions.

entry.title: Humanoid Factors: Design Principles for AI Humanoids in Human Worlds

author.name: Xinyuan Liu, Eren Sadikoglu, Ransalu Senanayake, Lixiao Huang

entry.summary: Introduces 'humanoid factors' as a design framework with four pillars (physical, cognitive, social, ethical) for developing humanoid robots that will coexist with humans, extending traditional human factors research.

entry.title: Finite-time Stable Pose Estimation on TSE(3) using Point Cloud and Velocity Sensors

author.name: Nazanin S. Hashkavaei, Abhijit Dongare, Neon Srinivasu, Amit K. Sanyal

entry.summary: Presents a finite-time stable pose estimator for rigid bodies designed directly on the tangent bundle of SE(3), avoiding coordinate singularities while providing formal stability guarantees and robustness to noise.

entry.title: Not-in-Perspective: Towards Shielding Google's Perspective API Against Adversarial Negation Attacks

author.name: Michail S. Alexiou, J. Sukarno Mertoguno

entry.summary: Presents formal reasoning-based methodologies that wrap around ML toxicity detection systems (specifically Google's Perspective API) to defend against adversarial negation attacks.

entry.title: E2CAR: An Efficient 2D-CNN Framework for Real-Time EEG Artifact Removal on Edge Devices

author.name: Haoliang Liu, Chengkun Cai, Xu Zhao, Lei Li

entry.summary: Presents E2CAR, replacing 1D CNNs with 2D CNNs for EEG artifact removal and deploying on Edge TPUs, achieving 90% compute reduction while maintaining artifact removal quality.

entry.title: A Deep Multi-Modal Method for Patient Wound Healing Assessment

author.name: Subba Reddy Oota, Vijay Rowtula, Shahid Mohammed, Jeffrey Galitz, Minghsun Liu, Manish Gupta

entry.summary: Proposes a deep multi-modal method combining wound images and variables to predict patient hospitalization risk, using transfer learning-based wound assessment.

entry.title: GAFR-Net: A Graph Attention and Fuzzy-Rule Network for Interpretable Breast Cancer Image Classification

author.name: Lin-Guo Gao, Suxing Liu

entry.summary: Proposes GAFR-Net combining graph attention with fuzzy rules for interpretable breast cancer histopathology classification under limited annotations.

entry.title: Surrogate-Guided Quantum Discovery in Black-Box Landscapes with Latent-Quadratic Interaction Embedding Transformers

author.name: Saisubramaniam Gopalakrishnan, Dagnachew Birru

entry.summary: Proposes a framework combining surrogate models with quantum approximate optimization for black-box optimization under limited query budgets, using latent quadratic interaction embedding transformers to bridge learned surrogates and quantum circuits.

entry.title: Hybrid Responsible AI-Stochastic Approach for SLA Compliance in Multivendor 6G Networks

author.name: Emanuel Figetakis, Ahmed Refaey Hussein

entry.summary: Presents a hybrid responsible AI framework for 6G network management combining RAI games with stochastic optimization for SLA compliance across multivendor systems.

entry.title: SARS: A Novel Face and Body Shape and Appearance Aware 3D Reconstruction System extends Morphable Models

author.name: Gulraiz Khan, Kenneth Y. Wertheim, Kevin Pimbblet, Waqas Ahmed

entry.summary: Proposes SARS for 3D face and body reconstruction that incorporates semantic features like age, gender, and facial landmarks into 3D morphable models.

entry.title: Bladder Vessel Segmentation using a Hybrid Attention-Convolution Framework

author.name: Franziska Krau{\ss}, Matthias Ege, Zoltan Lovasz, Albrecht Bartz-Schmidt, Igor Tsaur, Oliver Sawodny, Carina Veil

entry.summary: Introduces a hybrid attention-convolution architecture for bladder vessel segmentation in endoscopic images, combining transformers for global vessel topology with CNNs for local features.

entry.title: SpinCastML an Open Decision-Making Application for Inverse Design of Electrospinning Manufacturing: A Machine Learning, Optimal Sampling and Inverse Monte Carlo Approach

author.name: Elisa Roldan, Tasneem Sabir

entry.summary: SpinCastML is an open-source ML framework for inverse design of electrospinning manufacturing, combining distribution-aware modeling, chemical constraints, and Inverse Monte Carlo methods across a large curated fiber dataset.

entry.title: Towards Explainable Federated Learning: Understanding the Impact of Differential Privacy

author.name: J\'ulio Oliveira, Rodrigo Ferreira, Andr\'e Riker, Glaucio H. S. Carvalho, Eirini Eleni Tsilopoulou

entry.summary: Proposes FEXT-DP, a federated learning solution combining decision tree-based models with differential privacy for explainable and privacy-preserving ML. Aims to balance data privacy with model interpretability.

entry.title: Bridging the Modality Gap in Roadside LiDAR: A Training-Free Vision-Language Model Framework for Vehicle Classification

author.name: Yiqiao Li, Bo Shang, Jie Wei

entry.summary: Proposes a training-free framework that bridges the modality gap between sparse LiDAR point clouds and vision-language models for fine-grained truck classification, using a depth-aware image generation pipeline.

entry.title: Robust Processing and Learning: Principles, Methods, and Wireless Applications

author.name: Shixiong Wang, Wei Dai, Li-Chun Wang, Geoffrey Ye Li

entry.summary: Tutorial-style overview of robustness principles across robust statistics, optimization, and machine learning, using wireless sensing and communication as the application framework. Discusses costs of robustness and recent solutions.

entry.title: AmharicIR+Instr: A Two-Dataset Resource for Neural Retrieval and Instruction Tuning

author.name: Tilahun Yeshambel, Moncef Garouani, Josiane Mothe

entry.summary: Releases two Amharic-language datasets for neural retrieval-ranking and instruction-following text generation, addressing data scarcity for this low-resource language. Contains 1,091 manually verified query-document triplets and instruction-tuning data.

entry.title: Robust Vision Systems for Connected and Autonomous Vehicles: Security Challenges and Attack Vectors

author.name: Sandeep Gupta, Roberto Passerone

entry.summary: Surveys security challenges and attack vectors for vision systems in connected and autonomous vehicles, deriving a reference architecture and analyzing threats to confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

entry.title: Risk-Aware Obstacle Avoidance Algorithm for Real-Time Applications

author.name: Ozan Kaya, Emir Cem Gezer, Roger Skjetne, Ingrid Bouwer Utne

entry.summary: Presents a hybrid risk-aware navigation architecture for autonomous surface vessels that integrates probabilistic risk maps with smooth trajectory optimization, using risk-biased RRT* planning.

entry.title: Fast Motion Planning for Non-Holonomic Mobile Robots via a Rectangular Corridor Representation of Structured Environments

author.name: Alejandro Gonzalez-Garcia, Sebastiaan Wyns, Sonia De Santis, Jan Swevers, Wilm Decr\'e

entry.summary: Presents a motion planning framework for non-holonomic robots in structured environments using rectangular corridor decomposition, enabling compact graph search and near-time-optimal kinematically-feasible trajectories.

entry.title: A Collision-Free Sway Damping Model Predictive Controller for Safe and Reactive Forestry Crane Navigation

author.name: Marc-Philip Ecker, Christoph Fr\"ohlich, Johannes Huemer, David Gruber, Bernhard Bischof, Tobias Gl\"uck, Wolfgang Kemmetm\"uller

entry.summary: Presents the first collision-free sway-damping model predictive controller for forestry cranes, integrating LiDAR-based environment mapping directly into the MPC using online Euclidean distance fields.

entry.title: SAE Feature Matchmaking (Layer-to-Layer)

author.name: Mitali M

entry.summary: Summarizes and explains the 'Mechanistic Permutability' paper on matching SAE-extracted features across neural network layers without input data, discussing the alignment problem for sparse autoencoder features.

entry.title: Symbolic Pattern Temporal Numeric Planning with Intermediate Conditions and Effects

author.name: Matteo Cardellini, Enrico Giunchiglia

entry.summary: Extends Symbolic Pattern Planning to temporal planning with intermediate conditions and effects, encoding durative overlapping actions into SMT formulas for complete plan finding.

entry.title: Predicting Open Source Software Sustainability with Deep Temporal Neural Hierarchical Architectures and Explainable AI

author.name: S M Rakib Ul Karim, Wenyi Lu, Enock Kasaadha, Sean Goggins

entry.summary: Proposes a hierarchical deep learning framework for predicting open source software sustainability by modeling lifecycle stages rather than treating it as simple longevity.

entry.title: DRAGON: Robust Classification for Very Large Collections of Software Repositories

author.name: Stefano Balla (DISI), Stefano Zacchiroli (IP Paris, LTCI, ACES, INFRES), Thomas Degueule (LaBRI, UB), Jean-R\'emy Falleri (LaBRI, UB), Romain Robbes (LaBRI, UB)

entry.summary: Presents DRAGON, a repository classifier that operates on lightweight signals (file/directory names) for classifying software repositories at scale, improving F1@5 from 54.8% to 60.8%.

entry.title: Don't Shoot The Breeze: Topic Continuity Model Using Nonlinear Naive Bayes With Attention

author.name: Shu-Ting Pi, Pradeep Bagavan, Yejia Li, Disha, Qun Liu

entry.summary: Presents a topic continuity model using Naive Bayes with attention and logarithmic nonlinearity to assess whether chatbot responses stay on topic, grounded in NLU quantification.

entry.title: Maastricht University at AMIYA: Adapting LLMs for Dialectal Arabic using Fine-tuning and MBR Decoding

author.name: Abdulhai Alali, Abderrahmane Issam

entry.summary: Adapts a pre-trained LLM for Arabic dialects (Syrian, Moroccan, Saudi) using LoRA fine-tuning, adapter merging, and dialect-aware MBR decoding.

entry.title: EExApp: GNN-Based Reinforcement Learning for Radio Unit Energy Optimization in 5G O-RAN

author.name: Jie Lu, Peihao Yan, Huacheng Zeng

entry.summary: Presents EExAPP, a deep RL-based xApp for 5G O-RAN that jointly optimizes radio unit sleep scheduling and resource slicing using a dual-actor-dual-critic PPO architecture with transformer encoder for variable UE populations.

entry.title: Allure of Craquelure: A Variational-Generative Approach to Crack Detection in Paintings

author.name: Laura Paul, Holger Rauhut, Martin Burger, Samira Kabri, Tim Roith

entry.summary: Proposes a hybrid variational-generative approach for crack detection in paintings, decomposing images into crack-free artwork and crack components using deep generative priors for the artwork and variational methods for cracks.

entry.title: Measuring Inclusion in Interaction: Inclusion Analytics for Human-AI Collaborative Learning

author.name: Jaeyoon Choi, Nia Nixon

entry.summary: Introduces 'inclusion analytics' for measuring inclusion in human-AI collaborative learning through discourse analysis across three dimensions: participation equity, affective climate, and epistemic equity.

entry.title: AnalyticsGPT: An LLM Workflow for Scientometric Question Answering

author.name: Khang Ly, Georgios Cheirmpos, Adrian Raudaschl, Christopher James, Seyed Amin Tabatabaei

entry.summary: Introduces AnalyticsGPT, an LLM workflow for scientometric question answering that addresses meta-scientific questions about the 'science of science' using NER of academic entities and multi-faceted data retrieval.

entry.title: Semi-supervised Liver Segmentation and Patch-based Fibrosis Staging with Registration-aided Multi-parametric MRI

author.name: Boya Wang, Ruizhe Li, Chao Chen, Xin Chen

entry.summary: Introduces a multi-task framework for liver segmentation and fibrosis staging from multi-parametric MRI using semi-supervised learning with integrated image registration to handle limited annotations and domain shifts.

entry.title: Elements of Robot Morphology: Supporting Designers in Robot Form Exploration

author.name: Amy Koike (Serena), Ge (Serena), Guo, Xinning He, Callie Y. Kim, Dakota Sullivan, Bilge Mutlu

entry.summary: Introduces Elements of Robot Morphology, a design framework with five fundamental elements and accompanying tangible blocks (MEB) for collaborative exploration of robot forms in human-robot interaction design.

entry.title: Acoustic Drone Package Delivery Detection

author.name: Fran\c{c}ois Marcoux, Fran\c{c}ois Grondin

entry.summary: Presents the first acoustic package delivery detection algorithm for UAVs using ground-based microphone arrays, estimating propeller speed from mel spectrograms to identify delivery events for prison security applications.

entry.title: FLINGO -- Instilling ASP Expressiveness into Linear Integer Constraints

author.name: Jorge Fandinno, Pedro Cabalar, Philipp Wanko, Torsten Schaub

entry.summary: Presents FLINGO, a system that brings ASP expressiveness to linear integer constraints in Constraint Answer Set Programming, bridging the gap between ASP's declarative power and numerical constraint processing.

entry.title: Efficient Distance Pruning for Process Suffix Comparison in Prescriptive Process Monitoring

author.name: Sarra Madad (UTT, LIST3N - OPTI, QAD)

entry.summary: Proposes an efficient retrieval method for prescriptive process monitoring that uses triangle inequality and pivot-based pruning to accelerate suffix comparisons while maintaining exact results.

entry.title: SAS-Net: Scene-Appearance Separation Network for Robust Spatiotemporal Registration in Bidirectional Photoacoustic Microscopy

author.name: Jiahao Qin

entry.summary: Proposes a scene-appearance separation framework for robust spatiotemporal registration in bidirectional photoacoustic microscopy, separating domain-invariant content from scan-direction-dependent artifacts.

entry.title: A Lightweight Multi-View Approach to Short-Term Load Forecasting

author.name: Julien Guit\'e-Vinet, Alexandre Blondin Mass\'e, \'Eric Beaudry

entry.summary: Proposes a lightweight multi-view approach for short-term load forecasting using single-value embeddings, scaled time-range inputs, and embedding dropout, achieving competitive performance with simpler models.

entry.title: A Controlled Study of Double DQN and Dueling DQN Under Cross-Environment Transfer

author.name: Azka Nasir, Fatima Dossa, Muhammad Ahmed Atif, Mohammad Ahmed Atif

entry.summary: Studies transfer learning between Double DQN and Dueling DQN from CartPole to LunarLander, finding DDQN avoids negative transfer while Dueling DQN fails under domain shift.

entry.title: Effectiveness of Binary Autoencoders for QUBO-Based Optimization Problems

author.name: Tetsuro Abe, Masashi Yamashita, Shu Tanaka

entry.summary: Investigates binary autoencoders for encoding nonbinary structures in QUBO-based combinatorial optimization, addressing the problem that poor binary encodings can waste evaluations on infeasible candidates. Compares approaches within the FMQA framework.

entry.title: SinFoS: A Parallel Dataset for Translating Sinhala Figures of Speech

author.name: Johan Sofalas, Dilushri Pavithra, Nevidu Jayatilleke, Ruvan Weerasinghe

entry.summary: Introduces SinFoS, a corpus of 2,344 Sinhala figures of speech with cultural and cross-lingual annotations, plus a binary classifier achieving ~92% accuracy for FoS type classification.

entry.title: ViSpeechFormer: A Phonemic Approach for Vietnamese Automatic Speech Recognition

author.name: Khoa Anh Nguyen, Long Minh Hoang, Nghia Hieu Nguyen, Luan Thanh Nguyen, Ngan Luu-Thuy Nguyen

entry.summary: Proposes ViSpeechFormer, the first Vietnamese ASR framework that explicitly models phonemic representations, exploiting Vietnamese's high grapheme-phoneme transparency for better speech recognition and OOV generalization.

entry.title: Wearable environmental sensing to forecast how legged systems will interact with upcoming terrain

author.name: Michael D. Murray, James Tung, Richard W. Nuckols

entry.summary: Evaluates wearable RGB-D camera systems for predicting foot center-of-pressure and time-of-impact during level-to-stair transitions using CNN-RNN models, demonstrating feasibility of environmental sensing for assistive device control.

entry.title: Deep Modeling and Interpretation for Bladder Cancer Classification

author.name: Ahmad Chaddad, Yihang Wu, Xianrui Chen

entry.summary: Evaluates 13 deep learning models (CNNs and transformers) for bladder cancer classification, including calibration analysis and GradCAM++ interpretability, with synthetic data augmentation via diffusion models.

entry.title: Efficient Special Stain Classification

author.name: Oskar Thaeter, Christian Grashei, Anette Haas, Elisa Schmoeckel, Han Li, Peter J. Sch\"uffler

entry.summary: Compares MIL pipeline vs. lightweight thumbnail-based approaches for automated classification of 14 special stains plus H&E in histopathology whole slide images for quality control and dataset integrity.

entry.title: Optimal Control of Microswimmers for Trajectory Tracking Using Bayesian Optimization

author.name: Lucas Palazzolo, Micka\"el Binois, La\"etitia Giraldi

entry.summary: Applies Bayesian optimization with B-spline parametrization to solve trajectory tracking for microswimmers, demonstrating the approach on flagellated magnetic swimmers and three-sphere swimmer models.

entry.title: RANT: Ant-Inspired Multi-Robot Rainforest Exploration Using Particle Filter Localisation and Virtual Pheromone Coordination

author.name: Ameer Alhashemi, Layan Abdulhadi, Karam Abuodeh, Tala Baghdadi, Suryanarayana Datla

entry.summary: RANT presents an ant-inspired multi-robot exploration framework combining particle filter localization with virtual pheromone coordination for uncertain environments, analyzing how team size and coordination affect performance.

entry.title: Lateral tracking control of all-wheel steering vehicles with intelligent tires

author.name: Luigi Romano, Ole Morten Aamo, Jan {\AA}slund, Erik Frisk

entry.summary: Develops model-based lateral tracking control for all-wheel steering vehicles using intelligent/smart tire technology, leveraging physics-based tire models rather than empirical correlations or ML approaches.

entry.title: Detecting radar targets swarms in range profiles with a partially complex-valued neural network

author.name: Martin Bauw

entry.summary: Proposes partially complex-valued neural networks for detecting radar target swarms in range profiles with varying proximity and distorted echoes.

entry.title: A Hybrid Deterministic Framework for Named Entity Extraction in Broadcast News Video

author.name: Andrea Filiberto Lucas, Dylan Seychell

entry.summary: Presents a hybrid deterministic framework combining OCR and rule-based methods for extracting names from broadcast news video graphics, compared against generative LLM approaches.

entry.title: NOWJ @BioCreative IX ToxHabits: An Ensemble Deep Learning Approach for Detecting Substance Use and Contextual Information in Clinical Texts

author.name: Huu-Huy-Hoang Tran, Gia-Bao Duong, Quoc-Viet-Anh Tran, Thi-Hai-Yen Vuong, Hoang-Quynh Le

entry.summary: Presents an ensemble deep learning system for detecting substance use information in Spanish clinical texts, combining BETO with CRF for the ToxHabits shared task at BioCreative IX.

entry.title: Predicting Gene Disease Associations in Type 2 Diabetes Using Machine Learning on Single-Cell RNA-Seq Data

author.name: Maria De La Luz Lomboy Toledo, Daniel Onah

entry.summary: Applies ML to single-cell RNA-seq data from mouse models to predict gene-disease associations in Type 2 Diabetes, focusing on beta-cell dysfunction mechanisms.

entry.title: Targum -- A Multilingual New Testament Translation Corpus

author.name: Maciej Rapacz, Aleksander Smywi\'nski-Pohl

entry.summary: Introduces a multilingual corpus of 657 New Testament translations with unprecedented depth in 5 European languages, with standardized metadata for canonicalization. Enables computational stylistic and translation studies.

entry.title: ViMultiChoice: Toward a Method That Gives Explanation for Multiple-Choice Reading Comprehension in Vietnamese

author.name: Trung Tien Cao, Lam Minh Thai, Nghia Hieu Nguyen, Duc-Vu Nguyen, Ngan Luu-Thuy Nguyen

entry.summary: Introduces a Vietnamese dataset for multiple-choice reading comprehension with explanation generation, and proposes ViMultiChoice, a method that jointly predicts answers and generates explanations, achieving SOTA on Vietnamese benchmarks.

entry.title: Impact of domain adaptation in deep learning for medical image classifications

author.name: Yihang Wu, Ahmad Chaddad

entry.summary: Demonstrates domain adaptation techniques across 10 deep learning models on four medical image datasets, exploring multi-modality, noisy data, federated learning, and interpretability scenarios.

entry.title: SCA-Net: Spatial-Contextual Aggregation Network for Enhanced Small Building and Road Change Detection

author.name: Emad Gholibeigi, Abbas Koochari, Azadeh ZamaniFar

entry.summary: Presents SCA-Net for building and road change detection in remote sensing bi-temporal images, with innovations including a Difference Pyramid Block and Adaptive Multi-scale Processing module.

entry.title: Disambiguating Anthropomorphism and Anthropomimesis in Human-Robot Interaction

author.name: Minja Axelsson, Henry Shevlin

entry.summary: Disambiguates anthropomorphism (users perceiving human-like qualities in robots) from anthropomimesis (designers building human-like features into robots) as theoretical concepts in HRI research.

entry.title: First-order friction models with bristle dynamics: lumped and distributed formulations

author.name: Luigi Romano, Ole Morten Aamo, Jan {\AA}slund, Erik Frisk

entry.summary: Derives a novel class of first-order dynamic friction models from physical principles that approximate bristle dynamics, producing formulations resembling the LuGre model but with clearer physical interpretation.

entry.title: Kyrtos: A methodology for automatic deep analysis of graphic charts with curves in technical documents

author.name: Michail S. Alexiou, Nikolaos G. Bourbakis

entry.summary: Introduces Kyrtos, a methodology for automatically recognizing and analyzing charts with curves in technical document graphics. Uses clustering-based approaches for curve recognition and analysis.

entry.title: Stabilized Maximum-Likelihood Iterative Quantum Amplitude Estimation for Structural CVaR under Correlated Random Fields

author.name: Alireza Tabarraei

entry.summary: Develops a quantum-enhanced inference framework for CVaR evaluation in structural mechanics, extending iterative quantum amplitude estimation with maximum-likelihood inference for spatially correlated material uncertainty.

entry.title: Energy-Efficient Fast Object Detection on Edge Devices for IoT Systems

author.name: Mas Nurul Achmadiah, Afaroj Ahamad, Chi-Chia Sun, Wen-Kai Kuo

entry.summary: Implements and compares object detection models on three edge devices for IoT applications using frame difference methods, finding MobileNet offers the best accuracy-latency-energy tradeoff for fast object detection.

entry.title: Feasible Static Workspace Optimization of Tendon Driven Continuum Robot based on Euclidean norm

author.name: Mohammad Jabari (COBRA, PPrime), Carmen Visconte (COBRA, PPrime), Giuseppe Quaglia (COBRA, PPrime), Med Amine Laribi (COBRA, PPrime)

entry.summary: Presents an optimization method for tendon-driven continuum robot design based on feasible static workspace, using genetic algorithms to maximize workspace under external loads.

entry.title: Framework for Integrating Zero Trust in Cloud-Based Endpoint Security for Critical Infrastructure

author.name: Shyam Kumar Gajula

entry.summary: Proposes a Zero Trust Architecture framework for cloud-based endpoint security in critical infrastructure, addressing threats to power plants, healthcare, and financial systems.

entry.title: A Scoping Review of Deep Learning for Urban Visual Pollution and Proposal of a Real-Time Monitoring Framework with a Visual Pollution Index

author.name: Mohammad Masudur Rahman, Md. Rashedur Rahman, Ashraful Islam, Saadia B Alam, M Ashraful Amin

entry.summary: A scoping review of deep learning approaches for urban visual pollution detection, proposing a real-time monitoring framework with a Visual Pollution Index.

entry.title: How Do People Quantify Naturally: Evidence from Mandarin Picture Description
