entry.summary: Proposes Pre-hoc Sparsity (PrHS) for KV cache selection that selects entries before attention scoring rather than using posterior heuristics. Provides explicit accuracy control with guaranteed attention mass bounds.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning with Backtracking Feedback

author.name: Bilgehan Sel, Vaishakh Keshava, Phillip Wallis, Lukas Rutishauser, Ming Jin, Dingcheng Li

entry.summary: Introduces RLBF (Reinforcement Learning with Backtracking Feedback), where LLMs learn to detect and recover from safety violations by emitting a 'backtrack by x tokens' signal during generation.

entry.title: A Behavioural and Representational Evaluation of Goal-Directedness in Language Model Agents

author.name: Raghu Arghal, Fade Chen, Niall Dalton, Evgenii Kortukov, Calum McNamara, Angelos Nalmpantis, Moksh Nirvaan, Gabriele Sarti, Mario Giulianelli

entry.summary: Proposes a framework for evaluating goal-directedness in LLM agents that integrates behavioral evaluation with interpretability-based analysis of internal representations, using 2D grid world navigation as a case study.

entry.title: Convex Dominance in Deep Learning I: A Scaling Law of Loss and Learning Rate

author.name: Zhiqi Bu, Shiyun Xu, Jialin Mao

entry.summary: Examines convexity and Lipschitz continuity in deep learning, showing that loss landscapes become weakly convex after initial training. Builds scaling laws for learning rates and losses that extrapolate up to 80x.

entry.title: tLoRA: Efficient Multi-LoRA Training with Elastic Shared Super-Models

author.name: Kevin Li, Dibyadeep Saha, Avni Kanodia, Fan Lai

entry.summary: Introduces tLoRA, a framework for efficiently batch-training multiple LoRA adapters sharing the same frozen LLM backbone. Fuses heterogeneous adapters into an elastic shared super-model to reduce synchronization overhead and improve GPU utilization.

entry.title: Revisiting Robustness for LLM Safety Alignment via Selective Geometry Control

author.name: Yonghui Yang, Wenjian Tao, Jilong Liu, Xingyu Zhu, Junfeng Fang, Weibiao Huang, Le Wu, Richang Hong, Tat-Sent Chua

entry.summary: Proposes ShaPO, a geometry-aware preference optimization framework for LLM safety alignment. Addresses optimization-induced fragility by enforcing worst-case alignment objectives via selective geometry control over alignment-critical parameter subspaces.

entry.title: Rational Transductors

author.name: Mehryar Mohri

entry.summary: Introduces Rational Transductors, a dual-stream architecture augmenting Transformers with matrix-valued recurrence from Weighted Finite Automata. Aims to overcome Transformer limitations in sequential logic and state tracking.

entry.title: ParisKV: Fast and Drift-Robust KV-Cache Retrieval for Long-Context LLMs

author.name: Yanlin Qi, Xinhang Chen, Huiqiang Jiang, Qitong Wang, Botao Peng, Themis Palpanas

entry.summary: Introduces ParisKV, a drift-robust GPU-native KV-cache retrieval framework for long-context LLM inference. Uses collision-based candidate selection with quantized reranking and supports CPU-offloaded KV caches for million-token contexts.

entry.title: Towards Efficient Large Language Reasoning Models via Extreme-Ratio Chain-of-Thought Compression

author.name: Yuntian Tang, Bohan Jia, Wenxuan Huang, Lianyue Zhang, Jiao Xie, Wenxi Li, Wei Li, Jie Hu, Xinghao Chen, Rongrong Ji, Shaohui Lin

entry.summary: Proposes Extra-CoT, a framework for extreme-ratio chain-of-thought compression that aggressively reduces token budgets while preserving accuracy, using a dedicated semantically-preserved compressor trained on mathematical CoT data.

entry.title: Bayesian Preference Learning for Test-Time Steerable Reward Models

author.name: Jiwoo Hong, Shao Tang, Zhipeng Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Variational In-Context Reward Modeling (ICRM), a Bayesian reward modeling approach enabling test-time steerability via in-context preference demonstrations using a conjugate Beta prior under the Bradley-Terry model.

entry.title: Diffusion-Inspired Reconfiguration of Transformers for Uncertainty Calibration

author.name: Manh Cuong Dao, Quang Hung Pham, Phi Le Nguyen, Thao Nguyen Truong, Bryan Kian Hsiang Low, Trong Nghia Hoang

entry.summary: Proposes reconfiguring pre-trained transformers for uncertainty calibration by modeling each feature transformation block as a probabilistic mapping inspired by diffusion processes. This enables principled uncertainty propagation through the transformer stack without full retraining.

entry.title: Cross-View World Models

author.name: Rishabh Sharma, Gijs Hogervorst, Wayne E. Mackey, David J. Heeger, Stefano Martiniani

entry.summary: Introduces Cross-View World Models (XVWM) that predict future states from different viewpoints than the input, enforcing cross-view consistency as geometric regularization. Particularly beneficial for navigation tasks using bird's-eye views.

entry.title: Improving Variable-Length Generation in Diffusion Language Models via Length Regularization

author.name: Zicong Cheng, Ruixuan Jia, Jia Li, Guo-Wei Yang, Meng-Hao Guo, Shi-Min Hu

entry.summary: Identifies and addresses a fundamental length-induced bias in diffusion language models for variable-length generation. Proposes LR-DLLM, a length-regularized inference framework that corrects this bias without retraining.

entry.title: Flow-Based Conformal Predictive Distributions

author.name: Trevor Harris

entry.summary: Shows that conformal prediction scores induce deterministic flows whose trajectories converge to conformal set boundaries. Provides a training-free method for sampling conformal boundaries in high dimensions.

entry.title: Stop the Flip-Flop: Context-Preserving Verification for Fast Revocable Diffusion Decoding

author.name: Yanzheng Xiang, Lan Wei, Yizhen Yao, Qinglin Zhu, Hanqi Yan, Chen Jin, Philip Alexander Teare, Dandan Zhang, Lin Gui, Amrutha Saseendran, Yulan He

entry.summary: Proposes COVER, a method to stop flip-flop oscillations in parallel diffusion language model decoding. Performs leave-one-out verification and stable drafting in a single forward pass, improving both speed and quality of diffusion LM inference.

entry.title: BenchMarker: An Education-Inspired Toolkit for Highlighting Flaws in Multiple-Choice Benchmarks

author.name: Nishant Balepur, Bhavya Rajasekaran, Jane Oh, Michael Xie, Atrey Desai, Vipul Gupta, Steven James Moore, Eunsol Choi, Rachel Rudinger, Jordan Lee Boyd-Graber

entry.summary: Presents BenchMarker, an education-inspired toolkit using LLM judges to flag contamination, shortcuts, and writing errors in multiple-choice benchmarks. Audits 12 benchmarks revealing systematic quality issues.

entry.title: Baichuan-M3: Modeling Clinical Inquiry for Reliable Medical Decision-Making

author.name: M3 Team, Chengfeng Dou, Fan Yang, Fei Li, Jiyuan Jia, Qiang Ju, Shuai Wang, Tianpeng Li, Xiangrong Zeng, Yijie Zhou, Hongda Zhang, Jinyang Tai, Linzhuang Sun, Peidong Guo, Yichuan Mo, Xiaochuan Wang, Hengfu Cui, Zhishou Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces Baichuan-M3, a medical LLM designed for active clinical decision support with proactive information acquisition, long-horizon reasoning, and adaptive hallucination suppression. Achieves SOTA on HealthBench and new medical benchmarks.

entry.title: SEMA: Simple yet Effective Learning for Multi-Turn Jailbreak Attacks

author.name: Mingqian Feng, Xiaodong Liu, Weiwei Yang, Jialin Song, Xuekai Zhu, Chenliang Xu, Jianfeng Gao

entry.summary: Proposes SEMA, a simple RL framework for training multi-turn jailbreak attackers without external data or predefined strategies. Uses prefilling self-tuning and intent-drift-aware reward to generate effective multi-turn adversarial prompts.

entry.title: LogicSkills: A Structured Benchmark for Formal Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Brian Rabern, Philipp Mondorf, Barbara Plank

entry.summary: Introduces LogicSkills, a benchmark for evaluating LLMs on three core formal logic skills: symbolization (translating to first-order logic), countermodel construction, and validity assessment. Tests on the two-variable fragment of first-order logic.

entry.title: WorldArena: A Unified Benchmark for Evaluating Perception and Functional Utility of Embodied World Models

author.name: Yu Shang, Zhuohang Li, Yiding Ma, Weikang Su, Xin Jin, Ziyou Wang, Xin Zhang, Yinzhou Tang, Chen Gao, Wei Wu, Xihui Liu, Dhruv Shah, Zhaoxiang Zhang, Zhibo Chen, Jun Zhu, Yonghong Tian, Tat-Seng Chua, Wenwu Zhu, Yong Li

entry.summary: WorldArena provides a unified benchmark for evaluating embodied world models across both perceptual quality and functional utility in downstream decision-making, addressing the current fragmented evaluation landscape.

entry.title: UReason: Benchmarking the Reasoning Paradox in Unified Multimodal Models

author.name: Cheng Yang, Chufan Shi, Bo Shui, Yaokang Wu, Muzi Tao, Huijuan Wang, Ivan Yee Lee, Yong Liu, Xuezhe Ma, Taylor Berg-Kirkpatrick

entry.summary: Presents UReason, a diagnostic benchmark for reasoning-driven image generation that evaluates whether chain-of-thought reasoning actually improves visual synthesis. Finds that reasoning often fails to faithfully translate into pixels across code, arithmetic, spatial, attribute, and text tasks.

entry.title: Distributed vs centralized agents

author.name: Richard_Ngo

entry.summary: Richard Ngo presents a conceptual framework distinguishing 'distributed agents' (more autonomous subagents, more robust) from 'centralized agents' (more efficient, as formalized by coherence). Argues this distinction is important for understanding AI agency and proposes 'coalitional agency' as a way to achieve both properties.

entry.title: RECUR: Resource Exhaustion Attack via Recursive-Entropy Guided Counterfactual Utilization and Reflection

author.name: Ziwei Wang, Yuanhe Zhang, Jing Chen, Zhenhong Zhou, Ruichao Liang, Ruiying Du, Ju Jia, Cong Wu, Yang Liu

entry.summary: RECUR introduces Recursive Entropy to quantify resource exhaustion risks in Large Reasoning Models' reflection processes. It reveals that adversarially crafted inputs can trigger over-reflection, consuming excessive compute, and proposes attacks that exploit this vulnerability.

entry.title: Data Science and Technology Towards AGI Part I: Tiered Data Management

author.name: Yudong Wang, Zixuan Fu, Hengyu Zhao, Chen Zhao, Chuyue Zhou, Xinle Lin, Hongya Lyu, Shuaikang Xue, Yi Yi, Yingjiao Wang, Zhi Zheng, Yuzhou Zhang, Jie Zhou, Chaojun Xiao, Xu Han, Zhiyuan Liu, Maosong Sun

entry.summary: Proposes a tiered data management framework for LLM training arguing for data-model co-evolution rather than unidirectional data scaling. From a large team including Zhiyuan Liu and Maosong Sun (Tsinghua).

entry.title: Steering to Say No: Configurable Refusal via Activation Steering in Vision Language Models

author.name: Jiaxi Yang, Shicheng Liu, Yuchen Yang, Dongwon Lee

entry.summary: Develops CR-VLM, a configurable refusal approach for vision language models using activation steering, allowing adaptable refusal behavior based on user needs and context.

entry.title: GSS: Gated Subspace Steering for Selective Memorization Mitigation in LLMs

author.name: Xuanqi Zhang, Haoyang Shang, Xiaoxiao Li

entry.summary: Proposes Gated Subspace Steering (GSS) for selective memorization mitigation in LLMs, using a probe to detect memorization-relevant activations and a steer to apply targeted correction only when needed, preserving general performance.

entry.title: Efficient Post-Training Pruning of Large Language Models with Statistical Correction

author.name: Peiqi Yu, Jinhao Wang, Xinyi Sui, Nam Ling, Wei Wang, Wei Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes a lightweight post-training pruning framework for LLMs using first-order statistical properties. Channel-wise statistics calibrate importance scores, and analytic energy compensation corrects for pruning-induced output shifts.

entry.title: What, Whether and How? Unveiling Process Reward Models for Thinking with Images Reasoning

author.name: Yujin Zhou, Pengcheng Wen, Jiale Chen, Boqin Yin, Han Zhu, Jiaming Ji, Juntao Dai, Chi-Min Chan, Sirui Han

entry.summary: This work introduces the first comprehensive benchmark for Process Reward Models in the 'thinking with images' paradigm for Large Vision Language Models, where models dynamically edit and re-encode visual information during reasoning.

entry.title: DLLM-Searcher: Adapting Diffusion Large Language Model for Search Agents

author.name: Jiahao Zhao, Shaoxuan Xu, Zhongxiang Sun, Fengqi Zhu, Jingyang Ou, Yuling Shi, Chongxuan Li, Xiao Zhang, Jun Xu

entry.summary: DLLM-Searcher adapts diffusion-based large language models for search agent tasks, exploiting their parallel decoding mechanism to reduce the latency inherent in sequential ReAct-style agent pipelines. This is one of the first works to explore diffusion LLMs in an agentic setting, addressing both latency and capability gaps.

entry.title: W&D:Scaling Parallel Tool Calling for Efficient Deep Research Agents

author.name: Xiaoqiang Lin, Jun Hao Liew, Silvio Savarese, Junnan Li

entry.summary: The Wide and Deep research agent explores scaling agent performance through parallel tool calling (width) in addition to sequential depth. Unlike complex multi-agent orchestration approaches, it leverages intrinsic parallel tool calling within a single agent framework for deep research tasks.

entry.title: LOCA-bench: Benchmarking Language Agents Under Controllable and Extreme Context Growth

author.name: Weihao Zeng, Yuzhen Huang, Junxian He

entry.summary: LOCA-bench evaluates language agents under controllable, extreme context growth scenarios that simulate real-world 'context rot'. Unlike existing long-context benchmarks that test single-step retrieval, it requires agents to explore, plan, and act under dynamically growing context.

entry.title: Weak-Driven Learning: How Weak Agents make Strong Agents Stronger

author.name: Zehao Chen, Gongxun Li, Tianxiang Ai, Yifei Li, Zixuan Huang, Wang Zhou, Fuzhen Zhuang, Xianglong Liu, Jianxin Li, Deqing Wang, Yikun Ban

entry.summary: WMSS proposes using weak model checkpoints to guide continued optimization of strong models that have reached saturation. By identifying recoverable learning gaps via entropy dynamics and reinforcing them through compensatory learning, it enables improvements beyond conventional post-training limits.

entry.title: Moral Sycophancy in Vision Language Models

author.name: Shadman Rabby, Md. Hefzul Hossain Papon, Sabbir Ahmed, Nokimul Hasan Arif, A. B. M. Ashikur Rahman, Irfan Ahmad

entry.summary: First systematic study of moral sycophancy in Vision-Language Models. Tests 10 VLMs on moral benchmarks under explicit user disagreement, finding models frequently shift from morally correct to incorrect judgments and exhibit asymmetric sycophancy toward moral wrongness.

entry.title: Towards Better Evolution Modeling for Temporal Knowledge Graphs

author.name: Zhang Jiasheng, Li Zhangpin, Wang Mingzhe, Shao Jie, Cui Jiangtao, Li Hui

entry.summary: Reveals that existing temporal knowledge graph benchmarks contain shortcuts allowing near-SOTA performance through simple co-occurrence counting without temporal information. Identifies inherent biases in current datasets and proposes improved evaluation.

entry.title: Grounding Generative Planners in Verifiable Logic: A Hybrid Architecture for Trustworthy Embodied AI

author.name: Feiyu Wu, Xu Zheng, Yue Qu, Zhuocheng Wang, Zicheng Feng, Hui Li

entry.summary: Introduces VIRF, a neuro-symbolic framework that pairs a deterministic Logic Tutor with an LLM planner in a tutor-apprentice dialogue for safe embodied AI planning. Shifts from passive safety gatekeeping to active plan repair.

entry.title: Belief Offloading in Human-AI Interaction

author.name: Rose E. Guingrich, Dvija Mehta, Umang Bhatt

entry.summary: Defines and investigates 'belief offloading' in human-AI interaction, where people's belief formation processes are offloaded onto AI systems, with downstream consequences on behavior and belief systems.

entry.title: Bridging the Knowledge Void: Inference-time Acquisition of Unfamiliar Programming Languages for Coding Tasks

author.name: Chen Shen, Wei Cheng, Jingyue Yang, Huan Zhang, Yuhan Wu, Wei Hu

entry.summary: Proposes ILA-agent for Inference-time Language Acquisition, enabling LLMs to master unfamiliar programming languages through dynamic interaction with limited resources, modeling human-like learning behaviors.

entry.title: FADE: Selective Forgetting via Sparse LoRA and Self-Distillation

author.name: Carolina R. Kelsch, Leonardo S. B. Pereira, Natnael Mola, Luis H. Arribas, Juan C. S. M. Avedillo

entry.summary: Introduces FADE, a two-stage machine unlearning method for text-to-image diffusion models combining parameter localization via gradient-based saliency with self-distillation through sparse LoRA.

entry.title: AbFlow : End-to-end Paratope-Centric Antibody Design by Interaction Enhanced Flow Matching

author.name: Wenda Wang, Yang Zhang, Zhewei Wei, Wenbing Huang

entry.summary: AbFlow is a flow-matching framework using optimal transport for end-to-end full-atom antibody design, featuring an equivariant Surface Multi-channel Encoder for antigen interaction-guided structure refinement, particularly for CDR-H3 regions.

entry.title: Concept-Aware Privacy Mechanisms for Defending Embedding Inversion Attacks

author.name: Yu-Che Tsai, Hsiang Hsiao, Kuan-Yu Chen, Shou-De Lin

entry.summary: SPARSE proposes a user-centric framework for concept-specific privacy protection in text embeddings, using differentiable mask learning and the Mahalanobis mechanism for elliptical noise calibrated by dimension sensitivity, rather than uniform noise.

entry.title: Free Energy Mixer

author.name: Jiecheng Lu, Shihao Yang

entry.summary: Free Energy Mixer (FEM) replaces standard attention's convex average read with a log-sum-exp operation that applies value-driven, per-channel log-linear tilts, enabling channel-wise selection at unchanged complexity.

entry.title: "Death" of a Chatbot: Investigating and Designing Toward Psychologically Safe Endings for Human-AI Relationships

author.name: Rachel Poonsiriwong, Chayapatr Archiwaranguprok, Pat Pataranutaporn

entry.summary: Investigates the psychological impact of AI companion discontinuation through grounded theory analysis, finding that anthropomorphization co-occurs with intense grief and proposing design patterns for psychologically safe endings.

entry.title: Collaborative and Efficient Fine-tuning: Leveraging Task Similarity

author.name: Gagik Magakyan, Amirhossein Reisizadeh, Chanwoo Park, Pablo A. Parrilo, Asuman Ozdaglar

entry.summary: CoLoRA proposes collaborative low-rank adaptation where users with similar downstream tasks can share fine-tuning data to boost effective training data size, exploiting task similarity across users.

entry.title: The Double-Edged Sword of Data-Driven Super-Resolution: Adversarial Super-Resolution Models

author.name: Haley Duba-Sullivan, Steven R. Young, Emma J. Reid

entry.summary: AdvSR demonstrates that adversarial behavior can be embedded directly into super-resolution model weights during training, producing models that appear benign under quality metrics but cause targeted downstream failures.

entry.title: LUCID-SAE: Learning Unified Vision-Language Sparse Codes for Interpretable Concept Discovery

author.name: Difei Gu, Yunhe Gao, Gerasimos Chatzoudis, Zihan Dong, Guoning Zhang, Bangwei Guo, Yang Zhou, Mu Zhou, Dimitris Metaxas

entry.summary: LUCID-SAE introduces a unified vision-language sparse autoencoder learning shared latent dictionaries for image and text representations via optimal transport alignment, enabling cross-modal interpretability.

entry.title: Intent Mismatch Causes LLMs to Get Lost in Multi-Turn Conversation

author.name: Geng Liu, Fei Zhu, Rong Feng, Changyi Ma, Shiqi Wang, Gaofeng Meng

entry.summary: Investigates why LLMs perform worse in multi-turn conversations, arguing the root cause is intent alignment gap rather than capability deficits. Demonstrates 'Lost in Conversation' is an interaction breakdown, not a model failure.

entry.title: Secure Code Generation via Online Reinforcement Learning with Vulnerability Reward Model

author.name: Tianyi Wu, Mingzhe Du, Yue Liu, Chengran Yang, Terry Yue Zhuo, Jiaheng Zhang, See-Kiong Ng

entry.summary: SecCoderX proposes online RL for secure code generation with a reasoning-based vulnerability reward model, synthesizing vulnerability-inducing coding tasks from detection resources and addressing the functionality-security tradeoff.

entry.title: MemPot: Defending Against Memory Extraction Attack with Optimized Honeypots

author.name: Yuhao Wang, Shengfang Zhai, Guanghao Jin, Yinpeng Dong, Linyi Yang, Jiaheng Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes MemPot, the first defense framework against memory extraction attacks on LLM agents by injecting optimized honeypot documents. Uses Wald's Sequential Probability Ratio Test to theoretically verify detection guarantees.

entry.title: Gaussian Match-and-Copy: A Minimalist Benchmark for Studying Transformer Induction

author.name: Antoine Gonon, Alexandre Cordonnier, Nicolas Boumal

entry.summary: Introduces Gaussian Match-and-Copy (GMC), a minimalist benchmark that isolates the match-and-copy retrieval primitive in transformers from memorization, enabling clean study of how induction heads emerge.

entry.title: rePIRL: Learn PRM with Inverse RL for LLM Reasoning

author.name: Xian Wu, Kaijie Zhu, Ying Zhang, Lun Wang, Wenbo Guo

entry.summary: Introduces rePIRL, an inverse RL framework for learning process reward models with minimal assumptions about expert policies, using a dual learning process for PRM updates.

entry.title: Rethinking Latency Denial-of-Service: Attacking the LLM Serving Framework, Not the Model

author.name: Tianyi Wang, Huawei Fan, Yuanchao Shu, Peng Cheng, Cong Wang

entry.summary: Reveals that algorithmic latency attacks on LLMs are largely ineffective against modern serving systems due to continuous batching. Shifts focus to system-level attacks that target the serving framework itself.

entry.title: Reliable and Responsible Foundation Models: A Comprehensive Survey

author.name: Xinyu Yang, Junlin Han, Rishi Bommasani, Jinqi Luo, Wenjie Qu, Wangchunshu Zhou, Adel Bibi, Xiyao Wang, Jaehong Yoon, Elias Stengel-Eskin, Shengbang Tong, Lingfeng Shen, Rafael Rafailov, Runjia Li, Zhaoyang Wang, Yiyang Zhou, Chenhang Cui, Yu Wang, Wenhao Zheng, Huichi Zhou, Jindong Gu, Zhaorun Chen, Peng Xia, Tony Lee, Thomas Zollo, Vikash Sehwag, Jixuan Leng, Jiuhai Chen, Yuxin Wen, Huan Zhang, Zhun Deng, Linjun Zhang, Pavel Izmailov, Pang Wei Koh, Yulia Tsvetkov, Andrew Wilson, Jiaheng Zhang, James Zou, Cihang Xie, Hao Wang, Philip Torr, Julian McAuley, David Alvarez-Melis, Florian Tram\`er, Kaidi Xu, Suman Jana, Chris Callison-Burch, Rene Vidal, Filippos Kokkinos, Mohit Bansal, Beidi Chen, Huaxiu Yao

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on reliability and responsibility of foundation models covering bias/fairness, security/privacy, uncertainty, explainability, and distribution shift across LLMs, MLLMs, and generative models.

entry.title: CoRect: Context-Aware Logit Contrast for Hidden State Rectification to Resolve Knowledge Conflicts

author.name: Xuhua Ma, Richong Zhang, Zhijie Nie

entry.summary: Proposes CoRect for resolving knowledge conflicts in RAG by identifying and rectifying FFN layers that overwrite context-sensitive representations with memorized priors through logit contrast between contextualized and non-contextualized forward passes.

entry.title: Learning in Context, Guided by Choice: A Reward-Free Paradigm for Reinforcement Learning with Transformers

author.name: Juncheng Dong, Bowen He, Moyang Guo, Ethan X. Fang, Zhuoran Yang, Vahid Tarokh

entry.summary: Proposes In-Context Preference-based RL (ICPRL) that uses only preference feedback for both pretraining and deployment, eliminating need for reward signals. Studies two variants with different feedback granularity.

entry.title: SWE Context Bench: A Benchmark for Context Learning in Coding

author.name: Jared Zhu, Minhao Hu, Junde Wu

entry.summary: Introduces SWE-ContextBench, a benchmark for evaluating experience reuse and context learning in programming agents, augmenting SWE-Bench Lite with 99 related tasks to measure cross-task knowledge transfer.

entry.title: Dynamic Long Context Reasoning over Compressed Memory via End-to-End Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhuoen Chen, Dongfang Li, Meishan Zhang, Baotian Hu, Min Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a cognitively inspired framework for long-context inference using chunk-wise compression, selective memory recall via gating, and iterative reasoning with evolving working memory. Trained end-to-end with RL.

entry.title: We Should Separate Memorization from Copyright

author.name: Adi Haviv, Niva Elkin-Koren, Uri Hacohen, Roi Livni, Shay Moran

entry.summary: Argues that memorization as studied in data science should not be equated with copyright-relevant copying, and proposes separating these concepts in both technical and legal discussions of foundation models.

entry.title: On the Expressive Power of GNNs for Boolean Satisfiability

author.name: Saku Peltonen, Roger Wattenhofer

entry.summary: Proves that the full Weisfeiler-Leman hierarchy cannot in general distinguish between satisfiable and unsatisfiable Boolean formulas, establishing fundamental expressivity limitations of GNNs for SAT solving.

entry.title: Taming Scylla: Understanding the multi-headed agentic daemon of the coding seas

author.name: Micah Villmow

entry.summary: Introduces Scylla, an evaluation framework for benchmarking agentic coding tools through structured ablation studies with seven testing tiers. Key metric is Cost-of-Pass (CoP): expected dollar cost to get one correct solution.

entry.title: StealthRL: Reinforcement Learning Paraphrase Attacks for Multi-Detector Evasion of AI-Text Detectors

author.name: Suraj Ranganath, Atharv Ramesh

entry.summary: StealthRL uses reinforcement learning (GRPO with LoRA on Qwen3-4B) to train paraphrase attacks that evade multiple AI-text detectors simultaneously while preserving semantics, achieving near-zero detection at 1% FPR.

entry.title: MotionCrafter: Dense Geometry and Motion Reconstruction with a 4D VAE

author.name: Ruijie Zhu, Jiahao Lu, Wenbo Hu, Xiaoguang Han, Jianfei Cai, Ying Shan, Chuanxia Zheng

entry.summary: MotionCrafter jointly reconstructs 4D geometry and dense motion from monocular video using a novel 4D VAE. Challenges the assumption that 3D latents must align with RGB VAE latents, proposing new normalization and training strategies.

entry.title: ANCRe: Adaptive Neural Connection Reassignment for Efficient Depth Scaling

author.name: Yilang Zhang, Bingcong Li, Niao He, Georgios B. Giannakis

entry.summary: ANCRe adaptively learns residual connection layouts, proving that connection topology can create exponential gaps in convergence rates. Proposes lightweight parameterization of residual connectivities learned from data.

entry.title: Controllable Value Alignment in Large Language Models through Neuron-Level Editing

author.name: Yonghui Yang, Junwei Li, Jilong Liu, Yicheng He, Fengbin Zhu, Weibiao Huang, Le Wu, Richang Hong, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Introduces NeVA, a neuron-level editing framework for controllable value alignment in LLMs. Identifies 'value leakage' - where steering one value unintentionally activates others - and proposes sparse neuron-level editing grounded in Schwartz's value theory.

entry.title: MedVerse: Efficient and Reliable Medical Reasoning via DAG-Structured Parallel Execution

author.name: Jianwen Chen, Xinyu Yang, Peng Xia, Arian Azarang, Yueh Z Lee, Gang Li, Hongtu Zhu, Yun Li, Beidi Chen, Huaxiu Yao

entry.summary: Proposes MedVerse, a framework that reformulates medical reasoning as a parallelizable DAG process based on Petri net theory, enabling parallel inference for tasks like differential diagnosis. Full-stack design spanning data, model, and system execution.

entry.title: Riemannian MeanFlow

author.name: Dongyeop Woo, Marta Skreta, Seonghyun Park, Sungsoo Ahn, Kirill Neklyudov

entry.summary: Introduces Riemannian MeanFlow for learning flow maps directly on manifolds, enabling high-quality generation with as few as one forward pass. Derives three characterizations of manifold average velocity and demonstrates applications in protein and DNA generation.

entry.title: MARTI-MARS$^2$: Scaling Multi-Agent Self-Search via Reinforcement Learning for Code Generation

author.name: Shijie Wang, Pengfei Li, Yikun Fu, Kaifeng Liu, Fangyuan Li, Yang Liu, Xiaowei Sun, Zonglin Li, Siyao Zhao, Jian Zhao, Kai Tian, Dong Li, Junqi Gao, Yutong Zhang, Yiqun Chen, Yuqiang Li, Zoe Li, Weinan Zhang, Peng Ye, Shuyue Hu, Lei Bai, Bowen Zhou, Kaiyan Zhang, Biqing Qi

entry.summary: Proposes MARTI-MARS², a multi-agent RL framework for code generation that integrates policy learning with tree search. Multiple heterogeneous agents collaborate through reinforced training and inference-time self-search scaling.

entry.title: A Unified Density Operator View of Flow Control and Merging

author.name: Riccardo De Santi, Malte Franke, Ya-Ping Hsieh, Andreas Krause

entry.summary: Introduces a unified probability-space framework that subsumes both flow control (reward adaptation) and flow merging (model integration) as limit cases. Enables reward-guided merging of multiple pre-trained flow models.

entry.title: SkillRL: Evolving Agents via Recursive Skill-Augmented Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Peng Xia, Jianwen Chen, Hanyang Wang, Jiaqi Liu, Kaide Zeng, Yu Wang, Siwei Han, Yiyang Zhou, Xujiang Zhao, Haifeng Chen, Zeyu Zheng, Cihang Xie, Huaxiu Yao

entry.summary: Proposes SkillRL, a framework for LLM agents that automatically discovers and evolves reusable skills from experience through a hierarchical skill library (SkillBank), adaptive retrieval, and recursive RL-based skill evolution.

entry.title: Causal Schr\"odinger Bridges: Constrained Optimal Transport on Structural Manifolds

author.name: Rui Wu, Li YongJun

entry.summary: Introduces Causal Schrödinger Bridge (CSB), reformulating counterfactual inference as entropic optimal transport with diffusion processes that can robustly transport mass through low-density regions while enforcing structural causal constraints.

entry.title: Trapped by simplicity: When Transformers fail to learn from noisy features

author.name: Evan Peters, Ando Deng, Matheus H. Zambianco, Devin Blankespoor, Achim Kempf

entry.summary: Studies when transformers fail at noise-robust learning, showing they succeed for sparse parity/majority functions but fail for random k-juntas when the boolean sensitivity of the simpler solution is lower, revealing a 'simplicity trap'.

entry.title: Foundation Inference Models for Ordinary Differential Equations

author.name: Maximilian Mauel, Johannes R. H\"ubers, David Berghaus, Patrick Seifner, Ramses J. Sanchez

entry.summary: Proposes FIM-ODE, a pretrained foundation model for ODE inference that predicts vector fields from noisy trajectory data in a single forward pass, pretrained on polynomial ODE priors and represented with neural operators.

entry.title: A Graphop Analysis of Graph Neural Networks on Sparse Graphs: Generalization and Universal Approximation

author.name: Ofek Amran, Tom Gilat, Ron Levie

entry.summary: Presents a unified theoretical framework for MPNN generalization and approximation on graphs of all sizes (both sparse and dense), using graphop theory to define compact metrics under which MPNNs are Hölder continuous.

entry.title: Condition Errors Refinement in Autoregressive Image Generation with Diffusion Loss

author.name: Yucheng Zhou, Hao Li, Jianbing Shen

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of autoregressive image generation with diffusion loss, showing that patch-wise denoising in autoregressive models mitigates condition errors and leads to stable condition distributions, with the error decreasing exponentially.

entry.title: Automated Modernization of Machine Learning Engineering Notebooks for Reproducibility

author.name: Bihui Jin, Kaiyuan Wang, Pengyu Nie

entry.summary: Studies reproducibility of ML engineering notebooks, finding only 35.4% of 12,720 Kaggle notebooks remain reproducible. Proposes automated modernization via forward-porting to current environments rather than backporting.

entry.title: Optimizing Few-Step Generation with Adaptive Matching Distillation

author.name: Lichen Bai, Zikai Zhou, Shitong Shao, Wenliang Zhong, Shuo Yang, Shuo Chen, Bojun Chen, Zeke Xie

entry.summary: Proposes Adaptive Matching Distillation (AMD) for few-step generation, introducing a unified framework that reinterprets prior distillation methods as strategies to avoid 'Forbidden Zones' where teacher guidance is unreliable.

entry.title: Adaptive Matrix Online Learning through Smoothing with Guarantees for Nonsmooth Nonconvex Optimization

author.name: Ruichen Jiang, Zakaria Mhammedi, Mehryar Mohri, Aryan Mokhtari

entry.summary: Extends gradient-based prediction to adaptive matrix online learning and designs algorithms via smoothed potentials for the nuclear norm, matching best-known regret bounds without costly projection subproblems.

entry.title: Amortising Inference and Meta-Learning Priors in Neural Networks

author.name: Tommy Rochussen, Vincent Fortuin

entry.summary: Introduces a method to learn weight priors for Bayesian neural networks from collections of datasets by performing per-dataset amortised variational inference. Bridges Bayesian deep learning and probabilistic meta-learning, viewing the model as a neural process with BNN weights as latent variables.

entry.title: Learning to Coordinate via Quantum Entanglement in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

author.name: John Gardiner, Orlando Romero, Brendan Tivnan, Nicol\`o Dal Fabbro, George J. Pappas

entry.summary: Introduces the first framework for training MARL agents to exploit shared quantum entanglement as a coordination resource, enabling a larger class of correlated policies than shared randomness. Motivated by quantum physics results on cooperative games.

entry.title: What Is Novel? A Knowledge-Driven Framework for Bias-Aware Literature Originality Evaluation

author.name: Abeer Mostafa, Thi Huyen Nguyen, Zahra Ahmadi

entry.summary: Introduces a knowledge-driven framework for assessing research novelty that learns from ~80K peer review reports and grounds judgments in structured comparisons to existing work via similarity graphs.

entry.title: Is my model "mind blurting"? Interpreting the dynamics of reasoning tokens with Recurrence Quantification Analysis (RQA)

author.name: Quoc Tuan Pham, Mehdi Jafari, Flora Salim

entry.summary: Proposes using Recurrence Quantification Analysis (RQA) as a non-textual method for analyzing reasoning chains in LLMs at test time. Treats token generation as a dynamical system and extracts patterns from hidden embeddings to detect repetition and stalling.

entry.title: TrailBlazer: History-Guided Reinforcement Learning for Black-Box LLM Jailbreaking

author.name: Sung-Hoon Yoon, Ruizhi Qian, Minda Zhao, Weiyue Li, Mengyu Wang

entry.summary: Proposes TrailBlazer, a history-aware RL-based jailbreak framework that analyzes and reweights vulnerability signals from previous interactions for more efficient multi-turn attacks on LLMs.

entry.title: Echoes as Anchors: Probabilistic Costs and Attention Refocusing in LLM Reasoning

author.name: Zhuoyuan Hao, Zhuo Li, Wu Li, Fangming Liu, Min Zhang, Jing Li

entry.summary: Analyzes how LLMs' tendency to restate questions (Echo of Prompt) serves as a compute-shaping mechanism in reasoning. Models this through probabilistic cost analysis and attention refocusing, providing theoretical grounding for observed repetition behavior.

entry.title: Table-as-Search: Formulate Long-Horizon Agentic Information Seeking as Table Completion

author.name: Tian Lan, Felix Henry, Bin Zhu, Qianghuai Jia, Junyang Ren, Qihang Pu, Haijun Li, Longyue Wang, Zhao Xu, Weihua Luo

entry.summary: Proposes Table-as-Search (TaS), reformulating long-horizon information seeking as a table completion task where rows represent search candidates and columns denote constraints. Maintains search state in an external database rather than plain-text context.

entry.title: Analyzing Diffusion and Autoregressive Vision Language Models in Multimodal Embedding Space

author.name: Zihang Wang, Siyue Zhang, Yilun Zhao, Jingyi Yang, Tingyu Song, Anh Tuan Luu, Chen Zhao

entry.summary: Presents the first systematic study of whether multimodal diffusion language models can serve as effective multimodal embedding models, comparing them to autoregressive VLMs in the embedding space.

entry.title: Generics in science communication: Misaligned interpretations across laypeople, scientists, and large language models

author.name: Uwe Peters, Andrea Bertazzoli, Jasmine M. DeJesus, Gisela J. van der Velden, Benjamin Chin-Yee

entry.summary: Studies how laypeople, scientists, and LLMs (ChatGPT-5 and DeepSeek) interpret generic scientific statements differently, finding that LLMs rate generics as more generalizable and credible than even laypeople, highlighting risks for AI-mediated science communication.

entry.title: Exploring Physical Intelligence Emergence via Omni-Modal Architecture and Physical Data Engine

author.name: Minghao Han, Dingkang Yang, Yue Jiang, Yizhou Liu, Lihua Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces OmniFysics, a compact omni-modal model with integrated physical understanding across images, audio, video, and text, supported by a physical data engine that injects explicit physics knowledge through retrieval and verification.

entry.title: Privacy in Image Datasets: A Case Study on Pregnancy Ultrasounds

author.name: Rawisara Lohanimit, Yankun Wu, Amelia Katirai, Yuta Nakashima, Noa Garcia

entry.summary: Investigates privacy risks in large-scale image datasets by examining pregnancy ultrasound images in LAION-400M, detecting thousands of instances of private information including names and locations.

entry.title: VideoNeuMat: Neural Material Extraction from Generative Video Models

author.name: Bowen Xue, Saeed Hadadan, Zheng Zeng, Fabrice Rousselle, Zahra Montazeri, Milos Hasan

entry.summary: Presents VideoNeuMat, a pipeline that extracts reusable neural material assets from video diffusion models by fine-tuning Wan 2.1 14B to generate controlled material sample videos, creating a 'virtual gonioreflectometer'.

entry.title: Out of the box age estimation through facial imagery: A Comprehensive Benchmark of Vision-Language Models vs. out-of-the-box Traditional Architectures

author.name: Simiao Ren

entry.summary: Presents the first large-scale benchmark comparing 34 models (22 specialized + 12 VLMs) for facial age estimation across 8 datasets, finding that zero-shot VLMs significantly outperform most specialized models with 5.65 vs 9.88 MAE.

entry.title: Deepfake Synthesis vs. Detection: An Uneven Contest

author.name: Md. Tarek Hasan, Sanjay Saha, Shaojing Fan, Swakkhar Shatabda, Terence Sim

entry.summary: This paper provides a comprehensive empirical analysis of state-of-the-art deepfake detection techniques against cutting-edge synthesis methods including diffusion models and NeRFs. The findings highlight a growing asymmetry where synthesis capabilities are outpacing detection methods.

entry.title: Efficient-SAM2: Accelerating SAM2 with Object-Aware Visual Encoding and Memory Retrieval

author.name: Jing Zhang, Zhikai Li, Xuewen Liu, Qingyi Gu

entry.summary: Efficient-SAM2 accelerates SAM2 for video object segmentation through object-aware visual encoding and memory retrieval, exploiting the observation that SAM2 exhibits sparse perception patterns similar to biological vision.

entry.title: Revisiting [CLS] and Patch Token Interaction in Vision Transformers

author.name: Alexis Marouani, Oriane Sim\'eoni, Herv\'e J\'egou, Piotr Bojanowski, Huy V. Vo

entry.summary: This work investigates the interaction between [CLS] and patch tokens in Vision Transformers, revealing that normalization layers implicitly differentiate them. Specialized processing paths are proposed to disentangle global and local feature computation.

entry.title: ALIVE: Animate Your World with Lifelike Audio-Video Generation

author.name: Ying Guo, Qijun Gan, Yifu Zhang, Jinlai Liu, Yifei Hu, Pan Xie, Dongjun Qian, Yu Zhang, Ruiqi Li, Yuqi Zhang, Ruibiao Lu, Xiaofeng Mei, Bo Han, Xiang Yin, Bingyue Peng, Zehuan Yuan

entry.summary: ALIVE adapts a pretrained text-to-video model for synchronized audio-video generation including realistic lip-synced speech and sound effects, using TA-CrossAttn for temporal alignment and UniTemp-RoPE for audio-visual synchronization.

entry.title: Dynamic Black-hole Emission Tomography with Physics-informed Neural Fields

author.name: Berthy T. Feng, Andrew A. Chael, David Bromley, Aviad Levis, William T. Freeman, Katherine L. Bouman

entry.summary: Proposes PI-DEF, a physics-informed neural field approach for dynamic 3D black hole emission tomography that overcomes restrictive Keplerian dynamics assumptions. Extends BH-NeRF by incorporating general relativistic physics constraints for gas dynamics near black holes.

entry.title: Controlled Flight of an Insect-Scale Flapping-Wing Robot via Integrated Onboard Sensing and Computation

author.name: Yi-Hsuan Hsiao, Quang Phuc Kieu, Zhongtao Guan, Suhan Kim, Jiaze Cai, Owen Matteson, Jonathan P. How, Elizabeth Farrell Helbling, YuFeng Chen

entry.summary: Demonstrates a 1.29-gram insect-scale flapping-wing robot capable of hovering and trajectory tracking with solely onboard sensing and computation, achieving centimeter-scale accuracy. A significant milestone in micro-aerial robotics.

entry.title: SteerVLA: Steering Vision-Language-Action Models in Long-Tail Driving Scenarios

author.name: Tian Gao, Celine Tan, Catherine Glossop, Timothy Gao, Jiankai Sun, Kyle Stachowicz, Shirley Wu, Oier Mees, Dorsa Sadigh, Sergey Levine, Chelsea Finn

entry.summary: Proposes SteerVLA for autonomous driving that uses VLMs to generate fine-grained language instructions that steer a VLA driving policy, integrating high-level semantic reasoning for long-tail events with low-level reactive control.

entry.title: Conformal changepoint localization

author.name: Rohan Hore, Aaditya Ramdas

entry.summary: Introduces CONCH, a distribution-free algorithm for offline changepoint localization that produces finite-sample confidence sets using only exchangeability assumptions. Unlike existing methods that rely on parametric assumptions or asymptotic approximations, CONCH provides guaranteed coverage without distributional assumptions.

entry.title: TextResNet: Decoupling and Routing Optimization Signals in Compound AI Systems via Deep Residual Tuning

author.name: Suizhi Huang, Mei Li, Han Yu, Xiaoxiao Li

entry.summary: Proposes TextResNet to fix deep-chain failures in textual gradient optimization (TextGrad) for compound AI systems, introducing residual-style semantic gradient routing to prevent attribution ambiguity in extended workflows.

entry.title: ReRoPE: Repurposing RoPE for Relative Camera Control

author.name: Chunyang Li, Yuanbo Yang, Jiahao Shao, Hongyu Zhou, Katja Schwarz, Yiyi Liao

entry.summary: ReRoPE repurposes Rotary Position Embeddings (RoPE) to encode relative camera poses for controllable video generation. This plug-and-play approach avoids architectural changes to pre-trained video diffusion models while providing shift-invariant camera control.

entry.title: Steer2Adapt: Dynamically Composing Steering Vectors Elicits Efficient Adaptation of LLMs

author.name: Pengrui Han, Xueqiang Xu, Keyang Xuan, Peiyang Song, Siru Ouyang, Runchu Tian, Yuqing Jiang, Cheng Qian, Pengcheng Jiang, Jiashuo Sun, Junxia Cui, Ming Zhong, Ge Liu, Jiawei Han, Jiaxuan You

entry.summary: Steer2Adapt proposes composing steering vectors from a reusable semantic prior subspace rather than learning new ones per task. This enables lightweight adaptation of LLMs to new tasks by dynamically combining pre-computed concept dimensions, improving over static single-direction steering methods.

entry.title: Joint Reward Modeling: Internalizing Chain-of-Thought for Efficient Visual Reward Models

author.name: Yankai Yang, Yancheng Long, Hongyang Wei, Wei Chen, Tianke Zhang, Kaiyu Jiang, Haonan Fan, Changyi Liu, Jiankang Chen, Kaiyu Tang, Bin Wen, Fan Yang, Tingting Gao, Han Li, Shuo Yang

entry.summary: Joint Reward Modeling (JRM) combines the strengths of discriminative and generative reward models by internalizing chain-of-thought reasoning during training. This produces reward models that are both semantically rich and efficient at inference, targeting complex tasks like image editing.

entry.title: InfiCoEvalChain: A Blockchain-Based Decentralized Framework for Collaborative LLM Evaluation

author.name: Yifan Yang, Jinjia Li, Kunxi Li, Puhao Zheng, Yuanyi Wang, Zheyan Qu, Yang Yu, Jianmin Wu, Ming Li, Hongxia Yang

entry.summary: InfiCoEvalChain proposes decentralized LLM evaluation via blockchain, revealing that standard deviation across repeated runs on HumanEval exceeds the performance gap among top models. This makes current rankings statistically precarious and motivates heterogeneous distributed evaluation.

entry.title: Do MLLMs Really See It: Reinforcing Visual Attention in Multimodal LLMs

author.name: Siqu Ou, Tianrui Wan, Zhiyuan Zhao, Junyu Gao, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: SAYO trains multimodal LLMs with reinforcement learning using region-level visual attention rewards to address 'weak visual focus' — where early visual misalignment propagates through reasoning chains without correction. It improves credit assignment for visual attention during training.

entry.title: SCOUT-RAG: Scalable and Cost-Efficient Unifying Traversal for Agentic Graph-RAG over Distributed Domains

author.name: Longkun Li, Yuanben Zou, Jinghan Wu, Yuqing Wen, Jing Li, Hangwei Qian, Ivor Tsang

entry.summary: Introduces SCOUT-RAG, a distributed agentic Graph-RAG framework for progressive cross-domain retrieval in access-restricted settings like hospitals. Uses four cooperative agents for domain relevance estimation and retrieval depth control.

entry.title: Does Visual Rendering Bypass Tokenization? Investigating Script-Tokenizer Misalignment in Pixel-Based Language Models

author.name: Lucky Susanto, Musa Izzanardi Wijanarko, Khumaisa Nur'aini, Farid Adilazuarda, Alham Fikri Aji, Derry Tanti Wijaya

entry.summary: Investigates whether pixel-based language modeling truly bypasses tokenization constraints, finding that reintegrating text tokenizers in DualGPT reintroduces tokenization limitations for low-resource non-Latin scripts.

entry.title: What is Safety? Corporate Discourse, Power, and the Politics of Generative AI Safety

author.name: Ankolika De, Gabriel Lima, Yixin Zou

entry.summary: Examines how leading generative AI companies construct 'safety' through public-facing documents, arguing corporate safety discourse consolidates legitimacy and constrains alternative governance approaches.

entry.title: Behavioral Consistency Validation for LLM Agents: An Analysis of Trading-Style Switching through Stock-Market Simulation

author.name: Zeping Li, Guancheng Wan, Keyang Chen, Yu Chen, Yiwen Zhao, Philip Torr, Guangnan Ye, Zhenfei Yin, Hongfeng Chai

entry.summary: Tests whether LLM agents in stock market simulations exhibit behaviorally consistent trading-style switching aligned with financial theory, providing a framework for validating agent behavioral consistency.

entry.title: TACIT: Transformation-Aware Capturing of Implicit Thought

author.name: Daniel Nobrega

entry.summary: TACIT is a diffusion-based transformer that performs visual reasoning entirely in pixel space using rectified flow, enabling direct visualization of reasoning steps. Demonstrated on maze-solving with a 192x reduction in training loss and requiring only 10 Euler steps versus typical 100-1000 for diffusion models.

entry.title: RealFin: How Well Do LLMs Reason About Finance When Users Leave Things Unsaid?

author.name: Yuyang Dai, Yan Lin, Zhuohan Xie, Yuxia Wang

entry.summary: RealFin is a bilingual benchmark evaluating financial reasoning by systematically removing essential premises from exam-style questions while keeping them linguistically plausible, testing whether LLMs can recognize missing information and reject unjustified answers.

entry.title: Mimetic Initialization of MLPs

author.name: Asher Trockman, J. Zico Kolter

entry.summary: Mimetic initialization applied to MLPs for the first time - giving the first layer a nonzero mean speeds up training on vision tasks like CIFAR-10 and ImageNet-1k, inspired by patterns observed in pretrained model weights. From Trockman and Kolter (CMU).

entry.title: Fin-RATE: A Real-world Financial Analytics and Tracking Evaluation Benchmark for LLMs on SEC Filings

author.name: Yidong Jiang, Junrong Chen, Eftychia Makri, Jialin Chen, Peiwen Li, Ali Maatouk, Leandros Tassiulas, Eliot Brenner, Bing Xiang, Rex Ying

entry.summary: Fin-RATE is a benchmark on SEC filings designed to diagnose whether LLM errors in financial analysis stem from retrieval failures, generation flaws, or reasoning mistakes, requiring synthesis across multiple documents and periods.

entry.title: Action-to-Action Flow Matching

author.name: Jindou Jia, Gen Li, Xiangyu Chen, Tuo An, Yuxuan Hu, Jingliang Li, Xinying Guo, Jianfei Yang

entry.summary: Action-to-Action flow matching (A2A) speeds up diffusion-based robot policies by initializing from previous actions rather than random Gaussian noise, reducing inference latency for real-time control.

entry.title: SERE: Similarity-based Expert Re-routing for Efficient Batch Decoding in MoE Models

author.name: Juntong Wu, Jialiang Cheng, Fuyu Lv, Ou Dan, Li Yuan

entry.summary: SERE proposes similarity-based expert re-routing for efficient batch decoding in MoE models, dynamically reducing active experts by re-routing tokens from secondary to similar primary experts.

entry.title: On the Infinite Width and Depth Limits of Predictive Coding Networks

author.name: Francesco Innocenti, El Mehdi Achour, Rafal Bogacz

entry.summary: Studies infinite width and depth limits of predictive coding networks, showing the set of stable feature-learning parameterizations for PC matches backpropagation exactly, and PC energy converges to BP loss under these parameterizations.

entry.title: Scalable Adaptation of 3D Geometric Foundation Models via Weak Supervision from Internet Video

author.name: Zihui Gao, Ke Liu, Donny Y. Chen, Duochao Shi, Guosheng Lin, Hao Chen, Chunhua Shen

entry.summary: SAGE proposes scalable adaptation of 3D geometric foundation models using weak supervision from internet videos, with a hierarchical mining pipeline for training trajectories and hybrid supervision.

entry.title: A Kinetic-Energy Perspective of Flow Matching

author.name: Ziyun Li, Huancheng Hu, Soon Hoe Lim, Xuyu Li, Fei Gao, Enmao Diao, Zezhen Ding, Michalis Vazirgiannis, Henrik Bostrom

entry.summary: Introduces Kinetic Path Energy (KPE), a per-sample diagnostic for flow-based generative models that measures kinetic effort along ODE trajectories, showing higher KPE predicts stronger semantic fidelity.

entry.title: Lost in Translation? A Comparative Study on the Cross-Lingual Transfer of Composite Harms

author.name: Vaibhav Shukla, Hardik Sharma, Adith N Reganti, Soham Wasmatkar, Bagesh Kumar, Vrijendra Singh

entry.summary: CompositeHarm benchmark examines how safety alignment holds across 6 languages, combining adversarial attacks and contextual harms. Finds some harm types survive translation while others distort or disappear.

entry.title: Don't Always Pick the Highest-Performing Model: An Information Theoretic View of LLM Ensemble Selection

author.name: Yigit Turkmen, Baturalp Buyukates, Melih Bastopcu

entry.summary: Formulates LLM ensemble selection as mutual information maximization, models correlated errors via Gaussian-copula, and proves an information-theoretic error floor. Shows that the highest-performing individual model isn't always best for ensembles.

entry.title: Dreaming in Code for Curriculum Learning in Open-Ended Worlds

author.name: Konstantinos Mitsides, Maxence Faldor, Antoine Cully

entry.summary: Proposes DiCode (Dreaming in Code), where foundation models generate executable environment code as curriculum for open-ended learning agents, scaffolding progression toward increasing competence.

entry.title: When and How Much to Imagine: Adaptive Test-Time Scaling with World Models for Visual Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Shoubin Yu, Yue Zhang, Zun Wang, Jaehong Yoon, Huaxiu Yao, Mingyu Ding, Mohit Bansal

entry.summary: Studies when and how much visual imagination via world models helps spatial reasoning in MLLMs. Finds indiscriminate imagination can degrade performance, and proposes adaptive test-time scaling.

entry.title: Noise Stability of Transformer Models

author.name: Themistoklis Haris, Zihan Zhang, Yuichi Yoshida

entry.summary: Proposes noise stability as a more comprehensive simplicity metric for Transformers than average sensitivity. Provides theoretical analysis showing noise stability captures 'junta-like' input dependence in modern LLMs.

entry.title: The Chicken and Egg Dilemma: Co-optimizing Data and Model Configurations for LLMs

author.name: Zhiliang Chen, Alfred Wei Lun Leong, Shao Yong Ong, Apivich Hemachandram, Gregory Kang Ruey Lau, Chuan-Sheng Foo, Zhengyuan Liu, Nancy F. Chen, Bryan Kian Hsiang Low

entry.summary: Introduces JoBS for jointly optimizing data and model configurations for LLM training using scaling-law-inspired performance predictor with Bayesian optimization. Addresses the chicken-and-egg problem of data-model co-optimization.

entry.title: Predicting Future Utility: Global Combinatorial Optimization for Task-Agnostic KV Cache Eviction

author.name: Ziyao Tang, Pengkun Jiao, Xinhang Chen, Wei Liu, Shiyong Li, Jingjing Chen

entry.summary: Proposes LU-KV, a KV cache eviction framework that optimizes head-level budget allocation based on marginal utility of preserving long-term semantic information, rather than using instantaneous heuristic metrics. Accounts for heterogeneity in predictive fidelity across attention heads.

entry.title: Permissive-Washing in the Open AI Supply Chain: A Large-Scale Audit of License Integrity

author.name: James Jewitt, Gopi Krishnan Rajbahadur, Hao Li, Bram Adams, Ahmed E. Hassan

entry.summary: Conducts large-scale audit of license integrity in open-source AI, finding widespread 'permissive washing' where AI artifacts are labeled as freely usable while omitting required legal documentation like license text and attribution.

entry.title: Understanding Dynamic Compute Allocation in Recurrent Transformers

author.name: Ibraheem Muhammad Moosa, Suhas Lohit, Ye Wang, Moitreya Chatterjee, Wenpeng Yin

entry.summary: Introduces ANIRA, a unified recurrent Transformer framework for studying per-token adaptive computation, with a complexity-controlled evaluation paradigm using algorithmic tasks where token-level difficulty is directly observable.

entry.title: StretchTime: Adaptive Time Series Forecasting via Symplectic Attention

author.name: Yubin Kim, Viresh Pati, Jevon Twitty, Vinh Pham, Shihao Yang, Jiecheng Lu

entry.summary: StretchTime proposes Symplectic Positional Embeddings (SyPE) derived from Hamiltonian mechanics for time series forecasting, proving that RoPE cannot represent non-affine temporal warping and offering a principled alternative.

entry.title: Adaptive Retrieval helps Reasoning in LLMs -- but mostly if it's not used

author.name: Srijan Shakya, Anamaria-Roberta Hartl, Sepp Hochreiter, Korbinian P\"oppel

entry.summary: Explores adaptive retrieval-augmented generation where an LLM agent decides when to query an external knowledge base during reasoning. Finds that adaptive retrieval helps mostly by learning when NOT to retrieve, with static retrieval hurting performance on math benchmarks.

entry.title: ODELoRA: Training Low-Rank Adaptation by Solving Ordinary Differential Equations

author.name: Yihang Gao, Vincent Y. F. Tan

entry.summary: Proposes ODELoRA, which reformulates LoRA training as solving an ordinary differential equation that emulates gradient flow on the full adaptation matrix. Claims theoretically and empirically superior optimization compared to standard LoRA training.

entry.title: MaD-Mix: Multi-Modal Data Mixtures via Latent Space Coupling for Vision-Language Model Training

author.name: Wanyun Xie, Francesco Tonin, Volkan Cevher

entry.summary: Proposes MaD-Mix, a principled framework for deriving multi-modal data mixtures for VLM training. Uses modality-aware domain alignment maximization with closed-form solutions, handling domains with missing modalities.

entry.title: Efficient and Adaptable Detection of Malicious LLM Prompts via Bootstrap Aggregation

author.name: Shayan Ali Hassan, Tao Ni, Zafar Ayyub Qazi, Marco Canini

entry.summary: Presents BAGEL, a bootstrap aggregation approach for detecting malicious LLM prompts (harmful requests, jailbreaks, prompt injection) that balances performance, efficiency, and adaptability. Addresses limitations of both black-box moderation APIs and expensive white-box LLM judge approaches.

entry.title: CADO: From Imitation to Cost Minimization for Heatmap-based Solvers in Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Hyungseok Song, Deunsol Yoon, Kanghoon Lee, Han-Seul Jeong, Soonyoung Lee, Woohyung Lim

entry.summary: Identifies an objective mismatch in supervised learning for heatmap-based combinatorial optimization solvers (Decoder-Blindness and Cost-Blindness) and proposes CADO, an RL fine-tuning approach using diffusion models to directly optimize solution cost.

entry.title: Fast Flow Matching based Conditional Independence Tests for Causal Discovery

author.name: Shunyu Zhao, Yanfeng Yang, Shuai Li, Kenji Fukumizu

entry.summary: Proposes FMCIT, a flow matching-based conditional independence test for causal discovery that requires training only once throughout the entire procedure, substantially accelerating constraint-based causal discovery.

entry.title: Estimating Aleatoric Uncertainty in the Causal Treatment Effect

author.name: Liyuan Xu, Bijan Mazaheri

entry.summary: Introduces VTE and CVTE as measures of aleatoric uncertainty in treatment effects, showing they are identifiable even with unobserved confounders, and proposes nonparametric kernel-based estimators with convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Central Dogma Transformer II: An AI Microscope for Understanding Cellular Regulatory Mechanisms

author.name: Nobuyuki Ota

entry.summary: Presents CDT-II, an 'AI microscope' whose transformer architecture mirrors the central dogma of biology, making attention maps directly interpretable as DNA regulatory relationships, gene co-regulation, and transcriptional control.

entry.title: Where Not to Learn: Prior-Aligned Training with Subset-based Attribution Constraints for Reliable Decision-Making

author.name: Ruoyu Chen, Shangquan Sun, Xiaoqing Guo, Sanyi Zhang, Kangwei Liu, Shiming Liu, Zhangcheng Wang, Qunli Zhang, Hua Zhang, Xiaochun Cao

entry.summary: Proposes an attribution-based method to align model decisions with human priors by encoding expected input regions (e.g., bounding boxes) and using subset-selection attribution to constrain where models look. Addresses shortcut learning.

entry.title: Physical Analog Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks based on Reconfigurable Nonlinear-Processing Units

author.name: Manuel Escudero, Mohamadreza Zolfagharinejad, Sjoerd van den Belt, Nikolaos Alachiotis, Wilfred G. van der Wiel

entry.summary: Introduces physical analog Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KANs) using reconfigurable nonlinear nanoscale silicon devices as edge functions. Demonstrates a hardware implementation of KAN-style regression with analog processing units.

entry.title: Tighter Information-Theoretic Generalization Bounds via a Novel Class of Change of Measure Inequalities

author.name: Yanxiao Liu, Yijun Fan an Deniz G\"und\"uz

entry.summary: Proposes a novel class of change-of-measure inequalities via f-divergence data processing inequality, yielding tighter information-theoretic generalization bounds for stochastic learning algorithms.

entry.title: Fundamental Limits of Community Detection in Contextual Multi-Layer Stochastic Block Models

author.name: Shuyang Gong, Dong Huang, Zhangsong Li

entry.summary: Derives sharp thresholds for community detection from joint observation of covariates and multiple sparse networks. Resolves a conjecture and extends prior work to constant-degree regimes with noisy measurements.

entry.title: Schr\"odinger bridge problem via empirical risk minimization

author.name: Denis Belomestny, Alexey Naumov, Nikita Puchkin, Denis Suchkov

entry.summary: Proposes a learning-theoretic approach to the Schrödinger bridge problem, estimating potentials via empirical risk minimization with uniform concentration guarantees under sub-Gaussian assumptions.

entry.title: Trajectory Stitching for Solving Inverse Problems with Flow-Based Models

author.name: Alexander Denker, Moshe Eliasof, Zeljko Kereta, Carola-Bibiane Sch\"onlieb

entry.summary: Proposes MS-Flow for solving inverse problems with flow-based generative models by representing trajectories as sequences of intermediate states rather than optimizing the initial code, reducing memory while improving reconstruction.

entry.title: Learning to Judge: LLMs Designing and Applying Evaluation Rubrics

author.name: Clemencia Siro, Pourya Aliannejadi, Mohammad Aliannejadi

entry.summary: Introduces GER-Eval to investigate whether LLMs can design and apply their own evaluation rubrics. Finds LLMs generate interpretable criteria and apply them consistently, but scoring degrades in factual settings.

entry.title: ReBeCA: Unveiling Interpretable Behavior Hierarchy behind the Iterative Self-Reflection of Language Models with Causal Analysis

author.name: Tianqiang Yan, Sihan Shang, Yuheng Li, Song Qiu, Hao Peng, Wenjian Luo, Jue Xie, Lizhen Qu, Yuan Gao

entry.summary: Introduces ReBeCA, a framework that uses causal analysis to understand self-reflection behavior in LLMs. Uses Invariant Causal Prediction to identify genuine determinants of self-reflection outcomes, revealing a behavioral hierarchy.

entry.title: CORE: Comprehensive Ontological Relation Evaluation for Large Language Models

author.name: Satyam Dwivedi, Sanjukta Ghosh, Shivam Dwivedi, Nishi Kumari, Anil Thakur, Anurag Purushottam, Deepak Alok, Praveen Gatla, Manjuprasad B, Bipasha Patgiri

entry.summary: Introduces CORE, a 225K question dataset spanning 74 disciplines for evaluating LLMs' ability to distinguish semantic relations from genuine unrelatedness. Finds LLMs achieve only 48-70% vs human 92.6%, with near-ceiling on related pairs but failing on unrelated ones.

entry.title: FairJudge: An Adaptive, Debiased, and Consistent LLM-as-a-Judge

author.name: Bo Yang, Lanfei Feng, Yunkui Chen, Yu Zhang, Xiao Xu, Shijian Li

entry.summary: Proposes FairJudge, an LLM-as-a-Judge system that addresses limited adaptivity, systematic biases, and evaluation inconsistency. Models judging as a learnable, regularized policy with multi-mode consistency training.

entry.title: The Representational Geometry of Number

author.name: Zhimin Hu, Lanhao Niu, Sashank Varma

entry.summary: Studies how number representations in language models preserve stable relational structure across tasks while being embedded in task-specific subspaces. Proposes representational sharing lies in geometric relations rather than concepts themselves.

entry.title: PhenoLIP: Integrating Phenotype Ontology Knowledge into Medical Vision-Language Pretraining

author.name: Cheng Liang, Chaoyi Wu, Weike Zhao, Ya Zhang, Yanfeng Wang, Weidi Xie

entry.summary: Constructs PhenoKG, a large-scale phenotype-centric multimodal knowledge graph with 520K+ image-text pairs linked to 3,000+ phenotypes, and proposes PhenoLIP, a pretraining framework that incorporates structured phenotype knowledge into medical vision-language models.

entry.title: AgentCPM-Report: Interleaving Drafting and Deepening for Open-Ended Deep Research

author.name: Yishan Li, Wentong Chen, Yukun Yan, Mingwei Li, Sen Mei, Xiaorong Wang, Kunpeng Liu, Xin Cong, Shuo Wang, Zhong Zhang, Yaxi Lu, Zhenghao Liu, Yankai Lin, Zhiyuan Liu, Maosong Sun

entry.summary: Presents AgentCPM-Report, a lightweight local solution for generating deep research reports that interleaves drafting and deepening rather than following a plan-then-write paradigm. Addresses privacy concerns with closed-source models by providing a deployable local alternative.

entry.title: Rolling Sink: Bridging Limited-Horizon Training and Open-Ended Testing in Autoregressive Video Diffusion

author.name: Haodong Li, Shaoteng Liu, Zhe Lin, Manmohan Chandraker

entry.summary: Proposes Rolling Sink, a training-free method to bridge the gap between limited-horizon training and open-ended testing in autoregressive video diffusion models, through systematic analysis of AR cache dynamics.

entry.title: Thinking in Structures: Evaluating Spatial Intelligence through Reasoning on Constrained Manifolds

author.name: Chen Yang, Guanxin Lin, Youquan He, Peiyao Chen, Guanghe Liu, Yufan Mo, Zhouyuan Xu, Linhao Wang, Guohui Zhang, Zihang Zhang, Shenxiang Zeng, Chen Wang, Jiansheng Fan

entry.summary: Introduces SSI-Bench, a VQA benchmark for spatial reasoning on constrained manifolds from complex 3D structures, requiring compositional spatial operations like mental rotation, cross-sectional inference, and force-path reasoning.

entry.title: D-ORCA: Dialogue-Centric Optimization for Robust Audio-Visual Captioning

author.name: Changli Tang, Tianyi Wang, Fengyun Rao, Jing Lyu, Chao Zhang

entry.summary: D-ORCA introduces a dialogue-centric omni-modal LLM for audio-visual captioning that accurately identifies who spoke what and when in videos. It includes DVD, a large-scale bilingual dataset of 40K multi-party dialogue videos and uses group relative policy optimization with novel reward functions for speaker attribution accuracy.

entry.title: Omni-Video 2: Scaling MLLM-Conditioned Diffusion for Unified Video Generation and Editing

author.name: Hao Yang, Zhiyu Tan, Jia Gong, Luozheng Qin, Hesen Chen, Xiaomeng Yang, Yuqing Sun, Yuetan Lin, Mengping Yang, Hao Li

entry.summary: Omni-Video 2 connects pretrained MLLMs with video diffusion models for unified video generation and editing, using MLLM understanding to produce explicit target captions that guide the generative process.

entry.title: Guidestar-Free Adaptive Optics with Asymmetric Apertures

author.name: Weiyun Jiang, Haiyun Guo, Christopher A. Metzler, Ashok Veeraraghavan

entry.summary: The first closed-loop adaptive optics system that corrects aberrations in real-time without a guidestar or wavefront sensor, using asymmetric apertures and machine learning for computational wavefront sensing.

entry.title: Dexterous Manipulation Policies from RGB Human Videos via 4D Hand-Object Trajectory Reconstruction

author.name: Hongyi Chen, Tony Dong, Tiancheng Wu, Liquan Wang, Yash Jangir, Yaru Niu, Yufei Ye, Homanga Bharadhwaj, Zackory Erickson, Jeffrey Ichnowski

entry.summary: Proposes VIDEOMANIP, a framework that learns dexterous manipulation directly from RGB human videos without specialized sensing equipment. Reconstructs 4D robot-object trajectories from monocular videos by estimating hand poses, object meshes, and retargeting to robotic hands.

entry.title: RLinf-USER: A Unified and Extensible System for Real-World Online Policy Learning in Embodied AI

author.name: Hongzhi Zang, Shu'ang Yu, Hao Lin, Tianxing Zhou, Zefang Huang, Zhen Guo, Xin Xu, Jiakai Zhou, Yuze Sheng, Shizhe Zhang, Feng Gao, Wenhao Tang, Yufeng Yue, Quanlu Zhang, Xinlei Chen, Chao Yu, Yu Wang

entry.summary: Presents USER, a unified system for real-world online reinforcement learning on physical robots that treats robots as first-class hardware resources alongside GPUs, enabling automatic discovery, management, and scheduling of heterogeneous hardware.

entry.title: TwinRL-VLA: Digital Twin-Driven Reinforcement Learning for Real-World Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Qinwen Xu, Jiaming Liu, Rui Zhou, Shaojun Shi, Nuowei Han, Zhuoyang Liu, Chenyang Gu, Shuo Gu, Yang Yue, Gao Huang, Wenzhao Zheng, Sirui Han, Peng Jia, Shanghang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes TwinRL, a digital twin-real-world collaborative RL framework for VLA models that uses digital twins to expand the effective exploration space during online fine-tuning, addressing the limited exploration efficiency of real-world RL.

entry.title: Fast Response or Silence: Conversation Persistence in an AI-Agent Social Network

author.name: Aysajan Eziz

entry.summary: Studies conversation dynamics on Moltbook, an AI-agent social network, introducing the concept of 'interaction half-life' to measure how quickly reply probability decays. Finds that AI agent discussions are dominated by shallow first-layer reactions with rare extended back-and-forth, with replies arriving in seconds but persistence only on the order of minutes.

entry.title: NAAMSE: Framework for Evolutionary Security Evaluation of Agents

author.name: Kunal Pai, Parth Shah, Harshil Patel

entry.summary: NAAMSE proposes an evolutionary framework for AI agent security evaluation that uses genetic prompt mutation and behavioral scoring to iteratively compound effective attack strategies while maintaining benign-use correctness. It reframes security evaluation as feedback-driven optimization rather than static benchmarking.

entry.title: GraphAgents: Knowledge Graph-Guided Agentic AI for Cross-Domain Materials Design

author.name: Isabella A. Stewart, Tarjei Paule Hage, Yu-Chuan Hsu, Markus J. Buehler

entry.summary: GraphAgents uses multi-agent LLMs guided by knowledge graphs to find sustainable substitutes for PFAS chemicals. Agents explore cross-domain connections between molecular chemistry and mechanical performance, leveraging graph structure to reduce hallucinations. By Markus Buehler's group at MIT.

entry.title: IV Co-Scientist: Multi-Agent LLM Framework for Causal Instrumental Variable Discovery

author.name: Ivaxi Sheth, Zhijing Jin, Bryan Wilder, Dominik Janzing, Mario Fritz

entry.summary: IV Co-Scientist uses a multi-agent LLM framework to discover causal instrumental variables. It evaluates whether LLMs can recover known instruments and avoid discredited ones, then introduces a co-scientist system that integrates this capability. Authors include Zhijing Jin and Mario Fritz.

entry.title: Who Deserves the Reward? SHARP: Shapley Credit-based Optimization for Multi-Agent System

author.name: Yanming Li, Xuelin Zhang, WenJie Lu, Ziye Tang, Maodong Wu, Haotian Luo, Tongtong Wu, Zijie Peng, Hongze Mi, Yibo Feng, Naiqiang Tan, Chao Huang, Hong Chen, Li Shen

entry.summary: SHARP applies Shapley value-based credit attribution to multi-agent reinforcement learning for LLM tool-use systems. It addresses the credit assignment problem by precisely measuring each agent's contribution to trajectory success or failure.

entry.title: An Attention Mechanism for Robust Multimodal Integration in a Global Workspace Architecture

author.name: Roland Bertin-Johannet, Lara Scipio, Leopold Mayti\'e, Rufin VanRullen

entry.summary: Proposes a top-down attention mechanism for Global Workspace Theory-inspired multimodal architectures, demonstrating improved noise robustness on multimodal datasets. Connects cognitive neuroscience theory to computational architectures.

entry.title: Learning the Value Systems of Societies with Preference-based Multi-objective Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Andr\'es Holgado-S\'anchez, Peter Vamplew, Richard Dazeley, Sascha Ossowski, Holger Billhardt

entry.summary: Proposes algorithms for learning value systems of societies using preference-based multi-objective reinforcement learning, aiming to represent diverse value-based preferences across user groups.

entry.title: GEBench: Benchmarking Image Generation Models as GUI Environments

author.name: Haodong Li, Jingwei Wu, Quan Sun, Guopeng Li, Juanxi Tian, Huanyu Zhang, Yanlin Lai, Ruichuan An, Hongbo Peng, Yuhong Dai, Chenxi Li, Chunmei Qing, Jia Wang, Ziyang Meng, Zheng Ge, Xiangyu Zhang, Daxin Jiang

entry.summary: Introduces GEBench, a benchmark for evaluating image generation models as GUI environment simulators, testing dynamic interaction and temporal coherence in GUI generation with 700 curated samples.

entry.title: MosaicThinker: On-Device Visual Spatial Reasoning for Embodied AI via Iterative Construction of Space Representation

author.name: Haoming Wang, Qiyao Xue, Weichen Liu, Wei Gao

entry.summary: MosaicThinker enhances on-device small VLMs' spatial reasoning for embodied AI by iteratively constructing space representations from video frames, addressing the lack of 3D spatial knowledge in current VLMs.

entry.title: WorldEdit: Towards Open-World Image Editing with a Knowledge-Informed Benchmark

author.name: Wang Lin, Feng Wang, Majun Zhang, Wentao Hu, Tao Jin, Zhou Zhao, Fei Wu, Jingyuan Chen, Alan Yuille, Sucheng Ren

entry.summary: WorldEdit introduces a dataset for world-driven image editing that handles implicit editing instructions requiring world knowledge and reasoning, moving beyond explicit attribute manipulation.

entry.title: Fast and Robust Likelihood-Guided Diffusion Posterior Sampling with Amortized Variational Inference

author.name: L\'eon Zheng (MBZUAI, LRE), Thomas Hirtz (MBZUAI, LRE), Yazid Janati (MBZUAI, LRE), Eric Moulines (MBZUAI, LRE)

entry.summary: Introduces an amortization strategy for diffusion posterior sampling that preserves explicit likelihood guidance while accelerating inference for in-distribution degradations and maintaining robustness to unseen degradations.

entry.title: scDFM: Distributional Flow Matching Model for Robust Single-Cell Perturbation Prediction

author.name: Chenglei Yu, Chuanrui Wang, Bangyan Liao, Tailin Wu

entry.summary: scDFM presents a conditional flow matching framework for predicting single-cell perturbation responses that models full distributions rather than assuming cell-level correspondences, incorporating MMD objective for population-level alignment.

entry.title: The Median is Easier than it Looks: Approximation with a Constant-Depth, Linear-Width ReLU Network

author.name: Abhigyan Dutta, Itay Safran, Paul Valiant

entry.summary: Shows that the median of d inputs can be approximated by a constant-depth, linear-width ReLU network with exponentially small error, breaking a barrier suggested by prior work on the maximum function.

entry.title: Fine-R1: Make Multi-modal LLMs Excel in Fine-Grained Visual Recognition by Chain-of-Thought Reasoning

author.name: Hulingxiao He, Zijun Geng, Yuxin Peng

entry.summary: Fine-R1 adapts MLLMs for fine-grained visual recognition through R1-style training with chain-of-thought reasoning, addressing the performance gap compared to contrastive CLIP models with minimal annotated data.

entry.title: Learnable Chernoff Baselines for Inference-Time Alignment

author.name: Sunil Madhow, Yuchen Liang, Ness Shroff, Yingbin Liang, Yu-Xiang Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Learnable Chernoff Baselines for inference-time reward-guided alignment, using rejection sampling with adaptive acceptance probabilities and black-box sampling access to pretrained models.

entry.title: How well are open sourced AI-generated image detection models out-of-the-box: A comprehensive benchmark study

author.name: Simiao Ren (Neo), Yuchen Zhou (Neo), Xingyu Shen (Neo), Kidus Zewde (Neo), Tommy Duong (Neo), George Huang (Neo), Hatsanai (Neo), Tiangratanakul (Dennis), Tsang (Dennis), Ng (Dennis), En Wei, Jiayu Xue

entry.summary: Comprehensive zero-shot evaluation of 16 AI-generated image detection methods (23 variants) across 12 datasets with 2.6M images spanning 291 generators, providing the first systematic out-of-the-box benchmark.

entry.title: SPD-Faith Bench: Diagnosing and Improving Faithfulness in Chain-of-Thought for Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Weijiang Lv, Yaoxuan Feng, Xiaobo Xia, Jiayu Wang, Yan Jing, Wenchao Chen, Bo Chen

entry.summary: SPD-Faith Bench diagnoses faithfulness failures in chain-of-thought reasoning for MLLMs, identifying perceptual blindness and perception-reasoning dissociation as systematic failure modes traceable to decaying visual attention.

entry.title: MIND: Benchmarking Memory Consistency and Action Control in World Models

author.name: Yixuan Ye, Xuanyu Lu, Yuxin Jiang, Yuchao Gu, Rui Zhao, Qiwei Liang, Jiachun Pan, Fengda Zhang, Weijia Wu, Alex Jinpeng Wang

entry.summary: Introduces MIND, the first open-domain closed-loop benchmark for evaluating memory consistency and action control in world models, with 250 high-quality 1080p videos across diverse scenes and viewpoints.

entry.title: Self-Supervised Bootstrapping of Action-Predictive Embodied Reasoning

author.name: Milan Ganai, Katie Luo, Jonas Frey, Clark Barrett, Marco Pavone

entry.summary: Introduces R&B-EnCoRe for self-supervised bootstrapping of embodied reasoning in VLA models. Treats reasoning as a latent variable with importance-weighted optimization, breaking the policy-reasoning chicken-and-egg problem.

entry.title: Linearization Explains Fine-Tuning in Large Language Models

author.name: Zahra Rahimi Afzal, Tara Esmaeilbeig, Mojtaba Soltanalian, Mesrob I. Ohannessian

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of fine-tuning through linearization, showing that with Euclidean distance inductive bias, fine-tuning becomes equivalent to learning with the NTK. Analyzes proximity between linear and linearized fine-tuning.

entry.title: Grokking in Linear Models for Logistic Regression

author.name: Nataraj Das, Atreya Vedantam, Chandrashekar Lakshminarayanan

entry.summary: Studies grokking (delayed generalization) in the simplest possible setting: linear models with logistic loss. Shows grokking occurs under margin-concentrated test data and adversarial attacks, connected to implicit bias of gradient descent.

entry.title: LLMs + Security = Trouble

author.name: Benjamin Livshits

entry.summary: Argues that using probabilistic AI to secure AI-generated code is fundamentally insufficient for the long tail of security bugs. Discusses challenges of combining LLMs with formal methods in 'vibe coding' workflows.

entry.title: Equalized Generative Treatment: Matching f-divergences for Fairness in Generative Models

author.name: Alexandre Verine, Rafael Pinot, Florian Le Bronnec

entry.summary: Introduces equalized generative treatment (EGT), a new fairness definition for generative models that requires comparable generation quality across sensitive groups, measured via f-divergence, rather than just balanced probability of generating samples.

entry.title: QUOKA: Query-Oriented KV Selection For Efficient LLM Prefill

author.name: Dalton Jones, Junyoung Park, Matthew Morse, Mingu Lee, Chris Lott, Harper Langston

entry.summary: QUOKA accelerates transformer prefill by identifying that low cosine similarity queries (relative to mean query) interact most strongly with more keys and contribute most to attention. Prioritizes these queries for efficient sparse attention.

entry.title: FlattenGPT: Depth Compression for Transformer with Layer Flattening

author.name: Ruihan Xu, Qingpei Guo, Yao Zhu, Xiangyang Ji, Ming Yang, Shiliang Zhang
