entry.summary: FlattenGPT proposes a novel depth compression approach that flattens two adjacent transformer blocks into one, reducing network depth while enabling more fine-grained channel pruning within the merged block.

entry.title: Risk-Sensitive Exponential Actor Critic

author.name: Alonso Granados, Jason Pacheco

entry.summary: Provides comprehensive theoretical justification for policy gradient methods on the entropic risk measure, including on- and off-policy gradient theorems, addressing the high-variance instability that has limited risk-sensitive deep RL.

entry.title: Nonparametric Bayesian Optimization for General Rewards

author.name: Zishi Zhang, Tao Ren, Yijie Peng

entry.summary: Proposes infinite Gaussian process (∞-GP) as a novel surrogate model for Bayesian optimization under reward model uncertainty. Achieves first no-regret guarantee for BO in a general reward setting with only Lipschitz continuity requirements.

entry.title: On the Importance of a Multi-Scale Calibration for Quantization

author.name: Seungwoo Son, Ingyu Seong, Junhan Kim, Hyemi Jang, Yongkweon Jeon

entry.summary: Proposes MaCa (Matryoshka Calibration) for length-aware calibration in post-training quantization of LLMs. Shows that input length affects activation distributions and Hessian estimates, and uses variable-length calibration sets.

entry.title: Beyond Arrow: From Impossibility to Possibilities in Multi-Criteria Benchmarking

author.name: Polina Gordienko, Christoph Jansen, Julian Rodemann, Georg Schollmeyer

entry.summary: Formalizes multi-criteria ML benchmarking as a social choice problem and identifies conditions where meaningful aggregation is possible despite Arrow's impossibility theorem. Provides practical guidance for benchmark design.

entry.title: Analyzing and Guiding Zero-Shot Posterior Sampling in Diffusion Models

author.name: Roi Benita, Michael Elad, Joseph Keshet

entry.summary: Provides rigorous analysis of zero-shot diffusion-based posterior sampling for inverse problems under Gaussian prior assumptions. Derives closed-form expressions for both ideal and approximate posterior samplers enabling spectral domain analysis.

entry.title: A Thermodynamic Theory of Learning Part II: Critical Period Closure and Continual Learning Failure

author.name: Daisuke Okanohara

entry.summary: Develops a thermodynamic theory of continual learning failure, showing how finite-time irreversibility creates 'critical period closure' where certain learning paths become dynamically inaccessible. Part II of a series.

entry.title: Mutual information and task-relevant latent dimensionality

author.name: Paarth Gulati, Eslam Abdelaleem, Audrey Sederberg, Ilya Nemenman

entry.summary: Casts estimation of task-relevant latent dimensionality as an Information Bottleneck problem, showing that standard neural MI estimators with separable critics inflate inferred dimension. Introduces a hybrid critic that maintains dimensional bottleneck while allowing nonlinear interactions.

entry.title: Interaction-Grounded Learning for Contextual Markov Decision Processes with Personalized Feedback

author.name: Mengxiao Zhang, Yuheng Zhang, Haipeng Luo, Paul Mineiro

entry.summary: Extends Interaction-Grounded Learning from single-step to contextual episodic MDPs with personalized feedback, providing efficient algorithms with sublinear regret guarantees for sequential decision-making with indirect feedback.

entry.title: Learning To Sample From Diffusion Models Via Inverse Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Constant Bourdrez, Alexandre V\'erine, Olivier Capp\'e

entry.summary: Introduces an inverse reinforcement learning framework for learning diffusion model sampling strategies, formulating sampling as an MDP where actions modify sampling dynamics, avoiding reward function specification.

entry.title: How2Everything: Mining the Web for How-To Procedures to Evaluate and Improve LLMs

author.name: Yapei Chang, Kyle Lo, Mohit Iyyer, Luca Soldaini

entry.summary: Introduces How2Everything, a scalable framework for evaluating LLM procedural generation, including How2Mine (351K mined procedures), How2Bench (7K evaluation set), and How2Score (LLM-judge evaluation protocol).

entry.title: Graph-Based Nearest-Neighbor Search without the Spread

author.name: Jeff Giliberti, Sariel Har-Peled, Jonas Sauer, Ali Vakilian

entry.summary: Shows how to construct a linear-size external data structure for approximate nearest-neighbor queries on graph-based indices that achieves logarithmic query time in n, removing dependency on the spread (ratio of max to min distance).

entry.title: BayesFlow 2.0: Multi-Backend Amortized Bayesian Inference in Python

author.name: Lars K\"uhmichel, Jerry M. Huang, Valentin Pratz, Jonas Arruda, Hans Olischl\"ager, Daniel Habermann, Simon Kucharsky, Lasse Elsem\"uller, Aayush Mishra, Niels Bracher, Svenja Jedhoff, Marvin Schmitt, Paul-Christian B\"urkner, Stefan T. Radev

entry.summary: Presents BayesFlow 2.0, a multi-backend Python library for amortized Bayesian inference using neural networks. Supports multiple deep learning backends and provides tools for posterior estimation, likelihood estimation, and model comparison.

entry.title: LLM-Guided Diagnostic Evidence Alignment for Medical Vision-Language Pretraining under Limited Pairing

author.name: Huimin Yan, Liang Bai, Xian Yang, Long Chen

entry.summary: Proposes LGDEA for medical vision-language pretraining that uses LLMs to extract diagnostic evidence from reports and aligns visual and textual representations at the evidence level rather than globally, requiring less paired data.

entry.title: On Generation in Metric Spaces

author.name: Jiaxun Li, Vinod Raman, Ambuj Tewari

entry.summary: Extends the generation framework of Kleinberg and Mullainathan to separable metric spaces, introducing (ε,ε')-closure dimension and characterizing generatability. Identifies sharp geometric contrasts between doubling and non-doubling spaces.

entry.title: GAAVI: Global Asymptotic Anytime Valid Inference for the Conditional Mean Function

author.name: Brian M Cho, Raaz Dwivedi, Nathan Kallus

entry.summary: Proposes GAAVI for asymptotic anytime-valid testing of conditional mean functions, enabling experimenters to make high-confidence decisions at any point during adaptive experiments with optimal sample complexity.

entry.title: Empirically Understanding the Value of Prediction in Allocation

author.name: Unai Fischer-Abaigar, Emily Aiken, Christoph Kern, Juan Carlos Perdomo

entry.summary: Develops an empirical toolkit to quantify the welfare impact of investing in better predictions versus other policy levers like expanding capacity or improving treatment quality. Applied to German employment services and Ethiopian poverty targeting as case studies.

entry.title: Analysis of Converged 3D Gaussian Splatting Solutions: Density Effects and Prediction Limit

author.name: Zhendong Wang, Cihan Ruan, Jingchuan Xiao, Chuqing Shi, Wei Jiang, Wei Wang, Wenjie Liu, Nam Ling

entry.summary: Analyzes the statistical properties of converged 3D Gaussian Splatting solutions, revealing stable patterns like mixture-structured scales and bimodal radiance. Discovers density-stratification where dense regions have geometry-correlated parameters while sparse regions show systematic prediction failure.

entry.title: Can One-sided Arguments Lead to Response Change in Large Language Models?

author.name: Pedro Cisneros-Velarde

entry.summary: Studies whether LLM responses to polemic questions can be steered by presenting one-sided arguments. Finds opinion steering occurs consistently across different stances, question formulations, and argument presentations.

entry.title: Completing Missing Annotation: Multi-Agent Debate for Accurate and Scalable Relevant Assessment for IR Benchmarks

author.name: Minjeong Ban, Jeonghwan Choi, Hyangsuk Min, Nicole Hee-Yeon Kim, Minseok Kim, Jae-Gil Lee, Hwanjun Song

entry.summary: Proposes DREAM, a multi-round debate framework with LLM agents for completing missing relevance annotations in IR benchmarks. Achieves 95.2% labeling accuracy with only 3.5% human involvement, producing the BRIDGE benchmark.

entry.title: Do Prompts Guarantee Safety? Mitigating Toxicity from LLM Generations through Subspace Intervention

author.name: Himanshu Singh, Ziwei Xu, A. V. Subramanyam, Mohan Kankanhalli

entry.summary: Presents a targeted subspace intervention strategy for identifying and suppressing toxic patterns in LLM hidden representations while preserving fluent generation. Applied to RealToxicityPrompts.

entry.title: Zero-Shot UAV Navigation in Forests via Relightable 3D Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Zinan Lv, Yeqian Qian, Chen Sang, Hao Liu, Danping Zou, Ming Yang

entry.summary: Proposes an end-to-end RL framework for zero-shot UAV navigation in forests using relightable 3D Gaussian Splatting to overcome the sim-to-real visual domain gap by decoupling lighting from geometry.

entry.title: SpatialReward: Bridging the Perception Gap in Online RL for Image Editing via Explicit Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Yancheng Long, Yankai Yang, Hongyang Wei, Wei Chen, Tianke Zhang, Haonan fan, Changyi Liu, Kaiyu Jiang, Jiankang Chen, Kaiyu Tang, Bin Wen, Fan Yang, Tingting Gao, Han Li, Shuo Yang

entry.summary: Proposes SpatialReward, a reward model for online RL-based image editing that uses explicit spatial reasoning to address 'Attention Collapse' where evaluators neglect cross-image comparisons and fine-grained details.

entry.title: Uncovering Modality Discrepancy and Generalization Illusion for General-Purpose 3D Medical Segmentation

author.name: Yichi Zhang, Feiyang Xiao, Le Xue, Wenbo Zhang, Gang Feng, Chenguang Zheng, Yuan Qi, Yuan Cheng, Zixin Hu

entry.summary: Reveals that 3D medical segmentation foundation models have significant modality discrepancy when evaluated on PET/CT vs PET/MRI, using intra-subject controlled comparisons to isolate imaging modality as the primary variable.

entry.title: MambaFusion: Adaptive State-Space Fusion for Multimodal 3D Object Detection

author.name: Venkatraman Narayanan, Bala Sai, Rahul Ahuja, Pratik Likhar, Varun Ravi Kumar, Senthil Yogamani

entry.summary: MambaFusion introduces a multimodal 3D detection framework for autonomous driving that interleaves selective state-space models with windowed transformers for efficient camera-LiDAR fusion. It achieves linear-time global context propagation while preserving local detail.

entry.title: Demo-ICL: In-Context Learning for Procedural Video Knowledge Acquisition

author.name: Yuhao Dong, Shulin Tian, Shuai Liu, Shuangrui Ding, Yuhang Zang, Xiaoyi Dong, Yuhang Cao, Jiaqi Wang, Ziwei Liu

entry.summary: Demo-ICL introduces a benchmark for demo-driven video in-context learning, where models must learn from demonstration videos to answer questions about target videos. Results show current MLLMs struggle significantly with this task.

entry.title: Improving Reconstruction of Representation Autoencoder

author.name: Siyu Liu, Chujie Qin, Hubery Yin, Qixin Yan, Zheng-Peng Duan, Chen Li, Jing Lyu, Chun-Le Guo, Chongyi Li

entry.summary: LV-RAE proposes a representation autoencoder that augments semantic features from vision foundation models with low-level information (color, texture) for high-fidelity reconstruction in latent diffusion models.

entry.title: TimeChat-Captioner: Scripting Multi-Scene Videos with Time-Aware and Structural Audio-Visual Captions

author.name: Linli Yao, Yuancheng Wei, Yaojie Zhang, Lei Li, Xinlong Chen, Feifan Song, Ziyue Wang, Kun Ouyang, Yuanxin Liu, Lingpeng Kong, Qi Liu, Pengfei Wan, Kun Gai, Yuanxing Zhang, Xu Sun

entry.summary: TimeChat-Captioner introduces Omni Dense Captioning, generating continuous fine-grained audio-visual narratives with timestamps using a six-dimensional structural schema. Includes OmniDCBench benchmark and SodaM evaluation metric.

entry.title: VideoVeritas: AI-Generated Video Detection via Perception Pretext Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Hao Tan, Jun Lan, Senyuan Shi, Zichang Tan, Zijian Yu, Huijia Zhu, Weiqiang Wang, Jun Wan, Zhen Lei

entry.summary: VideoVeritas detects AI-generated videos using perception pretext reinforcement learning, where spatiotemporal grounding and object counting tasks in the RL stage enhance fine-grained perception capabilities of MLLMs.

entry.title: $\chi_{0}$: Resource-Aware Robust Manipulation via Taming Distributional Inconsistencies

author.name: Checheng Yu, Chonghao Sima, Gangcheng Jiang, Hai Zhang, Haoguang Mai, Hongyang Li, Huijie Wang, Jin Chen, Kaiyang Wu, Li Chen, Lirui Zhao, Modi Shi, Ping Luo, Qingwen Bu, Shijia Peng, Tianyu Li, Yibo Yuan

entry.summary: Introduces χ₀, a resource-efficient framework for robust long-horizon robotic manipulation that identifies distributional shift between demonstration, learned policy, and test-time execution as the primary bottleneck rather than data scale alone.

entry.title: Grow with the Flow: 4D Reconstruction of Growing Plants with Gaussian Flow Fields

author.name: Weihan Luo, Lily Goli, Sherwin Bahmani, Felix Taubner, Andrea Tagliasacchi, David B. Lindell

entry.summary: This paper introduces a 3D Gaussian flow field representation for modeling plant growth, where time-varying derivatives over Gaussian parameters enable nonlinear and continuous-time growth dynamics including new geometry generation.

entry.title: PreFlect: From Retrospective to Prospective Reflection in Large Language Model Agents

author.name: Hanyu Wang, Yuanpu Cao, Lu Lin, Jinghui Chen

entry.summary: PreFlect introduces prospective reflection for LLM agents — criticizing and refining plans before execution rather than only retrospectively analyzing failures. It distills planning error patterns from historical trajectories and combines pre-execution foresight with dynamic memory for improved agent performance.

entry.title: Progressive Multi-Agent Reasoning for Biological Perturbation Prediction

author.name: Hyomin Kim, Sang-Yeon Hwang, Jaechang Lim, Yinhua Piao, Yunhak Oh, Woo Youn Kim, Chanyoung Park, Sungsoo Ahn, Junhyeok Jeon

entry.summary: PBio-Agent is a multi-agent framework for predicting gene regulation responses to chemical perturbations, targeting drug discovery applications. It introduces LINCSQA, a benchmark for bulk-cell chemical perturbations, and uses difficulty-aware task sequencing with iterative retrieval-augmented generation.

entry.title: ToolSelf: Unifying Task Execution and Self-Reconfiguration via Tool-Driven Intrinsic Adaptation

author.name: Jingqi Zhou, Sheng Wang, DeZhao Deng, Junwen Lu, Junwei Su, Qintong Li, Jiahui Gao, Hao Wu, Jiyue Jiang, Lingpeng Kong, Chuan Wu

entry.summary: ToolSelf enables LLM agents to reconfigure their own behavior at runtime by abstracting configuration updates as callable tools. This unifies task execution and self-adjustment into a single action space, allowing agents to adapt to evolving task dynamics without manual orchestration.

entry.title: Accelerating Social Science Research via Agentic Hypothesization and Experimentation

author.name: Jishu Sen Gupta, Harini SI, Somesh Kumar Singh, Syed Mohamad Tawseeq, Yaman Kumar Singla, David Doermann, Rajiv Ratn Shah, Balaji Krishnamurthy

entry.summary: EXPERIGEN is an agentic framework for end-to-end social science discovery using Bayesian optimization-inspired hypothesis generation and experimentation. It discovers 2-4x more statistically significant hypotheses that are 7-17% more predictive than prior approaches.

entry.title: Dialogue Model Optimization via Agent Game and Adaptive Tree-based GRPO

author.name: Kun Peng, Conghui Tan, Yu Liu, Guohua Tang, Zhongqian Sun, Wei Yang, Zining Zhu, Lei Jiang, Yanbing Liu, Hao Peng

entry.summary: Proposes AT-GRPO for dialogue model optimization using a two-agent game paradigm where a user agent constructs dynamic environments with style mimicry and active termination, driving long-horizon RL training for dialogue agents.

entry.title: Why do we Trust Chatbots? From Normative Principles to Behavioral Drivers

author.name: Aditya Gulati, Nuria Oliver

entry.summary: Reframes chatbots as 'highly skilled salespeople' rather than companions, analyzing how trust in chatbots emerges from behavioral mechanisms and cognitive biases rather than demonstrated trustworthiness.

entry.title: Finite-State Controllers for (Hidden-Model) POMDPs using Deep Reinforcement Learning

author.name: David Hud\'ak, Maris F. L. Galesloot, Martin Tappler, Martin Kure\v{c}ka, Nils Jansen, Milan \v{C}e\v{s}ka

entry.summary: Proposes Lexpop framework combining deep RL with finite-state controller extraction for POMDPs, enabling formal performance guarantees. Extends to hidden-model settings requiring robustness across multiple POMDPs.

entry.title: Leveraging Adaptive Group Negotiation for Heterogeneous Multi-Robot Collaboration with Large Language Models

author.name: Siqi Song, Xuanbing Xie, Zonglin Li, Yuqiang Li, Shijie Wang, Biqing Qi

entry.summary: Presents CLiMRS, an adaptive group negotiation framework for heterogeneous multi-robot collaboration using LLMs, with dynamic subgroup formation and perception-driven multi-LLM discussions.

entry.title: MAU-GPT: Enhancing Multi-type Industrial Anomaly Understanding via Anomaly-aware and Generalist Experts Adaptation

author.name: Zhuonan Wang, Zhenxuan Fan, Siwen Tan, Yu Zhong, Yuqian Yuan, Haoyuan Li, Hao Jiang, Wenqiao Zhang, Feifei Shao, Hongwei Wang, Jun Xiao

entry.summary: Introduces MAU-Set, a comprehensive multi-type industrial anomaly understanding dataset, and MAU-GPT, a domain-adapted multimodal LLM for quality control spanning binary classification to complex reasoning.

entry.title: Stochastic Spiking Neuron Based SNN Can be Inherently Bayesian

author.name: Huannan Zheng, Jingli Liu, Kezhou Yang

entry.summary: Proposes a spiking Bayesian neural network framework using magnetic tunnel junction stochasticity as a functional Bayesian resource, achieving 99.16% on MNIST with uncertainty quantification.

entry.title: VLRS-Bench: A Vision-Language Reasoning Benchmark for Remote Sensing

author.name: Zhiming Luo, Di Wang, Haonan Guo, Jing Zhang, Bo Du

entry.summary: Proposes VLRS-Bench, the first benchmark exclusively for complex reasoning in remote sensing with 2000 QA pairs across Cognition, Decision, and Prediction dimensions spanning 14 tasks.

entry.title: Bidirectional Reward-Guided Diffusion for Real-World Image Super-Resolution

author.name: Zihao Fan, Xin Lu, Yidi Liu, Jie Huang, Dong Li, Xueyang Fu, Zheng-Jun Zha

entry.summary: Bird-SR proposes a bidirectional reward-guided diffusion framework for real-world image super-resolution that combines synthetic pairs with real-world images through trajectory-level preference optimization. Early diffusion steps use synthetic pairs for structure while later steps apply quality-guided rewards for perceptual enhancement.

entry.title: Electron-Informed Coarse-Graining Molecular Representation Learning for Real-World Molecular Physics

author.name: Gyoung S. Na, Chanyoung Park

entry.summary: Proposes electron-informed coarse-graining for molecular representation learning, transferring electron-level information from small molecules to real-world molecules without additional computation costs.

entry.title: Reasoning-Augmented Representations for Multimodal Retrieval

author.name: Jianrui Zhang, Anirudh Sundara Rajan, Brandon Han, Soochahn Lee, Sukanta Ganguly, Yong Jae Lee

entry.summary: Proposes a data-centric framework for universal multimodal retrieval that externalizes reasoning before retrieval by densely captioning visual evidence and resolving ambiguous queries, decoupling reasoning from embedding compression.

entry.title: Exactly Computing do-Shapley Values

author.name: R. Teal Witter, \'Alvaro Parafita, Tomas Garriga, Maximilian Muschalik, Fabian Fumagalli, Axel Brando, Lucas Rosenblatt

entry.summary: Provides exact computation of do-Shapley values by reformulating them in terms of irreducible sets of structural causal models, achieving linear time in the number of irreducible sets.

entry.title: Learning Molecular Chirality via Chiral Determinant Kernels

author.name: Runhan Shi, Zhicheng Zhang, Letian Chen, Gufeng Yu, Yang Yang

entry.summary: ChiDeK introduces Chiral Determinant Kernels for learning molecular chirality, systematically encoding stereogenic information into molecular representations, generalizing beyond central chirality to axial chirality.

entry.title: Astro: Activation-guided Structured Regularization for Outlier-Robust LLM Post-Training Quantization

author.name: Xi Chen, Ming Li, Junxi Li, Changsheng Li, Peisong Wang, Lizhong Ding, Ye Yuan, Guoren Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Astro, an activation-guided structured regularization framework for LLM post-training quantization that addresses weight and activation outliers by leveraging flat minima properties.

entry.title: Spectral Gating Networks

author.name: Jusheng Zhang, Yijia Fan, Kaitong Cai, Jing Yang, Yongsen Zheng, Kwok-Yan Lam, Liang Lin, Keze Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Spectral Gating Networks (SGN), a drop-in spectral reparameterization that augments standard MLP/FFN layers with a compact spectral pathway and learnable gates for frequency-rich expressivity.

entry.title: HypRAG: Hyperbolic Dense Retrieval for Retrieval Augmented Generation

author.name: Hiren Madhu, Ngoc Bui, Ali Maatouk, Leandros Tassiulas, Smita Krishnaswamy, Menglin Yang, Sukanta Ganguly, Kiran Srinivasan, Rex Ying

entry.summary: HypRAG introduces hyperbolic dense retrieval for RAG, developing fully hyperbolic and hybrid transformer architectures in the Lorentz model to better capture hierarchical structure in natural language.

entry.title: Direct Soft-Policy Sampling via Langevin Dynamics

author.name: Donghyeon Ki, Hee-Jun Ahn, Kyungyoon Kim, Byung-Jun Lee

entry.summary: Proposes Langevin Q-Learning (LQL) that realizes soft-policy sampling via Langevin dynamics driven by Q-function gradients, avoiding parametric policy limitations and diffusion-based likelihood intractability.

entry.title: AceGRPO: Adaptive Curriculum Enhanced Group Relative Policy Optimization for Autonomous Machine Learning Engineering

author.name: Yuzhu Cai, Zexi Liu, Xinyu Zhu, Cheng Wang, Jiaao Chen, Hanrui Wang, Wei-Chen Wang, Di Jin, Siheng Chen

entry.summary: AceGRPO applies GRPO with adaptive curriculum learning for autonomous ML engineering agents, featuring an evolving data buffer and learnability-guided task sampling.

entry.title: FlashVID: Efficient Video Large Language Models via Training-free Tree-based Spatiotemporal Token Merging

author.name: Ziyang Fan, Keyu Chen, Ruilong Xing, Yulin Li, Li Jiang, Zhuotao Tian

entry.summary: Introduces FlashVID, a training-free inference acceleration framework for Video LLMs that uses tree-based spatiotemporal token merging, exploiting correlated visual features across spatial and temporal dimensions.

entry.title: DICE: Disentangling Artist Style from Content via Contrastive Subspace Decomposition in Diffusion Models

author.name: Tong Zhang, Ru Zhang, Jianyi Liu

entry.summary: Proposes DICE, a training-free framework for artist style erasure in diffusion models via contrastive subspace decomposition. Disentangles style from content without requiring explicit replacement style specification.

entry.title: Inverting Data Transformations via Diffusion Sampling

author.name: Jinwoo Kim, S\'ekou-Oumar Kaba, Jiyun Park, Seunghoon Hong, Siamak Ravanbakhsh

entry.summary: Introduces TIED (Transformation-Inverting Energy Diffusion) for inverting unknown transformations on Lie groups. Models posterior over transformations as Boltzmann distribution and uses diffusion on Lie groups for sampling.

entry.title: When Do Multi-Agent Systems Outperform? Analysing the Learning Efficiency of Agentic Systems

author.name: Junwei Su, Chuan Wu

entry.summary: Rigorously analyzes when multi-agent RL outperforms single-agent RL for LLM training, providing theoretical sample efficiency comparisons within contextual bandit and MDP frameworks.

entry.title: ManifoldKV: Training-Free KV Cache Compression via Euclidean Outlier Detection

author.name: Debajyoti Datta, Trishala Neeraj, Bibek Paudel, Vyom Sharma, Subhabrata Mukherjee

entry.summary: Proposes ManifoldKV, a training-free KV cache compression scorer using Euclidean distance to key centroid instead of cosine similarity. Achieves 95.7% accuracy at 20% compression on RULER benchmark.

entry.title: CauScale: Neural Causal Discovery at Scale

author.name: Bo Peng, Sirui Chen, Jiaguo Tian, Yu Qiao, Chaochao Lu

entry.summary: CauScale is a neural architecture for causal discovery that scales to graphs with 1000 nodes through a reduction unit for data embedding compression and tied attention weights. Uses a two-stream design separating data stream from graph stream.

entry.title: Learning Potentials for Dynamic Matching and Application to Heart Transplantation

author.name: Itai Zilberstein, Ioannis Anagnostides, Zachary W. Sollie, Arman Kilic, Tuomas Sandholm

entry.summary: Proposes a framework for non-myopic policy optimization in online matching using learned potentials, applied to heart transplant allocation. Develops scalable methods for learning higher-dimensional potentials than prior work.

entry.title: Next-Gen CAPTCHAs: Leveraging the Cognitive Gap for Scalable and Diverse GUI-Agent Defense

author.name: Jiacheng Liu, Yaxin Luo, Jiacheng Cui, Xinyi Shang, Xiaohan Zhao, Zhiqiang Shen

entry.summary: Proposes Next-Gen CAPTCHAs to defend against advanced GUI agents, noting that recent models like Gemini3-Pro and GPT-5.2 achieve 90% pass rates on existing CAPTCHAs. Introduces scalable challenge generation pipeline.

entry.title: ArcFlow: Unleashing 2-Step Text-to-Image Generation via High-Precision Non-Linear Flow Distillation

author.name: Zihan Yang (Fudan University), Shuyuan Tu (Fudan University), Licheng Zhang (Fudan University), Qi Dai (Microsoft Research Asia), Yu-Gang Jiang (Fudan University), Zuxuan Wu (Fudan University)

entry.summary: ArcFlow proposes non-linear flow trajectories for few-step diffusion distillation, addressing the limitation that linear shortcuts cannot match the teacher's changing velocity directions. Achieves 2-step text-to-image generation.

entry.title: Finding Connections: Membership Inference Attacks for the Multi-Table Synthetic Data Setting

author.name: Joshua Ward, Chi-Hua Wang, Guang Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes membership inference attacks for multi-table synthetic relational data, addressing the unique privacy challenges when user information spans multiple interconnected tables.

entry.title: Privately Learning Decision Lists and a Differentially Private Winnow

author.name: Mark Bun, William Fang

entry.summary: Gives new differentially private algorithms for learning decision lists and large-margin halfspaces. Achieves a private analog of the Winnow algorithm with mistake bounds polylogarithmic in dimension.

entry.title: Bandit Allocational Instability

author.name: Yilun Chen, Jiaqi Lu

entry.summary: Introduces allocation variability as a new performance metric for multi-armed bandits, measuring the standard deviation of arm pull counts. Establishes a fundamental trade-off between allocation variability and regret.

entry.title: Compact Conformal Subgraphs

author.name: Sreenivas Gollapudi, Kostas Kollias, Kamesh Munagala, Aravindan Vijayaraghavan

entry.summary: Introduces graph-based conformal compression for constructing compact prediction subgraphs that preserve statistical validity. Formulates compression as selecting smallest subgraphs capturing prescribed probability mass.

entry.title: Unified Biomolecular Trajectory Generation via Pretrained Variational Bridge

author.name: Ziyang Yu, Wenbing Huang, Yang Liu

entry.summary: Presents Pretrained Variational Bridge (PVB) for efficient biomolecular trajectory generation. Uses an encoder-decoder framework to map structures through augmented Brownian bridges, enabling generalization across molecular systems.

entry.title: TASTE: Task-Aware Out-of-Distribution Detection via Stein Operators

author.name: Micha{\l} Kozyra, Gesine Reinert

entry.summary: Proposes TASTE, a task-aware out-of-distribution detection framework using Stein operators that links distribution shift to model input sensitivity. Provides geometric interpretation and theoretical guarantees for shift detection and localization.

entry.title: Horizon Imagination: Efficient On-Policy Training in Diffusion World Models

author.name: Lior Cohen, Ofir Nabati, Kaixin Wang, Navdeep Kumar, Shie Mannor

entry.summary: Proposes Horizon Imagination for efficient on-policy training in diffusion world models, denoising multiple future observations in parallel. Includes stabilization and novel sampling schedule decoupling denoising budget from effective horizon.

entry.title: A second order regret bound for NormalHedge

author.name: Yoav Freund, Nicholas J. A. Harvey, Victor S. Portella, Yabing Qi, Yu-Xiang Wang

entry.summary: Shows that a variant of NormalHedge achieves second-order quantile regret bounds for prediction with expert advice on 'easy' sequences, motivated by continuous-time SDE limits and using self-concordance techniques.

entry.title: Distribution-Free Robust Functional Predict-Then-Optimize

author.name: Yash Patel, Ambuj Tewari

entry.summary: Applies conformal prediction to neural operator surrogate models for PDEs in decision-making tasks, providing distribution-free uncertainty quantification for predict-then-optimize pipelines without distributional assumptions.

entry.title: Dynamic Regret via Discounted-to-Dynamic Reduction with Applications to Curved Losses and Adam Optimizer

author.name: Yan-Feng Xie, Yu-Jie Zhang, Peng Zhao, Zhi-Hua Zhou

entry.summary: Studies dynamic regret minimization for FTRL methods, presenting modular bounds via discounted-to-dynamic reduction for curved losses including linear and logistic regression, with applications to understanding Adam optimizer.

entry.title: Projected Gradient Ascent for Efficient Reward-Guided Updates with One-Step Generative Models

author.name: Jisung Hwang, Minhyuk Sung

entry.summary: Proposes projected gradient ascent for reward-guided generation with one-step generative models, enforcing white Gaussian noise constraints via closed-form projection to prevent reward hacking during test-time optimization.

entry.title: SoK: The Pitfalls of Deep Reinforcement Learning for Cybersecurity

author.name: Shae McFadden, Myles Foley, Elizabeth Bates, Ilias Tsingenopoulos, Sanyam Vyas, Vasilios Mavroudis, Chris Hicks, Fabio Pierazzi

entry.summary: Systematizes 11 methodological pitfalls in deep RL for cybersecurity across 66 papers (2018-2025), covering environment modeling, training, evaluation, and deployment stages.

entry.title: Data Reconstruction: Identifiability and Optimization with Sample Splitting

author.name: Yujie Shen, Zihan Wang, Jian Qian, Qi Lei

entry.summary: Studies identifiability of training data reconstruction from KKT conditions for two-layer networks with polynomial activations, and introduces sample splitting to improve optimization reliability of reconstruction.

entry.title: Fair Context Learning for Evidence-Balanced Test-Time Adaptation in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Sanggeon Yun, Ryozo Masukawa, SungHeon Jeong, Wenjun Huang, Hanning Chen, Mohsen Imani

entry.summary: Proposes Fair Context Learning (FCL) for test-time adaptation of vision-language models like CLIP under distribution shifts. Avoids entropy minimization by addressing shared-evidence bias through fairness-driven prompt updates.

entry.title: Evaluating Object-Centric Models beyond Object Discovery

author.name: Krishnakant Singh, Simone Schaub-Meyer, Stefan Roth

entry.summary: Evaluates object-centric learning models beyond standard object discovery metrics, using VLMs as evaluators for diverse VQA datasets and proposing new benchmarks that assess representation usefulness and compositional generalization.

entry.title: Capturing the Topological Phase Transition and Thermodynamics of the 2D XY Model via Manifold-Aware Score-Based Generative Modeling

author.name: Pratyush Jha

entry.summary: Demonstrates that training score-based generative models on manifold-valued data (like the XY spin model) requires respecting the manifold structure. Shows manifold-aware SGMs correctly capture the BKT phase transition and thermodynamic quantities.

entry.title: BFTS: Thompson Sampling with Bayesian Additive Regression Trees

author.name: Ruizhe Deng, Bibhas Chakraborty, Ran Chen, Yan Shuo Tan

entry.summary: Proposes BFTS, the first contextual bandit algorithm integrating Bayesian Additive Regression Trees (BART) with Thompson Sampling. Targets personalized mobile health interventions where non-linear user behaviors are common.

entry.title: Information Geometry of Absorbing Markov-Chain and Discriminative Random Walks

author.name: Masanari Kimura

entry.summary: Analyzes Discriminative Random Walks through information geometry, treating class-specific hitting-time distributions as a statistical manifold. Derives Fisher information, reveals flat manifold structure, and establishes minimax rates.

entry.title: Differentiable Logical Programming for Quantum Circuit Discovery and Optimization

author.name: Antonin Sulc

entry.summary: Introduces a neuro-symbolic framework that reframes quantum circuit design as a differentiable logic programming problem. Uses learnable continuous switches optimized via gradient descent to satisfy differentiable logical axioms for circuit correctness and simplicity.

entry.title: Provably robust learning of regression neural networks using $\beta$-divergences

author.name: Abhik Ghosh, Suryasis Jana

entry.summary: Proposes a robust learning framework for regression neural networks based on β-divergence (density power divergence), providing theoretical guarantees including influence function bounds and minimax rates. Recovers classical MLE as special case.

entry.title: CAST: Character-and-Scene Episodic Memory for Agents

author.name: Kexin Ma, Bojun Li, Yuhua Tang, Ruochun Jin, Liting Sun

entry.summary: Proposes CAST, a character-and-scene based episodic memory architecture for agents inspired by dramatic theory. Constructs 3D scenes organized into character profiles to represent episodic memory, complemented by graph-based semantic memory.

entry.title: Improve Large Language Model Systems with User Logs

author.name: Changyue Wang, Weihang Su, Qingyao Ai, Yiqun Liu

entry.summary: Surveys approaches for improving LLM systems using user interaction logs, addressing challenges of noisy unstructured data and off-policy optimization in continual learning from deployment.

entry.title: compar:IA: The French Government's LLM arena to collect French-language human prompts and preference data

author.name: Lucie Termignon, Simonas Zilinskas, Hadrien P\'elissier, Aur\'elien Barrot, Nicolas Chesnais, Elie Gavoty

entry.summary: Introduces compar:IA, the French government's open-source platform for collecting French-language human preference data through blind pairwise LLM comparisons. Aims to address scarcity of non-English preference data for RLHF/DPO.

entry.title: Halluverse-M^3: A multitask multilingual benchmark for hallucination in LLMs

author.name: Samir Abdaljalil, Parichit Sharma, Erchin Serpedin, Hasan Kurban

entry.summary: Introduces Halluverse-M³, a multilingual (English, Arabic, Hindi, Turkish) multitask benchmark for hallucination evaluation across QA and dialogue summarization, distinguishing entity, relation, and invented hallucination types.

entry.title: UNIKIE-BENCH: Benchmarking Large Multimodal Models for Key Information Extraction in Visual Documents

author.name: Yifan Ji, Zhipeng Xu, Zhenghao Liu, Zulong Chen, Qian Zhang, Zhibo Yang, Junyang Lin, Yu Gu, Ge Yu, Maosong Sun

entry.summary: Introduces UNIKIE-BENCH, a unified benchmark for evaluating large multimodal models on key information extraction from visual documents, with both constrained-category and open-category tracks covering diverse document layouts.

entry.title: SIGMA: Selective-Interleaved Generation with Multi-Attribute Tokens

author.name: Xiaoyan Zhang, Zechen Bai, Haofan Wang, Yiren Song

entry.summary: Presents SIGMA, a unified post-training framework enabling interleaved multi-condition generation in diffusion transformers using selective multi-attribute tokens for style, content, subject, and identity.

entry.title: Rethinking Practical and Efficient Quantization Calibration for Vision-Language Models

author.name: Zhenhao Shang, Haizhao Jing, Guoting Wei, Haokui Zhang, Rong Xiao, Jianqing Gao, Peng Wang

entry.summary: Proposes TLQ, a token-level importance-aware quantization framework for VLMs that addresses differences between visual and text token distributions during post-training quantization calibration.

entry.title: Vanilla Group Equivariant Vision Transformer: Simple and Effective

author.name: Jiahong Fu, Qi Xie, Deyu Meng, Zongben Xu

entry.summary: This work proposes a systematic framework for making Vision Transformer components group equivariant, including patch embedding, self-attention, positional encodings, and sampling operations. The resulting architecture serves as a versatile backbone with guaranteed equivariance properties.

entry.title: Moving Beyond Functional Connectivity: Time-Series Modeling for fMRI-Based Brain Disorder Classification

author.name: Guoqi Yu, Xiaowei Hu, Angelica I. Aviles-Rivero, Anqi Qiu, Shujun Wang

entry.summary: This work benchmarks state-of-the-art temporal models (PatchTST, TimesNet, TimeMixer) on raw fMRI BOLD signals for brain disorder classification, showing they consistently outperform traditional functional connectivity approaches.

entry.title: From Correspondence to Actions: Human-Like Multi-Image Spatial Reasoning in Multi-modal Large Language Models

author.name: Masanari Oi, Koki Maeda, Ryuto Koike, Daisuke Oba, Nakamasa Inoue, Naoaki Okazaki

entry.summary: HATCH proposes human-aware training for multi-image spatial reasoning in MLLMs, incorporating cross-view correspondence and stepwise viewpoint transformation with explicit supervision inspired by human cognitive mechanisms.

entry.title: Shifting the Breaking Point of Flow Matching for Multi-Instance Editing

author.name: Carmine Zaccagnino, Fabio Quattrini, Enis Simsar, Marta Tintor\'e Gazulla, Rita Cucchiara, Alessio Tonioni, Silvia Cascianelli

entry.summary: This work identifies limitations in flow matching models for multi-instance image editing and introduces Instance-Disentangled Attention to partition attention operations, preventing semantic interference between concurrent edits.

entry.title: LangGS-SLAM: Real-Time Language-Feature Gaussian Splatting SLAM

author.name: Seongbo Ha, Sibaek Lee, Kyungsu Kang, Joonyeol Choi, Seungjun Tak, Hyeonwoo Yu

entry.summary: LangGS-SLAM proposes an RGB-D SLAM system reconstructing language-aligned dense feature fields with Gaussian splatting, introducing Top-K Rendering for efficient high-dimensional feature map rendering.

entry.title: A Unified Framework for Multimodal Image Reconstruction and Synthesis using Denoising Diffusion Models

author.name: Weijie Gan, Xucheng Wang, Tongyao Wang, Wenshang Wang, Chunwei Ying, Yuyang Hu, Yasheng Chen, Hongyu An, Ulugbek S. Kamilov

entry.summary: Introduces Any2all, a unified diffusion model framework that treats multimodal image reconstruction and synthesis as a virtual inpainting problem. A single unconditional diffusion model trained on complete PET/MR/CT data can reconstruct any target modality from any combination of inputs.

entry.title: Mimic Intent, Not Just Trajectories

author.name: Renming Huang, Chendong Zeng, Wenjing Tang, Jingtian Cai, Cewu Lu, Panpan Cai

entry.summary: Proposes MINT (Mimic Intent, Not just Trajectories) for imitation learning that disentangles behavior intent from execution details via multi-scale frequency-space tokenization, enforcing spectral decomposition of action representations.

entry.title: Can Hardware Save Us from Software?

author.name: Alvin Ånestrand

entry.summary: Provides an overview of Hardware-Enabled Mechanisms (HEMs) as a way to enforce AI governance through hardware controls, covering location verification, usage monitoring, and compliance enforcement built into AI chips. Discusses timelines for development and deployment.

entry.title: Towards Adaptive, Scalable, and Robust Coordination of LLM Agents: A Dynamic Ad-Hoc Networking Perspective

author.name: Rui Li, Zeyu Zhang, Xiaohe Bo, Quanyu Dai, Chaozhuo Li, Feng Wen, Xu Chen

entry.summary: RAPS frames multi-agent LLM coordination as a dynamic ad-hoc networking problem, using a reputation-aware publish-subscribe paradigm for adaptive, scalable agent coordination. This replaces manual orchestration with automated communication protocols.

entry.title: Nansde-net: A neural sde framework for generating time series with memory

author.name: Hiromu Ozai, Kei Nakagawa

entry.summary: Proposes NA-noise, an Itô-process-based alternative to fractional Brownian motion that captures long- and short-memory in time series within neural SDE frameworks, parameterized by neural networks while preserving the Markov property.

entry.title: TFMLinker: Universal Link Predictor by Graph In-Context Learning with Tabular Foundation Models

author.name: Tianyin Liao, Chunyu Hu, Yicheng Sui, Xingxuan Zhang, Peng Cui, Jianxin Li, Ziwei Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes TFMLinker, which uses tabular foundation models for universal link prediction across graph datasets via in-context learning, converting graph link prediction into a tabular prediction problem.

entry.title: When do neural ordinary differential equations generalize on complex networks?

author.name: Moritz Laber, Tina Eliassi-Rad, Brennan Klein

entry.summary: Studies when neural ODEs generalize across different graph sizes and structures for learning dynamical systems. Finds degree heterogeneity and dynamical system type are primary factors determining generalization ability.

entry.title: PEGAsus: 3D Personalization of Geometry and Appearance

author.name: Jingyu Hu, Bin Hu, Ka-Hei Hui, Haipeng Li, Zhengzhe Liu, Daniel Cohen-Or, Chi-Wing Fu

entry.summary: PEGAsus generates personalized 3D shapes by learning reusable geometry and appearance concepts from reference shapes and composing them with text. It uses progressive optimization to decouple geometry and appearance concept learning with region-wise concept extraction.

entry.title: Language-Guided Transformer Tokenizer for Human Motion Generation

author.name: Sheng Yan, Yong Wang, Xin Du, Junsong Yuan, Mengyuan Liu

entry.summary: LG-Tok proposes language-guided motion tokenization that aligns natural language with motion at the tokenization stage, yielding compact semantic representations that maintain high reconstruction quality with fewer tokens.

entry.title: TiFRe: Text-guided Video Frame Reduction for Efficient Video Multi-modal Large Language Models

author.name: Xiangtian Zheng, Zishuo Wang, Yuxin Peng

entry.summary: TiFRe proposes text-guided video frame reduction for efficient Video MLLMs, using text queries to intelligently select relevant frames rather than uniform sampling, reducing computational costs while preserving task-relevant information.

entry.title: VERIFY-RL: Verifiable Recursive Decomposition for Reinforcement Learning in Mathematical Reasoning

author.name: Kaleem Ullah Qasim, Jiashu Zhang, Hao Li, Muhammad Kafeel Shaheen

entry.summary: VERIFY-RL uses the structure of symbolic differentiation to provide verified decomposition for reinforcement learning in mathematical reasoning. Each decomposition satisfies provable properties: decreasing complexity, solution containment, and formal rule correspondence.

entry.title: Learning Credal Ensembles via Distributionally Robust Optimization

author.name: Kaizheng Wang, Ghifari Adam Faza, Fabio Cuzzolin, Siu Lun Chau, David Moens, Hans Hallez

entry.summary: Proposes CreDRO, which learns credal (set-valued) predictors through distributionally robust optimization, defining epistemic uncertainty as disagreement among models trained with varying relaxations of the i.i.d. assumption.

entry.title: The Theory and Practice of MAP Inference over Non-Convex Constraints

author.name: Leander Kurscheidt, Gabriele Masina, Roberto Sebastiani, Antonio Vergari

entry.summary: Studies MAP inference over non-convex constraints, identifying tractable fragments for exact efficient inference and proposing a general strategy that partitions domains into convex subproblems via message passing.

entry.title: GeoFocus: Blending Efficient Global-to-Local Perception for Multimodal Geometry Problem-Solving

author.name: Linger Deng, Yuliang Liu, Wenwen Yu, Zujia Zhang, Jianzhong Ju, Zhenbo Luo, Xiang Bai

entry.summary: GeoFocus proposes a framework for geometry problem-solving in LMMs with a Critical Local Perceptor using theory-based perception templates and VertexLang, a compact topology language encoding global figures through vertex coordinates.

entry.title: Inspiration Seeds: Learning Non-Literal Visual Combinations for Generative Exploration

author.name: Kfir Goldberg, Elad Richardson, Yael Vinker

entry.summary: Inspiration Seeds proposes a generative framework for exploratory ideation that produces diverse visual compositions from two input images, revealing latent relationships without text prompts. This shifts generation from execution to exploration.

entry.title: Mind the Gap: Learning Implicit Impedance in Visuomotor Policies via Intent-Execution Mismatch

author.name: Cuijie Xu, Shurui Zheng, Zihao Su, Yuanfan Xu, Tinghao Yi, Xudong Zhang, Jian Wang, Yu Wang, Jinchen Yu

entry.summary: Proposes a Dual-State Conditioning framework that shifts imitation learning from trajectory cloning to 'Intent Cloning' by leveraging the master-slave mismatch in teleoperation as a signal encoding implicit interaction forces.

entry.title: ANCHOR: Branch-Point Data Generation for GUI Agents

author.name: Jinbiao Wei, Yilun Zhao, Kangqi Ni, Arman Cohan

entry.summary: ANCHOR presents a trajectory expansion framework for training GUI agents by bootstrapping scalable training data from a small set of verified seed demonstrations. It identifies branch points in trajectories to propose state-grounded task variants, then uses execution and verification to generate new high-quality training trajectories.

entry.title: RAPiD: Real-time Deterministic Trajectory Planning via Diffusion Behavior Priors for Safe and Efficient Autonomous Driving

author.name: Ruturaj Reddy, Hrishav Bakul Barua, Junn Yong Loo, Thanh Thi Nguyen, Ganesh Krishnasamy

entry.summary: RAPiD distills a pretrained diffusion-based trajectory planner into a deterministic policy for autonomous driving, eliminating the need for iterative stochastic sampling at inference time while maintaining the behavioral richness of the diffusion prior through score-regularized policy optimization.

entry.title: Time Series Reasoning via Process-Verifiable Thinking Data Synthesis and Scheduling for Tailored LLM Reasoning

author.name: Jiahui Zhou, Dan Li, Boxin Li, Xiao Zhang, Erli Meng, Lin Li, Zhuomin Chen, Jian Lou, See-Kiong Ng

entry.summary: VeriTime tailors LLM reasoning for time series tasks through process-verifiable thinking data synthesis and scheduled training. It addresses the lack of time-series-specific CoT data and RL algorithms for exploiting such data.

entry.title: Selective Fine-Tuning for Targeted and Robust Concept Unlearning

author.name: Mansi, Avinash Kori, Francesca Toni, Soteris Demetriou

entry.summary: TRUST proposes dynamic selective fine-tuning for concept unlearning in diffusion models, localizing and targeting specific concepts for removal while maintaining model utility. It handles realistic concept combinations rather than individual concepts in isolation.

entry.title: OSCAR: Optimization-Steered Agentic Planning for Composed Image Retrieval

author.name: Teng Wang, Rong Shan, Jianghao Lin, Junjie Wu, Tianyi Xu, Jianping Zhang, Wenteng Chen, Changwang Zhang, Zhaoxiang Wang, Weinan Zhang, Jun Wang

entry.summary: Proposes OSCAR, an optimization-steered agentic planning framework for composed image retrieval that reformulates agentic CIR from heuristic search to trajectory optimization with an offline-online paradigm.

entry.title: Empowering Affected Individuals to Shape AI Fairness Assessments: Processes, Criteria, and Tools

author.name: Lin Luo, Satwik Ghanta, Yuri Nakao, Mathieu Chollet, Simone Stumpf

entry.summary: Proposes processes and tools for empowering individuals affected by AI decisions to create their own fairness criteria, moving beyond predefined protected attributes.

entry.title: Multi-Scale Temporal Homeostasis Enables Efficient and Robust Neural Networks

author.name: MD Azizul Hakim

entry.summary: Presents Multi-Scale Temporal Homeostasis (MSTH), a biologically-inspired framework integrating regulation at multiple time scales (5ms to 1hr) into artificial neural networks for improved robustness.

entry.title: MENASpeechBank: A Reference Voice Bank with Persona-Conditioned Multi-Turn Conversations for AudioLLMs

author.name: Zien Sheikh Ali, Hunzalah Hassan Bhatti, Rabindra Nath Nandi, Shammur Absar Chowdhury, Firoj Alam

entry.summary: Introduces MENASpeechBank, a reference speech bank of 18K utterances from 124 speakers across MENA countries covering Arabic varieties, with a synthetic data pipeline for persona-conditioned conversations.

entry.title: Landscaper: Understanding Loss Landscapes Through Multi-Dimensional Topological Analysis

author.name: Jiaqing Chen, Nicholas Hadler, Tiankai Xie, Rostyslav Hnatyshyn, Caleb Geniesse, Yaoqing Yang, Michael W. Mahoney, Talita Perciano, John F. Hartwig, Ross Maciejewski, Gunther H. Weber

entry.summary: Landscaper is an open-source Python package for arbitrary-dimensional loss landscape analysis combining Hessian-based subspace construction with topological data analysis, introducing SMAD metric for quantifying landscape smoothness.

entry.title: Graph homophily booster: Reimagining the role of discrete features in heterophilic graph learning

author.name: Ruizhong Qiu, Ting-Wei Li, Gaotang Li, Hanghang Tong

entry.summary: Graph homophily booster reimagines the role of discrete features in heterophilic graph learning, finding that existing GNNs including 21 latest methods still underperform MLPs on challenging heterophilic datasets like Actor.

entry.title: TernaryLM: Memory-Efficient Language Modeling via Native 1-Bit Quantization with Adaptive Layer-wise Scaling

author.name: Nisharg Nargund, Priyesh Shukla

entry.summary: TernaryLM is a 132M parameter transformer trained with native 1-bit ternary quantization from scratch, achieving validation perplexity of 58.42 on TinyStories with significant memory reduction.

entry.title: Proximal Action Replacement for Behavior Cloning Actor-Critic in Offline Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Jinzong Dong, Wei Huang, Jianshu Zhang, Zhuo Chen, Xinzhe Yuan, Qinying Gu, Zhaohui Jiang, Nanyang Ye

entry.summary: Identifies a performance ceiling in offline RL caused by behavior cloning regularization preventing exploitation of high-value regions. Proposes Proximal Action Replacement to selectively replace suboptimal dataset actions with critic-guided improvements.

entry.title: Linguistic properties and model scale in brain encoding: from small to compressed language models

author.name: Subba Reddy Oota, Vijay Rowtula, Satya Sai Srinath Namburi, Khushbu Pahwa, Anant Khandelwal, Manish Gupta, Tanmoy Chakraborty, Bapi S. Raju

entry.summary: Investigates how model scale and compression affect brain alignment in language models. Finds that compressed models can retain brain-relevant representations, and syntactic and semantic features—not scale alone—drive brain alignment.

entry.title: Process-of-Thought Reasoning for Videos

author.name: Jusheng Zhang, Kaitong Cai, Jian Wang, Yongsen Zheng, Kwok-Yan Lam, Keze Wang

entry.summary: Process-of-Thought (PoT) reasoning for videos structures video inference into temporal evidence selection, step-wise state updates, and constrained answer synthesis, making reasoning explicit and verifiable.

entry.title: The Laplacian Keyboard: Beyond the Linear Span

author.name: Siddarth Chandrasekar, Marlos C. Machado

entry.summary: Introduces the Laplacian Keyboard, a hierarchical framework that constructs task-agnostic option libraries from Laplacian eigenvectors and learns a meta-policy to compose them, going beyond the linear span limitation.

entry.title: TodoEvolve: Learning to Architect Agent Planning Systems

author.name: Jiaxi Liu, Yanzuo Jiang, Guibin Zhang, Zihan Zhang, Heng Chang, Zhenfei Yin, Qibing Ren, Junchi Yan

entry.summary: TodoEvolve introduces meta-planning for AI agents that autonomously synthesizes and revises task-specific planning architectures using a modular design space (PlanFactory).

entry.title: The Rise of Sparse Mixture-of-Experts:A Survey from Algorithmic Foundations to Decentralized Architectures and Vertical Domain Applications

author.name: Dong Pan, Bingtao Li, Yongsheng Zheng, Jiren Ma, Victor Fei

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey of sparse Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architecture covering algorithmic foundations, decentralized architectures, and vertical domain applications across NLP, CV, and multimodal settings.

entry.title: FIRE: Frobenius-Isometry Reinitialization for Balancing the Stability-Plasticity Tradeoff

author.name: Isaac Han, Sangyeon Park, Seungwon Oh, Donghu Kim, Hojoon Lee, Kyung-Joong Kim

entry.summary: Proposes FIRE, a reinitialization method that balances stability-plasticity tradeoff using Squared Frobenius Error and Deviation from Isometry metrics. Solves a constrained optimization to find optimal reinitialization points.

entry.title: Epigraph-Guided Flow Matching for Safe and Performant Offline Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Manan Tayal, Mumuksh Tayal

entry.summary: Proposes EpiFlow, a framework combining epigraph-guided feasibility value functions with flow matching for safe offline RL. Formulates safe offline RL as state-constrained optimal control to co-optimize safety and performance.

entry.title: Picasso: Holistic Scene Reconstruction with Physics-Constrained Sampling

author.name: Xihang Yu, Rajat Talak, Lorenzo Shaikewitz, Luca Carlone

entry.summary: Proposes Picasso, a physics-constrained scene reconstruction method that reasons holistically over object poses and shapes. Addresses physically implausible reconstructions (interpenetration, unstable equilibrium) for digital twin applications.

entry.title: Online Domain-aware LLM Decoding for Continual Domain Evolution

author.name: Mohammad Abu-Shaira, Weishi Shi

entry.summary: Introduces ODD, an online domain-aware decoding framework for LLMs that adapts to evolving domain knowledge and concept drift without retraining, enabling real-time adaptation.

entry.title: DrugR: Optimizing Molecular Drugs through LLM-based Explicit Reasoning

author.name: Haoran Liu, Zheni Zeng, Yukun Yan, Yuxuan Chen, Yunduo Xiao

entry.summary: Proposes DrugR, an LLM-based molecular drug optimization method that introduces explicit step-by-step pharmacological reasoning, combining continual pretraining, supervised fine-tuning, and multi-granularity RL.

entry.title: Regime Change Hypothesis: Foundations for Decoupled Dynamics in Neural Network Training

author.name: Cristian P\'erez-Corral, Alberto Fern\'andez-Hern\'andez, Jose I. Mestre, Manuel F. Dolz, Jose Duato, Enrique S. Quintana-Ort\'i

entry.summary: Proposes Regime Change Hypothesis for neural network training: an early stage with substantial activation pattern changes and a later stage of refinement within stable activation regimes. Provides theoretical and empirical evidence.

entry.title: BiManiBench: A Hierarchical Benchmark for Evaluating Bimanual Coordination of Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Xin Wu, Zhixuan Liang, Yue Ma, Mengkang Hu, Zhiyuan Qin, Xiu Li

entry.summary: Introduces BiManiBench, a hierarchical benchmark evaluating MLLMs for bimanual robotic manipulation across spatial reasoning, action planning, and end-effector control. Tests 30+ state-of-the-art models.

entry.title: GISA: A Benchmark for General Information-Seeking Assistant

author.name: Yutao Zhu, Xingshuo Zhang, Maosen Zhang, Jiajie Jin, Liancheng Zhang, Xiaoshuai Song, Kangzhi Zhao, Wencong Zeng, Ruiming Tang, Han Li, Ji-Rong Wen, Zhicheng Dou

entry.summary: Introduces GISA, a benchmark of 373 human-crafted queries for evaluating information-seeking search agents, addressing limitations of existing benchmarks that construct queries backward from answers. Features dynamic answer evaluation to resist data contamination.

entry.title: Breaking the Grid: Distance-Guided Reinforcement Learning in Large Discrete and Hybrid Action Spaces

author.name: Heiko Hoppe, Fabian Akkerman, Wouter van Heeswijk, Maximilian Schiffer

entry.summary: Proposes Distance-Guided Reinforcement Learning (DGRL) combining Sampled Dynamic Neighborhoods and Distance-Based Updates for RL in extremely large discrete action spaces (up to 10^20 actions). Uses semantic embedding space for stochastic volumetric exploration.

entry.title: CompilerKV: Risk-Adaptive KV Compression via Offline Experience Compilation

author.name: Ning Yang, Chengzhi Wang, Yibo Liu, Baoliang Tian, Haijun Zhang

entry.summary: CompilerKV proposes risk-adaptive KV cache compression that compiles offline experience into reusable decision tables, accounting for prompt-dependent compression risk and functional heterogeneity across attention heads.

entry.title: AnomSeer: Reinforcing Multimodal LLMs to Reason for Time-Series Anomaly Detection

author.name: Junru Zhang, Lang Feng, Haoran Shi, Xu Guo, Han Yu, Yabo Dong, Duanqing Xu

entry.summary: AnomSeer reinforces multimodal LLMs for time-series anomaly detection by grounding reasoning in precise structural details (statistical measures, frequency transforms) via expert chain-of-thought traces and novel time-series grounded policy optimization.

entry.title: Breaking the Simplification Bottleneck in Amortized Neural Symbolic Regression

author.name: Paul Saegert, Ullrich K\"othe

entry.summary: Proposes SimpliPy, a rule-based expression simplification engine achieving 100x speedup over SymPy, enabling substantial improvements in amortized symbolic regression training and inference.

entry.title: Attractor Patch Networks: Reducing Catastrophic Forgetting with Routed Low-Rank Patch Experts

author.name: Shashank

entry.summary: Attractor Patch Networks (APN) replace Transformer FFNs with routed patch expert banks to reduce catastrophic forgetting. A similarity router selects top-k experts per token, enabling more localized parameter updates.

entry.title: Latent Target Score Matching, with an application to Simulation-Based Inference

author.name: Joohwan Ko, Tomas Geffner

entry.summary: Proposes Latent Target Score Matching (LTSM) extending target score matching to settings with latent variables, providing low-variance supervision of marginal scores using joint scores. Applied to simulation-based inference.

entry.title: Fair Decisions from Calibrated Scores: Achieving Optimal Classification While Satisfying Sufficiency

author.name: Etam Benger, Katrina Ligett

entry.summary: Presents an exact solution for optimal binary classification under the sufficiency fairness constraint (predictive parity), even when perfectly calibrated scores violate it after thresholding. Provides a closed-form randomized classification solution.

entry.title: Dichotomy of Feature Learning and Unlearning: Fast-Slow Analysis on Neural Networks with Stochastic Gradient Descent

author.name: Shota Imai, Sota Nishiyama, Masaaki Imaizumi

entry.summary: Analyzes feature unlearning dynamics in neural networks through fast-slow analysis of infinite-width two-layer networks with stochastic gradient descent. Reveals conditions under which networks progressively lose previously learned features.

entry.title: Quantifying Explanation Quality in Graph Neural Networks using Out-of-Distribution Generalization

author.name: Ding Zhang, Siddharth Betala, Chirag Agarwal

entry.summary: Proposes Explanation-Generalization Score (EGS) for evaluating GNN explanations based on the principle that causal explanations should lead to stable predictions across distribution shifts. Tests whether explanatory subgraphs generalize OOD.

entry.title: Harpoon: Generalised Manifold Guidance for Conditional Tabular Diffusion

author.name: Aditya Shankar, Yuandou Wang, Rihan Hai, Lydia Y. Chen

entry.summary: Introduces HARPOON, extending manifold theory to tabular data for guided conditional generation. Handles diverse inference-time objectives including imputation, conditional generation, and constraints on mixed data types.

entry.title: Sharp analysis of linear ensemble sampling

author.name: Arya Akhavan, David Janz, Csaba Szepesv\'ari

entry.summary: Analyzes linear ensemble sampling in stochastic linear bandits, showing that ensemble size m=Θ(d log n) achieves near-optimal regret. Introduces a novel continuous-time proof technique via Brownian motion exceedance.

entry.title: Efficient Distribution Learning with Error Bounds in Wasserstein Distance

author.name: Eduardo Figueiredo, Steven Adams, Luca Laurenti

entry.summary: Develops an algorithmic framework for approximating unknown probability distributions from finite samples with non-asymptotic, computable error bounds in Wasserstein distance. Leverages optimal transport theory for practical distribution learning guarantees.

entry.title: A Causal Machine Learning Framework for Treatment Personalization in Clinical Trials: Application to Ulcerative Colitis

author.name: Cristian Minoccheri, Sophia Tesic, Kayvan Najarian, Ryan Stidham

entry.summary: Presents a modular causal ML framework separating heterogeneity detection from policy evaluation in clinical trials, applied to ulcerative colitis treatment personalization. Distinguishes statistical heterogeneity from actionable treatment personalization.

entry.title: OJBKQ: Objective-Joint Babai-Klein Quantization

author.name: Xinyu Wang, Ziyu Zhao, Peng Lu, Yu Gu, Xiao-Wen Chang

entry.summary: Introduces OJBKQ, a post-training quantization method that formulates weight quantization as a joint optimization over activations and weights, solving it as a box-constrained integer least squares problem with extended Babai and Klein algorithms.

entry.title: Conditional Sequence Modeling for Safe Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Wensong Bai, Chao Zhang, Qihang Xu, Chufan Chen, Chenhao Zhou, Hui Qian

entry.summary: Proposes RCDT, a conditional sequence modeling approach for offline safe RL that enables zero-shot deployment across multiple cost thresholds from a single trained policy.

entry.title: Magnitude Distance: A Geometric Measure of Dataset Similarity

author.name: Sahel Torkamani, Henry Gouk, Rik Sarkar

entry.summary: Proposes magnitude distance, a novel metric between datasets using the mathematical concept of magnitude of metric spaces, with a tunable scale parameter controlling sensitivity to global vs. fine structure.

entry.title: Distributionally Robust Optimization via Generative Ambiguity Modeling

author.name: Jiaqi Wen, Jianyi Yang

entry.summary: Proposes GAS-DRO, which uses generative models to construct ambiguity sets for distributionally robust optimization. The generative approach captures adversarial distributions beyond the nominal support while maintaining tractability.

entry.title: MolLIBRA: Genetic Molecular Optimization with Multi-Fingerprint Surrogates and Text-Molecule Aligned Critic

author.name: Masahi Okada, Kazuki Sakai, Hiroaki Yoshida, Masaki Okoshi, Tadahiro Taniguchi

entry.summary: Proposes MolLIBRA, a genetic algorithm framework for molecular optimization that uses GP surrogates over multiple fingerprints and a text-molecule aligned encoder (CLAMP) for pre-ranking candidates before expensive oracle calls.

entry.title: $\partial$CBDs: Differentiable Causal Block Diagrams

author.name: Thomas Beckers, J\'an Drgo\v{n}a, Truong X. Nghiem

entry.summary: Introduces differentiable causal block diagrams (∂CBDs) that unify composable system modeling, differentiable programming for learning, and contract-based verification for cyber-physical systems.

entry.title: Scalable Mean-Field Variational Inference via Preconditioned Primal-Dual Optimization

author.name: Jinhua Lyu, Tianmin Yu, Ying Ma, Naichen Shi

entry.summary: Develops PD-VI and P²D-VI, scalable primal-dual algorithms for mean-field variational inference with block preconditioning that accounts for heterogeneous parameter geometry.

entry.title: Constructive conditional normalizing flows

author.name: Borjan Geshkovski, Dom\`enec Ruiz-Balet

entry.summary: Provides explicit constructions of conditional normalizing flows via continuity equations with neural network velocity fields, based on polar decomposition of Lagrange interpolants.

entry.title: Welfarist Formulations for Diverse Similarity Search

author.name: Siddharth Barman, Nirjhar Das, Shivam Gupta, Kirankumar Shiragur

entry.summary: Develops welfare-based formulations from mathematical economics for achieving diversity in nearest neighbor search, with applications to RAG and recommendation systems. Focuses on Nash social welfare to balance relevance (similarity) with diversity across attributes.

entry.title: Online monotone density estimation and log-optimal calibration

author.name: Rohan Hore, Ruodu Wang, Aaditya Ramdas

entry.summary: Studies online monotone density estimation, proposing an online Grenander estimator and an expert aggregation estimator. Establishes O(n^{1/3}) expected cumulative log-likelihood gap bounds and sqrt(n log n) pathwise regret bounds.

entry.title: Relevance-aware Multi-context Contrastive Decoding for Retrieval-augmented Visual Question Answering

author.name: Jongha Kim, Byungoh Ko, Jeehye Na, Jinsung Yoon, Hyunwoo J. Kim

entry.summary: Proposes Relevance-aware Multi-context Contrastive Decoding (RMCD) for retrieval-augmented visual question answering. Weights outputs from multiple contexts based on relevance to better leverage relevant information and suppress irrelevant context effects.

entry.title: RoPE-LIME: RoPE-Space Locality + Sparse-K Sampling for Efficient LLM Attribution

author.name: Isaac Picov, Ritesh Goru

entry.summary: Introduces RoPE-LIME for explaining closed-source LLM outputs using an open-source surrogate model. Uses RoPE embedding space locality kernels and sparse-K sampling for efficient token-level attribution.

entry.title: Evaluating an evidence-guided reinforcement learning framework in aligning light-parameter large language models with decision-making cognition in psychiatric clinical reasoning

author.name: Xinxin Lin, Guangxin Dai, Yi Zhong, Xiang Li, Xue Xiao, Yixin Zhang, Zhengdong Wu, Yongbo Zheng, Runchuan Zhu, Ming Zhao, Huizi Yu, Shuo Wu, Jun Zhao, Lingming Hu, Yumei Wang, Ping Yin, Joey W. Y. Chan, Ngan Yin Chan, Sijing Chen, Yun Kwok Wing, Lin Lu, Xin Ma, Lizhou Fan

entry.summary: Introduces ClinMPO, a reinforcement learning framework to align light-parameter LLMs with professional psychiatric diagnostic reasoning. Uses a reward model trained on expert psychiatric data.

entry.title: MUFASA: A Multi-Layer Framework for Slot Attention

author.name: Sebastian Bock, Leonie Sch\"u{\ss}ler, Krishnakant Singh, Simone Schaub-Meyer, Stefan Roth

entry.summary: Introduces MUFASA, a plug-and-play framework that computes slot attention across multiple ViT feature layers rather than just the last layer, improving unsupervised object-centric learning with a multi-layer fusion strategy.

entry.title: EasyTune: Efficient Step-Aware Fine-Tuning for Diffusion-Based Motion Generation

author.name: Xiaofeng Tan, Wanjiang Weng, Haodong Lei, Hongsong Wang

entry.summary: EasyTune proposes efficient step-aware fine-tuning for diffusion-based motion generation by decoupling recursive dependencies between denoising steps. This achieves comparable or better results with significantly reduced memory consumption and improved optimization efficiency.

entry.title: Geospatial-Reasoning-Driven Vocabulary-Agnostic Remote Sensing Semantic Segmentation

author.name: Chufeng Zhou, Jian Wang, Xinyuan Liu, Xiaokang Zhang

entry.summary: GR-CoT proposes a Geospatial Reasoning Chain-of-Thought framework for vocabulary-agnostic remote sensing semantic segmentation, using MLLMs to add geospatial contextual awareness beyond appearance-based matching.

entry.title: DINO-Mix: Distilling Foundational Knowledge with Cross-Domain CutMix for Semi-supervised Class-imbalanced Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Xinyu Liu, Guolei Sun

entry.summary: Proposes DINO-Mix, a semi-supervised medical image segmentation framework that uses a pre-trained visual foundation model (DINOv3) to inject external knowledge and combat confirmation bias under class imbalance. Uses cross-domain CutMix to blend foundation model features with target data.

entry.title: Why Look at It at All?: Vision-Free Multifingered Blind Grasping Using Uniaxial Fingertip Force Sensing

author.name: Edgar Lee, Junho Choi, Taemin Kim, Changjoo Nam, Seokhwan Jeong

entry.summary: Demonstrates that reliable multi-fingered grasping can be achieved using only uniaxial fingertip force feedback and joint proprioception, without vision or tactile sensing. Uses teacher-student RL with a transformer-based student policy.

entry.title: DexFormer: Cross-Embodied Dexterous Manipulation via History-Conditioned Transformer

author.name: Ke Zhang, Lixin Xu, Chengyi Song, Junzhe Xu, Xiaoyi Lin, Zeyu Jiang, Renjing Xu

entry.summary: Presents DexFormer, a cross-embodiment dexterous manipulation policy using a transformer backbone that conditions on historical observations to infer morphology and dynamics, enabling adaptation across different robotic hand configurations.

entry.title: Constrained Sampling to Guide Universal Manipulation RL

author.name: Marc Toussaint, Cornelius V. Braun, Eckart Cobo-Briesewitz, Sayantan Auddy, Armand Jordana, Justin Carpentier

entry.summary: Proposes Sample-Guided RL that uses model-based constraint solvers to sample feasible configurations and guide reinforcement learning exploration in contact-rich manipulation, addressing the exploration problem in sparse-reward settings.

entry.title: MOSAIC: Bridging the Sim-to-Real Gap in Generalist Humanoid Motion Tracking and Teleoperation with Rapid Residual Adaptation

author.name: Zhenguo Sun, Bo-Sheng Huang, Yibo Peng, Xukun Li, Jingyu Ma, Yu Sun, Zhe Li, Haojun Jiang, Biao Gao, Zhenshan Bing, Xinlong Wang, Alois Knoll

entry.summary: Presents MOSAIC, an open-source system for humanoid motion tracking and whole-body teleoperation that uses rapid residual adaptation to bridge sim-to-real gaps across multiple teleoperation interfaces.

entry.title: Three visions for diffuse control

author.name: Alek Westover

entry.summary: Critiques the 'diffuse control' plan for AI alignment — the idea of forcing misaligned AI systems to automate alignment research through distributed control. Presents three visions and argues this approach has dangerous properties including procrastination, delegation to untrusted parties, and difficulty ensuring AI effort.

entry.title: VGAS: Value-Guided Action-Chunk Selection for Few-Shot Vision-Language-Action Adaptation

author.name: Changhua Xu, Jie Lu, Junyu Xuan, En Yu

entry.summary: VGAS addresses few-shot VLA (Vision-Language-Action) adaptation through inference-time best-of-N selection of action chunks, using a value function to resolve geometric ambiguities that arise from limited supervision. This generation-selection perspective improves reliability without additional fine-tuning.

entry.title: MedCoG: Maximizing LLM Inference Density in Medical Reasoning via Meta-Cognitive Regulation

author.name: Yu Zhao, Hao Guan, Yongcheng Jing, Ying Zhang, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: MedCoG uses meta-cognitive awareness in LLMs to regulate medical reasoning — dynamically adjusting utilization of different knowledge types based on self-assessed task complexity, familiarity, and knowledge density. It integrates knowledge graphs with on-demand reasoning.

entry.title: Small Agent Group is the Future of Digital Health

author.name: Yuqiao Meng, Luoxi Tang, Dazheng Zhang, Rafael Brens, Elvys J. Romero, Nancy Guo, Safa Elkefi, Zhaohan Xi

entry.summary: Small Agent Group (SAG) challenges the 'scaling-first' paradigm in digital health by showing that collaborative deliberation among small, specialized agent groups can outperform monolithic large models for clinical reasoning while being more reliable and cost-effective.

entry.title: CoTZero: Annotation-Free Human-Like Vision Reasoning via Hierarchical Synthetic CoT

author.name: Chengyi Du, Yazhe Niu, Dazhong Shen, Luxin Xu

entry.summary: CoTZero introduces annotation-free vision reasoning through dual-stage data synthesis and cognition-aligned training. Drawing from neurocognitive models, it generates hierarchical chain-of-thought training data without human annotation.

entry.title: Variance-Gated Ensembles: An Epistemic-Aware Framework for Uncertainty Estimation

author.name: H. Martin Gillis, Isaac Xu, Thomas Trappenberg

entry.summary: Introduces Variance-Gated Ensembles (VGE), which inject epistemic sensitivity via a signal-to-noise gate from ensemble statistics, addressing known issues with additive decomposition of aleatoric and epistemic uncertainty in finite ensembles.

entry.title: Radial M\"untz-Sz\'asz Networks: Neural Architectures with Learnable Power Bases for Multidimensional Singularities

author.name: Gnankan Landry Regis N'guessan, Bum Jun Kim

entry.summary: Introduces Radial Müntz-Szász Networks (RMN) for modeling radial singular fields (like 1/r, log r) that coordinate-separable neural architectures cannot represent, with learnable radial powers and closed-form gradients enabling physics-informed learning.

entry.title: M-Loss: Quantifying Model Merging Compatibility with Limited Unlabeled Data

author.name: Tiantong Wang, Yiyang Duan, Haoyu Chen, Tiantong Wu, Wei Yang Bryan Lim

entry.summary: Proposes M-Loss, a metric to quantify model merging compatibility with limited unlabeled data, helping predict which models will merge well without extensive experimentation.

entry.title: FlexMoRE: A Flexible Mixture of Rank-heterogeneous Experts for Efficient Federatedly-trained Large Language Models

author.name: Annemette Brok Pirchert, Jacob Nielsen, Mogens Henrik From, Lukas Galke Poech, Peter Schneider-Kamp

entry.summary: Introduces FlexMoRE, allowing federated mixture-of-experts models where individual experts can be full-sized or low-rank adapters of varying rank, systematically investigating the trade-off between expert rank and performance.

entry.title: Extracting Root-Causal Brain Activity Driving Psychopathology from Resting State fMRI

author.name: Eric V. Strobl

entry.summary: Introduces SOURCE, a method for extracting root-causal brain activity maps from resting-state fMRI that initiate pathological cascades, linking them to specific symptom dimensions in psychiatric disorders.

entry.title: PhysDrape: Learning Explicit Forces and Collision Constraints for Physically Realistic Garment Draping

author.name: Minghai Chen, Mingyuan Liu, Yuxiang Huan

entry.summary: PhysDrape presents a hybrid neural-physical solver for garment draping that integrates explicit force modeling and collision constraints in a fully differentiable pipeline. This resolves the trade-off between geometric feasibility and physical plausibility that plagues soft-penalty approaches.

entry.title: Understanding and Optimizing Attention-Based Sparse Matching for Diverse Local Features

author.name: Qiang Wang

entry.summary: This paper revisits attention-based sparse image matching, identifies a critical overlooked design choice in LightGlue, and proposes a universal detector-agnostic matching model trained on diverse keypoint detectors.

entry.title: Differentiate-and-Inject: Enhancing VLAs via Functional Differentiation Induced by In-Parameter Structural Reasoning

author.name: Jingyi Hou, Leyu Zhou, Chenchen Jing, Jinghan Yang, Xinbo Yu, Wei He

entry.summary: Presents iSTAR, a framework that enhances VLA models by functionally differentiating task-level reasoning from low-level control, embedding structural task reasoning directly in model parameters rather than through prompts.

entry.title: Computing the Reachability Value of Posterior-Deterministic POMDPs

author.name: Nathana\"el Fijalkow, Arka Ghosh, Roman Kniazev, Guillermo A. P\'erez, Pierre Vandenhove

entry.summary: Introduces posterior-deterministic POMDPs, a novel subclass where the reachability value can be computed, overcoming the classical undecidability result for general POMDPs. This provides a tractable yet expressive class for verification and synthesis under partial observability.

entry.title: MemFly: On-the-Fly Memory Optimization via Information Bottleneck

author.name: Zhenyuan Zhang, Xianzhang Jia, Zhiqin Yang, Zhenbo Song, Wei Xue, Sirui Han, Yike Guo

entry.summary: MemFly uses information bottleneck principles for on-the-fly memory evolution in LLM agents, balancing compression efficiency with retrieval precision. It constructs stratified memory with semantic, symbolic, and topological retrieval pathways.

entry.title: Time-Delayed Transformers for Data-Driven Modeling of Low-Dimensional Dynamics

author.name: Albert Alcalde, Markus Widhalm, Emre Y{\i}lmaz

entry.summary: Proposes time-delayed transformer (TD-TF), a minimal single-layer transformer interpreted as a nonlinear generalization of time-delayed DMD, with linear complexity in sequence length for data-driven modeling of unsteady dynamics.

entry.title: Modeling Score Approximation Errors in Diffusion Models via Forward SPDEs

author.name: Junsu Seo

entry.summary: Investigates score approximation errors in diffusion models through a forward SPDE framework on probability density fields, offering a geometric stability interpretation and a candidate evaluation metric from quadratic variation.

entry.title: Generative Regression for Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Estimation from Echocardiography Video

author.name: Jinrong Lv, Xun Gong, Zhaohuan Li, Weili Jiang

entry.summary: This paper frames left ventricular ejection fraction estimation from echocardiograms as a generative regression problem rather than standard MSE regression, addressing the ill-posed nature where a single video may map to a distribution of plausible values.

entry.title: D$^2$-VR: Degradation-Robust and Distilled Video Restoration with Synergistic Optimization Strategy

author.name: Jianfeng Liang, Shaocheng Shen, Botao Xu, Qiang Hu, Xiaoyun Zhang

entry.summary: D²-VR proposes a single-image diffusion-based video restoration framework with low-step inference, featuring degradation-robust flow alignment and adversarial distillation for practical deployment with reduced latency.

entry.title: LLM-FSM: Scaling Large Language Models for Finite-State Reasoning in RTL Code Generation

author.name: Yuheng Wu, Berk Gokmen, Zhouhua Xie, Peijing Li, Caroline Trippel, Priyanka Raina, Thierry Tambe

entry.summary: LLM-FSM introduces a benchmark for evaluating how well LLMs can recover finite-state machine behavior from natural language specifications and translate it into correct RTL (hardware) implementations.
