The benchmark is fully automated and scales to configurable complexity levels, revealing that frontier models still struggle with complex state-dependent reasoning for hardware design.

entry.title: TermiGen: High-Fidelity Environment and Robust Trajectory Synthesis for Terminal Agents

author.name: Kaijie Zhu, Yuzhou Nie, Yijiang Li, Yiming Huang, Jialian Wu, Jiang Liu, Ximeng Sun, Zhenfei Yin, Lun Wang, Zicheng Liu, Emad Barsoum, William Yang Wang, Wenbo Guo

entry.summary: TermiGen provides an end-to-end pipeline for synthesizing verifiable terminal environments and resilient expert trajectories for training terminal agents. It addresses both the scarcity of executable training environments and the distributional mismatch between expert demonstrations and student model capabilities.

entry.title: LQA: A Lightweight Quantized-Adaptive Framework for Vision-Language Models on the Edge

author.name: Xin Wang, Hualin Zhou, Sheng Guang Wang, Ting Dang, Yu Zhang, Hong Jia, Tao Gu

entry.summary: LQA enables deployment of Vision-Language Models on edge devices through modality-aware quantization combined with gradient-free test-time adaptation. It introduces Selective Hybrid Quantization to handle distribution shifts on resource-constrained hardware.

entry.title: Interpretable Failure Analysis in Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning Systems

author.name: Risal Shahriar Shefin, Debashis Gupta, Thai Le, Sarra Alqahtani

entry.summary: Introduces a two-stage gradient-based framework for interpretable failure analysis in multi-agent RL, detecting the initial failure source (Patient-0), validating domino effects, and tracing failure propagation through coordination pathways.

entry.title: Toward Formalizing LLM-Based Agent Designs through Structural Context Modeling and Semantic Dynamics Analysis

author.name: Haoyu Jia, Kento Kawaharazuka, Kei Okada

entry.summary: Proposes the Structural Context Model, a formal model for analyzing and comparing LLM agents from the perspective of context structure. Aims to provide implementation-independent characterization to address fragmentation in agent research.

entry.title: Exploring SAIG Methods for an Objective Evaluation of XAI

author.name: Miquel Mir\'o-Nicolau, Gabriel Moy\`a-Alcover, Anna Arias-Duart

entry.summary: First review and analysis of Synthetic Artificial Intelligence Ground truth (SAIG) methods for evaluating XAI techniques, introducing a taxonomy with seven key distinguishing features.

entry.title: Negative-Aware Diffusion Process for Temporal Knowledge Graph Extrapolation

author.name: Yanglei Gan, Peng He, Yuxiang Cai, Run Lin, Guanyu Zhou, Qiao Liu

entry.summary: Introduces NADEx, a negative-aware diffusion model for temporal knowledge graph extrapolation that incorporates informative negative context and improved calibration of denoised embeddings.

entry.title: BiomechAgent: AI-Assisted Biomechanical Analysis Through Code-Generating Agents

author.name: R. James Cotton, Thomas Leonard

entry.summary: Presents BiomechAgent, a code-generating AI agent for biomechanical analysis through natural language, enabling clinicians to query databases and generate visualizations without programming.

entry.title: Adaptive Temporal Dynamics for Personalized Emotion Recognition: A Liquid Neural Network Approach

author.name: Anindya Bhattacharjee, Nittya Ananda Biswas, K. A. Shahriar, Adib Rahman

entry.summary: First comprehensive application of liquid neural networks for EEG-based emotion recognition with a multimodal framework combining convolutional extraction, liquid neural networks, and attention-guided fusion.

entry.title: Learning Alzheimer's Disease Signatures by bridging EEG with Spiking Neural Networks and Biophysical Simulations

author.name: Szymon Mamo\'n, Max Talanov, Alessandro Crimi

entry.summary: Proposes a neuro-bridge framework linking SNNs with biophysical simulations for EEG-based Alzheimer's detection, enabling bidirectional interpretation between data-driven learning and mechanistic models.

entry.title: A General Model for Retinal Segmentation and Quantification

author.name: Zhonghua Wang, Lie Ju, Sijia Li, Wei Feng, Sijin Zhou, Ming Hu, Jianhao Xiong, Xiaoying Tang, Yifan Peng, Mingquan Lin, Yaodong Ding, Yong Zeng, Wenbin Wei, Li Dong, Zongyuan Ge

entry.summary: Presents RetSAM, a general retinal segmentation and quantification framework for fundus imaging, trained on 200K+ images for multi-target segmentation and biomarker extraction.

entry.title: Federated Prompt-Tuning with Heterogeneous and Incomplete Multimodal Client Data

author.name: Thu Hang Phung, Duong M. Nguyen, Thanh Trung Huynh, Quoc Viet Hung Nguyen, Trong Nghia Hoang, Phi Le Nguyen

entry.summary: Introduces a federated prompt-tuning framework for scenarios where local datasets are multimodal with heterogeneous patterns of missing features, bridging federated learning and multimodal prompt-tuning with specialized client-tuning and server-aggregation designs.

entry.title: Beyond Pooling: Matching for Robust Generalization under Data Heterogeneity

author.name: Ayush Roy, Rudrasis Chakraborty, Lav Varshney, Vishnu Suresh Lokhande

entry.summary: Proposes a matching framework for robust generalization under data heterogeneity that uses propensity score matching and adaptive centroids, outperforming naive pooling and uniform subsampling for zero-shot generalization.

entry.title: VISOR: VIsual Spatial Object Reasoning for Language-driven Object Navigation

author.name: Francesco Taioli, Shiping Yang, Sonia Raychaudhuri, Marco Cristani, Unnat Jain, Angel X Chang

entry.summary: VISOR proposes a compact 3B-parameter Vision-Language-Action agent for language-driven object navigation that performs human-like embodied reasoning without requiring large LLMs or complex modular pipelines.

entry.title: TeleBoost: A Systematic Alignment Framework for High-Fidelity, Controllable, and Robust Video Generation

author.name: Yuanzhi Liang, Xuan'er Wu, Yirui Liu, Yijie Fang, Yizhen Fan, Ke Hao, Rui Li, Ruiying Liu, Ziqi Ni, Peng Yu, Yanbo Wang, Haibin Huang, Qizhen Weng, Chi Zhang, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: TeleBoost presents a systematic post-training framework for video generation models, organizing supervised policy shaping, reward-driven RL, and preference-based refinement into a unified optimization stack.

entry.title: Pruning as a Cooperative Game: Surrogate-Assisted Layer Contribution Estimation for Large Language Models

author.name: Xuan Ding, Pengyu Tong, Ranjie Duan, Yunjian Zhang, Rui Sun, Yao Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes a game-theoretic framework for LLM layer pruning using Shapley values to assess layer contributions, with surrogate models to make computation tractable.

entry.title: CausalCompass: Evaluating the Robustness of Time-Series Causal Discovery in Misspecified Scenarios

author.name: Huiyang Yi, Xiaojian Shen, Yonggang Wu, Duxin Chen, He Wang, Wenwu Yu

entry.summary: CausalCompass is a benchmark suite for evaluating robustness of time-series causal discovery methods under violations of modeling assumptions, testing across 8 assumption-violation scenarios.

entry.title: ForecastOcc: Vision-based Semantic Occupancy Forecasting

author.name: Riya Mohan, Juana Valeria Hurtado, Rohit Mohan, Abhinav Valada

entry.summary: Presents ForecastOcc, the first framework for vision-based semantic occupancy forecasting that jointly predicts future occupancy states and semantic categories directly from images, avoiding error accumulation from separate networks.

entry.title: Implicit Strategic Optimization: Rethinking Long-Horizon Decision-Making in Adversarial Poker Environments

author.name: Boyang Xia, Weiyou Tian, Qingnan Ren, Jiaqi Huang, Jie Xiao, Shuo Lu, Kai Wang, Lynn Ai, Eric Yang, Bill Shi

entry.summary: Introduces Implicit Strategic Optimization (ISO) for training LLM agents in adversarial poker, combining a Strategic Reward Model with context-conditioned optimistic learning. Proves sublinear contextual regret bounds.

entry.title: VidVec: Unlocking Video MLLM Embeddings for Video-Text Retrieval

author.name: Issar Tzachor, Dvir Samuel, Rami Ben-Ari

entry.summary: Introduces VidVec for leveraging MLLMs as video-text embedding extractors. Discovers that intermediate MLLM layers encode task-relevant information, enabling strong zero-shot retrieval without training.

entry.title: Sparsity-Aware Evolution for Model Merging

author.name: Huan Zhang, Yanjian Zhang, Guillaume Wisniewski, Nadi Tomeh, Bang Liu

entry.summary: Proposes sparsity-aware evolutionary (SAE) framework for model merging that uses iterative pruning-merging cycles as mutation operators. Sparsity constraints create novel competitive dynamics in the evolutionary process.

entry.title: STEP: Warm-Started Visuomotor Policies with Spatiotemporal Consistency Prediction

author.name: Jinhao Li, Yuxuan Cong, Yingqiao Wang, Hao Xia, Shan Huang, Yijia Zhang, Ningyi Xu, Guohao Dai

entry.summary: Proposes STEP, a spatiotemporal consistency prediction mechanism for warm-starting diffusion policies in robotic manipulation, reducing inference latency while preserving action quality for real-time control.

entry.title: Learning Human-Like Badminton Skills for Humanoid Robots

author.name: Yeke Chen, Shihao Dong, Xiaoyu Ji, Jingkai Sun, Zeren Luo, Liu Zhao, Jiahui Zhang, Wanyue Li, Ji Ma, Bowen Xu, Yimin Han, Yudong Zhao, Peng Lu

entry.summary: Proposes Imitation-to-Interaction, a progressive RL framework for teaching humanoid robots human-like badminton skills, evolving from motion mimicry to functional physics-aware striking.

entry.title: Agent-Supported Foresight for AI Systemic Risks: AI Agents for Breadth, Experts for Judgment

author.name: Leon Fr\"ohling, Alessandro Giaconia, Edyta Paulina Bogucka, Daniele Quercia

entry.summary: Proposes using AI agents with the Futures Wheel foresight method to simulate long-term systemic AI risks, benchmarking agent outputs against evaluations from 290 domain experts. Applied to four AI use cases spanning different technology readiness levels.

entry.title: FreqLens: Interpretable Frequency Attribution for Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Chi-Sheng Chen, Xinyu Zhang, En-Jui Kuo, Guan-Ying Chen, Qiuzhe Xie, Fan Zhang

entry.summary: FreqLens provides interpretable time series forecasting through learnable frequency discovery and axiomatic frequency attribution that provably satisfies Completeness, Faithfulness, Null-Frequency, and Symmetry axioms.

entry.title: Online Learning for Uninformed Markov Games: Empirical Nash-Value Regret and Non-Stationarity Adaptation

author.name: Junyan Liu, Haipeng Luo, Zihan Zhang, Lillian J. Ratliff

entry.summary: Studies online learning in two-player uninformed Markov games where opponent actions are unobserved. Proposes a new algorithm achieving optimal Nash-value regret that adapts to non-stationarity, fully addressing limitations of prior V-learning approaches.

entry.title: UTOPIA: Unlearnable Tabular Data via Decoupled Shortcut Embedding

author.name: Jiaming He, Fuming Luo, Hongwei Li, Wenbo Jiang, Wenshu Fan, Zhenbo Shi, Xudong Jiang, Yi Yu

entry.summary: Proposes UTOPIA for making tabular data unlearnable to prevent unauthorized model training. Addresses the challenge of extending unlearnable examples from vision to tabular domains, providing certified unlearnability under a spectral dominance condition.

entry.title: Pareto-guided Pipeline for Distilling Featherweight AI Agents in Mobile MOBA Games

author.name: Xionghui Yang, Bozhou Chen, Yunlong Lu, Yongyi Wang, Lingfeng Li, Lanxiao Huang, Lin Liu, Wenjun Wang, Meng Meng, Xia Lin, Wenxin Li

entry.summary: Addresses deploying powerful game AI agents on mobile devices for Honor of Kings MOBA game. Uses Pareto-guided knowledge distillation to compress large policy networks while maintaining performance under strict latency constraints.

entry.title: Escaping Spectral Bias without Backpropagation: Fast Implicit Neural Representations with Extreme Learning Machines

author.name: Woojin Cho, Junghwan Park

entry.summary: Proposes ELM-INR, a backpropagation-free implicit neural representation using Extreme Learning Machines with domain decomposition. Achieves fast training through closed-form linear least-squares solutions while avoiding spectral bias.

entry.title: ElliCE: Efficient and Provably Robust Algorithmic Recourse via the Rashomon Sets

author.name: Bohdan Turbal, Iryna Voitsitska, Lesia Semenova

entry.summary: Introduces ElliCE for robust algorithmic recourse that optimizes counterfactual explanations over an ellipsoidal approximation of the Rashomon set (set of near-optimal models), ensuring recourse validity across multiple models.

entry.title: Efficient Adaptive Data Analysis over Dense Distributions

author.name: Joon Suk Huh

entry.summary: Studies efficient adaptive data analysis over dense distributions, addressing the tension between computational efficiency and sample complexity. Identifies a natural distribution class where both O(log T) sample complexity and computational efficiency are achievable.

entry.title: Compiler-Assisted Speculative Sampling for Accelerated LLM Inference on Heterogeneous Edge Devices

author.name: Alejandro Ruiz y Mesa, Guilherme Korol, Moritz Riesteter, Jo\~ao Paulo Cardoso de Lima, Jeronimo Castrillon

entry.summary: Proposes a compiler-assisted approach for speculative decoding on heterogeneous edge devices, using an analytical cost model to explore hardware configurations for partitioning LLM inference across SoC components. This addresses the practical challenge of deploying LLMs on resource-constrained devices with real-time latency requirements.

entry.title: Drop the mask! GAMM-A Taxonomy for Graph Attributes Missing Mechanisms

author.name: Richard Serrano (LabHC), Baptiste Jeudy (LabHC), Charlotte Laclau (IDS, S2A), Christine Largeron (LabHC)

entry.summary: Proposes GAMM, a taxonomy for missing data mechanisms in attributed graphs that links missingness probability to both node attributes and graph structure, showing state-of-the-art imputation methods struggle with graph-aware missingness.

entry.title: Low Rank Transformer for Multivariate Time Series Anomaly Detection and Localization

author.name: Charalampos Shimillas, Kleanthis Malialis, Konstantinos Fokianos, Marios M. Polycarpou

entry.summary: Proposes ALoRa-T, a low-rank regularized Transformer for multivariate time series anomaly detection, connecting self-attention to statistical time series methods and introducing an Attention Low-Rank score for anomaly localization.

entry.title: Rho-Perfect: Correlation Ceiling For Subjective Evaluation Datasets

author.name: Fredrik Cumlin

entry.summary: Proposes ρ-Perfect, a practical estimate of the highest achievable model-human correlation on subjectively rated datasets, accounting for heteroscedastic noise inherent in human ratings.

entry.title: Dashed Line Defense: Plug-And-Play Defense Against Adaptive Score-Based Query Attacks

author.name: Yanzhang Fu, Zizheng Guo, Jizhou Luo

entry.summary: Proposes Dashed Line Defense (DLD), a plug-and-play post-processing defense against adaptive score-based query attacks that introduces ambiguity in returned scores to disrupt iterative adversarial optimization.

entry.title: HoGS: Homophily-Oriented Graph Synthesis for Local Differentially Private GNN Training

author.name: Wen Xu, Zhetao Li, Yong Xiao, Pengpeng Qiao, Mianxiong Dong, Kaoru Ota

entry.summary: Proposes HoGS, an LDP framework for GNN training that generates synthetic graphs preserving homophily structure while providing differential privacy for both links and node features.

entry.title: Rethinking Graph Generalization through the Lens of Sharpness-Aware Minimization

author.name: Yang Qiu, Yixiong Zou, Jun Wang

entry.summary: Identifies and addresses Minimal Shift Flip (MSF) in GNNs - where slight distribution shifts cause misclassification - through the lens of Sharpness-Aware Minimization, introducing Local Robust Radius to quantify loss sharpness.

entry.title: Discrete Bridges for Mutual Information Estimation

author.name: Iryna Zabarianska, Sergei Kholkin, Grigoriy Ksenofontov, Ivan Butakov, Alexander Korotin

entry.summary: Leverages discrete bridge matching models for mutual information estimation between discrete random variables, framing MI estimation as a domain transfer problem to construct the DBMI estimator.

entry.title: NLP Sampling: Combining MCMC and NLP Methods for Diverse Constrained Sampling

author.name: Marc Toussaint, Cornelius V. Braun, Joaquim Ortiz-Haro

entry.summary: Proposes NLP Sampling as a framework combining MCMC methods with nonlinear programming for generating diverse samples under hard constraints. Evaluated on analytical and robotics manipulation planning problems.

entry.title: ShapBPT: Image Feature Attributions Using Data-Aware Binary Partition Trees

author.name: Muhammad Rashid, Elvio G. Amparore, Enrico Ferrari, Damiano Verda

entry.summary: Introduces ShapBPT, using data-aware Binary Partition Trees for hierarchical Shapley value computation on images. Exploits multiscale image structure for better-aligned feature attributions with improved convergence.

entry.title: Learning to Alleviate Familiarity Bias in Video Recommendation

author.name: Zheng Ren, Yi Wu, Jianan Lu, Acar Ary, Yiqu Liu, Li Wei, Lukasz Heldt

entry.summary: Presents LAFB, a lightweight model-agnostic framework for mitigating familiarity bias in video recommendation by modeling user-content familiarity and estimating personalized debiasing factors. Validated with real-world A/B testing.

entry.title: DNS: Data-driven Nonlinear Smoother for Complex Model-free Process

author.name: Fredrik Cumlin, Anubhab Ghosh, Saikat Chatterjee

entry.summary: Proposes DNS, a data-driven nonlinear smoother for estimating hidden state sequences from noisy measurements when no state-transition model is available. Uses recurrent architecture with unsupervised learning.

entry.title: AMEM4Rec: Leveraging Cross-User Similarity for Memory Evolution in Agentic LLM Recommenders

author.name: Minh-Duc Nguyen, Hai-Dang Kieu, Dung D. Le

entry.summary: Proposes AMEM4Rec, an agentic LLM-based recommender system that learns collaborative filtering signals through cross-user memory evolution. Uses a global memory pool to store abstract user behavior patterns, addressing limitations of fine-tuning and prompt-based approaches.

entry.title: Quantifying and Attributing Polarization to Annotator Groups

author.name: Dimitris Tsirmpas, John Pavlopoulos

entry.summary: Introduces a metric with statistical significance test for attributing annotation polarization to specific annotator groups. Handles group size imbalances and multi-label settings, applied to hate speech and toxicity detection datasets.

entry.title: Cost-Aware Model Selection for Text Classification: Multi-Objective Trade-offs Between Fine-Tuned Encoders and LLM Prompting in Production

author.name: Alberto Andres Valdes Gonzalez

entry.summary: Systematic comparison of zero/few-shot LLM prompting versus fine-tuned encoder models for text classification, explicitly considering cost, latency, and throughput alongside accuracy across four benchmarks.

entry.title: Quantum Attention by Overlap Interference: Predicting Sequences from Classical and Many-Body Quantum Data

author.name: Alessio Pecilli, Matteo Rosati

entry.summary: Proposes a variational quantum implementation of self-attention (QSA) that uses interference of state overlaps for nonlinearity and achieves O(T d²) gate complexity versus O(T² d) for classical attention, with natural accommodation of trainable data embeddings.

entry.title: Understanding Real-World Traffic Safety through RoadSafe365 Benchmark

author.name: Xinyu Liu, Darryl C. Jacob, Yuxin Liu, Xinsong Du, Muchao Ye, Bolei Zhou, Pan He

entry.summary: Introduces RoadSafe365, a large-scale vision-language benchmark for traffic safety analysis aligned with official safety standards, providing hierarchical taxonomy and rich attribute annotations for crash, incident, and violation analysis.

entry.title: Thermal odometry and dense mapping using learned ddometry and Gaussian splatting

author.name: Tianhao Zhou, Yujia Chen, Zhihao Zhan, Yuhang Ming, Jianzhu Huai

entry.summary: Proposes TOM-GS, a thermal odometry and mapping method integrating learning-based odometry with Gaussian Splatting for dense mapping in adverse conditions like darkness, dust, and smoke.

entry.title: Visualizing the Invisible: Enhancing Radiologist Performance in Breast Mammography via Task-Driven Chromatic Encoding

author.name: Hui Ye, Shilong Yang, Yexuan Xing, Juan Yu, Yaoqin Xie, Wei Zhang, Chulong Zhang

entry.summary: Presents MammoColor, a framework that converts single-channel mammograms into task-driven chromatic encoded views for enhanced visualization, improving radiologist sensitivity in dense breast screening.

entry.title: Fields of The World: A Field Guide for Extracting Agricultural Field Boundaries

author.name: Isaac Corley, Hannah Kerner, Caleb Robinson, Jennifer Marcus

entry.summary: Fields of The World presents an ecosystem of 1.6M field polygons across 24 countries for agricultural field boundary extraction, including pre-trained models and inference tools. The tutorial demonstrates crop classification achieving F1 scores of 0.65-0.75.

entry.title: Geometric Image Editing via Effects-Sensitive In-Context Inpainting with Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Shuo Zhang, Wenzhuo Wu, Huayu Zhang, Jiarong Cheng, Xianghao Zang, Chao Ban, Hao Sun, Zhongjiang He, Tianwei Cao, Kongming Liang, Zhanyu Ma

entry.summary: GeoEdit proposes a framework for geometric image editing (translation, rotation, scaling) using in-context generation through diffusion transformers, with Effects-Sensitive Attention for realistic lighting and shadow modeling.

entry.title: Are Vision Foundation Models Foundational for Electron Microscopy Image Segmentation?

author.name: Caterina Fuster-Barcel\'o, Virginie Uhlmann

entry.summary: This work evaluates whether vision foundation models (DINOv2, DINOv3, OpenCLIP) provide useful representations for electron microscopy mitochondria segmentation, comparing frozen-backbone and LoRA fine-tuning approaches.

entry.title: TIBR4D: Tracing-Guided Iterative Boundary Refinement for Efficient 4D Gaussian Segmentation

author.name: He Wu, Xia Yan, Yanghui Xu, Liegang Xia, Jiazhou Chen

entry.summary: TIBR4D presents a learning-free framework for 4D Gaussian segmentation through iterative boundary refinement, lifting video segmentation masks to 4D space with two-stage refinement for handling occlusions.

entry.title: Evolving LLM-Derived Control Policies for Residential EV Charging and Vehicle-to-Grid Energy Optimization

author.name: Vishesh Purnananda, Benjamin John Wruck, Mingyu Guo

entry.summary: Uses LLMs as intelligent mutation operators in an evolutionary computation framework to generate interpretable Python control policies for residential EV charging and vehicle-to-grid optimization, replacing opaque neural network RL policies.

entry.title: ARGOS: Automated Functional Safety Requirement Synthesis for Embodied AI via Attribute-Guided Combinatorial Reasoning

author.name: Dongsheng Chen, Yuxuan Li, Yi Lin, Guanhua Chen, Jiaxin Zhang, Xiangyu Zhao, Lei Ma, Xin Yao, Xuetao Wei

entry.summary: Proposes ARGOS, a framework for automated functional safety requirement synthesis for embodied AI using LLM-based attribute-guided combinatorial reasoning to address the scalability limitations of traditional hazard analysis methods.

entry.title: Going with the Flow: Koopman Behavioral Models as Implicit Planners for Visuo-Motor Dexterity

author.name: Yunhai Han, Linhao Bai, Ziyu Xiao, Zhaodong Yang, Yogita Choudhary, Krishna Jha, Chuizheng Kong, Shreyas Kousik, Harish Ravichandar

entry.summary: Introduces Unified Behavioral Models (UBMs) based on Koopman operators that represent dexterous manipulation skills as coupled dynamical systems, offering an alternative to diffusion and transformer-based policies with better temporal coherence.

entry.title: Automating the Refinement of Reinforcement Learning Specifications

author.name: Tanmay Ambadkar, {\DJ}or{\dj}e \v{Z}ikeli\'c, Abhinav Verma

entry.summary: Proposes AutoSpec, a framework that automatically refines coarse-grained logical specifications for reinforcement learning tasks by searching for more informative refinements that still imply the original specification. This addresses the common problem of under-specified tasks where RL agents fail to learn useful policies, demonstrated on SpectRL specification logic.

entry.title: Does an AI Society Need an Immune System? Accepting Yampolskiy's Impossibility Results

author.name: Hiroshi Yamakawa

entry.summary: Accepts Yampolskiy's impossibility results for AI alignment but argues that shifting from human-monitors-AI to AI-monitors-AI restructures the problem landscape. Proposes an 'immune system' analogy where imperfect AI self-regulation within AI society is better than no regulation, noting that roughly one-third of impossibility arguments dissolve when AI monitors AI.

entry.title: Can LLMs Truly Embody Human Personality? Analyzing AI and Human Behavior Alignment in Dispute Resolution

author.name: Deuksin Kwon, Kaleen Shrestha, Bin Han, Spencer Lin, James Hale, Jonathan Gratch, Maja Matari\'c, Gale M. Lucas

entry.summary: This paper introduces an evaluation framework comparing human-human and LLM-LLM dispute resolution behaviors with respect to personality traits. It finds that LLMs prompted with personality traits do not reliably reproduce the personality-driven behavioral patterns observed in humans during conflict resolution.

entry.title: MSP-LLM: A Unified Large Language Model Framework for Complete Material Synthesis Planning

author.name: Heewoong Noh, Gyoung S. Na, Namkyeong Lee, Chanyoung Park

entry.summary: MSP-LLM is a unified LLM framework for complete material synthesis planning, covering both precursor prediction and synthesis operation prediction. It introduces material class as an intermediate variable to decompose the complex planning task into manageable subproblems.

entry.title: M2A: Multimodal Memory Agent with Dual-Layer Hybrid Memory for Long-Term Personalized Interactions

author.name: Junyu Feng, Binxiao Xu, Jiayi Chen, Mengyu Dai, Cenyang Wu, Haodong Li, Bohan Zeng, Yunliu Xie, Hao Liang, Ming Lu, Wentao Zhang

entry.summary: M2A proposes a dual-layer hybrid memory system for personalized multimodal interactions that can evolve over weeks/months of conversation. Two collaborative agents (ChatAgent and MemoryAgent) manage user interactions and memory updates respectively.

entry.title: Efficient Table Retrieval and Understanding with Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Zhuoyan Xu, Haoyang Fang, Boran Han, Bonan Min, Bernie Wang, Cuixiong Hu, Shuai Zhang

entry.summary: TabRAG enables multimodal LLMs to answer queries over large collections of table images by combining table retrieval with visual understanding. This addresses a practical gap where relevant tables must first be identified from large-scale collections before reasoning.

entry.title: G-LNS: Generative Large Neighborhood Search for LLM-Based Automatic Heuristic Design

author.name: Baoyun Zhao, He Wang, Liang Zeng

entry.summary: G-LNS uses LLMs to co-evolve destroy and repair operators for Large Neighborhood Search, extending automated heuristic design beyond fixed forms. This generative evolutionary approach enables structural exploration in combinatorial optimization.

entry.title: SurfAge-Net: A Hierarchical Surface-Based Network for Interpretable Fine-Grained Brain Age Prediction

author.name: Rongzhao He, Dalin Zhu, Ying Wang, Songhong Yue, Leilei Zhao, Yu Fu, Dan Wu, Bin Hu, Weihao Zheng

entry.summary: Proposes SurfAge-Net, a hierarchical surface-based network for brain age prediction that captures region-specific developmental patterns using multiple morphological metrics.

entry.title: XAI-CLIP: ROI-Guided Perturbation Framework for Explainable Medical Image Segmentation in Multimodal Vision-Language Models

author.name: Thuraya Alzubaidi, Sana Ammar, Maryam Alsharqi, Islem Rekik, Muzammil Behzad

entry.summary: Proposes XAI-CLIP, an ROI-guided perturbation framework for explainable medical image segmentation using multimodal vision-language models.

entry.title: Assessing Reproducibility in Evolutionary Computation: A Case Study using Human- and LLM-based Assessment

author.name: Francesca Da Ros, Tarik Za\v{c}iragi\'c, Aske Plaat, Thomas B\"ack, Niki van Stein

entry.summary: Studies reproducibility practices in evolutionary computation papers over a 10-year period, introducing a structured checklist and comparing human vs LLM-based reproducibility assessment.

entry.title: CALM: Class-Conditional Sparse Attention Vectors for Large Audio-Language Models

author.name: Videet Mehta, Liming Wang, Hilde Kuehne, Rogerio Feris, James R. Glass, M. Jehanzeb Mirza

entry.summary: CALM proposes class-conditional sparse attention vectors for large audio-language models, assigning non-uniform weights to attention heads based on semantic categories for better discriminative audio classification tasks.

entry.title: Multimodal Enhancement of Sequential Recommendation

author.name: Bucher Sahyouni, Matthew Vowels, Liqun Chen, Simon Hadfield

entry.summary: MuSTRec unifies multimodal and sequential recommendation by building item-item graphs from text and visual features with frequency-based self-attention for user preferences, achieving up to 33.5% improvement over baselines.

entry.title: Laplacian-LoRA: Delaying Oversmoothing in Deep GCNs via Spectral Low-Rank Adaptation

author.name: Sai Vamsi Alisetti

entry.summary: Laplacian-LoRA introduces a learnable spectral correction to GCN propagation operators to delay oversmoothing in deep GCNs, providing a principled spectral approach rather than architectural redesign.

entry.title: KRONE: Hierarchical and Modular Log Anomaly Detection

author.name: Lei Ma, Jinyang Liu, Tieying Zhang, Peter M. VanNostrand, Dennis M. Hofmann, Lei Cao, Elke A. Rundensteiner, Jianjun Chen

entry.summary: KRONE proposes the first hierarchical log anomaly detection framework that automatically derives execution hierarchies from flat logs for modular multi-level anomaly detection.

entry.title: High Fidelity Textual User Representation over Heterogeneous Sources via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Rajat Arora, Ye Tao, Jianqiang Shen, Ping Liu, Muchen Wu, Qianqi Shen, Benjamin Le, Fedor Borisyuk, Jingwei Wu, Wenjing Zhang

entry.summary: Uses reinforcement learning to synthesize unified textual user representations from heterogeneous sources at LinkedIn, using implicit engagement signals as rewards and rule-based rewards as complements.

entry.title: Debugging code world models

author.name: Babak Rahmani

entry.summary: Analyzes failure modes of Code World Models (CWMs) that simulate program execution, identifying two dominant failure regimes: token-budget exhaustion from dense runtime state and semantic errors in state tracking operations.

entry.title: Preference Conditioned Multi-Objective Reinforcement Learning: Decomposed, Diversity-Driven Policy Optimization

author.name: Tanmay Ambadkar, Sourav Panda, Shreyash Kale, Jonathan Dodge, Abhinav Verma

entry.summary: D³PO addresses multi-objective RL failures by decomposing optimization to preserve per-objective learning signals and maintaining diversity across preference space, demonstrating improved Pareto front recovery.

entry.title: VideoTemp-o3: Harmonizing Temporal Grounding and Video Understanding in Agentic Thinking-with-Videos

author.name: Wenqi Liu, Yunxiao Wang, Shijie Ma, Meng Liu, Qile Su, Tianke Zhang, Haonan Fan, Changyi Liu, Kaiyu Jiang, Jiankang Chen, Kaiyu Tang, Bin Wen, Fan Yang, Tingting Gao, Han Li, Yinwei Wei, Xuemeng Song

entry.summary: VideoTemp-o3 is a unified agentic thinking-with-videos framework that jointly models video temporal grounding and question answering, improving localization capability for long-video understanding.

entry.title: Adaptive Acquisition Selection for Bayesian Optimization with Large Language Models

author.name: Giang Ngo, Dat Phan Trong, Dang Nguyen, Sunil Gupta, Svetha Venkatesh

entry.summary: LMABO uses a pre-trained LLM as a zero-shot strategist for Bayesian optimization, dynamically selecting acquisition functions from a portfolio based on structured state representations.

entry.title: MCIE: Multimodal LLM-Driven Complex Instruction Image Editing with Spatial Guidance

author.name: Xuehai Bai, Xiaoling Gu, Akide Liu, Hangjie Yuan, YiFan Zhang, Jack Ma

entry.summary: Introduces MCIE-E1, an MLLM-driven complex instruction image editing method with spatial-aware and background-consistent cross-attention modules. Addresses instruction compliance and background consistency in image editing.

entry.title: Gender and Race Bias in Consumer Product Recommendations by Large Language Models

author.name: Ke Xu, Shera Potka, Alex Thomo

entry.summary: Examines gender and race bias in LLM-generated consumer product recommendations using prompt engineering and three analytical methods (Marked Words, SVM, Jensen-Shannon Divergence).

entry.title: PISCO: Precise Video Instance Insertion with Sparse Control

author.name: Xiangbo Gao, Renjie Li, Xinghao Chen, Yuheng Wu, Suofei Feng, Qing Yin, Zhengzhong Tu

entry.summary: Proposes PISCO for precise video instance insertion with sparse control, enabling insertion of specific instances into existing footage while maintaining scene integrity for AI-assisted filmmaking.

entry.title: Vista: Scene-Aware Optimization for Streaming Video Question Answering under Post-Hoc Queries

author.name: Haocheng Lu, Nan Zhang, Wei Tao, Xiaoyang Qu, Guokuan Li, Jiguang Wan, Jianzong Wang

entry.summary: Presents Vista, a scene-aware streaming video QA framework with dynamic scene segmentation, hierarchical memory, and query-adaptive retrieval for efficient reasoning over continuous video streams.

entry.title: Robustness Is a Function, Not a Number: A Factorized Comprehensive Study of OOD Robustness in Vision-Based Driving

author.name: Amir Mallak, Alaa Maalouf

entry.summary: Decomposes OOD robustness in autonomous driving along five environmental axes and measures performance under controlled perturbations. Finds ViT policies are markedly more robust than CNN/FC, and foundation model features yield best results.

entry.title: Featured Reproducing Kernel Banach Spaces for Learning and Neural Networks

author.name: Isabel de la Higuera, Francisco Herrera, M. Victoria Velasco

entry.summary: Develops a functional-analytic framework for learning in Banach spaces based on featured reproducing kernel Banach spaces, extending kernel learning theory beyond Hilbert space settings to accommodate non-quadratic norms.

entry.title: Cerebellar-Inspired Residual Control for Fault Recovery: From Inference-Time Adaptation to Structural Consolidation

author.name: Nethmi Jayasinghe, Diana Gontero, Spencer T. Brown, Vinod K. Sangwan, Mark C. Hersam, Amit Ranjan Trivedi

entry.summary: Introduces a cerebellar-inspired residual control framework for robotic fault recovery that augments frozen RL policies with online corrective actions at inference time. Demonstrates recovery from simulated actuator faults without retraining.

entry.title: Incorruptible Neural Networks: Training Models that can Generalize to Large Internal Perturbations

author.name: Philip Jacobson, Ben Feinberg, Suhas Kumar, Sapan Agarwal, T. Patrick Xiao, Christopher Bennett

entry.summary: Explores training neural networks robust to large internal weight perturbations using SAM and random-weight perturbation methods. Motivated by deployment on noisy low-power hardware platforms, establishes theoretical and empirical results on noise-robust generalization.

entry.title: FEM-Informed Hypergraph Neural Networks for Efficient Elastoplasticity

author.name: Jianchuan Yang, Xi Chen, Jidong Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes FEM-Informed Hypergraph Neural Networks that embed finite element computations directly into message-passing layers. Achieves physics-driven training without labeled data for elastoplasticity problems.

entry.title: Achieving Optimal Static and Dynamic Regret Simultaneously in Bandits with Deterministic Losses

author.name: Jian Qian, Chen-Yu Wei

entry.summary: Studies simultaneous optimization of static and dynamic regret in adversarial multi-armed bandits with deterministic losses. Shows impossibility against adaptive adversaries extends to deterministic losses, then provides an algorithm achieving optimality against oblivious adversaries.

entry.title: Interpretable Analytic Calabi-Yau Metrics via Symbolic Distillation

author.name: D Yang Eng

entry.summary: Uses symbolic regression to distill neural network approximations of Calabi-Yau metrics into simple interpretable formulas. Achieves R²=0.9994 with 3000x fewer parameters than neural approaches.

entry.title: On Improving Neurosymbolic Learning by Exploiting the Representation Space

author.name: Aaditya Naik, Efthymia Tsamoura, Shibo Jin, Mayur Naik, Dan Roth

entry.summary: Proposes a technique for neurosymbolic learning that prunes the space of label combinations by exploiting representation similarity. Addresses the exponential label space challenge when learning under logical constraints.

entry.title: The Benefits of Diversity: Combining Comparisons and Ratings for Efficient Scoring

author.name: Julien Fageot, Matthias Grossglauser, L\^e-Nguy\^en Hoang, Matteo Tacchi-B\'enard, Oscar Villemaud

entry.summary: Introduces SCoRa, a unified probabilistic model for learning scores from both pairwise comparisons and individual ratings. Proves MAP estimator properties and shows combining both signals outperforms either alone.

entry.title: Online Bayesian Imbalanced Learning with Bregman-Calibrated Deep Networks

author.name: Zahir Alsulaimawi

entry.summary: Presents Online Bayesian Imbalanced Learning (OBIL), a framework that decouples likelihood-ratio estimation from class-prior assumptions, enabling real-time adaptation to distribution shifts in class-imbalanced settings without model retraining.

entry.title: Modalities, a PyTorch-native Framework For Large-scale LLM Training and Research

author.name: Max L\"ubbering, Timm Ruland, Richard Rutmann, Felix Stollenwerk, David Fitzek, Michael Fromm, Alexander Weber, Rafet Sifa, Nicolas Flores-Herr, Joachim K\"ohler, Mehdi Ali

entry.summary: Presents Modalities, a PyTorch-native framework for large-scale LLM training and research that integrates state-of-the-art parallelization with modular configuration for efficient pretraining and systematic ablation studies.

entry.title: USBD: Universal Structural Basis Distillation for Source-Free Graph Domain Adaptation

author.name: Yingxu Wang, Kunyu Zhang, Mengzhu Wang, Siyang Gao, Nan Yin

entry.summary: Proposes USBD for source-free graph domain adaptation that learns a universal structural basis rather than adapting a biased source model, addressing limitations when source GNN smoothness priors don't match target topology.

entry.title: Bridging Academia and Industry: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Attributed Graph Clustering

author.name: Yunhui Liu, Pengyu Qiu, Yu Xing, Yongchao Liu, Peng Du, Chuntao Hong, Jiajun Zheng, Tao Zheng, Tieke He

entry.summary: Presents PyAGC, a comprehensive benchmark for attributed graph clustering that addresses gaps between academic evaluation (small homophilic citation datasets) and real-world deployment, including scalability and label-scarce evaluation.

entry.title: SDFed: Bridging Local Global Discrepancy via Subspace Refinement and Divergence Control in Federated Prompt Learning

author.name: Yicheng Di, Wei Yuan, Tieke He, Zhanjie Zhang, Ao Ma, Yuan Liu, Hongzhi Yin

entry.summary: Proposes SDFed for federated prompt learning with vision-language models, addressing client heterogeneity through subspace refinement and divergence control to bridge local-global prompt discrepancies.

entry.title: From Robotics to Sepsis Treatment: Offline RL via Geometric Pessimism

author.name: Sarthak Wanjari

entry.summary: Proposes Geometric Pessimism, a modular framework augmenting IQL with density-based penalties from k-NN distances to address OOD overestimation in offline RL, applied to robotics and sepsis treatment.

entry.title: Kirin: Improving ANN efficiency with SNN Hybridization

author.name: Chenyu Wang, Zhanglu Yan, Zhi Zhou, Xu Chen, Weng-Fai Wong

entry.summary: Proposes Kirin, an ANN-SNN hybrid approach to improve LLM energy efficiency through conversion, addressing challenges of time window length and information loss in the quantization-to-spike mapping.

entry.title: ShapeCond: Fast Shapelet-Guided Dataset Condensation for Time Series Classification

author.name: Sijia Peng, Yun Xiong, Xi Chen, Yi Xie, Guanzhi Li, Yanwei Yu, Yangyong Zhu, Zhiqiang Shen

entry.summary: Proposes ShapeCond, a dataset condensation framework for time series that leverages shapelets (discriminative temporal motifs) to guide synthesis. The approach is efficient with cost independent of sequence length.

entry.title: OMNI-Dent: Towards an Accessible and Explainable AI Framework for Automated Dental Diagnosis

author.name: Leeje Jang, Yao-Yi Chiang, Angela M. Hastings, Patimaporn Pungchanchaikul, Martha B. Lucas, Emily C. Schultz, Jeffrey P. Louie, Mohamed Estai, Wen-Chen Wang, Ryan H. L. Ip, Boyen Huang

entry.summary: Presents OMNI-Dent, a VLM-based dental diagnosis framework that operates on smartphone photos and incorporates clinical reasoning principles for data-efficient, explainable diagnosis across diverse imaging conditions.

entry.title: Fast Model Selection and Stable Optimization for Softmax-Gated Multinomial-Logistic Mixture of Experts Models

author.name: TrungKhang Tran, TrungTin Nguyen, Md Abul Bashar, Nhat Ho, Richi Nayak, Christopher Drovandi

entry.summary: Develops a batch minorization-maximization algorithm for softmax-gated multinomial-logistic MoE with convergence guarantees, plus a penalized approach for model selection using a finite mixture complexity penalty.

entry.title: Incremental (k, z)-Clustering on Graphs

author.name: Emilio Cruciani, Sebastian Forster, Antonis Skarlatos

entry.summary: Develops randomized incremental algorithms for (k,z)-clustering on dynamic graphs with adversarial edge updates, providing the first efficient dynamic algorithms for this general clustering problem.

entry.title: Cutting Through the Noise: On-the-fly Outlier Detection for Robust Training of Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials

author.name: Terry C. W. Lam, Niamh O'Neill, Christoph Schran, Lars L. Schaaf

entry.summary: Introduces an on-the-fly outlier detection scheme for training machine learning interatomic potentials that automatically down-weights noisy samples by tracking loss distribution via exponential moving average, without requiring additional reference calculations.

entry.title: VowelPrompt: Hearing Speech Emotions from Text via Vowel-level Prosodic Augmentation

author.name: Yancheng Wang, Osama Hanna, Ruiming Xie, Xianfeng Rui, Maohao Shen, Xuedong Zhang, Christian Fuegen, Jilong Wu, Debjyoti Paul, Arthur Guo, Zhihong Lei, Ozlem Kalinli, Qing He, Yingzhen Yang

entry.summary: Proposes VowelPrompt, a framework that augments LLM-based speech emotion recognition with interpretable vowel-level prosodic features, grounded in phonetic evidence that vowels carry primary affective prosody.

entry.title: STACodec: Semantic Token Assignment for Balancing Acoustic Fidelity and Semantic Information in Audio Codecs

author.name: Kaiyuan Zhang, Mohan Shi, Eray Eren, Natarajan Balaji Shankar, Zilai Wang, Abeer Alwan

entry.summary: Introduces STACodec, an audio codec that integrates semantic information from self-supervised learning models into the first quantization layer via semantic token assignment, balancing acoustic fidelity with semantic information without degrading reconstruction quality.

entry.title: SoulX-FlashHead: Oracle-guided Generation of Infinite Real-time Streaming Talking Heads

author.name: Tan Yu, Qian Qiao, Le Shen, Ke Zhou, Jincheng Hu, Dian Sheng, Bo Hu, Haoming Qin, Jun Gao, Changhai Zhou, Shunshun Yin, Siyuan Liu

entry.summary: Proposes SoulX-FlashHead, a 1.3B parameter framework for real-time, infinite-length streaming talking head video generation with a Temporal Audio Context Cache for stable audio feature extraction.

entry.title: IM-Animation: An Implicit Motion Representation for Identity-decoupled Character Animation

author.name: Zhufeng Xu, Xuan Gao, Feng-Lin Liu, Haoxian Zhang, Zhixue Fang, Yu-Kun Lai, Xiaoqiang Liu, Pengfei Wan, Lin Gao

entry.summary: Proposes IM-Animation with a novel implicit motion representation that compresses per-frame motion into compact 1D motion tokens for character animation, addressing identity leakage in implicit methods.

entry.title: All-Optical Segmentation via Diffractive Neural Networks for Autonomous Driving

author.name: Yingjie Li, Daniel Robinson, Cunxi Yu

entry.summary: Proposes all-optical semantic segmentation and lane detection using diffractive optical neural networks for autonomous driving, performing computation via light diffraction at the speed of light.

entry.title: Recovering 3D Shapes from Ultra-Fast Motion-Blurred Images

author.name: Fei Yu, Shudan Guo, Shiqing Xin, Beibei Wang, Haisen Zhao, Wenzheng Chen

entry.summary: Proposes a novel inverse rendering approach for 3D shape recovery from ultra-fast motion-blurred images, applicable to scenarios like fast-moving sports objects or rotating machinery.

entry.title: Which private attributes do VLMs agree on and predict well?

author.name: Olena Hrynenko, Darya Baranouskaya, Alina Elena Baia, Andrea Cavallaro

entry.summary: Evaluates VLMs for zero-shot privacy-related attribute recognition, finding they tend to over-predict privacy attributes compared to human annotators but can complement human annotation in high-agreement cases.

entry.title: FLAG-4D: Flow-Guided Local-Global Dual-Deformation Model for 4D Reconstruction

author.name: Guan Yuan Tan, Ngoc Tuan Vu, Arghya Pal, Sailaja Rajanala, Raphael Phan C. -W., Mettu Srinivas, Chee-Ming Ting

entry.summary: FLAG-4D introduces a dual-deformation network for 4D reconstruction of dynamic scenes using flow-guided local-global deformation of 3D Gaussians, with separate networks for fine-grained local and global motion.

entry.title: Rotated Lights for Consistent and Efficient 2D Gaussians Inverse Rendering

author.name: Geng Lin, Matthias Zwicker

entry.summary: RotLight proposes using rotated lighting conditions for consistent inverse rendering with 2D Gaussians, addressing the albedo-lighting ambiguity that causes baked shadows in material estimation.

entry.title: Closing the Confusion Loop: CLIP-Guided Alignment for Source-Free Domain Adaptation

author.name: Shanshan Wang, Ziying Feng, Xiaozheng Shen, Xun Yang, Pichao Wang, Zhenwei He, Xingyi Zhang

entry.summary: CLIP-Guided Alignment addresses source-free domain adaptation by modeling asymmetric and dynamic class confusion patterns using CLIP guidance to improve pseudo-labeling in fine-grained scenarios.

entry.title: Any-to-All MRI Synthesis: A Unified Foundation Model for Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma and Its Downstream Applications

author.name: Yao Pu, Yiming Shi, Zhenxi Zhang, Peixin Yu, Yitao Zhuang, Xiang Wang, Hongzhao Chen, Jing Cai, Ge Ren

entry.summary: A unified foundation model for MRI synthesis in nasopharyngeal carcinoma radiotherapy, integrating contrastive learning and vision-language alignment to enable any-to-all modality synthesis from incomplete MRI inputs.

entry.title: Modeling 3D Pedestrian-Vehicle Interactions for Vehicle-Conditioned Pose Forecasting

author.name: Guangxun Zhu, Xuan Liu, Nicolas Pugeault, Chongfeng Wei, Edmond S. L. Ho

entry.summary: A 3D vehicle-conditioned pedestrian pose forecasting framework for autonomous driving that explicitly models pedestrian-vehicle interactions, with enhanced Waymo-3DSkelMo dataset including aligned vehicle bounding boxes.

entry.title: Raster2Seq: Polygon Sequence Generation for Floorplan Reconstruction

author.name: Hao Phung, Hadar Averbuch-Elor

entry.summary: Raster2Seq frames floorplan reconstruction as sequence-to-sequence generation, representing rooms, windows, and doors as labeled polygon sequences with an autoregressive decoder for complex floorplans.

entry.title: Learning to Anchor Visual Odometry: KAN-Based Pose Regression for Planetary Landing

author.name: Xubo Luo, Zhaojin Li, Xue Wan, Wei Zhang, Leizheng Shu

entry.summary: KANLoc introduces a monocular localization framework for lunar landing that couples visual odometry with a KAN-based absolute pose regressor, producing global pose anchors that cancel VO drift while retaining local precision.

entry.title: FeudalNav: A Simple Framework for Visual Navigation

author.name: Faith Johnson, Bryan Bo Cao, Shubham Jain, Ashwin Ashok, Kristin Dana

entry.summary: FeudalNav proposes a hierarchical visual navigation framework with a simple waypoint selection network and latent-space memory organized by visual similarity, achieving transferable navigation in unmapped environments.

entry.title: Formal Methods in Robot Policy Learning and Verification: A Survey on Current Techniques and Future Directions

author.name: Anastasios Manganaris, Vittorio Giammarino, Ahmed H. Qureshi, Suresh Jagannathan

entry.summary: Survey on formal methods in robot policy learning and verification, covering how formal and semi-formal methods support specification, synthesis, and validation of deep learning-based robot policies.

entry.title: Trace-Focused Diffusion Policy for Multi-Modal Action Disambiguation in Long-Horizon Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Yuxuan Hu, Xiangyu Chen, Chuhao Zhou, Yuxi Liu, Gen Li, Jindou Jia, Jianfei Yang

entry.summary: Proposes Trace-Focused Diffusion Policy (TF-DP) that conditions action generation on explicit execution history traces to resolve multi-modal action ambiguity in long-horizon manipulation tasks where visually similar observations require different actions.

entry.title: Vec-QMDP: Vectorized POMDP Planning on CPUs for Real-Time Autonomous Driving

author.name: Xuanjin Jin, Yanxin Dong, Bin Sun, Huan Xu, Zhihui Hao, XianPeng Lang, Panpan Cai

entry.summary: Presents Vec-QMDP, a CPU-native parallel POMDP planner that achieves 227x-1073x speedup over serial planners by aligning search with SIMD architecture, enabling real-time autonomous driving planning under uncertainty.

entry.title: UniPlan: Vision-Language Task Planning for Mobile Manipulation with Unified PDDL Formulation

author.name: Haoming Ye, Yunxiao Xiao, Cewu Lu, Panpan Cai

entry.summary: Proposes UniPlan, a vision-language task planning system that unifies scene topology, visuals, and robot capabilities into holistic PDDL for long-horizon mobile manipulation in large indoor environments.

entry.title: GaussianCaR: Gaussian Splatting for Efficient Camera-Radar Fusion

author.name: Santiago Montiel-Mar\'in, Miguel Antunes-Garc\'ia, Fabio S\'anchez-Garc\'ia, Angel Llamazares, Holger Caesar, Luis M. Bergasa

entry.summary: Proposes GaussianCaR that repurposes Gaussian Splatting as a universal view transformer for camera-radar fusion, mapping both image pixels and radar points into a common BEV representation for autonomous driving perception.

entry.title: Fast Rerandomization for Balancing Covariates in Randomized Experiments: A Metropolis-Hastings Framework

author.name: Jiuyao Lu, Tianruo Zhang, Ke Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes a Metropolis-Hastings framework for fast rerandomization in experimental design, addressing the computational bottleneck of rejection sampling when trying to achieve strong covariate balance. This makes rerandomization practical under small balance thresholds that were previously computationally prohibitive.

entry.title: ST-Raptor: An Agentic System for Semi-Structured Table QA

author.name: Jinxiu Qu, Zirui Tang, Hongzhang Huang, Boyu Niu, Wei Zhou, Jiannan Wang, Yitong Song, Guoliang Li, Xuanhe Zhou, Fan Wu

entry.summary: ST-Raptor is an agentic system for question answering over semi-structured tables that preserves hierarchical relationships and implicit logical structures that existing Text-to-SQL or multimodal approaches lose. It uses an agent-based approach to handle complex table layouts more accurately than prior methods.

entry.title: SleepMaMi: A Universal Sleep Foundation Model for Integrating Macro- and Micro-structures

author.name: Keondo Park, Younghoon Na, Yourim Choi, Hyunwoo Ryu, Hyun-Woo Shin, Hyung-Sin Kim

entry.summary: SleepMaMi is a foundation model for sleep medicine that integrates both macro-structure (full-night sleep architecture) and micro-structure (fine-grained signal features) through a hierarchical dual-encoder design. It's trained on polysomnography data and aims to be a universal model across sleep analysis tasks.

entry.title: EventCast: Hybrid Demand Forecasting in E-Commerce with LLM-Based Event Knowledge

author.name: Congcong Hu, Yuang Shi, Fan Huang, Yang Xiang, Zhou Ye, Ming Jin, Shiyu Wang

entry.summary: EventCast integrates LLM-based event reasoning into time-series demand forecasting for e-commerce. LLMs process unstructured business data about campaigns and holidays to generate event features, while traditional time-series models handle numerical forecasting.

entry.title: Geo-Code: A Code Framework for Reverse Code Generation from Geometric Images Based on Two-Stage Multi-Agent Evolution

author.name: Zhenyu Wu, Yanxi Long, Jian Li, Hua Huang

entry.summary: Geo-Coder is the first inverse programming framework for geometric images using a multi-agent system. It decouples the process into geometric modeling via pixel-wise anchoring and metric-driven code evolution, enabling accurate reconstruction of complex geometric details.

entry.title: Puda: Private User Dataset Agent for User-Sovereign and Privacy-Preserving Personalized AI

author.name: Akinori Maeda, Yuto Sekiya, Sota Sugimura, Tomoya Asai, Yu Tsuda, Kohei Ikeda, Hiroshi Fujii, Kohei Watanabe

entry.summary: Puda proposes a user-sovereign architecture for personal data management that enables client-side data aggregation across services with privacy-preserving LLM personalization. Users control data sharing while getting personalized AI services.

entry.title: Effect-Level Validation for Causal Discovery

author.name: Hoang Dang, Luan Pham, Minh Nguyen

entry.summary: Proposes an effect-centric framework for validating causal discovery results that treats discovered graphs as structural hypotheses evaluated by identifiability, stability, and falsification rather than graph recovery accuracy alone. Applied to game telemetry data.

entry.title: TreeTensor: Boost AI System on Nested Data with Constrained Tree-Like Tensor

author.name: Shaoang Zhang, Yazhe Niu

entry.summary: Proposes TreeTensor, a data structure for handling nested/hierarchical data in AI systems more efficiently than conventional fixed-shape tensors, targeting cognitive AI systems with multi-modal hierarchical data.

entry.title: Root Cause Analysis Method Based on Large Language Models with Residual Connection Structures

author.name: Liming Zhou, Ailing Liu, Hongwei Liu, Min He, Heng Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes RC-LLM, a residual-connection-based root cause analysis method using LLMs that integrates multi-source telemetry data for microservice architectures.

entry.title: Improved cystic hygroma detection from prenatal imaging using ultrasound-specific self-supervised representation learning

author.name: Youssef Megahed, Robin Ducharme, Inok Lee, Inbal Willner, Adrian D. C. Chan, Mark Walker, Steven Hawken

entry.summary: Demonstrates ultrasound-specific self-supervised pretraining (USF-MAE) for detecting cystic hygroma in first-trimester ultrasound images, showing improved accuracy over ImageNet-pretrained models.

entry.title: Vectra: A New Metric, Dataset, and Model for Visual Quality Assessment in E-Commerce In-Image Machine Translation

author.name: Qingyu Wu, Yuxuan Han, Haijun Li, Zhao Xu, Jianshan Zhao, Xu Jin, Longyue Wang, Weihua Luo

entry.summary: Introduces Vectra, a reference-free MLLM-driven visual quality assessment framework for e-commerce in-image machine translation with 14 interpretable quality dimensions.

entry.title: Rethinking Scientific Modeling: Toward Physically Consistent and Simulation-Executable Programmatic Generation

author.name: Yongqing Jiang, Jianze Wang, Zhiqi Shen, Zhenghong Lin, Jiayuan Wang, Yijian Yang, Kaoshan Dai, Haoran Luo

entry.summary: Proposes a framework for physics-consistent automatic building modeling using LLMs, integrating domain knowledge, constraint-oriented alignment, and verification-driven evaluation. Introduces CivilInstruct dataset for structural engineering.

entry.title: Lemon Agent Technical Report

author.name: Haipeng Jiang, Kailong Ren, Zimo Yin, Zhetao Sun, Xin Gan, Guangyi Lv, Ming He, Peng Wang, Congli Yin, Hong Pan, Changwen Zhang, Shan Tong, Zhengyu Xu, Zeping Chen, Yubin Huangfu, Yanzhi Xu, Xing Su, Qin Feng, Dong An, Jianping Fan

entry.summary: Lemon Agent is a multi-agent orchestrator-worker system built on the AgentCortex framework, featuring hierarchical self-adaptive scheduling that dynamically adjusts computational intensity based on task complexity.

entry.title: DSL: Understanding and Improving Softmax Recommender Systems with Competition-Aware Scaling

author.name: Bucher Sahyouni, Matthew Vowels, Liqun Chen, Simon Hadfield

entry.summary: Dual-scale Softmax Loss (DSL) for recommender systems infers effective sharpness from sampled competition, adding temperature adaptation based on negative sample difficulty rather than using a global temperature.

entry.title: Sequences as Nodes for Contrastive Multimodal Graph Recommendation

author.name: Bucher Sahyouni, Matthew Vowels, Liqun Chen, Simon Hadfield

entry.summary: MuSICRec proposes a multi-view graph-based recommender combining collaborative, sequential, and multimodal signals by building a sequence-item graph view as an organic alternative to artificial data augmentation.

entry.title: Brep2Shape: Boundary and Shape Representation Alignment via Self-Supervised Transformers

author.name: Yuanxu Sun, Yuezhou Ma, Haixu Wu, Guanyang Zeng, Muye Chen, Jianmin Wang, Mingsheng Long

entry.summary: Brep2Shape introduces self-supervised pre-training aligning abstract B-rep CAD representations with intuitive shape representations by predicting dense spatial points from Bézier control points.

entry.title: Revealing the Semantic Selection Gap in DINOv3 through Training-Free Few-Shot Segmentation

author.name: Hussni Mohd Zakir, Eric Tatt Wei Ho

entry.summary: Investigates few-shot semantic segmentation capabilities of frozen DINOv3 features, revealing a significant performance gap between standard last-layer features and optimal layer selection, termed the 'semantic selection gap'.

entry.title: Generative Reasoning Re-ranker

author.name: Mingfu Liang, Yufei Li, Jay Xu, Kavosh Asadi, Xi Liu, Shuo Gu, Kaushik Rangadurai, Frank Shyu, Shuaiwen Wang, Song Yang, Zhijing Li, Jiang Liu, Mengying Sun, Fei Tian, Xiaohan Wei, Chonglin Sun, Jacob Tao, Shike Mei, Hamed Firooz, Wenlin Chen, Luke Simon

entry.summary: Proposes a generative reasoning re-ranker for recommendation systems using LLMs with reinforcement learning-enhanced reasoning, representing items with semantic identifiers instead of non-semantic IDs.

entry.title: Generating Adversarial Events: A Motion-Aware Point Cloud Framework

author.name: Hongwei Ren, Youxin Jiang, Qifei Gu, Xiangqian Wu

entry.summary: Proposes MA-ADV, first motion-aware adversarial attack framework for event cameras that generates adversarial events by leveraging point cloud representation to address non-differentiability of event representations.

entry.title: LEFT: Learnable Fusion of Tri-view Tokens for Unsupervised Time Series Anomaly Detection

author.name: Dezheng Wang, Tong Chen, Guansong Pang, Congyan Chen, Shihua Li, Hongzhi Yin

entry.summary: LEFT proposes learnable fusion of tri-view tokens (time, frequency, mixed resolution) for unsupervised time series anomaly detection, enforcing analysis-synthesis consistency across views through inverse transforms.

entry.title: From Obstacles to Etiquette: Robot Social Navigation with VLM-Informed Path Selection

author.name: Zilin Fang, Anxing Xiao, David Hsu, Gim Hee Lee

entry.summary: Proposes robot social navigation framework that integrates geometric planning with VLM-based social reasoning, using a fine-tuned VLM to evaluate candidate paths based on contextual social expectations.

entry.title: AVERE: Improving Audiovisual Emotion Reasoning with Preference Optimization

author.name: Ashutosh Chaubey, Jiacheng Pang, Maksim Siniukov, Mohammad Soleymani

entry.summary: AVERE introduces EmoReAlM benchmark for evaluating MLLM emotion understanding and proposes AVEm-DPO, a preference optimization technique addressing spurious cue-emotion associations and audiovisual hallucinations.

entry.title: VertCoHiRF: Decentralized Vertical Clustering Beyond k-means

author.name: Bruno Belucci, Karim Lounici, Vladimir R. Kostic, Katia Meziani

entry.summary: Introduces VertCoHiRF, a fully decentralized framework for vertical federated clustering that achieves structural consensus across heterogeneous feature views without exchanging feature-dependent statistics. Goes beyond distributed k-means.

entry.title: Scalable Dexterous Robot Learning with AR-based Remote Human-Robot Interactions

author.name: Yicheng Yang, Ruijiao Li, Lifeng Wang, Shuai Zheng, Shunzheng Ma, Keyu Zhang, Tuoyu Sun, Chenyun Dai, Jie Ding, Zhuo Zou

entry.summary: Presents a framework for scalable dexterous robot learning using AR-based remote human-robot interactions for demonstration collection. Combines behavior cloning pretraining with contrastive learning-empowered RL fine-tuning.

entry.title: Data-Aware and Scalable Sensitivity Analysis for Decision Tree Ensembles

author.name: Namrita Varshney, Ashutosh Gupta, Arhaan Ahmad, Tanay V. Tayal, S. Akshay

entry.summary: Proposes data-aware sensitivity analysis for decision tree ensembles that constrains sensitivity examples to remain close to the training distribution. Develops novel techniques for scalable data-aware search.

entry.title: Bipartite Graph Attention-based Clustering for Large-scale scRNA-seq Data

author.name: Zhuomin Liang, Liang Bai, Xian Yang

entry.summary: Proposes a bipartite graph transformer approach for large-scale scRNA-seq clustering that reduces O(n²) complexity. Uses bipartite attention between cells and learned cluster anchors.

entry.title: CoMI-IRL: Contrastive Multi-Intention Inverse Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Antonio Mone, Frans A. Oliehoek, Luciano Cavalcante Siebert

entry.summary: Proposes CoMI-IRL, a transformer-based framework for multi-intention inverse RL that decouples behavior representation from reward learning. Removes the need to know the number of behavioral modes a priori.

entry.title: Federated Learning with Profile Mapping under Distribution Shifts and Drifts

author.name: Mohan Li, Dario Fenoglio, Martin Gjoreski, Marc Langheinrich

entry.summary: Introduces Feroma, a federated learning framework handling both distribution shift across clients and distribution drift over time using compact, privacy-preserving client distribution profiles for adaptive model aggregation.

entry.title: Approximating Matrix Functions with Deep Neural Networks and Transformers

author.name: Rahul Padmanabhan, Simone Brugiapaglia

entry.summary: Studies approximation of matrix functions (e.g., matrix exponential) using neural networks and transformers. Proves bounds on ReLU network size needed and shows transformers can approximately compute matrix functions.

entry.title: Regret Analysis of Unichain Average Reward Constrained MDPs with General Parameterization

author.name: Anirudh Satheesh, Vaneet Aggarwal

entry.summary: Studies average-reward constrained MDPs under unichain assumption with general parameterization. Proposes a primal-dual actor-critic algorithm achieving O(√T) regret and constraint violation without mixing-time oracles.

entry.title: Enhancing Bandit Algorithms with LLMs for Time-varying User Preferences in Streaming Recommendations

author.name: Chenglei Shen, Yi Zhan, Weijie Yu, Xiao Zhang, Jun Xu

entry.summary: Proposes HyperBandit+, a contextual bandit policy integrating a time-aware hypernetwork for streaming recommendations with evolving user preferences, plus an LLM-assisted warm-start mechanism to improve early-phase exploration. Combines bandit algorithms with LLM capabilities.

entry.title: Interpretable Dynamic Network Modeling of Tensor Time Series via Kronecker Time-Varying Graphical Lasso

author.name: Shingo Higashiguchi, Koki Kawabata, Yasuko Matsubara, Yasushi Sakurai

entry.summary: Proposes KTVGL for modeling tensor time series by estimating time-varying dependency networks through Kronecker-structured graphical lasso, enabling interpretable and computationally efficient dynamic network estimation.

entry.title: RIFLE: Robust Distillation-based FL for Deep Model Deployment on Resource-Constrained IoT Networks

author.name: Pouria Arefijamal, Mahdi Ahmadlou, Bardia Safaei, J\"org Henkel

entry.summary: Introduces RIFLE, a robust federated learning framework for IoT that replaces gradient sharing with knowledge distillation and includes defenses against malicious clients and poisoned updates.

entry.title: Is Meta-Path Attention an Explanation? Evidence of Alignment and Decoupling in Heterogeneous GNNs

author.name: Maiqi Jiang, Noman Ali, Yiran Ding, Yanfu Zhang

entry.summary: Empirically studies when meta-path attention in heterogeneous GNNs reflects true meta-path importance versus when it can decouple, introducing MetaXplain for controlled analysis in the native meta-path view domain.

entry.title: FairRARI: A Plug and Play Framework for Fairness-Aware PageRank

author.name: Emmanouil Kariotakis, Aritra Konar

entry.summary: Proposes FairRARI, a unified convex optimization framework for computing PageRank vectors subject to various group-fairness criteria, leveraging a variational formulation of PageRank.

entry.title: ERIS: Enhancing Privacy and Communication Efficiency in Serverless Federated Learning

author.name: Dario Fenoglio, Pasquale Polverino, Jacopo Quizi, Martin Gjoreski, Marc Langheinrich

entry.summary: Proposes ERIS, a serverless federated learning framework combining model partitioning with distributed compressed gradient sharing, providing theoretical convergence and privacy guarantees.

entry.title: Two-Stage Data Synthesization: A Statistics-Driven Restricted Trade-off between Privacy and Prediction

author.name: Xiaotong Liu, Shao-Bo Lin, Jun Fan, Ding-Xuan Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes a two-stage data synthesis strategy that balances privacy (requiring perturbation) and prediction performance (sensitive to perturbation) through synthesis-then-hybrid and subsequent calibration steps.

entry.title: GEMSS: A Variational Bayesian Method for Discovering Multiple Sparse Solutions in Classification and Regression Problems

author.name: Kate\v{r}ina Henclov\'a, V\'aclav \v{S}m\'idl

entry.summary: Presents GEMSS, a variational Bayesian framework for discovering multiple diverse sparse feature subsets that explain data equally well in underdetermined settings. Addresses the limitation that conventional methods find only one sparse solution.

entry.title: Curriculum-Learned Vanishing Stacked Residual PINNs for Hyperbolic PDE State Reconstruction

author.name: Katayoun Eshkofti, Matthieu Barreau

entry.summary: Integrates curriculum learning methods (primal-dual optimization, causality progression, adaptive sampling) into Vanishing Stacked Residual PINNs for solving hyperbolic PDEs with discontinuities and shocks.

entry.title: Graph-based Semi-Supervised Learning via Maximum Discrimination

author.name: Nadav Katz, Ariel Jaffe

entry.summary: Proposes AUC-spec, a graph-based semi-supervised learning method that computes representations maximizing AUC-based class separation, improving upon Label Propagation and Label Spreading on complex distributions.

entry.title: Evasion of IoT Malware Detection via Dummy Code Injection

author.name: Sahar Zargarzadeh, Mohammad Islam

entry.summary: Presents an adversarial strategy against power side-channel malware detection by injecting dummy code to perturb power signatures, achieving high evasion rates against AI/ML classifiers.

entry.title: PACC: Protocol-Aware Cross-Layer Compression for Compact Network Traffic Representation

author.name: Zhaochen Guo, Tianyufei Zhou, Honghao Wang, Ronghua Li, Shinan Liu

entry.summary: Proposes PACC, a protocol-aware cross-layer compression method for network traffic representation that explicitly removes redundancy within and across protocol layers for better traffic classification.

entry.title: Do physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) need to be deep? Shallow PINNs using the Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm

author.name: Muhammad Luthfi Shahab, Imam Mukhlash, Hadi Susanto

entry.summary: Investigates shallow PINNs with Levenberg-Marquardt optimization for solving forward and inverse PDE problems, showing LM significantly outperforms BFGS for this purpose with analytical Jacobian computation.

entry.title: Contrastive Learning for Diversity-Aware Product Recommendations in Retail

author.name: Vasileios Karlis, Ezgi Y{\i}ld{\i}r{\i}m, David Vos, Maarten de Rijke

entry.summary: Introduces contrastive learning with carefully selected negative samples to improve catalog coverage in IKEA's retail recommendation system without compromising quality. Demonstrates improvements through both offline and online evaluations.

entry.title: Lost in Speech: Benchmarking, Evaluation, and Parsing of Spoken Code-Switching Beyond Standard UD Assumptions

author.name: Nemika Tyagi, Holly Hendrix, Nelvin Licona-Guevara, Justin Mackie, Phanos Kareen, Muhammad Imran, Megan Michelle Smith, Tatiana Gallego Hernande, Chitta Baral, Olga Kellert

entry.summary: Addresses challenges of parsing spoken code-switching by introducing a taxonomy of spoken CSW phenomena, SpokeBench gold benchmark, and FLEX-UD evaluation metrics that tolerate acceptable structural variation.

entry.title: Reading Between the Waves: Robust Topic Segmentation Using Inter-Sentence Audio Features

author.name: Steffen Freisinger, Philipp Seeberger, Tobias Bocklet, Korbinian Riedhammer

entry.summary: Proposes a multi-modal approach for topic segmentation in spoken content using fine-tuned text and Siamese audio encoders to capture acoustic cues around sentence boundaries. Shows gains over text-only baselines and better ASR noise resilience.

entry.title: Condition Matters in Full-head 3D GANs

author.name: Heyuan Li, Huimin Zhang, Yuda Qiu, Zhengwentai Sun, Keru Zheng, Lingteng Qiu, Peihao Li, Qi Zuo, Ce Chen, Yujian Zheng, Yuming Gu, Zilong Dong, Xiaoguang Han

entry.summary: Shows that conditioning choice is crucial for full-head 3D GANs, proposing view-invariant semantic features instead of view angles as conditioning input to achieve global coherence across different head regions.

entry.title: Learning Brain Representation with Hierarchical Visual Embeddings

author.name: Jiawen Zheng, Haonan Jia, Ming Li, Yuhui Zheng, Yufeng Zeng, Yang Gao, Chen Liang

entry.summary: Proposes a brain-image alignment strategy using multiple pre-trained visual encoders with distinct inductive biases to capture hierarchical visual representations for brain signal decoding via contrastive learning.

entry.title: FlexID: Training-Free Flexible Identity Injection via Intent-Aware Modulation for Text-to-Image Generation

author.name: Guandong Li, Yijun Ding

entry.summary: Proposes FlexID, a training-free framework for identity injection in text-to-image generation that decouples identity into semantic and visual dimensions with context-aware adaptive gating.

entry.title: HistoMet: A Pan-Cancer Deep Learning Framework for Prognostic Prediction of Metastatic Progression and Site Tropism from Primary Tumor Histopathology

author.name: Yixin Chen, Ziyu Su, Lingbin Meng, Elshad Hasanov, Wei Chen, Anil Parwani, M. Khalid Khan Niazi

entry.summary: Presents HistoMet, a deep learning framework for predicting metastatic progression and site tropism from primary tumor histopathology using a decision-aware, concept-aligned multiple instance learning approach.

entry.title: Open-Text Aerial Detection: A Unified Framework For Aerial Visual Grounding And Detection

author.name: Guoting Wei, Xia Yuan, Yang Zhou, Haizhao Jing, Yu Liu, Xianbiao Qi, Chunxia Zhao, Haokui Zhang, Rong Xiao

entry.summary: Proposes OTA-Det, the first unified framework bridging Open-Vocabulary Aerial Detection and Remote Sensing Visual Grounding into a cohesive architecture supporting both rich semantic understanding and multi-target detection.

entry.title: FSP-Diff: Full-Spectrum Prior-Enhanced DualDomain Latent Diffusion for Ultra-Low-Dose Spectral CT Reconstruction

author.name: Peng Peng, Xinrui Zhang, Junlin Wang, Lei Li, Shaoyu Wang, Qiegen Liu

entry.summary: FSP-Diff proposes a dual-domain latent diffusion framework for ultra-low-dose spectral CT reconstruction, integrating full-spectrum priors across energy channels. It combines complementary feature construction, multi-scale cross-spectral learning, and dual-domain diffusion for improved reconstruction quality.

entry.title: Chain-of-Caption: Training-free improvement of multimodal large language model on referring expression comprehension

author.name: Yik Lung Pang, Changjae Oh

entry.summary: Chain-of-Caption proposes a training-free framework to improve referring expression comprehension in MLLMs by providing additional visual and textual context through tool use and chain-of-thought techniques.

entry.title: TriC-Motion: Tri-Domain Causal Modeling Grounded Text-to-Motion Generation

author.name: Yiyang Cao, Yunze Deng, Ziyu Lin, Bin Feng, Xinggang Wang, Wenyu Liu, Dandan Zheng, Jingdong Chen

entry.summary: TriC-Motion proposes tri-domain (spatial, temporal, frequency) causal modeling for text-to-motion generation, using causal intervention to disentangle noise-related cues from motion-relevant features.

entry.title: Low-Light Video Enhancement with An Effective Spatial-Temporal Decomposition Paradigm

author.name: Xiaogang Xu, Kun Zhou, Tao Hu, Jiafei Wu, Ruixing Wang, Hao Peng, Bei Yu

entry.summary: VLLVE proposes a view-aware decomposition strategy for low-light video enhancement, separating view-independent appearance from view-dependent shading with cross-frame correspondences and scene-level continuity constraints.

entry.title: Generalizing Sports Feedback Generation by Watching Competitions and Reading Books: A Rock Climbing Case Study

author.name: Arushi Rai, Adriana Kovashka

entry.summary: This paper proposes using freely available web data (competition videos, instructional books) to improve sports feedback generation by video-LLMs without expensive sport-specific finetuning data, using rock climbing as a case study.

entry.title: When Simultaneous Localization and Mapping Meets Wireless Communications: A Survey

author.name: Konstantinos Gounis, Sotiris A. Tegos, Dimitrios Tyrovolas, Panagiotis D. Diamantoulakis, George K. Karagiannidis

entry.summary: A comprehensive survey on the intersection of SLAM and wireless communications, covering bidirectional impacts including RF-based sensing, visual SLAM integration, and channel-aware path planning.

entry.title: Generative structural elucidation from mass spectra as an iterative optimization problem

author.name: Mrunali Manjrekar, Runzhong Wang, Samuel Goldman, Jenna C. Fromer, Connor W. Coley

entry.summary: Introduces FOAM, a computational workflow for structural elucidation from mass spectrometry data that poses the problem as iterative optimization using a formula-constrained graph genetic algorithm coupled with spectral simulation.

entry.title: LCLA: Language-Conditioned Latent Alignment for Vision-Language Navigation

author.name: Nitesh Subedi, Adam Haroon, Samuel Tetteh, Prajwal Koirala, Cody Fleming, Soumik Sarkar

entry.summary: Proposes LCLA, a vision-language navigation framework that learns modular perception-action interfaces by aligning visual-language observations to a latent space of a privileged expert policy, decoupling perception from control.

entry.title: Feasibility-Guided Planning over Multi-Specialized Locomotion Policies

author.name: Ying-Sheng Luo, Lu-Ching Wang, Hanjaya Mandala, Yu-Lun Chou, Guilherme Christmann, Yu-Chung Chen, Yung-Shun Chan, Chun-Yi Lee, Wei-Chao Chen

entry.summary: Proposes a feasibility-guided planning framework for legged robots that integrates multiple terrain-specific locomotion policies using learned Feasibility-Nets that predict policy feasibility from local elevation maps.

entry.title: Decentralized Intent-Based Multi-Robot Task Planner with LLM Oracles on Hyperledger Fabric

author.name: Farhad Keramat, Salma Salimi, Tomi Westerlund

entry.summary: Proposes a decentralized multi-robot task planner using LLM oracles on Hyperledger Fabric blockchain, aggregating outputs from multiple LLM vendors to reduce self-preferencing and improve trustworthiness.

entry.title: Bi-Adapt: Few-shot Bimanual Adaptation for Novel Categories of 3D Objects via Semantic Correspondence

author.name: Jinxian Zhou, Ruihai Wu, Yiwei Liu, Yiwen Hou, Xunzhe Zhou, Checheng Yu, Licheng Zhong, Lin Shao

entry.summary: Proposes Bi-Adapt for bimanual manipulation generalization across object categories via semantic correspondence from vision foundation models. Achieves cross-category affordance mapping with few-shot fine-tuning.

entry.title: Reduced-order Control and Geometric Structure of Learned Lagrangian Latent Dynamics

author.name: Katharina Friedl, No\'emie Jaquier, Seungyeon Kim, Jens Lundell, Danica Kragic

entry.summary: Introduces a latent control framework using learned structure-preserving reduced-order dynamics for high-dimensional Lagrangian systems like deformable objects, with Riemannian perspective on model-order reduction.

entry.title: Design sketches for angels-on-the-shoulder

author.name: owencb

entry.summary: Presents design sketches for 'angels-on-the-shoulder' — AI-powered personal tools including aligned recommender systems, personalized learning systems, and decision-support tools designed to help people make more endorsed decisions and fewer unforced errors, especially during the AI transition period.

entry.title: MePo: Meta Post-Refinement for Rehearsal-Free General Continual Learnin

author.name: Guanglong Sun, Hongwei Yan, Liyuan Wang, Zhiqi Kang, Shuang Cui, Hang Su, Jun Zhu, Yi Zhong

entry.summary: MePo introduces Meta Post-Refinement for general continual learning with pre-trained models, inspired by meta-plasticity and reconstructive memory in neuroscience. It addresses the challenge of reconciling diverse, temporally mixed information in a single pass.

entry.title: Continuity-driven Synergistic Diffusion with Neural Priors for Ultra-Sparse-View CBCT Reconstruction

author.name: Junlin Wang, Jiancheng Fang, Peng Peng, Shaoyu Wang, Qiegen Liu
