entry.summary: CSDN proposes a continuity-driven diffusion approach with neural priors for ultra-sparse-view cone-beam CT reconstruction. Neural priors encode continuous 3D attenuation representations to enable physically consistent views while a diffusion process refines fine details.

entry.title: RealSynCol: a high-fidelity synthetic colon dataset for 3D reconstruction applications

author.name: Chiara Lena, Davide Milesi, Alessandro Casella, Luca Carlini, Joseph C. Norton, James Martin, Bruno Scaglioni, Keith L. Obstein, Roberto De Sire, Marco Spadaccini, Cesare Hassan, Pietro Valdastri, Elena De Momi

entry.summary: RealSynCol presents a realistic synthetic colon dataset for colonoscopy 3D reconstruction, comprising 28K frames from 10 CT-derived geometries with ground truth depth, optical flow, 3D meshes, and camera trajectories.

entry.title: FusionEdit: Semantic Fusion and Attention Modulation for Training-Free Image Editing

author.name: Yongwen Lai, Chaoqun Wang, Shaobo Min

entry.summary: FusionEdit proposes a training-free image editing framework using semantic fusion and attention modulation, with distance-aware latent fusion along region boundaries to mitigate artifacts from hard mask boundaries.

entry.title: E-VAds: An E-commerce Short Videos Understanding Benchmark for MLLMs

author.name: Xianjie Liu, Yiman Hu, Liang Wu, Ping Hu, Yixiong Zou, Jian Xu, Bo Zheng

entry.summary: E-VAds introduces a benchmark for understanding e-commerce short videos by MLLMs, with a multi-modal information density assessment framework showing e-commerce content has substantially higher density than mainstream datasets.

entry.title: Thegra: Graph-based SLAM for Thermal Imagery

author.name: Anastasiia Kornilova, Ivan Moskalenko, Arabella Gromova, Gonzalo Ferrer, Alexander Menshchikov

entry.summary: Thegra proposes a graph-based SLAM system for thermal imagery using learned features (SuperPoint + LightGlue) with preprocessing adaptations for the thermal domain's challenges of low texture and high noise.

entry.title: SupChain-Bench: Benchmarking Large Language Models for Real-World Supply Chain Management

author.name: Shengyue Guan, Yihao Liu, Lang Cao

entry.summary: SupChain-Bench benchmarks LLMs on real-world supply chain management tasks requiring multi-step tool-based orchestration following standard operating procedures. It reveals substantial gaps in execution reliability and proposes SupChain-ReAct, an SOP-free framework for autonomous orchestration.

entry.title: Disentangled Instrumental Variables for Causal Inference with Networked Observational Data

author.name: Zhirong Huang, Debo Cheng, Guixian Zhang, Yi Wang, Jiuyong Li, Shichao Zhang

entry.summary: DisIV proposes a method for disentangling instrumental variables in networked observational data to satisfy exogeneity assumptions. It exploits network homogeneity to separate environment-induced endogenous correlations from individual-specific exogenous variation.

entry.title: Circuit Representations of Random Forests with Applications to XAI

author.name: Chunxi Ji, Adnan Darwiche

entry.summary: Presents an approach for compiling random forest classifiers into circuits for computing decision explanations, robustness, and decision-flipping. Shows significant efficiency improvements over existing circuit compilation approaches.

entry.title: The Use of AI Tools to Develop and Validate Q-Matrices

author.name: Kevin Fan, Jacquelyn A. Bialo, Hongli Li

entry.summary: Investigates whether AI language models can support Q-matrix development for cognitive diagnostic modeling, finding Google Gemini 2.5 Pro achieved higher agreement with validated Q-matrices than human experts.

entry.title: Digital Twin and Agentic AI for Wild Fire Disaster Management: Intelligent Virtual Situation Room

author.name: Mohammad Morsali, Siavash H. Khajavi

entry.summary: Introduces the Intelligent Virtual Situation Room (IVSR), a bidirectional Digital Twin platform with autonomous AI agents for real-time wildfire disaster management.

entry.title: Hierarchical JEPA Meets Predictive Remote Control in Beyond 5G Networks

author.name: Abanoub M. Girgis, Ibtissam Labriji, Mehdi Bennis

entry.summary: Proposes Hierarchical JEPA for scalable predictive control in wireless networked systems, encoding device observations into low-dimensional embeddings for bandwidth-efficient communication.

entry.title: PipeMFL-240K: A Large-scale Dataset and Benchmark for Object Detection in Pipeline Magnetic Flux Leakage Imaging

author.name: Tianyi Qu, Songxiao Yang, Haolin Wang, Huadong Song, Xiaoting Guo, Wenguang Hu, Guanlin Liu, Honghe Chen, Yafei Ou

entry.summary: Introduces PipeMFL-240K, a large-scale annotated dataset and benchmark for object detection in pipeline magnetic flux leakage imaging with 12 categories.

entry.title: MTS-CSNet: Multiscale Tensor Factorization for Deep Compressive Sensing on RGB Images

author.name: Mehmet Yamac, Lei Xu, Serkan Kiranyaz, Moncef Gabbouj

entry.summary: Proposes MTSCSNet for deep compressive sensing on RGB images using Multiscale Tensor Summation factorization for efficient multi-dimensional signal processing.

entry.title: Pro-ZD: A Transferable Graph Neural Network Approach for Proactive Zero-Day Threats Mitigation

author.name: Nardine Basta, Firas Ben Hmida, Houssem Jmal, Muhammad Ikram, Mohamed Ali Kaafar, Andy Walker

entry.summary: Pro-ZD introduces a graph neural network model for identifying weighted shortest paths in enterprise networks to detect misconfigurations and high-risk exposures, particularly for zero-day threat mitigation. The model transfers across different network topologies.

entry.title: QuantaAlpha: An Evolutionary Framework for LLM-Driven Alpha Mining

author.name: Jun Han, Shuo Zhang, Wei Li, Zhi Yang, Yifan Dong, Tu Hu, Jialuo Yuan, Xiaomin Yu, Yumo Zhu, Fangqi Lou, Xin Guo, Zhaowei Liu, Tianyi Jiang, Ruichuan An, Jingping Liu, Biao Wu, Rongze Chen, Kunyi Wang, Yifan Wang, Sen Hu, Xinbing Kong, Liwen Zhang, Ronghao Chen, Huacan Wang

entry.summary: QuantaAlpha proposes an evolutionary framework using LLMs for alpha mining in financial markets, treating each mining run as a trajectory and improving factors through trajectory-level mutation and crossover operations.

entry.title: Ex-Omni: Enabling 3D Facial Animation Generation for Omni-modal Large Language Models

author.name: Haoyu Zhang, Zhipeng Li, Yiwen Guo, Tianshu Yu

entry.summary: Ex-Omni augments omni-modal LLMs with speech-accompanied 3D facial animation by decoupling semantic reasoning from temporal generation, using speech units as temporal anchors.

entry.title: BadSNN: Backdoor Attacks on Spiking Neural Networks via Adversarial Spiking Neuron

author.name: Abdullah Arafat Miah, Kevin Vu, Yu Bi

entry.summary: Proposes backdoor attacks on spiking neural networks that exploit unique SNN characteristics like membrane potential threshold and time constants, going beyond standard DNN backdoor approaches.

entry.title: Realistic Synthetic Household Data Generation at Scale

author.name: Siddharth Singh, Ifrah Idrees, Abraham Dauhajre

entry.summary: Proposes a generative framework for creating realistic synthetic household data at scale, modeling bidirectional influence between human behavior and environments for embodied AI research.

entry.title: Progressive Searching for Retrieval in RAG

author.name: Taehee Jeong, Xingzhe Zhao, Peizu Li, Markus Valvur, Weihua Zhao

entry.summary: Progressive searching algorithm for RAG retrieval that incrementally refines candidates through a hierarchy from low-dimensional to higher-dimensional embeddings, reducing computational cost.

entry.title: Seeing Roads Through Words: A Language-Guided Framework for RGB-T Driving Scene Segmentation

author.name: Ruturaj Reddy, Hrishav Bakul Barua, Junn Yong Loo, Thanh Thi Nguyen, Ganesh Krishnasamy

entry.summary: CLARITY proposes a VLM-guided dynamic RGB-Thermal fusion for road scene segmentation that adapts fusion strategy based on detected illumination conditions rather than using a static approach.

entry.title: TextOp: Real-time Interactive Text-Driven Humanoid Robot Motion Generation and Control

author.name: Weiji Xie, Jiakun Zheng, Jinrui Han, Jiyuan Shi, Weinan Zhang, Chenjia Bai, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: TextOp is a real-time text-driven humanoid robot motion generation and control framework that supports streaming language commands and on-the-fly instruction modification during execution, using a two-level architecture.

entry.title: How does longer temporal context enhance multimodal narrative video processing in the brain?

author.name: Prachi Jindal, Anant Khandelwal, Manish Gupta, Bapi S. Raju, Subba Reddy Oota, Tanmoy Chakraborty

entry.summary: Investigates how temporal context length of video clips affects brain-model alignment during movie watching using fMRI. Finds increasing clip duration improves alignment for multimodal LLMs but not unimodal models.

entry.title: Graph Domain Adaptation via Homophily-Agnostic Reconstructing Structure

author.name: Ruiyi Fang, Shuo Wang, Ruizhi Pu, Qiuhao Zeng, Hao Zheng, Ziyan Wang, Jiale Cai, Zhimin Mei, Song Tang, Charles Ling, Boyu Wang

entry.summary: Proposes a homophily-agnostic graph domain adaptation approach that handles graphs with varying degrees of homophily/heterophily by reconstructing separate homophilic and heterophilic graph variants.

entry.title: Continuous Program Search

author.name: Matthew Siper, Muhammad Umair Nasir, Ahmed Khalifa, Lisa Soros, Jay Azhang, Julian Togelius

entry.summary: Addresses locality problems in genetic programming by learning a continuous program space where latent distance has behavioral meaning, then designing mutation operators that exploit this structure.

entry.title: CausalTAD: Injecting Causal Knowledge into Large Language Models for Tabular Anomaly Detection

author.name: Ruiqi Wang, Ruikang Liu, Runyu Chen, Haoxiang Suo, Zhiyi Peng, Zhuo Tang, Changjian Chen

entry.summary: CausalTAD injects causal knowledge into LLMs for tabular anomaly detection by reordering columns according to causal relationships and using causal-aware soft prompts.

entry.title: SoulX-Singer: Towards High-Quality Zero-Shot Singing Voice Synthesis

author.name: Jiale Qian, Hao Meng, Tian Zheng, Pengcheng Zhu, Haopeng Lin, Yuhang Dai, Hanke Xie, Wenxiao Cao, Ruixuan Shang, Jun Wu, Hongmei Liu, Hanlin Wen, Jian Zhao, Zhonglin Jiang, Yong Chen, Shunshun Yin, Ming Tao, Jianguo Wei, Lei Xie, Xinsheng Wang

entry.summary: SoulX-Singer is an open-source singing voice synthesis system trained on 42K+ hours supporting Mandarin, English, and Cantonese, designed for industrial deployment with controllable singing generation.

entry.title: Accuracy-Delay Trade-Off in LLM Offloading via Token-Level Uncertainty

author.name: Yumin Kim, Hyeonsu Lyu, Minjae Lee, Hyun Jong Yang

entry.summary: Proposes an uncertainty-aware LLM offloading framework for mobile edge computing that decides local vs edge inference based on token-level uncertainty metrics.

entry.title: V-ABFT: Variance-Based Adaptive Threshold for Fault-Tolerant Matrix Multiplication in Mixed-Precision Deep Learning

author.name: Yiheng Gao, Qin Hua, Zizhong Chen

entry.summary: Presents V-ABFT, a variance-based adaptive threshold for fault-tolerant matrix multiplication in mixed-precision deep learning. Achieves much tighter error bounds than existing methods for detecting silent data corruptions.

entry.title: Multimodal normative modeling in Alzheimers Disease with introspective variational autoencoders

author.name: Sayantan Kumar, Peijie Qiu, Aristeidis Sotiras

entry.summary: Proposes mmSIVAE for multimodal normative modeling in Alzheimer's disease, combining soft-introspective VAE with MOPOE aggregation to improve reference distribution fidelity and multimodal neuroimaging integration.

entry.title: Large language models for spreading dynamics in complex systems

author.name: Shuyu Jiang, Hao Ren, Yichang Gao, Yi-Cheng Zhang, Li Qi, Dayong Xiao, Jie Fan, Rui Tang, Wei Wang

entry.summary: Surveys how LLMs can model spreading dynamics in complex systems (information, disease, behavior propagation), leveraging their ability to perceive semantic content and contextual cues that classical models cannot capture.

entry.title: DIAL-SUMMER: A Structured Evaluation Framework of Hierarchical Errors in Dialogue Summaries

author.name: Sahana Ramnath, Nima Chitsazan, Mingyang Zhou, Chia-Hsuan Lee, Shi-Xiong Zhang, Stephen Rawls, Sambit Sahu, Sangwoo Cho, Xiang Ren, Genta Indra Winata, Akshaj Kumar Veldanda

entry.summary: Introduces DIAL-SUMMER, a structured evaluation framework for dialogue summary errors that accounts for structure shifts and narration viewpoint changes specific to dialogue summarization.

entry.title: Nexus: Inferring Join Graphs from Metadata Alone via Iterative Low-Rank Matrix Completion

author.name: Tianji Cong, Yuanyuan Tian, Andreas Mueller, Rathijit Sen, Yeye He, Fotis Psallidas, Shaleen Deep, H. V. Jagadish

entry.summary: Introduces Nexus for inferring join relationships in databases using only metadata, formulated as low-rank matrix completion. Discovers that join graphs exhibit high sparsity and low-rank structure.

entry.title: UrbanGraphEmbeddings: Learning and Evaluating Spatially Grounded Multimodal Embeddings for Urban Science

author.name: Jie Zhang, Xingtong Yu, Yuan Fang, Rudi Stouffs, Zdravko Trivic

entry.summary: Introduces UGE, a framework for learning spatially grounded multimodal embeddings for urban science, with a dataset anchoring street-view images to spatial graphs with alignment supervision.

entry.title: Altruism and Fair Objective in Mixed-Motive Markov games

author.name: Yao-hua Franck Xu, Tayeb Lemlouma, Arnaud Braud, Jean-Marie Bonnin

entry.summary: Proposes Proportional Fairness as alternative to utilitarian welfare in multi-agent cooperation, introducing fair altruistic utility functions for mixed-motive Markov games.

entry.title: GOT-Edit: Geometry-Aware Generic Object Tracking via Online Model Editing

author.name: Shih-Fang Chen, Jun-Cheng Chen, I-Hong Jhuo, Yen-Yu Lin

entry.summary: GOT-Edit integrates 3D geometric cues into 2D generic object tracking through an online cross-modality model editing approach. Leverages pre-trained Visual Geometry Grounded Transformers to infer geometric information from 2D video frames.

entry.title: PBLean: Pseudo-Boolean Proof Certificates for Lean 4

author.name: Stefan Szeider

entry.summary: PBLean imports VeriPB pseudo-Boolean proof certificates into Lean 4 via reflection, enabling formal verification of combinatorial proofs that scale to tens of thousands of steps. Produces composable Lean theorems rather than external verdicts.

entry.title: Zero-shot System for Automatic Body Region Detection for Volumetric CT and MR Images

author.name: Farnaz Khun Jush, Grit Werner, Mark Klemens, Matthias Lenga

entry.summary: Investigates zero-shot body region detection in CT and MR images using pre-trained foundation models, proposing three training-free pipelines including segmentation-based rules and multimodal LLM approaches.

entry.title: Default Machine Learning Hyperparameters Do Not Provide Informative Initialization for Bayesian Optimization

author.name: Nicol\'as Villagr\'an Prieto, Eduardo C. Garrido-Merch\'an

entry.summary: Tests whether default hyperparameters from ML libraries like scikit-learn provide informative initialization for Bayesian Optimization, finding that they do not consistently outperform uniform random initialization.

entry.title: Affective Flow Language Model for Emotional Support Conversation

author.name: Chenghui Zou, Ning Wang, Tiesunlong Shen, Luwei Xiao, Chuan Ma, Xiangpeng Li, Rui Mao, Erik Cambria

entry.summary: AFlow proposes fine-grained supervision for emotional support conversations by modeling continuous affective flow along multi-turn trajectories, addressing limitations of sparse outcome-level alignment signals.

entry.title: Whose Name Comes Up? Benchmarking and Intervention-Based Auditing of LLM-Based Scholar Recommendation

author.name: Lisette Espin-Noboa, Gonzalo Gabriel Mendez

entry.summary: Introduces LLMScholarBench for auditing LLM-based scholar recommendation, jointly evaluating model infrastructure and end-user interventions. Measures technical quality and social representation across 22 LLMs.

entry.title: Hybrid Dual-Path Linear Transformations for Efficient Transformer Architectures

author.name: Vladimer Khasia

entry.summary: Proposes Hybrid Dual-Path Linear (HDPL) operator decomposing Transformer projections into sparse block-diagonal (local) and low-rank VAE bottleneck (global) pathways for improved efficiency.

entry.title: Learning Nonlinear Systems In-Context: From Synthetic Data to Real-World Motor Control

author.name: Tong Jian, Tianyu Dai, Tao Yu

entry.summary: Proposes transformer-based in-context learning for motor feedforward control, pretrained on synthetic linear/nonlinear systems and generalizing to real motors with few examples.

entry.title: Probing Neural TSP Representations for Prescriptive Decision Support

author.name: Reuben Narad, L\'eonard Boussioux, Michael Wagner

entry.summary: Investigates whether trained neural TSP solvers learn internal representations that transfer to other optimization tasks. Finds that internal embeddings from attention-based TSP policies can predict node-removal and edge-forbid sensitivity for logistics scenarios.

entry.title: BitLogic: Training Framework for Gradient-Based FPGA-Native Neural Networks

author.name: Simon B\"uhrer, Andreas Plesner, Aczel Till, Roger Wattenhofer

entry.summary: Presents BitLogic, a gradient-based framework for training FPGA-native neural networks using differentiable lookup table nodes. Replaces multiply-accumulate operations with LUT computations that map directly to FPGA primitives.

entry.title: Object-Oriented Transition Modeling with Inductive Logic Programming

author.name: Gabriel Stella, Dmitri Loguinov

entry.summary: Develops an object-oriented transition modeling approach using inductive logic programming for building interpretable world models from observations. Shows significant improvement over state-of-the-art in generalization.

entry.title: Dense Feature Learning via Linear Structure Preservation in Medical Data

author.name: Yuanyun Zhang, Mingxuan Zhang, Siyuan Li, Zihan Wang, Haoran Chen, Wenbo Zhou, Shi Li

entry.summary: Proposes dense feature learning for medical data that shapes the linear structure of embeddings through spectral balance, subspace consistency, and feature orthogonality objectives, improving transferability and stability.

entry.title: Efficient Planning in Reinforcement Learning via Model Introspection

author.name: Gabriel Stella

entry.summary: Proposes model introspection for efficient planning in RL, treating introspection as program analysis. Demonstrates how reasoning about internal models can synthesize task-relevant information for goal-oriented planning.

entry.title: Efficient Anti-exploration via VQVAE and Fuzzy Clustering in Offline Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Long Chen, Yinkui Liu, Shen Li, Bo Tang, Xuemin Hu

entry.summary: Proposes an anti-exploration method for offline RL using VQVAE-based discretization and fuzzy clustering to count state-action pairs more effectively. Addresses dimension disaster and information loss in existing pseudo-count methods.

entry.title: TAAM:Inductive Graph-Class Incremental Learning with Task-Aware Adaptive Modulation

author.name: Jingtao Liu, Xinming Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes TAAM for graph-class incremental learning using lightweight task-specific Neural Synapse Modulators that modulate a frozen GNN backbone. Avoids replay-based strategies and their memory/privacy concerns.

entry.title: Thermodynamic Isomorphism of Transformers: A Lagrangian Approach to Attention Dynamics

author.name: Gunn Kim

entry.summary: Proposes a thermodynamic interpretation of transformers, mapping attention to physical systems via Lagrangian mechanics, showing softmax as thermodynamic equilibrium minimizing Helmholtz free energy, and query-key interaction as electrodynamic coupling.

entry.title: Redundancy-Free View Alignment for Multimodal Human Activity Recognition with Arbitrarily Missing Views

author.name: Duc-Anh Nguyen, Nhien-An Le-Khac

entry.summary: Proposes RALIS for multimodal human activity recognition with arbitrary missing views, using contrastive learning with adjusted center loss and mixture-of-experts for flexible view configurations.

entry.title: 3D Transport-based Morphometry (3D-TBM) for medical image analysis

author.name: Hongyu Kan, Kristofor Pas, Ivan Medri, Naqib Sad Pathan, Natasha Ironside, Shinjini Kundu, Jingjia He, Gustavo Kunde Rohde

entry.summary: Presents 3D-TBM, a tool for morphological analysis of 3D medical images using optimal transport embeddings. Enables interpretable classification and regression with the ability to project results back to image space.

entry.title: Learned Finite Element-based Regularization of the Inverse Problem in Electrocardiographic Imaging

author.name: Manuel Haas, Thomas Grandits, Thomas Pinetz, Thomas Beiert, Simone Pezzuto, Alexander Effland

entry.summary: Introduces a space-time regularization framework for electrocardiographic imaging that couples spatial regularization with a learned temporal Fields-of-Experts prior, with finite element discretization and convergence guarantees.

entry.title: FMBench: Adaptive Large Language Model Output Formatting

author.name: Yaoting Wang, Yun Zhou, Henghui Ding

entry.summary: Introduces FMBench, a benchmark for evaluating LLMs' ability to produce correctly formatted Markdown output across diverse structural requirements including lists, tables, headings, and code blocks.

entry.title: Gaussian-Constrained LeJEPA Representations for Unsupervised Scene Discovery and Pose Consistency

author.name: Mohsen Mostafa

entry.summary: Investigates Gaussian-constrained representations inspired by LeJEPA for unsupervised 3D scene discovery and camera pose estimation from unstructured image collections, targeting the Image Matching Challenge 2025.

entry.title: COMBOOD: A Semiparametric Approach for Detecting Out-of-distribution Data for Image Classification

author.name: Magesh Rajasekaran, Md Saiful Islam Sajol, Frej Berglind, Supratik Mukhopadhyay, Kamalika Das

entry.summary: Presents COMBOOD, an unsupervised semi-parametric framework for out-of-distribution detection that combines nearest-neighbor and Mahalanobis distance metrics for image classification.

entry.title: TLC-Plan: A Two-Level Codebook Based Network for End-to-End Vector Floorplan Generation

author.name: Biao Xiong, Zhen Peng, Ping Wang, Qiegen Liu, Xian Zhong

entry.summary: Proposes TLC-Plan, a hierarchical generative model using two-level VQ-VAE to directly synthesize vector floorplans from input boundaries, avoiding post-hoc vectorization and structural inconsistencies.

entry.title: Adaptive Image Zoom-in with Bounding Box Transformation for UAV Object Detection

author.name: Tao Wang, Chenyu Lin, Chenwei Tang, Jizhe Zhou, Deng Xiong, Jianan Li, Jian Zhao, Jiancheng Lv

entry.summary: Proposes an adaptive zoom-in framework for UAV object detection that non-uniformly zooms into sparse, small objects to better capture features, with a lightweight offset prediction network.

entry.title: A hybrid Kolmogorov-Arnold network for medical image segmentation

author.name: Deep Bhattacharyya, Ali Ayub, A. Ben Hamza

entry.summary: Proposes U-KABS, a hybrid framework integrating Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks with a U-shaped encoder-decoder for medical image segmentation, using learnable activation functions based on Bernstein polynomials and B-splines.

entry.title: Back to Physics: Operator-Guided Generative Paths for SMS MRI Reconstruction

author.name: Zhibo Chen, Yu Guan, Yajuan Huang, Chaoqi Chen, XiangJi, Qiuyun Fan, Dong Liang, Qiegen Liu

entry.summary: Proposes an operator-guided diffusion framework for simultaneous multi-slice MRI reconstruction that models the degradation trajectory using known acquisition operators rather than Gaussian noise assumptions.

entry.title: Integrating Specialized and Generic Agent Motion Prediction with Dynamic Occupancy Grid Maps

author.name: Rabbia Asghar, Lukas Rummelhard, Wenqian Liu, Anne Spalanzani, Christian Laugier

entry.summary: Proposes a unified framework integrating specialized agent-specific and generic agent-agnostic motion prediction using dynamic occupancy grid maps for driving scene prediction.

entry.title: CAE-AV: Improving Audio-Visual Learning via Cross-modal Interactive Enrichment

author.name: Yunzuo Hu, Wen Li, Jing Zhang

entry.summary: CAE-AV proposes a caption-aligned and agreement-guided enhancement framework for audio-visual learning that addresses modality misalignment from off-screen sources and background clutter.

entry.title: SemiNFT: Learning to Transfer Presets from Imitation to Appreciation via Hybrid-Sample Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Melany Yang, Yuhang Yu, Diwang Weng, Jinwei Chen, Wei Dong

entry.summary: SemiNFT proposes a DiT-based color retouching framework that learns from imitation to appreciation via hybrid-sample reinforcement learning, mimicking the trajectory of human artistic training.

entry.title: WiFlow: A Lightweight WiFi-based Continuous Human Pose Estimation Network with Spatio-Temporal Feature Decoupling

author.name: Yi Dao, Lankai Zhang, Hao Liu, Haiwei Zhang, Wenbo Wang

entry.summary: WiFlow presents a lightweight framework for continuous human pose estimation using WiFi signals, employing an encoder-decoder with temporal and asymmetric convolutions to capture spatio-temporal CSI features.

entry.title: A Machine Learning accelerated geophysical fluid solver

author.name: Yang Bai

entry.summary: A machine learning accelerated PDE solver for geophysical fluid dynamics using data-driven discretization to predict quasi-linear stencil coefficients, improving accuracy and stability of low-resolution simulations.

entry.title: MVAnimate: Enhancing Character Animation with Multi-View Optimization

author.name: Tianyu Sun, Zhoujie Fu, Bang Zhang, Guosheng Lin

entry.summary: MVAnimate synthesizes character animation videos by combining 2D and 3D information with multi-view prior information for temporally consistent and spatially coherent outputs.

entry.title: Informative Object-centric Next Best View for Object-aware 3D Gaussian Splatting in Cluttered Scenes

author.name: Seunghoon Jeong, Eunho Lee, Jeongyun Kim, Ayoung Kim

entry.summary: Proposes an instance-aware Next Best View policy for 3D Gaussian Splatting in cluttered scenes that prioritizes underexplored regions using object-level features, balancing exploitation and exploration for robotic manipulation.

entry.title: Embodied Intelligence for Flexible Manufacturing: A Survey

author.name: Kai Xu, Hang Zhao, Ruizhen Hu, Min Yang, Hao Liu, Hui Zhang, Haibin Yu

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on embodied intelligence for flexible manufacturing, covering perception (Industrial Eye), control (Industrial Hand), and decision-making (Industrial Brain) perspectives. Reviews how AI advances are being applied to industrial robotics.

entry.title: CoLF: Learning Consistent Leader-Follower Policies for Vision-Language-Guided Multi-Robot Cooperative Transport

author.name: Joachim Yann Despature, Kazuki Shibata, Takamitsu Matsubara

entry.summary: Proposes CoLF for vision-language-guided multi-robot cooperative transport using a leader-follower design with consistency regularization to prevent symmetric behaviors during decentralized operation.

entry.title: Aerial Manipulation with Contact-Aware Onboard Perception and Hybrid Control

author.name: Yuanzhu Zhan, Yufei Jiang, Muqing Cao, Junyi Geng

entry.summary: Presents a contact-aware aerial manipulation pipeline with fully onboard perception using augmented VIO with contact-consistency factors and image-based visual servoing, without requiring external motion capture.

entry.title: Head-to-Head autonomous racing at the limits of handling in the A2RL challenge

author.name: Simon Hoffmann, Simon Sagmeister, Tobias Betz, Joscha Bongard, Sascha B\"uttner, Dominic Ebner, Daniel Esser, Georg Jank, Sven Goblirsch, Alexander Langmann, Maximilian Leitenstern, Levent \"Ogretmen, Phillip Pitschi, Ann-Kathrin Schwehn, Cornelius Schr\"oder, Marcel Weinmann, Frederik Werner, Boris Lohmann, Johannes Betz, Markus Lienkamp

entry.summary: Presents algorithms and strategies developed by TUM Autonomous Motorsport for winning the Abu Dhabi Autonomous Racing League (A2RL), covering multi-agent racing at the limits of vehicle dynamics.

entry.title: High-Speed Vision-Based Flight in Clutter with Safety-Shielded Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Jiarui Zhang, Chengyong Lei, Chengjiang Dai, Lijie Wang, Zhichao Han, Fei Gao

entry.summary: Proposes an end-to-end RL framework for high-speed UAV flight through clutter augmented with model-based safety mechanisms, including physics-informed rewards during training and real-time safety filtering during deployment.

entry.title: CLUE: Crossmodal disambiguation via Language-vision Understanding with attEntion

author.name: Mouad Abrini, Mohamed Chetouani

entry.summary: Introduces CLUE for interactive visual grounding in HRI that uses cross-modal attention from VLMs to determine when a robot should ask clarification questions, converting attention maps into an explicit ambiguity detection signal.

entry.title: Design sketches for a more sensible world

author.name: owencb

entry.summary: Proposes design sketches for a 'more sensible world' facing AI development, arguing that humanity is fumbling toward the most important technology ever created without adequate foresight. Outlines approaches for better collective decision-making and coordination around advanced AI.

entry.title: Model Integrity and Character

author.name: Oliver Klingefjord

entry.summary: Proposes 'integrity' as a frame for AI trustworthiness in alignment, drawing parallels from Vasily Arkhipov's refusal to launch nuclear weapons and Eichmann's order-following. Connects to Claude's new constitution and the need for AI systems that act on values rather than just rules.

entry.title: Overview and Comparison of AVS Point Cloud Compression Standard

author.name: Wei Gao, Wenxu Gao, Xingming Mu, Changhao Peng, Ge Li

entry.summary: This paper provides an overview and comparison of the AVS (Audio Video coding Standard) point cloud compression standard alongside MPEG standards (G-PCC, V-PCC), covering both geometry and attribute compression.

entry.title: Automatic regularization parameter choice for tomography using a double model approach

author.name: Chuyang Wu, Samuli Siltanen

entry.summary: A novel method for automatic regularization parameter selection in tomographic reconstruction using two distinct computational discretizations and a feedback control algorithm, demonstrated on real data.

entry.title: SynSacc: A Blender-to-V2E Pipeline for Synthetic Neuromorphic Eye-Movement Data and Sim-to-Real Spiking Model Training

author.name: Khadija Iddrisu, Waseem Shariff, Suzanne Little, Noel OConnor

entry.summary: SynSacc introduces a synthetic dataset generated with Blender for simulating saccades and fixations, evaluated with Spiking Neural Networks for sim-to-real transfer with neuromorphic event cameras.

entry.title: A Distributed Multi-Modal Sensing Approach for Human Activity Recognition in Real-Time Human-Robot Collaboration

author.name: Valerio Belcamino, Nhat Minh Dinh Le, Quan Khanh Luu, Alessandro Carf\`i, Van Anh Ho, Fulvio Mastrogiovanni

entry.summary: A multi-modal sensing system for human activity recognition in human-robot collaboration, combining a modular data glove with IMUs and vision-based tactile sensors for real-time classification.

entry.title: GCN-MPPR: Enhancing the Propagation of Message Passing Neural Networks via Motif-Based Personalized PageRank

author.name: Mingcan Wang, Junchang Xin, Zhongming Yao, Kaifu Long, Zhiqiong Wang

entry.summary: GCN-MPPR enhances message passing neural networks by incorporating motif-based Personalized PageRank to address over-smoothing and capture higher-order relationships during graph propagation.

entry.title: Graph-Enhanced Deep Reinforcement Learning for Multi-Objective Unrelated Parallel Machine Scheduling

author.name: Bulent Soykan, Sean Mondesire, Ghaith Rabadi, Grace Bochenek

entry.summary: Proposes a deep RL framework using PPO and Graph Neural Networks for multi-objective unrelated parallel machine scheduling with real-world constraints. The GNN represents complex job-machine-setup states for the PPO agent to learn scheduling policies.

entry.title: SynthAgent: A Multi-Agent LLM Framework for Realistic Patient Simulation -- A Case Study in Obesity with Mental Health Comorbidities

author.name: Arman Aghaee, Sepehr Asgarian, Jouhyun Jeon

entry.summary: SynthAgent is a multi-agent system for simulating obesity patients with mental health comorbidities. It integrates clinical evidence with personality-modeled virtual patients to simulate disease progression and treatment responses.

entry.title: A Comparative Study of Adversarial Robustness in CNN and CNN-ANFIS Architectures

author.name: Kaaustaaub Shankar, Bharadwaj Dogga, Kelly Cohen

entry.summary: Compares adversarial robustness of standard CNNs vs ANFIS-augmented CNNs across multiple datasets and attacks, finding architecture-dependent effects on robustness.

entry.title: Neural Sentinel: Unified Vision Language Model (VLM) for License Plate Recognition with Human-in-the-Loop Continual Learning

author.name: Karthik Sivakoti

entry.summary: Presents Neural Sentinel, a unified VLM approach for license plate recognition using fine-tuned PaliGemma 3B with LoRA, achieving 92.3% plate recognition in a single forward pass.

entry.title: Evaluating Retrieval-Augmented Generation Variants for Natural Language-Based SQL and API Call Generation

author.name: Michael Marketsm\"uller, Simon Martin, Tim Schlippe

entry.summary: Comprehensive evaluation of three RAG variants (standard RAG, Self-RAG, CoRAG) for SQL query generation, REST API call generation, and combined tasks in enterprise contexts.

entry.title: Long-Context Long-Form Question Answering for Legal Domain

author.name: Anagha Kulkarni, Parin Rajesh Jhaveri, Prasha Shrestha, Yu Tong Han, Reza Amini, Behrouz Madahian

entry.summary: Addresses long-context, long-form question answering for legal documents, proposing a system that deconstructs domain vocabulary, handles complex document layouts, and generates comprehensive answers spanning multiple pages.

entry.title: MDL: A Unified Multi-Distribution Learner in Large-scale Industrial Recommendation through Tokenization

author.name: Shanlei Mu, Yuchen Jiang, Shikang Wu, Shiyong Hong, Tianmu Sha, Junjie Zhang, Jie Zhu, Zhe Chen, Zhe Wang, Jingjian Lin

entry.summary: Proposes MDL, a unified framework for multi-scenario and multi-task learning in industrial recommendation systems, treating scenario and task information as specialized tokens inspired by LLM prompting.

entry.title: PAND: Prompt-Aware Neighborhood Distillation for Lightweight Fine-Grained Visual Classification

author.name: Qiuming Luo, Yuebing Li, Feng Li, Chang Kong

entry.summary: PAND proposes prompt-aware neighborhood distillation for fine-grained visual classification, generating adaptive semantic anchors and using neighborhood-aware structural distillation from VLMs to lightweight networks.

entry.title: SAGE: Scalable AI Governance & Evaluation

author.name: Benjamin Le, Xueying Lu, Nick Stern, Wenqiong Liu, Igor Lapchuk, Xiang Li, Baofen Zheng, Kevin Rosenberg, Jiewen Huang, Zhe Zhang, Abraham Cabangbang, Satej Milind Wagle, Jianqiang Shen, Raghavan Muthuregunathan, Abhinav Gupta, Mathew Teoh, Andrew Kirk, Thomas Kwan, Jingwei Wu, Wenjing Zhang

entry.summary: SAGE is a scalable AI governance framework for search relevance evaluation using a bidirectional calibration loop between human policy, precedent, and an LLM surrogate judge.

entry.title: $\texttt{lrnnx}$: A library for Linear RNNs

author.name: Karan Bania, Soham Kalburgi, Manit Tanwar, Dhruthi, Aditya Nagarsekar, Harshvardhan Mestha, Naman Chibber, Raj Deshmukh, Anish Sathyanarayanan, Aarush Rathore, Pratham Chheda

entry.summary: Introduces lrnnx, a unified library for linear recurrent neural networks that consolidates fragmented implementations across different frameworks, supporting multiple LRNN architectures with standardized interfaces.

entry.title: Enhancing Time Series Classification with Diversity-Driven Neural Network Ensembles

author.name: Javidan Abdullayev, Maxime Devanne, Cyril Meyer, Ali Ismail-Fawaz, Jonathan Weber, Germain Forestier

entry.summary: Introduces a diversity-driven ensemble framework for time series classification that explicitly encourages diverse feature representations across ensemble members rather than training identical architectures.

entry.title: Constraint-Aware Generative Auto-bidding via Pareto-Prioritized Regret Optimization

author.name: Binglin Wu, Yingyi Zhang, Xianneng Li, Ruyue Deng, Chuan Yue, Weiru Zhang, Xiaoyi Zeng

entry.summary: Proposes PRO-Bid for constrained auto-bidding that addresses state aliasing in Decision Transformers by decoupling cost constraints and uses Pareto-prioritized optimization to push performance toward constraint boundaries.

entry.title: Speech Emotion Recognition Leveraging OpenAI's Whisper Representations and Attentive Pooling Methods

author.name: Ali Shendabadi, Parnia Izadirad, Mostafa Salehi, Mahmoud Bijankhan

entry.summary: Explores using OpenAI's Whisper ASR model for speech emotion recognition with two novel attention-based pooling methods. Achieves state-of-the-art on the Persian ShEMO dataset.

entry.title: Statistical inference after variable selection in Cox models: A simulation study

author.name: Lena Schemet, Sarah Friedrich-Welz

entry.summary: Investigates post-selection inference procedures for Cox models after Lasso variable selection, comparing sample splitting, exact post-selection inference, and debiased Lasso through comprehensive simulation.

entry.title: Optimal Turkish Subword Strategies at Scale: Systematic Evaluation of Data, Vocabulary, Morphology Interplay

author.name: Duygu Altinok

entry.summary: Presents the first comprehensive study of Turkish subword tokenization, jointly varying vocabulary size and training corpus size across multiple tokenizer families with matched downstream evaluations.

entry.title: Enhancing IMU-Based Online Handwriting Recognition via Contrastive Learning with Zero Inference Overhead

author.name: Jindong Li, Dario Zanca, Vincent Christlein, Tim Hamann, Jens Barth, Peter K\"ampf, Bj\"orn Eskofier

entry.summary: Proposes ECHWR, a training framework for IMU-based online handwriting recognition that uses contrastive learning with semantic text embeddings to improve feature representation without increasing inference costs on edge hardware.

entry.title: DuMeta++: Spatiotemporal Dual Meta-Learning for Generalizable Few-Shot Brain Tissue Segmentation Across Diverse Ages

author.name: Yongheng Sun, Jun Shu, Jianhua Ma, Fan Wang

entry.summary: Proposes DuMeta++, a dual meta-learning framework for few-shot brain tissue segmentation across diverse ages that doesn't require paired longitudinal data, using meta-feature and meta-initialization learning.

entry.title: Uncertainty-Aware Counterfactual Traffic Signal Control with Predictive Safety and Starvation-Avoidance Constraints Using Vision-Based Sensing

author.name: Jayawant Bodagala, Balaji Bodagala

entry.summary: Introduces UCATSC, a model-based traffic signal control system that accounts for vision-based perception uncertainty, enforcing hard safety and starvation-prevention constraints during counterfactual rollouts.

entry.title: VFace: A Training-Free Approach for Diffusion-Based Video Face Swapping

author.name: Sanoojan Baliah, Yohan Abeysinghe, Rusiru Thushara, Khan Muhammad, Abhinav Dhall, Karthik Nandakumar, Muhammad Haris Khan

entry.summary: Presents VFace, a training-free plug-and-play method for video face swapping using frequency spectrum attention interpolation, target structure guidance, and flow-guided temporal smoothing.

entry.title: Building Damage Detection using Satellite Images and Patch-Based Transformer Methods

author.name: Smriti Siva, Jan Cross-Zamirski

entry.summary: This study evaluates Vision Transformer models (DINOv2-small, DeiT) for building damage classification on satellite imagery using the xBD dataset, proposing patch-based preprocessing to handle label noise and class imbalance.

entry.title: Wavelet-Domain Masked Image Modeling for Color-Consistent HDR Video Reconstruction

author.name: Yang Zhang, Zhangkai Ni, Wenhan Yang, Hanli Wang

entry.summary: Proposes WMNet for HDR video reconstruction using wavelet-domain masked image modeling with a two-phase training strategy. The approach addresses color inaccuracies and temporal inconsistencies in existing HDR methods through self-supervised pre-training in wavelet domain.

entry.title: UEREBot: Learning Safe Quadrupedal Locomotion under Unstructured Environments and High-Speed Dynamic Obstacles

author.name: Zihao Xu, Runyu Lei, Zihao Li, Boxi Lin, Ce Hao, Jin Song Dong

entry.summary: Proposes UEREBot, a hierarchical framework for quadruped locomotion that separates slow planning from instantaneous reflexive evasion against high-speed dynamic obstacles in unstructured environments.

entry.title: Benchmarking Autonomous Vehicles: A Driver Foundation Model Framework

author.name: Yuxin Zhang, Cheng Wang, Hubert P. H. Shum

entry.summary: Proposes a Driver Foundation Model (DFM) framework for benchmarking autonomous vehicles against experienced human drivers across safety, comfort, efficiency, and energy economy dimensions.

entry.title: Adaptive Scaffolding for Cognitive Engagement in an Intelligent Tutoring System

author.name: Sutapa Dey Tithi, Nazia Alam, Tahreem Yasir, Yang Shi, Xiaoyi Tian, Min Chi, Tiffany Barnes

entry.summary: This paper develops an adaptive scaffolding system for intelligent tutoring that dynamically selects between worked example types (Guided vs Buggy) using Bayesian Knowledge Tracing and Deep RL. It evaluates cognitive engagement levels based on the ICAP framework in a logic ITS.

entry.title: Structure-Aware Robust Counterfactual Explanations via Conditional Gaussian Network Classifiers

author.name: Zhan-Yi Liao, Jaewon Yoo, Hao-Tsung Yang, Po-An Chen

entry.summary: Presents structure-aware counterfactual explanations using conditional Gaussian network classifiers. The generative graph structure naturally encodes feature dependencies, eliminating the need for additional consistency constraints in counterfactual search.

entry.title: PTS-SNN: A Prompt-Tuned Temporal Shift Spiking Neural Networks for Efficient Speech Emotion Recognition

author.name: Xun Su, Huamin Wang, Qi Zhang

entry.summary: PTS-SNN proposes a prompt-tuned spiking neural network framework for speech emotion recognition that bridges frozen SSL representations with spiking neuron dynamics through parameter-efficient adaptation.

entry.title: Intermediate Results on the Complexity of STRIPS$_{1}^{1}$

author.name: Stefan Edelkamp, Ji\v{r}\'i Fink, Petr Gregor, Anders Jonsson, Bernhard Nebel

entry.summary: Investigates the computational complexity of propositional STRIPS planning with operators limited to one precondition and one effect, using SAT solvers and Petri net mappings.

entry.title: Deciding the Satisfiability of Combined Qualitative Constraint Networks

author.name: Quentin Cohen-Solal, Alexandre Niveau, Maroua Bouzid

entry.summary: Proposes a formal framework unifying extensions and combinations of qualitative constraint formalisms, establishing polynomial-time decidability theorems for satisfiability.

entry.title: BERT Learns (and Teaches) Chemistry

author.name: Josh Payne, Mario Srouji, Dian Ang Yap, Vineet Kosaraju

entry.summary: Proposes using BERT's attention heads to study functional groups in molecules, then applies learned representations to chemistry problems. An older paper (2020) resurfacing.

entry.title: When Excellence Stops Producing Knowledge: A Practitioner's Observation on Research Funding

author.name: Heimo M\"uller

entry.summary: Reflects on structural paradoxes in competitive research funding, arguing excellence has become decoupled from knowledge production, with AI proposal writing accelerating this trend.

entry.title: Multi-Agentic AI for Fairness-Aware and Accelerated Multi-modal Large Model Inference in Real-world Mobile Edge Networks

author.name: Haiyuan Li, Hari Madhukumar, Shuangyi Yan, Yulei Wu, Dimitra Simeonidou

entry.summary: Multi-agentic AI framework for fairness-aware and latency-optimized multimodal large model inference on mobile edge networks, using long-term planning and short-term scheduling agents.

entry.title: aerial-autonomy-stack -- a Faster-than-real-time, Autopilot-agnostic, ROS2 Framework to Simulate and Deploy Perception-based Drones

author.name: Jacopo Panerati, Sina Sajjadi, Sina Soleymanpour, Varunkumar Mehta, Iraj Mantegh

entry.summary: aerial-autonomy-stack is an open-source ROS2 framework for simulating and deploying perception-based autonomous drones, designed to be autopilot-agnostic and faster-than-real-time.

entry.title: Multi-Agent Systems Shape Social Norms for Prosocial Behavior Change

author.name: Yibin Feng, Tianqi Song, Yugin Tan, Zicheng Zhu, Yi-Chieh Lee

entry.summary: Explores whether multi-agent systems can establish 'virtual social norms' to encourage prosocial behavior like donations. An online experiment shows multi-agent interactions increased perceived social norms and donation willingness, with in-group agents being more effective.

entry.title: Bridging Speech, Emotion, and Motion: a VLM-based Multimodal Edge-deployable Framework for Humanoid Robots

author.name: Songhua Yang, Xuetao Li, Xuanye Fei, Mengde Li, Miao Li

entry.summary: Presents SeM², a VLM-based framework for humanoid robots that orchestrates emotionally coherent multimodal interactions (speech, facial expressions, gestures) through chain-of-thought reasoning, designed for edge deployment without cloud connectivity.

entry.title: Evaluating Large Language Models for Detecting Architectural Decision Violations

author.name: Ruoyu Su, Alexander Bakhtin, Noman Ahmad, Matteo Esposito, Valentina Lenarduzzi, Davide Taibi

entry.summary: Evaluates LLMs for detecting architectural decision violations in software projects by analyzing 980 ADRs across 109 GitHub repositories using a multi-model validation pipeline.

entry.title: GRAFT: Decoupling Ranking and Calibration for Survival Analysis

author.name: Mohammad Ashhad, Robert Hoehndorf, Ricardo Henao

entry.summary: GRAFT proposes a survival analysis model that decouples prognostic ranking from calibration, combining linear AFT with nonlinear residual networks and stochastic gates for feature selection.

entry.title: Rich-ARQ: From 1-bit Acknowledgment to Rich Neural Coded Feedback

author.name: Enhao Chen, Yulin Shao

entry.summary: Rich-ARQ transforms wireless communication feedback from 1-bit ACK/NACK to high-dimensional neural-coded vectors, implementing a full-stack software-defined radio prototype.

entry.title: Learning-guided Kansa collocation for forward and inverse PDEs beyond linearity

author.name: Zheyuan Hu, Weitao Chen, Cengiz \"Oztireli, Chenliang Zhou, Fangcheng Zhong

entry.summary: Extends the CNF framework for PDE solving to multi-dependent-variable and non-linear settings, combining neural PDE solvers with Kansa collocation methods. Includes a comprehensive survey of neural PDE solvers.

entry.title: Weak to Strong: VLM-Based Pseudo-Labeling as a Weakly Supervised Training Strategy in Multimodal Video-based Hidden Emotion Understanding Tasks

author.name: Yufei Wang, Haixu Liu, Tianxiang Xu, Chuancheng Shi, Hongsheng Xing

entry.summary: Proposes a multimodal weak-supervision framework using VLM-based pseudo-labeling for hidden emotion recognition in videos. Uses Gemini 2.5 Pro for CoT+Reflection pseudo-label generation, achieving SOTA on iMiGUE dataset.

entry.title: Large Language Models in Peer-Run Community Behavioral Health Services: Understanding Peer Specialists and Service Users' Perspectives on Opportunities, Risks, and Mitigation Strategies

author.name: Cindy Peng, Megan Chai, Gao Mo, Naveen Raman, Ningjing Tang, Shannon Pagdon, Margaret Swarbrick, Nev Jones, Fei Fang, Hong Shen

entry.summary: Uses co-design workshops with peer specialists and service users to explore perceptions of integrating LLM-based recommendation systems into peer-run behavioral health organizations.

entry.title: Investigating Writing Professionals' Relationships with Generative AI: How Combined Perceptions of Rivalry and Collaboration Shape Work Practices and Outcomes

author.name: Rama Adithya, Varanasi, Nov, Oded, Wiesenfeld, Batia Mishan

entry.summary: Survey-based study of 403 writing professionals examining how rivalry and collaboration orientations toward GenAI shape work practices and outcomes. Finds balanced approach (high rivalry + high collaboration) is optimal.

entry.title: Tutti: Expressive Multi-Singer Synthesis via Structure-Level Timbre Control and Vocal Texture Modeling

author.name: Jiatao Chen, Xing Tang, Xiaoyue Duan, Yutang Feng, Jinchao Zhang, Jie Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes Tutti, a unified framework for multi-singer synthesis with structure-level timbre control and vocal texture modeling via Condition-Guided VAE.

entry.title: A General Theory of Proportionality with Additive Utilities

author.name: Piotr Skowron

entry.summary: Develops a general theory of proportionality for cardinal ballots in constrained candidate selection, extending prior work that only handled approval ballots. Generalizes committee elections, participatory budgeting, and public decision-making under feasibility constraints.

entry.title: Kissan-Dost: Bridging the Last Mile in Smallholder Precision Agriculture with Conversational IoT

author.name: Muhammad Saad Ali, Daanish U. Khan, Laiba Intizar Ahmad, Umer Irfan, Maryam Mustafa, Naveed Anwar Bhatti, Muhammad Hamad Alizai

entry.summary: Kissan-Dost is a multilingual conversational system connecting IoT farm sensors with RAG-powered WhatsApp chatbot for smallholder farmers. A 90-day pilot showed chatbot engagement far exceeded dashboard engagement, with >90% correctness on crop queries.

entry.title: Addressing data annotation scarcity in Brain Tumor Segmentation on 3D MRI scan Using a Semi-Supervised Teacher-Student Framework

author.name: Jiaming Liu, Cheng Ding, Daoqiang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes semi-supervised teacher-student framework for brain tumor segmentation combining uncertainty-aware pseudo-labeling with progressive confidence-based curriculum learning. Achieves strong results with limited labeled data.

entry.title: OmniReview: A Large-scale Benchmark and LLM-enhanced Framework for Realistic Reviewer Recommendation

author.name: Yehua Huang, Penglei Sun, Zebin Chen, Zhenheng Tang, Xiaowen Chu

entry.summary: OmniReview presents a comprehensive dataset of 202K verified review records for academic reviewer recommendation, with a three-tier evaluation framework and LLM-enhanced matching methods.

entry.title: Automatic In-Domain Exemplar Construction and LLM-Based Refinement of Multi-LLM Expansions for Query Expansion

author.name: Minghan Li, Ercong Nie, Siqi Zhao, Tongna Chen, Huiping Huang, Guodong Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes an automated query expansion framework using multi-LLM ensembles with in-domain exemplar construction via BM25-MonoT5 pipeline, then LLM-based refinement of combined expansions.

entry.title: Neural Sabermetrics with World Model: Play-by-play Predictive Modeling with Large Language Model

author.name: Young Jin Ahn, Yiyang Du, Zheyuan Zhang, Haisen Kang

entry.summary: Trains an LLM as a play-by-play world model for baseball by treating games as auto-regressive event sequences, using 10+ years of MLB tracking data with 7M+ pitch sequences.

entry.title: Fault-Tolerant Evaluation for Sample-Efficient Model Performance Estimators

author.name: Zihan Zhu, Yanqiu Wu, Qiongkai Xu

entry.summary: Proposes fault-tolerant evaluation metrics for sample-efficient model performance estimators in Model-as-a-Service settings. Addresses failures of RMSE and p-value tests in low-variance settings by introducing new evaluation criteria.

entry.title: Robust Ultra-High-Dimensional Variable Selection With Correlated Structure Using Group Testing

author.name: Wanru Guo, Juan Xie, Binbin Wang, Weicong Chen, Xiaoyi Lu, Vipin Chaudhary, Curtis Tatsuoka

entry.summary: Proposes the Dorfman screening framework for robust variable selection in ultra-high-dimensional genomic data with correlated structures. Uses hierarchical clustering for group formation and elastic net refinement with robust covariance estimation.

entry.title: Financial Bond Similarity Search Using Representation Learning

author.name: Amin Haeri, Mahdi Ghelichi, Nishant Agrawal, David Li, Catalina Gomez Sanchez

entry.summary: Shows that categorical bond attributes (issuer sector, domicile) dominate spread curve predictability and proposes embedding models to capture their semantic similarities, outperforming one-hot encodings for fixed-income analytics.

entry.title: Empirical Study of Observable Sets in Multiclass Quantum Classification

author.name: Paul San Sebastian, Mikel Ca\~nizo, Roman Orus

entry.summary: Studies observable sets for multiclass quantum classification in variational quantum circuits, comparing expected-value maximization vs. fidelity maximization criteria across different measurement strategies.

entry.title: On the Wings of Imagination: Conflicting Script-based Multi-role Framework for Humor Caption Generation

author.name: Wenbo Shang, Yuxi Sun, Jing Ma, Xin Huang

entry.summary: Develops HOMER, a humor generation framework based on General Theory of Verbal Humor (GTVH) using multi-role LLM collaboration with humor retrieval for generating funny image captions.

entry.title: Visual Word Sense Disambiguation with CLIP through Dual-Channel Text Prompting and Image Augmentations

author.name: Shamik Bhattacharya, Daniel Perkins, Yaren Dogan, Vineeth Konjeti, Sudarshan Srinivasan, Edmon Begoli

entry.summary: Develops a Visual Word Sense Disambiguation framework using CLIP with dual-channel text prompts (semantic and photo-based) and test-time image augmentations, evaluated on SemEval-2023 VWSD dataset.

entry.title: Protean Compiler: An Agile Framework to Drive Fine-grain Phase Ordering

author.name: Amir H. Ashouri, Shayan Shirahmad Gale Bagi, Kavin Satheeskumar, Tejas Srikanth, Jonathan Zhao, Ibrahim Saidoun, Ziwen Wang, Bryan Chan, Tomasz S. Czajkowski

entry.summary: Presents Protean Compiler, a framework that uses machine learning to address the long-standing compiler phase ordering problem, enabling fine-grained optimization selection and ordering. The approach integrates ML-based performance models directly into the compiler rather than as external tools.

entry.title: Toward Accurate and Accessible Markerless Neuronavigation

author.name: Ziye Xie, Oded Schlesinger, Raj Kundu, Jessica Y. Choi, Pablo Iturralde, Dennis A. Turner, Stefan M. Goetz, Guillermo Sapiro, Angel V. Peterchev, J. Matias Di Martino

entry.summary: Introduces markerless neuronavigation approaches using low-cost cameras and facial geometry modeling, achieving 2.32mm median tracking discrepancy compared to marker-based systems.

entry.title: TwistNet-2D: Learning Second-Order Channel Interactions via Spiral Twisting for Texture Recognition

author.name: Junbo Jacob Lian, Feng Xiong, Yujun Sun, Kaichen Ouyang, Mingyang Yu, Shengwei Fu, Zhong Rui, Zhang Yujun, Huiling Chen

entry.summary: Introduces TwistNet-2D, a lightweight module for texture recognition that computes local pairwise channel products under directional spatial displacement, capturing both where features co-occur and how they interact.

entry.title: Perspective-aware fusion of incomplete depth maps and surface normals for accurate 3D reconstruction

author.name: Ondrej Hlinka, Georg Kaniak, Christian Kapeller

entry.summary: Proposes a perspective-aware log-depth fusion approach that extends orthographic depth-normals fusion by accounting for perspective projection, enabling metrically accurate 3D reconstruction with missing depth measurements.

entry.title: WristMIR: Coarse-to-Fine Region-Aware Retrieval of Pediatric Wrist Radiographs with Radiology Report-Driven Learning

author.name: Mert Sonmezer, Serge Vasylechko, Duygu Atasoy, Seyda Ertekin, Sila Kurugol

entry.summary: Introduces WristMIR, a region-aware retrieval framework for pediatric wrist radiographs using MedGemma-based structured report mining to generate fine-grained representations without manual annotations.

entry.title: Enhanced Mixture 3D CGAN for Completion and Generation of 3D Objects

author.name: Yahia Hamdi, Nicolas Andrialovanirina, K\'elig Mah\'e, Emilie Poisson Caillault

entry.summary: This paper proposes an enhanced mixture 3D conditional GAN combining Mixture of Experts with GANs for 3D object generation and completion. The MoE approach helps capture complex and diverse data distributions for incomplete 3D inputs.

entry.title: Deep Learning-Based Fixation Type Prediction for Quality Assurance in Digital Pathology

author.name: Oskar Thaeter, Tanja Niedermair, Johannes Raffler, Ralf Huss, Peter J. Sch\"uffler

entry.summary: A deep learning model predicts tissue fixation types (FFPE vs frozen section) from low-resolution thumbnail images for pathology quality assurance, achieving high accuracy on TUM and TCGA datasets.

entry.title: U-Net Based Image Enhancement for Short-time Muon Scattering Tomography

author.name: Haochen Wang, Pei Yu, Liangwen Chen, Weibo He, Yu Zhang, Yuhong Yu, Xueheng Zhang, Lei Yang, Zhiyu Sun

entry.summary: A U-Net framework trained on simulated muon scattering tomography data to enhance image quality from short-time measurements, improving SSIM from 0.72 to 0.97 on experimental data.

entry.title: Surveillance Facial Image Quality Assessment: A Multi-dimensional Dataset and Lightweight Model

author.name: Yanwei Jiang, Wei Sun, Yingjie Zhou, Xiangyang Zhu, Yuqin Cao, Jun Jia, Yunhao Li, Sijing Wu, Dandan Zhu, Xingkuo Min, Guangtao Zhai

entry.summary: Introduces a multi-dimensional dataset and lightweight model for surveillance facial image quality assessment that jointly evaluates visual quality and identity-preserving fidelity. Addresses the gap between face restoration and identity verification in surveillance applications.

entry.title: Chamelion: Reliable Change Detection for Long-Term LiDAR Mapping in Transient Environments

author.name: Seoyeon Jang, Alex Junho Lee, I Made Aswin Nahrendra, Hyun Myung

entry.summary: Introduces Chamelion, a dual-head network for online LiDAR-based change detection and long-term map maintenance in dynamic environments like construction sites. Addresses the challenge of detecting structural changes with frequent occlusions and spatiotemporal variations.

entry.title: Designing Multi-Robot Ground Video Sensemaking with Public Safety Professionals

author.name: Puqi Zhou (George Mason University, Fairfax, VA, USA), Ali Asgarov (Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA, USA), Aafiya Hussain (Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA, USA), Wonjoon Park (University of Maryland, College Park, MD, USA), Amit Paudyal (George Mason University, Fairfax, VA, USA), Sameep Shrestha (George Mason University, Fairfax, VA, USA), Chia-wei Tang (Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA, USA), Michael F. Lighthiser (George Mason University, Fairfax, VA, USA), Michael R. Hieb (George Mason University, Fairfax, VA, USA), Xuesu Xiao (George Mason University, Fairfax, VA, USA), Chris Thomas (Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, VA, USA), Sungsoo Ray Hong (George Mason University, Fairfax, VA, USA)

entry.summary: Collaborates with police agencies to design a multi-robot ground video sensemaking system (MRVS) for public safety, featuring VLM-powered scene summarization and event detection. Includes a testbed with 38 events-of-interest and design requirements from practitioners.

entry.title: Analyzing the Impact of Simulation Fidelity on the Evaluation of Autonomous Driving Motion Control

author.name: Simon Sagmeister, Panagiotis Kounatidis, Sven Goblirsch, Markus Lienkamp

entry.summary: Investigates how vehicle dynamics simulation fidelity affects the evaluation of autonomous driving trajectory-following controllers, introducing a comprehensive Autoware-compatible vehicle model and comparing simplified variants.

entry.title: ReefFlex: A Generative Design Framework for Soft Robotic Grasping of Organic and Fragile objects

author.name: Josh Pinskier, Sarah Baldwin, Stephen Rodan, David Howard

entry.summary: Introduces ReefFlex, a generative soft finger design methodology that explores diverse soft finger designs for safely grasping fragile coral in cluttered underwater environments, motivated by coral reef regeneration.

entry.title: UAV-Supported Maritime Search System: Experience from Valun Bay Field Trials

author.name: Stefan Ivi\'c, Luka Lan\v{c}a, Karlo Jakac, Ante Sikirica, Stella Dumen\v{c}i\'c, Matej Mali\v{s}a, Zvonimir Mrle, Bojan Crnkovi\'c

entry.summary: Presents an integrated system for UAV-supported maritime search operations tested in field trials, combining flow field reconstruction, probabilistic modeling, multi-UAV search control, and deep learning detection.

entry.title: A Precise Real-Time Force-Aware Grasping System for Robust Aerial Manipulation

author.name: Kenghou Hoi, Yuze Wu, Annan Ding, Junjie Wang, Anke Zhao, Chengqian Zhang, Fei Gao

entry.summary: Proposes a force-aware aerial grasping framework using six low-cost magnetic-based tactile sensors for three-dimensional force measurement, with geomagnetic interference elimination.

entry.title: Aurelius: Proposing Alignment as an Emergent Property

author.name: Austin McCaffrey

entry.summary: Introduces Aurelius, a decentralized protocol on Bittensor (Subnet 37) that generates alignment training data through multi-agent systems, proposing alignment as an emergent property. Introduces 'Organic-Synthetic' data generated by agents in persistent environments with causal dynamics.

entry.title: Large Language Models Live in Time

author.name: Eleni Angelou

entry.summary: Explores whether LLMs represent or track temporal structure, drawing on neuroscience concepts. Argues for 'LLM neurochronometry studies' and presents three key intuitions about how temporal representation matters for understanding LLM behavior.

entry.title: ONTrust: A Reference Ontology of Trust

author.name: Glenda Amaral, Tiago Prince Sales, Riccardo Baratella, Daniele Porello, Renata Guizzardi, Giancarlo Guizzardi

entry.summary: ONTrust presents a reference ontology of trust, formally conceptualizing trust in a way that can be understood by both humans and machines. It addresses the need for proper trust conceptualization as AI and decentralized technologies proliferate.

entry.title: Initial Risk Probing and Feasibility Testing of Glow: a Generative AI-Powered Dialectical Behavior Therapy Skills Coach for Substance Use Recovery and HIV Prevention

author.name: Liying Wang, Madison Lee, Yunzhang Jiang, Steven Chen, Kewei Sha, Yunhe Feng, Frank Wong, Lisa Hightow-Weidman, Weichao Yuwen

entry.summary: Describes initial risk probing and feasibility testing of Glow, a GenAI-powered DBT skills coach for substance use recovery and HIV prevention. Usability testing with clinical staff and individuals with lived experience assessed safety and feasibility.

entry.title: Hybrid Deep Learning Framework for CSI-Based Activity Recognition in Bandwidth-Constrained Wi-Fi Sensing

author.name: Alison M. Fernandes, Hermes I. Del Monego, Bruno S. Chang, Anelise Munaretto, H\'elder M. Fontes, Rui Campos

entry.summary: Presents a hybrid deep learning framework for Wi-Fi sensing-based human activity recognition using Inception, BiLSTM, and SVM in bandwidth-constrained environments.

entry.title: Video-based Music Generation

author.name: Serkan Sulun

entry.summary: EMSYNC is a system for automatically generating music synchronized emotionally and rhythmically to input video, using pretrained neural networks with frozen features and trained fusion layers. This is a thesis presentation rather than a single novel contribution.

entry.title: Advantages of Domain Knowledge Injection for Legal Document Summarization: A Case Study on Summarizing Indian Court Judgments in English and Hindi

author.name: Debtanu Datta, Rajdeep Mukherjee, Adrijit Goswami, Saptarshi Ghosh

entry.summary: Explores domain knowledge injection for summarizing Indian court judgments in English and Hindi, proposing frameworks for enhancing both extractive and LLM-based summarization with legal-specific encoders.

entry.title: Beyond Core and Penumbra: Bi-Temporal Image-Driven Stroke Evolution Analysis

author.name: Md Sazidur Rahman, Kjersti Engan, Kathinka D{\ae}hli Kurz, Mahdieh Khanmohammadi

entry.summary: Proposes a bi-temporal analysis framework for stroke evolution using CTP at admission and follow-up DWI, extracting statistical, radiomic, and deep features to characterize ischemic tissue beyond simple core/penumbra segmentation.

entry.title: Still Manual? Automated Linter Configuration via DSL-Based LLM Compilation of Coding Standards

author.name: Zejun Zhang, Yixin Gan, Zhenchang Xing, Tian Zhang, Yi Li, Xiwei Xu, Qinghua Lu, Liming Zhu

entry.summary: LintCFG automates linter configuration generation from coding standards using a DSL-driven, LLM-based compilation approach, inspired by compiler design to be language/standard/linter agnostic.

entry.title: Tighnari v2: Mitigating Label Noise and Distribution Shift in Multimodal Plant Distribution Prediction via Mixture of Experts and Weakly Supervised Learning

author.name: Haixu Liu, Yufei Wang, Tianxiang Xu, Chuancheng Shi, Hongsheng Xing

entry.summary: Proposes a multimodal fusion framework for plant distribution prediction that leverages both Presence-Absence and Presence-Only data with pseudo-label aggregation and Mixture of Experts.

entry.title: Technosocial risks of ideal emotion recognition technologies: A defense of the (social) value of emotional expressions

author.name: Alexandra Pregent

entry.summary: Challenges the assumption that ideal emotion recognition technologies would benefit social life, arguing that emotional expressions serve social coordination functions beyond mere readouts of inner states. Examines technosocial risks of perfect affective transparency.

entry.title: Active Learning Using Aggregated Acquisition Functions: Accuracy and Sustainability Analysis

author.name: C\'edric Jung, Shirin Salehi, Anke Schmeink

entry.summary: Evaluates various active learning acquisition functions analyzing both accuracy and computational costs. Proposes aggregated acquisition functions combining representativity and uncertainty-based approaches.

entry.title: The Connection between Kriging and Large Neural Networks

author.name: Marius Marinescu

entry.summary: Explores connections between Kriging/Gaussian process regression and large neural networks, revisiting the relevant literature to bridge spatial statistics and machine learning perspectives.

entry.title: Machine learning enhanced data assimilation framework for multiscale carbonate rock characterization

author.name: Zhenkai Bo, Ahmed H. Elsheikh, Hannah P. Menke, Julien Maes, Sebastian Geiger, Muhammad Z. Kashim, Zainol A. A. Bakar, Kamaljit Singh

entry.summary: Presents a machine learning enhanced data assimilation framework for multiscale carbonate rock characterization, combining X-ray CT imaging with ML to bridge macro and micro-scale analysis for subsurface applications.

entry.title: MMLSv2: A Multimodal Dataset for Martian Landslide Detection in Remote Sensing Imagery

author.name: Sidike Paheding, Abel Reyes-Angulo, Leo Thomas Ramos, Angel D. Sappa, Rajaneesh A., Hiral P. B., Sajin Kumar K. S., Thomas Oommen

entry.summary: Presents MMLSv2, a multimodal dataset for landslide segmentation on Mars using seven-band imagery. Includes geographic generalization evaluation with 276 isolated test images.

entry.title: Investigating the structure of emotions by analyzing similarity and association of emotion words

author.name: Fumitaka Iwaki, Tatsuji Takahashi

entry.summary: Analyzes semantic networks of emotion words to test the validity of Plutchik's wheel of emotion model, collecting similarity and association data for ordered pairs of emotion words.

entry.title: MTQE.en-he: Machine Translation Quality Estimation for English-Hebrew

author.name: Andy Rosenbaum, Assaf Siani, Ilan Kernerman

entry.summary: Releases MTQE.en-he, the first English-Hebrew machine translation quality estimation benchmark with human DA scores. Shows ensembling ChatGPT, TransQuest, and CometKiwi outperforms individual models.

entry.title: Row-Column Separated Attention Based Low-Light Image/Video Enhancement

author.name: Chengqi Dong, Zhiyuan Cao, Tuoshi Qi, Kexin Wu, Yixing Gao, Fan Tang

entry.summary: Proposes Row-Column Separated Attention (RCSA) for low-light image/video enhancement, using row and column statistics to guide local information with fewer parameters, plus temporal loss functions for video consistency.

entry.title: PTB-XL-Image-17K: A Large-Scale Synthetic ECG Image Dataset with Comprehensive Ground Truth for Deep Learning-Based Digitization

author.name: Naqcho Ali Mehdi

entry.summary: Introduces PTB-XL-Image-17K, a synthetic ECG image dataset with 17,271 12-lead ECG images providing five complementary data types per sample for ECG digitization research.

entry.title: Human Identification at a Distance: Challenges, Methods and Results on the Competition HID 2025

author.name: Jingzhe Ma, Meng Zhang, Jianlong Yu, Kun Liu, Zunxiao Xu, Xue Cheng, Junjie Zhou, Yanfei Wang, Jiahang Li, Zepeng Wang, Kazuki Osamura, Rujie Liu, Narishige Abe, Jingjie Wang, Shunli Zhang, Haojun Xie, Jiajun Wu, Weiming Wu, Wenxiong Kang, Qingshuo Gao, Jiaming Xiong, Xianye Ben, Lei Chen, Lichen Song, Junjian Cui, Haijun Xiong, Junhao Lu, Bin Feng, Mengyuan Liu, Ji Zhou, Baoquan Zhao, Ke Xu, Yongzhen Huang, Liang Wang, Manuel J Marin-Jimenez, Md Atiqur Rahman Ahad, Shiqi Yu

entry.summary: Presents methods and results from the Human Identification at a Distance competition (HID 2025), focusing on gait recognition across challenging variations in clothing, objects, and view angles.

entry.title: One-Shot Crowd Counting With Density Guidance For Scene Adaptaion

author.name: Jiwei Chen, Qi Wang, Junyu Gao, Jing Zhang, Dingyi Li, Jing-Jia Luo

entry.summary: Proposes using few-shot learning with local and global density characteristics to adapt crowd counting models to unseen surveillance scenes, treating different camera locations as different scene categories.

entry.title: DAS-SK: An Adaptive Model Integrating Dual Atrous Separable and Selective Kernel CNN for Agriculture Semantic Segmentation

author.name: Mei Ling Chee, Thangarajah Akilan, Aparna Ravindra Phalke, Kanchan Keisham

entry.summary: DAS-SK proposes a lightweight CNN architecture for agricultural semantic segmentation that combines selective kernel convolution with dual atrous separable convolution in a modified DeepLabV3 framework.

entry.title: VedicTHG: Symbolic Vedic Computation for Low-Resource Talking-Head Generation in Educational Avatars

author.name: Vineet Kumar Rakesh, Ahana Bhattacharjee, Soumya Mazumdar, Tapas Samanta, Hemendra Kumar Pandey, Amitabha Das, Sarbajit Pal

entry.summary: VedicTHG proposes a deterministic CPU-oriented talking-head generation framework inspired by Vedic mathematical principles, using symbolic computation for phoneme-to-viseme mapping suitable for resource-constrained environments.

entry.title: A Methodology for Effective Surrogate Learning in Complex Optimization

author.name: Tomohiro Harada, Enrique Alba, Gabriel Luque

entry.summary: Introduces PTME methodology for evaluating deep learning surrogates by analyzing Precision, Time, Memory, and Energy consumption together, arguing that both numerical and physical performance matter for surrogate quality.

entry.title: Continuum Robot Localization using Distributed Time-of-Flight Sensors

author.name: Spencer Teetaert, Giammarco Caroleo, Marco Pontin, Sven Lilge, Jessica Burgner-Kahrs, Timothy D. Barfoot, Perla Maiolino

entry.summary: Presents a localization technique for continuum robots using small, low-resolution time-of-flight sensors distributed along the robot's length, fusing measurements with a shape model for environment localization.

entry.title: Multi-Agent Route Planning as a QUBO Problem

author.name: Ren\'ata Rusn\'akov\'a, Martin Chovanec, Juraj Gazda

entry.summary: Formulates multi-agent route planning as a QUBO (Quadratic Unconstrained Binary Optimization) problem, proves NP-hardness, and provides a penalty parameter that controls coverage-overlap trade-off.

entry.title: Graph-Loc: Robust Graph-Based LiDAR Pose Tracking with Compact Structural Map Priors under Low Observability and Occlusion

author.name: Wentao Zhao, Yihe Niu, Zikun Chen, Rui Li, Yanbo Wang, Tianchen Deng, Jingchuan Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Graph-Loc, a graph-based LiDAR localization framework using compact point-line structural map priors for robust tracking under low observability and occlusion conditions.

entry.title: The Vibe-Automation of Automation: A Proactive Education Framework for Computer Science in the Age of Generative AI

author.name: Ilya Levin

entry.summary: Introduces the concept of 'Vibe-Automation' to characterize how generative AI operates differently from traditional automation — navigating contextual, semantic, and stylistic coherence rather than optimizing predefined objectives. Discusses implications for CS education.

entry.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Interference Suppression in RIS-Aided Space-Air-Ground Integrated Networks

author.name: Pujitha Mamillapalli, Shikhar Verma, Tiago Koketsu Rodrigues, Abhinav Kumar

entry.summary: Applies deep reinforcement learning for interference suppression in RIS-aided space-air-ground integrated networks for 6G.

entry.title: Lagged backward-compatible physics-informed neural networks for unsaturated soil consolidation analysis

author.name: Dong Li (Department of Civil, Environmental, and Infrastructure Engineering, George Mason University, Fairfax, VA, USA), Shuai Huang (National Institute of Natural Hazards, Ministry of Emergency Management, Beijing, China), Yapeng Cao (State Key Laboratory of Cryospheric Science and Frozen Soil Engineering, Northwest Institute of Eco-Environment and Resources, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Lanzhou, China, Navier Laboratory, \'Ecole Nationale des Ponts et Chauss\'ees, Marne-la-Vall\'ee Cedex 2, France), Yujun Cui (Navier Laboratory, \'Ecole Nationale des Ponts et Chauss\'ees, Marne-la-Vall\'ee Cedex 2, France), Xiaobin Wei (School of Civil Engineering, Hebei University of Engineering, Handan, China), Hongtao Cao (College of Civil Engineering, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, China)

entry.summary: Develops physics-informed neural networks with logarithmic time segmentation and transfer learning for simulating unsaturated soil consolidation.

entry.title: An Information-Theoretic Framework for Comparing Voice and Text Explainability

author.name: Mona Rajhans, Vishal Khawarey

entry.summary: Introduces an information-theoretic framework comparing voice vs. text modalities for AI explanations, using metrics for information retention, comprehension efficiency, and trust calibration error, evaluated via simulation.

entry.title: From Dead Pixels to Editable Slides: Infographic Reconstruction into Native Google Slides via Vision-Language Region Understanding

author.name: Leonardo Gonzalez

entry.summary: Images2Slides converts static infographic images into editable Google Slides using a VLM-based pipeline that extracts region-level specifications and recreates elements programmatically.

entry.title: Vision and language: Novel Representations and Artificial intelligence for Driving Scene Safety Assessment and Autonomous Vehicle Planning

author.name: Ross Greer, Maitrayee Keskar, Angel Martinez-Sanchez, Parthib Roy, Shashank Shriram, Mohan Trivedi

entry.summary: Investigates how vision-language representations support driving scene safety assessment, introducing CLIP-based hazard screening and VLM-augmented perception for autonomous driving.

entry.title: Deep Variable-Length Feedback Codes

author.name: Yu Ding, Yulin Shao

entry.summary: Introduces DeepVLF coding framework for variable-length feedback-based channel coding using deep learning, with receiver-driven and transmitter-driven termination architectures.

entry.title: Bielik Guard: Efficient Polish Language Safety Classifiers for LLM Content Moderation

author.name: Krzysztof Wr\'obel, Jan Maria Kowalski, Jerzy Surma, Igor Ciuciura, Maciej Szyma\'nski

entry.summary: Bielik Guard presents compact Polish language safety classifiers (0.1B and 0.5B parameters) for content moderation across five safety categories, trained on community-annotated Polish text.

entry.title: An Explainable Multi-Task Similarity Measure: Integrating Accumulated Local Effects and Weighted Fr\'echet Distance

author.name: Pablo Hidalgo, Daniel Rodriguez

entry.summary: Proposes a multi-task similarity measure using Accumulated Local Effects (ALE) curves compared via weighted Fréchet distance. The measure is explainable and incorporates feature importance for multi-task learning scenarios.

entry.title: Trust-Based Incentive Mechanisms in Semi-Decentralized Federated Learning Systems

author.name: Ajay Kumar Shrestha

entry.summary: Proposes trust-based incentive mechanism for federated learning that dynamically assesses trust scores based on data quality, model accuracy, consistency, and contribution frequency.

entry.title: Intelligent support for Human Oversight: Integrating Reinforcement Learning with Gaze Simulation to Personalize Highlighting

author.name: Thorsten Kl\"o{\ss}ner, Jo\~ao Belo, Zekun Wu, J\"org Hoffmann, Anna Maria Feit

entry.summary: Explores RL-based UI adaptation for human oversight, using gaze simulation to personalize alerting strategies in drone monitoring scenarios.

entry.title: Gesture Matters: Pedestrian Gesture Recognition for AVs Through Skeleton Pose Evaluation

author.name: Alif Rizqullah Mahdi, Mahdi Rezaei, Natasha Merat

entry.summary: Presents a gesture classification framework for autonomous vehicles using 2D pose estimation on real-world video data, categorizing pedestrian gestures into four classes. Achieves 97.5% accuracy using gradient boosting on 76 static/dynamic features extracted from normalized keypoints.

entry.title: 6G-Bench: An Open Benchmark for Semantic Communication and Network-Level Reasoning with Foundation Models in AI-Native 6G Networks

author.name: Mohamed Amine Ferrag, Abderrahmane Lakas, Merouane Debbah

entry.summary: 6G-Bench evaluates semantic communication and network-level reasoning for AI-native 6G networks, defining 30 decision-making tasks from standardization activities and generating 3,722 validated multi-choice questions. Benchmarks 28 LLMs.

entry.title: Improving Detection of Rare Nodes in Hierarchical Multi-Label Learning
