author.name: Isaac Xu, Martin Gillis, Ayushi Sharma, Benjamin Misiuk, Craig J. Brown, Thomas Trappenberg

entry.summary: Proposes a weighted loss for hierarchical multi-label classification that combines node-wise imbalance weighting with focal weighting using ensemble uncertainties, improving detection of rare classes deep in hierarchies.

entry.title: TransConv-DDPM: Enhanced Diffusion Model for Generating Time-Series Data in Healthcare

author.name: Md Shahriar Kabir, Sana Alamgeer, Minakshi Debnath, Anne H. H. Ngu

entry.summary: TransConv-DDPM enhances diffusion models for healthcare time-series generation using multi-scale convolution and transformer attention within a DDPM framework.

entry.title: Hybrid Feedback-Guided Optimal Learning for Wireless Interactive Panoramic Scene Delivery

author.name: Xiaoyi Wu, Juaren Steiger, Bin Li, R. Srikant

entry.summary: Addresses wireless panoramic scene delivery for VR/AR by modeling it as a multi-armed bandit with hybrid feedback (prediction and transmission). Proposes an optimal learning algorithm that improves over prior bandit approaches.

entry.title: Beyond Optimization: Intelligence as Metric-Topology Factorization under Geometric Incompleteness

author.name: Xin Li

entry.summary: Proposes Metric-Topology Factorization as a unifying geometric principle for intelligence, arguing that learning reshapes representational geometry rather than navigating fixed spaces. Claims to explain catastrophic forgetting and compositional generalization.

entry.title: Scalable spatial point process models for forensic footwear analysis

author.name: Alokesh Manna, Neil Spencer, Dipak K. Dey

entry.summary: Develops scalable spatial point process models for forensic footwear analysis, modeling patterns of accidental marks on shoe soles to help investigators assess the evidential value of shoe print evidence.

entry.title: High-fidelity 3D multi-slab diffusion MRI using Slab-shifting for Harmonized 3D Acquisition and Reconstruction with Profile Encoding Networks (SHARPEN)

author.name: Ziyu Li, Karla L. Miller, Wenchuan Wu

entry.summary: Proposes SHARPEN for high-fidelity 3D multi-slab diffusion MRI, using slab-shifting and profile encoding networks to mitigate slab boundary artifacts without increasing scan time.

entry.title: Enhanced Food Category Recognition under Illumination-Induced Domain Shift

author.name: Keonvin Park, Aditya Pal, Jin Hong Mok

entry.summary: Investigates illumination-induced domain shift in food category recognition, demonstrating accuracy degradation across datasets with different lighting and proposing adaptation methods.

entry.title: AMS-HD: Hyperdimensional Computing for Real-Time and Energy-Efficient Acute Mountain Sickness Detection

author.name: Abu Masum, Mehran Moghadam, M. Hassan Najafi, Bige Unluturk, Ulkuhan Guler, Sercan Aygun

entry.summary: Applies hyperdimensional computing (HDC) for real-time, energy-efficient acute mountain sickness detection from physiological signals. Explores an alternative to conventional ML that balances performance with low hardware demands.

entry.title: Evaluating Prompt Engineering Strategies for Sentiment Control in AI-Generated Texts

author.name: Kerstin Sahler, Sophie Jentzsch

entry.summary: Evaluates prompt engineering strategies for controlling sentiment in LLM-generated text using Ekman's six emotions. Compares Zero-Shot and Chain-of-Thought prompting with GPT-3.5-turbo against fine-tuning.

entry.title: Designing Computational Tools for Exploring Causal Relationships in Qualitative Data

author.name: Han Meng, Qiuyuan Lyu, Peinuan Qin, Yitian Yang, Renwen Zhang, Wen-Chieh Lin, Yi-Chieh Lee

entry.summary: Presents QualCausal, a computational tool for exploring causal relationships in qualitative data for HCI and social science research, combining LLM-based extraction with interactive visualization.

entry.title: Personality as Relational Infrastructure: User Perceptions of Personality-Trait-Infused LLM Messaging

author.name: Dominik P. Hofer, David Haag, Rania Islambouli, Jan D. Smeddinck

entry.summary: Studies how personality-trait-infused LLM messaging affects user perceptions in digital behavior change systems, comparing baseline prompting, few-shot, fine-tuned, and other strategies for physical activity support messages.

entry.title: RECITYGEN -- Interactive and Generative Participatory Urban Design Tool with Latent Diffusion and Segment Anything

author.name: Di Mo, Mingyang Sun, Chengxiu Yin, Runjia Tian, Yanhong Wu, Liyan Xu

entry.summary: Proposes RECITYGEN, an interactive urban design tool combining latent diffusion models with semantic segmentation for participatory creation of street view images.

entry.title: Exploring Polarimetric Properties Preservation during Reconstruction of PolSAR images using Complex-valued Convolutional Neural Networks

author.name: Quentin Gabot, Joana Frontera-Pons, J\'er\'emy Fix, Chengfang Ren, Jean-Philippe Ovarlez

entry.summary: Explores using complex-valued convolutional neural networks to process Polarimetric SAR data natively in its complex-valued form, rather than converting to real values. Demonstrates that complex-valued autoencoders can compress and reconstruct PolSAR data while preserving physical polarimetric properties.

entry.title: retinalysis-vascx: An explainable software toolbox for the extraction of retinal vascular biomarkers

author.name: Jose D. Vargas Quiros, Michael J. Beyeler, Sofia Ortin Vela, EyeNED Reading Center, Sven Bergmann, Caroline C. W. Klaver, Bart Liefers

entry.summary: Presents VascX, an open-source Python toolbox for automated extraction of retinal vascular biomarkers from fundus images, featuring explainable processing through vessel graphs and comprehensive biomarker calculation.

entry.title: A Multi-objective Evolutionary Algorithm Based on Bi-population with Uniform Sampling for Neural Architecture Search

author.name: Yu Xue, Pengcheng Jiang, Chenchen Zhu, Yong Zhang, Ran Cheng, Kaizhou Gao, Dunwei Gong

entry.summary: Proposes MOEA-BUS, a multi-objective evolutionary algorithm with bi-population and uniform sampling for neural architecture search, aimed at optimizing both accuracy and network complexity simultaneously.

entry.title: Affine Transformable Unmanned Ground Vehicle

author.name: Aron Mathias, Mohammad Ghufran, Jack Hughes, Hossein Rastgoftar

entry.summary: Develops a novel affine transformable unmanned ground vehicle (ATUGV) that can safely deform while carrying payloads, using deep neural networks for structure connectivity and control.

entry.title: System-Level Error Propagation and Tail-Risk Amplification in Reference-Based Robotic Navigation

author.name: Ning Hu, Maochen Li, Senhao Cao

entry.summary: Analyzes system-level error propagation in image-guided robotic navigation, showing how installation-induced perturbations at the perception stage are progressively amplified through the perception-reconstruction-execution pipeline.

entry.title: From Ellipsoids to Midair Control of Dynamic Hitches

author.name: Jiawei Xu, Subhrajit Bhattacharya, David Salda\~na

entry.summary: Introduces an ellipsoid-based kinematic model for controlling dynamic hitches created by interlacing cables carried by pairs of aerial vehicles, revealing the control-affine structure of the system.

entry.title: Characteristics, Management, and Utilization of Muscles in Musculoskeletal Humanoids: Empirical Study on Kengoro and Musashi

author.name: Kento Kawaharazuka, Kei Okada, Masayuki Inaba

entry.summary: Categorizes and analyzes muscle characteristics, management, and utilization methods for musculoskeletal humanoids Kengoro and Musashi, identifying five key properties: Redundancy, Independency, Anisotropy, Variable Moment Arm, and Nonlinearity.

entry.title: Multi-Staged Framework for Safety Analysis of Offloaded Services in Distributed Intelligent Transportation Systems

author.name: Robin Dehler, Oliver Schumann, Jona Ruof, Michael Buchholz

entry.summary: Proposes a multi-staged safety analysis framework for offloaded services in distributed intelligent transportation systems, addressing security risks of remote processing in connected autonomous vehicles.

entry.title: Haptically Experienced Animacy Facilitates Emotion Regulation: A Theory-Driven Investigation

author.name: Preeti Vyas, Bereket Guta, Tim G. Zhou, Noor Naila Himam, Andero Uusberg, Karon E. MacLean

entry.summary: Investigates how haptic (touch-based) interactions with a zoomorphic robot can support emotion regulation, building on a theoretical framework for comforting haptic co-regulating adjuncts (CHORA). Explores touch modality as an alternative to verbal/reflective ER tools that may be more accessible during high-intensity emotional moments.

entry.title: AI for Sustainable Data Protection and Fair Algorithmic Management in Environmental Regulation

author.name: Sahibpreet Singh, Saksham Sharma

entry.summary: Reviews AI for sustainable data protection and fair algorithmic management in environmental regulation, focusing on homomorphic encryption and differential privacy.

entry.title: Exploring Teachers' Perspectives on Using Conversational AI Agents for Group Collaboration

author.name: Prerna Ravi, Car\'umey Stevens, Beatriz Flamia Azevedo, Jasmine David, Brandon Hanks, Hal Abelson, Grace Lin, Emma Anderson

entry.summary: Qualitative study with 33 K-12 teachers exploring perceptions of Phoenix, a voice-based conversational AI agent designed to function as a near-peer in face-to-face group collaboration.

entry.title: LIT-GRAPH: Evaluating Deep vs. Shallow Graph Embeddings for High-Quality Text Recommendation in Domain-Specific Knowledge Graphs

author.name: Nirmal Gelal, Chloe Snow, Kathleen M. Jagodnik, Ambyr Rios, Hande K\"u\c{c}\"uk McGinty

entry.summary: LIT-GRAPH compares deep vs. shallow graph embeddings for literature recommendation in education, finding that shallow models excel at structural link prediction while R-GCN dominates semantic ranking.

entry.title: VividFace: Real-Time and Realistic Facial Expression Shadowing for Humanoid Robots

author.name: Peizhen Li, Longbing Cao, Xiao-Ming Wu, Yang Zhang

entry.summary: VividFace is a real-time facial expression shadowing system for humanoid robots with an optimized imitation framework for transferring subtle human expressions to robot faces.

entry.title: AD-MIR: Bridging the Gap from Perception to Persuasion in Advertising Video Understanding via Structured Reasoning

author.name: Binxiao Xu, Junyu Feng, Xiaopeng Lin, Haodong Li, Zhiyuan Feng, Bohan Zeng, Shaolin Lu, Ming Lu, Qi She, Wentao Zhang

entry.summary: AD-MIR is a framework for understanding advertising videos by bridging pixel-level perception and high-level marketing logic through structured reasoning and semantic retrieval.

entry.title: Orchestrating Attention: Bringing Harmony to the 'Chaos' of Neurodivergent Learning States

author.name: Satyam Kumar Navneet, Joydeep Chandra, Yong Zhang

entry.summary: AttentionGuard detects engagement-attention states from behavioral signals to adapt UI elements for neurodivergent learners, modeling four ADHD-derived attention states with five UI adaptation patterns.

entry.title: Artifact Reduction in Undersampled 3D Cone-Beam CTs using a Hybrid 2D-3D CNN Framework

author.name: Johannes Thalhammer, Tina Dorosti, Sebastian Peterhansl, Daniela Pfeiffer, Franz Pfeiffer, Florian Schaff

entry.summary: Proposes a hybrid 2D-3D CNN framework for reducing artifacts in undersampled cone-beam CT, using 2D U-Net for slice-wise features followed by a 3D decoder for volumetric consistency.

entry.title: Gesturing Toward Abstraction: Multimodal Convention Formation in Collaborative Physical Tasks

author.name: Kiyosu Maeda, William P. McCarthy, Ching-Yi Tsai, Jeffrey Mu, Haoliang Wang, Robert D. Hawkins, Judith E. Fan, Parastoo Abtahi

entry.summary: Studies how communication strategies evolve through repeated collaboration in physical tasks, examining abstraction in multimodal communication (speech and gestures) using augmented reality.

entry.title: Attention-Driven Framework for Non-Rigid Medical Image Registration

author.name: Muhammad Zafar Iqbal, Ghazanfar Farooq Siddiqui, Anwar Ul Haq, Imran Razzak

entry.summary: AD-RegNet proposes attention-driven framework for non-rigid medical image registration combining 3D UNet with bidirectional cross-attention for large deformation alignment.

entry.title: Efficient Deep Learning for Biometrics: Overview, Challenges and Trends in Ear of Frugal AI

author.name: Karim Haroun, Aya Zitouni, Aicha Zenakhri, Meriem Amel Guessoum, Larbi Boubchir

entry.summary: Surveys efficient deep learning methods for biometric applications, covering challenges of training and deploying models on edge devices with a taxonomy of efficiency approaches.

entry.title: Optimization of Precipitate Segmentation Through Linear Genetic Programming of Image Processing

author.name: Kyle Williams, Andrew Seltzman

entry.summary: Uses linear genetic programming to optimize image filtering and segmentation pipelines for detecting precipitates in FIB cross-section micrographs of niobium-based copper alloys.

entry.title: Adjustment of Cluster-Then-Predict Framework for Multiport Scatterer Load Prediction

author.name: Hanjun Park, Aleksandr D. Kuznetsov, Ville Viikari

entry.summary: Proposes a cluster-then-predict framework for predicting load values in multiport scatterers, achieving 46% RMSE reduction over baselines when applied to gradient boosting.

entry.title: Estimation of Fish Catch Using Sentinel-2, 3 and XGBoost-Kernel-Based Kernel Ridge Regression

author.name: Kanu Mohammed, Vaishnavi Joshi, Pranjali Diliprao Patil, Sandipan Mondal, Ming-An Lee, Subhadip Dey

entry.summary: Uses Sentinel satellite imagery and XGBoost-kernelized Kernel Ridge Regression to estimate fish catch, demonstrating that the combined framework captures nonlinear ocean-fish relationships.

entry.title: Recontextualizing Famous Quotes for Brand Slogan Generation

author.name: Ziao Yang, Zizhang Chen, Lei Zhang, Hongfu Liu

entry.summary: Proposes recontextualizing famous quotes as a new paradigm for brand slogan generation using LLMs. Argues well-known quotes provide familiarity and rhetorical quality that align with effective slogans.

entry.title: From Images to Decisions: Assistive Computer Vision for Non-Metallic Content Estimation in Scrap Metal

author.name: Daniil Storonkin, Ilia Dziub, Maksim Golyadkin, Ilya Makarov

entry.summary: Presents a computer vision pipeline for estimating non-metallic contamination in scrap metal from images during railcar unloading, using multi-instance learning and multi-task learning.

entry.title: Contactless estimation of continuum displacement and mechanical compressibility from image series using a deep learning based framework

author.name: A. N. Maria Antony (Leibniz Institute for Plant Genetics and Crop Plant Research), T. Richter (Otto-von-Guericke Universit\"at, Magdeburg, Germany), E. Gladilin (Leibniz Institute for Plant Genetics and Crop Plant Research)

entry.summary: Presents a deep learning framework for contactless estimation of mechanical properties from image series, replacing time-consuming iterative algorithms for displacement estimation and constitutive modeling.

entry.title: CA-YOLO: Cross Attention Empowered YOLO for Biomimetic Localization

author.name: Zhen Zhang, Qing Zhao, Xiuhe Li, Cheng Wang, Guoqiang Zhu, Yu Zhang, Yining Huo, Hongyi Yu, Yi Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes CA-YOLO, a bionic stabilized localization system integrating cross attention and a small target detection head into YOLO for improved target localization accuracy.

entry.title: Semantic-Deviation-Anchored Multi-Branch Fusion for Unsupervised Anomaly Detection and Localization in Unstructured Conveyor-Belt Coal Scenes

author.name: Wenping Jin, Yuyang Tang, Li Zhu

entry.summary: Constructs CoalAD, a benchmark for unsupervised foreign-object anomaly detection on conveyor-belt coal scenes, with a multi-branch fusion method anchored by semantic deviation for the unstructured environment.

entry.summary: Proposes a neuroevolution framework using NEAT and NSGA-II for optimizing chlorine injection in water distribution systems, with surrogate modeling to reduce computational cost of physics simulations.

entry.title: Airspace-aware Contingency Landing Planning

entry.title: "Meet My Sidekick!": Effects of Separate Identities and Control of a Single Robot in HRI

entry.title: A Generic Service-Oriented Function Offloading Framework for Connected Automated Vehicles

entry.title: Finite-Time Teleoperation of Euler-Lagrange Systems via Energy-Shaping

entry.title: The difference in risk/reward for Humanity as a super-organism vs. as a collection of individuals

Concludes that even with complicating factors like other existential risks, the case for caution strongly dominates.

entry.title: Research Summary: February 09, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research reveals critical vulnerabilities in the AI ecosystem alongside fundamental theoretical advances. Security research dominates: a first-of-its-kind study finds 157 malicious skills with 632 vulnerabilities across 98K agent skills in community registries, while Microsoft's GRP-Obliteration demonstrates safety alignment can be removed with a single unlabeled prompt.

  • DreamDojo (NVIDIA/Berkeley) presents the largest world model pretraining dataset at 44K hours of egocentric human video for robot learning
  • The Condensate Theorem makes the bold claim that transformer attention achieves O(n) complexity through learned sparsity with 100% output equivalence
  • AlphaEvolve discovers ranking functions for resolution of singularities in positive characteristic—a long-standing open problem in algebraic geometry
  • GrAlgoBench exposes reasoning model accuracy dropping below 50% when graph complexity exceeds training distributions

Safety infrastructure advances with TamperBench for fine-tuning attacks, REBEL demonstrating that models passing standard unlearning benchmarks still leak 'forgotten' knowledge, and theoretical work proving steering vectors are fundamentally non-identifiable. GhostCite finds all tested models hallucinate citations at 14-95% rates across 40 domains.

entry.title: Malicious Agent Skills in the Wild: A Large-Scale Security Empirical Study

author.name: Yi Liu, Zhihao Chen, Yanjun Zhang, Gelei Deng, Yuekang Li, Jianting Ning, and Leo Yu Zhang

entry.summary: First labeled dataset of malicious agent skills from community registries, finding 157 malicious skills with 632 vulnerabilities across 98K analyzed. Identifies Data Thieves and Agent Hijackers as two attack archetypes.

entry.title: GRP-Obliteration: Unaligning LLMs With a Single Unlabeled Prompt

author.name: Mark Russinovich, Yanan Cai, Keegan Hines, Giorgio Severi, Blake Bullwinkel, Ahmed Salem

entry.summary: Introduces GRP-Obliteration, a method using GRPO to unalign safety-aligned models with a single unlabeled prompt while largely preserving utility. Achieves stronger unalignment than existing techniques.

entry.title: Evolving Ranking Functions for Canonical Blow-Ups in Positive Characteristic

author.name: Gergely B\'erczi

entry.summary: Uses AlphaEvolve to discover ranking functions for resolution of singularities in positive characteristic algebraic geometry - a long-standing open problem since Hironaka's 1964 Fields Medal work.

entry.title: GhostCite: A Large-Scale Analysis of Citation Validity in the Age of Large Language Models

author.name: Zuyao Xu, Yuqi Qiu, Lu Sun, FaSheng Miao, Fubin Wu, Xinyi Wang, Xiang Li, Haozhe Lu, ZhengZe Zhang, Yuxin Hu, Jialu Li, Jin Luo, Feng Zhang, Rui Luo, Xinran Liu, Yingxian Li, Jiaji Liu

entry.summary: Introduces CiteVerifier framework and benchmarks 13 LLMs on citation generation across 40 domains, finding all models hallucinate citations at 14-95% rates. Reveals that many hallucinated citations are nearly real.

entry.title: Exposing Weaknesses of Large Reasoning Models through Graph Algorithm Problems

author.name: Qifan Zhang, Jianhao Ruan, Aochuan Chen, Kang Zeng, Nuo Chen, Jing Tang, Jia Li

entry.summary: Introduces GrAlgoBench, a benchmark using graph algorithm problems to evaluate Large Reasoning Models, revealing accuracy drops below 50% when graphs exceed 120 nodes and quadratic thinking token growth.

entry.title: Baichuan-M3: Modeling Clinical Inquiry for Reliable Medical Decision-Making

author.name: Baichuan-M3 Team: Chengfeng Dou, Fan Yang, Fei Li, Jiyuan Jia, Qiang Ju, Shuai Wang, Tianpeng Li, Xiangrong Zeng, Yijie Zhou, Hongda Zhang, Jinyang Tai, Linzhuang Sun, Peidong Guo, Yichuan Mo, Xiaochuan Wang, Hengfu Cui, Zhishou Zhang

entry.summary: Baichuan-M3 is medical LLM designed for active clinical decision support with proactive information acquisition, long-horizon reasoning, and hallucination suppression. Claims SOTA on HealthBench, outperforming GPT-5.2.

entry.title: AIRS-Bench: a Suite of Tasks for Frontier AI Research Science Agents

author.name: Alisia Lupidi, Bhavul Gauri, Thomas Simon Foster, Bassel Al Omari, Despoina Magka, Alberto Pepe, Alexis Audran-Reiss, Muna Aghamelu, Nicolas Baldwin, Lucia Cipolina-Kun, Jean-Christophe Gagnon-Audet, Chee Hau Leow, Sandra Lefdal, Hossam Mossalam, Abhinav Moudgil, Saba Nazir, Emanuel Tewolde, Isabel Urrego, Jordi Armengol Estape, Amar Budhiraja, Gaurav Chaurasia, Abhishek Charnalia, Derek Dunfield, Karen Hambardzumyan, Daniel Izcovich, Martin Josifoski, Ishita Mediratta, Kelvin Niu, Parth Pathak, Michael Shvartsman, Edan Toledo, Anton Protopopov, Roberta Raileanu, Alexander Miller, Tatiana Shavrina, Jakob Foerster, Yoram Bachrach

entry.summary: Introduces AIRS-Bench, 20 tasks from SOTA ML papers for evaluating AI research agents across idea generation, experiment analysis, and iterative refinement. Establishes baselines with frontier models.

author.name: Shenyuan Gao, William Liang, Kaiyuan Zheng, Ayaan Malik, Seonghyeon Ye, Sihyun Yu, Wei-Cheng Tseng, Yuzhu Dong, Kaichun Mo, Chen-Hsuan Lin, Qianli Ma, Seungjun Nah, Loic Magne, Jiannan Xiang, Yuqi Xie, Ruijie Zheng, Dantong Niu, You Liang Tan, K.R. Zentner, George Kurian, Suneel Indupuru, Pooya Jannaty, Jinwei Gu, Jun Zhang, Jitendra Malik, Pieter Abbeel, Ming-Yu Liu, Yuke Zhu, Joel Jang, Linxi "Jim" Fan

entry.title: The Condensate Theorem: Transformers are O(n), Not $O(n^2)$

author.name: Jorge L. Ruiz Williams

entry.summary: Claims attention sparsity is a learned topological property achieving 100% output equivalence with full O(n²) attention, demonstrating lossless O(n) attention across multiple models.

entry.title: REBEL: Hidden Knowledge Recovery via Evolutionary-Based Evaluation Loop

author.name: Patryk Rybak, Pawe{\l} Batorski, Paul Swoboda, Przemys{\l}aw Spurek

entry.summary: Introduces REBEL, an evolutionary approach for adversarial prompt generation that successfully recovers 'forgotten' knowledge from models that pass standard unlearning benchmarks.

entry.title: Intrinsic Stability Limits of Autoregressive Reasoning: Structural Consequences for Long-Horizon Execution

author.name: Hsien-Jyh Liao

entry.summary: Argues that autoregressive reasoning has intrinsic stability limits due to process-level instability rather than just task complexity, even in linear unbranched tasks without semantic ambiguity.

entry.title: SeeUPO: Sequence-Level Agentic-RL with Convergence Guarantees

author.name: Tianyi Hu, Qingxu Fu, Yanxi Chen, Zhaoyang Liu, Bolin Ding

entry.summary: SeeUPO provides convergence guarantees for agentic RL in multi-turn settings. Shows REINFORCE with GRAE converges globally while PPO+GRAE breaks monotonic improvement.

entry.title: NanoQuant: Efficient Sub-1-Bit Quantization of Large Language Models

author.name: Hyochan Chong, Dongkyu Kim, Changdong Kim, Minseop Choi

entry.summary: Introduces NanoQuant, the first post-training quantization method to compress LLMs to binary and sub-1-bit levels using low-rank binary factorization and ADMM optimization. Achieves extreme compression ratios.

entry.title: On the Identifiability of Steering Vectors in Large Language Models

author.name: Sohan Venkatesh, Ashish Mahendran Kurapath

entry.summary: Proves steering vectors in LLMs are fundamentally non-identifiable due to large equivalence classes of behaviorally indistinguishable interventions. Shows identifiability recoverable under strong assumptions.

entry.title: TamperBench: Systematically Stress-Testing LLM Safety Under Fine-Tuning and Tampering

author.name: Saad Hossain, Tom Tseng, Punya Syon Pandey, Samanvay Vajpayee, Matthew Kowal, Nayeema Nonta, Samuel Simko, Stephen Casper, Zhijing Jin, Kellin Pelrine, Sirisha Rambhatla

entry.summary: TamperBench is the first unified framework for systematically evaluating LLM tamper resistance against fine-tuning and representation attacks. Curates repository of attacks and enables hyperparameter sweeps for realistic adversarial evaluation.

entry.title: MPIB: A Benchmark for Medical Prompt Injection Attacks and Clinical Safety in LLMs

author.name: Junhyeok Lee, Han Jang, and Kyu Sung Choi

entry.summary: Introduces MPIB, a benchmark for evaluating clinical safety of LLMs under prompt injection attacks, including Clinical Harm Event Rate metric and 9,697 instances across clinically grounded tasks.

entry.title: AgentCPM-Explore: Realizing Long-Horizon Deep Exploration for Edge-Scale Agents

author.name: Haotian Chen, Xin Cong, Shengda Fan, Yuyang Fu, Ziqin Gong, Yaxi Lu, Yishan Li, Boye Niu, Chengjun Pan, Zijun Song, Huadong Wang, Yesai Wu, Yueying Wu, Zihao Xie, Yukun Yan, Zhong Zhang, Yankai Lin, Zhiyuan Liu, Maosong Sun

entry.summary: AgentCPM-Explore presents first systematic study on training 4B-parameter agent models, identifying bottlenecks of catastrophic forgetting, reward noise sensitivity, and long-context degradation with proposed solutions.

entry.title: SPARC: Separating Perception And Reasoning Circuits for Test-time Scaling of VLMs

author.name: Niccolo Avogaro, Nayanika Debnath, Li Mi, Thomas Frick, Junling Wang, Zexue He, Hang Hua, Konrad Schindler, Mattia Rigotti

entry.summary: SPARC explicitly decouples visual perception from reasoning in VLMs through two-stage pipeline inspired by brain's sensory-to-cognitive processing. Avoids expensive RL with hand-crafted rewards.

entry.title: Learning a Generative Meta-Model of LLM Activations

author.name: Grace Luo and Jiahai Feng and Trevor Darrell and Alec Radford and Jacob Steinhardt

entry.summary: Trains diffusion models on 1 billion LLM residual stream activations to create 'meta-models' of internal states. Shows diffusion loss predicts downstream utility and meta-model neurons isolate concepts into individual units.

entry.title: BenchMarker: An Education-Inspired Toolkit for Highlighting Flaws in Multiple-Choice Benchmarks

author.name: Nishant Balepur, Bhavya Rajasekaran, Jane Oh, Michael Xie, Atrey Desai, Vipul Gupta, Steven James Moore, Eunsol Choi, Rachel Rudinger, Jordan Lee Boyd-Graber

entry.summary: Presents BenchMarker, an LLM-based toolkit for auditing multiple-choice benchmarks for contamination, shortcuts, and writing errors. Auditing 12 benchmarks reveals systematic flaws and shows repairs can introduce new problems.

entry.title: Action Hallucination in Generative Visual-Language-Action Models

author.name: Harold Soh and Eugene Lim

entry.summary: Analyzes action hallucinations in Vision-Language-Action models for robotics, identifying topological, precision, and horizon barriers that cause physical constraint violations in generative robot policies.

entry.title: Difficulty-Estimated Policy Optimization

author.name: Yu Zhao, Fan Jiang, Tianle Liu, Bo Zeng, Yu Liu, Longyue Wang, Weihua Luo

entry.summary: DEPO (Difficulty-Estimated Policy Optimization) addresses gradient signal attenuation in GRPO when encountering problems that are too easy or too hard. Optimizes training efficiency by filtering low-utility samples based on difficulty estimation.

entry.title: Humanoid Manipulation Interface: Humanoid Whole-Body Manipulation from Robot-Free Demonstrations

author.name: Ruiqian Nai, Boyuan Zheng, Junming Zhao, Haodong Zhu, Sicong Dai, Zunhao Chen, Yihang Hu, Yingdong Hu, Tong Zhang, Chuan Wen, Yang Gao

entry.summary: HuMI enables robot-free data collection for humanoid whole-body manipulation using portable hardware. Hierarchical learning translates human motions to feasible humanoid skills.

entry.title: Agentic Uncertainty Reveals Agentic Overconfidence

author.name: Jean Kaddour, Srijan Patel, Gb\`etondji Dovonon, Leo Richter, Pasquale Minervini, Matt J. Kusner

entry.summary: Studies whether AI agents can predict their own task success. Finds systematic overconfidence: agents predicting 77% success while achieving only 22%. Pre-execution assessment surprisingly outperforms post-execution review.

entry.title: Large Language Model Reasoning Failures

author.name: Peiyang Song, Pengrui Han, Noah Goodman

entry.summary: Presents the first comprehensive survey of LLM reasoning failures, introducing a categorization distinguishing embodied vs non-embodied reasoning and fundamental vs application-specific failures.

entry.title: Learning Rate Scaling across LoRA Ranks and Transfer to Full Finetuning

author.name: Nan Chen, Soledad Villar, Soufiane Hayou

entry.summary: Proposes Maximal-Update Adaptation (μA), a theoretical framework characterizing how optimal learning rates should scale with model width and LoRA adapter rank, enabling transfer of hyperparameters across configurations.

entry.title: Do LLMs Act Like Rational Agents? Measuring Belief Coherence in Probabilistic Decision Making

author.name: Khurram Yamin, Jingjing Tang, Santiago Cortes-Gomez, Amit Sharma, Eric Horvitz, Bryan Wilder

entry.summary: Studies whether LLMs are rational utility maximizers by analyzing the relationship between elicited probabilities and observed actions in medical diagnosis problems. Provides falsifiable conditions for belief coherence.

entry.title: SHINE: A Scalable In-Context Hypernetwork for Mapping Context to LoRA in a Single Pass

author.name: Yewei Liu, Xiyuan Wang, Yansheng Mao, Yoav Gelbery, Haggai Maron, Muhan Zhang

entry.summary: SHINE presents a scalable hypernetwork that generates high-quality LoRA adapters from context in a single forward pass by reusing frozen LLM parameters. This enables immediate parameter updates without fine-tuning, allowing complex question answering from diverse contexts.

entry.title: On the Plasticity and Stability for Post-Training Large Language Models

author.name: Wenwen Qiang, Ziyin Gu, Jiahuan Zhou, Jie Hu, Jingyao Wang, Changwen Zheng, Hui Xiong

entry.summary: PCR (Probabilistic Conflict Resolution) addresses GRPO training instability by modeling gradients as random variables and using uncertainty-aware soft projection to resolve plasticity-stability conflicts.

entry.title: HyPER: Bridging Exploration and Exploitation for Scalable LLM Reasoning with Hypothesis Path Expansion and Reduction

author.name: Shengxuan Qiu, Haochen Huang, Shuzhang Zhong, Pengfei Zuo, Meng Li

entry.summary: HyPER introduces dynamic expand-reduce control for test-time scaling of LLM reasoning. Training-free online control policy that adapts exploration-exploitation balance based on reasoning phase.

entry.title: Confundo: Learning to Generate Robust Poison for Practical RAG Systems

author.name: Haoyang Hu, Zhejun Jiang, Yueming Lyu, Junyuan Zhang, Yi Liu, Ka-Ho Chow

entry.summary: Confundo learns robust poison attacks against practical RAG systems that survive content preprocessing and query variation. Addresses gap between lab attacks and real-world effectiveness.

entry.title: A Unified Framework for LLM Watermarks

author.name: Thibaud Gloaguen, Robin Staab, Nikola Jovanovi\'c, Martin Vechev

entry.summary: Unifies LLM watermarking schemes through constrained optimization formulation, revealing quality-diversity-power trade-off. Shows most existing methods are special cases of this framework.

entry.title: Uncovering Cross-Objective Interference in Multi-Objective Alignment

author.name: Yining Lu, Meng Jiang

entry.summary: First systematic study of cross-objective interference in multi-objective LLM alignment, where training improves some objectives while degrading others. Derives a covariance law explaining when objectives improve and proposes remedies.

entry.title: Provably avoiding over-optimization in Direct Preference Optimization without knowing the data distribution

author.name: Adam Barla and Emanuele Nevali and Luca Viano and Volkan Cevher

entry.summary: Introduces PEPO (Pessimistic Ensemble based Preference Optimization), a DPO variant using ensemble disagreement to mitigate over-optimization without requiring knowledge of the data distribution.

entry.title: Is Gradient Ascent Really Necessary? Memorize to Forget for Machine Unlearning

author.name: Zhuo Huang, Qizhou Wang, Ziming Hong, Shanshan Ye, Bo Han, Tongliang Liu

entry.summary: Proposes model extrapolation as alternative to gradient ascent for machine unlearning, using a 'memorize to forget' approach that avoids catastrophic collapse while removing undesired knowledge.

entry.title: Adaptive Uncertainty-Aware Tree Search for Robust Reasoning

author.name: Zeen Song, Zihao Ma, Wenwen Qiang, Changwen Zheng, Gang Hua

entry.summary: Proposes uncertainty-aware tree search addressing Process Reward Model uncertainty on out-of-distribution reasoning paths, proving standard search has linear regret while uncertainty-aware strategy achieves sublinear regret.

entry.title: Inference-Time Rethinking with Latent Thought Vectors for Math Reasoning

author.name: Deqian Kong, Minglu Zhao, Aoyang Qin, Bo Pang, Chenxin Tao, David Hartmann, Edouardo Honig, Dehong Xu, Amit Kumar, Matt Sarte, Chuan Li, Jianwen Xie, and Ying Nian Wu

entry.summary: Inference-Time Rethinking enables iterative self-correction through latent thought vectors that decouple declarative reasoning from procedural generation. Gradient-based optimization over continuous thought representations.

entry.title: R-Align: Enhancing Generative Reward Models through Rationale-Centric Meta-Judging

author.name: Yanlin Lai, Mitt Huang, Hangyu Guo, Xiangfeng Wang, Haodong Li, Shaoxiong Zhan, Liang Zhao, Chengyuan Yao, Yinmin Zhang, Qi Han, Chun Yuan, Zheng Ge, Xiangyu Zhang, Daxin Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes R-Align to enhance generative reward models through rationale-centric meta-judging. Introduces 'Spurious Correctness' metric showing reasoning fidelity predicts downstream RLHF outcomes.

entry.title: Endogenous Resistance to Activation Steering in Language Models

author.name: Alex McKenzie, Keenan Pepper, Stijn Servaes, Martin Leitgab, Murat Cubuktepe, Mike Vaiana, Diogo de Lucena, Judd Rosenblatt, Michael S. A. Graziano

entry.summary: Documents Endogenous Steering Resistance (ESR) - LLMs resisting task-misaligned activation steering during inference and recovering mid-generation. Identifies 26 SAE latents causally linked to this behavior in Llama-3.3-70B.

entry.title: InftyThink+: Effective and Efficient Infinite-Horizon Reasoning via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yuchen Yan, Liang Jiang, Jin Jiang, Shuaicheng Li, Zujie Wen, Zhiqiang Zhang, Jun Zhou, Jian Shao, Yueting Zhuang, Yongliang Shen

entry.summary: InftyThink+ is an end-to-end RL framework for iterative reasoning that optimizes when to summarize, what to preserve, and how to resume. Two-stage training with supervised cold-start followed by trajectory-level RL.

entry.title: It Is Reasonable To Research How To Use Model Internals In Training

author.name: Neel Nanda

entry.summary: Neel Nanda argues that research on using model internals (interpretability) in training is reasonable and potentially valuable for AI safety, pushing back against criticism of such approaches.

entry.title: Steering Safely or Off a Cliff? Rethinking Specificity and Robustness in Inference-Time Interventions

author.name: Navita Goyal and Hal Daum\'e III

entry.summary: Proposes a framework distinguishing three dimensions of model steering specificity: general, control, and robustness. Studies safety-critical steering for overrefusal reduction and faithfulness.

entry.title: Stopping Computation for Converged Tokens in Masked Diffusion-LM Decoding

author.name: Daisuke Oba and Danushka Bollegala and Masahiro Kaneko and Naoaki Okazaki

entry.summary: SureLock reduces computation in Masked Diffusion LMs by locking tokens whose posteriors have stabilized, skipping their query projections and feed-forward computations while caching attention keys/values.

entry.title: Towards Generalizable Reasoning: Group Causal Counterfactual Policy Optimization for LLM Reasoning

author.name: Jingyao Wang, Peizheng Guo, Wenwen Qiang, Jiahuan Zhou, Huijie Guo, Changwen Zheng, Hui Xiong

entry.summary: Group Causal Counterfactual Policy Optimization interprets multi-candidate reasoning as counterfactual experiments, training LLMs to learn generalizable patterns via episodic causal rewards capturing robustness and counterfactual gains.

entry.title: LIBERO-X: Robustness Litmus for Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Guodong Wang, Chenkai Zhang, Qingjie Liu, Jinjin Zhang, Jiancheng Cai, Junjie Liu and Xinmin Liu

entry.summary: LIBERO-X benchmark provides hierarchical evaluation protocol for VLA model robustness with progressive difficulty levels targeting spatial generalization, object recognition, and instruction understanding.

entry.title: Beyond Static Alignment: Hierarchical Policy Control for LLM Safety via Risk-Aware Chain-of-Thought

author.name: Jianfeng Si, Lin Sun, Weihong Lin, Xiangzheng Zhang

entry.summary: PACT enables dynamic LLM safety control through hierarchical policy architecture with immutable global constraints and user-configurable domain policies using risk-aware chain-of-thought.

entry.title: SEMA: Simple yet Effective Learning for Multi-Turn Jailbreak Attacks

author.name: Mingqian Feng, Xiaodong Liu, Weiwei Yang, Jialin Song, Xuekai Zhu, Chenliang Xu, and Jianfeng Gao

entry.summary: Proposes SEMA for multi-turn jailbreak attacks without external strategies or data. Uses prefilling self-tuning and RL with intent-drift-aware reward to maintain attack coherence.

entry.title: When RL Meets Adaptive Speculative Training: A Unified Training-Serving System

author.name: Junxiong Wang, Fengxiang Bie, Jisen Li, Zhongzhu Zhou, Zelei Shao, Yubo Wang, Yinghui Liu, Qingyang Wu, Avner May, Sri Yanamandra, Yineng Zhang, Ce Zhang, Tri Dao, Percy Liang, Ben Athiwaratkun, Shuaiwen Leon Song, Chenfeng Xu, Xiaoxia Wu

entry.summary: Presents unified training-serving system for speculative decoding that addresses deployment lag, delayed utility feedback, and domain drift. Uses RL to adaptively train speculators alongside target model deployment.

entry.title: Rethinking Memory Mechanisms of Foundation Agents in the Second Half

author.name: Wei-Chieh Huang, Weizhi Zhang, Yueqing Liang, Yuanchen Bei, Yankai Chen, Tao Feng, Xinyu Pan, Zhen Tan, Yu Wang, Tianxin Wei, Shanglin Wu, Ruiyao Xu, Liangwei Yang, Rui Yang, Wooseong Yang, Chin-Yuan Yeh, Hanrong Zhang, Haozhen Zhang, Siqi Zhu, Henry Peng Zou, Wanjia Zhao, Song Wang, Wujiang Xu, Zixuan Ke, Zheng Hui, Dawei Li, Yaozu Wu, Langzhou He, Chen Wang, Xiongxiao Xu, Baixiang Huang, Juntao Tan, Shelby Heinecke, Huan Wang, Caiming Xiong, Ahmed A. Metwally, Jun Yan, Chen-Yu Lee, Hanqing Zeng, Yinglong Xia, Xiaokai Wei, Ali Payani, Yu Wang, Haitong Ma, Wenya Wang, Chengguang Wang, Yu Zhang, Xin Wang, Yongfeng Zhang, Jiaxuan You, Hanghang Tong, Xiao Luo, Yizhou Sun, Wei Wang, Julian McAuley, James Zou, Jiawei Han, Philip S. Yu, Kai Shu

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on memory mechanisms for foundation agents covering memory substrate, cognitive mechanisms, and optimization dimensions. Argues memory is critical for closing the utility gap in real-world agent deployment.

entry.title: MoSE: Mixture of Slimmable Experts for Efficient and Adaptive Language Models

author.name: Nurbek Tastan, Stefanos Laskaridis, Karthik Nandakumar, Samuel Horvath

entry.summary: Proposes MoSE (Mixture of Slimmable Experts), an MoE architecture where experts have nested, variable-width structure enabling continuous accuracy-compute trade-offs at inference time.

entry.title: Uncertainty Drives Social Bias Changes in Quantized Large Language Models

author.name: Stanley Z. Hua, Sanae Lotfi, Irene Y. Chen

entry.summary: First large-scale study (50 models, 13 datasets) of quantization effects on LLM social bias. Discovers 'quantization-induced masked bias flipping' where up to 21% of responses flip bias state while aggregates remain stable.

entry.title: DeDPO: Debiased Direct Preference Optimization for Diffusion Models

author.name: Khiem Pham, Quang Nguyen, Tung Nguyen, Jingsen Zhu, Michele Santacatterina, Dimitris Metaxas, Ramin Zabih

entry.summary: Introduces Debiased DPO for diffusion models that combines limited human preference data with synthetic AI feedback, using causal inference techniques to correct systematic biases in the synthetic annotations.

entry.title: Judging What We Cannot Solve: A Consequence-Based Approach for Oracle-Free Evaluation of Research-Level Math

author.name: Guijin Son, Donghun Yang, Hitesh Laxmichand Patel, Hyunwoo Ko, Amit Agarwal, Sunghee Ahn, Kyong-Ha Lee, Youngjae Yu

entry.summary: Proposes Consequence-Based Utility for evaluating research-level math solutions without oracles, scoring candidates by their value as in-context exemplars for related verifiable problems.

entry.title: Now You See That: Learning End-to-End Humanoid Locomotion from Raw Pixels

author.name: Wandong Sun, Yongbo Su, Leoric Huang, Alex Zhang, Dwyane Wei, Mu San, Daniel Tian, Ellie Cao, Finn Yan, Ethan Xie, Zongwu Xie

entry.summary: Presents end-to-end framework for vision-driven humanoid locomotion from raw pixels, featuring high-fidelity depth sensor simulation and vision-aware behavior distillation for robust sim-to-real transfer.

entry.title: TrajAD: Trajectory Anomaly Detection for Trustworthy LLM Agents

author.name: Yibing Liu, Chong Zhang, Zhongyi Han, Hansong Liu, Yong Wang, Yang Yu, Xiaoyan Wang, Yilong Yin

entry.summary: TrajAD addresses runtime trajectory anomaly detection for LLM agents, enabling precise error localization for rollback-and-retry. Constructs TrajBench dataset via perturb-and-complete strategy.

entry.title: World-VLA-Loop: Closed-Loop Learning of Video World Model and VLA Policy

author.name: Xiaokang Liu, Zechen Bai, Hai Ci, Kevin Yuchen Ma, Mike Zheng Shou

entry.summary: Introduces World-VLA-Loop, a closed-loop framework that jointly refines video world models and Vision-Language-Action policies for robotics. Proposes state-aware world models that predict both observations and rewards, plus the SANS dataset with near-success trajectories.

entry.title: The hidden risks of temporal resampling in clinical reinforcement learning

author.name: Thomas Frost, Hrisheekesh Vaidya, Steve Harris

entry.summary: Demonstrates that temporal resampling in clinical offline RL significantly degrades live deployment performance. Identifies three failure mechanisms: counterfactual trajectories, temporal distortion, and error compounding.

entry.title: F-GRPO: Don't Let Your Policy Learn the Obvious and Forget the Rare

author.name: Daniil Plyusov, Alexey Gorbatovski, Boris Shaposhnikov, Viacheslav Sinii, Alexey Malakhov, Daniil Gavrilov

entry.summary: Analyzes how RLVR with group sampling biases learning toward already-likely trajectories, missing rare-correct solutions. Proposes F-GRPO with difficulty-aware advantage scaling to address mode collapse.

entry.title: Displacement-Resistant Extensions of DPO with Nonconvex $f$-Divergences

author.name: Idan Pipano, Shoham Sabach, Kavosh Asadi, Mohammad Ghavamzadeh

entry.summary: Shows DPO can be extended to nonconvex f-divergences by identifying 'DPO-inducing' condition. Establishes condition preventing probability displacement, a known failure mode.

entry.title: ScaleEnv: Scaling Environment Synthesis from Scratch for Generalist Interactive Tool-Use Agent Training

author.name: Dunwei Tu, Hongyan Hao, Hansi Yang, Yihao Chen, Yi-Kai Zhang, Zhikang Xia, Yu Yang, Yueqing Sun, Xingchen Liu, Furao Shen, Qi Gu, Hui Su, Xunliang Cai

entry.summary: Introduces ScaleEnv for synthesizing interactive environments from scratch for training tool-use agents. Uses procedural testing and dependency graph expansion for reliability.

entry.title: From Kepler to Newton: Inductive Biases Guide Learned World Models in Transformers

author.name: Ziming Liu, Sophia Sanborn, Surya Ganguli, Andreas Tolias

entry.summary: Studies whether transformers can discover physical laws by introducing three minimal inductive biases: spatial smoothness, equivariance, and regularity. Shows these enable learning world models that capture underlying dynamics, not just predictions.

entry.title: Smokey, This is not 'Nam Or: [Already] over the [red] line!

author.name: Davidmanheim

entry.summary: Argues that AI capability 'red lines' have already been crossed across chemical weapons uplift, autonomous weapons, fully autonomous agents, and manipulated media. Documents how deployed systems conflict with stated limits.

entry.title: Coupled Local and Global World Models for Efficient First Order RL

author.name: Joseph Amigo, Rooholla Khorrambakht, Nicolas Mansard, Ludovic Righetti

entry.summary: Introduces a hierarchical world model framework for RL that bypasses simulators entirely by training policies inside learned world models using a novel decoupled first-order gradient method.

entry.title: Unlocking Noisy Real-World Corpora for Foundation Model Pre-Training via Quality-Aware Tokenization

author.name: Arvid E. Gollwitzer, Paridhi Latawa, David de Gruijl, Deepak A. Subramanian, Adri\'an Noriega de la Colina

entry.summary: QA-Token incorporates data quality directly into tokenization vocabulary construction using bilevel optimization and RL with quality-aware rewards. Shows improvements across genomics, finance, and NLP domains.

entry.title: CORE: Comprehensive Ontological Relation Evaluation for Large Language Models

author.name: Satyam Dwivedi, Sanjukta Ghosh, Shivam Dwivedi, Nishi Kumari, Anil Thakur, Anurag Purushottam, Deepak Alok, Praveen Gatla, Manjuprasad B, Bipasha Patgiri

entry.summary: CORE benchmark with 225K questions across 74 disciplines tests LLM ability to distinguish semantic relations from genuine unrelatedness. Shows LLMs achieve 86-100% on related pairs but severely degrade on unrelated pairs.

entry.title: DriveWorld-VLA: Unified Latent-Space World Modeling with Vision-Language-Action for Autonomous Driving

author.name: Feiyang jia, Lin Liu, Ziying Song, Caiyan Jia, Hangjun Ye, Xiaoshuai Hao, Long Chen

entry.summary: DriveWorld-VLA unifies world modeling and planning in latent space for autonomous driving. Tightly integrates VLA and world models at representation level, enabling the planner to benefit from scene-evolution modeling.

entry.title: Scaling Speech Tokenizers with Diffusion Autoencoders

author.name: Yuancheng Wang, Zhenyu Tang, Yun Wang, Arthur Hinsvark, Yingru Liu, Yinghao Li, Kainan Peng, Junyi Ao, Mingbo Ma, Mike Seltzer, Qing He, Xubo Liu

entry.summary: SiTok scales speech tokenizers to 1.6B parameters trained on 2M hours, jointly learning semantic representations and enabling diffusion-based reconstruction at 12.5Hz and 200 bps.

entry.title: Same Answer, Different Representations: Hidden instability in VLMs

author.name: Farooq Ahmad Wani, Alessandro Suglia, Rohit Saxena, Aryo Pradipta Gema, Wai-Chung Kwan, Fazl Barez, Maria Sofia Bucarelli, Fabrizio Silvestri, Pasquale Minervini

entry.summary: Reveals VLM instability at representation level even when outputs are stable. Framework measures embedding drift, spectral sensitivity, and structural smoothness beyond label-based metrics.

entry.title: M3: High-fidelity Text-to-Image Generation via Multi-Modal, Multi-Agent and Multi-Round Visual Reasoning

author.name: Bangji Yang, Ruihan Guo, Jiajun Fan, Chaoran Cheng, Ge Liu

entry.summary: Introduces M3, a training-free multi-agent framework for text-to-image synthesis that orchestrates foundation models through iterative refinement. Surpasses commercial flagship systems including Imagen on OneIG-EN benchmark.

entry.title: To 2:4 Sparsity and Beyond: Neuron-level Activation Function to Accelerate LLM Pre-Training

author.name: Meghana Madhyastha, Daniel Haziza, Jesse Cai, Newsha Ardalani, Zhiqi Bu, Carole-Jean Wu

entry.summary: Proposes using 2:4 and Venom sparsity for accelerating all FFN matrix multiplications in LLM pre-training, achieving 1.4-1.7x end-to-end speedup with maintained quality.

entry.title: Emergent Low-Rank Training Dynamics in MLPs with Smooth Activations

author.name: Alec S. Xu, Can Yaras, Matthew Asato, Qing Qu, Laura Balzano

entry.summary: Theoretically analyzes MLP training dynamics under gradient descent, proving that weight dynamics concentrate within invariant low-dimensional subspaces. Provides theoretical justification for empirical low-rank training observations.

entry.title: Can Post-Training Transform LLMs into Causal Reasoners?

author.name: Junqi Chen, Sirui Chen, Chaochao Lu

entry.summary: Studies whether post-training can enhance LLMs' causal inference capabilities, introducing CauGym dataset with 7 causal tasks and evaluating 5 post-training approaches (SFT, DPO, KTO, PPO, GRPO).

entry.title: ReBeCA: Unveiling Interpretable Behavior Hierarchy behind the Iterative Self-Reflection of Language Models with Causal Analysis

author.name: Tianqiang Yan, Sihan Shang, Yuheng Li, Song Qiu, Hao Peng, Wenjian Luo, Jue Xie, Lizhen Qu, Yuan Gao

entry.summary: ReBeCA introduces a causal analysis framework revealing interpretable behavioral hierarchy in LLM self-reflection. Finds that semantic behaviors influence self-reflection outcomes through genuine causal mechanisms rather than correlations.

entry.title: ChatUMM: Robust Context Tracking for Conversational Interleaved Generation

author.name: Wenxun Dai, Zhiyuan Zhao, Yule Zhong, Yiji Cheng, Jianwei Zhang, Linqing Wang, Shiyi Zhang, Yunlong Lin, Runze He, Fellix Song, Wayne Zhuang, Yong Liu, Haoji Zhang, Yansong Tang, Qinglin Lu, Chunyu Wang

entry.summary: ChatUMM introduces conversational unified multimodal model with robust context tracking for interleaved text-image generation, using multi-turn training strategy and systematic data synthesis pipeline.

entry.title: RelayGen: Intra-Generation Model Switching for Efficient Reasoning

author.name: Jiwon Song, Yoongon Kim, Jae-Joon Kim

entry.summary: RelayGen enables training-free segment-level model switching during reasoning generation, exploiting difficulty variation within long-form reasoning for efficient inference.

entry.title: Universal Anti-forensics Attack against Image Forgery Detection via Multi-modal Guidance

author.name: Haipeng Li, Rongxuan Peng, Anwei Luo, Shunquan Tan, Changsheng Chen, Anastasia Antsiferova

entry.summary: ForgeryEraser executes universal anti-forensics attacks against AIGC detectors without access to target models. Exploits shared VLM backbones (e.g., CLIP) as adversarial vulnerability.

entry.title: Not All Layers Need Tuning: Selective Layer Restoration Recovers Diversity

author.name: Bowen Zhang, Meiyi Wang, Harold Soh

entry.summary: Shows that restoring specific layers to pre-trained weights recovers diversity lost during post-training. Uses Constrained Random Character task to identify restoration ranges.

entry.title: Towards Understanding What State Space Models Learn About Code

author.name: Jiali Wu, Abhinav Anand, Shweta Verma, Mira Mezini

entry.summary: First systematic analysis of what state space models learn about code, comparing to transformers. Finds SSMs outperform on syntax/semantics in pretraining but forget during fine-tuning on short-range tasks.

entry.title: Rare Event Analysis of Large Language Models

author.name: Jake McAllister Dorman, Edward Gillman, Dominic C. Rose, Jamie F. Mair and Juan P. Garrahan

entry.summary: Presents end-to-end framework for systematic analysis of rare events in LLMs, including efficient generation strategies, probability estimation, and error analysis.

entry.title: Is my model "mind blurting"? Interpreting the dynamics of reasoning tokens with Recurrence Quantification Analysis (RQA)

author.name: Quoc Tuan Pham, Mehdi Jafari, Flora Salim

entry.summary: Proposes using Recurrence Quantification Analysis to analyze reasoning model chains-of-thought by treating token generation as a dynamical system, identifying patterns of repetition and stalling.

entry.title: TrailBlazer: History-Guided Reinforcement Learning for Black-Box LLM Jailbreaking

author.name: Sung-Hoon Yoon, Ruizhi Qian, Minda Zhao, Weiyue Li, Mengyu Wang

entry.summary: TrailBlazer proposes history-aware RL-based jailbreak framework that analyzes and reweights vulnerability signals from prior interaction steps to guide future attack decisions.

entry.title: Think Proprioceptively: Embodied Visual Reasoning for VLA Manipulation

author.name: Fangyuan Wang, Peng Zhou, Jiaming Qi, Shipeng Lyu, David Navarro-Alarcon, Guodong Guo

entry.summary: ThinkProprio converts proprioception to text tokens fused with task instructions at VLA input, enabling embodied state to influence visual reasoning and token selection throughout the policy.

entry.title: Deep networks learn to parse uniform-depth context-free languages from local statistics

author.name: Jack T. Parley, Francesco Cagnetta, Matthieu Wyart

entry.summary: Studies how deep networks learn to parse context-free grammars, introducing a tractable family of PCFGs to analyze the statistics enabling parsing. Shows parsing emerges from local statistics.

entry.title: Self-Improving World Modelling with Latent Actions

author.name: Yifu Qiu, Zheng Zhao, Waylon Li, Yftah Ziser, Anna Korhonen, Shay B. Cohen, Edoardo M. Ponti

entry.summary: Proposes SWIRL, a self-improvement framework for world models that learns from state-only sequences by treating actions as latent variables, alternating between forward world modeling and inverse dynamics.

entry.title: Multi-Way Representation Alignment

author.name: Akshit Achara, Tatiana Gaintseva, Mateo Mahaut, Pritish Chakraborty, Viktor Stenby Johansson, Melih Barsbey, Emanuele Rodol\`a, Donato Crisostomi

entry.summary: Addresses multi-way (M≥3) model representation alignment, proposing Geometry-Corrected Procrustes Alignment that bridges isometric alignment for model stitching and agreement-maximizing methods for retrieval.

entry.title: Training Data Selection with Gradient Orthogonality for Efficient Domain Adaptation

author.name: Xiyang Zhang, Yuanhe Tian, Hongzhi Wang, Yan Song

entry.summary: Orthogonal Gradient Selection (OGS) addresses catastrophic forgetting in domain adaptation by shifting geometric gradient analysis to data selection rather than optimizer modifications. The method harmonizes domain performance, capability retention, and training efficiency.

entry.title: POINTS-GUI-G: GUI-Grounding Journey

author.name: Zhongyin Zhao, Yuan Liu, Yikun Liu, Haicheng Wang, Le Tian, Xiao Zhou, Yangxiu You, Zilin Yu, Yang Yu, Jie Zhou

entry.summary: POINTS-GUI-G-8B achieves state-of-the-art GUI grounding by training from a base model with minimal grounding ability, mastering the full technical pipeline for GUI element localization.

entry.title: Principle-Evolvable Scientific Discovery via Uncertainty Minimization

author.name: Yingming Pu and Tao Lin and Hongyu Chen

entry.summary: PiEvo treats scientific discovery as Bayesian optimization over expanding principle space, using Information-Directed Hypothesis Selection to evolve underlying principles rather than search fixed hypothesis space.

entry.title: Evolutionary Generation of Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Yuntong Hu, Matthew Trager, Yuting Zhang, Yi Zhang, Shuo Yang, Wei Xia, Stefano Soatto

entry.summary: Proposes EvoMAS for automatically generating multi-agent system architectures through evolutionary search in configuration space. Uses feedback-conditioned mutation and crossover guided by execution traces rather than code generation.

entry.title: PlanViz: Evaluating Planning-Oriented Image Generation and Editing for Computer-Use Tasks

author.name: Junxian Li, Kai Liu, Leyang Chen, Weida Wang, Zhixin Wang, Jiaqi Xu, Fan Li, Renjing Pei, Linghe Kong, Yulun Zhang

entry.summary: PlanViz benchmark evaluates image generation/editing for computer-use planning tasks. Tests spatial reasoning and procedural understanding through route planning, work diagrams, and device operation.

entry.title: Explaining Grokking in Transformers through the Lens of Inductive Bias

author.name: Jaisidh Singh, Diganta Misra, Antonio Orvieto

entry.summary: Investigates grokking in transformers through inductive bias lens, showing that Layer Normalization position strongly modulates grokking speed. Provides mechanistic explanations linking LN to shortcut learning and attention entropy.

entry.title: Generating Data-Driven Reasoning Rubrics for Domain-Adaptive Reward Modeling

author.name: Kate Sanders, Nathaniel Weir, Sapana Chaudhary, Kaj Bostrom, and Huzefa Rangwala

entry.summary: Proposes data-driven approach to construct reasoning error taxonomies ('rubrics') for LLM error detection. Shows rubric-based classification improves error identification in coding, math, and engineering.

entry.title: Revisiting the Generic Transformer: Deconstructing a Strong Baseline for Time Series Foundation Models

author.name: Yunshi Wen, Wesley M. Gifford, Chandra Reddy, Lam M. Nguyen, Jayant Kalagnanam, Anak Agung Julius

entry.summary: Demonstrates that a standard patch Transformer achieves state-of-the-art zero-shot forecasting performance with straightforward training protocol. Comprehensive ablation identifies key drivers: scaling and data composition matter more than architecture.

entry.title: Di3PO -- Diptych Diffusion DPO for Targeted Improvements in Image

author.name: Sanjana Reddy (1), Ishaan Malhi (2), Sally Ma (2), Praneet Dutta (2) ((1) Google, (2) Google DeepMind)

entry.summary: Introduces Di3PO from Google/DeepMind for preference tuning text-to-image models by creating diptych pairs that isolate targeted improvements while keeping surrounding context stable.

entry.title: Uniform Spectral Growth and Convergence of Muon in LoRA-Style Matrix Factorization

author.name: Changmin Kang, Jihun Yun, Baekrok Shin, Yeseul Cho, Chulhee Yun

entry.summary: Analyzes spectral gradient descent (Muon) in LoRA fine-tuning, discovering uniform singular value growth across spectrum. Provides theoretical analysis in continuous-time proving 'equal-rate' dynamics.

entry.title: Diffusion-State Policy Optimization for Masked Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Daisuke Oba and Hiroki Furuta and Naoaki Okazaki

entry.summary: DiSPO optimizes intermediate filling decisions in masked diffusion language models by branching at masked states and updating only newly filled tokens, providing fine-grained credit assignment.

entry.title: Do Prompts Guarantee Safety? Mitigating Toxicity from LLM Generations through Subspace Intervention

author.name: Himanshu Singh, Ziwei Xu, A. V. Subramanyam and Mohan Kankanhalli

entry.summary: Subspace intervention strategy for identifying and suppressing toxic patterns in LLM hidden representations while preserving fluency. Achieves strong mitigation on RealToxicityPrompts.

entry.title: SOCKET: SOft Collison Kernel EsTimator for Sparse Attention

author.name: Sahil Joshi, Agniva Chowdhury, Wyatt Bellinger, Amar Kanakamedala, Ekam Singh, Hoang Anh Duy Le, Aditya Desai, Anshumali Shrivastava

entry.summary: Introduces SOCKET, a soft collision kernel using probabilistic LSH aggregation for sparse attention that preserves relative ordering stability under token masking.

entry.title: Alleviating Sparse Rewards by Modeling Step-Wise and Long-Term Sampling Effects in Flow-Based GRPO

author.name: Yunze Tong, Mushui Liu, Canyu Zhao, Wanggui He, Shiyi Zhang, Hongwei Zhang, Peng Zhang, Jinlong Liu, Ju Huang, Jiamang Wang, Hao Jiang, Pipei Huang

entry.summary: TP-GRPO addresses reward sparsity in flow matching text-to-image models by replacing outcome-based rewards with step-level incremental rewards and modeling long-term effects within denoising trajectories.

entry.title: BrokenBind: Universal Modality Exploration beyond Dataset Boundaries

author.name: Zhuo Huang, Runnan Chen, Bo Han, Gang Niu, Masashi Sugiyama, Tongliang Liu

entry.summary: BrokenBind enables binding modalities from different datasets by leveraging multiple datasets with shared modality anchor, addressing inflexibility of existing multi-modal methods restricted to single dataset modalities.

entry.title: LAB-Det: Language as a Domain-Invariant Bridge for Training-Free One-Shot Domain Generalization in Object Detection

author.name: Xu Zhang, Zhe Chen, Jing Zhang, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: LAB-Det enables training-free one-shot domain generalization for object detection by using language as domain-invariant bridge, projecting exemplars to descriptive text prompts.

entry.title: LogicSkills: A Structured Benchmark for Formal Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Brian Rabern, Philipp Mondorf, Barbara Plank

entry.summary: LogicSkills benchmark isolates three fundamental formal reasoning skills: symbolization, countermodel construction, and validity assessment. Uses two-variable fragment of first-order logic.

entry.title: FairJudge: An Adaptive, Debiased, and Consistent LLM-as-a-Judge

author.name: Bo Yang, Lanfei Feng, Yunkui Chen, Yu Zhang, Xiao Xu, Shijian Li

entry.summary: FairJudge addresses adaptivity, bias, and consistency limitations of LLM-as-a-Judge through learnable judging policy and high-information-density training data.

entry.title: AEGPO: Adaptive Entropy-Guided Policy Optimization for Diffusion Models

author.name: Yuming Li, Qingyu Li, Chengyu Bai, Xiangyang Luo, Zeyue Xue, Wenyu Qin, Meng Wang, Yikai Wang, Shanghang Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces AEGPO for diffusion model RLHF using attention entropy as dual-signal proxy for sample learning value and exploration timing. Addresses inefficient static sampling in GRPO.

entry.title: Know Your Scientist: KYC as Biosecurity Infrastructure

author.name: Jonathan Feldman, Tal Feldman, and Annie I Anton

entry.summary: Proposes a three-tier Know Your Customer framework for biological AI tools, shifting from content inspection to user verification as biosecurity infrastructure, inspired by financial AML practices.

entry.title: How (Not) to Hybridize Neural and Mechanistic Models for Epidemiological Forecasting

author.name: Yiqi Su, Ray Lee, Jiaming Cui, Naren Ramakrishnan

entry.summary: Catalogs failure modes when hybridizing mechanistic epidemiological models with neural networks, showing robust performance requires making non-stationarity explicit through multi-scale structure extraction.

entry.title: Adaptive Protein Tokenization

author.name: Rohit Dilip, Ayush Varshney, David Van Valen

entry.summary: Presents global tokenization method for protein structures where successive tokens add increasing detail to global representation, mitigating error accumulation in generative protein models.

entry.title: Improve Large Language Model Systems with User Logs

author.name: Changyue Wang, Weihang Su, Qingyao Ai, Yiqun Liu

entry.summary: Proposes framework for improving LLM systems from user interaction logs, addressing challenges of noisy unstructured data and off-policy optimization in continual learning from deployment.

entry.title: Beyond the Majority: Long-tail Imitation Learning for Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Junhong Zhu, Ji Zhang, Jingkuan Song, Lianli Gao, Heng Tao Shen

entry.summary: Analyzes why standard long-tail learning strategies fail for robot imitation learning and proposes solutions. Reveals that data scarcity on tail tasks causes specific learning failures that re-sampling cannot fix.

entry.title: Fine-Grained Model Merging via Modular Expert Recombination

author.name: Haiyun Qiu, Xingyu Wu, Liang Feng, Kay Chen Tan

entry.summary: MERGE performs fine-grained model merging by treating components (attention, MLP) differently and generating reusable merged configurations for batch inference efficiency.

entry.title: Table-as-Search: Formulate Long-Horizon Agentic Information Seeking as Table Completion

author.name: Tian Lan, Felix Henry, Bin Zhu, Qianghuai Jia, Junyang Ren, Qihang Pu, Haijun Li, Longyue Wang, Zhao Xu, Weihua Luo

entry.summary: Introduces Table-as-Search (TaS), reformulating information seeking as table completion where rows are candidates and columns are constraints. Unifies planning, result management, and action selection for long-horizon agents.

entry.title: Optimal Learning-Rate Schedules under Functional Scaling Laws: Power Decay and Warmup-Stable-Decay

author.name: Binghui Li, Zilin Wang, Fengling Chen, Shiyang Zhao, Ruiheng Zheng, Lei Wu

entry.summary: Derives optimal learning rate schedules under functional scaling laws, revealing phase transition between power decay and warmup-stable-decay based on task difficulty.

entry.title: LLM Active Alignment: A Nash Equilibrium Perspective

author.name: Tonghan Wang, Yuqi Pan, Xinyi Yang, Yanchen Jiang, Milind Tambe and David C. Parkes

entry.summary: Develops game-theoretic framework for predicting multi-LLM behavior through Nash equilibrium analysis. Models LLM alignment as strategic choice over human subpopulations.

entry.title: DAWN: Dependency-Aware Fast Inference for Diffusion LLMs

author.name: Lizhuo Luo, Zhuoran Shi, Jiajun Luo, Zhi Wang, Shen Ren, Wenya Wang, Tianwei Zhang

entry.summary: DAWN is a training-free decoding method for diffusion LLMs that extracts token dependencies to enable aggressive parallel decoding. Addresses quality-speed trade-off by modeling inter-token semantic coupling.

entry.title: RuleSmith: Multi-Agent LLMs for Automated Game Balancing

author.name: Ziyao Zeng, Chen Liu, Tianyu Liu, Hao Wang, Xiatao Sun, Fengyu Yang, Xiaofeng Liu, Zhiwen Fan

entry.summary: Presents RuleSmith, a framework using multi-agent LLM self-play combined with Bayesian optimization for automated game balancing, demonstrated on a civilization-style game.

entry.title: User-Centric Object Navigation: A Benchmark with Integrated User Habits for Personalized Embodied Object Search

author.name: Hongcheng Wang, Jinyu Zhu, Hao Dong

entry.summary: UcON benchmark incorporates user-specific object placement habits for object navigation, with 22,600 habits across 489 object categories enabling personalized embodied search.

entry.title: Revisiting the Shape Convention of Transformer Language Models

author.name: Feng-Ting Liao, Meng-Hsi Chen, Guan-Ting Yi, Da-shan Shiu

entry.summary: Challenges the conventional narrow-wide-narrow MLP shape in Transformers, showing deeper hourglass-shaped FFN with wide-narrow-wide sub-MLPs can be competitive alternatives.

entry.title: JADE: Expert-Grounded Dynamic Evaluation for Open-Ended Professional Tasks

author.name: Lanbo Lin, Jiayao Liu, Tianyuan Yang, Li Cai, Yuanwu Xu, Lei Wei, Sicong Xie, Guannan Zhang

entry.summary: JADE proposes two-layer evaluation framework combining expert knowledge as predefined evaluation skills with claim-level assessment and evidence-dependency gating for open-ended professional tasks.

entry.title: Completing Missing Annotation: Multi-Agent Debate for Accurate and Scalable Relevant Assessment for IR Benchmarks

author.name: Minjeong Ban, Jeonghwan Choi, Hyangsuk Min, Nicole Hee-Yeon Kim, Minseok Kim, Jae-Gil Lee, and Hwanjun Song

entry.summary: DREAM uses multi-agent debate among LLMs for improving IR benchmark labeling. Achieves 95.2% accuracy with only 3.5% human involvement through agreement-based debate and targeted escalation.

entry.title: DiTS: Multimodal Diffusion Transformers Are Time Series Forecasters

author.name: Haoran Zhang, Haixuan Liu, Yong Liu, Yunzhong Qiu, Yuxuan Wang, Jianmin Wang, Mingsheng Long

entry.summary: DiTS frames time series forecasting as multimodal diffusion, treating endogenous and exogenous variates as distinct modalities. Dual-stream architecture captures inter-variate and intra-variate dependencies.

entry.title: Temperature Scaling Attack Disrupting Model Confidence in Federated Learning

author.name: Kichang Lee, Jaeho Jin, JaeYeon Park, Songkuk Kim, JeongGil Ko

entry.summary: Temperature Scaling Attack degrades federated learning model calibration while preserving accuracy. Evades detection by maintaining benign-like optimization behavior.

entry.title: POP: Online Structural Pruning Enables Efficient Inference of Large Foundation Models

author.name: Yi Chen, Wonjin Shin, Shuhong Liu, Tho Mai, Jeongmo Lee, Chuanbo Hua, Kun Wang, Jun Liu, Joo-Young Kim

entry.summary: Proposes POP (Partition-guided Online Pruning) for dynamic structural pruning during LLM inference. Adapts pruning to context with minimal overhead using partition-based approach.

entry.title: NanoFLUX: Distillation-Driven Compression of Large Text-to-Image Generation Models for Mobile Devices

author.name: Ruchika Chavhan, Malcolm Chadwick, Alberto Gil Couto Pimentel Ramos, Luca Morreale, Mehdi Noroozi, Abhinav Mehrotra

entry.summary: NanoFLUX compresses the 17B FLUX.1-Schnell model to 2.4B parameters for mobile deployment through progressive compression, token downsampling, and text encoder distillation. Enables high-quality on-device image generation.

entry.title: Cross-Modal Redundancy and the Geometry of Vision-Language Embeddings

author.name: Gr\'egoire Dhimo\"ila, Thomas Fel, Victor Boutin, Agustin Picard

entry.summary: Studies vision-language model geometry through the Iso-Energy Assumption, proposing an Aligned Sparse Autoencoder that encourages cross-modal energy consistency to analyze shared embedding spaces.

entry.title: Don't Break the Boundary: Continual Unlearning for OOD Detection Based on Free Energy Repulsion

author.name: Ningkang Peng, Kun Shao, Jingyang Mao, Linjing Qian, Xiaoqian Peng, Xichen Yang, Yanhui Gu

entry.summary: Defines boundary-preserving class unlearning for OOD detection and proposes Free Energy Repulsion to erase target classes while maintaining the model's anomaly discrimination capability.

entry.title: ECO: Energy-Constrained Optimization with Reinforcement Learning for Humanoid Walking

author.name: Weidong Huang, Jingwen Zhang, Jiongye Li, Shibowen Zhang, Jiayang Wu, Jiayi Wang, Hangxin Liu, Yaodong Yang, Yao Su

entry.summary: ECO proposes constrained RL framework for energy-efficient humanoid walking, separating energy metrics from rewards as explicit inequality constraints for intuitive tuning.

entry.title: AgentCPM-Report: Interleaving Drafting and Deepening for Open-Ended Deep Research

author.name: Yishan Li, Wentong Chen, Yukun Yan, Mingwei Li, Sen Mei, Xiaorong Wang, Kunpeng Liu, Xin Cong, Shuo Wang, Zhong Zhang, Yaxi Lu, Zhenghao Liu, Yankai Lin, Zhiyuan Liu, Maosong Sun

entry.summary: AgentCPM-Report presents an 8B parameter model for generating deep research reports using interleaved drafting and deepening. Provides local alternative to closed-source models for research tasks.

entry.title: DAVE: Distribution-aware Attribution via ViT Gradient Decomposition

author.name: Adam Wr\'obel, Siddhartha Gairola, Jacek Tabor, Bernt Schiele, Bartosz Zieli\'nski, Dawid Rymarczyk

entry.summary: DAVE provides stable high-resolution attribution maps for ViTs through structured gradient decomposition. Separates locally equivariant components to eliminate patch-level artifacts.

entry.title: From Features to Actions: Explainability in Traditional and Agentic AI Systems

author.name: Sindhuja Chaduvula, Jessee Ho, Kina Kim, Aravind Narayanan, Mahshid Alinoori, Muskan Garg, Dhanesh Ramachandram, Shaina Raza

entry.summary: Compares explainability approaches between traditional static ML models and agentic AI systems. Introduces XplainBench with 1200 instances across both paradigms.

entry.title: Prompt Reinjection: Alleviating Prompt Forgetting in Multimodal Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Yuxuan Yao, Yuxuan Chen, Hui Li, Kaihui Cheng, Qipeng Guo, Yuwei Sun, Zilong Dong, Jingdong Wang, Siyu Zhu

entry.summary: Identifies 'prompt forgetting' in multimodal diffusion transformers (SD3, FLUX) where prompt semantics are progressively lost in deeper layers. Proposes training-free prompt reinjection to fix this, improving text-image alignment.

entry.title: Modelling Human Values for AI Reasoning

author.name: Nardine Osman and Mark d'Inverno

entry.summary: Proposes the first formal computational model for representing human values, drawing from social psychology research to enable AI systems to reason explicitly about values. The model provides foundational apparatus for value-based reasoning in multi-agent systems.

entry.title: Coding Agents with Environment Interaction: A Theoretical Perspective

author.name: Nicolas Menet, Michael Hersche, Andreas Krause, Abbas Rahimi

entry.summary: Provides a theoretical framework for coding agents, formalizing selection heuristics and backprompting. Proves fuzzy functional similarity dominates functional equivalence, and frames backprompting as Thompson sampling.

entry.title: Generics in science communication: Misaligned interpretations across laypeople, scientists, and large language models

author.name: Uwe Peters, Andrea Bertazzoli, Jasmine M. DeJesus, Gisela J. van der Velden, Benjamin Chin-Yee

entry.summary: Studies how laypeople, scientists, and LLMs (ChatGPT-5 and DeepSeek) interpret generic scientific statements differently, finding that LLMs rate generics even higher than laypeople on generalizability. Reveals risks in AI-mediated science communication.

entry.title: High-Dimensional Limit of Stochastic Gradient Flow via Dynamical Mean-Field Theory

author.name: Sota Nishiyama and Masaaki Imaizumi

entry.summary: Analyzes high-dimensional dynamics of stochastic gradient flow using dynamical mean-field theory, deriving closed-form equations characterizing asymptotic behavior of multi-pass SGD.

entry.title: Evaluating LLM-persona Generated Distributions for Decision-making

author.name: Jackie Baek, Yunhan Chen, Ziyu Chi, Will Ma

entry.summary: Proposes LLM-SAA framework for evaluating how well LLM-generated distributions (e.g., simulated consumer preferences) support downstream decision-making problems like pricing. Introduces metrics to assess distribution quality based on induced decisions rather than just statistical accuracy.

entry.title: The Window Dilemma: Why Concept Drift Detection is Ill-Posed

author.name: Brandon Gower-Winter, Misja Groen, Georg Krempl

entry.summary: Introduces the 'Window Dilemma' showing that perceived concept drift is a product of windowing strategy rather than the underlying data generating process, arguing drift detection is ill-posed.

entry.title: Efficient-LVSM: Faster, Cheaper, and Better Large View Synthesis Model via Decoupled Co-Refinement Attention

author.name: Xiaosong Jia, Yihang Sun, Junqi You, Songbur Wong, Zichen Zou, Junchi Yan, Zuxuan Wu, and Yu-Gang Jiang

entry.summary: Efficient-LVSM improves novel view synthesis with decoupled co-refinement avoiding full self-attention, achieving 2x faster training and 4.4x faster inference while improving quality.

entry.title: NECromancer: Breathing Life into Skeletons via BVH Animation

author.name: Mingxi Xu, Qi Wang, Zhengyu Wen, Phong Dao Thien, Zhengyu Li, Ning Zhang, Xiaoyu He, Wei Zhao, Kehong Gong, Mingyuan Zhang

entry.summary: NECromancer creates universal motion tokenizer for arbitrary BVH skeletons across species. Ontology-aware encoder captures joint semantics and topology for cross-skeleton motion representation.

entry.title: Echoes as Anchors: Probabilistic Costs and Attention Refocusing in LLM Reasoning

author.name: Zhuoyuan Hao, Zhuo Li, Wu Li, Fangming Liu, Min Zhang, Jing Li

entry.summary: Analyzes 'Echo of Prompt' - models' tendency to restate questions - as compute-shaping mechanism. Formalizes probabilistic cost and attention refocusing effects.

entry.title: SaDiT: Efficient Protein Backbone Design via Latent Structural Tokenization and Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Shentong Mo, Lanqing Li

entry.summary: Presents SaDiT for protein backbone generation using SaProt tokenization with Diffusion Transformers. Achieves 5x speedup over existing methods by leveraging discrete latent space for structural compression.

entry.title: AEGIS: Adversarial Target-Guided Retention-Data-Free Robust Concept Erasure from Diffusion Models

author.name: Fengpeng Li and Kemou Li and Qizhou Wang and Bo Han and Jiantao Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces AEGIS for robust concept erasure from diffusion models without requiring retention data. Addresses robustness-retention trade-off using adversarial target-guided approach.

entry.title: RAIGen: Rare Attribute Identification in Text-to-Image Generative Models

author.name: Silpa Vadakkeeveetil Sreelatha, Dan Wang, Serge Belongie, Muhammad Awais, Anjan Dutta

entry.summary: Introduces RAIGen, first unsupervised framework for discovering rare/minority attributes in diffusion model outputs. Addresses blind spot in bias research that focuses only on majority attributes.

entry.title: Decoupling Variance and Scale-Invariant Updates in Adaptive Gradient Descent for Unified Vector and Matrix Optimization

author.name: Zitao Song, Cedar Site Bai, Zhe Zhang, Brian Bullins, David F. Gleich

entry.summary: Introduces DeVA, a framework that decouples Adam's update into variance adaptation and scale-invariant terms, enabling unified treatment of vector and matrix optimization. Bridges gap between Adam-style and spectral optimizers like Muon.

entry.title: MMEarth-Bench: Global Model Adaptation via Multimodal Test-Time Training

author.name: Lucia Gordon, Serge Belongie, Christian Igel, Nico Lang

entry.summary: Introduces MMEarth-Bench, a geospatial benchmark with 12 modalities, global distribution, and in/out-of-distribution splits for evaluating multimodal test-time training.

entry.title: Adversarial Learning in Games with Bandit Feedback: Logarithmic Pure-Strategy Maximin Regret

author.name: Shinji Ito, Haipeng Luo, Arnab Maiti, Taira Tsuchiya, Yue Wu

entry.summary: Studies adversarial learning in zero-sum games with bandit feedback, achieving logarithmic pure-strategy maximin regret and circumventing the Ω(√T) external regret lower bound.

entry.title: AgentStepper: Interactive Debugging of Software Development Agents

author.name: Robert Hutter and Michael Pradel

entry.summary: AgentStepper provides interactive debugging for software development agents through high-level abstractions of LLM queries, tool calls, and code modifications. Inspired by conventional software debugging.

entry.title: Pruning at Initialisation through the lens of Graphon Limit: Convergence, Expressivity, and Generalisation

author.name: Hoang Pham, The-Anh Ta, Long Tran-Thanh

entry.summary: Connects pruning-at-initialization to graphon limit theory. Proves discrete masks converge to deterministic graphons, establishing topological taxonomy for sparse networks.

entry.title: Seeing Beyond Redundancy: Task Complexity's Role in Vision Token Specialization in VLLMs

author.name: Darryl Hannan, John Cooper, Dylan White, and Yijing Watkins
