entry.summary: Investigates why vision LLMs struggle with fine-grained visual tasks by analyzing how visual information is processed and discarded. Examines visual token specialization varying with task complexity.

entry.title: Canzona: A Unified, Asynchronous, and Load-Balanced Framework for Distributed Matrix-based Optimizers

author.name: Liangyu Wang, Siqi Zhang, Junjie Wang, Yiming Dong, Bo Zheng, Zihan Qiu, Shengkun Tang, Di Wang, Rui Men, Dayiheng Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Canzona, a unified framework for distributed matrix-based optimizers (Shampoo, Muon, SOAP) in LLM training, introducing asynchronous and load-balanced partitioning strategies.

entry.title: Swap Regret Minimization Through Response-Based Approachability

author.name: Ioannis Anagnostides, Gabriele Farina, Maxwell Fishelson, Haipeng Luo, Jon Schneider

entry.summary: Develops a simpler and computationally efficient algorithm for swap regret minimization achieving O(d^{3/2}√T) bounds, improving on prior work with O(d^4√T) bounds.

entry.title: Towards Adaptive Environment Generation for Training Embodied Agents

author.name: Teresa Yeo, Dulaj Weerakoon, Dulanga Weerakoon, Archan Misra

entry.summary: Presents proof-of-concept for closed-loop environment generation that adapts training difficulty to an embodied agent's current capabilities, using fine-grained performance feedback beyond binary success/failure.

entry.title: TFusionOcc: Student's t-Distribution Based Object-Centric Multi-Sensor Fusion Framework for 3D Occupancy Prediction

author.name: Zhenxing Ming, Julie Stephany Berrio, Mao Shan, Stewart Worrall

entry.summary: TFusionOcc introduces object-centric multi-sensor fusion using Student's t-distribution for 3D semantic occupancy prediction in autonomous driving, addressing limitations of voxel and Gaussian representations.

entry.title: Instance-Free Domain Adaptive Object Detection

author.name: Hengfu Yu, Jinhong Deng, Lixin Duan, Wen Li

entry.summary: Formulates Instance-Free Domain Adaptive Object Detection where target domain data contains only backgrounds. Proposes RSCNet achieving alignment using only target background information.

entry.title: Can Microcanonical Langevin Dynamics Leverage Mini-Batch Gradient Noise?

author.name: Emanuel Sommer, Kangning Diao, Jakob Robnik, Uros Seljak, David R\"ugamer

entry.summary: First systematic study of microcanonical Langevin dynamics with mini-batch gradients, revealing failure modes from anisotropic gradient noise and numerical instabilities with proposed mitigation strategies.

entry.title: Dynamics-Aligned Shared Hypernetworks for Zero-Shot Actuator Inversion

author.name: Jan Benad, Pradeep Kr. Banerjee, Frank R\"oder, Nihat Ay, Martin V. Butz, Manfred Eppe

entry.summary: DMA*-SH uses single hypernetwork trained via dynamics prediction to generate adapter weights shared across dynamics model, policy, and value function for zero-shot actuator inversion.

entry.title: Trust Regions Sell, But Who's Buying? Overlap Geometry as an Alternative Trust Region for Policy Optimization

author.name: Gaurish Trivedi, Alakh Sharma, Kartikey Singh Bhandari, Yash Sinha, Pratik Narang, Dhruv Kumar, and Jagat Sesh Challa

entry.summary: Proposes Bhattacharyya coefficient as alternative trust region for policy optimization, providing tighter control over likelihood-ratio tails than KL divergence.

entry.title: CytoCrowd: A Multi-Annotator Benchmark Dataset for Cytology Image Analysis

author.name: Yonghao Si, Xingyuan Zeng, Zhao Chen, Libin Zheng, Caleb Chen Cao, Lei Chen, Jian Yin

entry.summary: CytoCrowd benchmark provides cytology images with both multiple annotator labels showing disagreement and separate gold-standard ground truth for objective evaluation.

entry.title: Disentanglement by means of action-induced representations

author.name: Gorka Mu\~noz-Gil, Hendrik Poulsen Nautrup, Arunava Majumder, Paulin de Schoulepnikoff, Florian F\"urrutter, Marius Krumm, Hans J. Briegel

entry.summary: Introduces action-induced representations (AIRs) framework showing that disentanglement can be achieved provably when representations model physical systems with performable experiments/actions.

entry.title: Weisfeiler and Lehman Go Categorical

author.name: Seongjin Choi, Gahee Kim, Se-Young Yun

entry.summary: Introduces categorical Weisfeiler-Lehman framework formalizing lifting as functorial mapping to graded posets. Derives Hypergraph Isomorphism Networks with provable expressivity.

entry.title: FlowDA: Accurate, Low-Latency Weather Data Assimilation via Flow Matching

author.name: Ran Cheng and Lailai Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces FlowDA for weather data assimilation using flow matching, achieving efficient and accurate analysis with single-step generation. Fine-tunes Aurora foundation model for DA.

entry.title: Rethinking Multi-Condition DiTs: Eliminating Redundant Attention via Position-Alignment and Keyword-Scoping

author.name: Chao Zhou, Tianyi Wei, Yiling Chen, Wenbo Zhou, Nenghai Yu

entry.summary: Proposes PKA (Position-aligned Keyword-scoped Attention) for efficient multi-condition control in DiTs. Eliminates redundant cross-modal attention for O(N) vs O(N²) complexity.

entry.title: Cochain Perspectives on Temporal-Difference Signals for Learning Beyond Markov Dynamics

author.name: Zuyuan Zhang, Sizhe Tang and Tian Lan

entry.summary: Presents topological viewpoint on temporal-difference learning where TD errors are 1-cochains and Markov dynamics are topological integrability conditions. Provides framework for understanding non-Markovian dynamics in RL.

entry.title: Time-uniform conformal and PAC prediction

author.name: Kayla E. Scharfstein and Arun Kumar Kuchibhotla

entry.summary: Develops time-uniform (anytime-valid) versions of conformal and PAC prediction that provide guarantees without fixing sample size in advance for streaming data settings.

entry.title: FlowConsist: Make Your Flow Consistent with Real Trajectory

author.name: Tianyi Zhang, Chengcheng Liu, Jinwei Chen, Chun-Le Guo, Chongyi Li, Ming-Ming Cheng, Bo Li, Peng-Tao Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes FlowConsist for fast flow models that addresses trajectory drift from random noise-data pairing and error accumulation by enforcing consistency with marginal velocities from pretrained models.

entry.title: Prism: Spectral Parameter Sharing for Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Kyungbeom Kim, Seungwon Oh and Kyung-Joong Kim

entry.summary: Prism introduces parameter sharing for MARL via spectral domain representation where agents share singular vector directions but learn distinct spectral masks on singular values.

entry.title: Progress Constraints for Reinforcement Learning in Behavior Trees

author.name: Finn Rietz, Mart Karta\v{s}ev, Johannes A. Stork, Petter \"Ogren

entry.summary: Proposes progress constraints to prevent RL controllers within Behavior Trees from undoing previously achieved subgoals. Combines structured domain knowledge from BTs with RL's ability to learn optimal controllers.

entry.title: Infinite-dimensional generative diffusions via Doob's h-transform

author.name: Thorben Pieper-Sethmacher, Daniel Paulin

entry.summary: Rigorous framework for infinite-dimensional generative diffusions using Doob's h-transform. Provides theoretical foundation for diffusion models beyond finite dimensions.

entry.title: compar:IA: The French Government's LLM arena to collect French-language human prompts and preference data

author.name: Lucie Termignon, Simonas Zilinskas, Hadrien P\'elissier, Aur\'elien Barrot, Nicolas Chesnais, Elie Gavoty

entry.summary: compar:IA is French government's open-source platform for collecting French-language human preference data through blind pairwise comparison. Addresses scarcity of non-English preference data.

entry.title: Halluverse-M^3: A multitask multilingual benchmark for hallucination in LLMs

author.name: Samir Abdaljalil, Parichit Sharma, Erchin Serpedin, Hasan Kurban

entry.summary: Halluverse-M³ is a multilingual, multitask benchmark for LLM hallucinations covering 4 languages (English, Arabic, Hindi, Turkish) and 2 tasks. Distinguishes entity, relation, and sentence-level hallucinations.

entry.title: Show or Tell? Effectively prompting Vision-Language Models for semantic segmentation

author.name: Niccolo Avogaro, Thomas Frick, Mattia Rigotti, Andrea Bartezzaghi, Filip Janicki, Cristiano Malossi, Konrad Schindler, Roy Assaf

entry.summary: Systematically evaluates how to prompt VLMs for semantic segmentation, introducing few-shot prompted segmentation. Finds VLMs lag specialist models by ~30% IoU on out-of-distribution data.

entry.title: PackInfer: Compute- and I/O-Efficient Attention for Batched LLM Inference

author.name: Rui Ning, Wei Zhang, Fan Lai

entry.summary: Introduces PackInfer, a kernel-level attention framework for batched LLM inference that orchestrates heterogeneous requests into load-balanced groups, reducing end-to-end latency through better GPU utilization.

entry.title: Jackpot: Optimal Budgeted Rejection Sampling for Extreme Actor-Policy Mismatch Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhuoming Chen, Hongyi Liu, Yang Zhou, Haizhong Zheng, Beidi Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Jackpot, a framework using Optimal Budget Rejection Sampling to address actor-policy mismatch in LLM reinforcement learning when using efficient models for rollout generation.

entry.title: $f$-FUM: Federated Unlearning via min--max and $f$-divergence

author.name: Radmehr Karimian, Amirhossein Bagheri, Meghdad Kurmanji, Nicholas D. Lane, Gholamali Aminian

entry.summary: Proposes a federated unlearning framework using min-max optimization and f-divergence to enable principled data removal in federated learning systems. Addresses the 'right to be forgotten' requirements while maintaining model performance on retained data.

entry.title: Addressing the Waypoint-Action Gap in End-to-End Autonomous Driving via Vehicle Motion Models

author.name: Jorge Daniel Rodr\'iguez-Vidal, Gabriel Villalonga, Diego Porres, Antonio M. L\'opez Pe\~na

entry.summary: Proposes a differentiable vehicle-model framework that bridges waypoint-based and action-based autonomous driving approaches, enabling action-based models to train and evaluate within waypoint-based benchmarks.

entry.title: Can One-sided Arguments Lead to Response Change in Large Language Models?

author.name: Pedro Cisneros-Velarde

entry.summary: Studies whether LLM responses to polemic questions can be steered by providing one-sided arguments, finding consistent opinion steering across diverse models and topics.

entry.title: Zero-Trust Runtime Verification for Agentic Payment Protocols: Mitigating Replay and Context-Binding Failures in AP2

author.name: Qianlong Lan, Anuj Kaul, Shaun Jones, Stephanie Westrum

entry.summary: Presents security analysis of AI agent payment protocols (AP2), identifying runtime enforcement gaps including replay attacks and context-binding failures in mandate-based authorization.

entry.title: Nipping the Drift in the Bud: Retrospective Rectification for Robust Vision-Language Navigation

author.name: Gang He, Zhenyang Liu, Kepeng Xu, Li Xu, Tong Qiao, Wenxin Yu, Chang Wu, Weiying Xie

entry.summary: BudVLN introduces an online framework for Vision-Language Navigation that addresses exposure bias by constructing supervision matching current state distributions. The approach tackles the critical issue of instruction-state misalignment that occurs when forcing agents to learn recovery from off-track states.

entry.title: Cost-Aware Model Selection for Text Classification: Multi-Objective Trade-offs Between Fine-Tuned Encoders and LLM Prompting in Production

author.name: Alberto Andres Valdes Gonzalez

entry.summary: Systematic comparison of zero/few-shot LLMs versus fine-tuned encoders for text classification, measuring predictive quality, latency, and cost across canonical benchmarks. Provides practical guidance for production deployment.

entry.title: HyQuRP: Hybrid quantum-classical neural network with rotational and permutational equivariance for 3D point clouds

author.name: Semin Park and Chae-Yeun Park

entry.summary: HyQuRP is a hybrid quantum-classical neural network with rotational and permutational equivariance for 3D point clouds, built on group representation theory. Outperforms classical baselines in sparse-point regime.

entry.title: Bridging the Indoor-Outdoor Gap: Vision-Centric Instruction-Guided Embodied Navigation for the Last Meters

author.name: Yuxiang Zhao, Yirong Yang, Yanqing Zhu, Yanfen Shen, Chiyu Wang, Zhining Gu, Pei Shi, Wei Guo, Mu Xu

entry.summary: Introduces out-to-in prior-free instruction-driven embodied navigation task requiring agents to navigate from outdoor to indoor without relying on precise coordinate systems.

entry.title: FloorplanVLM: A Vision-Language Model for Floorplan Vectorization

author.name: Yuanqing Liu, Ziming Yang, Yulong Li, Yue Yang

entry.summary: FloorplanVLM reformulates floorplan vectorization as image-conditioned sequence modeling outputting structured JSON, with Floorplan-2M large-scale dataset and high-fidelity evaluation subset.

entry.title: Sequential Auditing for f-Differential Privacy

author.name: Tim Kutta, Martin Dunsche, Yu Wei, Vassilis Zikas

entry.summary: Presents new auditors for f-Differential Privacy that work sequentially without requiring pre-specified sample sizes. Detects privacy violations across the full spectrum with statistical significance guarantees.

entry.title: Live Knowledge Tracing: Real-Time Adaptation using Tabular Foundation Models

author.name: Mounir Lbath, Alexandre Paresy, Abdelkayoum Kaddouri, Alan Andr\'e, Alexandre Ittah, Jill-J\^enn Vie (SODA)

entry.summary: Applies tabular foundation models to knowledge tracing for education, enabling real-time 'live' adaptation. Two-way attention mechanism attends across both time steps and other students' interactions.

entry.title: ProtoQuant: Quantization of Prototypical Parts For General and Fine-Grained Image Classification

author.name: Miko{\l}aj Janusz, Adam Wr\'obel, Bartosz Zieli\'nski, Dawid Rymarczyk

entry.summary: ProtoQuant achieves prototype stability through latent vector quantization, constraining prototypes to discrete codebook. Enables ImageNet-scale classification without backbone finetuning.

entry.title: CauCLIP: Bridging the Sim-to-Real Gap in Surgical Video Understanding via Causality-Inspired Vision-Language Modeling

author.name: Yuxin He, An Li, Cheng Xue

entry.summary: CauCLIP uses causality-inspired vision-language modeling to bridge sim-to-real gap in surgical video understanding. Combines frequency-based augmentation with causal suppression loss.

entry.title: Memory-Conditioned Flow-Matching for Stable Autoregressive PDE Rollouts

author.name: Victor Armegioiu

entry.summary: Addresses instability in autoregressive PDE solvers by introducing memory-conditioned flow-matching based on Mori-Zwanzig projection formalism. Shows that memoryless closures have structural limitations and proposes injecting compact online state into denoising.

entry.title: Pairwise is Not Enough: Hypergraph Neural Networks for Multi-Agent Pathfinding

author.name: Rishabh Jain, Keisuke Okumura, Michael Amir, Pietro Lio, Amanda Prorok

entry.summary: Proposes hypergraph neural networks for multi-agent path finding to capture higher-order interactions beyond pairwise message passing. Addresses attention dilution in dense environments.

entry.title: Soft Forward-Backward Representations for Zero-shot Reinforcement Learning with General Utilities

author.name: Marco Bagatella, Thomas Rupf, Georg Martius, Andreas Krause

entry.summary: Extends forward-backward algorithms for zero-shot RL to general utilities beyond additive rewards, enabling tasks like distribution matching without reward specification.

entry.title: AI-Generated Music Detection in Broadcast Monitoring

author.name: David Lopez-Ayala, Asier Cabello, Pablo Zinemanas, Emilio Molina, Martin Rocamora

entry.summary: Introduces AI-OpenBMAT, first dataset for broadcast-style AI music detection with realistic duration/loudness patterns. Shows existing detectors fail on broadcast audio.

entry.title: Are Deep Learning Based Hybrid PDE Solvers Reliable? Why Training Paradigms and Update Strategies Matter

author.name: Yuhan Wu, Jan Willem van Beek, Victorita Dolean, Alexander Heinlein

entry.summary: Shows deep learning hybrid PDE solvers can stagnate at false fixed points where neural updates vanish. Demonstrates training paradigm and update strategy critically affect reliability.

entry.title: Zero-shot Generalizable Graph Anomaly Detection with Mixture of Riemannian Experts

author.name: Xinyu Zhao, Qingyun Sun, Jiayi Luo, Xingcheng Fu, Jianxin Li

entry.summary: Proposes GAD-MoRE using mixture of Riemannian experts for zero-shot graph anomaly detection. Addresses geometric differences across anomaly patterns by embedding in multiple curvature spaces.

entry.title: Consensus-based optimization (CBO): Towards Global Optimality in Robotics

author.name: Xudong Sun, Armand Jordana, Massimo Fornasier, Jalal Etesami, Majid Khadiv

entry.summary: Introduces consensus-based optimization (CBO) to robotics, a zero-order method with theoretical guarantees for global optimum convergence. Compares favorably to MPPI, CEM, and CMA-ES on trajectory optimization tasks.

entry.title: TraceCoder: A Trace-Driven Multi-Agent Framework for Automated Debugging of LLM-Generated Code

author.name: Jiangping Huang, Wenguang Ye, Weisong Sun, Jian Zhang, Mingyue Zhang, Yang Liu

entry.summary: TraceCoder is a multi-agent framework for debugging LLM-generated code that uses runtime traces for fine-grained error localization. Emulates human expert debugging with observe-analyze-repair cycle.

entry.title: Robustness Beyond Known Groups with Low-rank Adaptation

author.name: Abinitha Gourabathina, Hyewon Jeong, Teya Bergamaschi, Marzyeh Ghassemi, Collin Stultz

entry.summary: LEIA improves deep learning group robustness without known subgroup labels by identifying a low-dimensional subspace where errors concentrate. Restricts adaptation to this error-informed subspace via low-rank adjustment.

entry.title: RoPE-LIME: RoPE-Space Locality + Sparse-K Sampling for Efficient LLM Attribution

author.name: Isaac Picov and Ritesh Goru

entry.summary: Introduces RoPE-LIME for explaining closed-source LLM outputs using an open-source surrogate, with RoPE-space locality kernels and Sparse-K sampling for efficient perturbation.

entry.title: Halt the Hallucination: Decoupling Signal and Semantic OOD Detection Based on Cascaded Early Rejection

author.name: Ningkang Peng, Chuanjie Cheng, Jingyang Mao, Xiaoqian Peng, Feng Xing, Bo Zhang, Chao Tan, Zhichao Zheng, Peiheng Li, Yanhui Gu

entry.summary: Proposes Cascaded Early Rejection (CER) for OOD detection with hierarchical filtering to prevent semantic hallucination where networks interpret physical anomalies as semantic features.

entry.title: Exploring Specular Reflection Inconsistency for Generalizable Face Forgery Detection

author.name: Hongyan Fei, Zexi Jia, Chuanwei Huang, Jinchao Zhang, Jie Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes deepfake detection method focusing on specular reflection inconsistency based on Phong illumination model, which is inherently difficult for generative models to replicate.

entry.title: Which Graph Shift Operator? A Spectral Answer to an Empirical Question

author.name: Yassine Abbahaddou

entry.summary: Introduces alignment gain metric connecting GSO selection to generalization bounds via spectral proxy for Lipschitz constant. Provides principled criterion for graph neural network design.

entry.title: Adaptive-CaRe: Adaptive Causal Regularization for Robust Outcome Prediction

author.name: Nithya Bhasker, Fiona R. Kolbinger, Susu Hu, Gitta Kutyniok, Stefanie Speidel

entry.summary: Adaptive-CaRe combines predictive accuracy with causal robustness through model-agnostic regularization for medical outcome prediction. Balances conventional ML optimization with causal structure learning.

entry.title: CineScene: Implicit 3D as Effective Scene Representation for Cinematic Video Generation

author.name: Kaiyi Huang, Yukun Huang, Yu Li, Jianhong Bai, Xintao Wang, Zinan Lin, Xuefei Ning, Jiwen Yu, Pengfei Wan, Yu Wang, Xihui Liu

entry.summary: CineScene uses implicit 3D-aware scene representation for cinematic video generation from multiple scene images. Injects 3D features through novel conditioning mechanism using VGGT encoder.

entry.title: Inheritance Between Feedforward and Convolutional Networks via Model Projection

author.name: Nicolas Ewen, Jairo Diaz-Rodriguez, Kelly Ramsay

entry.summary: Proves feedforward networks are a strict subset of convolutional networks and proposes model projection, a parameter-efficient transfer method that learns scalar gates per channel contribution.

entry.title: Lost in Speech: Benchmarking, Evaluation, and Parsing of Spoken Code-Switching Beyond Standard UD Assumptions

author.name: Nemika Tyagi, Holly Hendrix, Nelvin Licona-Guevara, Justin Mackie, Phanos Kareen, Muhammad Imran, Megan Michelle Smith, Tatiana Gallego Hernande, Chitta Baral, Olga Kellert

entry.summary: Introduces SpokeBench benchmark and FLEX-UD evaluation metric for spoken code-switching parsing, addressing disfluencies and discourse structures that violate standard UD assumptions.

entry.title: Trifuse: Enhancing Attention-Based GUI Grounding via Multimodal Fusion

author.name: Longhui Ma, Di Zhao, Siwei Wang, Zhao Lv, Miao Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Trifuse for GUI grounding that integrates attention, OCR-derived text anchors, and SoM-based visual markers to improve reliability of attention-based element localization.

entry.title: MeDocVL: A Visual Language Model for Medical Document Understanding and Parsing

author.name: Wenjie Wang, Wei Wu, Ying Liu, Yuan Zhao, Xiaole Lv, Liang Diao, Zengjian Fan, Wenfeng Xie, Ziling Lin, De Shi, Lin Huang, Kaihe Xu and Hong Li

entry.summary: MeDocVL is a vision-language model for medical document parsing combining training-driven label refinement with noise-aware hybrid post-training integrating RL and supervised fine-tuning.

entry.title: Refining the Information Bottleneck via Adversarial Information Separation

author.name: Shuai Ning, Zhenpeng Wang, Lin Wang, Bing Chen, Shuangrong Liu, Xu Wu, Jin Zhou, Bo Yang

entry.summary: AdverISF isolates task-relevant features from noise without supervision using adversarial mechanisms. Addresses generalization in data-limited domains like materials science.

entry.title: Sample-Efficient Policy Space Response Oracles with Joint Experience Best Response

author.name: Ariyan Bighashdel, Thiago D. Sim\~ao, Frans A. Oliehoek

entry.summary: Joint Experience Best Response (JBR) improves sample efficiency of PSRO by reusing single joint dataset to compute best responses for all agents simultaneously.

entry.title: Missing At Random as Covariate Shift: Correcting Bias in Iterative Imputation

author.name: Luke Shannon, Song Liu, Katarzyna Reluga

entry.summary: Formulates missing data imputation as a covariate shift problem, deriving importance weights to correct distributional bias in iterative imputation algorithms. Shows 7% improvements in RMSE.

entry.title: Improved Sampling Schedules for Discrete Diffusion Models

author.name: Alberto Foresti, Mustapha Bounoua, Giulio Franzese, Luca Ambrogioni, Pietro Michiardi

entry.summary: Proposes physics-inspired sampling schedules for discrete diffusion based on entropy production rate. Introduces Entropic Discrete Schedule improving sample quality.

entry.title: Vision Transformer Finetuning Benefits from Non-Smooth Components

author.name: Ambroise Odonnat, Laetitia Chapel, Romain Tavenard, Ievgen Redko

entry.summary: Analyzes 'plasticity' of vision transformer components - their sensitivity to input perturbations - and shows this perspective guides which components to prioritize during fine-tuning. High-plasticity attention modules benefit most from adaptation.

entry.title: MedMO: Grounding and Understanding Multimodal Large Language Model for Medical Images

author.name: Ankan Deria, Komal Kumar, Adinath Madhavrao Dukre, Eran Segal, Salman Khan, Imran Razzak

entry.summary: MedMO is a medical foundation model with multi-stage training: cross-modal pretraining, multi-task instruction tuning, and RL with verifiable rewards including GIoU for grounded disease localization.

entry.title: Analyzing Diffusion and Autoregressive Vision Language Models in Multimodal Embedding Space

author.name: Zihang Wang, Siyue Zhang, Yilun Zhao, Jingyi Yang, Tingyu Song, Anh Tuan Luu, Chen Zhao

entry.summary: First systematic study comparing multimodal diffusion LLMs and autoregressive models as embedding models, examining whether diffusion-based approaches can serve as effective multimodal embedders.

entry.title: Compressing LLMs with MoP: Mixture of Pruners

author.name: Bruno Lopes Yamamoto, Lucas Lauton de Alcantara, Victor Zacarias, Leandro Giusti Mugnaini, Keith Ando Ogawa, Lucas Pellicer, Rosimeire Pereira Costa, Edson Bollis, Anna Helena Reali Costa, Artur Jordao

entry.summary: Proposes MoP (Mixture of Pruners), an iterative pruning framework unifying depth and width pruning for LLMs. Demonstrates improved structured pruning on LLaMA-2 and LLaMA-3 with real speedups.

entry.title: EgoAVU: Egocentric Audio-Visual Understanding

author.name: Ashish Seth, Xinhao Mei, Changsheng Zhao, Varun Nagaraja, Ernie Chang, Gregory P. Meyer, Gael Le Lan, Yunyang Xiong, Vikas Chandra, Yangyang Shi, Dinesh Manocha, Zhipeng Cai

entry.summary: Introduces EgoAVU, a data engine for egocentric audio-visual narrations and QA, with cross-modal correlation modeling and graph-based curation. Constructs EgoAVU-Instruct dataset for training MLLMs.

entry.title: Driving with DINO: Vision Foundation Features as a Unified Bridge for Sim-to-Real Generation in Autonomous Driving

author.name: Xuyang Chen, Conglang Zhang, Chuanheng Fu, Zihao Yang, Kaixuan Zhou, Yizhi Zhang, Jianan He, Yanfeng Zhang, Mingwei Sun, Zengmao Wang, Zhen Dong, Xiaoxiao Long, Liqiu Meng

entry.summary: Proposes Driving with DINO (DwD), using vision foundation model features as unified bridge for sim-to-real generation in autonomous driving, addressing the consistency-realism dilemma.

entry.title: AnyThermal: Towards Learning Universal Representations for Thermal Perception

author.name: Parv Maheshwari, Jay Karhade, Yogesh Chawla, Isaiah Adu, Florian Heisen, Andrew Porco, Andrew Jong, Yifei Liu, Santosh Pitla, Sebastian Scherer, Wenshan Wang

entry.summary: Introduces AnyThermal, a thermal image backbone that distills representations from DINOv2 to create task-agnostic thermal features. Includes new RGB-Thermal paired dataset with 1M samples across diverse environments.

entry.title: Do It for HER: First-Order Temporal Logic Reward Specification in Reinforcement Learning (Extended Version)

author.name: Pierriccardo Olivieri, Fausto Lasca, Alessandro Gianola, Matteo Papini

entry.summary: Proposes using Linear Temporal Logic Modulo Theories over finite traces (LTLfMT) for specifying non-Markovian rewards in MDPs, enabling complex task specifications over heterogeneous data domains.

entry.title: PurSAMERE: Reliable Adversarial Purification via Sharpness-Aware Minimization of Expected Reconstruction Error

author.name: Vinh Hoang, Sebastian Krumscheid, Holger Rauhut, Ra\'ul Tempone

entry.summary: Proposes PurSAMERE, a deterministic adversarial purification method using sharpness-aware minimization to map adversarial samples toward data distribution modes while maintaining reliable test accuracy.

entry.title: HiWET: Hierarchical World-Frame End-Effector Tracking for Long-Horizon Humanoid Loco-Manipulation

author.name: Zhanxiang Cao, Liyun Yan, Yang Zhang, Sirui Chen, Jianming Ma, Tianyue Zhan, Shengcheng Fu, Yufei Jia, Cewu Lu, Yue Gao

entry.summary: Proposes HiWET, a hierarchical RL framework for humanoid loco-manipulation that decouples world-frame end-effector tracking from dynamic execution using a Kinematic Manifold Prior.

entry.title: Revisiting Salient Object Detection from an Observer-Centric Perspective

author.name: Fuxi Zhang, Yifan Wang, Hengrun Zhao, Zhuohan Sun, Changxing Xia, Lijun Wang, Huchuan Lu, Yangrui Shao, Chen Yang, Long Teng

entry.summary: Proposes Observer-Centric Salient Object Detection (OC-SOD) that considers observer-specific factors like preferences when predicting saliency, addressing the inherent subjectivity of the task using multi-modal large language models.

entry.title: Generating High-quality Privacy-preserving Synthetic Data

author.name: David Yavo, Richard Khoury, Christophe Pere, and Sadoune Ait Kaci Azzou

entry.summary: Proposes model-agnostic post-processing framework for synthetic data generation combining mode patching for missing categories and k-NN filtering for privacy protection.

entry.title: Near-Optimal Regret for Distributed Adversarial Bandits: A Black-Box Approach

author.name: Hao Qiu, Mengxiao Zhang, Nicol\`o Cesa-Bianchi

entry.summary: Establishes minimax regret bounds for distributed adversarial bandits with novel black-box reduction to delayed feedback bandits. Shows optimal scaling with spectral gap and number of agents.

entry.title: Evaluating an evidence-guided reinforcement learning framework in aligning light-parameter large language models with decision-making cognition in psychiatric clinical reasoning

author.name: Xinxin Lin, Guangxin Dai, Yi Zhong, Xiang Li, Xue Xiao, Yixin Zhang, Zhengdong Wu, Yongbo Zheng, Runchuan Zhu, Ming Zhao, Huizi Yu, Shuo Wu, Jun Zhao, Lingming Hu, Yumei Wang, Ping Yin, Joey W.Y. Chan, Ngan Yin Chan, Sijing Chen, Yun Kwok Wing, Lin Lu, Xin Ma, and Lizhou Fan

entry.summary: ClinMPO introduces RL framework to align light-parameter LLMs with psychiatric clinical reasoning using reward model trained on psychiatry literature and structured case records.

entry.title: MultiGraspNet: A Multitask 3D Vision Model for Multi-gripper Robotic Grasping

author.name: Stephany Ortuno-Chanelo, Paolo Rabino, Enrico Civitelli, Tatiana Tommasi, Raffaello Camoriano

entry.summary: MultiGraspNet predicts feasible poses for both parallel and vacuum grippers simultaneously within unified 3D deep learning framework, enabling single robot to handle multiple end effectors.

entry.title: AdaptOVCD: Training-Free Open-Vocabulary Remote Sensing Change Detection via Adaptive Information Fusion

author.name: Mingyu Dou, Shi Qiu, Ming Hu, Yifan Chen, Huping Ye, Xiaohan Liao, Zhe Sun

entry.summary: AdaptOVCD enables training-free open-vocabulary change detection for remote sensing through multi-level information fusion across heterogeneous pre-trained models.

entry.title: Degradation of Feature Space in Continual Learning

author.name: Chiara Lanza, Roberto Pereira, Marco Miozzo, Eduard Angelats and Paolo Dini

entry.summary: Investigates feature space isotropy degradation in continual learning and whether enforcing isotropy can improve plasticity-stability balance and reduce catastrophic forgetting.

entry.title: Force Generative Imitation Learning: Bridging Position Trajectory and Force Commands through Control Technique

author.name: Hiroshi Sato, Sho Sakaino, Toshiaki Tsuji

entry.summary: Force Generative Imitation Learning estimates force commands from position trajectories using generative model with feedback control. Addresses hardware-dependent nature of force control.

entry.title: Diffeomorphism-Equivariant Neural Networks

author.name: Josephine Elisabeth Oettinger, Zakhar Shumaylov, Johannes Bostelmann, Jan Lellmann, Carola-Bibiane Sch\"onlieb

entry.summary: Proposes extending neural network equivariance to infinite-dimensional diffeomorphism groups via energy-based canonicalization. Uses differentiable image registration methods to achieve this for pre-trained networks.

entry.title: Autoregressive Models for Knowledge Graph Generation

author.name: Thiviyan Thanapalasingam, Antonis Vozikis, Peter Bloem, Paul Groth

entry.summary: Presents ARK, autoregressive models treating knowledge graphs as sequences of triples. Achieves 89-100% semantic validity while learning implicit constraints like type consistency without rule supervision.

entry.title: Semantically Labelled Automata for Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning with LTL Instructions

author.name: Alessandro Abate, Giuseppe De Giacomo, Mathias Jackermeier, Jan Kret\'insk\'y, Maximilian Prokop, Christoph Weinhuber

entry.summary: Presents semantically labelled automata for multi-task RL with LTL task specifications. Enables efficient on-the-fly computation, expressive task embeddings, and reward shaping.

entry.title: Next-generation cyberattack detection with large language models: anomaly analysis across heterogeneous logs

author.name: Yassine Chagna and Antal Goldschmidt

entry.summary: Proposes two-phase framework for LLM-based log anomaly detection: Base-AMAN (3B) for log understanding and AMAN (0.5B) via distillation. Introduces LogAtlas datasets for heterogeneous log sources.

entry.title: A 26-Gram Butterfly-Inspired Robot Achieving Autonomous Tailless Flight

author.name: Weibin Gu, Chenrui Feng, Lian Liu, Chen Yang, Xingchi Jiao, Yuhe Ding, Xiaofei Shi, Chao Gao, Alessandro Rizzo, Guyue Zhou

entry.summary: Presents AirPulse, a 26-gram butterfly-inspired flapping-wing robot achieving fully autonomous untethered flight. Replicates butterfly biomechanics including body undulation.

entry.title: RanSOM: Second-Order Momentum with Randomized Scaling for Constrained and Unconstrained Optimization

author.name: El Mahdi Chayti

entry.summary: Proposes RanSOM using randomized step sizes to eliminate momentum bias in stochastic optimization. Achieves optimal rates without auxiliary sampling through Stein-type identities.

entry.title: The Representational Geometry of Number

author.name: Zhimin Hu, Lanhao Niu, Sashank Varma

entry.summary: Studies how number concepts are represented in LLMs, showing stable relational structure preserved across tasks despite task-specific subspaces. Features like magnitude/parity encoded on separate axes.

entry.title: RFDM: Residual Flow Diffusion Model for Efficient Causal Video Editing

author.name: Mohammadreza Salehi, Mehdi Noroozi, Luca Morreale, Ruchika Chavhan, Malcolm Chadwick, Alberto Gil Ramos, Abhinav Mehrotra

entry.summary: Presents a causal video editing model that processes variable-length videos frame-by-frame by conditioning on previous predictions. Uses residual flow prediction to leverage temporal redundancy efficiently.

entry.title: Continuous-time reinforcement learning: ellipticity enables model-free value function approximation

author.name: Wenlong Mou

entry.summary: Develops theoretical foundations for model-free reinforcement learning in continuous-time with diffusion processes. Establishes new Hilbert-space properties for Bellman operators leveraging ellipticity of diffusions.

entry.title: Statistical Learning from Attribution Sets

author.name: Lorne Applebaum, Robert Busa-Fekete, August Y. Chen, Claudio Gentile, Tomer Koren, Aryan Mokhtari

entry.summary: Addresses conversion prediction under privacy constraints where conversions can only be linked to attribution sets of candidate clicks, constructing unbiased loss estimators from coarse signals.

entry.title: Taming SAM3 in the Wild: A Concept Bank for Open-Vocabulary Segmentation

author.name: Gensheng Pei, Xiruo Jiang, Yazhou Yao, Xiangbo Shu, Fumin Shen, Byeungwoo Jeon

entry.summary: Proposes ConceptBank for SAM3 open-vocabulary segmentation calibration that constructs dataset-specific concept banks from target statistics to handle distribution and concept drift.

entry.title: What Is Wrong with Synthetic Data for Scene Text Recognition? A Strong Synthetic Engine with Diverse Simulations and Self-Evolution

author.name: Xingsong Ye, Yongkun Du, JiaXin Zhang, Chen Li, Jing LYU, Zhineng Chen

entry.summary: UnionST addresses limitations of synthetic text data for scene text recognition by systematically improving diversity in corpus, font, and layout to better match real-world complexity.

entry.title: Rebenchmarking Unsupervised Monocular 3D Occupancy Prediction

author.name: Zizhan Guo, Yi Feng, Mengtan Zhang, Haoran Zhang, Wei Ye and Rui Fan

entry.summary: Reformulates benchmark for unsupervised monocular 3D occupancy prediction, identifying inconsistency between NeRF training and occupancy evaluation and proposing physically consistent interpretation.

entry.title: The Law of Task-Achieving Body Motion: Axiomatizing Success of Robot Manipulation Actions

author.name: Malte Huerkamp, Jonas Dech, Michael Beetz

entry.summary: Introduces axiomatic correctness specification for robot body motions using Semantic Digital Twins. Decomposes task achievement into semantic request satisfaction, causal sufficiency, and feasibility.

entry.title: Green Optimization: Energy-aware Design of Metaheuristics by Using Machine Learning Surrogates to Cope with Real Problems

author.name: Tomohiro Harada, Enrique Alba, Gabriel Luque

entry.summary: Investigates energy efficiency and solution accuracy trade-offs when using neural surrogates in metaheuristics. Shows 70% energy reduction possible with state-of-the-art surrogates.

entry.title: Parameters as Experts: Adapting Vision Models with Dynamic Parameter Routing

author.name: Meng Lou, Stanley Yu, Yizhou Yu

entry.summary: Proposes AdaRoute, adapter-style method with MoE architecture for vision model fine-tuning. Dynamic parameter routing generates input-specific weight matrices.

entry.title: Sample Complexity of Causal Identification with Temporal Heterogeneity

author.name: Ameya Rathod, Sujay Belsare, Salvik Krishna Nautiyal, Dhruv Laad, Ponnurangam Kumaraguru

entry.summary: Studies sample complexity of causal identification by integrating time-series dynamics and multi-environment heterogeneity. Shows temporal structure can substitute for missing environmental diversity in achieving identifiability.

entry.title: From Core to Detail: Unsupervised Disentanglement with Entropy-Ordered Flows

author.name: Daniel Galperin, Ullrich K\"othe

entry.summary: Introduces entropy-ordered flows (EOFlows), normalizing flows that order latent dimensions by explained entropy. Enables adaptive compression where top variables form core representation while others capture detail/noise.

entry.title: On Randomized Algorithms in Online Strategic Classification

author.name: Chase Hutton, Adam Melrod, and Han Shao

entry.summary: Studies randomized algorithms in online strategic classification, showing the potential advantages over deterministic learners in settings where agents strategically modify features.

entry.title: Online Adaptive Reinforcement Learning with Echo State Networks for Non-Stationary Dynamics

author.name: Aoi Yoshimura, Gouhei Tanaka

entry.summary: Proposes lightweight online RL adaptation using Echo State Networks with online RLS weight updates, enabling rapid adaptation to non-stationary dynamics without expensive pretraining.

entry.title: Operationalizing Stein's Method for Online Linear Optimization: CLT-Based Optimal Tradeoffs

author.name: Zhiyu Zhang, Aaditya Ramdas

entry.summary: Shows how Stein's method can be operationalized as computationally efficient algorithms for online linear optimization. Achieves additively sharp regret bounds.

entry.title: An Integer Linear Programming Approach to Geometrically Consistent Partial-Partial Shape Matching

author.name: Viktoria Ehm, Paul Roetzer, Florian Bernard, Daniel Cremers

entry.summary: First integer linear programming approach for partial-partial 3D shape matching using geometric consistency. Addresses challenge of computing correspondences while finding unknown overlapping regions.

entry.title: Reading Between the Waves: Robust Topic Segmentation Using Inter-Sentence Audio Features

author.name: Steffen Freisinger, Philipp Seeberger, Tobias Bocklet, Korbinian Riedhammer

entry.summary: Multi-modal approach for topic segmentation using inter-sentence audio features. Fine-tunes text and Siamese audio encoders, showing gains over text-only baselines.

entry.title: CORP: Closed-Form One-shot Representation-Preserving Structured Pruning for Vision Transformers

author.name: Boxiang Zhang and Baijian Yang

entry.summary: Introduces CORP, a closed-form one-shot structured pruning method for Vision Transformers that removes MLP dimensions and attention substructures without fine-tuning using only unlabeled calibration data.

entry.title: CAST: Character-and-Scene Episodic Memory for Agents

author.name: Kexin Ma, Bojun Li, Yuhua Tang, Ruochun Jin, Liting Sun

entry.summary: Proposes CAST, an episodic memory architecture for agents inspired by dramatic theory, constructing 3D scenes organized into character profiles with complementary graph-based semantic memory.

entry.title: SVRepair: Structured Visual Reasoning for Automated Program Repair

author.name: Xiaoxuan Tang, Jincheng Wang, Liwei Luo, Jingxuan Xu, Sheng Zhou, Dajun Chen, Wei Jiang, Yong Li

entry.summary: Proposes SVRepair, a multimodal automated program repair framework using structured visual representations from screenshots and control-flow graphs to enable vision-language models to generate precise patches.

entry.title: Algebraic Robustness Verification of Neural Networks

author.name: Yulia Alexandr, Hao Duan and Guido Mont\'ufar

entry.summary: Formulates neural network robustness verification as algebraic optimization, using Euclidean Distance degree as complexity measure and introducing discriminants to characterize verification difficulty.

entry.title: Flow Matching for Offline Reinforcement Learning with Discrete Actions

author.name: Fairoz Nower Khan, Nabuat Zaman Nahim, Ruiquan Huang, Haibo Yang, Peizhong Ju

entry.summary: Extends flow matching to discrete action spaces for offline RL using continuous-time Markov chains with Q-weighted objectives, including factorized approach for multi-agent settings.

entry.title: Stop the Flip-Flop: Context-Preserving Verification for Fast Revocable Diffusion Decoding

author.name: Yanzheng Xiang, Lan Wei, Yizhen Yao, Qinglin Zhu, Hanqi Yan, Chen Jin, Philip Alexander Teare, Dandan Zhang, Lin Gui, Amrutha Saseendran, Yulan He

entry.summary: Proposes COVER for diffusion language model decoding, addressing flip-flop oscillations in revocable decoding through cache override verification and stable drafting in a single forward pass.

entry.title: PhenoLIP: Integrating Phenotype Ontology Knowledge into Medical Vision-Language Pretraining

author.name: Cheng Liang, Chaoyi Wu, Weike Zhao, Ya Zhang, Yanfeng Wang, Weidi Xie

entry.summary: Proposes PhenoLIP, a medical VLM pretraining framework integrating phenotype ontology knowledge through PhenoKG, a 520K image-text knowledge graph covering 3,000+ phenotypes.

entry.title: ForeHOI: Feed-forward 3D Object Reconstruction from Daily Hand-Object Interaction Videos

author.name: Yuantao Chen, Jiahao Chang, Chongjie Ye, Chaoran Zhang, Zhaojie Fang, Chenghong Li, Xiaoguang Han

entry.summary: Introduces ForeHOI, a feed-forward model for reconstructing 3D object geometry from monocular hand-object interaction videos in under one minute, jointly predicting mask inpainting and 3D shape completion.

entry.title: ATEX-CF: Attack-Informed Counterfactual Explanations for Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Yu Zhang, Sean Bin Yang, Arijit Khan, Cuneyt Gurcan Akcora

entry.summary: Proposes ATEX-CF, a framework unifying adversarial attack techniques with counterfactual explanation generation for GNNs, leveraging both edge additions and deletions grounded in theory.

entry.title: Toward generative machine learning for boosting ensembles of climate simulations

author.name: Parsa Gooya, Reinel Sospedra-Alfonso, Johannes Exenberger

entry.summary: Develops a conditional VAE trained on limited climate simulations to generate large ensembles for uncertainty quantification, addressing computational constraints in climate modeling.

entry.title: SPDA-SAM: A Self-prompted Depth-Aware Segment Anything Model for Instance Segmentation

author.name: Yihan Shang, Wei Wang, Chao Huang, Xinghui Dong

entry.summary: Proposes SPDA-SAM with self-prompting from semantic-spatial features and coarse-to-fine RGB-D fusion for depth-aware instance segmentation without manual prompts.

entry.title: Robust Pedestrian Detection with Uncertain Modality

author.name: Qian Bie, Xiao Wang, Bin Yang, Zhixi Yu, Jun Chen, Xin Xu

entry.summary: Introduces TRNT dataset with 8,281 pixel-aligned RGB-NIR-TIR image triplets for pedestrian detection, addressing limitations of dual-modality approaches in varying lighting conditions.

entry.title: FMBench: Adaptive Large Language Model Output Formatting

author.name: Yaoting Wang, Yun Zhou, Henghui Ding

entry.summary: FMBench evaluates LLM Markdown formatting capabilities across diverse structural requirements, targeting practical issues like broken lists, malformed tables, and inconsistent headings that affect deployment.

entry.title: Point Virtual Transformer

author.name: Veerain Sood, Bnalin, and Gaurav Pandey

entry.summary: Point Virtual Transformer fuses raw LiDAR points with selectively sampled virtual points from depth completion, examining multiple fusion strategies for far-field 3D object detection.

entry.title: MicroBi-ConvLSTM: An Ultra-Lightweight Efficient Model for Human Activity Recognition on Resource Constrained Devices

author.name: Mridankan Mandal

entry.summary: MicroBi-ConvLSTM achieves human activity recognition with only 11.4K parameters (2.9x smaller than TinierHAR) while maintaining accuracy. Designed for microcontrollers with limited SRAM.

entry.title: Target noise: A pre-training based neural network initialization for efficient high resolution learning

author.name: Shaowen Wang and Tariq Alkhalifah

entry.summary: Proposes initialization strategy using self-supervised pre-training on random noise targets. Shows noise-driven pre-training improves convergence in subsequent tasks.

entry.title: Can We Build a Monolithic Model for Fake Image Detection? SICA: Semantic-Induced Constrained Adaptation for Unified-Yet-Discriminative Artifact Feature Space Reconstruction

author.name: Bo Du, Xiaochen Ma, Xuekang Zhu, Zhe Yang, Chaogun Niu, Jian Liu, Ji-Zhe Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes SICA, a monolithic model for fake image detection across four forensic subdomains by addressing the 'heterogeneous phenomenon' where artifacts differ across domains. The approach reconstructs artifact feature spaces to be both unified and discriminative.

entry.title: Taipan: A Query-free Transfer-based Multiple Sensitive Attribute Inference Attack Solely from Publicly Released Graphs

author.name: Ying Song and Balaji Palanisamy

entry.summary: Introduces Taipan, a query-free transfer-based attack that infers multiple sensitive attributes from publicly released graphs without model access. Exploits homophilic patterns for attribute inference.

entry.title: Optimal Abstractions for Verifying Properties of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KANs)

author.name: Noah Schwartz, Chandra Kanth Nagesh, Sriram Sankaranarayanan, Ramneet Kaur, Tuhin Sahai, Susmit Jha

entry.summary: Develops verification methods for Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks using piecewise affine abstractions encoded as MILP. Provides local and global error estimates between original network and approximation.

entry.title: On the Convergence of Multicalibration Gradient Boosting

author.name: Daniel Haimovich, Fridolin Linder, Lorenzo Perini, Niek Tax, Milan Vojnovic

entry.summary: Provides convergence guarantees for multicalibration gradient boosting with squared-error loss, showing O(1/√T) convergence rate that improves to linear under smoothness assumptions.

entry.title: Calibrating Tabular Anomaly Detection via Optimal Transport

author.name: Hangting Ye, He Zhao.Wei Fan, Xiaozhuang Song, Dandan Guo, Yi Chang, Hongyuan Zha

entry.summary: Introduces CTAD, a model-agnostic post-processing framework for tabular anomaly detection using optimal transport for sample-specific calibration.

entry.title: DynaRetarget: Dynamically-Feasible Retargeting using Sampling-Based Trajectory Optimization

author.name: Victor Dhedin, Ilyass Taouil, Shafeef Omar, Dian Yu, Kun Tao, Angela Dai, Majid Khadiv

entry.summary: Presents DynaRetarget for retargeting human motions to humanoid robots using sampling-based trajectory optimization. Enables long-horizon task optimization.

entry.title: An Adaptive Differentially Private Federated Learning Framework with Bi-level Optimization

author.name: Jin Wang, Hui Ma, Fei Xing, Ming Yan

entry.summary: Proposes adaptive differentially private federated learning with bi-level optimization addressing gradient instability from device heterogeneity and non-IID data.

entry.title: SURE: Safe Uncertainty-Aware Robot-Environment Interaction using Trajectory Optimization

author.name: Zhuocheng Zhang, Haizhou Zhao, Xudong Sun, Aaron M. Johnson, Majid Khadiv

entry.summary: Proposes SURE, a trajectory optimization framework for robotics that explicitly handles contact timing uncertainty by branching multiple trajectories from pre-impact states. Shows 21.6% improvement on cart-pole balancing with uncertain wall location.

entry.title: Supercharging Simulation-Based Inference for Bayesian Optimal Experimental Design

author.name: Samuel Klein, Willie Neiswanger, Daniel Ratner, Michael Kagan, Sean Gasiorowski

entry.summary: Shows that modern simulation-based inference methods (neural posterior, likelihood, ratio estimation) can be directly applied to Bayesian optimal experimental design. Proposes novel EIG estimator and identifies optimization as key bottleneck.

entry.title: Every Measurement Has a Scale

author.name: CarolusRenniusVitellius

entry.summary: Explains concept from physics that measurements must be stable under unobservable perturbations. Argues for replacing binary questions with quantitative ones at stated scales, with applications to loss landscapes and modularity.

entry.title: Adaptive and Balanced Re-initialization for Long-timescale Continual Test-time Domain Adaptation

author.name: Yanshuo Wang, Jinguang Tong, Jun Lan, Weiqiang Wang, Huijia Zhu, Haoxing Chen, Xuesong Li, Jie Hong

entry.summary: Proposes Adaptive-and-Balanced Re-initialization (ABR) for long-timescale continual test-time adaptation based on observed correlation between label flip trajectories and long-term performance.

entry.title: Learning to Allocate Resources with Censored Feedback

author.name: Giovanni Montanari, C\^ome Fiegel, Corentin Pla, Aadirupa Saha, Vianney Perchet

entry.summary: Studies online resource allocation with censored feedback, proving Ω(T^{1/3}) lower bound. Proposes RA-UCB algorithm achieving near-optimal regret.

entry.title: RAPID: Reconfigurable, Adaptive Platform for Iterative Design

author.name: Zi Yin, Fanhong Li, Shurui Zheng, Jia Liu

entry.summary: RAPID provides reconfigurable robotics platform for rapid iteration on tactile sensing, gripper design, and sensor placement. Modular hardware with software awareness of configuration.

entry.title: OmniVideo-R1: Reinforcing Audio-visual Reasoning with Query Intention and Modality Attention

author.name: Zhangquan Chen, Jiale Tao, Ruihuang Li, Yihao Hu, Ruitao Chen, Zhantao Yang, Xinlei Yu, Haodong Jing, Manyuan Zhang, Shuai Shao, Biao Wang, Qinglin Lu, Ruqi Huang

entry.summary: Proposes OmniVideo-R1, a reinforced framework for audio-visual reasoning using query-intensive grounding and modality-attentive fusion built on contrastive and self-supervised learning paradigms.

entry.title: PersonaPlex: Voice and Role Control for Full Duplex Conversational Speech Models

author.name: Rajarshi Roy, Jonathan Raiman, Sang-gil Lee, Teodor-Dumitru Ene, Robert Kirby, Sungwon Kim, Jaehyeon Kim, Bryan Catanzaro

entry.summary: Introduces PersonaPlex, a duplex conversational speech model with hybrid system prompts combining role conditioning via text and voice cloning via speech samples for personalized interactions.

entry.title: Toward Faithful and Complete Answer Construction from a Single Document

author.name: Zhaoyang Chen, Cody Fleming

entry.summary: Introduces EVE, a structured framework for document-grounded reasoning that decomposes high-rigor reasoning into extraction, validation, and enumeration steps to ensure completeness and faithfulness.

entry.title: Private and interpretable clinical prediction with quantum-inspired tensor train models

author.name: Jos\'e Ram\'on Pareja Monturiol, Juliette Sinnott, Roger G. Melko, Mohammad Kohandel

entry.summary: Studies privacy risks in clinical prediction models, demonstrating both logistic regression and neural networks leak training information. Proposes tensor train models as privacy-preserving alternative.

entry.title: Latent Structure Emergence in Diffusion Models via Confidence-Based Filtering

author.name: Wei Wei, Yizhou Zeng, Kuntian Chen, Sophie Langer, Mariia Seleznova, Hung-Hsu Chou

entry.summary: Studies latent space structure in diffusion models through confidence-based filtering, showing class separability emerges when focusing on high-confidence noise seeds.

entry.title: Adaptive Sparse M\"obius Transforms for Learning Polynomials

author.name: Yigit Efe Erginbas, Justin Singh Kang, Elizabeth Polito, Kannan Ramchandran

entry.summary: Develops adaptive algorithms for learning sparse Boolean polynomials in the AND basis (Möbius transform), exploiting adaptive group testing to handle the coherent basis vector challenge.

entry.title: VowelPrompt: Hearing Speech Emotions from Text via Vowel-level Prosodic Augmentation

author.name: Yancheng Wang, Osama Hanna, Ruiming Xie, Xianfeng Rui, Maohao Shen, Xuedong Zhang, Christian Fuegen, Jilong Wu, Debjyoti Paul, Arthur Guo, Zhihong Lei, Ozlem Kalinli, Qing He, Yingzhen Yang

entry.summary: Proposes VowelPrompt, a linguistically-grounded framework augmenting LLM emotion recognition with interpretable vowel-level prosodic features (pitch, energy, duration).

entry.title: Uncertainty-Aware 4D Gaussian Splatting for Monocular Occluded Human Rendering

author.name: Weiquan Wang, Feifei Shao, Lin Li, Zhen Wang, Jun Xiao, Long Chen

entry.summary: Proposes U-4DGS for rendering dynamic humans from monocular video under occlusions using uncertainty-aware 4D Gaussian Splatting with probabilistic deformation and double rasterization.

entry.title: POPL-KF: A Pose-Only Geometric Representation-Based Kalman Filter for Point-Line-Based Visual-Inertial Odometry

author.name: Aiping Wang, Zhaolong Yang, Shuwen Chen and Hai Zhang

entry.summary: POPL-KF proposes pose-only geometric representation for both point and line features in visual-inertial odometry, eliminating feature coordinates from measurement equations to reduce linearization errors.

entry.title: Achieving Better Local Regret Bound for Online Non-Convex Bilevel Optimization

author.name: Tingkai Jia, Haiguang Wang, Cheng Chen

entry.summary: Establishes optimal regret bounds for online non-convex bilevel optimization, proposing algorithms achieving optimal standard and window-averaged bilevel local regret.

entry.title: Forest canopy height estimation from satellite RGB imagery using large-scale airborne LiDAR-derived training data and monocular depth estimation

author.name: Yongkang Lai, Xihan Mu, Tim R. McVicar, Dasheng Fan, Donghui Xie, Shanxin Guo, Wenli Huang, Tianjie Zhao and Guangjian Yan

entry.summary: Trains Depth Anything V2 on ~16,000 km² of airborne LiDAR data for forest canopy height estimation from satellite RGB imagery.

entry.title: Perturbing the Phase: Analyzing Adversarial Robustness of Complex-Valued Neural Networks

author.name: Florian Eilers, Christof Duhme, Xiaoyi Jiang

entry.summary: Designs Phase Attacks targeting phase information in complex-valued neural networks. Shows CVNNs are more susceptible to phase perturbations than magnitude attacks.

entry.title: Orientation-Robust Latent Motion Trajectory Learning for Annotation-free Cardiac Phase Detection in Fetal Echocardiography

author.name: Yingyu Yang, Qianye Yang, Can Peng, Elena D'Alberti, Olga Patey, Aris T. Papageorghiou, J.Alison Noble

entry.summary: Presents ORBIT, a self-supervised framework for cardiac phase detection in fetal echocardiography that handles varying heart orientations without annotations.

entry.title: Robust Online Learning

author.name: Sajad Ashkezari

entry.summary: Studies robust online learning where both data and perturbations are adversarial. Defines new dimension characterizing learnability and proves bounds for realizable and agnostic settings.

entry.title: Wild Guesses and Mild Guesses in Active Concept Learning

author.name: Anirudh Chari, Neil Pattanaik

entry.summary: Studies active concept learning comparing rational (EIG-maximizing) vs human-like (positive test strategy) query selection in LLM-based Bayesian learner. Finds EIG can destabilize hypothesis generation.

entry.title: GaussianPOP: Principled Simplification Framework for Compact 3D Gaussian Splatting via Error Quantification

author.name: Soonbin Lee, Yeong-Gyu Kim, Simon Sasse, Tomas M. Borges, Yago Sanchez, Eun-Seok Ryu, Thomas Schierl, Cornelius Hellge

entry.summary: Introduces GaussianPOP for 3D Gaussian Splatting simplification using analytical error quantification derived from rendering equation. Enables principled pruning based on visual error.

entry.title: Learning Deep Hybrid Models with Sharpness-Aware Minimization

author.name: Naoya Takeishi

entry.summary: Proposes using sharpness-aware minimization for hybrid models combining ML and scientific models. Aims to prevent ML components from ignoring physical models.

entry.title: A first realization of reinforcement learning-based closed-loop EEG-TMS

author.name: Dania Humaidan, Jiahua Xu, Jing Chen, Christoph Zrenner, David Emanuel Vetter, Laura Marzetti, Paolo Belardinelli, Timo Roine, Risto J. Ilmoniemi, Gian Luca Romani, Ulf Zieman

entry.summary: First implementation of reinforcement learning-based closed-loop EEG-TMS system that identifies optimal stimulation timing without user-specified target phases. Learns individual-specific parameters for brain stimulation.

entry.title: AS-Mamba: Asymmetric Self-Guided Mamba Decoupled Iterative Network for Metal Artifact Reduction

author.name: Bowen Ning, Zekun Zhou, Xinyi Zhong, Zhongzhen Wang, HongXin Wu, HaiTao Wang, Liu Shi, Qiegen Liu

entry.summary: Proposes AS-Mamba for CT metal artifact reduction using Mamba's sequential modeling to capture directional streak artifacts with frequency domain correction.

entry.title: Energy-Aware Metaheuristics

author.name: Tomohiro Harada, Enrique Alba, Gabriel Luque

entry.summary: Presents framework for energy-aware metaheuristics operating under fixed energy budgets. Defines Expected Improvement per Joule metric for adaptive operator selection.

entry.title: ToPolyAgent: AI Agents for Coarse-Grained Topological Polymer Simulations

author.name: Lijie Ding, Jan-Michael Carrillo, Changwoo Do

entry.summary: Introduces ToPolyAgent, a multi-agent AI framework enabling natural language-driven coarse-grained molecular dynamics simulations of topological polymers including linear, ring, brush, star, and dendrimer structures.

entry.title: Relevance-aware Multi-context Contrastive Decoding for Retrieval-augmented Visual Question Answering

author.name: Jongha Kim, Byungoh Ko, Jeehye Na, Jinsung Yoon, Hyunwoo J. Kim

entry.summary: Proposes RMCD, a decoding method for RAG with Vision-Language Models that weights outputs based on relevance to aggregate useful information from multiple contexts while suppressing irrelevant ones.

entry.title: What Is Novel? A Knowledge-Driven Framework for Bias-Aware Literature Originality Evaluation

author.name: Abeer Mostafa, Thi Huyen Nguyen and Zahra Ahmadi

entry.summary: Proposes a framework for literature novelty assessment using LLMs fine-tuned on 80K peer-review reports, grounding judgments in structured comparison to prior work via similarity graphs.

entry.title: ALIEN: Analytic Latent Watermarking for Controllable Generation

author.name: Liangqi Lei, Keke Gai, Jing Yu, Qi Wu

entry.summary: Proposes ALIEN, an analytical watermarking framework for diffusion models that derives closed-form solutions for time-dependent modulation coefficients to achieve controllable watermark embedding.

entry.title: Pragmatic Curiosity: A Hybrid Learning-Optimization Paradigm via Active Inference

author.name: Yingke Li, Anjali Parashar, Enlu Zhou, and Chuchu Fan

entry.summary: Proposes 'pragmatic curiosity' derived from active inference, unifying goal-seeking (Bayesian optimization) and information-seeking (Bayesian experimental design) by minimizing expected free energy.

entry.title: Tempora: Characterising the Time-Contingent Utility of Online Test-Time Adaptation

author.name: Sudarshan Sreeram, Young D. Kwon, and Cecilia Mascolo

entry.summary: Introduces Tempora, a framework for evaluating test-time adaptation under temporal pressure, providing scenarios, protocols, and time-contingent utility metrics for latency-sensitive deployments.

entry.title: Optimistic Training and Convergence of Q-Learning -- Extended Version

author.name: Prashant Mehta and Sean Meyn

entry.summary: Extends theoretical analysis of Q-learning stability and convergence, showing conditions under which PBE solutions may not exist or be unique, and providing convergence criteria beyond tabular settings.

entry.title: DroneKey++: A Size Prior-free Method and New Benchmark for Drone 3D Pose Estimation from Sequential Images

author.name: Seo-Bin Hwang, Yeong-Jun Cho

entry.summary: Introduces DroneKey++, a prior-free framework for drone 3D pose estimation using keypoint detection and ray-based geometric reasoning, along with 6DroneSyn, a large-scale synthetic benchmark.

entry.title: ASMa: Asymmetric Spatio-temporal Masking for Skeleton Action Representation Learning

author.name: Aman Anand and Amir Eskandari and Elyas Rahsno and Farhana Zulkernine

entry.summary: Proposes ASMa, an asymmetric spatio-temporal masking strategy for self-supervised skeleton action recognition that addresses biases toward high-motion frames and high-degree joints.

entry.title: Zero-shot Multi-Contrast Brain MRI Registration by Intensity Randomizing T1-weighted MRI (LUMIR25)

author.name: Hengjie Liu, Yimeng Dou, Di Xu, Xinyi Fu, Dan Ruan and Ke Sheng

entry.summary: Summarizes the winning approach for LUMIR25 challenge using intensity randomization and MIND-based loss for zero-shot multi-contrast brain MRI registration from T1-weighted training only.

entry.title: A Consistency-Improved LiDAR-Inertial Bundle Adjustment

author.name: Xinran Li, Shuaikang Zheng, Pengcheng Zheng, Xinyang Wang, Jiacheng Li, Zhitian Li and Xudong Zou

entry.summary: Proposes consistency-improved LiDAR-inertial bundle adjustment using stereographic-projection representation for planar and edge features with observability analysis.

entry.title: Empirical Analysis of Adversarial Robustness and Explainability Drift in Cybersecurity Classifiers

author.name: Mona Rajhans, Vishal Khawarey

entry.summary: Empirical study of adversarial robustness and explainability drift in cybersecurity ML classifiers under FGSM and PGD attacks, introducing Robustness Index metric.

entry.title: Learning Human Visual Attention on 3D Surfaces through Geometry-Queried Semantic Priors

author.name: Soham Pahari and Sandeep C. Kumain

entry.summary: SemGeo-AttentionNet models human visual attention on 3D surfaces through dual-stream architecture fusing diffusion-based semantic priors with geometric features via asymmetric cross-attention.

entry.title: DreamHome-Pano: Design-Aware and Conflict-Free Panoramic Interior Generation

author.name: Lulu Chen, Yijiang Hu, Yuanqing Liu, Yulong Li, Yue Yang

entry.summary: DreamHome-Pano generates panoramic interiors with Prompt-LLM translating constraints to professional prompts and StyleGuard-SA preserving architectural structures against style interference.

entry.title: AlertBERT: A noise-robust alert grouping framework for simultaneous cyber attacks

author.name: Lukas Karner, Max Landauer, Markus Wurzenberger, Florian Skopik

entry.summary: AlertBERT clusters security alerts by underlying cause using BERT-based representations. Handles noise from false positives and simultaneous attacks in large-scale networks.

entry.title: Exploring Sparsity and Smoothness of Arbitrary $\ell_p$ Norms in Adversarial Attacks

author.name: Christof Duhme, Florian Eilers, Xiaoyi Jiang

entry.summary: Studies how ℓp norm choice affects sparsity and smoothness of adversarial perturbations for p∈[1,2]. Introduces smoothness measures and proposes general framework for deriving smoothness from sparsity.

entry.title: Crowd-FM: Learned Optimal Selection of Conditional Flow Matching-generated Trajectories for Crowd Navigation

author.name: Antareep Singha, Laksh Nanwani, Mathai Mathew P., Samkit Jain, Phani Teja Singamaneni, Arun Kumar Singh, K. Madhava Krishna

entry.summary: Presents Crowd-FM for robot navigation in dense human crowds using Conditional Flow-Matching to learn collision-free trajectory primitives. Addresses both safety and human-likeness of robot motion.

entry.title: Clinical-Prior Guided Multi-Modal Learning with Latent Attention Pooling for Gait-Based Scoliosis Screening

author.name: Dong Chen, Zizhuang Wei, Jialei Xu, Xinyang Sun, Zonglin He, Meiru An, Huili Peng, Yong Hu, Kenneth MC Cheung

entry.summary: Introduces ScoliGait benchmark for video-based scoliosis screening with clinical priors and multi-modal learning. Uses latent attention pooling for interpretable gait analysis.

entry.title: Revisiting Emotions Representation for Recognition in the Wild

author.name: Joao Baptista Cardia Neto, Claudio Ferrari, Stefano Berretti

entry.summary: Proposes casting emotion recognition as distribution learning over emotion classes rather than single-label classification. Uses solution to derive soft labels from single-label annotations.

entry.title: SuReNav: Superpixel Graph-based Constraint Relaxation for Navigation in Over-constrained Environments

author.name: Keonyoung Koh, Moonkyeong Jung, Samuel Seungsup Lee, Daehyung Park

entry.summary: Proposes SuReNav using superpixel graphs with GNN-based constraint relaxation for navigation in over-constrained semi-static environments. Imitates human-like safe navigation.

entry.title: Perception-Control Coupled Visual Servoing for Textureless Objects Using Keypoint-Based EKF

author.name: Allen Tao, Jun Yang, Stanko Oparnica and Wenjie Xue

entry.summary: Proposes perception-control coupled visual servoing using EKF with learned keypoints for textureless objects. Integrates perception and control in closed loop for robustness.

entry.title: Parameter-free Dynamic Regret: Time-varying Movement Costs, Delayed Feedback, and Memory

author.name: Emmanuel Esposito, Andrew Jacobsen, Hao Qiu, Mengxiao Zhang

entry.summary: Develops parameter-free algorithm for dynamic regret in online convex optimization with time-varying movement costs. Achieves comparator-adaptive bounds and extends to delayed feedback and memory settings.

entry.title: The Two-Board Problem: Training Environment for Research Agents

author.name: Valerii K.

entry.summary: Proposes 'Two-Board Problem' as a training environment for research agents that must discover hidden structure from limited observations. Designed to capture asymmetric information challenges in scientific discovery.

entry.title: Joint Partitioning and Placement of Foundation Models for Real-Time Edge AI

author.name: Aladin Djuhera, Fernando Koch, Alecio Binotto

entry.summary: Introduces a framework for runtime-optimized partitioning and placement of foundation models across heterogeneous edge environments, treating model segmentation as a constrained optimization problem.

entry.title: Robots That Generate Planarity Through Geometry

author.name: Jakub F. Kowalewski, Abdulaziz O. Alrashed, Jacob Alpert, Rishi Ponnapalli, Lucas R. Meza, and Jeffrey Ian Lipton

entry.summary: Introduces Flat-Plane Mechanisms that achieve planar robotic motion through geometric constraints (sphere-to-plane inversion) without external metrology, demonstrated from micron to meter scales.

entry.title: AdFL: In-Browser Federated Learning for Online Advertisement

author.name: Ahmad Alemari, Pritam Sen, Cristian Borcea

entry.summary: Presents AdFL, a federated learning framework operating in browsers to learn ad preferences locally, enabling targeted advertising while maintaining privacy compliance.

entry.title: MTQE.en-he: Machine Translation Quality Estimation for English-Hebrew

author.name: Andy Rosenbaum, Assaf Siani, Ilan Kernerman

entry.summary: Releases first public English-Hebrew machine translation quality estimation benchmark. Shows ensemble of ChatGPT, TransQuest, and CometKiwi outperforms single models.

entry.title: Reliable Mislabel Detection for Video Capsule Endoscopy Data

author.name: Julia Werner, Julius Oexle, Oliver Bause, Maxime Le Floch, Franz Brinkmann, Hannah Tolle, Jochen Hampe, Oliver Bringmann

entry.summary: Framework for detecting mislabels in medical imaging datasets, validated on video capsule endoscopy datasets. Addresses annotation quality challenges where specialized physicians must provide labels.

entry.title: HQP: Sensitivity-Aware Hybrid Quantization and Pruning for Ultra-Low-Latency Edge AI Inference

author.name: Dinesh Gopalan, Ratul Ali

entry.summary: Proposes HQP, a hybrid quantization and pruning framework using Fisher Information Matrix approximation for sensitivity-aware pruning followed by 8-bit post-training quantization for edge AI.

entry.title: An Interpretable Vision Transformer as a Fingerprint-Based Diagnostic Aid for Kabuki and Wiedemann-Steiner Syndromes

author.name: Marilyn Lionts, Arnhildur Tomasdottir, Viktor I. Agustsson, Yuankai Huo, Hans T. Bjornsson, Lotta M. Ellingsen

entry.summary: Presents a vision transformer model that uses fingerprint images to diagnose Kabuki and Wiedemann-Steiner syndromes, achieving discrimination between these rare disorders and controls.

entry.title: Multimodal Generative Retrieval Model with Staged Pretraining for Food Delivery on Meituan

author.name: Boyu Chen, Tai Guo, Weiyu Cui, Yuqing Li, Xingxing Wang, Chuan Shi, Cheng Yang

entry.summary: Multimodal generative retrieval with staged pretraining for food delivery. Addresses modality dominance and one-epoch problems in joint optimization.

entry.title: Robust Real-Time Mortality Prediction in the Intensive Care Unit using Temporal Difference Learning

author.name: Thomas Frost, Kezhi Li, Steve Harris

entry.summary: Proposes using temporal difference learning from reinforcement learning for real-time ICU mortality prediction, arguing it reduces variance compared to supervised methods by generalizing across state transitions.

entry.title: LL-ViT: Edge Deployable Vision Transformers with Look Up Table Neurons

author.name: Shashank Nag, Alan T.L. Bacellar, Zachary Susskind, Anshul Jha, Logan Liberty, Aishwarya Sivakumar, Eugene B. John, Krishnan Kailas, Priscila M.V. Lima, Neeraja J. Yadwadkar, Felipe M.G. Franca, Lizy K. John

entry.title: iScheduler: Reinforcement Learning-Driven Continual Optimization for Large-Scale Resource Investment Problems

entry.title: MGP-KAD: Multimodal Geometric Priors and Kolmogorov-Arnold Decoder for Single-View 3D Reconstruction in Complex Scenes

entry.title: MetaSSP: Enhancing Semi-supervised Implicit 3D Reconstruction through Meta-adaptive EMA and SDF-aware Pseudo-label Evaluation

author.name: Luoxi Zhang, Chun Xie, Itaru Kitahara

entry.summary: Proposes MetaSSP, a semi-supervised framework for implicit 3D reconstruction using meta-adaptive EMA and SDF-aware pseudo-label evaluation, achieving ~20% improvement in Chamfer Distance.

entry.title: STACodec: Semantic Token Assignment for Balancing Acoustic Fidelity and Semantic Information in Audio Codecs

author.name: Kaiyuan Zhang, Mohan Shi, Eray Eren, Natarajan Balaji Shankar, Zilai Wang, Abeer Alwan

entry.title: Personagram: Bridging Personas and Product Design for Creative Ideation with Multimodal LLMs

author.name: Taewook Kim, Matthew K. Hong, Yan-Ying Chen, Jonathan Q. Li, Monica P Van, Shabnam Hakimi, Matthew Kay, Matthew Klenk

entry.title: A Fast and Generalizable Fourier Neural Operator-Based Surrogate for Melt-Pool Prediction in Laser Processing

author.name: Alix Benoit (1), Toni Ivas (1), Mateusz Papierz (2), Asel Sagingalieva (2), Alexey Melnikov (2), Elia Iseli (1) ((1) EMPA, (2) Terra Quantum AG)

entry.title: Internalized Morphogenesis: A Self-Organizing Model for Growth, Replication, and Regeneration via Local Token Exchange in Modular Systems

author.name: Takeshi Ishida

entry.summary: Presents an internalized morphogenesis model for swarm robotics that achieves growth, replication, and regeneration through strictly local token exchange between adjacent modules.

entry.title: A Multiplicative Neural Network Architecture: Locality and Regularity of Appriximation

author.name: Hee-Sun Choi and Beom-Seok Han

entry.summary: Introduces multiplicative neural network architecture with multiplicative interactions as fundamental representation, establishing universal approximation theorem and analyzing approximation properties in Bessel potential spaces.

entry.title: A neuromorphic model of the insect visual system for natural image processing

author.name: Adam D. Hines, Karin Nordstr\"om, Andrew B. Barron

entry.title: Revisiting the Sliced Wasserstein Kernel for persistence diagrams: a Figalli-Gigli approach

author.name: Marc Janthial (X), Th\'eo Lacombe (LIGM)

entry.title: Quantum Attention by Overlap Interference: Predicting Sequences from Classical and Many-Body Quantum Data

entry.title: Optimal Turkish Subword Strategies at Scale: Systematic Evaluation of Data, Vocabulary, Morphology Interplay

entry.summary: Proposes ERDF (Enhanced and Reused Feature Deep Forest) for label distribution learning with feature enhancement and reuse mechanisms to leverage label correlations.

entry.title: Topography scanning as a part of process monitoring in power cable insulation process

author.name: Janne Harjuhahto, Jaakko Harjuhahto, Mikko Lahti, Jussi Hanhirova, Bj\"orn Sonerud

entry.summary: Develops topography scanning system for power cable insulation monitoring using deep learning for surface defect detection. Combines 3D surface mapping with CNN-based real-time analysis.

entry.title: A Unified Formula for Affine Transformations between Calibrated Cameras

author.name: Levente Hajder

entry.summary: Derives closed-form expression for affine transformation between local image patches in calibrated stereo views as function of relative pose and surface normal.

entry.title: Implementing Grassroots Logic Programs with Multiagent Transition Systems and AI

author.name: Ehud Shapiro

entry.summary: Describes Grassroots Logic Programs (GLP), a concurrent logic programming language designed for distributed smartphone systems. Proposes implementation using multiagent transition systems and AI.

entry.title: Enhancing Hyperspectral Image Prediction with Contrastive Learning in Low-Label Regime

author.name: Salma Haidar and Jos\'e Oramas

entry.summary: Applies self-supervised contrastive learning to hyperspectral remote sensing imagery for classification with limited labels. Uses a two-stage approach with encoder pre-training followed by predictor training.

entry.title: ARIS-RSMA Enhanced ISAC System: Joint Rate Splitting and Beamforming Design

author.name: Xin Jin, Tiejun Lv, Yashuai Cao, Jie Zeng, Mugen Peng

entry.summary: Proposes active RIS-assisted RSMA integrated sensing and communication system optimizing beamforming and rate splitting for multi-target sensing.

entry.title: Strategizing at Speed: A Learned Model Predictive Game for Multi-Agent Drone Racing

author.name: Andrei-Carlo Papuc, Lasse Peters, Sihao Sun, Laura Ferranti, Javier Alonso-Mora

entry.summary: Autonomous drone racing pushes the boundaries of high-speed motion planning and multi-agent strategic decision-making. Success in this domain requires drones not only to navigate at their limits but a...

entry.title: A Short-Term Predict-Then-Cluster Framework for Meal Delivery Services

author.name: Jingyi Cheng and Shadi Sharif Azadeh

entry.summary: Develops a predict-then-cluster framework for meal delivery optimization using ensemble learning for demand forecasting and novel constrained clustering algorithms for dynamic service zone generation.

entry.title: Dynamic Modeling, Parameter Identification and Numerical Analysis of Flexible Cables in Flexibly Connected Dual-AUV Systems

author.name: Kuo Chen, Minghao Dou, Qianqi Liu, Yang An, Kai Ren, Zeming WU, Yu Tian, Jie Sun, Xinping Wang, Zhier Chen and Jiancheng Yu

entry.summary: Presents a dynamic modeling framework and parameter identification methods for flexible cables connecting dual-AUV systems using lumped mass methods and experimental validation.

entry.title: Claude's Bad Primer Fanfic

author.name: abramdemski

entry.summary: Author tests Claude Opus 4.6 on writing Primer-style time travel fiction and analyzes where it fails compared to the original film's narrative complexity.

entry.title: Recontextualizing Famous Quotes for Brand Slogan Generation

author.name: Ziao Yang, Zizhang Chen, Lei Zhang, Hongfu Liu

entry.summary: Proposes recontextualizing famous quotes for brand slogan generation using LLMs, arguing this balances novelty with familiarity while leveraging existing rhetorical devices.

entry.title: Advances in Battery Energy Storage Management: Control and Economic Synergies

author.name: Venkata Rajesh Chundru, Shreshta Rajakumar Deshpande, Stanislav A Gankov

entry.summary: Literature review examining the intersection of control system design and techno-economic analysis for Battery Energy Storage Systems, focusing on grid stability and revenue optimization.

entry.title: Join My New Movement for the Post-AI World

author.name: E.G. Blee-Goldman

entry.summary: Manifesto for a new social movement focused on meaning and purpose in a post-AI world where traditional work becomes unnecessary. Addresses existential questions about human value when AI handles most tasks.

entry.title: Empathy Has Outworn Its Place in Politics

author.name: Character#2736

entry.summary: Essay arguing that empathy contributes to political polarization through tribalistic dynamics. Proposes that rational discourse should replace empathy-driven political engagement.

entry.title: Donations, The Fifth Year

author.name: jenn

entry.summary: Personal reflection on effective altruism donations, questioning whether small individual donations matter when large institutional funders cover shortfalls. Expresses confusion about optimal giving strategy.

entry.title: The optimal age to freeze eggs is 19

author.name: GeneSmith

entry.summary: Argues that the optimal age for egg freezing is 19, not mid-30s as commonly recommended. Uses fertility data to show earlier freezing dramatically improves outcomes.

entry.title: Research Summary: February 08, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
A sparse day for AI research, with two notable contributions. A prompt injection vulnerability in Google Translate reveals the production system runs on an instruction-following LLM, exposing architectural choices and security implications for task-specific fine-tuning.
