entry.summary: Provides theoretical foundations for multi-modal in-context learning, proving that single-layer self-attention fails to achieve Bayes-optimal predictions for multi-modal data, while multi-layer cross-attention can provably recover optimal performance.

entry.title: Online Vector Quantized Attention

author.name: Nick Alonso, Tomas Figliolia, Beren Millidge

entry.summary: Proposes Online Vector-Quantized (OVQ) attention, achieving linear compute and constant memory while better handling long-context tasks than existing linear attention or SSMs. Uses sparse memory updates to enable larger memory states without increased cost.

entry.title: Reinforced Attention Learning

author.name: Bangzheng Li, Jianmo Ni, Chen Qu, Ian Miao, Liu Yang, Xingyu Fu, Muhao Chen, Derek Zhiyuan Cheng

entry.summary: Introduces Reinforced Attention Learning (RAL), a policy-gradient framework that optimizes internal attention distributions rather than output tokens in MLLMs. Shifts optimization from 'what to generate' to 'where to attend' for better multimodal grounding.

entry.title: VTok: A Unified Video Tokenizer with Decoupled Spatial-Temporal Latents

author.name: Feng Wang, Yichun Shi, Ceyuan Yang, Qiushan Guo, Jingxiang Sun, Alan Yuille, Peng Wang

entry.summary: VTok presents a unified video tokenization framework that decouples spatial and temporal representations - keeping spatial features of a key frame while encoding subsequent frames as single residual tokens. Reduces complexity from product to sum of frame count and per-frame tokens.

entry.title: Steering LLMs via Scalable Interactive Oversight

author.name: Enyu Zhou, Zhiheng Xi, Long Ma, Zhihao Zhang, Shihan Dou, Zhikai Lei, Guoteng Wang, Rui Zheng, Hang Yan, Tao Gui, Qi Zhang, Xuanjing Huang

entry.summary: Proposes Scalable Interactive Oversight, decomposing complex user intent into recursive decision trees to enable humans to supervise AI systems on tasks beyond their own specification/verification ability.

entry.title: First-Principles AI finds crystallization of fractional quantum Hall liquids

author.name: Ahmed Abouelkomsan, Liang Fu

entry.summary: Introduces MagNet, self-attention neural network wavefunction for quantum systems on torus geometry, discovering fractional quantum Hall crystallization through energy minimization alone.

entry.title: EMA Policy Gradient: Taming Reinforcement Learning for LLMs with EMA Anchor and Top-k KL

author.name: Lunjun Zhang, Jimmy Ba

entry.summary: Proposes two techniques for policy gradient algorithms: EMA anchor (replacing fixed anchor with exponential moving average) and Top-k KL estimator. Combined EMA-PG leads to +1.5-5% improvements on reasoning benchmarks.

entry.title: When Silence Is Golden: Can LLMs Learn to Abstain in Temporal QA and Beyond?

author.name: Xinyu Zhou, Chang Jin, Carsten Eickhoff, Zhijiang Guo, Seyed Ali Bahrainian

entry.summary: First study of training LLMs with abstention ability for temporal QA using CoT supervision and RL with abstention-aware rewards, enabling models to refuse when uncertain about time-sensitive facts.

entry.title: CoT is Not the Chain of Truth: An Empirical Internal Analysis of Reasoning LLMs for Fake News Generation

author.name: Zhao Tong, Chunlin Gong, Yiping Zhang, Qiang Liu, Xingcheng Xu, Shu Wu, Haichao Shi, Xiao-Yu Zhang

entry.summary: Reveals that even when reasoning LLMs refuse harmful requests, their Chain-of-Thought may internally contain and propagate unsafe narratives. Introduces safety analysis framework with Jacobian-based metrics.

entry.title: PerpetualWonder: Long-Horizon Action-Conditioned 4D Scene Generation

author.name: Jiahao Zhan, Zizhang Li, Hong-Xing Yu, Jiajun Wu

entry.summary: PerpetualWonder enables long-horizon action-conditioned 4D scene generation from single images with a novel unified representation creating bidirectional links between physical state and visual primitives for true closed-loop generation.

entry.title: WIND: Weather Inverse Diffusion for Zero-Shot Atmospheric Modeling

author.name: Michael Aich, Andreas F\"urst, Florian Sestak, Carlos Ruiz-Gonzalez, Niklas Boers, Johannes Brandstetter

entry.summary: Introduces WIND, a single pre-trained atmospheric foundation model using video diffusion that handles diverse weather/climate tasks without task-specific fine-tuning through inverse diffusion.

entry.title: Beyond KL Divergence: Policy Optimization with Flexible Bregman Divergences for LLM Reasoning

author.name: Rui Yuan, Mykola Khandoga, Vinay Kumar Sankarapu

entry.summary: Introduces GBMPO, extending group-based policy optimization to flexible Bregman divergences beyond KL. Hand-designed ProbL2-GRPO achieves 86.7% on GSM8K (+5.5 points over baseline).

entry.title: Multi-Head LatentMoE and Head Parallel: Communication-Efficient and Deterministic MoE Parallelism

author.name: Chenwei Cui, Rockwell Jackson, Benjamin Joseph Herrera, Ana Mar\'ia T\'arano, Hannah Kerner

entry.summary: Proposes Multi-Head LatentMoE with Head Parallel achieving O(1) communication cost regardless of activated experts, completely balanced traffic, and deterministic communication for MoE training.

entry.title: Vision-aligned Latent Reasoning for Multi-modal Large Language Model

author.name: Byungwoo Jeon, Yoonwoo Jeong, Hyunseok Lee, Minsu Cho, Jinwoo Shin

entry.summary: VaLR introduces vision-aligned latent reasoning for MLLMs, dynamically generating vision-aligned latent tokens before each chain-of-thought step to preserve visual information during long reasoning chains.

entry.title: VLS: Steering Pretrained Robot Policies via Vision-Language Models

author.name: Shuo Liu, Ishneet Sukhvinder Singh, Yiqing Xu, Jiafei Duan, Ranjay Krishna

entry.summary: VLS enables training-free inference-time adaptation of frozen diffusion/flow-matching robot policies using VLMs to steer action generation, treating adaptation as iterative latent-space optimization.

entry.title: AgentArk: Distilling Multi-Agent Intelligence into a Single LLM Agent

author.name: Yinyi Luo, Yiqiao Jin, Weichen Yu, Mengqi Zhang, Srijan Kumar, Xiaoxiao Li, Weijie Xu, Xin Chen, Jindong Wang

entry.summary: Proposes AgentArk, a framework to distill multi-agent debate dynamics into a single model's weights, making test-time multi-agent reasoning computationally efficient by converting explicit interactions into implicit capabilities.

entry.title: Revisiting Prompt Sensitivity in Large Language Models for Text Classification: The Role of Prompt Underspecification

author.name: Branislav Pecher, Michal Spiegel, Robert Belanec, Jan Cegin

entry.summary: Argues that observed prompt sensitivity in LLMs is largely attributable to prompt underspecification. Shows that providing specific instructions significantly reduces sensitivity compared to minimal task instructions.

entry.title: Delving into Muon and Beyond: Deep Analysis and Extensions

author.name: Xianbiao Qi, Marco Chen, Jiaquan Ye, Yelin He, Rong Xiao

entry.summary: Analyzes the Muon optimizer through a spectral perspective, viewing it as p=0 endpoint of spectral transformations, and proposes variants including learned neural mirror maps.

entry.title: Subliminal Effects in Your Data: A General Mechanism via Log-Linearity

author.name: Ishaq Aden-Ali, Noah Golowich, Allen Liu, Abhishek Shetty, Ankur Moitra, Nika Haghtalab

entry.summary: Uncovers a general mechanism through which hidden signals can arise in LLM training datasets that aren't observable from individual datapoints. Introduces Logit-Linear models to characterize how log-linear structure enables subliminal effects.

entry.title: Protein Autoregressive Modeling via Multiscale Structure Generation

author.name: Yanru Qu, Cheng-Yen Hsieh, Zaixiang Zheng, Ge Liu, Quanquan Gu

entry.summary: Introduces PAR, the first multi-scale autoregressive framework for protein backbone generation using coarse-to-fine prediction. Combines hierarchical structure encoding with flow-based decoding for controllable protein design.

entry.title: Theory of Speciation Transitions in Diffusion Models with General Class Structure

author.name: Beatrice Achilli, Marco Benedetti, Giulio Biroli, Marc M\'ezard

entry.summary: Develops general theory of speciation transitions in diffusion models applicable to arbitrary target distributions. Formalizes class structure and shows when trajectories become dynamically committed to data classes during backward diffusion.

entry.title: QUATRO: Query-Adaptive Trust Region Policy Optimization for LLM Fine-tuning

author.name: Doyeon Lee, Eunyi Lyou, Hyunsoo Cho, Sookyung Kim, Joonseok Lee, Jaemoo Choi

entry.summary: Proposes QUATRO, which improves GRPO-style LLM fine-tuning by directly enforcing trust-region constraints rather than relying on heuristic clipping. Claims more stable optimization with entropy-controlled updates.

entry.title: $C$-$\Delta\Theta$: Circuit-Restricted Weight Arithmetic for Selective Refusal

author.name: Aditya Kasliwal, Pratinav Seth, Vinay Kumar Sankarapu

entry.summary: Proposes C-ΔΘ for selective refusal by localizing refusal-causal circuits and distilling into weight updates, enabling safety policies without runtime intervention overhead.

entry.title: KVSmooth: Mitigating Hallucination in Multi-modal Large Language Models through Key-Value Smoothing

author.name: Siyu Jiang, Feiyang Chen, Xiaojin Zhang, Kun He

entry.summary: KVSmooth is a training-free method to mitigate hallucination in MLLMs by performing attention-entropy-guided adaptive smoothing on hidden states. Uses exponential moving average on KV cache guided by attention patterns to reduce semantic drift during decoding.

entry.title: Laminating Representation Autoencoders for Efficient Diffusion

author.name: Ram\'on Calvo-Gonz\'alez, Fran\c{c}ois Fleuret

entry.summary: FlatDINO compresses SSL patch features into 32 continuous tokens via variational autoencoder, achieving 8x fewer FLOPs for diffusion on ImageNet with 1.80 gFID using DiT-XL.

entry.title: Efficient Long-Horizon Vision-Language-Action Models via Static-Dynamic Disentanglement

author.name: Weikang Qiu, Tinglin Huang, Aosong Feng, Rex Ying

entry.summary: SD-VLA improves VLA efficiency by disentangling visual inputs into static and dynamic components across multiple levels, exploiting the observation that much visual information remains static across trajectory timesteps.

entry.title: GOPO: Policy Optimization using Ranked Rewards

author.name: Kyuseong Choi, Dwaipayan Saha, Woojeong Kim, Anish Agarwal, Raaz Dwivedi

entry.summary: Proposes GOPO (Group Ordinal Policy Optimization) using only reward rankings rather than magnitudes for policy optimization, addressing misalignment between pairwise preference training and absolute reward usage.

entry.title: UnMaskFork: Test-Time Scaling for Masked Diffusion via Deterministic Action Branching

author.name: Kou Misaki, Takuya Akiba

entry.summary: Introduces UnMaskFork (UMF), applying Monte Carlo Tree Search to Masked Diffusion Language Models for test-time scaling. Uses deterministic partial unmasking actions to explore the search space.

entry.title: Addressing Corpus Knowledge Poisoning Attacks on RAG Using Sparse Attention

author.name: Sagie Dekel, Moshe Tennenholtz, Oren Kurland

entry.summary: Introduces SDAG (Sparse Document Attention RAG), a block-sparse attention mechanism defending against corpus knowledge poisoning attacks by disallowing cross-attention between retrieved documents.

entry.title: CoWTracker: Tracking by Warping instead of Correlation

author.name: Zihang Lai, Eldar Insafutdinov, Edgar Sucar, Andrea Vedaldi

entry.summary: CoWTracker proposes dense point tracking via warping rather than correlation, achieving linear complexity in spatial resolution by iteratively warping features from target to query frame based on current estimates.

entry.title: WideSeek-R1: Exploring Width Scaling for Broad Information Seeking via Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zelai Xu, Zhexuan Xu, Ruize Zhang, Chunyang Zhu, Shi Yu, Weilin Liu, Quanlu Zhang, Wenbo Ding, Chao Yu, Yu Wang

entry.summary: Explores width scaling via multi-agent RL for broad information seeking, proposing WideSeek-R1 with lead-agent-subagent framework that enables parallel execution and scalable orchestration.

entry.title: Thickening-to-Thinning: Reward Shaping via Human-Inspired Learning Dynamics for LLM Reasoning

author.name: Wenze Lin, Zhen Yang, Xitai Jiang, Pony Ma, Gao Huang

entry.summary: Introduces T2T (Thickening-to-Thinning), a dynamic reward framework for LLM reasoning inspired by human learning. Incentivizes exploration on incorrect attempts and efficiency on mastered knowledge.

entry.title: Rethinking the Design Space of Reinforcement Learning for Diffusion Models: On the Importance of Likelihood Estimation Beyond Loss Design

author.name: Jaemoo Choi, Yuchen Zhu, Wei Guo, Petr Molodyk, Bo Yuan, Jinbin Bai, Yi Xin, Molei Tao, Yongxin Chen

entry.summary: Provides systematic analysis of RL design space for diffusion models in visual tasks, disentangling policy-gradient objectives, likelihood estimators, and rollout sampling schedules.

entry.title: It's not a Lottery, it's a Race: Understanding How Gradient Descent Adapts the Network's Capacity to the Task

author.name: Hannah Pinson

entry.summary: Identifies three dynamical principles (mutual alignment, unlocking, racing) governing how gradient descent adapts neural network capacity to tasks. Explains success of neuron merging and weight pruning post-training.

entry.title: The Illusion of Generalization: Re-examining Tabular Language Model Evaluation

author.name: Aditya Gorla, Ratish Puduppully

entry.summary: Re-evaluates Tabular Language Models finding that strong performance is driven entirely by quartile classification tasks, with binary/categorical achieving near-zero lift. Reveals pervasive train-test contamination including complete overlap.

entry.title: MaMa: A Game-Theoretic Approach for Designing Safe Agentic Systems

author.name: Jonathan N\"other, Adish Singla, Goran Radanovic

entry.summary: Introduces MaMa, framing agentic system safety as a Stackelberg security game between a system designer and adversary who compromises agent subsets. Uses LLM-based adversarial search to automatically design safe multi-agent systems.

entry.title: Gradient Flow Through Diagram Expansions: Learning Regimes and Explicit Solutions

author.name: Dmitry Yarotsky, Eugene Golikov, Yaroslav Gusev

entry.summary: Develops mathematical framework for analyzing gradient flow in large learning problems using Feynman-like diagram expansions. Identifies distinct learning regimes (lazy, rich, mean-field) with explicit analytic solutions for tensor decomposition.

entry.title: SAFE: Stable Alignment Finetuning with Entropy-Aware Predictive Control for RLHF

author.name: Dipan Maity

entry.summary: SAFE proposes a new RLHF algorithm combining Double Soft-Min Critic with multi-layer stabilization to address PPO's issues with reward oscillations, entropy collapse, and policy divergence.

entry.title: Scaling Agentic Verifier for Competitive Coding

author.name: Zeyao Ma, Jing Zhang, Xiaokang Zhang, Jiaxi Yang, Zongmeng Zhang, Jiajun Zhang, Yuheng Jing, Lei Zhang, Hao Zheng, Wenting Zhao, Junyang Lin, Binyuan Hui

entry.summary: Proposes Agentic Verifier for competitive coding that actively reasons about program behaviors and searches for discriminative test inputs through multi-turn interaction with execution environments.

entry.title: Seg-ReSearch: Segmentation with Interleaved Reasoning and External Search

author.name: Tianming Liang, Qirui Du, Jian-Fang Hu, Haichao Jiang, Zicheng Lin, Wei-Shi Zheng

entry.summary: Seg-ReSearch enables segmentation with interleaved reasoning and external search, overcoming the frozen knowledge limitations of MLLMs by dynamically retrieving up-to-date or domain-specific information during segmentation.

entry.title: AGILE: Hand-Object Interaction Reconstruction from Video via Agentic Generation

author.name: Jin-Chuan Shi, Binhong Ye, Tao Liu, Junzhe He, Yangjinhui Xu, Xiaoyang Liu, Zeju Li, Hao Chen, Chunhua Shen

entry.summary: AGILE shifts hand-object interaction reconstruction from reconstruction to agentic generation, using VLM-guided generative synthesis of watertight CAD models and sim-to-real refinement for robust in-the-wild performance.

entry.title: VISTA-Bench: Do Vision-Language Models Really Understand Visualized Text as Well as Pure Text?

author.name: Qing'an Liu, Juntong Feng, Yuhao Wang, Xinzhe Han, Yujie Cheng, Yue Zhu, Haiwen Diao, Yunzhi Zhuge, Huchuan Lu

entry.summary: VISTA-Bench systematically evaluates VLM understanding of visualized text versus pure text, revealing significant modality gap where models perform well on text queries but struggle with the same content rendered as images.

entry.title: Group-Evolving Agents: Open-Ended Self-Improvement via Experience Sharing

author.name: Zhaotian Weng, Antonis Antoniades, Deepak Nathani, Zhen Zhang, Xiao Pu, Xin Eric Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Group-Evolving Agents (GEA), a paradigm for open-ended self-improvement where agent groups share experiences across evolutionary branches, overcoming isolated tree-structured evolution limitations.

entry.title: DeFrame: Debiasing Large Language Models Against Framing Effects

author.name: Kahee Lim, Soyeon Kim, Steven Euijong Whang

entry.summary: Identifies framing (how semantically equivalent prompts are expressed) as an underexplored contributor to hidden bias in LLMs. Introduces 'framing disparity' metric and shows fairness scores can vary up to 18% due to framing.

entry.title: Identifying Intervenable and Interpretable Features via Orthogonality Regularization

author.name: Moritz Miller, Florent Draye, Bernhard Sch\"olkopf

entry.summary: Shows that orthogonality regularization during SAE fine-tuning disentangles decoder features, leading to identifiable and more interpretable features amenable to causal intervention.

entry.title: SpatiaLab: Can Vision-Language Models Perform Spatial Reasoning in the Wild?

author.name: Azmine Toushik Wasi, Wahid Faisal, Abdur Rahman, Mahfuz Ahmed Anik, Munem Shahriar, Mohsin Mahmud Topu, Sadia Tasnim Meem, Rahatun Nesa Priti, Sabrina Afroz Mitu, Md. Iqramul Hoque, Shahriyar Zaman Ridoy, Mohammed Eunus Ali, Majd Hawasly, Mohammad Raza, Md Rizwan Parvez

entry.summary: SpatiaLab benchmarks VLM spatial reasoning with 1,400 QA pairs across six categories including relative positioning, depth, orientation, and 3D geometry in realistic unconstrained contexts.

entry.title: Horizon-LM: A RAM-Centric Architecture for LLM Training

author.name: Zhengqing Yuan (Fanny), Lichao Sun (Fanny), Yanfang (Fanny), Ye

entry.summary: Proposes Horizon-LM, a RAM-centric architecture for LLM training that enables full fine-tuning of 70B+ models on single GPU by hosting model in RAM with streaming layer computation.

entry.title: Scaling In-Context Online Learning Capability of LLMs via Cross-Episode Meta-RL

author.name: Xiaofeng Lin, Sirou Zhu, Yilei Chen, Mingyu Chen, Hejian Sang, Ioannis Paschalidis, Zhipeng Wang, Aldo Pacchiano, Xuezhou Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces ORBIT, a meta-RL framework that trains LLMs for in-context online learning by generating multi-task, multi-episode training data where models must balance exploration and exploitation.

entry.title: From Dead Neurons to Deep Approximators: Deep Bernstein Networks as a Provable Alternative to Residual Layers

author.name: Ibrahim Albool, Malak Gamal El-Din, Salma Elmalaki, Yasser Shoukry

entry.summary: Shows that Deep Bernstein Networks using Bernstein polynomials as activations can replace residual connections while improving trainability. Reduces dead neurons from 90% to under 1% in deep networks.

entry.title: Med-MMFL: A Multimodal Federated Learning Benchmark in Healthcare

author.name: Aavash Chhetri, Bibek Niroula, Pratik Shrestha, Yash Raj Shrestha, Lesley A Anderson, Prashnna K Gyawali, Loris Bazzani, Binod Bhattarai

entry.summary: Introduces Med-MMFL, the first comprehensive multimodal federated learning benchmark for healthcare, encompassing diverse modalities, tasks, and federation scenarios with evaluation of six FL algorithms.

entry.title: SE-Bench: Benchmarking Self-Evolution with Knowledge Internalization

author.name: Jiarui Yuan, Tailin Jin, Weize Chen, Zeyuan Liu, Zhiyuan Liu, Maosong Sun

entry.summary: Introduces SE-Bench for measuring agent self-evolution capabilities by obfuscating NumPy into a pseudo-novel package. Tests whether agents can internalize new knowledge without access to documentation.

entry.title: Stroke Lesions as a Rosetta Stone for Language Model Interpretability

author.name: Julius Fridriksson (University of South Carolina, ALLT.AI, LLC), Roger D. Newman-Norlund (University of South Carolina, ALLT.AI, LLC), Saeed Ahmadi (University of South Carolina), Regan Willis (University of South Carolina, Department of Computer Science and Engineering), Nadra Salman (University of South Carolina, Linguistics Program), Kalil Warren (University of South Carolina, Linguistics Program), Xiang Guan (University of South Carolina, Department of Computer Science and Engineering), Yong Yang (University of South Carolina, Department of Computer Science and Engineering), Srihari Nelakuditi (University of South Carolina, Department of Computer Science and Engineering), Rutvik Desai (Department of Psychology, University of South Carolina), Leonardo Bonilha (Department of Neurology, USC School of Medicine), Jeff Charney (ALLT.AI, LLC, MKHSTRY, LLC), Chris Rorden (Department of Psychology, University of South Carolina)

entry.summary: Introduces BLUM, using brain lesion-symptom mapping data from stroke patients as external validation for LLM interpretability. Maps perturbation effects in transformers to corresponding brain damage patterns.

entry.title: Synthesizable Molecular Generation via Soft-constrained GFlowNets with Rich Chemical Priors

author.name: Hyeonah Kim, Minsu Kim, Celine Roget, Dionessa Biton, Louis Vaillancourt, Yves V. Brun, Yoshua Bengio, Alex Hernandez-Garcia

entry.summary: Proposes S3-GFN for synthesizable molecule generation using soft-constrained GFlowNets with molecular priors from large SMILES corpora. Alternative to hard-coded reaction template approaches.

entry.title: BPDQ: Bit-Plane Decomposition Quantization on a Variable Grid for Large Language Models

author.name: Junyu Chen, Jungang Li, Jing Xiong, Wenjie Wang, Qingyao Yang, He Xiao, Zhen Li, Taiqiang Wu, Mengzhao Chen, Zhen Peng, Chaofan Tao, Long Shi, Hongxia Yang, Ngai Wong

entry.summary: Proposes BPDQ, a novel quantization method for LLMs using bit-plane decomposition to create variable quantization grids rather than fixed uniform intervals. Uses approximate second-order information for iterative refinement.

entry.title: MirrorLA: Reflecting Feature Map for Vision Linear Attention

author.name: Weikang Meng, Liangyu Huo, Yadan Luo, Yaowei Wang, Yingjian Li, Zheng Zhang

entry.summary: Identifies non-negativity constraint in linear attention as root cause of performance degradation. Proposes MirrorLA using learnable Householder reflections to rotate features into non-negative orthant while preserving information.

entry.title: Decomposing Query-Key Feature Interactions Using Contrastive Covariances

author.name: Andrew Lee, Yonatan Belinkov, Fernanda Vi\'egas, Martin Wattenberg

entry.summary: Presents a contrastive covariance method to decompose transformer query-key space into interpretable low-rank components, revealing how attention scores emerge from feature alignment in subspaces.

entry.title: Likelihood-Based Reward Designs for General LLM Reasoning

author.name: Ariel Kwiatkowski, Natasha Butt, Ismail Labiad, Julia Kempe, Yann Ollivier

entry.summary: Systematically investigates likelihood-based rewards for LLM reasoning fine-tuning, comparing variants against binary rewards. Finds these scale-agnostic rewards don't require task-specific verifiers and work across benchmarks.

entry.title: Adaptive 1D Video Diffusion Autoencoder

author.name: Yao Teng, Minxuan Lin, Xian Liu, Shuai Wang, Xiao Yang, Xihui Liu

entry.summary: One-DVA introduces a transformer-based video autoencoder with adaptive 1D encoding and diffusion-based decoding, addressing fixed-rate compression, inflexible architectures, and deterministic decoder limitations in existing video autoencoders.

entry.title: ImmuVis: Hyperconvolutional Foundation Model for Imaging Mass Cytometry

author.name: Marcin Mo\.zejko, Dawid Uchal, Krzysztof Gogolewski, Piotr Kupidura, Szymon {\L}ukasik, Jakub Giezga{\l}a, Tomasz Noco\'n, Kacper Pietrzyk, Robert Pieniuta, Mateusz Sulimowicz, Michal Orzy{\l}owski, Tomasz Si{\l}kowski, Karol Zagr\'odka, Eike Staub, Ewa Szczurek

entry.summary: ImmuVis introduces hyperconvolutional foundation model for imaging mass cytometry that generates convolutional kernels from learned marker embeddings, enabling operation on arbitrary marker subsets without retraining.

entry.title: Light Forcing: Accelerating Autoregressive Video Diffusion via Sparse Attention

author.name: Chengtao Lv, Yumeng Shi, Yushi Huang, Ruihao Gong, Shen Ren, Wenya Wang

entry.summary: Light Forcing introduces the first sparse attention solution for autoregressive video generation, using Chunk-Aware Growth mechanism to estimate frame contribution and efficiently utilize past context.

entry.title: GeneralVLA: Generalizable Vision-Language-Action Models with Knowledge-Guided Trajectory Planning

author.name: Guoqing Ma, Siheng Wang, Zeyu Zhang, Shan Yu, Hao Tang

entry.summary: GeneralVLA proposes hierarchical VLA model for zero-shot manipulation with knowledge-guided trajectory planning, using foundation model generalization for both task planning and automatic data generation.

entry.title: Modular Safety Guardrails Are Necessary for Foundation-Model-Enabled Robots in the Real World

author.name: Joonkyung Kim, Wenxi Chen, Davood Soleymanzadeh, Yi Ding, Xiangbo Gao, Zhengzhong Tu, Ruqi Zhang, Fan Fei, Sushant Veer, Yiwei Lyu, Minghui Zheng, Yan Gu

entry.summary: Argues for modular safety guardrails for foundation-model-enabled robots, characterizing safety along three dimensions: action safety (physical feasibility), decision safety (semantic appropriateness), and human-centered safety (conformance to intent/norms).

entry.title: Byzantine Machine Learning: MultiKrum and an optimal notion of robustness

author.name: Gilles Bareilles, Wassim Bouaziz, Julien Fageot, El-Mahdi El-Mhamdi

entry.summary: Provides first proof that MultiKrum is a robust aggregation rule in Byzantine-tolerant distributed learning, introducing optimal robustness coefficient κ* and bounding MultiKrum's robustness.

entry.title: How Few-shot Demonstrations Affect Prompt-based Defenses Against LLM Jailbreak Attacks

author.name: Yanshu Wang, Shuaishuai Yang, Jingjing He, Tong Yang

entry.summary: Comprehensively evaluates how few-shot demonstrations affect prompt-based defenses against jailbreak attacks. Discovers opposite effects on Role-Oriented vs Task-Oriented prompts across multiple LLMs and safety benchmarks.

entry.title: Discovering Mechanistic Models of Neural Activity: System Identification in an in Silico Zebrafish

author.name: Jan-Matthis Lueckmann, Viren Jain, Micha{\l} Januszewski

entry.summary: Uses LLM-based tree search to discover mechanistic models of neural circuits in simulated zebrafish. Finds structural priors essential for out-of-distribution generalization and interpretable model recovery.

entry.title: The Key to State Reduction in Linear Attention: A Rank-based Perspective

author.name: Philipp Nazari, T. Konstantin Rusch

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis showing trained linear attention exhibits low-rank structure affecting retrieval error. Proposes hardware-aware state compression method achieving faster and more memory-efficient models.

entry.title: Fine-Grained Activation Steering: Steering Less, Achieving More

author.name: Zijian Feng, Tianjiao Li, Zixiao Zhu, Hanzhang Zhou, Junlang Qian, Li Zhang, Jia Jim Deryl Chua, Lee Onn Mak, Gee Wah Ng, Kezhi Mao

entry.summary: Introduces fine-grained activation steering at atomic unit level rather than block level, revealing heterogeneity in activations and enabling more efficient, less intrusive behavioral modification.

entry.title: PIO-FVLM: Rethinking Training-Free Visual Token Reduction for VLM Acceleration from an Inference-Objective Perspective

author.name: Haokui Zhang, Congyang Ou, Dawei Yan, Peng Wang, Qingsen Yan, Ying Li, Rong Xiao, Chunhua Shen

entry.summary: PIO-FVLM transforms visual token compression into preserving output invariance, using token-level gradient saliency from layer-local proxy loss to reorder tokens by importance to inference objectives.

entry.title: LoRDO: Distributed Low-Rank Optimization with Infrequent Communication

author.name: Andrej Jovanovi\'c, Alex Iacob, Mher Safaryan, Ionut-Vlad Modoranu, Lorenzo Sani, William F. Shen, Xinchi Qiu, Dan Alistarh, Nicholas D. Lane

entry.summary: Proposes LoRDO, a framework unifying low-rank optimization with infrequent synchronization for distributed training of foundation models, addressing bandwidth limitations in DDP.

entry.title: Overstating Attitudes, Ignoring Networks: LLM Biases in Simulating Misinformation Susceptibility

author.name: Eun Cheol Choi, Lindsay E. Young, Emilio Ferrara

entry.summary: Shows LLM-simulated survey respondents overstate attitudinal effects and ignore network features when reproducing patterns of misinformation susceptibility, revealing systematic biases in LLM social simulations.

entry.title: Proxy Compression for Language Modeling

author.name: Lin Zheng, Xinyu Li, Qian Liu, Xiachong Feng, Lingpeng Kong

entry.summary: Introduces proxy compression for language models that trains on both raw bytes and compressed views, enabling end-to-end byte interface at inference while maintaining compressed input efficiency.

entry.title: Inference-Time Reasoning Selectively Reduces Implicit Social Bias in Large Language Models

author.name: Molly Apsel, Michael N. Jones

entry.summary: Finds that enabling inference-time reasoning significantly reduces implicit bias in LLMs on IAT-like tasks, while explicit bias remains unaffected, connecting to dual-process cognitive theories.

entry.title: HY3D-Bench: Generation of 3D Assets

author.name: Team Hunyuan3D, :, Bowen Zhang, Chunchao Guo, Dongyuan Guo, Haolin Liu, Hongyu Yan, Huiwen Shi, Jiaao Yu, Jiachen Xu, Jingwei Huang, Kunhong Li, Lifu Wang, Linus, Penghao Wang, Qingxiang Lin, Ruining Tang, Xianghui Yang, Yang Li, Yirui Guan, Yunfei Zhao, Yunhan Yang, Zeqiang Lai, Zhihao Liang, Zibo Zhao

entry.summary: Introduces HY3D-Bench ecosystem with 250K curated 3D objects, part-level decomposition, and real-world capture for 3D generation evaluation from Hunyuan team.

entry.title: Disentangling Causal Importance from Emergent Structure in Multi-Expert Orchestration

author.name: Sudipto Ghosh, Sujoy Nath, Sunny Manchanda, Tanmoy Chakraborty

entry.summary: Introduces INFORM, an interpretability framework for multi-expert LLM systems that decouples expert interaction structure, execution order, and causal attribution. Evaluates on GSM8K, HumanEval, MMLU with LLaMA, Qwen, and DeepSeek models.

entry.title: LycheeDecode: Accelerating Long-Context LLM Inference via Hybrid-Head Sparse Decoding

author.name: Gang Lin, Dongfang Li, Zhuoen Chen, Yukun Shi, Xuhui Chen, Baotian Hu, Min Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes LycheeDecode for accelerating long-context LLM inference using hybrid-head attention with HardKuma-based mechanism to partition heads into retrieval vs streaming functions.

entry.title: El Agente Quntur: A research collaborator agent for quantum chemistry

author.name: Juan B. P\'erez-S\'anchez, Yunheng Zou, Jorge A. Campos-Gonzalez-Angulo, Marcel M\"uller, Ignacio Gustin, Andrew Wang, Han Hao, Tsz Wai Ko, Changhyeok Choi, Eric S. Isbrandt, Mohammad Ghazi Vakili, Hanyong Xu, Chris Crebolder, Varinia Bernales, Al\'an Aspuru-Guzik

entry.summary: Introduces El Agente Quntur, a hierarchical multi-agent AI system designed as a research collaborator for computational quantum chemistry. Eliminates hard-coded prompts in favor of flexible, adaptive approaches.

entry.title: Group Contrastive Learning for Weakly Paired Multimodal Data

author.name: Aditya Gorla, Hugues Van Assel, Jan-Christian Huetter, Heming Yao, Kyunghyun Cho, Aviv Regev, Russell Littman

entry.summary: Introduces GROOVE with GroupCLIP, a novel group-level contrastive loss bridging CLIP (paired data) and SupCon (supervised) for weakly-paired multi-modal settings where samples share perturbation labels but lack direct correspondence.

entry.title: Rethinking Perplexity: Revealing the Impact of Input Length on Perplexity Evaluation in LLMs

author.name: Letian Cheng, Junyan Wang, Yan Gao, Elliott Wen, Ting Dang, Hong Jia

entry.summary: Systematically studies impact of input length on perplexity evaluation, showing perplexity can be unreliable with irrelevant long inputs. Introduces LengthBenchmark for system-conscious evaluation.

entry.title: Benchmarking Bias Mitigation Toward Fairness Without Harm from Vision to LVLMs

author.name: Xuwei Tan, Ziyu Hu, Xueru Zhang

entry.summary: NH-Fair provides unified benchmark for fairness without harm spanning vision models and LVLMs under standardized protocols, covering supervised and zero-shot regimes.

entry.title: Rethinking Weight Tying: Pseudo-Inverse Tying for Stable LM Training and Updates

author.name: Jian Gu, Aldeida Aleti, Chunyang Chen, Hongyu Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Pseudo-Inverse Tying (PIT) that synchronizes embedding and unembedding as coupled projections of shared latent token memory, ensuring stable token interface throughout LM training.

entry.title: When and Where to Attack? Stage-wise Attention-Guided Adversarial Attack on Large Vision Language Models

author.name: Jaehyun Kwak, Nam Cao, Boryeong Cho, Segyu Lee, Sumyeong Ahn, Se-Young Yun

entry.summary: Proposes Stage-wise Attention-Guided Adversarial Attack on LVLMs, exploiting correlation between regional attention scores and adversarial loss sensitivity to concentrate perturbations on high-attention regions for more efficient attacks.

entry.title: SynthVerse: A Large-Scale Diverse Synthetic Dataset for Point Tracking

author.name: Weiguang Zhao, Haoran Xu, Xingyu Miao, Qin Zhao, Rui Zhang, Kaizhu Huang, Ning Gao, Peizhou Cao, Mingze Sun, Mulin Yu, Tao Lu, Linning Xu, Junting Dong, Jiangmiao Pang

entry.summary: SynthVerse introduces a large-scale diverse synthetic dataset for point tracking, covering domains missing from existing synthetic datasets including animated content, embodied manipulation, and articulated objects.

entry.title: To What Extent Do Token-Level Representations from Pathology Foundation Models Improve Dense Prediction?

author.name: Weiming Chen, Xitong Ling, Xidong Wang, Zhenyang Cai, Yijia Guo, Mingxi Fu, Ziyi Zeng, Minxi Ouyang, Jiawen Li, Yizhi Wang, Tian Guan, Benyou Wang, Yonghong He

entry.summary: PFM-DenseBench provides large-scale benchmark evaluating 17 pathology foundation models across 18 segmentation datasets with systematic assessment of adaptation and fine-tuning strategies.

entry.title: A Modern System Recipe for Situated Embodied Human-Robot Conversation with Real-Time Multimodal LLMs and Tool-Calling

author.name: Dong Won Lee, Sarah Gillet, Louis-Philippe Morency, Cynthia Breazeal, Hae Won Park

entry.summary: Presents minimal system recipe for situated embodied conversation using real-time multimodal LLMs with tool interfaces for attention and active perception, evaluating across home-style scenarios.

entry.title: Understanding the Impact of Differentially Private Training on Memorization of Long-Tailed Data

author.name: Jiaming Zhang, Huanyi Xie, Meng Ding, Shaopeng Fu, Jinyan Liu, Di Wang

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of how DP-SGD affects memorization on long-tailed data, extending privacy analysis to nonconvex neural networks commonly used in practice.

entry.title: OAT: Ordered Action Tokenization

author.name: Chaoqi Liu, Xiaoshen Han, Jiawei Gao, Yue Zhao, Haonan Chen, Yilun Du

entry.summary: Introduces Ordered Action Tokenization (OAT), a learned action tokenizer for autoregressive robot policies that achieves high compression, total decodability, and causally ordered token space for compatibility with next-token prediction.

entry.title: Performative Learning Theory

author.name: Julian Rodemann, Unai Fischer-Abaigar, James Bailie, Krikamol Muandet

entry.summary: Embeds performative predictions into statistical learning theory, proving generalization bounds when predictions affect samples, populations, or both. Establishes foundations for performative prediction analysis.

entry.title: ZKBoost: Zero-Knowledge Verifiable Training for XGBoost

author.name: Nikolas Melissaris, Jiayi Xu, Antigoni Polychroniadou, Akira Takahashi, Chenkai Weng

entry.summary: ZKBoost provides first zero-knowledge proof of training protocol for XGBoost, enabling model owners to prove correct training without revealing data or parameters using VOLE-based instantiation.

entry.title: CoLT: Reasoning with Chain of Latent Tool Calls

author.name: Fangwei Zhu, Zhifang Sui

entry.summary: Proposes CoLT (Chain of Latent Tool calls), implementing latent reasoning as tool calls where seed tokens encode reasoning steps that are unpacked by smaller external models, avoiding model structure augmentation.

entry.title: Decomposed Prompting Does Not Fix Knowledge Gaps, But Helps Models Say "I Don't Know"

author.name: Dhruv Madhwal, Lyuxin David Zhang, Dan Roth, Tomer Wolfson, Vivek Gupta

entry.summary: Shows decomposed prompting helps LLMs recognize knowledge limits through cross-regime disagreement, enabling effective 'I don't know' responses without accuracy loss.

entry.title: ReThinker: Scientific Reasoning by Rethinking with Guided Reflection and Confidence Control

author.name: Zhentao Tang, Yuqi Cui, Shixiong Kai, Wenqian Zhao, Ke Ye, Xing Li, Anxin Tian, Zehua Pei, Hui-Ling Zhen, Shoubo Hu, Xiaoguang Li, Yunhe Wang, Mingxuan Yuan

entry.summary: Introduces ReThinker, a confidence-aware agentic framework for scientific reasoning with stage-wise Solver-Critic-Selector architecture, targeting benchmarks like Humanity's Last Exam.

entry.title: Understanding and Guiding Layer Placement in Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning of Large Language Models

author.name: Yichen Xu, Yuyang Liang, Shan Dai, Tianyang Hu, Tsz Nam Chan, Chenhao Ma

entry.summary: Develops unified projected residual view of PEFT, identifying three quantities (resnorm, projection angle, forgetting score) that govern layer-wise adaptation importance under quadratic approximation.

entry.title: Bi-directional Bias Attribution: Debiasing Large Language Models without Modifying Prompts

author.name: Yujie Lin, Kunquan Li, Yixuan Liao, Xiaoxin Chen, Jinsong Su

entry.summary: Proposes bi-directional bias attribution framework that identifies stereotype-inducing words and attributes bias to specific neurons in LLMs without fine-tuning or prompt modification.

entry.title: From independent patches to coordinated attention: Controlling information flow in vision transformers

author.name: Kieran A. Murphy

entry.summary: Makes attention-mediated information flow explicit in vision transformers via variational information bottlenecks, enabling controllable spectrum from independent patches to full global attention.

entry.title: Guided Verifier: Collaborative Multimodal Reasoning via Dynamic Process Supervision

author.name: Lingzhuang Sun, Ruitong Liu, Yuxia Zhu, Xiaohan Xu, Jingxuan Wei, Xiangxiang Zhang, Bihui Yu, Wentao Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Guided Verifier framework where a dynamic verifier co-solves tasks alongside the policy during RL rollouts, providing intermediate supervision to prevent error propagation in MLLM reasoning.

entry.title: Nix and Fix: Targeting 1000x Compression of 3D Gaussian Splatting with Diffusion Models

author.name: Cem Eteke, Enzo Tartaglione

entry.summary: NiFi achieves extreme 3DGS compression (down to 0.1 MB) through artifact-aware diffusion-based restoration, using one-step distillation to fix artifacts introduced by aggressive compression.

entry.title: Empirical-MCTS: Continuous Agent Evolution via Dual-Experience Monte Carlo Tree Search

author.name: Hao Lu, Haoyuan Huang, Yulin Zhou, Chen Li, Ningxin Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes Empirical-MCTS, adding persistent memory to MCTS through Pairwise-Experience-Evolutionary Meta-Prompting and Memory Optimization Agent, enabling continuous learning across problem instances.

entry.title: SCALE: Self-uncertainty Conditioned Adaptive Looking and Execution for Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Hyeonbeom Choi, Daechul Ahn, Youhan Lee, Taewook Kang, Seongwon Cho, Jonghyun Choi

entry.summary: Introduces SCALE, a training-free inference strategy for Vision-Language-Action models that modulates both visual perception and action decisions based on self-uncertainty, enabling the model to reconsider perception under ambiguity.

entry.title: Continual Learning through Control Minimization

author.name: Sander de Haan, Yassine Taoudi-Benchekroun, Pau Vilimelis Aceituno, Benjamin F. Grewe

entry.summary: Reformulates continual learning as a control problem where learning and preservation signals compete within neural dynamics. Achieves implicit encoding of prior-task curvature without explicit storage.

entry.title: El Agente Estructural: An Artificially Intelligent Molecular Editor

author.name: Changhyeok Choi, Yunheng Zou, Marcel M\"uller, Han Hao, Yeonghun Kang, Juan B. P\'erez-S\'anchez, Ignacio Gustin, Hanyong Xu, Mohammad Ghazi Vakili, Chris Crebolder, Al\'an Aspuru-Guzik, Varinia Bernales

entry.summary: Introduces El Agente Estructural, a multimodal agent for 3D molecular geometry manipulation via natural language. Mimics human expert manipulation rather than using generative models.

entry.title: CoRe: Context-Robust Remasking for Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Kevin Zhai, Sabbir Mollah, Zhenyi Wang, Mubarak Shah

entry.summary: Introduces CoRe (Context-Robust Remasking), a training-free framework for improving masked diffusion model decoding by identifying context-brittle tokens through sensitivity probing rather than static confidence scores.

entry.title: Cascading Robustness Verification: Toward Efficient Model-Agnostic Certification

author.name: Mohammadreza Maleki, Rushendra Sidibomma, Arman Adibi, Reza Samavi

entry.summary: Proposes Cascading Robustness Verification (CRV), a model-agnostic framework that combines multiple incomplete verifiers to enhance reliability and efficiency of neural network robustness certification.

entry.title: Mosaic Learning: A Framework for Decentralized Learning with Model Fragmentation

author.name: Sayan Biswas, Davide Frey, Romaric Gaudel, Nirupam Gupta, Anne-Marie Kermarrec, Dimitri Ler\'ev\'erend, Rafael Pires, Rishi Sharma, Fran\c{c}ois Ta\"iani, Martijn de Vos

entry.summary: Introduces Mosaic Learning, decomposing models into fragments that propagate independently across decentralized networks. Reduces redundant communication across correlated parameters while enabling diverse information flow.

entry.title: Finding Structure in Continual Learning

author.name: Pourya Shamsolmoali, Masoumeh Zareapoor

entry.summary: Proposes using Douglas-Rachford Splitting to reformulate continual learning as negotiation between plasticity and stability objectives rather than competing loss terms. Enables cleaner optimization without gradient conflicts.

entry.title: MTS-JEPA: Multi-Resolution Joint-Embedding Predictive Architecture for Time-Series Anomaly Prediction

author.name: Yanan He, Yunshi Wen, Xin Wang, Tengfei Ma

entry.summary: MTS-JEPA extends Joint-Embedding Predictive Architecture to multivariate time series anomaly prediction, using multi-resolution objectives and soft codebook bottleneck to capture regime transitions.

entry.title: Focus-LIME: Surgical Interpretation of Long-Context Large Language Models via Proxy-Based Neighborhood Selection

author.name: Junhao Liu, Haonan Yu, Zhenyu Yan, Xin Zhang

entry.summary: Focus-LIME addresses interpretation of long-context LLMs using proxy model to curate perturbation neighborhood, enabling fine-grained attribution within optimized context.

entry.title: Theory of Optimal Learning Rate Schedules and Scaling Laws for a Random Feature Model

author.name: Blake Bordelon, Francesco Mori

entry.summary: Develops theory of optimal learning rate schedules for SGD training, identifying 'easy' and 'hard' phases with different optimal decay patterns. Derives analytical solutions using optimal control methods.

entry.title: Model-Dowser: Data-Free Importance Probing to Mitigate Catastrophic Forgetting in Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Hyeontaek Hwang, Nguyen Dinh Son, Daeyoung Kim

entry.summary: Proposes Model-Dowser, a data-free sparse fine-tuning approach for MLLMs that measures parameter importance for pretrained generalization using weight magnitude and gradient information.

entry.title: DiMo: Discrete Diffusion Modeling for Motion Generation and Understanding

author.name: Ning Zhang, Zhengyu Li, Kwong Weng Loh, Mingxi Xu, Qi Wang, Zhengyu Wen, Xiaoyu He, Wei Zhao, Kehong Gong, Mingyuan Zhang

entry.summary: DiMo introduces a discrete diffusion framework for bidirectional text-motion understanding and generation, unifying text-to-motion, motion-to-text, and motion-to-motion tasks in a single model. It uses iterative masked token refinement rather than autoregressive decoding, enabling flexible quality-latency tradeoffs.

entry.title: S-MUSt3R: Sliding Multi-view 3D Reconstruction

author.name: Leonid Antsfeld, Boris Chidlovskii, Yohann Cabon, Vincent Leroy, Jerome Revaud

entry.summary: S-MUSt3R extends foundation models for large-scale monocular 3D reconstruction through sequence segmentation, segment alignment, and lightweight loop closure, without requiring model retraining.

entry.title: When LLaVA Meets Objects: Token Composition for Vision-Language-Models

author.name: Soumya Jahagirdar, Walid Bousselham, Anna Kukleva, Hilde Kuehne

entry.summary: Mask-LLaVA combines mask-based object representations with global and local patch tokens for VLMs, enabling flexible token dropping at inference without retraining while maintaining performance.

entry.title: EgoActor: Grounding Task Planning into Spatial-aware Egocentric Actions for Humanoid Robots via Visual-Language Models

author.name: Yu Bai, MingMing Yu, Chaojie Li, Ziyi Bai, Xinlong Wang, B\"orje F. Karlsson

entry.summary: EgoActor proposes unified VLM for humanoid robots predicting locomotion primitives, head movements, manipulation commands, and human-robot interaction from egocentric view and language instructions.

entry.title: TACO: Temporal Consensus Optimization for Continual Neural Mapping

author.name: Xunlan Zhou, Hongrui Zhao, Negar Mehr

entry.summary: TACO proposes replay-free continual neural mapping through temporal consensus optimization, treating past model snapshots as temporal neighbors with pseudo-GT distillation and virtual-view consistency.

entry.title: The Supportiveness-Safety Tradeoff in LLM Well-Being Agents

author.name: Himanshi Lalwani, Hanan Salam

entry.summary: Evaluates 6 LLMs across varying levels of supportive prompting on well-being queries, finding moderately supportive prompts improve empathy while maintaining safety, but highly supportive prompts can compromise safety. Uses LLM-judge framework validated against human ratings.

entry.title: From Competition to Collaboration: Designing Sustainable Mechanisms Between LLMs and Online Forums

author.name: Niv Fono, Yftah Ziser, Omer Ben-Porat

entry.summary: Models the paradox where GenAI draws users from Q&A forums while depending on forum data, proposing a framework for sustainable LLM-forum collaboration with data-driven simulations on Stack Exchange.

entry.title: PluRel: Synthetic Data unlocks Scaling Laws for Relational Foundation Models

author.name: Vignesh Kothapalli, Rishabh Ranjan, Valter Hudovernik, Vijay Prakash Dwivedi, Johannes Hoffart, Carlos Guestrin, Jure Leskovec

entry.summary: Introduces PluRel framework for synthesizing multi-tabular relational databases with schema graphs, primary-foreign key connectivity, and conditional causal mechanisms to enable RFM training.

entry.title: ProxyWar: Dynamic Assessment of LLM Code Generation in Game Arenas

author.name: Wenjun Peng, Xinyu Wang, Qi Wu

entry.summary: Presents ProxyWar, a framework for evaluating LLM code generation by embedding generated agents in competitive game environments, revealing discrepancies between benchmark performance and operational characteristics.

entry.title: RexBERT: Context Specialized Bidirectional Encoders for E-commerce

author.name: Rahul Bajaj, Anuj Garg

entry.summary: Introduces RexBERT, BERT-style encoders for e-commerce trained on Ecom-niverse, a 350 billion token corpus curated from retail and shopping sources.

entry.title: Provable Target Sample Complexity Improvements as Pre-Trained Models Scale

author.name: Kazuto Fukuchi, Ryuichiro Hataya, Kota Matsui

entry.summary: Provides theoretical framework ('caulking') explaining how pre-trained model scale reduces downstream sample complexity, inspired by PEFT methods like adapters and LoRA.

entry.title: Semantic Self-Distillation for Language Model Uncertainty

author.name: Edward Phillips, Sean Wu, Boyan Gao, David A. Clifton

entry.summary: Proposes semantic self-distillation to predict LLM uncertainty before generation by distilling sampled semantic distributions into lightweight student models for fast hallucination prediction.

entry.title: Phaedra: Learning High-Fidelity Discrete Tokenization for the Physical Science

author.name: Levi Lingsch, Georgios Kissas, Johannes Jakubik, Siddhartha Mishra

entry.summary: Investigates image tokenizer accuracy for scientific images with PDEs, proposing Phaedra and evaluating fidelity of physical/spectral properties across tokenizer suite.

entry.title: SparVAR: Exploring Sparsity in Visual AutoRegressive Modeling for Training-Free Acceleration

author.name: Zekun Li, Ning Wang, Tongxin Bai, Changwang Mei, Peisong Wang, Shuang Qiu, Jian Cheng

entry.summary: Presents SparVAR, a training-free acceleration framework for Visual AutoRegressive models exploiting attention sink patterns, cross-scale similarity, and local attention properties.

entry.title: OmniRad: A Radiological Foundation Model for Multi-Task Medical Image Analysis

author.name: Luca Zedda, Andrea Loddo, Cecilia Di Ruberto

entry.summary: Introduces OmniRad, a radiological foundation model pretrained on 1.2M medical images, evaluated across multiple downstream adaptation regimes including frozen backbone and full fine-tuning.

entry.title: The Role of Target Update Frequencies in Q-Learning

author.name: Simon Weissmann, Tilman Aach, Benedikt Wille, Sebastian Kassing, Leif D\"oring

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of target network update frequency in Q-learning through approximate dynamic programming lens. Formulates periodic updates as nested optimization with convergence analysis for asynchronous sampling.

entry.title: eCP: Informative uncertainty quantification via Equivariantized Conformal Prediction with pre-trained models

author.name: Nikolaos Bousias, Lars Lindemann, George Pappas

entry.summary: Studies group symmetrization of pre-trained models for conformal prediction, showing geometric information via group-averaging distributes non-conformity mass to produce more informative uncertainty regions.

entry.title: Federated Concept-Based Models: Interpretable models with distributed supervision

author.name: Dario Fenoglio, Arianna Casanova, Francesco De Santis, Mohan Li, Gabriele Dominici, Johannes Schneider, Martin Gjoreski, Marc Langheinrich, Pietro Barbiero, Giovanni De Felice

entry.summary: Proposes Federated Concept-Based Models, integrating interpretable concept-based models with federated learning where concept annotations are distributed across institutions joining over time.

entry.title: Supervised Learning as Lossy Compression: Characterizing Generalization and Sample Complexity via Finite Blocklength Analysis

author.name: Kosuke Sugiyama, Masato Uchida

entry.summary: Frames supervised learning as lossy compression using finite blocklength analysis, deriving lower bounds on sample complexity and generalization error with explicit separation of overfitting and inductive bias mismatch.

entry.title: Decoupling Time and Risk: Risk-Sensitive Reinforcement Learning with General Discounting

author.name: Mehrdad Moghimi, Anthony Coache, Hyejin Ku

entry.summary: Proposes novel framework for risk-sensitive distributional RL supporting flexible discounting of future rewards beyond exponential discount factors.

entry.title: Training Data Efficiency in Multimodal Process Reward Models

author.name: Jinyuan Li, Chengsong Huang, Langlin Huang, Shaoyang Xu, Haolin Liu, Wenxuan Zhang, Jiaxin Huang

entry.summary: Studies data efficiency for Multimodal Process Reward Model training, finding quick saturation under random subsampling. Proposes Balanced method guided by label mixture and reliability factors.

entry.title: Training A Foundation Model to Represent Graphs as Vectors

author.name: Qi Feng, Jicong Fan

entry.summary: Proposes training graph foundation model using multi-graph feature alignment with density maximization mean alignment for consistent node embeddings across diverse domains.

entry.title: Separation-Utility Pareto Frontier: An Information-Theoretic Characterization

author.name: Shizhou Xu

entry.summary: Studies Pareto frontier between utility and separation fairness criterion via information theory. Proves concavity of frontier and characterizes conditions under which trade-off is strict.

entry.title: Forget to Generalize: Iterative Adaptation for Generalization in Federated Learning

author.name: Abdulrahman Alotaibi, Irene Tenison, Miriam Kim, Isaac Lee, Lalana Kagal

entry.summary: Proposes Iterative Federated Adaptation (IFA) using generation-wise forget and evolve strategy to enhance generalization in heterogeneous federated settings through controlled forgetting.

entry.title: Towards Understanding and Avoiding Limitations of Convolutions on Graphs

author.name: Andreas Roth

entry.summary: Thesis analyzing theoretical limitations of message-passing neural networks, identifying shared component amplification and component dominance as key properties limiting performance, and proposing frameworks to address them.

entry.title: Beyond Rejection Sampling: Trajectory Fusion for Scaling Mathematical Reasoning

author.name: Jie Deng, Hanshuang Tong, Jun Li, Shining Liang, Ning Wu, Hongzhi Li, Yutao Xie

entry.summary: Proposes TrajFusion for mathematical reasoning that interleaves incorrect trajectories with reflection prompts and correct solutions, explicitly modeling trial-and-error reasoning during training.

entry.title: 4DPC$^2$hat: Towards Dynamic Point Cloud Understanding with Failure-Aware Bootstrapping

author.name: Xindan Zhang, Weilong Yan, Yufei Shi, Xuerui Qiu, Tao He, Ying Li, Ming Li, Hehe Fan

entry.summary: Presents 4DPC²hat, first MLLM for dynamic point cloud understanding with 200K sample dataset and failure-aware bootstrapping for temporal reasoning over 3D sequences.

entry.title: Finding NeMO: A Geometry-Aware Representation of Template Views for Few-Shot Perception

author.name: Sebastian Jung, Leonard Kl\"upfel, Rudolph Triebel, Maximilian Durner

entry.summary: NeMO creates object-centric representations from few RGB template views for detection, segmentation and 6DoF pose estimation without retraining. Uses learned UDF to generate sparse point clouds with semantic and geometric information.

entry.title: TrajVG: 3D Trajectory-Coupled Visual Geometry Learning

author.name: Xingyu Miao, Weiguang Zhao, Tao Lu, Linning Yu, Mulin Yu, Yang Long, Jiangmiao Pang, Junting Dong

entry.summary: TrajVG proposes 3D trajectory-coupled visual geometry learning for multi-frame reconstruction, making cross-frame 3D correspondence explicit through camera-coordinate 3D trajectory estimation with geometric consistency objectives.

entry.title: X2HDR: HDR Image Generation in a Perceptually Uniform Space

author.name: Ronghuan Wu, Wanchao Su, Kede Ma, Jing Liao, Rafa{\l} K. Mantiuk

entry.summary: X2HDR shows pretrained LDR diffusion models can be adapted to HDR generation without retraining by converting HDR to perceptually uniform encodings (PU21/PQ) that bridge the statistics gap with sRGB.

entry.title: Towards Next-Generation SLAM: A Survey on 3DGS-SLAM Focusing on Performance, Robustness, and Future Directions

author.name: Li Wang, Ruixuan Gong, Yumo Han, Lei Yang, Lu Yang, Ying Li, Bin Xu, Huaping Liu, Rong Fu

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey of 3DGS-SLAM methods covering rendering quality, tracking accuracy, reconstruction speed, memory consumption, and robustness in dynamic environments.

entry.title: Landscape-aware Automated Algorithm Design: An Efficient Framework for Real-world Optimization

author.name: Haoran Yin, Shuaiqun Pan, Zhao Wei, Jian Cheng Wong, Yew-Soon Ong, Anna V. Kononova, Thomas B\"ack, Niki van Stein

entry.summary: Proposes landscape-aware automated algorithm design combining GP function generator with LLM-driven evolutionary algorithm designer, decoupling algorithm discovery from expensive evaluation through fitness landscape analysis.

entry.title: ALORE: Autonomous Large-Object Rearrangement with a Legged Manipulator

author.name: Zhihai Bi, Yushan Zhang, Kai Chen, Guoyang Zhao, Yulin Li, Jun Ma

entry.summary: ALORE presents autonomous large-object rearrangement system for legged manipulators with hierarchical RL training, high-level object velocity control, and global path planning for furniture-scale objects.

entry.title: Anthropic’s “Hot Mess” paper overstates its case (and the blog post is worse)

author.name: RobertM

entry.summary: Critiques Anthropic's 'Hot Mess' paper on misalignment scaling, arguing the technical definition of 'incoherence' is uninteresting and equivocates with everyday meaning. Claims the blog post and Twitter thread overstate mixed results.

entry.title: WebAccessVL: Making an Accessible Web via Violation-Conditioned VLM

author.name: Amber Yijia Zheng, Jae Joong Lee, Bedrich Benes, Raymond A. Yeh

entry.summary: Develops VLM that automatically edits website HTML to fix WCAG2 accessibility violations, reducing average violations from 5.34 to 0.44 per website, outperforming GPT-5 and Gemini.

entry.title: SpecMD: A Comprehensive Study On Speculative Expert Prefetching

author.name: Duc Hoang, Ajay Jaiswal, Mohammad Samragh, Minsik Cho

entry.summary: Develops SpecMD, standardized framework for benchmarking MoE expert caching policies across hardware configurations, enabling fair comparison of prefetching strategies.

entry.title: Toward Effective Multimodal Graph Foundation Model: A Divide-and-Conquer Based Approach

author.name: Sicheng Liu, Xunkai Li, Daohan Su, Ru Zhang, Hongchao Qin, Ronghua Li, Guoren Wang

entry.summary: Proposes divide-and-conquer approach for multimodal graph foundation models, explicitly modeling modality interaction and improving alignment between modalities in multimodal-attributed graphs.

entry.title: Mixture of Masters: Sparse Chess Language Models with Player Routing

author.name: Giacomo Frisoni, Lorenzo Molfetta, Davide Freddi, Gianluca Moro

entry.summary: Introduces Mixture-of-Masters (MoM), first chess MoE model with experts emulating world-class grandmasters. Uses learnable gating to select appropriate persona based on game state.

entry.title: Audio ControlNet for Fine-Grained Audio Generation and Editing

author.name: Haina Zhu, Yao Xiao, Xiquan Li, Ziyang Ma, Jianwei Yu, Bowen Zhang, Mingqi Yang, Xie Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Audio ControlNet for fine-grained control over text-to-audio generation attributes (loudness, pitch, events). T2A-Adapter achieves SOTA with only 38M additional parameters.

entry.title: Dynamical Regimes of Multimodal Diffusion Models

author.name: Emil Albrychiewicz, Andr\'es Franco Valiente, Li-Ching Chen

entry.summary: Presents theoretical framework for coupled diffusion models using nonequilibrium statistical physics, identifying 'synchronization gap' where distinct eigenmodes stabilize at different rates during generation.

entry.title: A principled framework for uncertainty decomposition in TabPFN

author.name: Sandra Fortini, Kenyon Ng, Sonia Petrone, Judith Rousseau, Susan Wei

entry.summary: Develops principled framework for uncertainty decomposition in TabPFN using Bayesian predictive inference, proving predictive CLT under quasi-martingale conditions.

entry.title: Beyond Many-Shot Translation: Scaling In-Context Demonstrations For Low-Resource Machine Translation

author.name: Luis Frentzen Salim, Esteban Carlin, Alexandre Morinvil, Xi Ai, Lun-Wei Ku

entry.summary: Explores scaling in-context learning for low-resource MT to 1M tokens using long-context models, comparing monolingual, instruction, and parallel data as in-context supervision.

entry.title: Enhancing Mathematical Problem Solving in LLMs through Execution-Driven Reasoning Augmentation

author.name: Aditya Basarkar (DK), Benyamin Tabarsi (DK), Tiffany Barnes (DK), Dongkuan (DK), Xu

entry.summary: Introduces Iteratively Improved Programmatic reasoning for math problems, enabling multi-agent LLM systems to revisit and correct earlier reasoning steps while separating programmatic context from language understanding.

entry.title: Agent-Omit: Training Efficient LLM Agents for Adaptive Thought and Observation Omission via Agentic Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yansong Ning, Jun Fang, Naiqiang Tan, Hao Liu

entry.summary: Trains LLM agents via reinforcement learning to adaptively omit redundant thoughts and observations during multi-turn interactions, improving efficiency while maintaining task performance.

entry.title: GeoIB: Geometry-Aware Information Bottleneck via Statistical-Manifold Compression

author.name: Weiqi Wang, Zhiyi Tian, Chenhan Zhang, Shui Yu

entry.summary: Proposes GeoIB, a geometric information bottleneck dispensing with MI estimation by using KL projections, offering exact rather than variational IB optimization.

entry.title: On the Credibility of Evaluating LLMs using Survey Questions

author.name: Jind\v{r}ich Libovick\'y

entry.summary: Identifies methodological limitations in evaluating LLM value orientation via surveys, showing prompting methods and decoding strategies significantly affect results. Introduces self-correlation distance metric.

entry.title: Natural Language Instructions for Scene-Responsive Human-in-the-Loop Motion Planning in Autonomous Driving using Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Angel Martinez-Sanchez, Parthib Roy, Ross Greer

entry.summary: Adapts OpenEMMA, an open-source MLLM-based driving framework, to support instruction-conditioned trajectory planning using the doScenes dataset, enabling vehicles to follow free-form natural language commands for navigation.

entry.title: Beyond Static Cropping: Layer-Adaptive Visual Localization and Decoding Enhancement

author.name: Zipeng Zhu, Zhanghao Hu, Qinglin Zhu, Yuxi Hong, Yijun Liu, Jingyong Su, Yulan He, Lin Gui

entry.summary: Proposes dynamic layer-adaptive visual localization for Large Vision-Language Models, showing that optimal visual grounding layers vary by task rather than being fixed to a single 'magic layer'.

entry.title: Is Micro Domain-Adaptive Pre-Training Effective for Real-World Operations? Multi-Step Evaluation Reveals Potential and Bottlenecks

author.name: Masaya Tsunokake, Yuta Koreeda, Terufumi Morishita, Koichi Nagatsuka, Hikaru Tomonari, Yasuhiro Sogawa

entry.summary: Evaluates micro domain-adaptive pre-training (mDAPT) effectiveness for generative tasks by disentangling the answering process into eliciting, selecting, and utilizing subtasks.

entry.title: From Evaluation to Design: Using Potential Energy Surface Smoothness Metrics to Guide Machine Learning Interatomic Potential Architectures

author.name: Ryan Liu, Eric Qu, Tobias Kreiman, Samuel M. Blau, Aditi S. Krishnapriyan

entry.summary: Introduces Bond Smoothness Characterization Test (BSCT) to evaluate machine learning interatomic potentials via controlled bond deformations, detecting non-smoothness issues that standard evaluations miss.

entry.title: Grables: Tabular Learning Beyond Independent Rows

author.name: Tamara Cucumides, Floris Geerts

entry.summary: Introduces grables, a modular interface separating how tables are lifted to graphs from how predictions are computed. Shows that row-wise prediction provably fails on targets depending on global counts and relational patterns.

entry.title: A Probabilistic Framework for Solving High-Frequency Helmholtz Equations via Diffusion Models

author.name: Yicheng Zou, Samuel Lanthaler, Hossein Salahshoor

entry.summary: Develops score-based conditional diffusion operator for solving high-frequency Helmholtz equations, arguing probabilistic approach handles strong input-to-output sensitivity better than deterministic methods.

entry.title: Benchmarking Uncertainty Quantification of Plug-and-Play Diffusion Priors for Inverse Problems Solving

author.name: Xiaoyu Qiu, Taewon Yang, Zhanhao Liu, Guanyang Wang, Liyue Shen

entry.summary: Conducts systematic benchmarking study of uncertainty quantification in plug-and-play diffusion priors for inverse problems, addressing mismatch between point-estimate evaluations and distributional nature of methods.

entry.title: Stochastic Decision Horizons for Constrained Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Nikola Milosevic, Leonard Franz, Daniel Haeufle, Georg Martius, Nico Scherf, Pavel Kolev

entry.summary: Proposes a novel Control as Inference formulation for constrained MDPs using stochastic decision horizons, where constraint violations shorten effective planning horizons. This enables replay-compatible off-policy learning while maintaining constraint satisfaction.

entry.title: DMFlow: Disordered Materials Generation by Flow Matching

author.name: Liming Wu, Rui Jiao, Qi Li, Mingze Li, Songyou Li, Shifeng Jin, Wenbing Huang

entry.summary: DMFlow is a generative framework for disordered crystals using Riemannian flow matching with spherical reparameterization, enabling generation of substitutionally and positionally disordered materials.

entry.title: Evolving Afferent Architectures: Biologically-inspired Models for Damage-Avoidance Learning

author.name: Wolfgang Maass, Sabine Janzen, Prajvi Saxena, Sach Mukherjee

entry.summary: Introduces Afferent Learning framework producing computational afferent traces as internal risk signals for damage-avoidance learning, using two-level evolutionary-RL architecture with convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Anytime-Valid Conformal Risk Control

author.name: Bror Hultberg, Dave Zachariah, Ant\^onio H. Ribeiro

entry.summary: Extends conformal risk control to remain valid with high probability over cumulatively growing calibration data at any time point, with matching lower bounds.

entry.title: Less Finetuning, Better Retrieval: Rethinking LLM Adaptation for Biomedical Retrievers via Synthetic Data and Model Merging

author.name: Sameh Khattab, Jean-Philippe Corbeil, Osman Alperen Kora\c{s}, Amin Dada, Julian Friedrich, Fran\c{c}ois Beaulieu, Paul Vozila, Jens Kleesiek

entry.summary: Introduces STM (Synthesize-Train-Merge) framework for adapting LLMs into biomedical retrievers using synthetic hard negatives and model merging. Demonstrates gains on medical retrieval benchmarks.

entry.title: Beyond Unimodal Shortcuts: MLLMs as Cross-Modal Reasoners for Grounded Named Entity Recognition

author.name: Jinlong Ma, Yu Zhang, Xuefeng Bai, Kehai Chen, Yuwei Wang, Zeming Liu, Jun Yu, Min Zhang

entry.summary: Reveals modality bias in MLLMs for grounded NER where models take unimodal shortcuts rather than cross-modal verification. Proposes Modality-aware Consistency Reasoning to enforce structured cross-modal reasoning.

entry.title: OmniSIFT: Modality-Asymmetric Token Compression for Efficient Omni-modal Large Language Models

author.name: Yue Ding, Yiyan Ji, Jungang Li, Xuyang Liu, Xinlong Chen, Junfei Wu, Bozhou Li, Bohan Zeng, Yang Shi, Yushuo Guan, Yuanxing Zhang, Jiaheng Liu, Qiang Liu, Pengfei Wan, Liang Wang

entry.summary: Proposes OmniSIFT for omni-modal LLM token compression using spatio-temporal video pruning and vision-guided audio selection, reducing computational overhead while maintaining performance.

entry.title: iSight: Towards expert-AI co-assessment for improved immunohistochemistry staining interpretation

author.name: Jacob S. Leiby, Jialu Yao, Pan Lu, George Hu, Anna Davidian, Shunsuke Koga, Olivia Leung, Pravin Patel, Isabella Tondi Resta, Rebecca Rojansky, Derek Sung, Eric Yang, Paul J. Zhang, Emma Lundberg, Dokyoon Kim, Serena Yeung-Levy, James Zou, Thomas Montine, Jeffrey Nirschl, Zhi Huang

entry.summary: Introduces HPA10M dataset (10.5M IHC images) and iSight framework for automated IHC staining assessment combining whole-slide features with tissue metadata through multi-task learning.

entry.title: JOintGS: Joint Optimization of Cameras, Bodies and 3D Gaussians for In-the-Wild Monocular Reconstruction

author.name: Zihan Lou, Jinlong Fan, Sihan Ma, Yuxiang Yang, Jing Zhang

entry.summary: JOintGS jointly optimizes camera extrinsics, human poses, and 3D Gaussian representations from monocular RGB video, enabling robust human avatar reconstruction in unconstrained settings where off-the-shelf methods provide inaccurate initialization.

entry.title: LCUDiff: Latent Capacity Upgrade Diffusion for Faithful Human Body Restoration

author.name: Jue Gong, Zihan Zhou, Jingkai Wang, Shu Li, Libo Liu, Jianliang Lan, Yulun Zhang

entry.summary: LCUDiff upgrades pretrained latent diffusion models from 4 to 16-channel latent space for human body restoration using channel splitting distillation to maintain alignment with pretrained priors while adding high-frequency detail capacity.

entry.title: Understanding Degradation with Vision Language Model

author.name: Guanzhou Lan, Chenyi Liao, Yuqi Yang, Qianli Ma, Zhigang Wang, Dong Wang, Bin Zhao, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: DU-VLM redefines degradation understanding as hierarchical structured prediction, proving that degradation type, parameter keys, and continuous values can be unified under autoregressive prediction with bounded quantization error.

entry.title: Mitigating Long-Tail Bias via Prompt-Controlled Diffusion Augmentation

author.name: Buddhi Wijenayake, Nichula Wasalathilake, Roshan Godaliyadda, Vijitha Herath, Parakrama Ekanayake, Vishal M. Patel

entry.summary: Presents prompt-controlled diffusion augmentation to mitigate long-tail pixel imbalance in semantic segmentation, using discrete diffusion for layout generation and image translation with domain and class-ratio control.

entry.title: Self-evolving Embodied AI

author.name: Tongtong Feng, Xin Wang, Wenwu Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces self-evolving embodied AI paradigm where agents operate with memory self-updating, task self-switching, environment self-prediction, and embodiment self-adaptation for dynamic open environments.

entry.title: Real-time processing of analog signals on accelerated neuromorphic hardware

author.name: Yannik Stradmann, Johannes Schemmel, Mihai A. Petrovici, Laura Kriener

entry.summary: Demonstrates real-time analog signal processing on BrainScaleS-2 neuromorphic hardware with direct microphone interface, using spiking neural networks at 1000x acceleration for interaural time difference processing.

entry.title: Reshaping Action Error Distributions for Reliable Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Shuanghao Bai, Dakai Wang, Cheng Chi, Wanqi Zhou, Jing Lyu, Xiaoguang Zhao, Pengwei Wang, Zhongyuan Wang, Lei Xing, Shanghang Zhang, Badong Chen

entry.summary: Applies Minimum Error Entropy to VLA training to reshape action error distributions, proposing trajectory-level MEE objective and weighted variants for more reliable continuous action prediction.

entry.title: Viewpoint Matters: Dynamically Optimizing Viewpoints with Masked Autoencoder for Visual Manipulation

author.name: Pengfei Yi, Yifan Han, Junyan Li, Litao Liu, Wenzhao Lian

entry.summary: MAE-Select proposes active viewpoint selection for robotic manipulation using pretrained multi-view MAE representations to dynamically select most informative camera viewpoints without labeled data.

entry.title: Integrated Exploration and Sequential Manipulation on Scene Graph with LLM-based Situated Replanning

author.name: Heqing Yang, Ziyuan Jiao, Shu Wang, Yida Niu, Si Liu, Hangxin Liu

entry.summary: EPoG integrates exploration with sequential manipulation planning using scene graphs, combining graph-based global planner with LLM-based local planner for partially known environments.

entry.title: Towards X-embodiment safety: A control theory perspective on transferring safety certificates across dynamical systems

author.name: Nikolaos Bousias, George Pappas

entry.summary: Proposes transferred control barrier functions (tCBF) framework that enables safety constraints defined on one robot system to be systematically enforced on another with mismatched dynamics. Addresses the x-embodiment problem from a safety perspective.

entry.title: HybridQuestion: Human-AI Collaboration for Identifying High-Impact Research Questions

author.name: Keyu Zhao, Fengli Xu, Yong Li, Tie-Yan Liu

entry.summary: Explores human-AI hybrid approach for identifying high-impact research questions, combining LLM data processing with human expert value judgment to assess past breakthroughs and future directions.

entry.title: Transformers perform adaptive partial pooling

author.name: Vsevolod Kapatsinski

entry.summary: Demonstrates GPT-2 performs adaptive partial pooling of evidence across contexts, with pooling decreasing over training and varying by context similarity—behavior analogous to hierarchical regression.

entry.title: History-Guided Iterative Visual Reasoning with Self-Correction

author.name: Xinglong Yang, Zhilin Peng, Zhanzhan Liu, Haochen Shi, Sheng-Jun Huang

entry.summary: Proposes H-GIVR framework for multimodal LLM reasoning that reuses historical reasoning information for iterative verification and dynamic error correction, inspired by human reasoning behavior.

entry.title: Adaptive Prompt Elicitation for Text-to-Image Generation

author.name: Xinyi Wen, Lena Hegemann, Xiaofu Jin, Shuai Ma, Antti Oulasvirta

entry.summary: Proposes Adaptive Prompt Elicitation (APE) for text-to-image generation that adaptively asks visual queries to refine user intent using information-theoretic framework.

entry.title: NeuroCanvas: VLLM-Powered Robust Seizure Detection by Reformulating Multichannel EEG as Image

author.name: Yan Chen, Jie Peng, Moajjem Hossain Chowdhury, Tianlong Chen, Yunmei Liu

entry.summary: NeuroCanvas reformulates multi-channel EEG as images for VLLM-based seizure detection, using entropy-guided channel selection to address heterogeneity while improving computational efficiency.

entry.title: Maximin Relative Improvement: Fair Learning as a Bargaining Problem

author.name: Jiwoo Han, Moulinath Banerjee, Yuekai Sun

entry.summary: Interprets group fairness as bargaining problem among subpopulations, showing relative improvement corresponds to Kalai-Smorodinsky solution with axiomatic justification including scale invariance.

entry.title: Disentangling meaning from language in LLM-based machine translation

author.name: Th\'eo Lasnier, Armel Zebaze, Djam\'e Seddah, Rachel Bawden, Beno\^it Sagot

entry.summary: Analyzes machine translation in LLMs mechanistically, finding distinct sparse sets of attention heads specialize in target language identification vs. meaning preservation.

entry.title: InterPReT: Interactive Policy Restructuring and Training Enable Effective Imitation Learning from Laypersons

author.name: Feiyu Gavin Zhu, Jean Oh, Reid Simmons

entry.summary: Introduces InterPReT for interactive imitation learning from non-experts, allowing laypersons to teach agents through instructions that update policy structure and demonstrations that optimize parameters. Validated with N=34 user study.

entry.title: All-Atom GPCR-Ligand Simulation via Residual Isometric Latent Flow

author.name: Jiying Zhang, Shuhao Zhang, Pierre Vandergheynst, Patrick Barth

entry.summary: Introduces GPCRLMD for efficient all-atom GPCR-ligand molecular dynamics simulation using Harmonic-Prior VAE with physics-informed constraints and Residual Latent Flow.

entry.title: DeXposure-FM: A Time-series, Graph Foundation Model for Credit Exposures and Stability on Decentralized Financial Networks

author.name: Aijie Shu, Wenbin Wu, Gbenga Ibikunle, Fengxiang He

entry.summary: Introduces DeXposure-FM, first time-series graph foundation model for DeFi credit exposure measurement using graph-tabular encoder with pre-trained weights and task-specific heads.

entry.title: Enforcing Monotonic Progress in Legal Cross-Examination: Preventing Long-Horizon Stagnation in LLM-Based Inquiry

author.name: Hsien-Jyh Liao

entry.summary: Proposes Soft-FSM, a neuro-symbolic architecture that enforces monotonic procedural progress in legal cross-examination tasks by using an external state controller. Achieves 97% completeness vs 40% for baselines on Taiwanese criminal cases.

entry.title: Enabling Real-Time Colonoscopic Polyp Segmentation on Commodity CPUs via Ultra-Lightweight Architecture

author.name: Weihao Gao, Zhuo Deng, Zheng Gong, Lan Ma

entry.summary: Introduces UltraSeg, ultra-lightweight (<0.3M params) polyp segmentation models achieving 90 FPS on commodity CPUs, enabling real-time colonoscopy in resource-limited settings.

entry.title: DRMOT: A Dataset and Framework for RGBD Referring Multi-Object Tracking

author.name: Sijia Chen, Lijuan Ma, Yanqiu Yu, En Yu, Liman Liu, Wenbing Tao

entry.summary: Proposes DRMOT, a novel task combining RGB, Depth, and Language modalities for referring multi-object tracking with explicit 3D spatial reasoning.

entry.title: REDistill: Robust Estimator Distillation for Balancing Robustness and Efficiency

author.name: Ondrej Tybl, Lukas Neumann

entry.summary: REDistill replaces standard KL-based knowledge distillation with power divergence loss to adaptively downweight unreliable teacher predictions. Provides principled robustness grounded in robust statistics.

entry.title: A Multi-Modal Foundational Model for Wireless Communication and Sensing

author.name: Vahid Yazdnian, Yasaman Ghasempour

entry.summary: Introduces task-agnostic multi-modal foundational model for physical-layer wireless systems using physics-guided self-supervised pretraining for cross-modal representation learning.

entry.title: ECG-R1: Protocol-Guided and Modality-Agnostic MLLM for Reliable ECG Interpretation

author.name: Jiarui Jin, Haoyu Wang, Xingliang Wu, Xiaocheng Fang, Xiang Lan, Zihan Wang, Deyun Zhang, Bo Liu, Yingying Zhang, Xian Wu, Hongyan Li, Shenda Hong

entry.summary: Introduces ECG-R1, first reasoning MLLM for ECG interpretation using protocol-guided instruction generation grounded in measurable features and clinical thresholds, with modality dropout for robustness.

entry.title: LiteToken: Removing Intermediate Merge Residues From BPE Tokenizers

author.name: Yike Sun, Haotong Yang, Zhouchen Lin, Muhan Zhang
